articleBodyHTML:
Enjoy the warm weather with this cool, creamy good eating recipe! It's Peach nana-cream. Think ice cream, only healthier!

Ice cream, move over. The new and improved sweet and delightful treat has taken oven. Nana-ice cream, the ultimate no-guilt comfort food that will leave you satisfied and wanting seconds. This simple recipe is made with only a handful of ingredients. The base of this recipe is frozen bananas. When you blend them with a little water or nut milk, it creates a beautiful ice-cream-like texture. The best part is that it’s 100 percent natural, raw, vegan, and gluten free.

There are so many people who suffer from lactose intolerance, inability to consume sugar, or who are vegan. Since this recipe only uses frozen fruits, it’s the perfect recipe for anyone. This is a great idea to serve the kids to replace high fat and high sugar ice creams. A typical ice cream serving (which is usually ½–¾ cup) comes in a whopping 200 plus calories and more than 20–25 grams of sugar. A nana-cream has only 60 calories per serving and less than 10 grams of natural sugars.

Since spring is here, I used peaches in my recipe. You can go bananas (no pun intended) and add whichever flavors you desire. Here are some variations:

Chocolate peanut butter: 1.5 cup frozen banana, 1/3 cup almond milk, 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder, and 1 tablespoon natural peanut butter

Strawberries and crème: 2 cups frozen strawberries with ½ cup coconut milk

Mint chocolate: 2 cup frozen bananas, ½ cup almond milk, 1 tablespoon raw cocoa, 1 tablespoon fresh mint leaves, 1 teaspoon spirulina. Blend frozen bananas with almond milk and remove from blender. Add 1 tablespoon raw cacao to one bowl and 1 tablespoon of mint and spirulina to the other. Mix separately and then combine.

Enjoy this spring and this rocking recipe for banana ice cream!
articleSummaryHTML: Spring into the warming weather with this cool, creamy good eating! It's Peach nana-cream, like ice cream only healthy!
seoTitle: Peach Nana-Cream
seoDescription: Spring into the warming weather with this cool creamy good eating! It's Peach nana-cream, like ice cream only healthy!
ingredients:
s:247:"
  • 1 cup frozen bananas
  • 1/2 cup frozen peaches
  • 1/3 cup nondairy milk (almond, rice, soy, hemp)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Optional toppings: dried fruit, nuts, seeds, fruit, coconut
";
directions:
Place all ingredients in a high speed blender. Blend until smooth and serve!

Check out all the reasons bananas rule!

articleBodyHTML:
A sweet and salty snack loaded with health benefits and flavor will have your back pre or post workout!

Craving something sweet and salty? These amazing protein balls will hit the spot and are great for healthy snacks or post-workout snacks. I have made these protein balls for a few years now, when I was trying to make some healthier snacks with only a few, real ingredients. I like to know and pronounce the ingredients that I put into my body. If you want to exercise and be the best that you can be, eating healthy is a huge part of it. This time when I made these, I added coconut oil and chia seed. They were a hit! They barely lasted two days around the house.

Do you know the health benefits of chia seeds and coconut oil? They are so good for you!

Health benefits of chia seeds:

  • Deliver a massive amount of nutrients with very few calories (fiber, protein, fat, calcium, manganese, magnesium, phosphorus).
  • Loaded with antioxidants
  • High in quality protein!
  • Can help you lose weight
  • High in Omega-3 fatty acids

And those are just a few of the benefits!

Health benefits of coconut oil:

  • Contain Medium Chain Triglycerides (used for quick energy)
  • Increase your energy expenditure (helps you burn more fat)
  • Can kill bacteria, viruses, helping fight infections
  • Can improve blood cholesterol levels and may lower risk of heart disease
  • Can protect hair against damage, moisturize skin and function as sunscreen

The ingredients really pack a punch as far as health and nutrition is concerned. You should make yourself up some today!
articleSummaryHTML: A sweet and salty snack loaded with health benefits and flavor will have your back pre or post workout!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter Protein Balls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: A sweet and salty snack loaded with health benefits and flavor will have your back pre or post workout!
ingredients:
s:340:"
  • 2 ½ cups oats
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • ½ cup honey (or agave for vegans)
  • 1/3 cup coconut oil
  • 4 tablespoons chia seeds
  • 2 ½ scoops Sunwarrior Classic Plus Vanilla Protein
";
directions:
Mix all dry ingredients together and then add all the wet ingredients. This is a pretty easy recipe you can add more of one ingredient or less of one depending on what you like.

Once all of the ingredients are mixed together. Scoop 1 tablespoon of the dough and roll into a ball. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes and then enjoy! Keep stored in the refrigerator for up to two weeks (if they last that long).

Or if you're looking for a thirst-quenching protein option, maybe try this great protein smoothie!

articleBodyHTML:
For nutrients and prebiotics, these Millet Croquettes are not only tasty, but they are also just what the doctor ordered.

Millet, though quite often referred to as a grain, is actually a seed. It does not contain gluten, making it a perfect choice for those with gluten sensitivities. It can be used as a breakfast food, in baking and on its own as a stand in for mashed potatoes or rice. Full of nutrients, this prebiotic food is easily digested and helps to keep your colon regular.
articleSummaryHTML: For nutrients and prebiotics, these Millet Croquettes are not only tasty, but they are also just what the doctor ordered.
seoTitle: Millet Croquettes
seoDescription: For nutrients and prebiotics, these Millet Croquettes are not only tasty, but they are also just what the doctor ordered.
ingredients:
s:629:"
  • 1 cup millet (or 1⁄2 millet and 1⁄2 amaranth)
  • 2 cups of water
  • 1⁄4 cup flour of your choice (corn, brown rice or quinoa)
  • 1⁄2 cup toasted walnuts or sunflower seeds (ground to a powder)
  • 1 carrot, shredded
  • 2 scallions, minced or 1⁄4 cup chopped parsley
  • 1 bunch of kale, washed and chopped
  • 1⁄4 cup chopped dill
  • 1 onion, diced
  • Dash of turmeric
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon tamari
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Rinse and dry toast millet and amaranth for a few minutes; add 2 cups of water and cook for 30 minutes. To dry toast, place grains in a pan over low-medium heat until the water from rinsing has been absorbed.

2. Grind the toasted walnuts or sunflower seeds to a powder, or, alternatively, use whole for a crunch and nutty texture.

3. Sauté onions and a bit of olive oil over medium heat, once onions have softened, add kale, carrots, chopped dill, and scallions until wilted and cooked together.

4. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl; add corn flour, salt, turmeric, sesame oil, and tamari.

5. Form into 2-inch logs on baking sheet with parchment paper and bake for 25–30 minutes.

What Can You Add to Your Millet Croquettes?

The short answer: just about anything! Adding fresh, diced vegetables will give your croquettes a delicious nutrient and fibre boost. Try adding zucchini, carrot, peppers, spinach and onions.

If you're looking for quick energy, you might want to try these great-tasting protein balls!

articleBodyHTML:
Put spring in your step with these in-season vegetables and great flavor. Dinner with this asparagus and Celeriac soup will be your favorite part of the day!

April marks the beginning of spring, a beautiful transitional time between cold to warm. The days are longer and packed with sunshine. The trees are blooming, and the plants are thriving. This time of year is absolutely stunning. With spring comes in season vegetables and fruits that are too delicious to ignore.

Shopping for produce in season has so many perks, the first being that it is 100 percent more nutritious. After the produce is picked, enzymes start depleting rapidly. Out of season produce will travel long distances to reach its final destination. While in transit, many key nutrients are lost. Another great perk to shopping in season is to support local farmers. The price of local produce is typically less than fruits and vegetables that have been imported from around the world. Lastly, local produce always tastes fresher and crispier!

In the spring, lighter fare items replace dense hearty meals from colder months. There is one item that stays on any menu all year around. That item is soup. Just because it’s getting warmer doesn’t mean you have to put that soup spoon down. Spring soups are always vibrant and bursting with fresh flavors. They are light and refreshing, being served hot or cold.

The beautiful soup is made with spring fresh vegetables such as asparagus, peas, celeriac and mint. Celeriac is a root vegetable not many people know or use in their cooking. It’s a great alternative to using potatoes in soups or stews as it has a lower starch content. It’s also great source of fiber, potassium and calcium. Asparagus is not only delicious. but it’s also another vegetable packed with health benefits such as fiber, minerals, and folate.

This soup only takes 30 minutes from start to finish and can be stored in the freezer for later use.
articleSummaryHTML: Put spring in your step with these in-season vegetables and great flavor. Dinner with this asparagus and Celeriac soup will be your favorite part of the day!
seoTitle: Spring Asparagus and Celeriac Soup
seoDescription: Put spring in your step with these in-season vegetables and great flavor. Dinner with this asparagus and Celeriac soup will be your favorite part of the day!
ingredients:
s:458:"
  • 4 cups low sodium organic vegetable broth
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 garlic cloves, chopped
  • 1 celeriac, peeled and chopped
  • 1 bundle asparagus, chopped
  • 1 cup fresh or frozen peas
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1/4 cup fresh tarragon or basil
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt

Garnish:

  • 1/2 cup lentils
  • 1/2 cup micro greens
";
directions:
1.) Warm a saucepan over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of coconut oil. Add the onions and let them cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another minute.

2.) Add celeriac, asparagus, and vegetable stock. Let this simmer for 15 minutes

3.) Add frozen peas, fresh herbs of choice. and Himalayan salt. Cook for 2 minutes

4.) Working in batches, ladle soup into your high speed blender or food processor. Once smooth, pass the soup through a sieve and then pour it back into the sauce pan. Cook for another 4–5 minutes

5.) Garnish with lentils, micro greens. or fresh herbs of

Looking for more soups? Try this butternut squash with tahini drizzle!

articleBodyHTML:
It’s never too late to celebrate Cinco de Mayo—especially when it tastes this great! You must try this amazing Mexican couscous vegetarian bowl!

A simple and versatile little bowl of yumminess! Spring is in the air, and this recipe will burst with flavor. It’s quick and easy and can even be packed as a picnic side dish. Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: It’s never too late to celebrate Cinco de Mayo—especially when it tastes this great! You must try this amazing Mexican couscous vegetarian bowl!
seoTitle: Mexican Couscous Vegetarian Bowl
seoDescription: It’s never too late to celebrate Cinco de Mayo—especially when it tastes this great! You must try this amazing Mexican couscous vegetarian bowl!
ingredients:
s:692:"
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • ¾ cup couscous
  • ½ cup water
  • 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 cob corn, roasted
  • 1 avocado
  • 1 lime, half juiced, half quartered
  • ¾ cup cherry tomatoes, chopped
  • 3 radishes, shaved thinly
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon chili powder
  • Pickled jalapeno for garnish
  • ¼ cup Mexican sour cream (or vegan option)
  • ½ cup manchego cheese (or ½ cup vegan cheese)
  • Cilantro, to your taste preference
  • Tortilla chips
";
directions:
1. Heat ½ tablespoon of oil in pot and lightly toast couscous in oil. Add just under ¾ cup of water. When couscous comes to a boil, turn off heat and cover. Couscous will fluff up.

2. Husk corn and put into toaster oven for approximately 20 minutes to slightly turn brown. When ready, remove corn from cob for later use.

3. Pit and peel avocado and dice up. Place in bowl, squeeze ½ lime over it, and stir.

4. In a skillet, use remaining oil and heat. Add chopped garlic and stir until fragrant (about 30 seconds). Add black beans, cumin, chili powder and water. Let simmer on low for a few minutes until water is almost all gone. Lightly season with salt, stir and turn off heat when water is almost gone.

5. Using a medium serving bowl, add most of the avocado to the bottom of the bowl (reserve a little for the top). Add couscous and then top the couscous with other ingredients as you desire. Serve with thick Mexican chips for dipping!

Have some peach nana-cream for dessert!

articleBodyHTML:
Whether you pronounce it tomayto or tomahto, nothing says summer better than fresh, delicious tomatoes, especially when they’re in a delicious marinara soup!

While any tomato will work in this marinara soup recipe, we encourage you to try it with different cultivars. There are so many kinds of tomatoes—the USDA says there are 25,000 varieties—you could make this dish just about every day for, well, a really long time.

The red tomato varieties seem to be the most popular, including Beefsteak, Roma, and Abraham Lincoln. Pink tomatoes taste somewhat similar to the red ones; pink types include Julia Child, Pink Girl, and Brandywine. Orange tomato varieties include Hillbilly, Persimmon, and Mountain Gold. Orange tomatoes are often sweeter than red tomatoes, due to their higher sugar content. Yellow varieties are similar to orange—again, usually less tangy than red tomatoes. Look for yellow tomatoes to have names like Azoychka, Golden Boy, and Garden Peach. But it doesn’t stop there! Green tomato varieties are green when they’re ripe, and usually have lower acidic values than their red cousins. Black tomatoes are not really black; So-called black tomatoes come in a range of dark colors (deep purple or brown, bluish-brown, mahogany). There are bi-colored or striped tomatoes, which come in an amazing array of colors: red with yellow stripes, red with orange or green stripes, black with orange stripes, green tomatoes with yellow stripes, and many more color combinations.
articleSummaryHTML: Whether you pronounce it tomayto or tomahto, nothing says summer better than fresh, delicious tomatoes, especially when they’re at their peak and in a delicious marinara soup!
seoTitle: Tomato Time with Marinara Soup
seoDescription: Whether you pronounce it tomayto or tomahto, nothing says summer better than fresh, delicious tomatoes, especially when they’re in a delicious marinara soup!
ingredients:
s:266:"
  • 3 medium ripe tomatoes
  • 1/3 cup oil packed sundried tomatoes, drained
  • 2 ribs celery
  • 1 teaspoon minced onion
  • 2 cloves garlic, peeled
  • 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil
  • 1/2 avocado
";
directions:
Puree all ingredients except the avocado in a blender until smooth. Taste and add salt as needed. Add avocado to the blender and pulse until smooth. Garnish with minced basil if desired and serve immediately.

articleBodyHTML:
When you're feeling snacky and want a sweet and healthy treat, you will definitely want to reach for pistachio brittle! 

This brittle is a great treat for after a heavy meal. Brown rice syrup or coconut nectar do not spike your blood sugar as quickly as other sweeteners. Enjoyed in moderation, this brittle is a great dessert to keep on hand for when guests are over, or to give as a gift. It also tastes delicious on top of coconut ice cream, just saying!

With simple ingredients, including the healthy pistachio, this recipe is sure to delight everyone!
articleSummaryHTML: When you're feeling snacky and want a sweet and healthy treat, you will definitely want to reach for pistachio brittle!
seoTitle: Pistachio Brittle
seoDescription: When you're feeling snacky and want a sweet and healthy treat, you will definitely want to reach for pistachio brittle!
ingredients:
s:183:"
  • 1 ¼ cup maple syrup
  • ¾ cup brown rice syrup or coconut nectar
  • ½ cup of water
  • 1 ½ cup of pistachios
";
directions:
1. Prepare a sheet pan with a silpat or parchment.

2. In a pot, combine water, maple, and rice syrup or coconut nectar. Cook on medium low heat until your thermometer reads 300 degrees.

3. Add nuts, quickly stir and quickly pour onto pan.

4. Using an oiled rubber spatula, spread mixture out and let cool to room temperature before breaking into shards.

For other nutty option try these peanut butter protein balls!

articleBodyHTML:
Take your apple a day to a whole new level with these apple pie no-bake bars! Full of flavor, these snacks are so good you’ll forget they’re healthy!

An apple a day keeps the doctor away: the saying makes an apple sound like a tedious chore. But in reality the apple is a flavor-filled sack lunch packed by nature. It tastes great, gives you those great benefits that make apples a truly fabulous fruit.

Apples help cleanse your mouth. They also contain pectin, which helps control odors. They are high in fiber, which increases heart health and reduces cholesterol. Whether you’re eating them because they’re healthy or because they’re great-tasting, you should stick to the doctors orders and have one a day! Or maybe two.
articleSummaryHTML: Take your apple a day to a whole new level with these apple pie no-bake bars! Full of flavor, these snacks are so good you’ll forget they’re healthy!
seoTitle: Apple Pie No Bakes | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Take apple a day to a whole new level with Sunwarrior's apple pie no-bake bars! Full of flavor, these snacks are so good you’ll forget they’re healthy!
ingredients:
s:538:"
  • ½ cup coconut oil
  • 2/3 cup either almond or peanut butter
  • ¼ cup either honey or agave
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 2 cups puffed brown rice cereal
  • 2/3 cup dried chopped apples
  • ¼ cup of either chopped almonds or peanuts (Depends on what kind of nut butter you used)
  • ¼ cup ground flax
  • ½ teaspoon apple pie spices
  • ½ cup white chocolate chips
  • ½ cup dark chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Melt the first four ingredients (coconut oil, nut butter, honey or agave, and vanilla) in a sauce pan, and stir until blended. Add in all the other ingredients, and stir until all coated.
  2. Line a baking dish with parchment paper that has been greased with coconut oil. Pour contents of saucepan into baking dish. Press everything down into bottom of baking dish. Place in the fridge for a few minutes to set.
  3. While that sets up, use a double boiler to melt the white chips. Spread out over the top on the bars. Put back in fridge to set again while melting the dark chocolate.
  4. Remove the pan and gently remove the whole pan-sized spread and carefully turn over. Pour the dark chocolate on the bars and let chill again to set.
  5. Cut in to bars or squares and ENJOY.
  6. Keep leftovers in the fridge, that is, if there are any.

Makes approximately 15–20 bars

These bars would make fabulous to-go snacks for your summer picnics and outings!

articleTitle: No-Bake Gluten Free, Vegan Peanut Butter bars
articleBodyHTML:
You need some peanut butter bars with some crunch and nutty awesomeness. They are no bake and gluten free but full of flavor!

Growing up in an Italian home you could almost always find a jar of Nutella in the house. It was not uncommon to slather Nutella on a nice piece of crostini bread and bring it to school for lunch. Most Italian kids my age loved their Nutella sandwiches. I was not one of them. Sadly, a jar of peanut butter was not on the top of an Italian family’s grocery list in the 70’s. I still remember with deep fondness when I was introduced to my first peanut butter sandwich. One day, I decided to swap my Nutella sandwich with someone else’s peanut butter sandwich (there was no such thing as a nut free school in those days). I had never heard of peanut butter. “Peanut butter, what’s that?” I remember saying to my non-Italian friend. “Want some?” she said. From that time on, if I had a Nutella sandwich for lunch, I would call upon my favorite friend who almost always brought peanut butter sandwiches to school and swap lunches. That’s when my love affair with peanut butter started.

These bars are dedicated to that special friend who introduced me to peanut butter. These bars are super quick, easy to make, gluten-free, and vegan. This delicious treat not only satisfies your sweet tooth, but your peanut butter craving as well. If you haven’t figured it out yet, I am just cuckoo for peanut butter!

It’s best to keep these bars in the fridge or freezer so that they last longer. They taste better if kept cold. Personally, I enjoy eating them frozen.

I decided to use raw cacao nibs instead of chocolate chips. Don’t get me wrong, I enjoy chocolate from time to time, but it does not have to be a staple food in my diet. I find that the cacao nibs add a nice crunch to the bars.

I sweetened these bars using raw honey however, feel free to experiment with other sweeteners of your choice. If you are truly a peanut butter lover, you can skip the sweeteners altogether since these bars taste delicious without the sweet stuff.

Just be forewarned, you can easily polish off the whole batch at once.
articleSummaryHTML: You need some peanut butter bars with some crunch and nutty awesomeness. They are no bake and gluten free but full of flavor!
seoTitle: No-Bake Gluten Free, Vegan Peanut Butter bars
seoDescription: You need some peanut butter bars with some crunch and nutty awesomeness. They are no bake and gluten free but full of flavor!
recipeName: No-Bake Gluten Free, Vegan Peanut Butter bars
ingredients:
s:304:"
  • 1 cup gluten free oat flakes
  • 1/2 cup all-natural peanut butter
  • 1/4 cup coconut flakes
  • 1/4 cup flaxseed ground
  • 1/4 cup cacao nibs
  • 3 tablespoons raw honey (or agave or sweetener of choice)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix until all ingredients are thoroughly combined.
  2. Place the mixture in a small 6x6 inch square pan.
  3. Spread and press mixture down from corner to corner.
  4. Cover the pan with foil and place the square pan in the freezer.
  5. Chill for at least 2 hours, or until firm, before slicing into bars.
  6. FYI recipe note #1 – If you find that the mixture is a little dry and is not sticking together, just add a little more peanut butter (oh yum!) or a little bit more honey. A tiny bit of water to help with holding it together can also work.
  7. FYI recipe note #2 - The bars can be somewhat fragile and flimsy, even if eaten directly from the refrigerator. For firmer bars, freeze for 10–20 minutes before eating.

Happy snacking peanut butter lovers!

Try some Mexican Couscous for dinner!

articleBodyHTML:
Eat flavor sprinkled with fabulous when you make this quinoa with chickpeas and spinach for dinner!

Using quinoa as the base of a salad or side dish is so versatile. It is truly a blank slate for any flavors, colors, and textures to layer in. Whether hot or cold, you can truly upgrade any quinoa dish. Also in case you didn’t know, quinoa is not only gluten free, but it is high in fiber and protein. So make it a consistent part of your meals – you won’t regret it!
articleSummaryHTML: Eat flavor sprinkled with fabulous when you make this quinoa with chickpeas and spinach for dinner!
seoTitle: Quinoa with Chickpeas and Spinach
seoDescription: Eat flavor sprinkled with fabulous when you make this quinoa with chickpeas and spinach for dinner!
ingredients:
s:666:"
  • 1 cup water
  • 3/4 cup fresh-squeezed orange juice
  • 1/2 teaspoon sea salt
  • Zest from 1 organic orange, approximately 1/2 tablespoon
  • 1 cup quinoa, rinsed and drained
  • 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 3 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1/2 cup organic raisins
  • 1 cup cooked chickpeas or organic canned chickpeas
  • 1–2 cups spinach leaves, trimmed, washed, drained, and dried
  • Salt to taste
  • 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon
  • 1/4 cup toasted pine nuts or almonds
  • 1 orange, cut into wedges
";
directions:
1) Combine the water and orange juice in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the salt, orange zest, and quinoa and return to boil.

2) Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for twelve minutes, or until all the liquids are absorbed.

3) Remove the quinoa from the heat, keep it covered, and let sit for three minutes.

4) While the quinoa is cooking, heat the oil in a large skillet that has a tight-fitting lid. Add the onions and sauté over medium heat for about five minutes, until they have softened and begun to brown. Add the garlic and sauté until golden.

5) Add the raisins, chickpeas, and spinach. Cover and cook over medium heat for three minutes, or just until the spinach ha wilted. Adjust the heat if necessary.

6) Drain any excess water and season to taste with salt.

7) To serve, fold the vegetables into the quinoa. Stir in the cinnamon. Squeeze some orange juice over the quinoa. Garish with toasted pine nuts and orange wedges.

articleBodyHTML:
Turmeric and ginger are two of the healthiest ingredients known to mankind. This drink isn’t just a cold remedy tea but rather a daily detox and rejuvenation.

I drink turneric and ginger tea every day, and it has been a god sent to me. I first discovered this tea while I had a pesky cold and flu that wasn’t dissipating. I started making this every day and my flu symptoms went away. Not only that, my energy levels started climbing day by day.

This drink has incredible properties that detoxify your body and liver. Turmeric is a spice used in traditional Chinese and Indian medicine for centuries. Its anti-inflammatory properties help with a whole array of conditions such as chronic pain, arthritis, cancer, and diabetes. One of the greatest properties of turmeric is that it is alkalizing, which helps the body heal and detoxify. It also increases your metabolism. I’ve started using turmeric on my skin which is a superhero against wrinkles and elasticity.

Just like its counterpart, ginger has a whole array of health benefits. Some of the main benefits of ginger is its ability to decrease muscle soreness, reduce nausea symptoms, indigestion, menstrual cramps, and cold symptoms. Now, add turmeric and ginger together and you have a natural power house that is detoxing your liver and building your immunity.

If you are trying to go caffeine-free, this tea is a wonderful alternative. You can also use any herbal tea such as green teas, herbal teas such as chamomile or mint. You can add a touch of sweetness such as honey or agave after the tea is done boiling.
articleSummaryHTML: Turmeric and ginger are two of the healthiest ingredients known to mankind. This drink isn’t just a cold remedy tea but rather a daily detox and rejuvenation.
seoTitle: Turmeric Ginger Tea
seoDescription: Turmeric and ginger are two of the healthiest ingredients known to mankind. This drink isn’t just a cold remedy tea but rather a daily detox and rejuvenation.
ingredients:
s:229:"
  • 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, cut into slices
  • 2 tablespoons fresh turmeric, grated
  • 2 cups water
  • 1 bag herbal tea
  • Lemon slices
  • Honey or agave to sweeten
";
directions:
Place water in a small pot, let it simmer covered on low heat with ginger, turmeric, and lemon slices for 20–30 minutes. Remove from heat and add herbal tea bag of choice (mint, chamomile is mine). Add a touch of honey or agave for sweetness and serve.

Have some no-baked goodies with your tea!

articleBodyHTML:
For something sweet but also healthy to top your salads with, this blueberry balsamic beet dressing hits the spot.

Some researchers think that the reason there are so many Russian centenarians is that Russians eat a lot of beets. The colorful root vegetables contain nutrients that are said to protect against certain cancers, especially colon cancer.

The sweet taste of beets tips us off to their relatively high sugar content, while the beet greens have a somewhat bitter taste, similar to chard. Raw beetroots have a crunchy texture, but when they are cooked, they become soft and almost buttery.

Although available year-round, beets are in season from June through October; this is when the youngest, most tender (and best tasting!) beets are easiest to find. When buying beets, select smallish or medium-sized beets with a firm root. Look for smooth-skin and a deep color. An advantage to buying smaller, younger beets is that they may be tender enough that peeling won't be needed once they are cooked.

If you buy beets with the greens still attached, cut the majority of the greens from the beetroots, so they do not wick moisture away from the beetroot itself. Leave one or two inches of the stem attached to prevent the roots from "bleeding." Do not wash beets before storing. Place them in a plastic bag—squeeze out as much of the air from the bag as possible—and place in refrigerator where they will keep for several weeks.

Store the unwashed greens in a separate plastic bag squeezing out as much of the air as possible. Place in refrigerator where they will keep fresh for a few days.
articleSummaryHTML: For something sweet but also healthy to top your salads with, this blueberry balsamic beet dressing hits the spot.
seoTitle: Blueberry Balsamic Beet Dressing
seoDescription: For something sweet but also healthy to top your salads with, this blueberry balsamic beet dressing hits the spot.
ingredients:
s:301:"
  • 3 large beets, boiled and peeled, or roasted
  • 3 tablespoons water
  • 1/2 cup blueberry balsamic vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice or apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon walnut oil or olive oil
  • To taste: unrefined salt and pepper
";
directions:
Combine first six ingredients in a blender until smooth. Season to taste. Blueberry Balsamic Beet Dressing will keep in a sealed glass jar in the refrigerator for several days.

A note about substitutions: If blueberry balsamic vinegar is not available in your area, try raspberry, date, or another high-quality balsamic.

Try these amazing no-bake apple pie bars!

articleBodyHTML:
Feeding a large family healthy vegan or vegetarian meals they want to eat is a challenge. But it can be done! We'll show you how with this Southwest salad!

Salad is a delicious, light, and easy dinner that you can have on the table in less then 30 minutes. It’s filled with all the yummy things you love to eat, but the really great thing about this salad is you probably already have most of the ingredients you need in your fridge or pantry.

Black beans are an excellent filler that support your digestive track and have key nutrients such as fiber and folate. The sunflower seeds are an antioxidant and are chuck full of vitamin E. Avocados are a tasty source of healthy fat that lowers your risk of heart disease and essential vitamin E nutrients. The sweet corn is another wonderful antioxidant and add just the right amount of sweetness.
articleSummaryHTML: Feeding a large family healthy vegan and vegetarian meals they want to eat is a challenge. But it can be done! We'll show you how with this Southwest salad!
seoTitle: Southwest Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Feeding a large family healthy vegan & vegetarian meals they want to eat is a challenge. But it can be done! We'll show you how with this Southwest salad!
ingredients:
s:976:"

Southwest Salad

  • 1 head romaine lettuce, chopped
  • 1 can organic sweet corn, drained or 1 cup frozen corn, thawed
  • 1 red bell pepper, chopped
  • 1 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, cut in half
  • 1 (15 oz.) can organic black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 1/3 cup roasted and unsalted sunflower kernels

Creamy Avocado Salsa Dressing

  • 1 small avocado, peeled and sliced
  • 1 small jalapeno, seeded, deveined and roughly chopped (optional)
  • 1 clove garlic, peeled
  • ¼ cup loosely packed cilantro
  • ¼ cup salsa (medium for more of a kick)
  • ½ cup non-dairy sour cream
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • ½ teaspoon agave nectar
  • Juice from 1 lime
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ teaspoon cumin
  • 1/8 teaspoon pepper
";
directions:
Make the dressing first and chill, if possible, before serving.

For dressing

Add all ingredients to a food processor or blender and mix well. Add additional non-dairy sour cream, if needed, to reach desired consistency. Chill.

For the salad

Add all salad ingredients into a large bowl and toss. Pour in dressing and toss again.

Serve immediately.

*If you aren’t going to eat the salad all at once, add dressing to individual servings.

For dessert, try these amazing apple pie no bakes!

articleBodyHTML:
This healthy, home-made spelt pizza means that you will win dinner-chef tonight! You're welcome!

This recipe can be made gluten-free by substituting the spelt flour for brown rice flour.

Spelt vs. Gluten Free

Spelt is an ancient grain that contains numerous health benefits. Part of the wheat family, it is much more nutritious than whole wheat; however, it is not gluten free. It is only an option for those who can tolerate a moderate amount of gluten on occasion. Spelt is nutty and high in fiber and protein.

In the case of those with gluten intolerance or celiac, brown rice flour is an excellent substitute as it is gluten free. You can simply substitute cup for cup in this recipe. If you find that the crust is too dry, try adding in more water or a 1 tablespoon of arrowroot flour.
articleSummaryHTML: This healthy, home-made spelt pizza means that you will win dinner-chef tonight! You're welcome!
seoTitle: Spelt Pizza
seoDescription: This healthy, home-made spelt pizza means that you will win dinner-chef tonight! You're welcome!
ingredients:
s:552:"

Dough

  • 1 ¼ cup whole spelt flour
  • ¼ cup ground flax seeds
  • ½ cup water
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon honey or preferred sweetener
  • Pinch sea salt

Topping

  • 2 large onions, finely sliced
  • 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 cup arugula
  • 1 bulb garlic, roasted
  • 2 tablespoons crumbled goat cheese, or Daiya cheese for vegan option
";
directions:
Garlic

Preheat oven to 375 F. Cut the tip off the whole head of garlic so that every clove is exposed at the top. Place on square of aluminum foil, sprinkle with tablespoon of oil. Seal tightly and bake at 375 F for 45 minutes to an hour, until the garlic is golden and very soft. Cool about 5 minutes, then pinch the cloves from the bottom up so that the soft garlic meat is squeezed out. Set aside the soft garlic in a small bowl.

Toppings

Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium-low heat in a pan, and add the onions. Sauté until soft and golden brown, about 10–15 minutes.

The Dough

Line a round pan with parchment paper. Mix flour, flax, and salt in large bowl and set aside. In a measuring cup, measure ½ cup water. Then add oil, honey, and salt and mix well.

Pour the wet mixture over the dry and toss with fork. Once it starts to come together, knead with your hands about 2 minutes. It should be a soft dough, but one that holds together. Using firm pressure, press the dough with you knuckles evenly over the pizza pan. Let the dough extend a little onto the rim of the pan. Prick the surface with a fork and then bake for 10 minutes at 375 F.

Assemble the Pizza

Increase oven temperature to 400F. Spread the roasted garlic evenly over the pre baked pizza crust, then top with caramelized onions, greens and crumbled goat cheese. Bake the pizza for about 15 minutes until heated through and edges of crust are deep golden.

articleBodyHTML:
Eat a cup of tea with this scrumptious Bubble tea dessert! This low in calories and sugar recipe is not low on flavor!

The sun is shining, the birds are chirping and cold desserts are arriving. A classic Asian dessert drink uses tapioca pearls. Tapioca is derived from the root of a cassava plant and is naturally gluten free. Tapioca is naturally a thickening agent so it’s a great alternative many desserts such as pies, puddings and jellies.

Bubble teas either have a variety of black or white pearls or bobas. The texture and constancy is chewy but has a sweet undertone to them. Typically, bubble teas are high in calories and sugar but don’t fret, this recipe will change your life. It’s low in calories and sugar.

The key to obtaining the perfect bubble tea is cooking the tapioca pearls to perfection. Make sure there’s enough water to cover the tapioca and as soon as they float to the top, put the lid on and let them work their magic. If you have left over tapioca, you can place them in an airtight container as soon as they are cooled. They will last one day covered in the fridge.

To give the bubble tea its signature creaminess, I used coconut milk. You can use any nondairy unsweetened milk of choice. Hemp, rice, soy, almond or coconut milk will all taste delicious. To sweeten the tea you can use either a simple syrup, a splash of agave or maple syrup or a tsp of coconut sugar. In terms of tea, you can use whatever tea you like. I used a blood orange tea which gave the drink a fruity flavor. Another great option is using matcha powder with your nondairy milk. The earthiness of the matcha pairs beautifully with the silkiness of the nondairy milk. The variations are endless and the spring has only begun so let the tapioca season begin!

I used “Let’s do organic” tapioca pearls but you can find these at any local Asian supermarket.
articleSummaryHTML: Eat a cup of tea with this scrumptious Bubble tea dessert! This low in calories and sugar recipe is not low on flavor!
seoTitle: Blood Orange Bubble Tea Dessert | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Eat a cup of tea with this scrumptious Bubble tea dessert! This low in calories and sugar recipe is not low on flavor!
ingredients:
s:249:"
  • ½ cup organic tapioca pearls
  • 5 cups water
  • 1 tea of choice
  • 1 cup nondairy milk of choice
  • 1 teaspoon agave, maple syrup or coconut sugar
  • 1 cup blood orange segments
";
directions:
1.) Boil 3 cups of water and add tapioca pearls. Reduce heat to a simmer and let cook for 20 minutes. Turn the heat off and cover with a lid for another 25–30 minutes. Once pearls have cooked, drain them and rice thoroughly

2.) While the tapioca is cooking, add 2 cups of water with tea bag to a pitcher. Add liquid sweetener and let it steep for 5–10 minutes, depending on how strong you want the tea. After steeping, discard tea bag. Add 1 cup of nondairy milk and stir well

3.) Add tapioca pearls and blood orange segments to tea and place in fridge until ready to use

articleBodyHTML:
Calorie and carb intake is wasted on the bread products in our wraps when we can have the flavor without the carbs or the calories with collard green wrap!

Collard greens are cruciferous plants that are best known for its large, dark, and edible leaves. Collard greens are known to resemble a cabbage and are part of the cabbage family. Low in calories and high in nutrients, collard greens are sure to be a health enhancer. With an impressive source of vitamin K and omega-3 fatty acid profile, they not only help with inflammation, they also help increase bone mass and are beneficial for brain health.

Much like other leafy greens, collards are also rich in many of the B vitamins: B3, B5, and B6—all of which help support the nervous system. Collards score high in antioxidants such as vitamins A, C, and E that are all great for vision and healthy skin. But the benefits don’t stop there; they are also high in minerals such as iron, calcium, selenium, and manganese.

Collards are an excellent source of fiber that aids in digestion and helps lower cholesterol. They have been known to have anti-cancer properties that can help in the prevention of various cancers such as breast, prostate, colon, and ovarian.

The great news is that Collards can be steamed or eaten raw. In this recipe, we are going to utilize their raw powers and use them as a wrap to substitute conventional wraps and breads. They are the best leafy green to use if you want to ditch the carbs but love to eat food with your hands
articleSummaryHTML: Calorie and carb intake is wasted on the bread products in our wraps when we can have the flavor without the carbs or the calories with collard green wrap!
seoTitle: Collard Green Goddess Wrap
seoDescription: Calorie and carb intake is wasted on the bread products in our wraps when we can have the flavor without the carbs or the calories with collard green wrap!
ingredients:
s:520:"

Cashew Cheese

  • 2 cups cashews
  • ½ cup water
  • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • 1 teaspoon nutritional yeast

For Wrap

  • 1 cup of broccoli or broccolini
  • 1 cup sunflower sprouts
  • 1 cup cashew cream
  • ½ cup arugula
  • 2 collard green leaves
  • Pinch of salt and pepper (optional)
";
directions:
Soak cashews in water for at least 2 hours and drain. Add all the cashew cheese ingredients in a food processor. Process until smooth.

Steam broccoli until just tender.

Place collard leaf opened and flat on a surface.

Add your cashew cheese making a lengthwise line.

Top with steamed broccoli, sprouts, and arugula or any other ingredients you desire to add.

Fold the stem and the top edge of the leaf inwards. Roll to one side to the other side so that it looks like a burrito wrap.

Have fun and enjoy!

For other green meal ideas, try this Southwest salad!

articleBodyHTML:
Sure you can buy coconut milk at the store, but if you make this coconut milk at home once, you will never go store-bought again!

Vegan milk, or mylk if you prefer to spell it this way, is a must in my home – for smoothies, soups, lattes, sauces, and sweets. Since making my own, buying the cartons or tetra packages is something I would rather not do because the home-made versions are so much better. When my time crunch finds me in a jam, and I need a super quick way to keep milk on hand, this recipe is it! It’s so easy, and I really love the creamy thickness. The best part is no straining is required – ya gotta love that.

If you have been intimidated to make your own vegan milk, this recipe is a must try. It’s virtually no-fail and all you need are the ingredients, your blender (and it doesn’t even have to be high speed yet I sure do love mine) and a glass jar. From there, it’s measure, blend, pour, and enjoy. After this, I am sure you’ll be “hooked on home-made.”

This super simple no straining coconut milk makes approximately 3 cups.
articleSummaryHTML: Sure you can buy coconut milk at the store, but if you make this coconut milk at home once, you will never go store-bought again!
seoTitle: Super Simple Coconut Milk
seoDescription: Sure you can buy coconut milk at the store, but if you make this coconut milk at home once, you will never go store-bought again!
ingredients:
s:608:"
  • 1 can organic coconut milk or cream (my fave brand is Earth’s Choice)
  • 1–2 Medjool dates, pitted, optional
  • Approximately 3 cups filtered water, more if you prefer a lighter milk
  • ½ – 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 3 tablespoons raw cacao
  • 3 servings Vitamin Mineral Rush
  • Pink sea salt if desired – just a tiny pinch
  • *optional 1 tablespoon or two of raw cashew or macadamia nut butter adds wonderful creaminess.
";
directions:
In a powerful blender add water, coconut milk, and the dates, and blend for 1–2 minutes. Turn blender off, adding more water and dates, if desired, blend 30 seconds longer.

Pour the milk into a glass container with a cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days.

Making dinner? Try this amazing quinoa recipe!

articleTitle: Peaches & Cream Muscle Builder Smoothie with Hello Alice
articleBodyHTML:
Let Alice show you the way to a peachy keen workout smoothie with peaches and cream and muscle building protein!

Here’s Alice! In a fun nod to nostalgic days gone by, we’ve put together some smoothie recipes that reach back into the 1950s. The time of classy cars, drive-ins, and swanky ideas on what the future would hold is alive and well with Alice. She’ll begin with the perfect workout smoothie for all you cool cats and daddios who want to get fit. This delicious peaches and cream smoothie hides some powerful, muscle-building protein under the hood.

You don’t have to go boring or bland with your smoothies. All you need is a little Alice-know-how. Start with some quick burning carbohydrates. Alice uses orange juice and peaches to push those energy levels up. Add a slow burning carb to the mix to keep that energy going. Top that off with a quality protein, like Warrior Blend. This protein is clean, vegan, natural, and delicious! It supplies the branched chain amino acids your muscles crave before and after exercise. The vanilla flavor also supplies the creaminess you expect with those peaches. Kick the protein even higher with a dash of hemp seeds.
articleSummaryHTML: Let Alice show you the way to a peachy keen workout smoothie with peaches and cream and muscle building protein!
seoTitle: Peaches & Cream Muscle Builder Smoothie with Hello Alice
seoDescription: Let Alice show you the way to a peachy keen workout smoothie with peaches and cream and muscle building protein!
ingredients:
s:345:"
  • ¼ cup coconut or almond milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • 1 tablespoon Activated Barley
  • 1 tablespoon hemp seeds
  • 2 cups frozen or fresh peaches
  • ¼ cup fresh orange juice
  • Handful ice
  • Optional: handful fresh or frozen pineapple
";
directions:
That’s all you need. Pop that soft top on, and put your foot to floor to blend away. Enjoy your radical peaches and cream smoothie. It’s as good as it sounds.

Try other great options with peaches with this yummy bubble tea dessert!

articleBodyHTML:
Put some zing in your coming summer months with this lemon tomato tapenade! Your taste buds and overall health will thank you.

Sundried tomatoes are a rich red color, deeply flavored, and relatively salty. They are loaded with nutrients including lycopene, which protects against cancer. This delicious recipe can be enjoyed as a dip, spread on raw pizza or sprouted wraps, tossed with kelp or zucchini noodles.
articleSummaryHTML: Put some zing in your coming summer months with this lemon tomato tapenade! Your taste buds and overall health will thank you.
seoTitle: Lemon Tomato Tapenade
seoDescription: Put some zing in your coming summer months with this lemon tomato tapenade! Your taste buds and overall health will thank you.
ingredients:
s:363:"
  • 1 cup sun dried tomatoes, soaked for 1–2 hours
  • ½ cup olive oil
  • ½ – 1 teaspoon salt
  • 2 cloves garlic, crushed
  • 1 ½ teaspoons grated lemon rind
  • 1 ½ tablespoons fresh lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme or 3/4 teaspoon dried thyme
";
directions:
1. Soak sun-dried tomatoes in warm water for 1 hour.

2. Drain and chop sun-dried tomatoes coarsely.

3. Process all ingredients in a food processor or blender until finely minced.

4. Spread on flatbread, sprouted bread, or crackers.

Wrap it all up in this collard green wrap!

articleBodyHTML:
It’s time to get wrapping! This tomato wrapped vegan roll will definitely keep your taste buds happy and wanting more.

Once you get your creative juices flowing, you can come up with so many combinations you will never get bored! It’s quick, easy and great to make, take and go. This ingredient list can be easily altered by personal preferences. To make this recipe completely vegan try making vegan hummus (my preference). I also enjoy using purple kale for an extra color pop!
articleSummaryHTML: It’s time to get wrapping! This tomato wrapped vegan roll will definitely keep your taste buds happy and wanting more.
seoTitle: Tomato Gem Wrap
seoDescription: It’s time to get wrapping! This tomato wrapped vegan roll will definitely keep your taste buds happy and wanting more.
ingredients:
s:694:"
  • 1 tomato Gem Wrap
  • 2 tablespoons hummus
  • ½ cup alfalfa sprouts
  • ⅔ cups mixed baby lettuce
  • 4 tomato strips or small dice
  • Thinly sliced pickle spears sliced to approximately 4”
  • 4–6 cucumber spears sliced to approximately 4”
  • 4 red bell pepper strips sliced to approximately 4”
  • 4–6 sliced carrots sliced approximately 4”
  • 1–2 finely sliced mushrooms
  • 8–10 cranberries
  • 1–2 avocado slices
  • 3–4 tablespoons cooked quinoa
  • Small bowl of water
  • Small pastry brush
";
directions:
1. Peel sheet from gem wrap and place shiny side down on a flat working surface.

2. Spread a layer of hummus over wrap leaving approximately a 1 inch border at the top and bottom.

3. Assemble your ingredients in layers on the inside.

4. Tightly roll your wrap like you would a sushi roll and along the 1 inch border at the bottom, lightly use your pastry brush and apply water and seal the wrap closed. Let lay flat for a minute to make sure seal has taken.

5. Leave whole, cut in half, or have fun and cut into several sushi pieces!

articleBodyHTML:
Power up with these five ingredient protein balls that if you “choc” the recipe up with cacao, you can transform them into amazing truffles.

Put together a few fab foods and they become even more fabulous. That’s how I like it!

When infusing foods with fun, flavor, and nutrients, eating great is truly great and these protein-rich, no-added sugar, gluten-free, and vegan gems are the perfect go-to snack or treat.

Crammed with vitamins, minerals, protein, fiber, quality carbs, and antioxidants, you can enjoy these easy-to-make power balls without guilt and you can double the batch and store them in the freezer in an airtight container for 2 – 4 weeks. Including a pinch of quality sea salt is a great way to infuse added electrolytes making your power balls a post-workout friendly snack. I love to double the recipe, divide it, and make a few different versions.
articleSummaryHTML: Power up with these five ingredient protein balls that if you “choc” the recipe up with cacao, you can transform them into amazing truffles.
seoTitle: 5 Ingredient Power Balls and Truffles
seoDescription: Power up with these five ingredient protein balls that if you “choc” the recipe up with cacao, you can transform them into amazing truffles.
ingredients:
s:1052:"
  • 2 scoops vanilla Sunwarrior Classic Plus protein, approximately ½ cup or more as needed
  • 2 heaping tablespoons Sunbutter, creamy or crunchy, add a little more if needed
  • 2 tablespoons extra virgin coconut oil, add a little more if needed
  • 2 large Medjool dates, soaked and pureed, to taste
  • 2 tablespoons unsweetened shredded coconut, plus extra for rolling the balls

Variations

  • Pinch of sea salt, to taste (great for electrolytes)
  • 2–4 tablespoons raw cacao powder, adjust liquid as needed
  • 2 tablespoons maca or mesquite powder for a caramel taste, adjust liquid as needed
  • 1 tablespoon raw cacao nibs and or chopped pecans if desired
  • 2 drops essential oil – pharmaceutical grade orange, peppermint, lemon
  • 1–2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract or Ojio vanilla powder
";
directions:
Combine all ingredients (except the extra coconut flakes) in a bowl, and create a sticky dough that holds together well when rolled. Adjust ingredient amounts if needed. Form the dough into 1 – 1½ inch balls.

Add the reserved coconut flakes to a little baggie and shake or roll the balls until they are completely coated.

Store in a covered container and enjoy as desired.

Truffle Tip

Elevate these to ‘Truffle’ level, melt 6 oz. of 70% (or higher) quality non-dairy organic chocolate or raw cacao paste in a double boiler with 1 tablespoon coconut oil or milk. Add a splash of maple syrup if desired. Remove from heat and carefully dip each truffle into the chocolate, covering completely. Set on a parchment-covered platter, dropping a few cacao nibs on the top if desired and let firm. Store as directed above.

For a savory meal recipe, try these tomato gem wraps!

articleBodyHTML:
As spring rolls around and the winter becomes a chilly memory, it’s a great time to start an overall spring detox of your body, mind, and kitchen!

There is so much talk about cleansing and detoxing now a days and there’s a reason for it: it creates healthy habits. There are so many ways to detox your body. Start with what you drink. Try to replace all sugary-based drinks with water. Try to replace coffee with green tea. Green tea has natural antioxidants and can detoxify the body. Coffee turns the body acidic which creates a hostile environment that allows bacteria and illness to thrive in the body. Adding green smoothies is another way to add nutrients that may be missing. It can also help remove toxins from your body. You can also detox the body by replacing one meal a day with a green smoothie. One of the best go-to smoothies is made with kale, bananas, parsley, coconut oil, and spinach. This amazing breakfast can fuel you until lunch.

Turning to organic foods is another method of detoxing the body. Organic fruits and vegetables are not grown the same way conventional farmers grow their crops. Organic farmers will use natural fertilizers to feed their plants. Organic produce is GMO-free, which has been a rising concern in health over the years. Also, if purchasing meats; organically raised animals are not given antibiotics or hormones.

Over the years grocery stores have gotten larger, but with size came an overwhelming amount of processed and refined foods. You walk in to purchase tomatoes and walk out with a shopping cart full of food that you were enticed to buy. My theory that I stand by: always stick to the perimeter of the grocery store. This is where the most nutrient dense foods will be. As you stray within the isles, this is where temptation lays. Rows upon rows of processed foods. Everything in the grocery store has been strategically placed in order for you to purchase more, from the lighting and music to the food demonstrations. In recent years, companies have noticed that people are adhering to the “perimeter rule”. Be aware while selecting foods, and always read labels. Overall, when you’re choosing the right foods, it creates a healthy habit to make good choices at the grocery store.

Cutting out white sugar and flour will be beneficial for detoxing your body. Not only does sugar and flour add pounds to your waistline, it leaves you feeling lethargic and unhealthy. This deadly duo can make the body feel as though it is full but realistically your blood sugar level is increasing and then decreasing at such a high rate that your appetite returns with a vengeance. Try adding more complex carbohydrates such as brown rice and sweet potato.

Sleeping is another way to reboot the system. Try to get to bed one hour earlier, even if you don’t sleep right away, it creates a habit for your body. This will reset your internal clock and you will wake up feeling refreshed. Try to exercise a few times a week as well. This will release natural endorphins in the body. Not only will this help with overall weight and health goals, it will decrease your stress levels.

Lastly, eat more greens! Greens vegetables are natural powerhouses that are packed with essential vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. They are low in fat and carbohydrates and provide an excellent source of plant based protein. This recipe for steamed pea shoots is a delicious way to get key nutrients in the body.
articleSummaryHTML: As spring rolls around and the winter becomes a chilly memory, it’s a great time to start an overall spring detox of your body, mind, and kitchen!
seoTitle: Pea Shoot Stir Fry
seoDescription: As spring rolls around and the winter becomes a chilly memory, it’s a great time to start an overall spring detox of your body, mind, and kitchen!
ingredients:
s:281:"
  • 2 cups pea shoots
  • 1 cup asparagus, chopped
  • 1 cup blueberries
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoon water
  • 1 tablespoon ginger, minced
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 teaspoon hemp hearts
";
directions:
1.) Heat a skillet with coconut oil over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1–2 minutes or until fragrant.

2.) Add pea shoots and water. Cover with a lid and cook for 2 minutes.

3.) Remove from heat, add chopped asparagus, blueberries, and hemp hearts

articleBodyHTML:
Get some antioxidant love for your body with vitamin rich berries in this tasty berry jam. Berry up!

Berries are one of the best sources of antioxidants you’ll find; it also doesn’t hurt that they taste delicious. The antioxidant properties in berries help fight something called oxidative stress which is caused by free radicals. Free radicals are atoms that are formed when oxygen interacts with certain molecules. The danger from them comes when they interact with cellular components such as cell membranes or DNA. The biggest antioxidant micronutrients are Vitamin C, Vitamin E and Beta-Carotene. Because the body cannot make these nutrients itself, it’s important to get it through your diet. Berry up!

Equipment

1 pot

1 canning jar
articleSummaryHTML: Get some antioxidant love for your body with vitamin rich berries in this tasty berry jam. Berry up!
seoTitle: Vegan Plant Based Berry Spread | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get some antioxidant love for your body with vitamin rich berries in this tasty berry jam. Berry up!
ingredients:
s:235:"
  • 1 pint of Blackberries or any other berry of choice (the riper the fruit, the better!)
  • 2 tablespoons of chia seeds
  • 2 tablespoons of coconut sugar, maple syrup, or other sweetener of choice
";
directions:
1. Rinse the berries under cold water

2. In a mixing bowl, mash the berries with a fork or a masher (you can leave some chunks)

3. Place the berries into the pot on medium heat, let it come to a boil and then on low for 15 minutes

4. The berries will start to break apart more, and become a thinner consistency

5. Add in chia seeds and sugar, and simmer for another 5–10 minutes

6. The mixture will start to become thicker, at this point you can turn off the stove

7. When mixture is to your desired consistency, pour it into your canning jar or a slice of toast and enjoy

articleTitle: Make summer POP! with Watermelon Coconut Mint Ice Pops!
articleBodyHTML:
I scream; you scream; we all scream for ice pops! No, really, ice pops, the healthy refreshing cool treat of summer.

It’s finally summertime, and while some might scream for ice cream, others prefer a healthier, faster-to-make chilly treat. Enter homemade ice pops.

If you’re just starting to dabble in the ice pop arena, here are a few tips and a fun beginner recipe.

Start simple. The most basic pops don’t require a recipe or a mold. Just make a combo of your favorite fruit juice. Pour your liquid into 3-ounce paper cups. Cover the cups with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Insert a wooden craft stick through the wrap or foil to hold the stick in place.

Don’t rule out vegetable juice pops. Pick veggies that are a little on the sweet side like beets and carrots. Consider using fresh herbs in your blend: cucumber, lime, and mint.

Texturize your pops by adding chunks of fresh fruit, thinly sliced dried fruit, nuts and even cooked grains. These ingredients will sometimes sink to the bottom of the pops; to prevent this, fill your mold partially with liquid and freeze partially. Add your ingredients in a layer or stir them in and add the rest of the liquid before returning pops to the freezer.

Freezing time varies depending on your base (creamier bases take longer), what kind of mold you are using, and the efficiency of your freezer. Generally expect to wait a couple of hours.

Remember liquid expands as it freezes. Do not overfill your molds.

Fruit loses some of its sweetness after freezing, so if you have a big sweet tooth, consider adding a little sweetener before you freeze. Liquid sweeteners tend to work well. Some granulated sweeteners can result in a grainy texture if they are not fully dissolved.

Ice pops will keep for about four weeks if you wrap them tightly. Beyond a month, however, they start to lose some of their flavor.
articleSummaryHTML: I scream, you scream we all scream for ice pops! No, really, ice pops, the healthy refreshing cool treat of summer.
seoTitle: Make summer POP! with Watermelon Coconut Mint Ice Pops!
seoDescription: I scream, you scream we all scream for ice pops! No, really, ice pops, the healthy refreshing cool treat of summer.
ingredients:
s:130:"
  • 2 cups chopped watermelon
  • 1/3 cup shredded coconut
  • 3 tablespoons chopped fresh mint
";
directions:
Puree chopped watermelon in a blender until smooth. Add the shredded coconut and pulse until combined, longer if a smoother result is desired. Pulse in mint. Freeze in pop molds according to manufacturer’s directions.

For more fun summer recipes try this amazing berry jam!

articleBodyHTML:
Bring all the fun of summer festivities and the tropics to you with this amazing vegan coconut ice cream!

Hot summer weather calls for delicious and creamy ice cream. Now, this isn’t your ordinary dairy ice cream. This creamy ice cream is made with coconut crème and vanilla. This is a great alternative to those who are lactose intolerant or vegan. This recipe is dairy free, egg free, raw, and vegan. This ice cream reminds me of my favorite soft serve as a child minus all of the added sugars and dairy. An added bonus to making your own homemade ice cream is that it is half the price of store bought ice cream. Here in Toronto, a tub can run anywhere from 6$ to 12$! Yikes!

If you have an ice cream maker, you can simply place all of the ingredients in and let the machine do the work. If you don’t have an ice cream machine, this recipe takes a little patience and time but I promise it’s worth it. Once the ingredients are blended together, place in freezer. You need to stir and whip the ice cream every 30–40 minutes to allow air in. This will have an end result of a creamy and delicious soft texture. If you want a harder based ice cream, you can stir it once or twice and leave it to set.

Full fat coconut crème will allow you to get that wonderful creamy mouth feel. If you use lower fat coconut milk, there will be more ice crystals therefore resulting in a harder ice cream. I love using the seeds from a vanilla bean as it adds a natural and delicate flavor to the ice cream. The best part is adding your favorite toppings to this ice cream. I love using my homemade cookie dough and carob chips. You can add fresh fruit, nuts and any ingredients you desire. After all, it is your masterpiece!
articleSummaryHTML: Bring all the fun of summer festivities and the tropics to you with this amazing vegan coconut ice cream!
seoTitle: Vegan Coconut Ice Cream | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Bring all the fun of summer festivities and the tropics to you with this amazing vegan coconut ice cream!
ingredients:
s:182:"
  • 2 cans full fat coconut milk
  • 1/4 cup coconut sugar
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract or 1 vanilla bean pod
";
directions:
1.) Open the can of coconut milk and scoop the crème off. Place into a bowl. Discard the clear coconut juice or save it for smoothies.

2.) Place coconut crème and remaining ingredients into your mixer. Mix for 1–2 minutes or until well combined.

3.) Place in a freezer safe bowl. Place in the freezer and whisk every 30–40 minutes for 5 hours. The more air your whisk into the mixture, the creamier the ice cream will be.

4.) Remove from freezer once set and let it sit out for a few minutes to soften. Add any additional toppings on top

articleBodyHTML:
Being vegan doesn’t mean missing your favorite yogurt. With a little coconut and this recipe, you’re back in business!

Missing out on your favorite creamy yogurt? Yogurt made out of dairy is filled with at least 12–25g of sugar per serving and they are also packed with artificial color and fruit flavors. Consuming these kinds of ingredients on a daily basis or even weekly basis does your body no good. High amounts of sugar and artificial colorings have been proven to be leading causes for mood swings, depression, anxiety, and even generating cancer cells.

Creating your own homemade yogurt made of 100% natural ingredients, dairy free, color free and sugar free is the best way to go. And absolutely tastes better than the usual yogurt.
articleSummaryHTML: Being vegan doesn’t mean missing your favorite yogurt. With a little coconut and this recipe, you’re back in business!
seoTitle: Raw Vegan Coconut Yogurt
seoDescription: Being vegan doesn’t mean missing your favorite yogurt. With a little coconut and this recipe, you’re back in business!
ingredients:
s:244:"
  • 3–4 young coconuts
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 2 probiotic capsules or 1 tablespoon probiotic powder
  • ¾ cup dairy-free milk or coconut water
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla bean (optional)
";
directions:
1. Cut the coconuts and scoop out the coconut meat. Rinse them well and strain the water, until all the small particles are clear
  2. Using a high speed blender, blend the coconut meat with coconut water or dairy-free milk until smooth and creamy
  3. Empty the probiotic capsule into the mix and give it a quick pulse
  4. Transfer the content into a glass jar and cover the top with a cheese cloth or a thin cloth that is breathable. Leave the container in a warm dark place for about a day or two.
  5. You can taste the yogurt and see if it’s fermented enough according to your taste (if it’s your enough or not).
  6. Close the jar with an air-tight lid and store it in the refrigerator. Lasts for about 1–2 weeks in the fridge.

Variations

You can use vanilla bean or lavender for giving it a unique flavor

If your kids hate eating fruits, you can hide some inside the yogurt by adding a few blueberries and orange zest to give it a bit more vitamin C

If you're loving coconut, maybe try these coconut ice pops!

articleTitle: Sunflower, Sesame and Pumpkin Seed Salad Topper
articleBodyHTML:
Take your salad to a whole new level of gourmet with this salty, spicy sunflower, sesame, and pumpkin seed salad topper!

Add some crunch, protein, healthy fats and even more nutrients to your next salad, soup or baked potato or squash. This combo of seeds is salty and spicy and elevates a salad to gourmet status. Keep a jar in the freezer to maintain freshness and to have it ready whenever you are!
articleSummaryHTML: Take your salad to a whole new level of gourmet with this salty, spicy sunflower, sesame, and pumpkin seed salad topper!
seoTitle: Sunflower, Sesame and Pumpkin Seed Salad Topper
seoDescription: Take your salad to a whole new level of gourmet with this salty, spicy sunflower, sesame, and pumpkin seed salad topper!
recipeName: Sunflower, Sesame, and Pumpkin Seed Salad Topper
ingredients:
s:300:"
  • 1 cup raw organic sunflower seeds
  • 1 cup raw organic pumpkin seeds
  • ½ cup sesame seeds, black or white
  • 2 tablespoons tamari sauce or 2–3 tablespoons coconut nectar
  • 1–2 teaspoons chili oil or cayenne pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Cover baking sheet with parchment paper, or use a stoneware baking sheet.

2. Combine the seeds and seasonings in a large bowl, stirring well. Taste and adjust seasonings if desired. Spread out evenly onto baking sheet.

3. Bake approximately 15–25 minutes stirring after 10 minutes. Let cool and store in glass jars. Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 3 weeks.

Sliced almonds, pecans, pine nuts or walnuts etc. are a great alternative to the seeds and additional spices or dried herbs can be used as well.

Check out the health benefits to pumpkin seeds!

articleBodyHTML:
Get ready for this delicious ginger-inspired smoothie that will start your day off right with energy and antioxidants!

Ginger is a powerful antioxidant that does your body good. So put some spring into your step, and energize yourself. Feel free to use your favorite fruits, but this smoothie tastes great as is. This recipe serves 2.
articleSummaryHTML: Get ready for this delicious ginger-inspired smoothie that will start your day off right with energy and antioxidants!
seoTitle: Almond Coconut Ginger Fruit Smoothie
seoDescription: Get ready for this delicious ginger-inspired smoothie that will start your day off right with energy and antioxidants!
ingredients:
s:903:"
  • 1 cup raw almond nut milk (see recipe at end)
  • ¾ cup unsweetened coconut milk (used only in the making of above nut milk)
  • ¼ fresh squeezed orange juice
  • 1 tablespoon agave
  • ½ cup frozen mango
  • 5 large frozen strawberries
  • ½ cup frozen peaches
  • ½ banana
  • 3 tablespoons grated fresh ginger (about 2.5 inches of ginger root, peeled)
  • ½ teaspoon ground ginger
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • Pinch of cloves

Almond Coconut Nut Milk

Soaking Process

  • ½ cup slivered almonds
  • 1 cup water

Blending Process

  • Use soaked almond slivers
  • 1 cup water
  • ¾ cup unsweetened coconut milk
";
directions:
Soaked Almonds

Soak almond slivers overnight (6–8 hours minimum) so they are ready for blending in the morning. I soaked about 12 hours to avoid the straining process. I also used slivered almonds because I find the result smoother and nicer.

In the morning, rinse the soaked almonds and blend with 1 cup water and 3/4 cup coconut milk until smooth.

Smoothie

Place all ingredients into blender and blend until smooth. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
A delicious, vegan smoothie using Central American fave fruits and veggies is one way to add sunshine to summer! This beet smoothie is a definite celebration of flavor!

If you’re not in Central America, don’t worry! You can still find these fruits and veggies in International Food Stores, or even better for the environment in terms of less travel for transport, try local alternatives. If you do have easy access to these fresh foods, enjoy their delicious combinations in this smoothie with Sunwarrior protein for an added anti-inflammatory, plant protein punch.
articleSummaryHTML: A delicious, vegan smoothie using Central American fave fruits and veggies is one way to add sunshine to summer! This beet smoothie is a definite celebration of flavor!
seoTitle: Creamy Nicaraguan “Beet It” Smoothie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: A delicious smoothie using Central American fave fruits and veggies is one way to add sunshine to summer! Try this Creamy Nicaraguan “Beet It” Smoothie.
ingredients:
s:825:"
  • ½ cup beet
  • ½ cup plantain
  • ½ cup chayote
  • ½ avocado
  • 1 serving Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 2–3 cups of water
  • 1 cup ice

Substitutions:

  • Instead of plantain, use banana
  • Instead of chayote, use zucchini, papaya, or pear
  • Instead of water use coconut milk

Superfood Additions:

  • 1 packet Lion's Mane medicinal mushrooms
  • 1/2 teaspoon mucuna powder
  • 1 tablespoon Liquid Light
  • Top with hemp seeds
";
directions:
Place all ingredients in blender, blend, and enjoy!

What is Chayote?

The Chayote plant contains nutrients that have anti-inflammatory properties that help with high-blood pressure, kidney stones, and indigestion. Chayote is high in fiber to balance blood sugar. Eat it raw, shred it in salads, add it to stir-fry or soups. You can even juice chayote which helps with liver health.

Did You Know?

Beets are very detoxifying for the liver? They also contain betaine, which studies have shown have significant anti-cancer properties and are effective in inhibiting the formation of cancer-causing cells in the body.

Try another Gracious Living Plant Powered Smoothie, Chocolate Lava Smoothie with beets!

articleTitle: Aztec Chocolate No Bake Chocolate Cake
articleBodyHTML:
Carpe diem with this Aztec Chocolate No Bake Chocolate Cake, flavor so decadent, you’ll forget all the nutritional benefits it offers!

Time: about 30-40 minutes and Serves 2
articleSummaryHTML: Carpe diem with this Aztec Chocolate No Bake Chocolate Cake, flavor so decadent, you’ll forget all the nutritional benefits it offers!
seoTitle: Aztec Chocolate No Bake Chocolate Cake | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Carpe diem with this Aztec Chocolate No Bake Chocolate Cake, flavor so decadent, you’ll forget all the nutritional benefits it offers!
recipeName: Aztec Chocolate No Bake Chocolate Cake
ingredients:
s:1141:"

Dry: whisk the following into a bowl:

  • ½ unbleached flour
  • ½ cup coconut flour
  • 2 1/3 tablespoon cocoa powder
  • 2 1/3 tablespoon Sunwarrior Aztec Chocolate
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ¾ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • Pinch of chili powder (optional)

Wet: mix into a separate bowl

  • ¾ cup to 1 cup coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter or peanut butter (We used Peanut Butter & Co Smooth Operator)
  • 2 tablespoons applesauce
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon ground flax seed
  • 1/3 cup organic sugar or coconut sugar
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla
  • ½ teaspoon lemon juice

Ganache topping

  • 3 tablespoons coconut milk
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 cup vegan chocolate chips
";
directions:
Add the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to make a smooth batter. Heat a heavy skillet pan over medium/low heat. Place a round metal cookie cutter (I used a large well-washed tuna can with both ends off) in the bottom of the pan and spray with coconut oil spray. Pour enough batter into the can or cutter to make about ½ inch layer. Cover with a lid and cook for about 3–4 minutes. Using tongs remove the cookie cutter form, flip the "pancake" cooking another 2–3 minutes. Continue doing this with all the batter. You can do this without the can "molds" but it will be a little drier.

Ganache

Heat the coconut milk and maple syrup until you start to see smoke or steam. Turn the heat off and add the chocolate chips and stir until melted. Let sit for a few minutes before using. Pour or spoon ganache over the cakes and stack them on top of each other.

This recipe makes 2 mini cakes with 3 layers each. It is super YUMMY and dense almost a little like a brownie, and VERY decadent.

articleBodyHTML:
Summer’s here baby, which means splish splash fun with tropical smoothies!

This smoothie definitely puts me in the mood for the summer! I love all tropical smoothies; they have such a great summery feel to them. This smoothie involves the great combination of pineapple and coconut. Of course, pineapple and coconut just scream tropical goodness! The shredded coconut adds a nice taste and texture to the smoothie. The Sunwarrior vanilla protein adds a nice vanilla flavoring. This smoothie will have you longing to lounge on a tropical island soon.

Health Benefits of Pineapple

This delicious fruit has a wealth of nutrients, vitamins, and minerals, including potassium, copper, manganese, calcium, magnesium, vitamin C, beta carotene, thiamin, B6, and folate, as well as soluble and insoluble fiber.

Health Benefits of Shredded Coconut

Coconut contains protein and fiber. Protein helps rebuilds cells and maintains healthy tissues and muscles. It is also a good source of iron. The iron is crucial to the formation hemoglobin, which carry oxygen to each part of your body. Coconut is also a good source of zinc. Zinc is a mineral crucial to the strength and health of your immune system and plays a good role in healing wounds.
articleSummaryHTML: Summer’s here baby, which means splish splash fun with tropical smoothies!
seoTitle: Tropical Smoothie Splash | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Summer’s here baby, which means splish splash fun with tropical smoothies!
ingredients:
s:352:"
  • 1 Scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 1 ½ cups almond & coconut milk
  • 1 cup frozen pineapple
  • 1 cup frozen banana
  • ½ cup shredded unsweetened coconut plus 2 tablespoons for topping
";
directions:
Combine all the ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth. Top with the 2 tablespoons of shredded coconut.

There are many other tropical smoothie combinations that taste just as good! Here are some other tropical variations to try:

  • Mango and Coconut
  • Peach and Coconut
  • Strawberry, Mango, and Coconut
  • Mango, Pineapple, and Coconut

Try other great cool coconut treats with this vegan coconut ice cream!

articleTitle: Red Curry Paste and Thai Dishes
articleBodyHTML:
For an aromatic meal of robust flavors that create a cultural experience, we offer culinary beauty with this red curry paste and Thai dishes. You’re welcome!

Lemon grass, ginger, lime leaves, and cilantro make up the delicious flavors and aromatics of Thailand. These flavors are beautiful when they are combined, creating a marriage of balance that is to be savored. Every country has its own take on flavors; these represent their culture, environment, and food profiles. Thailand is known for robust and fresh flavors with an attention to detail in each dish. Thai cuisine is growing in popularity over the world: Pad Thai and curries to the simplicity of a mango salad. This recipe will give you the base of a beautiful red Thai curry that can be used in soups, stews, and curries.

This recipe is a spin on the usual Thai curry pastes. This recipe calls for roasted red peppers and tomato paste. You can roast the peppers yourself, or you can buy a jar of organic roasted peppers, which makes life a little easier. If you want to roast your own peppers, just preheat the oven to 400 degrees, line a baking tray with parchment paper, and bake your peppers for 20 minutes, flipping them over half way through baking. The beautiful thing about this recipe is that it’s a lower sodium option then most store bought pastes. You can always opt out of using low sodium tamari by replacing it with Himalayan salt.

There are two ingredients that really make this dish flourish. The lime leaves and lemongrass. These two ingredients can be found at your local Asian supermarket. If you’ve never worked with lemon grass before, it’s always best to remove the outside layer. After you’ve remove it, chop it into 1 inch pieces and throw the pieces in to your food processor. Lime leaves are also crucial for this dish. It gives the curry paste a fragrant and aromatic taste that reflects Thailand’s unique and vibrant taste.
articleSummaryHTML: For an aromatic meal of robust flavors that create a cultural experience, we offer culinary beauty with this red curry paste and Thai dishes. You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Red Curry Paste and Thai Dishes | Sunwarrior Recipe
seoDescription: For an aromatic meal of robust flavors that create a cultural experience, we offer culinary beauty with this red curry paste and Thai dishes. You’re welcome!
recipeName: Red Curry Paste and Thai Dishes
ingredients:
s:1157:"

Thai Curry Paste

  • 1 cup chopped cilantro
  • 1/4 cup organic tomato paste
  • 2 lemon grass stalks
  • 1/4 inch ginger, grated
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • 4 roasted red peppers
  • 3 lime leaves
  • 1/2 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon low sodium Tamari
  • 1/2 Thai chili pepper
  • 1 teaspoon ground coriander

Red curry

  • 1 cup brown jasmine rice
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 onion, sliced
  • 1 tablespoon ginger, minced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 zucchini, sliced
  • 1/2 cup spinach
  • 1/2 cup chopped kale 
  • 1 can coconut milk 
  • 1/3 cup curry paste 

Garnish: Bean sprouts, fresh cilantro or basil

Noodle Soup

  • 1/4 cup Thai curry paste
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup cooked rice noodles
  • 1 cup sliced mushrooms
  • 1 cup bean sprouts
  • 1/2 cup chopped cilantro
";
directions:
Thai Curry Paste
