1.) Combine all ingredients in a food processor. Blend for 45 seconds to 1 minute.

2.) Store in an airtight container in the fridge for 5 days

Red Curry

1.) Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add coconut oil. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add ginger and garlic and cook until fragrant, 2 minutes. Add coconut milk, pepper, zucchini, and curry paste. Cover with a fitted lid and cook for 10 minutes.

2.) Add spinach and kale. Cook uncovered for 2–3 minutes. Top with bean sprouts and herbs

3.) Serve with rice

Noodle Soup

1.) Bring vegetable broth and curry paste to a boil

2.) Add mushrooms and rice noodles. Cook for 5 minutes. Top with bean sprouts and cilantro

articleBodyHTML:
You’ve got apple slices and want a sweet dip but don’t want the guilt. This chickpea coconut dip is a guilt free way to satisfy the sweet tooth.

Being vegan, chickpeas are a common staple in every household. We use them on salads, when we make hummus, and in a variety of soups. This recipe is different! It’s a treat to tempt your taste buds when that sweet craving comes along! It’s quick and easy, so grab your blender or food processor, and relax with a guilt free snack.

This recipe is also very versatile, so you can substitute and create your own creations!
articleSummaryHTML: You’ve got apple slices and want a sweet dip but don’t want the guilt. This chickpea coconut dip is a guilt free way to satisfy the sweet tooth.
seoTitle: Chickpea Coconut Dip
seoDescription: You’ve got apple slices and want a sweet dip but don’t want the guilt. This chickpea coconut dip is a guilt free way to satisfy the sweet tooth.
ingredients:
s:441:"
  • 1 cup chickpeas, drained, rinsed and shells removed (this is about 1 can’s worth)
  • ¼ cup almond butter
  • ¼-½ cup coconut milk (your preference on sweet or unsweet)
  • 2 tablespoons agave nectar
  • 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla
  • ⅓ cup vegan chocolate chips
  • ¼ cup dried cranberries
  • ⅓ cup unsweetened coconut flakes
";
directions:
1. The most time consuming part of this recipe is removing the shell off the chickpea. This is not difficult to do, it just takes about 5 minutes. The easiest way I’ve found is after you strain and rinse your chickpeas, hold one between your thumb and forefinger and slightly pinch. The chickpea will fall into your desired bowl and you can discard the shell. This step gives you a better texture.

2. When chickpeas are all ready, place them into your blender or food processor and give a quick blend just to get it started.

3. Add the almond butter, agave, and vanilla to your mixture.

4. Add the coconut milk in a little at a time until you have reached your own desired consistency. Since we are aiming for a dip, you want it to still be a little thick.

5. Once desired consistency is achieved, place into bowl and add in chips, cranberries and coconut flakes.

Serve with sliced apples for a sweet healthy treat! Dip away!

For other cool food hacks, you’ve got to try this vegan coconut yogurt!

articleTitle: How to: DIY All-Natural Home Spray
articleBodyHTML:
Clean house and freshen up with this do it yourself all natural home spray!

DIY chemical-free, all-natural home sprays to keep your house clean! Easy and fun to make, and feels good to know that you can minimize your exposure to chemicals in your food and also your environment, while saving a few bucks every month. Try it out! It will literally take you seconds to make once you get everything you need together.

Clean your home, bathroom, and counter tops with this homemade spray that is devoid of harmful chemicals that may irritate the body and skin over time. It’s also more economical and fun to make. You can add different essential oils for different anti-bacterial smells.
articleSummaryHTML: Clean house and freshen up with this do it yourself all natural home spray!
seoTitle: How to: DIY All-Natural Home Spray
seoDescription: Clean house and freshen up with this do it yourself all natural home spray!
recipeName: How to: DIY All-Natural Home Spray
ingredients:
s:669:"

Equipment

  • 1 BPA free spray bottle (You can buy these at the $1 Store, or re-use an empty spray bottle)

Ingredients

  • 1 cup white vinegar or apple cider vinegar
  • 1 cup water
  • 10–20 drops Thieves Essential Oil

The essential oils help to take away from the strong vinegar smell while having anti-bacterial and anti-mold properties.

Other Essential Oils You Can Use (as is, or in combination)

  • Lemon
  • Tea Tree Oil
  • Clove
  • Lavender
  • Grapefruit
";
directions:
Pour everything into a spray bottle. I usually do a 1:1 solution, so if your bottle is really big, I just do ½ vinegar, and ½ water. Spray and use when needed for cleaning counter tops, sinks, or toilets.

Store under sink or in cupboard away from sunlight.

Why vinegar as a cleaner?

Mildly acidic white vinegar dissolves dirt, soap scum, and hard water deposits from smooth surfaces, yet it's gentle enough to use in solution to clean hardwood flooring. White vinegar is a natural deodorizer, absorbing odors instead of covering them up. With no coloring agents, white vinegar won't stain grout on tiled surfaces. In the kitchen, use vinegar-and-water spray to clean countertops, lightly soiled range surfaces and backsplash areas. In the bathroom, spray countertops, floors and exterior surfaces of the toilet.

The less water you dilute the vinegar with, the stronger it works. Undiluted white vinegar works quicker on tougher cleaning problems involving hard water deposits or soap scum. Undiluted vinegar works particularly well on the inside of the toilet bowl. It also works really well to clean showerheads that have been clogged with mineral deposits.

articleBodyHTML:
Charge up with cacao banana chia power pudding for the most important meal of your day!

Breakfast! It’s touted as our most important meal for numerous reasons including kick-starting metabolism after your overnight fast, enabling better brain power, and stabilizing blood sugars to avoid a mid-morning crash and the often accompanying binge! Some people, just plain and simple, find this to be the best meal of the day. If you’re not convinced, this recipe may change your mind. Besides being easy to make, and best prepped the evening before, which allows for an easier morning, this recipe is oh-so-yummy. It also promotes alkalinity and can be varied to your desire. You can change the fruits, sub in vanilla or orange for the chocolate and change the toppings. Because it’s so good, I suggest you make a few days’ worth as well for it will keep in the fridge three days or so.
articleSummaryHTML: Charge up with cacao banana chia power pudding for the most important meal of your day!
seoTitle: Cacao Banana Chia Power Pudding
seoDescription: Charge up with cacao banana chia power pudding for the most important meal of your day!
ingredients:
s:729:"
  • 2 tablespoons chia seeds or chocolate chia cereal
  • 2/3 cup dairy-free milk
  • 1 small ripe banana, mashed
  • 1 heaping teaspoon raw cacao powder
  • Stevia or maple syrup if needed (to taste, optional)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla (powder or liquid or the seeds of ½ fresh pod)
  • Generous pinch cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg and ginger powder
  • Garnish: Hemp seeds, coconut shreds, raw cacao nibs, orange zest, optional

Great add-ins

  • 1 serving Vitamin Mineral Rush
  • 1 serving maca or Lucama powder
";
directions:
For best results, assemble the ingredients the night before and let it set in the refrigerator. The next morning, it’s ready to go. Forgot to do this? No problem; just let stand fifteen minutes in the morning.

Serving option: To enjoy the pudding warm, simply warm the milk in the morning over medium low heat. (Don’t boil). Serve in a bowl garnishing as desired.

articleBodyHTML:
You could call granola the “little black dress” of the breakfast table. It's simple, elegant and dresses up or down at your whim. Breakfast never looked so good!

Start with a simple combo of oats and nuts, add a little oil and a sweetener and then dress it up—or down—for just about any season!  Here are a few pointers to make sure your granola is always the talk of the town.

Feel your oats

For best results, select old-fashioned rolled oats over the quick-cooking or steel-cut kind.

Go big or go home

Because there are lots of ingredients—most of them in small pieces or flakes—a big mixing bowl is a must for combining your granola mixture. The right bowl will give you plenty of room to combine ingredients easily and quickly without making a giant mess.

Make a template

One of the best things about granola is how easy it is to make substitutions. Find a good recipe and make it the first time according to the recipe directions. Then put your own stamp on it by switching things up. Try dried cherries or cranberries instead of raisins. Ditch the nuts and stir in pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds. (Work to keep the ratio of wet-to-dry ingredients roughly the same as in the original recipe for best results.)

Spice it up

Cinnamon is a natural in granola, but you can have fun with small amounts of allspice or cardamom, or try a spice blend like pumpkin pie or apple pie spice. Flavored extracts open up another world of flavor options, but start out sparingly, a little can go a long way, depending on the extract. And don’t forget the salt—it adds dimension to the finished granola and keeps it from being too sweet.

Chew the fat

Of course you want to make granola as healthy as possible, but if you don’t use any oil, you're going to have a pile of dry oats. Olive and coconut oil are the most commonly used in granola recipes, but you can experiment with small batches using oils to complement your other ingredients.

Cool it

Be sure your granola has completely cooled before storing. Condensation from still-warm granola in a closed container will make the mixture sticky and limp.
articleSummaryHTML: You could call granola the “little black dress” of the breakfast table. It's simple, elegant and dresses up or down at your whim. Breakfast never looked so good!
seoTitle: Pear Raisin Granola
seoDescription: You could call granola the “little black dress” of the breakfast table. It's simple, elegant and dresses up or down at your whim. Breakfast never looked so good!
ingredients:
s:427:"
  • 6 cups old fashioned rolled oats
  • 1 cup walnuts, soaked and drained
  • 2/3 cup almonds, soaked and drained
  • 1 cup golden raisins
  • 1/2 cup honey (or agave for vegan option)
  • 1/2 cup coconut oil, softened
  • 1 tablespoon cinnamon
  • 1 vanilla bean, insides only
  • 3 large pears, cored
  • 1/4 cup purified or distilled water
";
directions:
Chop nuts and place in a large mixing bowl. Add oats to bowl. In a blender, blend honey (or agave), oil, pears, vanilla, cinnamon and water together. Pour blended mixture over dry ingredients. Stir until well combined. Place mixture on mesh dehydrator sheets. Dehydrate at 105 degrees until completely dry, approximately 18–20 hours. After granola is dehydrated, place it back into a large mixing bowl and add any or all of the following:

Store in a glass jar or air tight container. Serve with almond or walnut milk as a breakfast or eat plain as a snack.

articleBodyHTML: For a bar that is more meal than it is snack, you have got to try the little bit of heaven found in these tropical chocolate peanut butter bars.
articleSummaryHTML: For a bar that is more meal than it is snack, you have got to try the little bit of heaven found in these tropical chocolate peanut butter bars.
seoTitle: Tropical Chocolate Peanut Butter Bars | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: For a bar that is more meal than it is snack, you have got to try the little bit of heaven found in these tropical chocolate peanut butter bars.
ingredients:
s:1049:"
  • ½ cups Medjool dates pitted
  • 1 cup of shredded coconut
  • ¾ cup pecans
  • 1 ½ cup oats
  • 1 cup brown rice cereal
  • 1 cup chopped dried pineapple
  • 1 cup chopped dried mango
  • ¾-1 cup chopped raw cashews
  • ½ cup mini chocolate chips
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior illumin8 Vanilla Bean or Warrior Blend vanilla
  • Pinch of sea salt
  • 1 ½ cup peanut butter (I used PB&CO Smooth Operator)
  • ½ cup honey, Agave, or maple syrup
";
directions:
1. Pulse Medjool dates, shredded coconut, and pecans together in processor then press into bottom of parchment lined cake pan
  2. In separate bowl mix oats, rice cereal, pineapple, mango, cashews, chocolate chips, illumin8, and sea salt
  3. In small sauce pan melt peanut butter and honey together
  4. Pour melted PB mixture over dried mix and stir together till all incorporated.
  5. Spread over top of date, pecan, and coconut mixture. Press down firm and chill in fridge.
  6. I like to melt dark chocolate and spread on top of that and chill again for a few minutes.
  7. Cut into bars and enjoy!!
  8. Store in fridge

Makes approx. 12 bars or 24 squares

articleBodyHTML:
Who doesn’t love the delicious edible delight we call rice crispy treats? If you make them with health in mind, you will be thrilled with the results!

These little snacks are a staple in my kitchen. They are simple to make and packed with nutrients and protein. The best part about these treats is that they are made with brown rice cereal instead of its heavily processed counterpart. Unlike the store bought brand, this recipe uses brown rice syrup to hold the bars together. You can always use honey if you do not have brown rice syrup in your pantry.

Brown rice, unlike white, still has the hull and bran on it. This hull provides the rice grain with vitamins and fiber. Brown rice is also low on the glycemic rating which reduces insulin spikes. This is great for anyone trying to watch their figure or wanting to add more nutrients into their daily diet.

This recipe calls for almond butter because of its nutritional elements. Almond butter contains heart healthy fats and fiber. Almond butter is a higher fat food but it contains monounsaturated fats which helps reduce cholesterol levels and aids in weight loss. Switching from unhealthy fats such as trans fats found in fast food and junk food to monounsaturated fats such as almond butter, olive oil and avocados are a great way to reduce the mid line. Almond butter is also very high in protein, coming in at a whopping 7–8 grams of protein per 2 tablespoons. You can either make your own almond butter at home or purchase it at the store. Just be wary of any added sugars, salt and additives. Always read the labels and be aware of what you are buying.

If you do not like almond butter, don’t fret. You can sub this for any nut butter such as cashew, walnut, or even hazelnut.
articleSummaryHTML: Who doesn’t love the delicious edible delight we call rice crispy treats? If you make them with health in mind, you will be thrilled with the results!
seoTitle: Brown Rice Crispy Treats
seoDescription: Who doesn’t love the delicious edible delight we call rice crispy treats? If you make them with health in mind, you will be thrilled with the results!
ingredients:
s:254:"
  • 3 cups brown rice crispy cereal
  • 1/2 cup almond butter
  • 1/3 cup brown rice syrup or honey
  • 2 tablespoons flax meal
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1/3 cup trail mix or chocolate chips
";
directions:
1.) Place almond butter, brown rice syrup and coconut oil in a small pan over low heat. Cook for 4–5 minutes, ensuring the mixture is slightly warm to the touch. Remove from heat and set aside.

2.) Place brown rice cereal, trail mix and flax meal in a large bowl. Add warmed almond butter mixture and combine until cereal is well coated.

3.) Line a small rectangular pan with parchment paper. Pour mixture into pan and press down firmly to ensure the mixture is well set. Place in fridge for 2 hours to set.

4.) Remove from fridge, and cut into squares.

articleBodyHTML:
For the snack attack days of summer, these sunbutter banana bites will add satisfaction and sweetness to your day.

You have those days, too, right? The “I really want a snack, yet it’s got to be healthy and sate my appetite for a while” sensation. I am sure it happens to the best of us, and that’s why I keep a cache of goodies on hand. Today, our creation takes a familiar combination and marries the ingredients with a few hero foods for a truly satisfying, seems-so-indulgent-but-it’s not, treat.

Banana bites store perfectly in the freezer, making them a cool, refreshing treat in summer’s heat. I make sure to serve them fresh when presenting them at conferences where I speak since frozen bananas can be a little unsightly when they start to melt. Fresh or frozen, the treats are a hit—especially among children, making the treats a great snack for the classroom. Best of all, If you enlist your children’s help, the kids will have a blast making them with you! There is both magic and wisdom in preparing food with your loved ones.

Connecting kids with food and meal creation is an ideal way to educate them on the importance of eating nourishing foods and taking the time to enjoy both the preparation as well as the consumption. Plus the time you spend together is irreplaceable. Let’s make family meals a norm once again.

Here’s to great food that fuels great health, is ever so fun in both prep and consumption, and just happens to deliver a great dose of antioxidants in the raw cacao.
articleSummaryHTML: For the snack attack days of summer, these sunbutter banana bites will add satisfaction and sweetness to your day.
seoTitle: Sunbutter Banana Bites
seoDescription: For the snack attack days of summer, these sunbutter banana bites will add satisfaction and sweetness to your day.
ingredients:
s:244:"
  • 2 large ripe bananas
  • Approximately ¼ cup sunbutter (organic: regular or crunchy)
  • 2 tablespoons raw cacao powder
  • 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon
  • Raw cacao nibs for topping
";
directions:
Cut bananas into approximately ½ inch slices.

Place slices on a parchment-covered cutting board and sprinkle each with raw cacao powder.

Top each piece with a small teaspoon of Sunbutter then top with cinnamon and cacao nibs.

Cover and place in the freezer for approximately 1 hour or until frozen then transfer to a container, storing for up to two weeks.

Ready for more dessert? You gotta try this no bake chocolate cake!

articleTitle: Apple Fennel Salad with Lemon Zest
articleBodyHTML: Cool off from those hot summer days while also adding a little zing to your life with an apple fennel salad with lemon zest!
articleSummaryHTML: Cool off from those hot summer days while also adding a little zing to your life with an apple fennel salad with lemon zest!
seoTitle: How to Make Apple Fennel Salad with Lemon Zest | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Cool off from those hot summer days while also adding a little zing to your life with an apple fennel salad with lemon zest!
recipeName: Apple Fennel Salad with Lemon Zest
ingredients:
s:432:"
  • 2 cups fennel, thinly sliced
  • 2 cups apple, thinly julienned
  • 1 tablespoon lemon zest
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar
  • 2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon fresh thyme, minced or 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • Cracked black pepper, to taste
  • 1⁄2 cup chopped walnuts
";
directions:
1.To julienne apple and fennel, slice thinly in one direction and then slice in opposite direction to create matchsticks, or use a mandolin on a thin slice setting.

2. In a medium size bowl, toss together all salad ingredients except walnuts. Let marinate at room temperature up to 4 hours. Top with walnuts just before serving.

Apples and fennel make a sweet, fresh, and crisp combination. Both are loaded with fiber, nutrients, and properties that are excellent for digestion. This salad is perfect in the summertime alongside other recipes that are fresh and wholesome.

And for dessert, tropical chocolate peanut butter bars!

articleBodyHTML:
Move over breakfast burrito, the breakfast taco has arrived! A healthy way to start your morning!

Why didn’t I think of this before?! Combining two of my favorites: tacos and breakfast - genius!

I’m sure you have read or heard about how important breakfast is to your health. But, some people just can’t stomach the thought of eating anything in the morning. Is that you? If so, you are definitely not alone, as a surprising amount of people skip breakfast for one reason or another.

Breakfast helps prevent that mid-morning blood sugar crash that leaves you feeling fatigued and irritable later in the day. By getting something in our systems before we run out the door, we can stabilize our blood sugar levels.

What makes a successful breakfast?

Getting a blend of protein, carbohydrates, and fat is a great start! These macronutrients will ensure you have energy to nail your morning meetings. Major bright flavor from the cilantro-lime dressing wakes up the senses, which can be helpful in the morning :) These tacos are also easy to make, grab and go. No utensils required!

I hope this entree-inspired breakfast recipe encourages you, or someone you know, to start your day with the right nutrients to fuel your morning.
articleSummaryHTML: Move over breakfast burrito, the breakfast taco has arrived! A healthy way to start your morning!
seoTitle: How to Make Vegan Breakfast Tacos | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Move over breakfast burrito, the breakfast taco has arrived! A healthy way to start your morning!
ingredients:
s:811:"
  • 5 corn tortillas
  • 1/4 cup arugula

Black Bean Spread

  • 1/3 cup canned black beans, drained
  • 1 garlic clove
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Dash of cumin

Potato Onion Hash

  • 2 red potatoes
  • 1/2 cup diced onions (white or yellow work best)
  • Liberal seasoning of dried oregano and rosemary
  • 3 teaspoons olive oil

Cilantro-Lime Dressing

  • 1/4 cup cilantro finely chopped
  • Juice of 1 whole lime
  • 1/4 teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil

Optional

  • 3 egg whites + 3 eggs (or vegg equivalent)
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
  2. Dice potatoes in 1/4 inch cubes and onions into small pieces. Set aside onions.
  3. Spread potatoes in a single layer on a cookie sheet wrapped in aluminum foil. Drizzle olive oil and dried herbs over potatoes and toss to evenly combine.
  4. Place in oven for about 15 minutes. Before the potatoes are completely cooked, add in the onions for the last 5 minutes or so. Use a spatula to incorporate the onions in the hash so that they combine with the olive oil and seasonings.
  5. While the potatoes are baking, let’s make the black bean spread.
  6. Throw in all ingredients for the spread into a small food processor or blender and pulse on high until a paste develops. Set the spread aside.
  7. After the potato/onion hash is pulled out, let cool.
  8. Warm tortillas slightly so they are pliable and easier to work with.
  9. Now we are ready to start assembling the tacos!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your green on with this green smoothie bowl and stock up on the nutrients you’ve been missing!

Smoothie bowls are the perfect way to start the day, have as a delicious snack, or enjoy as a wonderful dessert. Green smoothies are a perfect way to amass all of the nutrients that may be missing from your day to day repertoire. You can add any fruits or vegetables that you like and blend it up! This smoothie bowl uses coconut water, matcha powder, greens, and pumpkin seeds, which all have their own special properties and health benefits. Smoothie bowls are naturally sweet and filling. At this time of year, we tend to be more active either taking part in activities outside, walking, or swimming. This smoothie bowl will keep you hydrated, replenished, and will add a large amount of plant-based protein, which will help your muscles recover from any type of workout.

Matcha or green tea powder is one of the richest foods in antioxidants. Antioxidants can kill free radial cells in the body which have been linked to cancer. They are our first line of defense in the body or, as I like to call them, my internal soldiers. Matcha can boost our energy levels and endurance while boosting our memory. We added a scoop of Sunwarrior protein to give our smoothie bowl a burst of protein.

This smoothie bowl has coconut water to keep you refreshed the entire day. Coconut water has a large amount of natural electrolytes and mineral rich fluids which replenishes you after a long workout or prior to a workout. Coconut water also aids in indigestion and stomach aches. We added avocado to incorporate healthy fats and potassium. Avocados contain more potassium than a banana! Potassium can help reduce cramps in the body after a workout. Potassium helps regulate fluid glance and activity of the heart in the body. Lastly we added a protein powerhouse: pumpkin seeds. These little guys are high in fiber, high in protein and minerals, and help reduce inflammation in the body.
articleSummaryHTML: Get your green on with this green smoothie bowl and stock up on the nutrients you’ve been missing!
seoTitle: Green Smoothie Bowl | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get your green on with this green smoothie bowl and stock up on the nutrients you’ve been missing!
ingredients:
s:293:"
  • 1/2 avocado
  • 1 can coconut water
  • 1 teaspoon matcha powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior natural protein
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 tablespoon raw pumpkin seeds
";
directions: Blend avocado, coconut water, matcha powder, protein powder, and banana in a high speed blender. Remove from blender and add pumpkin seeds

articleTitle: PB&J Superfood Smoothie with Hello Alice
articleBodyHTML:
Hello Alice! It’s time for another smoothie, but let’s turn back the clocks to an age of swanky good times and iconic fashion for this PB&J smoothie recipe!

Pull up to the drive in and let Alice whip you up something in her blender. She’s a smoothie gal, so you know it’ll be healthy and delicious. Today, you get to enjoy a PB&J, the sandwich that just about everyone loves. That’s right; Alice is combining the childlike wonder of your first peanut butter and jelly into an adult version you can sip at without judgement.

To go from sandwich to smoothie isn’t too complicated. It also doesn’t involve just tossing one in the blender. Start with peanut butter, of course. You can also use other nut butters here. Choose your favorite! Strawberries and blueberries come together to take care of the jelly portion of this smoothie. They’re sweet, colorful, rich in antioxidants, and they smell like spring. Use frozen ones for a cooler, thicker, more refreshing beverage.

Now on to the superfoods! Chia seeds create some of the jelly texture you want, plus they’re energizing with healthy fats and the best mix of soluble and insoluble fiber. Spinach, camu camu, and Sunwarrior’s Liquid Light add vitamins and minerals to make this recipe extra healthy. Shhh, no one will know they’re there once you blend. Classic vanilla protein boosts the protein level and the creaminess. Honey brings more of that sweetness. If you still need some greens, we’ve got you covered with Supergreens. Slip on that soft top, pop the clutch, and see what your blender can handle. Man oh man, it’s smoking, in a good way. Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: Hello Alice! It’s time for another smoothie, but let’s turn back the clocks to an age of swanky good times and iconic fashion for this PB&J smothie recipe!
seoTitle: PB&J Superfood Smoothie with Hello Alice
seoDescription: Hello Alice! It’s time for another smoothie, but let’s turn back the clocks to an age of swanky good times and iconic fashion for this PB&J smothie recipe!
recipeName: PB&J Superfood Smoothie with Hello Alice
ingredients:
s:732:"
  • 1 cup strawberries
  • 1 cup water
  • ½ cup spinach
  • 2 spoonfuls hemp seeds
  • 2 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 2 teaspoons maca powder
  • ½ teaspoon camu camu powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • 1 capful Liquid Light
  • ½ tablespoon Ormus Greens
  • 1 tablespoon honey (or vegan sweetener)
  • ½ cup blueberries
";
directions: Blend until smooth.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your Yankee Doodle on with this red, white, and blue smoothie bowl just in time for your July festivities!

July fourth is almost here and we are celebrating America’s Independence Day with something cold, sweet, and healthy. Yep. Healthy. It is no real surprise that the strawberry is shaped like your heart as the benefits the strawberry offers your heart are numerous with the fiber, antioxidants, and vitamins your body needs. The blueberry is an excellent companion with even more fiber, antioxidants and rocking the vitamin C as if it’s gunning for the orange’s job.

And we’re doing your muscles an extra favor by including a special treat just for them: protein. As you work out, your muscles require an extra boost to do what they do best, and Sunwarrior’s protein hits the perfect spot of adding creamy smooth flavor to your smoothie and adding the extra mile to your work out. We put it in a bowl because a smoothie this good cannot be limited to a simple glass.

So this Independence Day, liberate yourself from disease and the aging effects of free radicals with this vitamin rich smoothie that tastes as great as it will make you feel! We celebrate our holidays with healthy snacks because healthy is how you get more days to celebrate!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your Yankee Doodle on with this red, white, and blue smoothie bowl just in time for your July festivities!
seoTitle: July Fun Smoothie Bowl | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Get your Yankee Doodle on with this red, white, and blue smoothie bowl just in time for your July festivities!
ingredients:
s:413:"
  • ½ cup frozen strawberries
  • ½ cup frozen blueberries
  • ½ cup nut milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract or maple syrup
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
";
directions:
Place all ingredients into your blender. Blend away until creamy. Pour in bowl. Garnish with fruit, seeds, nuts, or your favorite natural goodies. Eat with a big ol’ spoon! Napkins are optional.

If you’re planning on picnicking in July, we’ve got your covered!

articleTitle: 3 Dairy-Free Nut Milk Recipes + Recipe Videos
articleBodyHTML:
Nut milks are full of healthy fats needed for optimal health without all the downsides to dairy milks. Check ‘em out and have a drink to good health!

A Gracious Living Lifestyle is all about fresh foods, living foods, whole foods, raw foods, plants foods, superfoods, and REAL FOOD for peak performance and abundant energy. We are living beings made of cells, so it only makes sense to eat live foods filled with nutrition that maximize the performance of our cells.

Almond milk is great, but variety is greater! Keep things interesting by giving these yummy dairy-free nut milks a try. The nuts featured in the milk recipes below are full of good fats that are needed for optimal health. These heart-healthy fats also make for super creamy milks. If you really want to make almond milk, simply swap out the nuts in these recipes with almonds!

These are just some of the recipes in the BRAND NEW Gracious Living Lifestyle Healing Series E-books with accompanying videos. My passion is helping others heal and prevent diseases, and live the life of their dreams, by eating as clean as possible. The cleaner we eat, the better our bodies and brains work, giving us clarity and focus to better handle life’s stresses and move in the direction of our limitless potential.

These eBooks contain some of my favorite raw food recipes designed to heal the body rapidly. They are super easy, delicious, and nutrient dense. These recipes were chosen to show you that healthy eating does not have to be complicated or require hours in the kitchen. There are so many variations you can do with these simple, healing recipes. Every recipe includes ingredients that help your cells thrive and work to the best of their ability. The beauty of these ingredients is that they are versatile and easy to use in different kinds of recipes, sweet or savory. We are not only learning to become efficient inside of our bodies, but we are also learning to become more efficient in the kitchen!

Want to learn more, feel better, and have fun in the kitchen? You can purchase Grace’s healing recipe collection on her website:

http://www.gracevanberkum.com/gracious-living-healing-bundle/
articleSummaryHTML: Nut milks are full of healthy fats needed for optimal health without all the downsides to dairy milks. Check ‘em out and have a drink to good health!
seoTitle: 3 Dairy-Free Nut Milk Recipes + Recipe Videos
seoDescription: Nut milks are full of healthy fats needed for optimal health without all the downsides to dairy milks. Check ‘em out and have a drink to good health!
ingredients:
s:1075:"

(Makes 3–4 servings)

Pecan Cinnamon Milk

This combination of pecans and cinnamon will blow your taste buds away!

1 cup soaked pecans

3 cups clean water

1 teaspoon cinnamon powder

Optional

3 soaked and pitted dates for added natural sweetness and extra fiber

½ teaspoon pure vanilla

Brazil Nut Maca Milk

1 cup soaked brazil nuts

3 cups clean water

1 teaspoon raw maca powder

Optional

1 teaspoon Ceylon cinnamon powder

1 tablespoon raw cacao powder

3 soaked and pitted dates for added natural sweetness and extra fiber

Cashew Banana Milk

1 cup soaked cashew nuts

3 cups clean water

1 ripe banana

Optional

1 teaspoon Ceylon cinnamon powder

1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder

3 soaked and pitted dates for added natural sweetness and extra fiber

";
directions:
Prior to adding to recipes or consuming, soak nuts and seeds in clean, filtered water for about an hour. This removes natural components of the nut called “enzyme inhibitors” that hinder digestion and nutrient absorption. If you don’t have time to soak your nuts, rinse them thoroughly. You will notice the brown murky water that accumulates when you soak them; this is all the stuff that impedes digestion. Dispose of soaking liquid and rinse nuts or seeds again. They are now ready to use.

Place all ingredients for one individual nut milk recipe into blender. Blend until smooth and creamy. Keeps in refrigerator for three days.

Learn more about soaking nuts and seeds!

Gracious Living Tip:

Use your homemade dairy-free milks as a base for your chia puddings.

Try Gracious Living Lifestyle 3 minute Layered Chia Pudding

articleBodyHTML:
Summer is a great time to make smoothies and fruity drinks. With the temperatures steadily rising, stay hydrated and cool with this healthy strawberry limeade!

I made this drink after I completed a hot workout, and craved something cold and fruity. I found some strawberries and limes in the fridge, combined them with some chia seeds, and enjoyed a refreshing post-workout drink. This limeade is delicious and refreshing!

Here are a few tips to stay hydrated throughout your day:

1) Keep a water bottle with you at all times.

2) Sip on water throughout the day, do not wait until you feel thirsty because at this point, you’re already dehydrated.

3) Eat lots of fruits and vegetables. Fruits and vegetables have a lot of water content in them, more than you would think. Fruits such as pineapple, cranberries, oranges, raspberries, apricots, blueberries, plums, pears, and apples are more than 85% water.

4) Sip on sports drinks (coconut water is a healthy option) after hot workouts to replace electrolytes.

5) Check the toilet: Note the color of your urine to see if you are well hydrated or not. When you are properly hydrated, your urine color should be pale yellow. If your urine color is dark yellow, drink more water!

Strawberries are full of antioxidants, Vitamin C, helps with production of collagen, and a good source of fiber.

The health benefits of strawberries:

  • Boost immunity
  • Promote eye health
  • Help fight cancer
  • Keep wrinkles at bay
  • Fight bad cholesterol
  • Reduce inflammation
  • Regulate blood pressure
  • Aid in weight management.

Limes are another great fruit! They're full of dietary fiber, Vitamin C, Folate, Thiamin, Vitamin B6, Calcium, Iron, Copper, Phosphorous, and Potassium.

The health benefits of lime:

  • Weight loss
  • Skin care
  • Improved digestion
  • Relief from constipation
  • Eye care
  • Heart health
articleSummaryHTML: Summer is a great time to make smoothies and fruity drinks. With the temperatures steadily rising, stay hydrated and cool with this healthy strawberry limeade!
seoTitle: Healthy Strawberry Limeade | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Summer is a great time to make smoothies and fruity drinks. With the temperatures steadily rising, stay hydrated and cool with this healthy strawberry limeade!
ingredients:
s:224:"
  • 5 medium-sized strawberries
  • Juice from 3 small key limes
  • 2 tablespoons honey or agave
  • ¾ cup water
  • 1 cup ice cubes
  • ¼ cup chia seeds
";
directions:
Blend all ingredients together for 2 minutes until fully blended. Enjoy right away!

Stay hydrated and be happy!

Wanting to mix up your hydration options? Try this superfood smoothie!

articleBodyHTML:
Why is the cashew shaped like a smile? Because it knows how good for you it is! Nut cheese is a tasty way to find your own smile!

Cashews are great for your blood due to the iron and copper content, and anything that is good for your blood is good for your heart. Cashews have been shown to lower blood pressure and level out cholesterol. This is due to the healthy fats and proteins as well as the many vitamins and minerals like B6, folic acid and potassium.

Nuts are a great way to replace animal fats in your diet with healthy fats that actually improve your cardiovascular health rather than detract from it. A diet balanced with these healthy fats will help reduce the risk of stroke and heart disease and if eaten in moderation, they will also contribute to weight loss.
articleSummaryHTML: Why is the cashew shaped like a Cheshire cat smile? Because it knows how good for you it is! Nut cheese is a tasty way to find your own smile!
seoTitle: Vegan Cheese: Cashew “Raw”cotta
seoDescription: Why is the cashew shaped like a Cheshire cat smile? Because it knows how good for you it is! Nut cheese is a tasty way to find your own smile!
recipeName: Make Your Own Nut Cheese: Cashew “Raw”cotta
ingredients:
s:332:"
  • 1/2 cup cashews (soaked in water for 1 hour)
  • 1 teaspoon nutritional yeast
  • Handful of basil or 1–2 teaspoons dried basil
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Add olive oil if necessary for consistency
";
directions:
1. Drain the cashews and place in food processor with dried herbs and salt and pepper. Process until the mixture takes on the consistency of ricotta cheese. Set aside.

2. Sprinkle on raw pizza crust, raw pasta “zucchini noodles” or on a salad.

When you can make your own “cheese” out of nuts, you are truly using one of the best ways to keep your diet natural and dairy free. Cashews have that same mouth feel as cheese, as they provide fat, texture, and flavor—especially when you make it salty! If you are allergic to nuts, you can also use hemp seeds.

You can also make nut milk! These three nut milk recipes will make you wonder why you ever bought dairy.

articleBodyHTML:
For a sweet, healthy snack with some crunch to it, you will love this quinoa brittle!

Quinoa has more protein than other grains like rice, barley, and wheat. One cup of quinoa even has two grams more protein than a large egg. The protein in quinoa is also a complete protein, offering all the essential amino acids a human requires to build strong muscle and connective tissue, and create all the enzymes we use in a myriad of ways throughout the body. This amino acid profile is similar to the balance provided by milk and it includes lysine, often missing in plant-based proteins. This is why Sunwarrior uses quinoa in their Classic Plus!

Other benefits of quinoa is that it’s gluten free, unlike many grains. It is a low calorie food and is low on the glycemic index. It comes packed with fiber and contains more calcium than other grains.
articleSummaryHTML: For a sweet, healthy snack with some crunch to it, you will love this quinoa brittle!
seoTitle: Protein Quinoa Brittle
seoDescription: For a sweet, healthy snack with some crunch to it, you will love this quinoa brittle!
ingredients:
s:336:"
  • ½ cup uncooked quinoa
  • ¾ cup chopped pecans
  • ¼ cup rolled oats
  • 2 tablespoons chia seeds
  • 2 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • Pinch of sea salt
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • ½ cup maple syrup
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment, make sure it covers the entire pan and up the edges to prevent spill over.
  2. Mix all the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl.
  3. In a small sauce pan, melt the coconut oil and maple syrup until well blended. Pour over the dry ingredients and stir until completely combined.
  4. Pour out onto the parchment-lined pan. Spread as evenly as possible to ensure even baking. If the mixture is too thin on the edges, the edges will burn while the middle won’t crisp up.
  5. Bake for 15–20, turn the pan for even browning and bake for 5–10 more minutes until a nice golden brown color.

articleBodyHTML:
Smokey roasted cauliflower is a savory meal that will fill your cells with nutrition while it fills your belly with goodness!

I am a self-confessed veggie addict, and this is one of those recipes I can make time and time again. If anyone else plans on getting any then I need to double the recipe as my personal serving size is big. This cruciferous vegetable has seemed to gain popularity recently, if you’ve yet to add it to your vegetable selection, now is the time.

This recipe is ever so easy to prepare as only the roasting time that demands your patience.  Shop for the freshest cauliflower heads you can find and toss in the flavorful marinade then let the oven heat do its magic transforming this veggie into a wonderful flavor-rich side dish.

Any color of cauliflower will be fine whether it’s the white, green, or orange options the grocers carry. For all of those out there believing they don’t like vegetables, my thoughts are you simply haven’t liked the way they were prepared. Give your veggies flavor with interesting seasoning and try roasting. You will most likely be very pleasantly surprised.
articleSummaryHTML: Smokey roasted cauliflower is a savory meal that will fill your cells with nutrition while it fills your belly with goodness!
seoTitle: Smokey Roasted Cauliflower Divine
seoDescription: Smokey roasted cauliflower is a savory meal that will fill your cells with nutrition while it fills your belly with goodness!
ingredients:
s:430:"
  • 1 large cauliflower
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard or grainy mustard
  • 1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt, or to taste and freshly ground black pepper
  • 2–3 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • Topping, optional: 2 tablespoons nutrition yeast
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375–400° Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.

2. Remove any green leaves from the cauliflower, wash and cut into 2 inch pieces. Set aside to prepare the marinade.

3. In a large bowl combine the garlic, lemon juice, Dijon, thyme leaves, salt and pepper. Whisk in the oil.

4. Toss the cauliflower in the marinade and stir well or massage in, ensuring each floweret is covered. Place in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle with paprika.

5. Roast until the surface is nicely bronzed, approximately 25 to 35 minutes pending on the heat of your oven and the size of the cauliflower pieces. Remove from the oven and top with the nutritional yeast mixture if using.

6. Return to the oven and bake approximately 5 minutes longer or until desired doneness. Cauliflower should look bronzed. Serve while hot or enjoy a room temperature if desired.

articleTitle: Green Protein Chia Pudding with Party in My Plants
articleBodyHTML:
Get ready for awesome! This green chia pudding is full of healthy, happy flavor. You’re welcome.

Ready for a hyper-energetic delivery of a hyper-energetic recipe? Talia Pollock, the always entertaining and totally knowledgeable host of Party in My Plants, is living proof that plant-based energy is hard to contain. Ever heard the expression “Good old healthy fun?” Nothing fits that description better than chia pudding. Chia pudding is all of that and more.

Chia seeds themselves are nothing short of a miracle. They come fully loaded with fiber, protein, potassium, calcium, iron, and omega 3s. Good things do come in small packages. These great things come in tiny seeds with no caloric downsides. And the way they transform themselves in liquid is magical. Way cooler than Mentos and Coke, especially since you can still enjoy them afterward.

This green protein chia pudding makes the ultimate snack or breakfast: serving boot optional.

 

 

Are you seeing weird numbers and letters? Find out why here!
articleSummaryHTML: Get ready for awesome! This green chia pudding is full of healthy happy flavor. You’re welcome.
seoTitle: Green Protein Chia Pudding | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Get ready for awesome! This green chia pudding is full of healthy happy flavor. You’re welcome.
recipeName: Green Protein Chia Pudding with Party In My Plants
ingredients:
s:296:"
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • Handful spinach or kale
  • 2 tablespoons Sunwarrior vanilla powder
  • 2 pitted dates (or sweetener of your choice)
  • ¼ cup chia seeds
";
directions:
1. Place all ingredients in the blender except the chia seeds.
  2. Blend them up until it’s nice and smooth and add chia seeds.
  3. Mix them all up until all the chia seeds are covered.
  4. Lid it and pop it in the fridge for fifteen to twenty minutes to let the chia seeds do their magic.
  5. You can now treat it like a deliciously decadent tapioca pudding. Add granola, nut butter, make a parfait, sprinkle in fruit, or enjoy it straight as is. Let your imagination out to play. Take it on the go. Eat it anywhere. Feel the energizing effects as you tackle the gym or your day at the office. This pudding is your new best friend. Enjoy!

articleTitle: 10 Day Smoothie Detox: Day 1 - Very Berry with Koya Webb
articleBodyHTML:
Day one of Koya's detox challenge! We’ll kick it off with a very berry smoothie to be peaceful, happy, and whole!

Koya’s back with her first smoothie of the 10 day smoothie detox challenge, and she does not disappoint. If you like berries, you’re gonna love this one. Koya uses one of her favorite beverages, Raspberry Olakino Koa, as the base for this smoothie. This Koa is perfect for hot weather, and is made with 11 fruits and vegetables. If Koa’s not an option for you, feel free to use your favorite berry-flavored juice or even filtered water as your base.
articleSummaryHTML: Day one of Koya's detox challenge! We’ll kick it off with a very berry smoothie to be peaceful, happy, and whole!
seoTitle: 10 Day Smoothie Detox: Day 1 - Very Berry | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Day one of Koya's detox challenge! We’ll kick it off with a very berry smoothie to be peaceful, happy, and whole!
ingredients:
s:485:"
  • 8–12 ounces Raspberry Olakino Koa
  • 2 bananas
  • 2 cups mixed frozen berries
  • Handful of parsley and cilantro
  • 1 thumb ginger
  • Pinch of cayenne
  • Pinch of turmeric
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 3 drops stevia
  • 2 tablespoons Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
Start with either a Koa or water base. Throw in some potassium-filled bananas, and frozen berries. Love strawberries? Throw ‘em in. Raspberries or blueberries? Add them too. Next, add your greens. Koya loves cilantro and parsley in this smoothie, although you can use whatever you love. Finish up with ginger, cayenne, turmeric, and cinnamon. For a warm, sweet taste, add a little vanilla and stevia. Blend this baby up, get your blender boogie on, then add protein powder and blend again. Pour, drink, savor, and enjoy this perfect way to start your day.

articleTitle: 10 Day Smoothie Detox: Day 2 - Peach Perfection with Koya Webb
articleBodyHTML:
Day two of Koya's detox challenge teaches you to love yourself first with a perfect peachy keen smoothie!

Did you just absolutely love day one of Koya’s 10 day smoothie detox challenge? Are you ready for day two? Good. Here ya go. If peaches are your perfect passion, get ready for a mouthful of melodious magnitude!
articleSummaryHTML: Day two of Koya's detox challenge teaches you to love yourself first with a perfect peachy keen smoothie!

ingredients:
s:505:"
  • 2 bananas
  • 2 cups frozen peaches
  • 8 ounces filtered water
  • 2 sprigs basil
  • 1 kale leaf
  • Dash of salt
  • 1 inch ginger
  • Pinch of cayenne
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric
  • Pinch of pepper
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 3 drops stevia
  • 2 tablespoons Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
Start this smoothie by adding bananas to your blender mug. Add frozen peaches, and 8 ounces of filtered water. For your greens, throw in some basil and kale. Add a dash of salt, some ginger, and some cayenne. Add turmeric, and to help absorption, add some black pepper. To help curb your appetite, add cinnamon. Finish up with vanilla and stevia or your favorite sweetener. Throw in your protein powder (one scoop if drinking before a workout, or two scoops if drinking after a workout). Blend, boogie, pour, drink, and enjoy. Koya’s goal is to eat 5 fruits and 5 veggies every day. This smoothie is a great way to get half of those in. Until next time… grab your smoothie, and power up!

articleTitle: 10 Day Smoothie Detox: Day 3 – Blueberry Bliss
articleBodyHTML:
Day three of Koya's detox challenge lets you enjoy a blueberry bliss protein smoothie and believe in miracles!

If blueberries are your bliss, then day 3 of Koya’s 10 day smoothie detox challenge is for you. Fitness Expert, Yogi, and lover of health and wellness, Koya Webb, is back in her kitchen with a blueberry smoothie that’s full of antioxidant goodness that will keep your free radicals at bay, while giving a boost to your nervous system and brain health. For fruit consumption in the United States, blueberries rank only second to strawberries in popularity of berries. Did you know blueberries are native to North America?
articleSummaryHTML: Day three of Koya's detox challenge lets you enjoy a blueberry bliss protein smoothie and believe in miracles!

ingredients:
s:528:"

  • 2 bananas
  • 1 chard leaf
  • 1 inch ginger
  • 1 tablespoon turmeric
  • Pinch of pepper
  • 1 tablespoon spirulina

directions:
Start your smoothie off with 8 ounces of water. Add bananas (or if you’re not a banana fan, substitute mangoes or peaches). Koya’s a huge advocate for variety when it comes to greens, so today she’s using chard, but use what you love. Throw in ginger, turmeric, and black pepper. Next, for B12 and protein, add some spirulina. Add cayenne or paprika, some cinnamon, and finally the piece de resistance – blueberries. For a little zing and zest, add lemon. And finish with vanilla and stevia for some sweetness. Give your blender a whir, and make sure you get your heart going by doing the boogie. If you love your protein powder, add a scoop or two, and give the blender another go. Pour into your favorite glass, and drink the sweetness that is the blueberry bliss smoothie.

For the base Koya uses fresh OJ. That’s right, rich-in-vitamin C-orange juice. Like usual, add bananas – both fresh and frozen. Next, place in mango, nectarine, sweet potato, and carrots. To spice it up, add a little ginger, cayenne, turmeric, and black pepper. Toss in a little cardamom, a little vanilla, and a little stevia or sweetener of choice. Finish up with Sunwarrior Liquid Light for extra trace minerals and fulvic acid to help your body absorb all the wonderful nutrients from the ingredients you just added to your smoothie. Begin by adding two bananas to your blender. For a nice creamy consistency, add almond milk (or your favorite non-dairy milk). If your favorite PB&J included strawberries, throw in some strawberries. Now it’s time to add the PB. Peanuts and peanut butter are high in several B vitamins, vitamin E, and dietary fiber. The high protein and healthy oils can help with diabetes, weight loss, and even Alzheimer’s disease. According to the US Food and Drug Administration, "Scientific evidence suggests but does not prove that eating 1.5 ounces per day of most nuts (such as peanuts) as part of a diet low in saturated fat and cholesterol may reduce the risk of heart disease." Continuing with the smoothie, add a scoop or two of protein powder, a bit of vanilla, and finish up with your sweetener of choice. Turn that blender on full blast, boogie down, drink up, and enjoy. PB&J smoothified!

articleBodyHTML:
Pesto is a sauce meant to zip and zing. This pesto recipe is no exception! filled with healthy ingredients and great flavor, you'll never want pesto any other way.

There is nothing more wonderful than the smell of fresh basil growing on the windowsill. One of the healthiest, most delicious and fun herbs to cook with is basil. Basil is an essential ingredient in Italian and Mediterranean cuisines and can be added to sauces, pasta dishes, pizza, soups, salads, and so much more. Basil is easy to grow both indoors and outdoors.

Basil, high in vitamin A and C, is excellent for vision, bone health, skin and immune boosting. Vitamin K is also abundant in basil and is an important nutrient essential for blood clotting and strengthening bones.

In addition, this recipe contains brain boosting walnut and pecan power. It is not a coincidence that the walnut resembles the shape of the brain. In addition to improving memory and brain function, the omega 3 fatty acids found in walnuts contain inflammation-fighting powers.

Pecans, are loaded with minerals such as magnesium, zinc, iron, calcium, and selenium. They are high in vitamin E, which is beneficial for heart health.

Lastly, this recipe includes cilantro which is an amazing toxic-metal cleaner. If you suffer from mercury exposure, add some cilantro leaves to your smoothie or juices to flush any heavy metals out of your body.

Cilantro is also known as coriander in the culinary world. Coriander is the seed of the cilantro plant. this herb is very popular and widely used in a number of cultural dishes from the Middle East, Latin America, India, and the Mediterranean.

This pesto recipe is far from the traditional Italian recipe that includes parmesan cheese, pine nuts and olive oil; however, it is equally tasty and delicious. There are so many wonderful variations of pesto; give this one a try and let us know how you like it.
articleSummaryHTML: Pesto is a sauce meant to zip and zing. This pesto recipe is no exception! filled with healthy ingredients and great flavor, you'll never want pesto any other way.
seoTitle: Oil-Free Basil Pesto
seoDescription: Pesto is a sauce meant to zip and zing. This pesto recipe is no exception! filled with healthy ingredients and great flavor, you'll never want pesto any other way.
ingredients:
s:258:"
  • ½ cup walnuts (soak for 3–4 hours, optional)
  • ½ cup pecans
  • 1 bunch basil
  • 1 cup cilantro
  • 2–3 tablespoons of lemon
  • ½ teaspoon Himalayan or pink salt
";
directions:
Add all ingredients into a food processor and process until smooth.

Add a little bit of water (only if necessary) to allow all ingredients to blend evenly.

The pesto should be chunky and thick.

Add to your favorite pasta, pizza, or simply dip your favourite vegetable crudités.

Enjoy!!

articleBodyHTML:
Think berry thoughts. Think cool refreshing thoughts. Think how good a coco-berry green warrior smoothie will taste!

Calling all chocoholics!

Summertime is in full swing, and it’s hot outside! Nothing goes down better than an ice cold chocolate shake when the sun is beaming and the air is thick. You may have noticed the abundance of fresh berries at your local supermarket, and that’s because they’re in season—meaning they’re at the peak of their flavor and nutritional density! Berries also happen to be on the “Dirty Dozen” list—which lists the most chemical and pesticide-ridden produce out there, so be sure to stock up on organic whenever possible!

A Well-Rounded Meal in a Glass

This Coco-Berry Green Warrior Smoothie will give you everything you need to stay cool and well-nourished this summer, and it’s sure to satisfy your chocolate cravings in a healthy way! The strawberries and blueberries pack a healthy dose of antioxidants and vitamin C to keep your immune system in check. The ripe, frozen banana is loaded with potassium and adds an extra kick of sweetness, while cinnamon helps regulate blood sugar levels. Of course we all want to cut down on our inflammation, and that’s where ginger comes in as the power-player. And don’t forget—try to work greens into every meal of the day! Spinach is loaded with calcium and protein and is highly alkaline, which helps to balance your body’s pH and keep acidity at bay. Last but not least, Sunwarrior Chocolate Warrior Blend will give you the extra protein boost you need with a smooth and indulgent, chocolatey flavor that’s unbeatable!
articleSummaryHTML: Think berry thoughts. Think cool refreshing thoughts. Think how good a coco-berry green warrior smoothie will taste!
seoTitle: Coco-Berry Green Warrior Smoothie
seoDescription: Think berry thoughts. Think cool refreshing thoughts. Think how good a coco-berry green warrior smoothie will taste!
ingredients:
s:542:"
  • 1 ripe, frozen banana
  • 5–7 good-sized strawberries
  • 1/2 cup fresh blueberries
  • 1–2 cups spinach
  • 1/2–1 scoop Sunwarrior Chocolate Warrior Blend
  • 3/4 cup almond milk
  • 1 cup ice
  • Small slice of ginger
  • Dash of cinnamon

Options:

  • Try adding in other berries like raspberries and blackberries
";
directions:
Place all ingredients in high-speed blender and blend until smooth.

Pour into a tall glass and enjoy as an afternoon poolside refreshment, first thing in the morning for energy, or to refuel post-workout!

For an extra dose of green fuel, try Supergreens!

articleTitle: Easy, Raw, Vegan: Sunwarrior Protein Bliss Balls
articleBodyHTML:
Eating healthy can be a literal lifesaver. Happy and healthy is just a few nutritional choices away. Start now with these healing protein balls!

My father healed from cancer after being given only 10 months left to live. He radically changed his diet and lifestyle to feed his cells and boost his immune system (like this healthy, protein-rich dessert recipe from my new Gracious Living Lifestyle RAW HEALING Recipe Video Books).

He opened his mind by releasing his past judgments that were holding him back. He figured out where he needed to forgive others, and where he needed to forgive himself, so that he could open himself up to more love and healing. Our thoughts affect our health just as much as food and lifestyle habits do. Love your body and love your self. Everything you do, and think, impacts the direction of your life. It is not about being perfect. It’s about knowing that life is full of twists and turns, and it’s our duty to learn from every thing that comes our way. The ups, the downs, the middle. All of it. Stop fighting yourself, stop fighting the flow of life, accept where you are, and accept the challenges. Focus on the present moment and what you can do in the here and now. Abundant health and happiness is in the present moment.

What can you do right now to be happy and healthy? What choices can you make? What food choices can you make? What lifestyle choices can you make? What thoughts can you choose to attach yourself to? (It’s human nature to have negative thoughts. The learning adventure of life is to learn to let negative thoughts go when they happen. This is where yoga and meditation helps). 

Stop judging yourself. You always have a choice. Your future is dependent on the choices you make today.

Come on, let’s start improving your health and life! The time is now. And let’s have some fun doing it, too! Health and healing doesn’t have to be so serious!
articleSummaryHTML: Eating healthy can be a literal lifesaver. Happy and healthy is just a few nutritional choices away. Start now with these healing protein balls!
seoTitle: Easy, Raw, Vegan: Protein Bliss Balls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Eating healthy can be a literal lifesaver. Happy and healthy is just a few nutritional choices away. Start now with these healing protein balls!
recipeName: Easy, Raw, Vegan: Sunwarrior Protein Bliss Balls
ingredients:
s:684:"

Easy, Raw, Vegan: Sunwarrior Protein Bliss Balls

  • 2 serving scoops Sunwarrior Classic Plus chocolate protein
  • 2 tablespoons raw, organic, coconut oil
  • 1 very ripe banana
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Crunchy coating:

  • 2 tablespoons sunflower seeds
  • 2 tablespoons hemp seeds

Easy variation:

  • For a sweet salty taste, just add a tad of Celtic salt to the mixture before rolling.
  • Add a pinch of cardamom or nutmeg
";
directions:
Combine all powders and liquids in a bowl. Mash the banana into the mixture well to form a cookie dough consistency. Roll into balls. The mixtures usually makes about a dozen balls. Then roll into sunflower seeds for outer covering. Or put sunflower seeds in mixture before rolling into balls.

Gracious Living Tips

If banana is yellow but still a little hard, rub between hands with peel on until it gets soft and mushy.

If the mixture is too dry, add 1 tablespoon more coconut oil. The texture should be like cookie dough, easy to roll, not too dry, not too wet.

Try it before you roll it! If it isn’t sweet enough for your taste buds, add 1–2 tablespoons of yacon syrup or coconut nectar. The thick sweetener will make it easier to roll, too.

These are just some of the recipes in the BRAND NEW Gracious Living Lifestyle Healing Series E-books with accompanying videos. My passion is helping others heal and prevent disease, and live their dreams by eating as cleanly as possible. The cleaner we eat, the better our bodies and brains work, giving us clarity and focus so we can better handle life’s stresses and move in the direction of our limitless potential.

These eBooks contain some of my favorite raw food recipes designed to heal the body rapidly. They are super easy, delicious, and nutrient dense. These recipes were chosen to show you that healthy eating does not have to be complicated or require hours in the kitchen. There are so many variations you can do with these simple, healing recipes. Every recipe includes ingredients that help your cells thrive and work to the best of their abilities. The beauty of these ingredients is that they are versatile and easy to use in different kinds of recipes, sweet or savory. We are not only learning to become efficient inside of our bodies, but we are also learning to become more efficient in the kitchen!

Want to learn more, feel better, and have fun in the kitchen? You can purchase Grace’s healing recipe collection on her website:

http://www.gracevanberkum.com/gracious-living-healing-bundle/

articleBodyHTML:
Black bean burgers are perfect for that weekend barbeque or even during the week. You are gonna love this easy dinner recipe!

The black bean burgers are super easy and delicious. You can’t go wrong when you serve these. I serve them in a lettuce wrap or just eat them with a fork. Either way is amazing!

Black beans are a delicious source of folate and fiber that help with your digestive tract. Peppers are very high in vitamin C and are an excellent antioxidant. The oats have manganese and are a delicious whole grain. Combine them together and you have a dinner for champions!
articleSummaryHTML: Black bean burgers are perfect for that weekend barbeque or even during the week. You are gonna love this easy dinner recipe!
seoTitle: Black Bean Burgers
seoDescription: Black bean burgers are perfect for that weekend barbeque or even during the week. You are gonna love this easy dinner recipe!
ingredients:
s:451:"
  • 2 cups cooked black beans (2 15-ounce cans), drained & rinsed
  • 1¼ teaspoons garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon ground paprika
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ cup peppers, (red, green, or orange), finely chopped
  • ½ cup oats
  • ½ cup red onion, finely chopped
  • 1 flax egg*
";
directions:
In a large mixing bowl, mash 1½ cups of the black beans. Add remaining ½ cup of beans. In a small bowl, mix together the garlic powder, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt. Pour the spices over the bean mixture. Add all of the remaining ingredients, and mix well with your hands.

Form into four or five large patties or eight smaller patties for the kids.

Grill on a greased sheet of aluminum foil on the grill just as you would a traditional burger. (Use the foil to prevent pieces from falling down between the grates until it cooks thoroughly.) Or you can cook these burgers in a pan. Once browned and starting to crisp on the bottom side, flip and do the same on the other. Serve on a gluten free bun or in a lettuce wrap topped with your favorite toppings like vegan cheese and yummy tomatoes!

*Flax egg: 1 tablespoon ground flax + 3 tablespoons warm water. Mix and set aside for at least 5 minutes.

articleBodyHTML:
Too tired to make an after-workout snack? Get ahead of the game by making a post-workout granola that will leave you with the satisfying crunch of a great reward.

Talia Pollock, the healthy nut in charge of the craziness of Party in my Plants, is hitting the kitchen to make you a delicious, fun, and tropical post-workout granola. No one wants to make food after a workout, or make anything really, apart from a massage appointment. Many people muster up the energy to manage a smoothie, but even the best smoothie can get a little boring after a few hundred workouts. So what’s a healthy, active, fit, protein-loving soul to do? Try making a protein rich granola ahead of time. Then you can snack away or eat it like cereal with nut milk to get that recovery started fast.

Knowing you have this treat waiting for you can also help push you through the tail end of your exercise when energy is normally flagging. You can do it!
articleSummaryHTML: Too tired to make an after-workout snack? Get ahead of the game by making a post work out granola that will leave you with the satisfying crunch of a great snack.
seoTitle: Protein Tropical Granola | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Too tired to make an after-workout snack? Get ahead of the game by making a post work out granola that will leave you with the satisfied.
ingredients:
s:613:"
  • 1 ½ cups rolled oats
  • 1 cup quinoa
  • 2 tablespoons chia seeds
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Vanilla Protein
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 2 tablespoons chopped almonds
  • 1/3 cup shredded coconut
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 ripe banana
  • 1/3 cup dried mango
";
directions:
Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.

In a large bowl mix rolled oats, quinoa, chia seeds, protein, salt, cinnamon, chopped almonds, and one third cup shredded coconut.

Hop on over to your stovetop. In a saucepan on low heat, melt coconut oil with almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. Pour the melted mixture over your dry ingredients.

Mix that together well and add in one smashed ripe banana. That’s a nice tropical hit.

Dump all this on a cookie sheet and pop it in the oven for twelve minutes.

Take it out. Add one third a cup of dried mango for your last bit of tropicality.

Pop it back in the oven for another five to seven minutes, depending on your taste in golden crunchiness.

Once you have the granola made, Talia has five top ways to enjoy it. One: on top of a smoothie for double the Sunwarrior fun. Two: in a yogurt parfait, layered between fruit and coconut yogurt. Three: in a bowl with almond milk. Four: right out of the jar as a snack. Five: at the top of every sit up. That sweet reward is worth it every time.

articleBodyHTML:
Bursting with carbs and protein, this mung bean bowl will keep you fueled throughout your workout!

This is the perfect pre workout meal. This bowl is jam-packed with healthy carbohydrates and protein which will keep you fueled throughout your workout. The best part about this mung bean bowl is that it can be prepped and stored in the fridge. In summertime, we tend to cook less and want to be outside more. This is the perfect on-the-go lunch or dinner that can be reheated and is just as delicious as when it was first cooked.

Chickpeas are the wonder food for vegans or vegetarians. They provide a huge source of protein with 15 grams of protein per cup. Chickpeas or garbanzo beans are filled with fiber, which can help regulate your digestive system. Due to their high fiber content, chickpeas will also keep you fuller longer, which, in turn, can control your appetite. Chickpeas are a staple in many parts of the world because they are an inexpensive way to amass nutrients into the body. Chickpeas have a large amount of iron to keep you energized and focused.

Mung bean noodles are one of the most versatile noodles. They are relatively tasteless so they will take on any flavor you add to the dish. Mung bean noodles are widely popular in Asia. Mung bean noodles have a few other names such as glass noodles or thread noodles. Mung bean noodles are gluten free. They are translucent prior to cooking. When purchasing Mung bean pasta, opt for the organic version. I purchased these noodles at my local organic store and they were delicious. Mung bean noodles tend to be more filling than traditional pasta. Normally, when we consume gluten-based pasta, we tend to eat a lot more than we should. Luckily, these little guys will keep you satiated for a longer amount of time and give you lots of energy.
articleSummaryHTML: Bursting with carbs and protein, this mung bean bowl will keep you fueled throughout your workout!
seoTitle: Mung Bean Bowl
seoDescription: Bursting with carbs and protein, this mung bean bowl will keep you fueled throughout your workout!
ingredients:
s:333:"
  • 1 package organic mung bean noodles
  • 1 cup chickpeas
  • 1 cup sliced carrots
  • 1/2 cup chopped parsley
  • 1 tablespoon gluten free tamari
  • 2 teaspoons sesame oil
  • 1/2 tablespoon grated ginger
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 Thai chili (optional)
";
directions:
1.) Cook mung bean noodles according to package. After cooking, rinse with cold water and set aside.

2.) Drain chickpeas and set aside.

3.) Preheat a pan over medium heat. Add sesame oil, ginger, and garlic. Cook until fragrant or 2 minutes. Add sliced carrots and Thai chili if using, cook for another 3 minutes. Remove from heat.

4.) Combine carrot ginger sauce with chickpeas and mung bean noodles. Top with parsley and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
Don’t you just love it when two great ideas come together? If so you’ve gotta try this peanut butter fudge!

One of my favorite ingredients is peanut butter and I love to come up with new recipes containing peanut butter. The other night I had a brilliant idea of combining most of my favorite ingredients to make a "peanut butter fudge." It turned out so good and it was delicious! It did not last long!

This is a healthy treat or dessert that you can enjoy without any guilt. To take it a step further, check out all these great health benefits of all these ingredients, and you will be glad you're putting these healthy foods in your body.

Health benefits of peanut butter: Peanut butter has protein as well as potassium — which lowers the risk of high blood pressure, stroke and heart disease. It also contains fiber for your bowel health, healthy fats, magnesium to fortify your bones and muscles, Vitamin E and antioxidants

Health benefits of honey (for our vegetarian friends): Honey is nature's energy booster. Not only does honey have great taste, the benefits go beyond that. Honey is a natural source of carbohydrates which helps give our bodies strength and energy.  It can instantly boosting the performance, endurance and reduce muscle fatigue of athletes. The natural sugars play an important role in preventing fatigue during exercise. The glucose in honey is absorbed by the body quickly and gives an immediate energy boost, while the fructose is absorbed more slowly providing sustained energy. It is known that honey has also been found to keep levels of blood sugar fairly constant compared to other types of sugar.
articleSummaryHTML: Don’t you just love it when two great ideas come together? If so you’ve gotta try this peanut butter fudge!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter Fudge
seoDescription: Don’t you just love it when two great ideas come together? If so you’ve gotta try this peanut butter fudge!
ingredients:
s:289:"
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 3/4 cup coconut oil
  • 3/4 cup honey (or sweetener of your choice if you’re vegan)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla protein
";
directions:
Measure out the coconut oil, and stick in microwave for 20 seconds, so it melts. Then combine all ingredients, place into a flat dish or 9 by 11 Pyrex dish, freeze for 30 minutes. Cut into squares and enjoy immediately! If you have any leftovers, stick back into freezer or it will quickly melt.

Still needing even more peanut butter? Try this great PB&J smoothie!

articleBodyHTML:
Look forward to getting out of bed in the morning by beginning the day right with these two great morning drinks!

Birds are singing outside your window and gentle rays of morning sunshine spill over your face. It’s a beautiful morning! And all you need right now is a fabulous drink in your hands. Having a healthy and delicious drink in the am time period is a great way to kick start your day and the perfect way to recharge your body with abundant nutrients. How you start your day sets the tone for rest of the day or even week sometimes. Here are some great recipes that will give you the perfect wake-me-up!

Turmeric Almond Drink

A combination of high protein, fiber, and anti-inflammatory properties is what you get from a turmeric almond blend. It is a perfect drink for your pre or post yoga session. Drinking this every day after a cup of water can help to lubricate joints, clear mucus, enable bowel moments, keeps your warm, and, above all, is delicious.

Hemplicious Protein Drink

If you are heading to yoga or the gym or even crossfit, the most important drink to take with you is something packed with good amounts of protein and carbs. Hemp seeds are packed with protein, amino acids, and essential vitamins and minerals. Making a drink based on this, is a great way to thank your body.
articleSummaryHTML: Look forward to getting out of bed in the morning by beginning the day right with these two great morning drinks!
seoTitle: 2 Morning Drink Recipes
seoDescription: Look forward to getting out of bed in the morning by beginning the day right with these two great morning drinks!
ingredients:
s:655:"

Turmeric Almond Drink

  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
  • 1 tablespoon raw honey (or other sweetener for our vegan friends)
  • ¾ teaspoon black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon ginger, grated

Hemplicious Protein Drink

  • 3 tablespoons hemp seeds
  • 2 tablespoons Brazil nuts, soaked
  • 1 banana
  • 2–3 dates
  • ¾ cup strawberries
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
Turmeric Almond Drink

  1. Heat up the almond milk with black pepper for about 2 minutes.
  2. Transfer all ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
  3. Drink up!

Hemplicious Protein Drink

  1. Using a high speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy.
  2. Drink up!
