articleTitle: Crazy Good Creamy Parsnip Soup with Thai Basil (Dairy Free)
articleBodyHTML:
Want something crazy good? You’ve gotta try this easy-to-make-and-tasting-great recipe for creamy parsnip soup with Thai basil!

It’s pure, addictive, nourishing comfort food at its best! Soup – savory, steaming soup in the winter or frosty cool soups in the summer—is truly a must in your repertoire of recipes. This creamy concoction just may very well hit the top of your best ten.

While I have a number of must-make soups in my back pocket, this one has taken up residence in a front pocket. I am not alone in loving this recipe, but how will you know for yourself if you love it? Pull out the chopping board, power blender, and a big pot – you likely want to double this recipe since it tastes amazing and stashes really well in the freezer for up to a month. The fact that there are less than 10 ingredients makes this recipe a true winner!
articleSummaryHTML: Want something crazy good? You’ve gotta try this easy-to-make-and-tasting-great recipe for creamy parsnip soup with Thai basil!
seoTitle: Crazy Good Creamy Parsnip Soup with Thai Basil (Dairy Free)
seoDescription: Want something crazy good? You’ve gotta try this easy-to-make-and-tasting-great recipe for creamy parsnip soup with Thai basil!
recipeName: Crazy Good Creamy Parsnip Soup with Thai Basil (Dairy Free)
ingredients:
s:635:"

 

  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 large onion, chopped
  • 2 garlic cloves, chopped
  • 2 large parsnips, peeled and chopped into 1 inch pieces
  • 1 can coconut milk
  • 4 cups (1 liter) vegetable broth
  • ½–1 teaspoon sea salt
  • ½–1 teaspoon black pepper
  • 1 head broccoli, chopped into 1 inch pieces (stem peeled)
  • ½ cup fresh Thai basil (Italian basil can be substituted but is not as fragrant)
  • Garnish: Additional Thai basil, or cilantro, fresh lime juice, and cayenne pepper.
";
directions:
Heat a large soup pot over high heat. Reduce to medium high and add the coconut oil, onion, and garlic, and sauté for 5 minutes or until the onions are translucent.

Add the parsnips, coconut milk, vegetable broth and seasonings. Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes until the parsnips are tender.

Add the chopped broccoli and basil. Simmer for another 5 minutes until the broccoli is tender. Let cool a few minutes.

Pour slightly cooled soup into the blender (in small batches if using a smaller blender) and blast until velvety smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings if needed then reheat and serve in warm bowls, garnished as desired.

TERI’S TIPS:

If you want to add a protein boost, blend in 1 cup cooked white beans or a scoop or two of natural Sunwarrior Warrior Blend natural protein, or your favorite natural nut or seed butter when pureeing the soup.

articleBodyHTML:
For a quick pre or post workout snack that provides a great protein source as well as provides energy, this is the recipe for you: apricot energy rounds!

Just about everyone loves energy bars. Quick, convenient and portable, a good vegan energy bar can serve as a meal replacement, pre or post workout treat, or a handy protein source. Eating snack-size protein bars can help reduce overeating between meals. Unfortunately, many store-bought bars are high in sugar or sodium, and some contain preservatives, animal products, or filler ingredients. For cheaper, healthier energy options, you’re really better off making your own!

While the recipe below for Apricot Energy Rounds is simple to make—and delightful to eat—we hope you’ll be inspired to make up your own no-bake energy bar recipe for bars, bites, or balls. Here are a few more thought-starters to get you on your way:

Give some extra “oomph” to your energy bars by incorporating a top quality protein powder, such as Sunwarrior into your recipes. Adjust your moisture by adding a few drops of water or additional dried fruits to the batter, so the mixture binds properly.

Add an extra punch of flavor with natural extracts. Think outside of the usual vanilla, and test-drive chocolate, coconut, rum, almond, butterscotch, or one of the dozens of other flavors available.

Spices can also ramp up the flavor of your energy snacks. Cinnamon is the one most often used, but you can also draw on ginger, cardamom, nutmeg, or a spice blend such as pumpkin pie spice or apple pie spice. Start with a half teaspoon, as some dried spices can be rather strong.
articleSummaryHTML: For a quick pre or post workout snack that provides a great protein source as well as provides energy, this is the recipe for you: apricot energy rounds!
seoTitle: Apricot Energy Rounds
seoDescription: For a quick pre or post workout snack that provides a great protein source as well as provides energy, this is the recipe for you: apricot energy rounds!
ingredients:
s:632:"

 

  • 2/3 cup dried apricots, soaked 30 minutes in water
  • 3 tablespoons apricot water (use the water from the dried apricot soaking)
  • ¾ cup Medjool dates, pitted
  • 2 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 ¼ cup almonds
  • ¾ cup rolled oats
  • ¾ cup dried cranberries
  • ¾ cup shredded coconut
  • 1/3 cup pumpkin seeds
  • ½ teaspoon unrefined salt
  • ½ scoop Classic Plus natural protein
";
directions:
Place apricots, dates, apricot soak water and vanilla in a food processor and process until mixture becomes a paste. Add the almonds, oats, cranberries, coconut, pumpkin seeds salt and protein, and pulse several times until incorporated. Roll 1 tablespoon of mixture between hands to form a ball. Repeat until mixture is gone. Stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator, Apricot Energy Rounds will keep for three weeks.

Yield: 12–14 servings

articleTitle: Losing weight by eating delicious chocolate? My moment of illumination
articleBodyHTML:
Get illumin8ed! Lose weight by eating well; and by well, we mean by eating chocolate. Life is so awesome sometimes! Plus! A chocolate cherry smoothie recipe!

Illuminate. What does that mean? According to Merriam-Webster, there are a few different choices. My favorite definition is this: “to enlighten spiritually or intellectually.”

As I sit here and enjoy this Chocolate Cherry Smoothie made with Sunwarrior’s intensely delicious Illumin8 plant-based organic meal replacement shake in Aztec Chocolate flavor, I’m enlightened about what weight loss really entails, and how my own challenging process has led me to what I believe is the most delicious, nutritious, and satisfying diet on the planet.

Following each of my complicated pregnancies, I struggled to lose weight. The more I failed, the worse I felt about myself. My sense of self-love tangled with the flawed concept of will-power, or the power to starve myself and lose weight. I always believed that some form of starvation and suffering was necessary if I was to be truly tough or committed.

I remember one day in particular back when I was on a mainstream packaged-food diet and knew I had already eaten my designated chemical-bomb bars for the afternoon. I was driving to a furniture store to complete a purchase with my baby in tow. I was starving and miserable but knew I had to be strong and push through the day. This is just what I’d accepted as the weight loss process. I was unhappy. I didn’t love myself. And I was setting myself up for a cycle of failure with every passing week.

Unsurprisingly, I lost a few pounds on those expensive, unrealistic diet programs. But that kind of weight loss never lasted. My body craved real food and high-quality nutrition. Ultimately, I failed. Thank goodness, really. It was those failures that led to my moment of illumination. When I hit rock bottom and couldn’t see a way to lose the pregnancy weight once and for all, I finally discovered a raw vegan lifestyle, and the rest is history. (And so is the weight!)

Now, eight years into my journey as a raw vegan, I can’t believe I used to live that way, punishing myself all the time. Today, I am my strongest, happiest self, and I accomplish this with ample food intake that supports my energy levels and nourishes my body in full. My diet is rich in fresh fruits, vegetables, herbs, and healthy fats like avocado and hemp seed. I also enjoy high-quality raw vegan protein from Sunwarrior and was thrilled when they released the illumin8 line of shakes.

illumin8 makes for a filling, energizing meal on the go, as it contains, not only clean plant-based protein, but also gluten-free carbs, healthy fats, vitamins, minerals, and plenty of fiber, too. As a busy mom, I am always needed somewhere, so it has been wonderful to have illumin8 in my arsenal of healthy food choices that I can prepare in minutes. I can whip up a shake, put it into a glass mason jar with a screw-top lid, and zip out the door to take my son to practice, no problem! And no temptation or cravings for unhealthy foods because I am already well-nourished.

As a vegan culinary artist and raw food teacher, I was excited to experiment with illumin8 in the kitchen. Because it contains so many hearty and nutrient-dense plant ingredients on its own, I found that I could blend it with a banana and water and enjoy it in its simplest form that way. But I love to include fresh water-rich plants in my meals whenever possible, too. So I made quite a few different smoothies using raw fruits and greens. Some of these varieties included blending a scoop of illumin8 with 3 cups of greens like kale, chard, collards, or spinach along with bananas, berries, and water. (Note: If you use kale in a green smoothie, I recommend removing the stems first, as they can be bitter.) illumin8 blended well with every smoothie I created. Of course, my favorite is the recipe I’m sharing below. That one knocked my socks off.

Now, let’s dive into this truly yummy Chocolate Cherry Smoothie recipe that is both simple and fast to prepare while packing in ample plant-based nutrition to keep you fueled all day. Chocolate and cherries tend to conjure up an image of dessert, and rightfully so. Chefs worldwide pair these flavors to bring clientele a magical culinary experience, but often this is at the cost of the diner’s health as they ingest sweets packed with animal fats, refined sugar, and processed flour. In contrast, I’ve blended Sunwarrior’s Aztec chocolate Illumin8 with wholesome fruits to give it the same delectable flavor as a sweet dessert without any of the unhealthy ingredients. You win, your body wins, and your taste buds REALLY win.

So there’s my moment of illumination, and hopefully yours, too: You can lose weight and attain your best health by eating delicious chocolate! Who knew? Leave behind the fad diets, the starvation, and all that self-sabotaging guilt FOREVER. Be illuminated. Be happy. Be healthy!
articleSummaryHTML: Get illumin8ed! Lose weight by eating well; and by well, we mean by eating chocolate. Life is so awesome, sometimes! Plus! A chocolate cherry smoothie recipe!
seoTitle: Losing Weight by Eating Chocolate | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get illumin8ed! Lose weight by eating well; and by well, we mean by eating chocolate. Plus! Sunwarrior Health Hub chocolate cherry smoothie recipe!
ingredients:
s:307:"
  • 2 frozen bananas broken into chunks
  • 1 scoop Aztec Chocolate illumin8
  • 25 pitted cherries, fresh or frozen
  • 3-4 cups of water or as needed to create your desired consistency
";
directions: Blend until emulsified. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Are you crazy about oats? How about chai latte? If so then you are going to love the marriage of these two amazing things! Breakfast just got real!

Join Sunwarrior and the host of Party in My Plants, Talia Pollock, as she puts her crazy effervescent personality to work for you making deliciousness a bigger part of your life. So watch and listen! Since Talia is crazy about overnight oats and crazy about chai lattes, she figured the combination would make the most perfect breakfast imaginable. She was right.
If you don’t already know, overnight oats are a healthy, easy, filling, digestible breakfast that makes itself. All you have to do is throw the ingredients into a jar, cup, or mug and pop it in the fridge for the night. They’ll be waiting for you to make up for that annoying alarm ruining your dreams. Let’s go make some already.

  • 1 cup almond milk
";
directions: In a jar, dump in half a cup of rolled oats, two tablespoons of chia seeds, two tablespoons of Sunwarrior vanilla protein, half a teaspoon of cinnamon, a quarter teaspoon of allspice, a quarter teaspoon of cardamom, a quarter teaspoon of ginger, half a tablespoon of coconut sugar, and one cup of almond milk. Mix it up. Pop it in the fridge. And then go enjoy your beauty sleep. When you wake up, it is a simple grab and go meal. Sorry about the Morning Superstar song that will be in your head for a while. Talia doesn’t really feel bad though.

articleBodyHTML:
Your summer garden is likely bursting with awesome, so we’re giving you a few ideas on how to take that awesome to the next level with these cheesy tomato crisps!

A popular ingredient in many types of cooking, sundried tomatoes are easy to make. The best time to dry-preserve tomatoes is late summer, when they’re cheap, abundant, and tasty. Simply cut tomatoes into ¼ inch slices and place them in a dehydrator for at least 8–10 hours.

While you’re in the kitchen, set aside some of those gorgeous tomato slices to make into Cheesy Tomato Crisps. They’re the high-brow cousin to regular Tomato Chips (which can prepared simply with a sprinkle of salt and dried basil). This recipe gives the finished snack a nice cheesy, smoky taste—you might even want to make a double batch.
articleSummaryHTML: Your summer garden is likely bursting with awesome, so we’re giving you a few ideas on how to take that awesome to the next level with these cheesy tomato crisps!
seoTitle: Cheesy Tomato Crisps
seoDescription: Your summer garden is likely bursting with awesome, so we’re giving you a few ideas on how to take that awesome to the next level with these cheesy tomato crisps!
ingredients:
s:453:"
  • 2/3 cup cashews, soaked 1 hour
  • 1/3 cup purified water
  • 1 red or yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 3 tablespoons nutritional yeast
  • 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup
  • 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
  • 1/4 teaspoon Himalayan pink salt
  • 3 large tomatoes
";
directions:
Wash and dry the tomatoes. Place a double layer of paper toweling on a cafeteria tray or baking sheet. Evenly slice tomatoes ¼ inch thick. Lay the tomato slices on the paper towel in a single layer, lay another paper towel on top and continue. This important step will help remove the excess moisture from the tomatoes.

Drain cashews and place in a blender with water, bell pepper, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, Italian seasoning, smoked paprika, maple syrup, red pepper flakes and salt. Blend on high until smooth and creamy. Pour into a shallow bowl.

Place a nonstick sheet on dehydrator tray.

Dredge each tomato slice through the sauce in the bowl. Let excess sauce drip from tomato slice before arranging in a single layer on the nonstick sheet.

Dehydrate at 105 degrees Fahrenheit for about 8 hours. Remove crisps from nonstick sheet and place on the mesh dehydrator sheet and continue to dry for another 6–8 hours or until crisp. Store in a glass jar at room temperature.

articleBodyHTML:
Sometimes you just want something sweet. Healthy, but sweet. These delicious flourless oatmeal raisin cookies will hit the spot.

I don’t feel guilty indulging in these every now and again, and my chocolate-chip-cookie-loving husband loves them as well! And every one of my children thought they were just as good as a regular cookie. You can serve these as a breakfast cookie or even a dessert cookie. I’d love them as either.

The oats make these cookies especially hardy and provide an excellent source of manganese and fiber. The coconut oil used makes these cookies delectable and provide healthy fats. It’s okay to indulge on occasion and now you can do it without the guilt!
articleSummaryHTML: Sometimes you just want something sweet. Healthy, but sweet. These delicious flourless oatmeal raisin cookies will hit the spot.
seoTitle: Flourless Raisin Cookies
seoDescription: Sometimes you just want something sweet. Healthy, but sweet. These delicious flourless oatmeal raisin cookies will hit the spot.
ingredients:
s:365:"
  • 1 ¾ cup ground old fashioned oats
  • 1 cup old fashioned oats
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • Pinch sea salt
  • ¾ to 1 cup raisins
  • 1/3 coconut oil
  • ½ cup agave nectar
  • 1 egg or flax egg*
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350.
  2. In a medium bowl combine the ground oats, 1 cup old fashioned oats, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
  3. In a small pot, melt the coconut oil and agave nectar together on low heat. Let cool for a few minutes. Whisk in vanilla and egg (or flax egg). Pour the liquid into the bowl of dry ingredients and stir together. Stir in raisins.
  4. Scoop onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper using a cookie scoop. Bake for 6-8 minutes or until golden brown. (They become very crumbly if you under bake the cookies, so bake until golden brown.) Let cool for a few minutes before transferring onto a cooling rack.

Yields: 18 to 24 cookies

*Combine 1 tablespoon flaxseed meal and 2 ½ tablespoons water. Let sit for five minutes. Use in place of 1 egg.

To make ground oats. Just blend the 1 ¾ c oats in a blender until ground.

articleBodyHTML:
Vegan meatballs? Is there such a thing? Yes, there is! These meatballs are protein packed and make vegan taste so good!

The summer months can get pretty heated, but that doesn’t mean we don’t still crave our favorite foods we tend to eat in cooler months such as pasta or hot foods.

The main ingredient in these meatballs is tempeh. Tempeh is used as a meat substitute for vegans and stands up to any other substitute. Tempeh contains a huge source of protein and has a versatile. yet earthy, flavor. It can be used raw in salads or cooked in main courses. Most soy products are highly processed and refined and contain a huge amount of added chemicals that can lead to sickness and intolerances over the years. When purchasing tempeh, try to buy organic as this ensures that no additives have been used. Tempeh is a way better option over tofu as the soybeans have been fermented, which gives it a predigested state, making for easy absorption into the body.

These meatballs take around 40 minutes to make from start to finish. I used gluten free breadcrumbs in this recipe, but if you do not have any intolerances you can opt for the regular breadcrumbs. You can bake the meatballs or fry them. If you are frying them, cook them in a tablespoon of coconut oil or avocado oil to ensure you are receiving all of the nutritional benefits of the oil. If you want to add a beautiful cheesy flavor to your dish, sprinkle a little nutritional yeast on top.

You can use whichever noodles you like for this recipe. I love the taste of using zucchini, but you can add carrots, turnips, carrots, or beets.

The most important part is that these meatballs are savoury, delicious, fresh and simple. These can be made in a larger batch, stored in the freezer, and then reheated. Happy meatball making!
articleSummaryHTML: Vegan meatballs? Is there such a thing? Yes, there is! These meatballs are protein packed and make vegan taste so good!
seoTitle: Tempeh Meatballs | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Vegan meatballs? Is there such a thing? Yes, there is! These meatballs are protein packed and make vegan taste so good!
ingredients:
s:443:"
  • 1 onion
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 tablespoon flax meal + 3 tablespoon water
  • 1/2 block of tempeh, crumbled
  • 1/2 cup parsley
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 1/2 cup cilantro (optional)
  • 3/4 cup gluten free breadcrumbs
  • 1/2 cup almond meal
  • 1/4 cup tomato or marinara sauce

Optional: nutritional yeast

";
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees

Cook onion and garlic in a pan over medium heat. In a small bowl combine flax seeds and water. Allow the mixture to thicken for 5 minutes

Place tempeh in a food processor and pulse until broken down (the tempeh, not the processor). Add cooked onions, garlic, flax meal, breadcrumbs, almond meal, parsley, oregano, salt, and tomato sauce. Pulse again until well combined. Using an ice cream scooper, scoop balls of dough onto a parchment-paper-lined baking tray. Bake for 20 minutes, flipping them over half way through baking

articleBodyHTML:
Who doesn’t love donuts? I know I do! Now, you can share your donuts with anyone and everyone. These donuts are gluten free, easy to make, and delicious.

The joke in my family is that you can buy Mom’s love with a donut. It’s true. Donuts make me happy. And, in the spirit of sharing and giving and making people happy, we share this recipe with all of you.
articleSummaryHTML: Who doesn’t love donuts? I know I do! Now, you can share your donuts with anyone and everyone. These donuts are gluten free, easy to make, and delicious.
seoTitle: Easy Bake Vegan Cake Donuts | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Who doesn’t love donuts? I know I do! Now, you can share your donuts with anyone and everyone. These donuts are gluten free, easy to make, and delicious.
ingredients:
s:593:"
  • 1 cup gluten free flour
  • 1 cup coconut sugar
  • ½ cup potato starch
  • ¼ cup arrowroot powder
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ½ tablespoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon xanthan gum.
  • 1 scoop vanilla Sunwarrior protein powder
  • ½ cup water
  • ¼ cup vanilla
  • 1/3 cup coconut oil
  • ¼ cup apple sauce
  • *optional: chocolate chips and sprinkles
";
directions:
Start with 1 cup of gluten free flour. Add to it coconut sugar, potato starch, arrowroot powder, sea salt, baking powder, xanthan gum. Top your dry ingredients off with a scoop of vanilla Sunwarrior protein powder. Classic, Warrior Blend, Classic Plus, and even illumin8 would all work well in this recipe. Mix your dry ingredients and then move on to your wet ingredients in another bowl.

Start your new bowl with water, vanilla, coconut oil, and apple sauce. Mix those and then pour them over your dry ingredients. Stir everything together into a fluffy dough. Grease a donut pan with coconut oil and spoon in the dough. Bake them at 325 degrees Fahrenheit for 15 minutes. Melt chocolate chips on the donuts while they are still hot and add sprinkles or your favorite toppings. That’s all it takes to eat a deliciously sweet dessert. Try to save some for your friends and family.

articleBodyHTML:
It’s dinner time again, and you have no idea what to make! Don’t worry; we’ve got you covered with this easy fried rice recipe!

If there is one meal that is in my kids’ top ten, it would be fried rice. They love it! They constantly ask me to make it. And why not? It’s super easy, they eat it without a fight, and I usually always have all the ingredients on hand.

Fried rice is awesome with brown rice, but sometimes kids are harder to feed. If your kids aren’t used to brown rice yet, it’s okay to let them into a healthier world slowly. You can easily make it half brown rice and half white rice. And then gradually increase the brown and decrease the white each time you make it and before they know it, they’ll be eating healthy without complaint.

Brown rice has tons of health benefits! It’s rich in fiber and selenium and can lower your cholesterol. Top that with the fact that it is rich in protein and you’ve got an awesome food source. Sesame seed oil is a heart-healthy oil and contains omega-3s. The peas provide vitamin K and manganese, and carrots are an excellent source of vitamin A.
articleSummaryHTML: It’s dinner time again, and you have no idea what to make! Don’t worry; we’ve got you covered with this easy fried rice recipe!
seoTitle: Easy Fried Rice
seoDescription: It’s dinner time again, and you have no idea what to make! Don’t worry; we’ve got you covered with this easy fried rice recipe!
ingredients:
s:434:"
  • 3 cups cooked rice
  • 1 tablespoon sesame seed oil
  • 1 small white onion, chopped
  • 1 ½ cup frozen peas and carrots, thawed
  • 2–3 tablespoons coconut aminos (more or less to taste)
  • 3 eggs (or egg substitutes), lightly beaten
";
directions:
Preheat a large skillet or wok to medium heat. Pour sesame oil in the bottom. Add white onion, peas, and carrots and fry until tender.

Slide the onion, peas and carrots to the side, and pour the beaten eggs onto the other side. Using a spatula, scramble the eggs. Once cooked, mix the eggs with the vegetable mix.

Add the rice to the veggie mixture. Pour the soy sauce on top. Stir and fry the rice and veggie mixture until heated through and combined.

articleTitle: Simple Sunday Breakfast: Banana Blender Oat Pancakes
articleBodyHTML:
When life gets crazy busy, simplify. Start with breakfast and these banana blender oat pancakes!

Simplicity is necessary to help balance the crazy, hectic world we live in today. With all of the overly dramatic things we have to deal with, finding simpler ways to do things can help keep us from formally going crazy. A stress-free leisurely breakfast on the weekend is such a nice way to gently start the day and reconnect with our family and ourselves, even if it’s only this one day a week. Just because you have the extra time to prepare a nicer breakfast on this day does not mean it needs to be complicated. In fact, it shouldn’t be.

Having a simple breakfast that is also highly nutritious is the key. A fantastic recipe that fits both these bills is banana blender oat pancakes, a favorite in my house. I mean, who doesn’t love pancakes? And with this base recipe, you can add various mix-ins to give variety. All you need are a few ingredients, a blender, and a skillet. Simple. Here is the recipe:
articleSummaryHTML: When life gets crazy busy, simplify. Start with breakfast and these banana blender oat pancakes!
seoTitle: Simple Sunday Breakfast: Banana Blender Oat Pancakes
seoDescription: When life gets crazy busy, simplify. Start with breakfast and these banana blender oat pancakes!
ingredients:
s:585:"
  • 2 ripe bananas
  • 2 cups gluten free old fashioned rolled oats
  • 2 cups unsweetened nut milk of your choice (like almond or coconut)
  • 2-teaspoon organic cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon aluminum free baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon pink Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon Neat Egg (or ground flax or chia seeds)
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
  • Coconut oil for the skillet

OPTIONAL: ½ cup fresh blueberries or 1/3 cup chopped raw nuts

";
directions:
Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Rub lightly with virgin coconut oil to keep pancakes from sticking. Place all ingredients (expect optional add-ins) in a blender with the liquids on the bottom. Blend for about 60 secs, stopping blender and scraping sides half way through if needed. Fold in optional mix-ins if using. Pour batter in skillet, making about 4” round disks. Let cook for about 4 minutes, then flip and cook about 2–4 minutes on the other side. These will keep in the refrigerator for up to a week or in the freezer for a few months. I often make a huge batch to have something handy for those busy weekday mornings. Tip: to kick up the nutrition even more, add a scoop of Sun Warrior Illumin8 Vanilla Bean. Serve warm with a drizzle of raw honey or coconut nectar.

Cheers to the simple things in life. Enjoy!

articleTitle: 3 Obscure Ways to Use Activated Charcoal for Your Body
articleBodyHTML:
Activated charcoal has so many beneficial uses, some more known than others. Check out the three uses you might not have heard about before!

As health-conscious, natural-living sun warriors, many of us probably use activated charcoal in our beauty routines in a number of awesomely effective ways: teeth whitener, detoxifier, face mask, but the natural powerhouse has many other, more obscure, uses as a beauty product.

Today I am sharing three of my favorite, lesser known ways to incorporate activated charcoal into your beauty routine.

How is Activated Charcoal Made?

In case you’re not familiar, activated charcoal is a naturally occurring compound that is made by heating regular charcoal in the presence of gas to around 600–900C. The heating process creates tiny pores in the charcoal. These pores act as powerful binding agents that can adsorb many different compounds.

Adsorbing is different than absorbing. Adsorbing means that the compound collects other compounds on its surface. Absorbing means the compound takes the compounds in; our bodies absorb nutrients while activated charcoal adsorbs toxins and poisons.

Topical Remedies for Bites and Stings

Because activated charcoal is such a powerful absorber, it’s a wonderfully effective natural option for relief from insect bites and stings. Putting activated charcoal on top of a mosquito bite will help pull the poisons out of the area, relieving itching and redness.
articleSummaryHTML: Activated charcoal has so many beneficial uses, some more known than others. Check out the three uses you might not have heard about before!
seoTitle: 3 Obscure Ways to Use Activated Charcoal for Your Body
seoDescription: Activated charcoal has so many beneficial uses, some more known than others. Check out the three uses you might not have heard about before!
recipeName: Bug Bite and Sting Remedy, Body Polish, and Detox Bath
ingredients:
s:1373:"

Homemade Topical Remedy for Bug Bites and Stings

  • 1 ½ tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon activated charcoal
  • 3–4 drops tea tree oil
  • 3–4 drops lavender oil
  • 1 teaspoon bentonite clay
  • 1 teaspoon aloe vera gel

Activated Charcoal Body Polish

This activated charcoal body polish recipe pulls double duty as both a detoxifier and exfoliator. After using the polish in the shower, your skin is clearer, brighter and smoother.

  • ¼ cup raw sugar
  • 5 tablespoons cold pressed coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon activated charcoal
  • 15 drops of your favorite essential oil
  • ¾ cup Himalayan fine pink salt

Detox Bath: Activated Charcoal & Oatmeal

  • 1/2 cup activated charcoal
  • 1/2 cup oatmeal (finely ground)
  • ½ cup sea salt
";
directions:
Homemade Topical Remedy for Bug Bites and Stings

Directions:

In a double boiler, melt down coconut oil.

Add the remaining ingredients to the coconut oil.

Carefully spoon or use a funnel to place the liquid into lip balm containers or a small tin.

Allow to rest for 2–3 hours. Store in a cool, dry place.

Activated Charcoal Body Polish

Directions

Mix all the ingredients thoroughly and store it in an air tight container. When you're ready to use, mix 1 part body polish with 1 part of your favorite liquid; coconut oil, honey and aloe vera work well.

Detox Bath: Activated Charcoal & Oatmeal

Directions:

Mix all three ingredients together and store in an airtight mason jar.

When you’re ready for a bath, simply add 1/3 of a cup of the mixture directly into the bath. For even better results add 10–15 drops of your favorite essential oil(s). I personally like to use peppermint, lavender, and tea tree oil.

Feel free to use several essential oils or just stick to one.

There’s not much that activated charcoal can’t do, and do well, and it’s because of this that we keep a bag of activated charcoal in our medicine cabinet…right next to the coconut oil, of course!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your salad on this summer with this tasty, refreshing, tempeh salad bowl filled with everything you want out of a meal!

Salads can be as creative as you want them to be. Throw in some farm fresh vegetables—which are perfect this time of year—and voila! Farmers markets are bursting with in-season vegetables and fruits. It’s the commencement of beautiful and local produce. These fruits and vegetables are flavorful and packed with more nutrients because they are grown locally. The lesser the amount of time the produce needs to travel to reach your dinner plate, the more nutrients will remain intact!

Salad bowls can be made from whatever is in season and sitting already in your fridge or pantry! This salad bowl is bursting with beautiful in-season golden beets, leeks, sprouts, and tempeh.  Tempeh is a delicious substitution for meat. It’s bursting with nutrients and can take on any flavor when cooked.

Tempeh is fermented, which means it’s a probiotic food. Fermented foods can help treat stomach issues such as candida, and they are easy to digest because they help break down carbohydrates and sugar. Fermented foods can control bacteria in the body and help with indigestion. If you have never worked with tempeh before, it has a firm texture that can be sliced, crumbled, or cooked whole. Tempeh has grown in popularity in the vegan community due to its high protein content.

Top your salad with whichever dressing you like. I used a delicious herb-based dressing, which is packed with nutrients from all of the herbs used.
articleSummaryHTML: Get your salad on this summer with this tasty, refreshing, tempeh salad bowl filled with everything you want out of a meal!
seoTitle: Tempeh Salad Bowl
seoDescription: Get your salad on this summer with this tasty, refreshing, tempeh salad bowl filled with everything you want out of a meal!
ingredients:
s:885:"

Salad

  • 1 package tempeh
  • 1 tablespoon Bragg’s liquid aminos
  • 1/2 teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 1 golden beet, shredded
  • 1 cup sprouts
  • 1/3 cup leeks, shredded
  • 1 cup grape tomatoes
  • 1/3 cup cabbage, shredded

Dressing:

  • 1 cup cilantro
  • 1/2 cup parsley
  • 1/2 cup dill
  • 2 tablespoon avocado or olive oil
  • 1 zest and juice of lemon
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1.) Combine Bragg’s liquid aminos, Himalayan salt, and tempeh in a small bowl. Let this marinate for 20 minutes

2.) Cut tempeh into slices. Preheat a pan over medium heat and cook tempeh for 2–3 minutes on each side. Remove from heat and set aside.

3.) Combine all dressing ingredients in a high speed blender. Mix until smooth; set aside

4.) Shred beets, leeks, and cabbage. Place in a bowl and top with sprouts and grape tomatoes.

5.) Toss dressing, tempeh, and salad together

articleTitle: Let Me Bend Your Ear About Corn! Corn Summer Salad
articleBodyHTML:
Corn doesn't always deserve the bad reputation it's received. Fresh, organic summer corn is actually pretty awesome. Don't believe us? Try it for yourself!

Not everyone eats corn. Some eschew it due to food allergies and others are convinced it’s nutritionally void and too difficult to digest. Currently, over 90% of U.S. corn is genetically engineered (GE), which is another strike against the starchy vegetable (which, technically is a grain, but that’s another article for another time!).

I’ll be honest with you, most of the year I don’t eat much corn. I don’t think of it being particularly healthful and, unless it’s summertime, the corn available is either frozen, trucked in from far away or just too tough to taste good. But right now—because I live in Iowa, which you could call “corn central”—I am doing my share of shuckin’!

Organic (non-GE) sweet corn is one of summer’s simplest pleasures. A freshly-plucked ear is delicious eaten straight out of its husk; it needs no butter, no salt, no cooking—no kidding! You can also dress corn up, like in this salad mixed with other in-season vegetables including red bell peppers, tomatoes, and cilantro.

The key to enjoying corn is to recognize it for the fleeting delight that it is. Old corn is not good corn, and my best advice is not to buy an ear that was picked more than 24 hours ago. Avoid corn with dry, pale husks and silks. Test corn by piercing a kernel with your fingernail: it should squirt a whitish juice.

If your eyes were bigger than your stomach and you find yourself with leftover ears, place extra corn in your refrigerator as soon as possible. Leave the husks on, and store it uncovered. Keep the temperature at or below 40 degrees so the natural sugars are less likely to turn to starch. Eat it in less than two days if you plan to have “fresh corn,” or use it in a recipe where less-than-fresh corn won’t be as noticeable. You can also remove the kernels from the ears and freeze.
articleSummaryHTML: Corn doesn't always deserve the bad reputation it's received. Fresh, organic summer corn is actually pretty awesome. Don't believe us? Try it for yourself!
seoTitle: Let Me Bend Your Ear About Corn! Corn Summer Salad

articleBodyHTML:
Be surprised with healthy blondies. The surprise is the secret ingredient, but since it’s listed in the title, it isn’t that secret, but still good!

Sometimes things surprise you. Take Talia Pollock, the energetic host of Party in My Plants, as an example. articleBodyHTML:
Pack your smoothie with the nutrient dense sweetness of mango in this mango smoothie bowl.

It is now mango season, which means I am going mango crazy. I buy them by the case and use them daily: in my oatmeal and, more importantly, my smoothies. Mangoes not only provide a sweet flavor and a beautiful orange color, they also pack a health-dense punch.

This creation of mine is clearly mango based. But, before I share the recipe with you, let me highlight the main ingredient: mangoes. Let’s discuss all the benefits of this amazing fruit!

Alkalize the Body

Mangos are high in tartaric acid and malic acid which help the body to maintain a healthy pH. An acidic body leads to inflammation and disease.

Balance Blood Pressure

Due to the high amounts of magnesium and potassium found in mangos, they provide a natural way to keep blood pressure levels in check. Magnesium is also great for healthy muscle contraction, utilizing B vitamins, and it helps the body to absorb calcium.

Brain Health

Who doesn’t want a healthy brain? We need our brain for everything we do in life: from breathing to writing a 5000 word essay. Mangoes are packed with vitamin B6 (and numerous other B vitamins), which are known for maintaining and possibly improving brain function. The B vitamins also help support a healthy mood and healthy sleep patterns.

Bone Health

Mangoes are high in vitamin K which is an essential vitamin in building strong bones.

High in Fiber

This means better digestion and elimination. Health begins in the gut, so ensuring a healthy gut is crucial for overall wellness.

Increasing Immunity

Due to their high amount of beta-carotene, mangoes help increase immunity, protecting us from sickness and infection. Beta-carotene also ensures healthy skin, hair, teeth and gums, plus promotes the growth of strong bones.

[https://draxe.com/mango-nutrition/]

Now you see why we should be eating mangoes, not only because they taste good, but because they are a nutritional powerhouse.

When you buy a can, of full fat coconut milk, you will open it and a hard cream substance (which is the fat) will be on top. That is the cream, and that is the part of the coconut milk we will be using.

I don’t like to waste so I pour the coconut water, which will be under the coconut cream, into a jar and use it in other recipes.
articleSummaryHTML: Pack your smoothie with the nutrient dense sweetness of mango in this mango smoothie bowl.
seoTitle: Mangoes and Cream Smoothie Bowl | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Pack your smoothie with the nutrient dense sweetness of mango in this mango smoothie bowl.

s:1108:"

  • 1 teaspoon maca powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein powder

Toppings (optional)

  • 5 raw vegan brownie fudge pops [1/2 ripe banana / 4 Medjool dates / 1/2 cup oat flour/ 1 tablespoon. raw cacao/ dash of pink Himalayan sea salt combined until smooth in a food processor, than rolled into little balls ]

Finish, by placing your toppings, on top of the smoothie.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your chill on this summer with three delightfully cool summer refreshments!

Summer is a time when you want to be outside, not in the kitchen. But you also want to have cool refreshing and satisfying snacks and drinks. In the spirit of summer and snacking and cool refreshment, it’s time to share some easy quick recipes to make your summer cool and delightful!

s:1867:"

Berry-Lime Chiller

This is a great, easy-to-make drink for hot summer months. The coconut water provides additional sweetness along with essential electrolytes.

  • 2 cups coconut water
  • 2 tablespoons raw cane sugar
  • ¼ cup fresh lime juice
  • 1 cup frozen raspberries or strawberries

Vanilla Almond Butter Popsicles

Almond butter, dates, cinnamon, and vanilla create an addictive combo! Now you can have creamy deliciousness—without a tinge of guilt. Packed with protein, these also make an awesome post-workout treat.

  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter
  • 2–3 dates
  • 2 tablespoons raw honey or maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • Cinnamon to your taste preference

Pomegran-mint Iced Tea

Pomegranate combined with fresh mint is thirst quenching. It can be difficult drinking only water to stay hydrated throughout the summer months. Make up this antioxidant-packed, sweet tea and stay refreshed!

  • 3 cups unsweetened mint tea
  • 6–8 ounces of pure pomegranate juice
  • 1–3 tablespoons raw sugar
  • Fresh mint leaves
";
directions:
Berry-Lime Chiller

Combine all ingredients in a blender and process until smooth.

Vanilla Almond Butter Popsicles

Combine all the ingredients in a blender and pulse until the consistency is smooth. Pour into Popsicle mold and freeze for 6 hours.

Pomegran-mint Iced Tea

Mix in a quart jar or container. Add 2–3 fresh mint sprigs and refrigerate until very cold.

Relax & enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Boost potassium and antioxidants for you and your family with these fun, easy chocolate dipped bananas.

It’s time to dip those bananas for a delicious treat that transcends the simple fruit and encourages you and your family to boost potassium and antioxidant consumption. We make it easy and fun.
articleSummaryHTML: Boost potassium and antioxidants for you and your family with these fun, easy chocolate dipped bananas.
seoTitle: Chocolate Dipped Bananas
seoDescription: Boost potassium and antioxidants for you and your family with these fun, easy chocolate dipped bananas.
ingredients:
s:533:"
  • 3 bananas, peeled
  • 4–5 cups water
  • 1–2 cups chocolate for melting
  • 1/4–1/2 cup almond milk

*Optional toppings:

  • Sprinkles
  • Nuts
  • Granola
  • white chocolate chips
  • dark chocolate chips
";
directions:
Start by peeling three bananas. Cut those sweet crescent shaped fruits in half. Place them on a skewer in preparation for their dunking.

Away from your halved nanners, boil some water. Lower the heat and set a bowl above the steam. This will become your melting chamber, where the secrets of the universe (aka chocolate) are transformed into a liquid perfect for dipping. Put your chocolate in that warm bowl and add almond milk. Stir until these become one and all the chocolate is melted.
It is now time to upgrade your bananas and introduce them to the joy that comes from the cacao bean. Dip them and rotate them in the molten chocolate until they are fully covered. Roll or sprinkle your creations with sprinkles, nuts, granola, white chocolate chips, or even dark chocolate chips. Your imagination will take you far with your toppings, so choose what makes you happiest inside.

That’s it. It really is that simple to treat yourself to the best things. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Spicy Roasted Beet Cashew Crème Dip with Za'atar
articleBodyHTML:
You cannot BEET this recipe! Flavor, nutrition, we've got it all with this spicy roasted beet cashew crème dip with za'atar!

Beets are a wonderfully vivacious veggie. The jewel-like color and the sweet taste is divine, and the fact they are so good for us is a gem in itself. Be they raw and sliced onto crackers, juiced, spiraled for salad and pasta, made into a beautiful carpaccio, or roasted like this exotic tasting dip, I am in love. Beets are great in smoothies and truffles. They’re even a perfect pair with chocolate in brownies and raw mousse-like parfaits.

This root veggie has numerous benefits: boosts stamina, increases blood flow (thanks to the natural nitrates). The betaine that beets contain help reduce inflammation and protect our cells from environmental stress. Their rich color comes from phytonutrients that research shows may help ward off cancer.

The benefits go on to include nutrient density including Vitamin B (folate) and C, essential minerals like potassium and manganese, and they support detoxification for our blood and liver. Give this recipe a taste test and add it to your list of great ways to enjoy beautiful beets every day. By the way the greens are great, too, so be sure to keep them when you buy beets with the tops.
articleSummaryHTML: You cannot BEET this recipe! Flavor, nutrition, we've got it all with this spicy roasted beet cashew crème dip with za'atar!
seoTitle: Spicy Roasted Beet Cashew Crème Dip with Za'atar
seoDescription: You cannot BEET this recipe! Flavor, nutrition, we've got it all with this spicy roasted beet cashew crème dip with za'atar!
recipeName: Spicy Roasted Beet Cashew Crème Dip with za'atar
ingredients:
s:940:"
  • 2 fresh, organic, medium-sized beets
  • 2–3 garlic cloves, crushed
  • Jalapeno, finger, or habanera chili pepper, roughly sliced – to taste (seed if desired)
  • 2/3 cup home-made savory cashew crème or ½ cup cashew butter
  • 1–2 tablespoons lemon juice, to taste
  • 2 tablespoons organic olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon za’atar (full flavored Middle Eastern spice blend) or more to taste
  • ½–1 teaspoon unrefined sea salt

Garnish:

  • Pumpkin seeds, chopped hazelnuts, Brazil nuts, or cashews (raw or toasted)
  • Fresh herbs of your choice
";
directions:
Line a baking dish with parchment and roast beets at 375–400F approximately one hour or until a knife easily slides into the center. Cool, peel, cut into pieces and place into food processor along with the remaining ingredients.

Process until smooth

Taste and adjust seasonings if desired.

Garnish with mint and cilantro chiffonade, additional za’atar and raw or toasted nuts or seeds

articleTitle: Tarts, Roasted Apricots, and Trail Mix to Keep Summer Sweet
articleBodyHTML:
From elegant evening dessert to hitting the trails, you can get your snack on with three delightfully awesome summer refreshments!

Dessert first! is the battle cry of many people. But don’t judge too quickly. It doesn’t mean they’re indulgent gluttons. They may have just figured out how to make dessert a guilt-free experience and they are excited to get to it. With these three recipes, you might just adopt their battle cry as your own.
articleSummaryHTML: From elegant evening dessert to hitting the trails, you can get your snack on with three delightfully awesome summer refreshments!
seoTitle: Tarts, Roasted Apricots, & Trail Mix to Keep Summer Sweet
seoDescription: From elegant evening dessert to hitting the trails, you can get your snack on with three delightfully awesome summer refreshments!
recipeName: Tarts, Roasted Apricots, and Trail Mix to Keep Summer Sweet
ingredients:
s:2416:"

Raw Carob Cream Tartlet

This is a unique alternative to chocolate mousse. You’ll find carob is every bit as flavorful as chocolate, but with a slightly sweeter taste. Avocado and coconut butter makes for a rich, creamy base, and provides essential fats. The crust is a combination of dates and almonds. Although very energy-dense, this dessert is both healthy and delectable. It makes a great weekend or special occasion treat.

For the Carob Cream Mousse:

  • 1 large avocado
  • 4 tablespoons carob powder
  • 3 tablespoons raw honey or maple syrup
  • ½ teaspoon pure vanilla extract
  • 2–3 tablespoons raw coconut butter

For the Tart Crust:

  • 2/3-cup raw almonds
  • 1/3-cup dates.

Hit the Trails Mix

Summer’s here—it’s time to get out and enjoy the fresh air and sunshine! Here’s a nutrient-packed mix that will give fuel to explore the great outdoors a little longer.

  • 1 cup raw cashews
  • 1 cup dried blueberries
  • 1 cup dried banana chips
  • ½ cup raw macadamia nuts
  • ½–1 cup raw cacao nibs

Roasted Apricots and Peaches in Wine

A southern summer brings an abundance of my favorite fruits: apricots and peaches. In this recipe, ghee, dessert wine, honey, cinnamon and vanilla meld together perfectly. Enjoy the warm summer evenings with this tasty dessert.

  • 5 ripe organic apricots
  • 3 ripe but firm organic peaches
  • 3 tablespoons ghee
  • 3 tablespoons honey or agave syrup
  • 1/3 cup sweet dessert wine
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • Cinnamon and brown sugar to taste
";
directions:
Raw Carob Cream Tartlet

Directions:

Pulse the ingredients for the carob cream mousse in a blender until creamy.

Process the ingredients for the tart crust until crumbly and easy to press.

Press the date/almond mixture into a small tartlet mold and top with the carob cream. Sprinkle with raw cacao nibs or even dark chocolate to garnish.

Hit the Trails Mix

Directions:

Mix all together and store in your favorite backpacking form of storage.

Roasted Apricots and Peaches in Wine

Directions:

In a broiler-safe pan, combine the ghee and honey place in heated broiler until melted. Add pitted, quartered peaches and halved apricots along with the dessert wine, and vanilla. Make sure liquid ingredients are well blended together.

Broil or roast for 7–10 minutes; they should begin turning golden brown when ready. Once out of the oven, allow the peaches and apricots to cool. Lightly sprinkle with cinnamon and brown sugar.

Can serve with vanilla ice cream.

articleBodyHTML:
Reduce inflammation, relieve joint pain, and enjoy other health benefits, this chocolate turmeric smoothie is a good companion to the apple a day habit!

Yes, I did say turmeric in your smoothie! Fresh turmeric is so healthy and helpful for reducing inflammation. I am always thinking of new, creative ways to use turmeric than solely in curries or savory dishes. (It has an earthy taste, so it can overpower the flavor of recipes if not combined with other foods in a balanced way). I discovered that when you add turmeric to a healthy, raw chocolate smoothie or chocolate dessert, the dominant taste of the chocolate hides the earthy turmeric taste. Hooray! I love a great tasting smoothie that has the hidden healing powers of fresh food from the earth, such as this one that has turmeric, spinach, and zucchini in it. Don’t be weirded out by this one until you try it! It sounds odd, but it’s simply delicious. And it will make you feel so good!

Many people don’t know what fresh turmeric looks like. It looks similar to ginger, except it is a little smaller in size, and the inside is a bright orange or yellow. It will be in the fresh veggie section, so ask your supermarket for help when trying to locate it. Fresh turmeric is known to have cancer fighting abilities. A must for anyone trying to heal cancer or going through chemotherapy. A must for anyone trying to keep their immune system robust and strong.

Without further delay, may I present to you a delicious and creamy, anti-inflammatory, magnesium-rich, nutrient dense, energizing, and healing, raw, vegan smoothie to knock your chocolate socks off!
articleSummaryHTML: Reduce inflammation, relieve joint pain, and enjoy other health benefits, this chocolate turmeric smoothie is a good companion to the apple a day habit!
seoTitle: Gracious Living Chocolate Turmeric Smoothie
seoDescription: Reduce inflammation, relieve joint pain, and enjoy other health benefits, this chocolate turmeric smoothie is a good companion to the apple a day habit!
ingredients:
s:794:"
  • 1 tablespoon fresh turmeric (either grated into your smoothie, or if you have a high powered smoothie, you can just peel it and throw in the chunk)
  • 2 tablespoons raw cacao powder
  • ½ a zucchini (skin on or off)
  • 1 cup spinach
  • 1 banana (optional)
  • ½ teaspoon black pepper
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Chocolate Protein
  • 2–3 cups water, or dairy-free milk of choice (I love sulfite-free coconut milk)
  • 1 cup ice
";
directions:
Blend until super creamy and smooth. Enjoy the yummy chocolate-y taste while knowing that you are putting an abundant of nutrients into your body to help it thrive and heal.

Did you know?

Turmeric’s healing powers become more intense (bioavailable) when you combine it with a good fat and also black pepper. In this recipe the good fats come from your Sunwarrior Protein Powder and also from the coconut milk if you are using that.

Gracious Living Tips:

Turmeric’s taste will always be hidden by the chocolate taste. Make delicious raw, chocolate dessert balls or protein bars and add fresh turmeric to the recipe for an extra anti-inflammatory boost.

Fresh is always best. This recipe does not taste AS good when using turmeric powder as opposed to fresh. Try using about ½ teaspoon turmeric powder (too much will taste chalky).

Or try adding a shot of this amazing liquid turmeric to your smoothie. I believe it is one of the best turmeric products in the world: Synchro Gold: The World’s Best Liquid Turmeric.

Try this recipe Gracious Living Monkey Fudge Bars: https://sunwarrior.com/healthhub/gracious-living-protein-monkey-fudge-bars

articleBodyHTML:
S’mores just scream summer! These melty marshmallows will bring back memories of campfires and starlit nights, all while tasting amazing!

Thought you couldn’t have this classic summer treat because of the gluten in the graham crackers? Fear not! I have you covered! These S’mores Tartelettes are gluten free and dairy free. This dessert is secretly packed with multiple sources of protein, is naturally-sweetened, and will sure to delight even the pickiest of eaters!

Remember the three components of a traditional s’more?

  • A piece of chocolate
  • A toasted marshmallow
  • Sandwiched between two graham crackers.

Well, these tartelettes put a fun spin on this classic!

I took the graham crackers and turned them into a mini tart shell: the perfect vessel for a summer dessert. They can be eaten without utensils, which is ideal for outdoor activities.

I upgraded the piece of chocolate and instead made a chocolate ganache. The chocolate ganache features not one, but two of Sunwarrior’s proteins. The Warrior Blend Vanilla protein and the Illumin8 Organic Meal in Aztec Chocolate combine beautifully to give the S’mores Tartelettes a decadent chocolate layer.

I made my own marshmallow meringue topping to replace the pre-made ones you typically use for s’mores. Depending on your affinity for marshmallows, you can top the cups with as much or as little meringue as you like.

The S’mores Tartelettes are best served and enjoyed right away, as the marshmallow topping will gradually deflate. But, I bet these won’t sit out very long!
articleSummaryHTML: S’mores just scream summer! These melty marshmallows will bring back memories of campfires and starlit nights, all while tasting amazing!
seoTitle: Gluten Free S’mores Tartelettes | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: S’mores just scream summer! These melty marshmallows will bring back memories of campfires and starlit nights, all while tasting amazing!
ingredients:
s:1078:"

Crust:

Heaping 1/3 cup gluten free graham cracker cookies

1/2 cup almond flour, finely milled

3 tablespoons almond butter

Chocolate Ganache:

1/2 cup almond milk

1/4 cup chocolate chips (use a dairy free version)

1 scoop Warrior Blend vanilla protein

1 tablespoon Illumin8 Organic Meal Aztec Chocolate

1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

Marshmallow Topping:

1.5 oz egg whites (or egg white substitute)

1/4 cup raw honey (or agave syrup)

1/8 teaspoon vanilla extract

1/2 teaspoon ice water

Pinch sea salt

";
directions:
For the Crust:

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

2. Combine almond flour and almond butter in a food processor. Blend on high until soft dough forms.

3. Divide dough into four parts.

4. Press dough into parchment lined ramekins, or another oven-safe mold. Press up onto sides of your mold to form a small cup.

5. Set molds into oven to par-bake for 8–12 minutes, or until edges begin to slightly brown.

6. Remove and let cool completely.

For the Chocolate Ganache:

1. Warm the milk in a saucepan under low heat. Pour in chocolate chips and stir frequently with a wooden spoon until all chocolate pieces are melted. This will take 3–5 minutes.

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat to let cool slightly.

3. Pour the melted chocolate mixture and the remaining ingredients of the ganache into a blender (I used a Magic Bullet). Blend until smooth.

4. The mixture should become thick and frosting like.

5. Place into a covered container and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. The ganache will harden as it cools.

For the Marshmallow Meringue Topping:

1. Bring a small saucepan with 2 inches of water to a simmer.

2. Pour the egg whites, honey, vanilla, and salt into a heat-proof bowl. Place the bowl on top of the saucepan, making sure the bowl doesn’t touch the water.

3. Begin to whisk the contents of the bowl until it becomes slightly warm, approximately 3–5 minutes. Foam will start to develop.

4. Remove the bowl from the saucepan and pour the ice water into the mixture.

5. Immediately begin to whisk the mix, keeping it in the same bowl, on high until the mixture stiffens, much like the stiff peaks of whipped cream. You can use a handheld beater or stand-up mixer. The time it takes will vary. I did this with a handheld beater and it took at least 10 minutes for the mix to stiffen.

6. The meringue will gradually deflate and is best enjoyed upon serving.

Take the cooled crust and place a generous spoonful of the chocolate ganache in the center. Flatten the chocolate out with a spoon. Spoon or pipe the desired amount of marshmallow meringue over the top and enjoy!

For extra pizzazz, torch the top of the marshmallow meringue to give your S’mores Tartelettes a real authentic marshmallow toasted affect.

articleBodyHTML:
When you need a motherhood win, we’ve got your back with these blueberry oatmeal pancakes! Send them back to school right!

School mornings are busy. Getting all the kids up at the right time and to their various bus stops can prove to be a magnificent balancing act. I like to make this pancake batter before I get them up, so when they are dressed, breakfast is ready to go. It cooks up like a dream and is loved by all my kids, even the ones who claim they don’t like pancakes.

At first, my kids didn’t like oatmeal pancakes because of the texture the oats brought. However if you mix them in the blender, the blender grinds them while they are mixed and the batter comes out smooth. Now, I hear no complaints.

The oats have a ton of fiber as well as manganese and are known to reduce cholesterol. Blueberries are a proven antioxidant. They also are loaded with Vitamin K and manganese also. When sending your kids off to school, you want them to have the best chance at a good day as possible. A healthy warm breakfast is a great start to a great day!

 

Are you seeing weird numbers and letters? Find out why here!
articleSummaryHTML: When you need a motherhood win, we’ve got your back with these blueberry oatmeal pancakes! Send them back to school right!
seoTitle: Blueberry Oatmeal Pancakes
seoDescription: When you need a motherhood win, we’ve got your back with these blueberry oatmeal pancakes! Send them back to school right!
ingredients:
s:644:"

 

  • 1 1/3 cup oats
  • 1 egg or flax egg
  • 2 teaspoons agave
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt
  • ¾ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • ¾ to 1 cup almond milk or milk of choice
  • 2 teaspoons any vinegar (apple cider, red wine, white wine)
  • Fresh or frozen blueberries
  • Maple syrup
";
directions: Add all ingredients except blueberries to blender and mix until well blended. Let sit 10 to 15 minutes to thicken. Add additional almond milk if too thick. Cook on greased hot griddle and add desired amount of blueberries on top after you pour batter on griddle. Flip once bubbly. Serve hot with maple syrup or preserves and additional blueberries, if desired.

articleBodyHTML:
Ice cream pops are not just warm weather treats for children! Adults can cool off with these coconut mango-rum cocktail ice-cream pops

For a tasty, leisure treat that every cabana bar and smoothie joint should have, here is Kaz's Coconut Mango-Rum Cocktail Ice-Cream Pops. With a team of delicious mango and coconut cream, these pops are every fitness-partygoers’ dream. The juicy, sweet mango provides an abundance of vitamin C for immunity, vitamin A for your vision, and fiber to help keep that cholesterol lowered. The malic acid and tartaric acid help alkalize the whole body. The plant-based protein offers an easily digestible protein source that tastes great. So go hit the freezer and enjoy them after making these. You won’t be disappointment. If you’re enjoying these at the gym, make sure you consume responsibly and have someone else drive. And make sure to enjoy them post work out so you don’t get a little tipsy and hurt yourself on the equipment.
articleSummaryHTML: Ice cream pops are not just warm weather treats for children! Adults can cool off with these coconut mango-rum cocktail ice-cream pops
seoTitle: Coconut Mango-Rum Cocktail Ice-Cream Pops | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Ice cream pops are not just warm weather treats for children! Adults can cool off with these coconut mango-rum cocktail ice-cream pops
ingredients:
s:703:"
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla
  • 1 cup unsweetened coconut milk
  • ¾ cup coconut water
  • 2 shots Bacardi Gold Rum
  • 4 tablespoons coconut cream
  • 3 tablespoons coconut flakes
  • 1 ¼ cup organic mangos
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon ground vanilla bean
  • 1 teaspoon lemon juice
";
directions:
1. Combine all ingredients except about of 1 ¼ cup of mangos and coconut flakes in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy.

2. Add the rest of the mangos and coconut and pulse until clumpy without blending entirely.

3. Next pour coconut mango rum cocktail ice-cream in ice-cream molds.

4. Store in freezer to set over night.

5. Take out and eat them for a nice protein and rum cocktail dessert.

Itadakimasu! ~ Enjoy!

Check out these other refreshing summer delights!

articleBodyHTML:
Like shooting stars and wishes, chocolate and peanut butter were made for one another. Which is why these vegan peanut butter protein cookies are our special gift to you today!

Chocolate and peanut butter: two plants, both coming out of ancient South America, that mesh together to create dessert perfection. We aren’t the first to combine them, but we think our chocolate chip peanut butter cookies are a pretty fantastic take on the classic.
articleSummaryHTML: Like shooting stars and wishes, chocolate and peanut butter were made for one another. Which is why these vegan peanut butter protein cookies are our special gift to you today!
seoTitle: Vegan Peanut Butter Protein Cookies
seoDescription: Like shooting stars and wishes, chocolate and peanut butter were made for one another. Which is why these vegan peanut butter protein cookies are our special gift to you today!
ingredients:
s:467:"
  • ¾ cup peanut butter
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 1/3 cup almond milk
  • ½ tablespoon vanilla
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/8 cup coconut oil
  • 2 cups flour
  • 1 scoop of Sunwarrior’s vanilla Classic Plus
  • 1–2 cups chocolate chips.
";
directions:
Start with 3/4 cup peanut butter. We like the delicious varieties that Peanut Butter & Co cranks out. We’re using the Smooth Operator, their name for creamy. Add to that brown sugar, almond milk, vanilla, sea salt, baking powder, coconut oil. Whisk that together before adding flour and Sunwarrior’s vanilla Classic Plus for extra protein. Mix that together. Add in your chocolate chips.

Lay out balls of dough on a cookie sheet and smash those little guys criss-cross style with a fork. Bake at 375 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 minutes. Watch em rise! Enjoy the deliciousness of peanut butter and chocolate in one of the best delivery systems available, a cookie. Yay!

Breakfast is an important meal, so make it awesome with these blueberry pancakes!

articleBodyHTML:
Beat the late summer heat with Talia Pollock of Party in My Plants and her chocolate peanut butter ice pops!

The super energetic soul that is Talia Pollock from Party in My Plants is in the kitchen to make your summer more bearable with a delicious chocolate peanut butter popsicle. Yes, the great combo that is peanut butter and chocolate can be made into a creamy, satisfying, and refreshing dessert on a stick. You’re welcome. Also, if you haven’t had the chance to watch a video with Talia before, you’re in for a treat. She’s fun!

Nothing is more perfect in the middle of the summer heat than a little popsicle action. Take these with you to the pool, the beach, the park, and everywhere in between. Unlike other popsicles, these also score big in the healthy category. These aren’t full of sugar or fake flavors. They’re sweetened with bananas and flavored with real foods, including Sunwarrior’s creamy, chocolatey plant-based protein and peanut butter. They’re like frozen peanut butter cups on a stick.
articleSummaryHTML: Beat the late summer heat with Talia Pollock of Party in My Plants and her chocolate peanut butter ice pops!
seoTitle: Chocolate Peanut Butter Ice Pops
seoDescription: Beat the late summer heat with Talia Pollock of Party in My Plants and her chocolate peanut butter ice pops!
ingredients:
s:609:"
  • 3 ripe bananas
  • 3 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 1 ½ cup almond milk
  • 2 scoops of Sunwarrior chocolate protein (Classic Plus or Warrior Blend)

*Optional

  • 2 optional tablespoons maple syrup
  • Pinch of sea salt.
";
directions:
Toss bananas into your blender with the creamy, dreamy peanut buttery goodness, almond milk, Sunwarrior chocolate protein (Classic Plus or Warrior Blend), maple syrup, and a pinch of sea salt. Blend it to perfection and pour the creamy, sweet-smelling results into your popsicle molds. Sip the leftovers. We won’t tell.

Pop them in the freezer for at least four hours. Pull them out and enjoy the day. You won’t regret making these. The only challenge is waiting for them to thaw enough to pull them free of the mold. So hard being patient!

articleTitle: Vegan Cashew, Cacao N’ Rawtella Cheesecake
articleBodyHTML:
There comes a time when dessert is a must and you just have to give in. But dessert doesn’t have to come with guilt. If you make it healthy, you can have your cake and eat it too!

With a cake like this one –comprised of amazing nutrient rich ingredients and being super easy to make—you can indulge a little more often than ever before! While I have a nice collection of various vegan cheesecakes and desserts, this recipe has moved up to the top of my fave treats lists. It’s a celebration for me every time be it a birthday, Valentine’s, Christmas, or just… cuz-I-can. Once you taste this, I am confident you will feel the same way.

As for regular cheesecake still being better? Not a chance! Once you’ve tasted this cream cheese, other cheesecakes will be a thing of the past.
articleSummaryHTML: There comes a time when dessert is a must and you just have to give in. But dessert doesn’t have to come with guilt. If you make it healthy, you can have your cake and eat it too!
seoTitle: Vegan Cashew, Cacao N’ Rawtella Cheesecake
seoDescription: There comes a time when dessert is a must and you just have to give in. But dessert doesn’t have to come with guilt. If you make it healthy, you can have your cake and eat it too!
recipeName: Vegan Cashew, Cacao N’ Rawtella Cheesecake
ingredients:
s:1325:"

For the Crust

  • 1 cup hazelnuts or pecan meal (use raw nuts and blast in your blender)
  • 4–6 Medjool dates, pitted (start with 4, if mixture holds together, this is fine)
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil, room temp
  • 1 teaspoon real vanilla extract or powder or brandy
  • 1 pinch sea salt

For the Filling

  • 2 cups raw cashews, soaked at least 4 hours or overnight, rinsed and drained
  • ½ cup coconut oil, warmed to liquid in a hot water bath
  • ½ cup raw agave or coconut syrup
  • ¼ cup Rawtella silk (Sunbutter, Cashew, or Rainforest can be substituted)
  • ½ cup raw cacao powder
  • ½ cup water
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt

Garnish:

Cacao nibs, crushed cashews, cacao powder, or dairy-free chocolate slivers

";
directions:
1. Blend the crust ingredients together in a food processor until it starts to come together. Add extra dates only if needed. Press the crust into the bottom of a 9 inch parchment lined spring form pan, to about ¼ inch thickness. Set aside while you make the filling.

2. In a high speed blender or food processor, blend together cashews, agave or coconut syrup, water, and salt. Blast until creamy and smooth, scraping down the sides occasionally if necessary. Add in the Rawtella, cacao powder, and coconut oil, and continue to blend until mixture is well combined.

3. Using a spatula, pour and scrape the filling on top of the crust and smooth evenly. Cover the cheesecake and place in the freezer on a flat surface for approximately 4 hours or until frozen throughout.

4. When ready to serve, remove the cheesecake from the pan and let stand at room temp for 5-10 minutes then garnish and slice into 10–12 slivers. Return any leftovers to the freezer for a repeat treat later. This delish cake will keep up 2–4 weeks if well wrapped. (What a treat to find this stashed in your freezer).

No calorie count to be found with my recipes. My focus is on creating and consuming quality foods made with whole foods or those minimally processed. This approach enables my body to cue me when I’m sated. There is always another day to enjoy this delish cake again rather than over-indulging in one sitting.

articleBodyHTML:
There’s no denying that lemonade screams summer, and while we have those last few vestiges of summer weather, we might as well use it right with lemonade!

But let’s face it, the store-bought or kid-on-the-corner kind is laden with refined sugar. But what if we swapped honey for the sugar (or agave syrup for our vegan friends), used organic (of course) lemons, and added a little fresh rosemary—which pairs great with lemon—for flavor oomph? Well, by George, I think we’ve got something. (Let’s not kid ourselves, this is still a high-glycemic beverage. But dang, it does taste good!)

Remember, in addition to the alkalizing properties of lemon, you will benefit from the presence of rosemary, simply because:

It’s good for your head! Rosemary has been shown to increase the blood flow to the head and brain, helping to uplift mood, clear the mind and improve concentration.

It helps you stay well. Rosemary helps stimulate the immune system, increase circulation and improve digestion.

It’ll soothe you. Rosemary has anti-inflammatory compounds that may make it useful in helping with a variety of conditions.  Do some research to find out more!

One last thing: fresh rosemary can be refrigerated in a plastic bag for several weeks—so buy a bunch of it!
articleSummaryHTML: There’s no denying that lemonade screams summer, and while we have those last few vestiges of summer weather, we might as well use it right with lemonade!
seoTitle: Rosemary Lemonade
seoDescription: There’s no denying that lemonade screams summer, and while we have those last few vestiges of summer weather, we might as well use it right with lemonade!
ingredients:
s:244:"
  • 4 cups purified water
  • 5” sprig fresh rosemary
  • 2/3 cup honey (or agave syrup)
  • 1/2 cup lemon juice
";
directions:
Boil 4 cups of water and pour over sprig of rosemary. Allow to steep for 8–10 minutes and remove herbs. Add honey and stir to dissolve. Pour into a half-gallon jar, add lemon juice and fill the rest of the jar with cold water. Chill and taste. Serve over ice with a fresh sprig of rosemary as a garnish.

BONUS TIP:

Freeze any leftover lemonade (good luck with that!) in a freezer pop mold for a delish frozen treat

articleBodyHTML:
Can I have a cookie? Yes, you can! These cookie carob dough balls will give protein and delicious happiness!

Cookie dough will always have a soft spot in my heart. Whenever I see cookie dough, it serenades me into its delicious sweet texture and crunchy chocolate chips. It always entices me to eat more. With my giant spoon, I dig into this mixture and then before I know it, it’s gone. Well, thank goodness this cookie dough is packed with protein, fiber, and nutrients! This cookie dough is also egg free, so it is safe to eat. These cookie dough balls are absolutely delicious and super easy to make. You can make a large batch and place them in the freezer. They will last 1–2 months in an air tight container.

I used carob chips in this recipe instead of chocolate. So what exactly is carob? Carob is harvested from pods, just as cocoa is. These sweet beans are grown around the world. Carob has many of the same textural properties as cocoa but is 100 percent vegan. Carob is used as a substitute for chocolate in baking and sweet treats. Carob has many wonderful properties such as the ability to lower blood cholesterol and rich in calcium. Carob just like cocoa has antioxidants. Carob also contains selenium which is wonderful for anyone suffering from thyroid issues.

These cookie dough protein balls are awesome after or before an intense workout. It’s the perfect treat without adding any refined sugars to your body. If you have kids, these are wonderful to pack in a lunch bag. These cookie dough balls are vegan, gluten free, grain-free, raw and refined sugar free. I used coconut butter in this recipe, but you can always substitute it for almond butter or peanut butter. The best part about these little bundles of joy is that they only take 5 minutes to make (and 1 second to eat).
articleSummaryHTML: Can I have a cookie? Yes, you can! These cookie carob dough balls will give protein and delicious happiness!
seoTitle: Cookie Carob Dough Balls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Can I have a cookie? Yes, you can! These cookie carob dough balls will give protein and delicious happiness!
ingredients:
s:546:"
  • 1 cup raw almonds
  • 8–10 Medjool dates (pitted)
  • 1/2 cup almond meal
  • 1/2 cup desiccated coconut
  • 2 tablespoons coconut butter
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup carob chips
";
directions:
1.) Place all ingredients except carob chips in your food processor. Pulse for 1 minute until the mixture is tacky and holds together.

2.) Remove from food processor and place in a medium size bowl. Stir in carob chips and using an ice cream scooper, scoop dough into balls. Place in an airtight container in the fridge or freezer.

articleBodyHTML:
Cool heaven: that’s what we’re giving you with this chocolate freezer fudge treat. Who knew freezers could be so much fun?

Shhhh, you are about to be initiated into a secret wisdom that few know. Your freezer can be a source of delicious desserts, and we aren’t talking popsicles. These are the desserts you might typically expect to come from the oven or stovetop. Join the always exuberant host of Party in My Plants, Talia Pollock, as she brings you into the fold of the Chocolate Freezer Fudge.

Talia has always been a fan of two independently awesome things combined into one even awesomer thing, like shampoo conditioner, pajama jeans, and planter desks. Fudge and frozen treat aren't that unusual when you think about it. Especially in the summer, when almost anything coming out of the freezer tastes so fantastic and anything not cold seems less appetizing. Add to this awesomeness that this freezer fudge is rich in plant protein, and you have a three awesomes in one recipe. You’re welcome!

Talia shares her top three suggestions on how to enjoy them too. 1) In a cooler at the beach. 2) After a sweaty summer workout. 3) As an afternoon pick-me-up. 4) As a dessert. Just so you know Talia isn’t great at coloring inside the lines, even when she makes those lines herself. 5) When bored. 6) When the chocolate craving comes a-callin’. 7) Just kidding – make up your own reasons.
articleSummaryHTML: Cool heaven: That’s what we’re giving you with this chocolate freezer fudge treat. Who knew freezers could be so much fun?
seoTitle: Chocolate Freezer Fudge
seoDescription: Cool heaven: That’s what we’re giving you with this chocolate freezer fudge treat. Who knew freezers could be so much fun?
ingredients:
s:508:"
  • 1/3 cup melted coconut oil
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior’s chocolate protein powder
  • 2 tablespoons cocoa or cacao powder
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • ¼ up of maple syrup (or coconut nectar)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla.
";
directions:
Grab a mixing bowl and dump into said bowl one cup of nut butter (choose your favorite). Add to it melted coconut oil and mix those two ingredients together. Add to this delicious slurry Sunwarrior’s chocolate protein powder, cocoa or cacao powder,  sea salt, maple syrup (or coconut nectar), and vanilla.

Mix everything together into one happy fudge family in a bowl. Dump the gooey goodness into any pan lined with plastic wrap. Put it in your freezer for an hour. When you pull it out, the coconut oil will have done its magic, firming this treat into fudge. Slice it, dice it, drop it in your mouth, and enjoy. Just watch those portions. This is a rich and calorie dense treat, even if the ingredients lean hard to the healthier side.

articleBodyHTML:

Our world has accelerated so fast on so many different frontiers, that stress and disease have increased. The great news is that the body is miraculously strong and resilient and wants to function at its best. Your body wants to function at its best! That’s what it was designed to do. Nutrition and lifestyle choices have a profound impact on how fast the body can turn itself around from poor health to awesome health.
