articleSummaryHTML: Healing begins here today with a change in attitude and a new recipe: You will be glad you made this healing citrus sunshine smoothie!
seoTitle: Healing Citrus Sunshine Sunwarrior Smoothie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Healing begins here today with a change in attitude and a new recipe: You will be glad you made this healing citrus sunshine smoothie!
ingredients:
s:737:"
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 whole lemon without the skin (yes, the whole lemon!)
  • 1 teaspoon fresh ginger
  • ½ cup of fresh chopped cilantro (don’t knock it until you try it!)
  • ½ avocado
  • 1 serving Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla Protein Powder
  • 2 cups water
  • 1 cup ice

Optional

  • Add 1 cup berries of choice
";
directions:
Blend until divinely smooth and creamy. As you are blending, take five deep breaths, place your hand on your heart and repeat your affirmation. Deep breathing is the fastest way to alkalize the body and calm the mind. Smile, and tell yourself you love yourself. Keep practicing this every day until you believe it.

Gracious Living Smoothie Tip #1:

Use frozen bananas for creamier smoothies. Wait till the bananas are ripe, peel the skin off, break the bananas into pieces, and store in a Ziplock bag or glass container in the freezer for your smoothie use. You can also freeze apples (core and cut into chunks), pineapples, papayas, kiwis, oranges, peaches, grapes, watermelon, mangos, pears, etc. Cut everything yourself and then freeze them in portion sizes.

You can freeze your kale, spinach, and other dark green leafy vegetables. You can even freeze your herbs. Cilantro, basil, mint, and rosemary are my Gracious Living faves in smoothies (although you don’t need to freeze rosemary). Just peel them from the stem and store in a Ziplock bag. Use as needed.

You can freeze your lemons and limes. Peel them, cut into halves or quarters (depending on your blender’s ability to blend up big or small chunks), and put in your Ziplock bag. With organic lemons or limes only (otherwise there are chemicals all over the outside peel), I like to grate the lemon zest into my smoothies for an extra lemon taste that promotes healing. Believe it or not, there is extra nutrition in the peel!

You can even freeze your avocados! No need to waste avocados anymore that have gone from unripe to too ripe. Once soft and ready to eat, cut the avocado in half, take out the pit, spoon avocado out into individualized Ziplock bags, or in a container, and store in the freezer, Use as needed.

After the avocado is cut in half and pitted, use a spoon and go along the whole edge of the avocado to get the green meat out in a clean sweep, without a speck of avocado left behind.

These are just some of the recipes in the BRAND NEW Gracious Living Lifestyle Healing Series E-books with accompanying videos. My passion is helping others heal and prevent diseases, and live the life of their dreams, by eating as clean as possible. The cleaner we eat, the better our bodies and brains work, giving us clarity and focus to better handle life’s stresses and move in the direction of our limitless potential.

articleBodyHTML:
For a salad that travels anywhere you want to go, and that fills you with all the healthy refreshing ingredients you crave, this Mason jar salad is your new best friend.

While we’re still in summer, we tend to crave lighter and healthier food options. Mason jar salads are an awesome way to create your own masterpiece. You can use a whole array of fresh and local ingredients to make a delicious work of art. From experience, using plastic containers can lead to soggy vegetables and salad. More and more people are turning to mason jars as they are environmentally friendly and maintain the freshness of the salad. Canning jars have so many great uses from smoothies on the go to piling them high with veggies. Try to find a wider mouth mason jar so it’s easier for you to get all of the salad ingredients inside. Meal prepping on a Sunday is a great way to save time during the week. There is no need to vacuum seal the mason jars. Once you make your Mason jar salads and place a lid on them, they will last up to 5 days in the fridge.

{gvlzn9vb}

There’s a few rules of thumb when it comes to making a rocking Mason jar salad. The formula is simple:

1.) Dressing

2. Nonabsorbent vegetables

3.) Absorbent vegetables

4.) Carbohydrate

5.) Lettuce

6.) Protein
articleSummaryHTML: For a salad that travels anywhere you want to go, and that fills you with all the healthy refreshing ingredients you crave, this Mason jar salad is your new best friend.
seoTitle: Mason Jar Salad
seoDescription: For a salad that travels anywhere you want to go, and that fills you with all the healthy refreshing ingredients you crave, this Mason jar salad is your new best friend.
ingredients:
s:690:"

Dressing

  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 juice of lemon
  • 1/2 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
  • 1/8 tsp Himalayan salt

Salad

  • 1/2 cup baby tomatoes
  • 1 cup chopped red pepper
  • 1/2 cup radish
  • 1 cup blueberries
  • 1/2 cup brown rice
  • 1 cup mixed greens
  • 1 cup sprouts
";
directions:
Always place dressing on the bottom. This will ensure the rest of the salad will remain crisp and delicious. The next layer would be items that don’t soak up the salad dressing such as tomatoes, cauliflower, peas or peppers. The next layer would be softer veggies such as avocado, squash, onions, cabbage, broccoli, corn, celery, zucchini or cucumbers. Then add your grains such as quinoa, edamame, chickpeas or brown rice. Add your choice of lettuce such as arugula, spinach, spring mix or kale. Lastly, add any desired protein on top.

Now all that’s left is to shake the salad and eat away!

articleBodyHTML:
Become the creator of the party’s best dessert with this incredible berry crisp recipe! You can keep the fact that it’s healthy your secret.

Is there anything better than going to a party, plopping down a dessert, and watching as hordes of people attack the yummy goodness you created, while ignoring all the other goodies on the table? Well, the dessert itself might be a little better, but the feeling is still pretty darn good. If you’re looking for a staple dessert that you can take to any outing, picnic, or party, look no further. This summer berry crisp recipe from Talia of Party in My Plants {k9fvdzjg} is a definite crowd pleaser. Thankfully, this crisp is easy to make, and requires very few ingredients, which is obviously great news for you since you’ll be making it all the time!
articleSummaryHTML: Become the creator of the party’s best dessert with this incredible berry crisp recipe! You can keep the fact that it’s healthy your secret.
seoTitle: Summer Berry Crisp | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Become the creator of the party’s best dessert with this incredible berry crisp recipe! You can keep the fact that it’s healthy your secret.
ingredients:
s:565:"
  • 5–6 cups berries
  • ½ cup+ 2 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • 2 cups oats
  • 1 cup almond meal
  • 1 cup pecans
  • 1–2 scoops vanilla Sunwarrior protein
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 6 tablespoons coconut oil (room temperature)
";
directions:
Take off those rings, wash those hands, and massage that coconut oil right into the mixture.

Start by preheating your oven then dumping 5–6 cups of berries into a bowl. Which berries, you say? We say, whichever berries you love! Strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, heck… we don’t care. This is your dessert! Throw in a little coconut sugar, and give it a good mixin’. Spread your berries into a greased casserole dish, then set aside. To another bowl, dump in 2 cups of oats, 1 cup of almond meal, 1 cup of pecans, a scoop or two of  vanilla Sunwarrior protein, half a teaspoon of salt, and some coconut sugar. Mix those dry ingredients up, then add 6 tablespoons of room temperature coconut oil. Take off those rings, wash those hands, and massage that coconut oil right into the mixture.

Bring your berries back into the picture, and plop your mixture evenly onto the berries. Simple as that. Scoot this masterpiece right into your oven, and bake for 45–50 minutes, or until it smells fresh, and has a golden top, and you just can’t wait any longer. Remove, let it cool, and enjoy! If you so wish (and we think you should) top it off with a little dairy-free ice cream or coconut cream.

articleTitle: Banana & Carrot Cake Ice Cream Bars
articleBodyHTML:
There’s still heat enough in this summer to need a cool-off treat! Make that treat healthy with these banana carrot cake ice cream bars.

For a refreshing dessert combination, why not enjoy a banana and carrot cake ice-cream hybrid that is homespun. Top that off with a banana drizzle and you have a treat no one would want to miss out. Made with wholesome fruits and vegetables the way nature intended. Armed with Sunwarrior protein, you cannot go wrong with these sustainable and delicious post-workout treats. If you like ice-cream—and who doesn’t—then you must try this high-powered protein snack. Go ahead and give it a go!
articleSummaryHTML: There’s still heat enough in this summer to need a cool-off treat! Make that treat healthy with these banana carrot cake ice cream bars.
seoTitle: Banana & Carrot Cake Ice Cream Bars
seoDescription: There’s still heat enough in this summer to need a cool-off treat! Make that treat healthy with these banana carrot cake ice cream bars.
recipeName: Banana & Carrot Cake Ice Cream Bars
ingredients:
s:1145:"
  • 3 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 3 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend natural protein
  • 3 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Plus vanilla protein
  • 1–1/2 cup unsweetened coconut milk
  • 1 cup Thai coconut water
  • 2 medium frozen bananas
  • 1/2 cup unsweetened apple sauce
  • 1 cup sliced carrots
  • 3/4 gluten-free oatmeal
  • 1 tablespoon coconut butter
  • 1 tablespoon coconut flour
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Combine all ingredients (except 1/2 cup unsweetened coconut milk, 1/2 cup applesauce and 1 sliced medium banana) in a large bowl and mash it all up.

2. Once combined and smooth, put large bowl in the refrigerator to chill.

3. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

3. Pour the mix in ice-cream molds and place molds in the freezer to freeze overnight.

4. On the next day, take out molds and remove frozen ice-cream bars.

5. Drizzle your banana drizzle on the flat side of each bar and return to freezer to freeze about 4 hours.

6. Once firm, take out and serve on dish and enjoy.

Drink sunshine in a glass with this Sunwarrior citrus smoothie!

Itadakimasu! ~ Enjoy!

Have you ever had super, natural frozen green protein smoothies? Today, Talia of Party in My Plants shows you how to turn those super, natural green protein smoothies into super, natural frozen green smoothie popsicles. These are the kind of healthy treats that you’ll want in your freezer at all times. So gear up your blender, and follow along. {94dkuxn7}

seoDescription: You know that green smoothies are supernatural, right? They’re super tasting, and they’re natural and become even more supernatural as frozen green smoothie popsicles!
ingredients:
s:244:"
  • 2 ½ cups chopped banana
  • 2 ½ cups Spinach
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • 2 tablespoons water.
";
directions:
Begin by dumping chopped banana into your blender. Add in spinach, and Sunwarrior vanilla protein, and water. That’s it? You say? Yes, we say. That’s it! Blend those darn healthy ingredients into a creamy, smooth consistency. Then dump that creamy, dreamy perfection right into your popsicle molds. At least 3 hours later, pop these pops right onto your counter, let thaw for a few brief minutes, wiggle, remove, and enjoy. What’s so great about these pops, besides being probably the healthiest summer treat on the planet, is that they’re chlorophyll for the entire family. Now go and end your summer right. Keep these babies going on into the fall. And the winter. Heck, just keep these babies around all year long! You’ll be glad you did!

articleBodyHTML:
Basil is not just for the savory, but can be for the sweet as well. Don't believe us? Try it for yourself with these lemon basil bites!

Basil is one of the most distinctive and popular spices. There are more than sixty varieties of basil, each with its own subtle difference in fragrance and taste including Thai, cinnamon, lemon, and lime.

Here are a few basil basics for beginners:

  • Grow basil year-round in pots indoors by a sunny window.
  • Pinch back basil flowers as soon as they appear on a growing plant. The plant will become bushier, and you’ll have a greater harvest.
  • Basil leaves contain several health-benefiting essential oils thought to have anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties.
  • Chewing up a basil leaf and applying to an insect bite will help relieve the pain and itching.
  • Basil tea can be helpful in relieving nausea; it’s also good when used as a gargle when you have a sore throat.
  • When buying fresh basil, look for perky vibrant green leaves with no dark spots.

To store basil with stems still attached, place in a glass of water and cover with a plastic bag secured to the glass (a shower cap works well for this). Store at room temperature or in the refrigerator, changing the water each day. Basil should last about a week when stored this way. {6avqtgje}

Traditionally thought of for its starring role in savory dishes such as pesto and marinara sauce, as well as in Thai and Indian cuisine, this recipe shows the versatility of basil in these sweet, macaroon-like treats. (While you can buy dried basil in the seasonings section of the grocery store, there is a considerable difference in flavor between the two forms of the herb, and dried is not recommended in this recipe.)
articleSummaryHTML: Basil is not just for the savory, but can be for the sweet as well. Don't believe us? Try it for yourself with these lemon basil bites!
seoTitle: Lemon Basil Bites
seoDescription: Basil is not just for the savory, but can be for the sweet as well. Don't believe us? Try it for yourself with these lemon basil bites!
ingredients:
s:600:"

 

  • 1 cup almond flour
  • 1/4 cup coconut butter, softened
  • Pinch unrefined salt
  • 3 tablespoons  lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon   lemon zest
  • 1/4 cup coconut nectar
  • 1/3 cup fresh basil, stems removed
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 1/4 cups shredded coconut, unsweetened
";
directions:
Place almond flour, coconut butter, and salt in a food processor fitted with the S blade, and process until well-combined.

Add lemon juice, lemon zest, coconut nectar, basil, and vanilla and process again.

Add shredded coconut and pulse until the mixture holds together. Press firmly into a silicone mini brownie pan. Refrigerate briefly to set up before removing from pan.

Feeling a craving for a spoonful of happiness? This cacao and coconut is everything you want in a spread!

s:748:"

Store in a jar in the fridge. The cacao and coconut spread will keep for a few weeks.

Snack, Sweet!

articleBodyHTML:
For burns, cuts, skin, muscle cramps, and more this coconut healing balm has all the benefits you need and is easy to make for yourself!

Raw, organic coconut oil and raw, organic honey are two things that are a must in my remedy cabinet. They are used for smoothies, for facials, for burns, cuts, and pretty much anything!

Coconut oil is a miracle oil and can be used for pretty much anything: dry hair, moisturizer, as a shaving lotion, for cooking, for coffee, for smoothies, and of course for skin application. Coconut oil is well known for its anti-bacterial and anti- inflammatory benefits which helps to reduce inflammation, reduce scar tissue, heal burns and can be used internally to aid digestion and any viral infection.

Egyptians and Greeks have used honey, on the other hand, for thousands of years for baths, food and for healing burns. As found in research, over 100 superficial burn injuries, honey has many uses:

“A total of 104 cases of superficial burn injury were studied to assess the efficiency of honey as a dressing in comparison with silver sulfadiazine gauze dressing. In the 52 patients treated with honey, 91 percent of wounds were rendered sterile within 7 days. In the 52 patients treated with silver sulfadiazine, 7 percent showed control of infection within 7 days. Healthy granulation tissue was observed earlier in patients treated with honey (mean 7.4 versus 13.4 days). Of the wounds treated with honey, 87 percent healed within 15 days as against 10 per cent in the control group. Relief of pain, a lower incidence of hypertrophic scar and post-burn contracture, low cost and easy availability make honey an ideal dressing in the treatment of burns.”

Honey aids in increased cell generation by protecting the wound from external foreign particles and giving the skin a good layer of protection. Due its high nutrient quantity, it provides one with essentials vitamins and minerals that escalates the healing process. For our vegan friends, you may replace the honey ingredient with coconut nectar in this recipe, but you will lose some of the anti-inflammatory and immune boosting healing properties.
articleSummaryHTML: For burns, cuts, skin, muscle cramps, and more this coconut healing balm has all the benefits you need and is easy to make for yourself!
seoTitle: Coconut Honey Healing Balm
seoDescription: For burns, cuts, skin, muscle cramps, and more this coconut healing balm has all the benefits you need and is easy to make for yourself!
ingredients:
s:316:"
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil or coconut butter
  • 1 tablespoon honey
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 drop lavender oil
  • 1 tablespoon turmeric (optional)
";
directions:
1. Place the coconut oil in a small cup and let it float in a pan of warm water
  2. Once the coconut oil melts, add the remaining ingredients and give it a quick whisk
  3. Transfer the ingredients to a small box of your choice and let it sit.
  4. You can store in the refrigerator for longer usage.

How to apply?

  • If it is a wound, clean the wound thoroughly
  • Then slowly apply the balm and let it soak it up before covering it up if needed
  • If it is used for inflammation or any other beauty purpose, you can apply it and let it be for about 20 minutes. Then rinse your face with warm water.

articleBodyHTML:
Need a snack but want something not processed and not unhealthy? You’ve gotta try the snack of champions: fruit leather!

When your kids run out the door or come home, make sure you always have a healthy snack to send with them or awaiting them. When I was growing up, I loved anything that was chewy, sweet, and colorful. My favorite snack was fruit roll ups. Sadly, as many of you have read over the years, companies label children's snacks as natural but then fill those snacks with processed sugars, preservatives, and additives. Fruit snacks from the supermarket can also get costly, so why not make your own at home? All you need is one base ingredient, fruit!

So what exactly is fruit leather you ask? Well, fruit leather is a natural, sweet treat that uses fresh or frozen fruit and vegetables by pureeing them and then dehydrating them. You can make your own delicious fruit leather strips at home with seasonal and local ingredients. {oehzeu6v}

You can even hide the healthy ingredients in the mixture that your kids would be reluctant to eat such as beets, sweet potatoes, and spinach. Sometimes, I add chia seeds to my fruit leathers. If your kids don't have any issues with texture, then throw in a tablespoon or two. Chia seeds are high in fiber, protein, and essential fats. This is a wonderful superfood to give your children for their health and development.

These fruit roll-ups can be made ahead of time and placed in an airtight container in the fridge. They can last up to two weeks (if the kids don’t eat them all before then!). There are so many variations you can do.
articleSummaryHTML: Need a snack but want something not processed and not unhealthy? You’ve gotta try the snack of champions: fruit leather!
seoTitle: Fruit Leather: Snack of Champions
seoDescription: Need a snack but want something not processed and not unhealthy? You’ve gotta try the snack of champions: fruit leather!
ingredients:
s:222:"
  • 1 cup blueberries
  • 1 cup strawberries
  • 1 teaspoon white chia seeds
  • Handful spinach
";
directions:
1.) Blend your fruits and vegetables into a puree.

2.) Spread the fruit evenly on a Silpat mat (or parchment paper) on a baking tray. Don't let the mixture thin out too much or it will turn crispy in the oven.

3.) Place in the oven at 170 degrees for 6–8 hours or until the fruit leather is set.

4.) Let the fruit leather cool to room temperature and peel it off the baking tray. Cut into slices and store in airtight container for up to a month.

articleBodyHTML:
Lift weights and gain weight: muscle weight! Here’s where we learn that muscle building happens in the kitchen. So put your aprons on and bulk up!

As a weightlifter, I have spent almost a decade exploring how to most effectively build muscle. The most important lesson I’ve learned is, “muscle-building happens in the kitchen.” No amount of “pumping iron” will build the physique of your dreams if you are not giving equal attention to what goes into your body.

Over half of my time as a weightlifter has been spent juggling the restrictions of a gluten-free, grain-free, and most recently, vegan diet. The latest breakthrough in my weight gain saga is a recipe I like to call the Sunwarrior Protein Weight Gainer Smoothie.

Gaining weight and building muscle is often a daunting goal for those adhering to dietary restrictions. Whether gluten-free, grain-free, vegan, allergen-free, or all of the above in my case, the number one question I have received over the years is “How do you gain weight?”

While there are many answers to this question, the Sunwarrior Protein Weight Gainer Smoothie is my most recent solution. My need for this recipe arose not only from a desire to gain weight and fuel my workout recovery, but also from the need to increase my daily intake of fruits and vegetables.

The Sunwarrior Protein Weight Gainer Smoothie not only has a high caloric content for weight gain, but is also jam-packed with essential amino acids, vitamins, omega-3s, and other important nutrients. {z438wufu} This recipe is a huge timesaver, providing the caloric content of two meals quickly, easily, and deliciously. All of these benefits and every ingredient is vegan, gluten-free, grain-free, nut-free, and easily made 100% organic by choosing organic coconut milk and Sunbutter.

articleSummaryHTML: Lift weights and gain weight: muscle weight! Here’s where we learn that muscle building happens in the kitchen. So put your aprons on and bulk up!
seoTitle: The 1300-calorie Sunwarrior Protein Weight-Gainer Smoothie
seoDescription: Lift weights and gain weight: muscle weight! Here’s where we learn that muscle building happens in the kitchen. So put your aprons on and bulk up!
ingredients:
s:598:"

";
directions:
Simply add all of the ingredients to a large blender (I use a Ninja), blend for 10 seconds, and drink up!

articleBodyHTML:
Summer peaches are ready to harvest and we’ve got some ideas on how to mix those peaches into yumminess that will make you smile all through winter!

If you love peaches and you hate sharing, this is the treat for you! This personal peach parfait from Talia of Party in My Plants is as peachy keen a summer snack as possible. You’re gonna be packing a creamy dreamy coconut sweet cream between layers of perfectly ripe peaches (assuming you found a perfectly ripe peach), and then tossing in a crunchy layer of raw nutritious goodness.
articleSummaryHTML: Summer peaches are ready to harvest and we’ve got some ideas on how to mix those peaches into yumminess that will make you smile all through winter!
seoTitle: Personal Peach Parfait
seoDescription: Summer peaches are ready to harvest and we’ve got some ideas on how to mix those peaches into yumminess that will make you smile all through winter!
ingredients:
s:774:"

Coconut Cream (note: you have to keep your coconut milk in the fridge overnight so plan to make this recipe ahead of time)

  • 1 can coconut milk
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extra

Crunchy Date and Nut Filling

  • ½ cup almonds
  • ½ cup dates, pitted
  • ½ cup rolled oats
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon cardamom
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
";
directions:
Coconut Cream

  1. Place can of coconut milk in your fridge UPSIDE DOWN!!!
  2. Leave it there overnight. (At least 12 hours, please.)
  3. While you're at it, pop a ball jar in your freezer, too.
  4. After your coconut milk's been chilling for at least 12 hours, remove it from the fridge and gently open it. Scoop the creamy contents right into your cold ball jar.(DO NOT USE THE COCONUT WATER FROM THE JAR IN THIS RECIPE!!! It's great for a smoothie, but not this coconut cream!)
  5. Add in your maple syrup and vanilla and shake shake shake (with the lid on, of course) for about 2–3 minutes or until it becomes super creamy!

Crunchy Date and Nut Filling

Process all in a food processor!

To Assemble

  1. Chop 1 peach per parfait and set it aside.
  2. Then, into a jar or bowl, rotate layering all 3 components, in whichever order you see delish!
  3. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Peanut Butter Aztec Brownies with Ormus Greens
articleBodyHTML:
Warm and moist and filled with all the awesome: protein, greens, and yummy goodness! These brownies taste as great as they are good for you!

Sunwarrior Supergreens are grown in pristine, volcanic soil, which nurtures the organic, green superfoods, with trace minerals and plenty of chlorophyll. Cover your most important nutrition bases with superfoods like baobab, {k9fvdzjg} chia, flax, whole grain brown rice, kelp, holy basil, guava, and coconut, to name just a few. Clean protein, the best gluten free carbohydrates from, healthy fats, minerals, fiber, natural vitamins, enzymes, and probiotics, they all come together in Sunwarrior Aztec Chocolate illuminate.
articleSummaryHTML: Warm and moist and filled with all the awesome: protein, greens, and yummy goodness! These brownies taste as great as they are good for you!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter Aztec Brownies with Ormus Greens | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Warm and moist and filled with all the awesome: protein, greens, and yummy goodness! These brownies taste as great as they are good for you!
recipeName: Peanut Butter Aztec Brownies with Ormus Greens
ingredients:
s:687:"
  • 2 cups peanut butter
  • 1 egg or flax egg
  • 1 cup applesauce
  • 1/8 cup Sunwarrior Aztec Chocolate Protein
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Ormus Greens, I used peppermint
  • 2 bars any organic dark chocolate roughly broken (or chocolate chips, but they melt into the batter while the bigger chunks make a better bite.)
";
directions:
1. Mix together all the ingredients except the dark chocolate into a bowl
  2. Stir 2 bars roughly broken, organic, dark chocolate into batter
  3. Spread into a 13X9 baking dish. Bake at 325 for approximately 25–30 minutes until firm.
  4. Feel free to add in chopped walnuts, coconut.

YUMMMMMM

Dark Chocolate Pancakes! Doesn’t that just sound fantastic? These steamy, dark, decadent beauties are begging you to whip them up for breakfast, brunch, or even brinner.

These dark chocolate pancakes truly are a work of art and the best way to surprise your loved one with a special meal in bed, just so you know. And you can make them even healthier and chocolaty-er with a scoop of Sunwarrior protein!
articleSummaryHTML: Dark Chocolate Pancakes! Doesn’t that just sound fantastic? These steamy, dark, decadent beauties are begging you to whip them up for breakfast, brunch, or even brinner.
seoTitle: Vegan Dark Chocolate Pancakes
seoDescription: Dark Chocolate Pancakes! Doesn’t that just sound fantastic? These steamy, dark, decadent beauties are begging you to whip them up for breakfast, brunch, or even brinner.
ingredients:
s:670:"
  • ½ cup gluten-free flour
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 3 tablespoon cocoa
  • ½ tablespoon baking powder
  • Pinch salt
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • Toppings of choice
  • Optional: 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior protein powder
";
directions:
Start these off by combining 1/2 cup flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, 3 tablespoons of cacao powder (or cocoa), 1/2 tablespoon baking powder, a pinch of salt, and optional protein powder. Mix those together before adding your wet ingredients. Then you’ll pour in 1/2 cup almond milk, 1 tablespoon coconut oil, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Whisk slowly until smooth. Melt a dollop of coconut oil on a skillet over medium-high heat. Pour out your pancakes using your chocolatey batter. Cook each side, flipping carefully, until they are browned and beautiful.

We topped them with maple, blueberries, and shredded coconut, but you don’t have to follow our lead when it comes to toppings. Drizzle on your favorite syrups, top with fruit, smear on peanut butter, or eat them with your hands. We recommend trying these with peanut butter (or your favorite nut butter) and bananas. Blackberry syrup would work well with the chocolate too. The options are endless and all up to you. Enjoy them however you wish.

articleTitle: BooBerry FroYo! A Frightfully Good Frozen Yogurt!
articleBodyHTML:
Frozen yogurt is a great way to make Halloween spooky awesome without the scare of the unhealthy! Keep Halloween Healthy for Kids (and Parents!)

It’s coming. It’s unavoidable. It’s Halloween! And it’s scary but not because of the costumes. It’s scary because your kids get hopped up on ten pounds of refined sugar and then morph into monsters of a different variety. And blowing your own healthy diet is pretty scary, too.

Look, I’m not that mom. I’m not going to pass out apples on Halloween night and chance getting my house TP’d as a consequence. But I’m also not going to encourage my kids to gorge themselves on sweets that will not only change their personalities in a negative way but will also make them sick, suppress their immune systems, and lead to tooth decay or obesity. {z438wufu}

My children’s pediatrician said his largest spike in office visits occurs the week or two following Halloween because all that sugar leads to a drop in immunity. I did a little research on this issue, and sure enough, refined sugar does not do a body good in terms of the body’s ability to prevent and fight infection. In fact, consuming processed white sugar can reduce the body’s ability to fight germs by 40%. That’s a big YIKES for moms! The last thing we need is for our little ones to come down with a whopper of a cold. Granted, sometimes catching a cold is unavoidable. But shouldn’t we try to stack the cards in our kids’ favor as often as possible?

So here’s the trick (in the form of a treat).

While you might not be able to eliminate the massive wave of candy coming your way during the holidays, you can focus on adding in healthy sweets that keep your family nourished and satisfied. That way, they’ll have less room for the bad stuff. And the bonus is that this works for parents, too!

Don’t tell me you’ve never been tempted to eat Halloween candy for breakfast. It’s ok. I’m not judging. I’ve been there. But now you can make simple, fast, and easy desserts that are packed with nutrition and keep you full for hours. And they’re not just for dessert! Enjoy this raw vegan BooBerry FroYo any time of day. I love the blend of healthy fruit carbs with filling plant-based protein, which helps to tell our brains that we are full.

This BooBerry FroYo is one of the simplest ways for you to serve up some Sunwarrior. All you have to do is get creative with the presentation, and you’re well on your way to winning over your kids’ imaginations. Even better? Let them help!

The more you get kids involved in preparing their own foods, the more you give them a sense of control and choice. I know my kids love that. Sometimes I just leave out platters of fresh fruits and vegetables on the kitchen table and let them choose what they like, combining it however they choose to. The same theory applies with this recipe. You can set out little bowls filled with cacao nibs, ground pistachios, mini celery sticks, banana slices, and blueberries to let them design all sorts of creatures!

The holidays can be healthy AND fun.

Enjoy this recipe! And don’t ever fear the effects of Halloween again.
articleSummaryHTML: Frozen yogurt is a great way to make Halloween spooky awesome without the scare of the unhealthy! Keep Halloween Healthy for Kids (and Parents!)
seoTitle: BooBerry FroYo! A Frightfully Frozen Yogurt! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Frozen yogurt is a great way to make Halloween spooky awesome without the scare of the unhealthy! Keep Halloween Healthy for Kids (and Parents!)
recipeName: BooBerry FroYo! A Frightfully Good Frozen Yogurt!
ingredients:
s:720:"
  • 3 cups frozen banana
  • 2 cups frozen blueberries
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla
  • ¼ cup raw cacao nibs
  • ¼ cup raw pistachios

Optional Ingredients for Decorations:

  • ¼ cup ground raw pistachio
  • ¼ cup raw cacao nibs
  • ¼ cup sliced banana
  • ¼ cup fresh blueberries
";
directions:
Blend bananas, blueberries, and Sunwarrior protein until a smooth ice cream texture is achieved. Pulse in cacao nibs and pistachios for a chunky, crunchy consistency. Spoon into cups and decorate however you wish!

articleBodyHTML:
Cool off after a work out with a light refreshing meal! Avocado cucumber soup totally hits the spot!

During the summer months, we tend to eat a lot lighter and crave fresh tasting foods. One of my go to summer favorites is cold soup. What better way to cool off on a hot summer day than a cold soup. But cooling off is not just a summertime activity. After a good workout, a cool meal can be a refreshing reward! This gorgeous and velvety soup has no cream and no dairy, making it perfect for vegans. This soup is bursting with farm fresh flavors from the beautiful and gentle taste of the dill, parsley, and basil. The avocado and tahini add a richness to the soup while the cucumber adds hydration. The best part is that this recipe is insanely easy to make and only takes a few ingredients.

Cucumbers are made up of almost 95 percent of water. I love eating them because they keep me feeling hydrated and fresh. Cucumbers work wonders on oral health, as they are able to fight odor-causing bacteria in your mouth. They can also help in digestive health by raising our stomachs PH levels which tend to be very acidic most of the time. Cucumbers can also help maintain a healthy weight in the body as they contain only 16 calories per cup! They slow digestion in the body due to their fiber content, so it’s a great healthy snack which will keep you feeling full.

We add a touch of tahini to give this soup its extra “oomph” and flavor. Being rich in minerals and calcium, tahini has many great health benefits. Tahini is also rich in healthy fats contributing to healthy skin and glow.

This soup can be made the night before and placed in the fridge. It will keep around 2–3 days in an airtight container.

seoTitle: Avocado & Cucumber Soup
seoDescription: Cool off after a work out with a light refreshing meal! Avocado cucumber soup totally hits the spot!
ingredients:
s:424:"
  • 5 cucumbers, peeled and sliced
  • 5 limes, juiced
  • 1 tablespoon tahini
  • ½ avocado, pitted
  • 1 cup dill
  • 1 cup basil
  • 1 cup parsley
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions: Place all ingredients in a high-speed blender. Blend for 2–3 minutes. Remove from blender and place in an airtight container in the fridge or serve immediately.

articleBodyHTML:
Mango and lime together create a powerhouse dessert of vitamins, minerals, and great taste!

Mango is known as the king of the fruits and is also one of the most widely consumed fruits in the world. Mangos have a sweet, creamy taste and boast over twenty vitamins and minerals.

The best way to choose a mango at the store is by its firmness as opposed to selecting based on color. Avoid fruits with an abundance of black freckles on the skin. Push gently against the skin with your thumb. It's ready when it gives slightly to gentle pressure; it may also have a fruity aroma on the stem end. To ripen a mango, keep it at room temperature so it can become not only softer but also sweeter. To accelerate the ripening process, place it in a brown paper bag for a few days.

Refrigerate ripe mangos. When uncut, they can keep for about 3–5 days. One cup of mangos has about 100 calories.

While there are many benefits of eating mango, a small percentage of people are known to suffer from mango allergy symptoms. This is due to the presence of the irritant urushiol in mango sap and peel. Mango allergies commonly result in itching and burning around the mouth, with swelling of lips. One way to help prevent a mango allergy reaction is to wash the area of your body with soap and water which has come into contact with mango sap.
articleSummaryHTML: Mango and lime together create a powerhouse dessert of vitamins, minerals, and great taste!
seoTitle: Mango Lime Pudding
seoDescription: Mango and lime together create a powerhouse dessert of vitamins, minerals, and great taste!
ingredients:
s:277:"
  • 1 ½ cups chopped mango flesh, or frozen mango chunks, thawed and drained
  • ½ cup dried mangoes, chopped and soaked for 10 minutes, drained
  • ½ teaspoon lime zest
  • Sprinkle cinnamon, to garnish (optional)
";
directions:
1. Drain dried mangoes.
  2. Place ingredients in a high-speed blender and process until smooth.
  3. Scoop into serving dish
  4. Sprinkle with cinnamon (if you’re using it) and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Dinner's ready! Dig in to stuffed bell peppers and prepare to have your family thank you!

I don’t know about you, but having a meal in the fridge is a lifesaver. Many times, activities keep dinner from getting done quickly, but with this stuffed peppers recipe, you can prepare it all a few days ahead and then assemble in a few minutes.

The bell peppers bring a wonderful flavor to this simple dish with the ever-helpful vitamin C. The bell peppers, zucchini, and tomatoes all are an excellent source of carotenoids (alpha-carotene, beta-carotene, lycopene, lutein, cryptoxanthin, and zeaxanthin) as well. The quinoa is a delicious protein to keep you fuller longer and has nutrients such as manganese and fiber.
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner's ready! Dig in to stuffed bell peppers and prepare to have your family thank you!
seoTitle: Stuffed Bell Peppers
seoDescription: Dinner's ready! Dig in to stuffed bell peppers and prepare to have your family thank you!
ingredients:
s:650:"
  • 6–8 bell peppers, any color
  • 1-tablespoon olive oil
  • Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
  • 1 medium onion, finely diced
  • 3 cloves garlic, chopped
  • 1 large zucchini, finely diced
  • 4 Roma tomatoes, seeded and finely diced
  • Red pepper flakes, as needed
  • 2 cups cooked quinoa
  • 2 cups grated cheese (regular or vegan)
";
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

About a half inch to an inch from the top, slice the tops of the peppers off. Cut around the stems and throw those away since you won’t be needing them. Cut up the remaining parts of the tops and set them aside for later. Scoop out the seeds, cleaning out the pepper as best you can. Stand the peppers upright in a baking dish big enough that they won’t fall over (no one wants peppers slouching on the job).

Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and chopped pepper tops and saute for 3 to 4 minutes. Add the zucchini, tomatoes, and garlic and saute another minute or two. Add salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (to taste) for seasoning. Let that all simmer for a minute or two then stir in the quinoa. Stir in half of the cheese, leaving the other half for the stuffing.

Fill the peppers with the quinoa mixture and top each with a sprinkle of the remaining cheese. Add a little water to the bottom of the baking dish. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and continue baking until the peppers are soft and the cheese is melted and lightly browned, another 15 to 20 minutes.

If preparing later, all ingredients can stay in the fridge for up to 3 days. Allow the mixture to cool and store rice mixture, peppers and extra cheese in a separate container. When you are ready to make dinner, place peppers cut side up in a baking dish big enough to keep them up right. Add rice mixture into peppers and top with cheese. And bake as directed above.

articleBodyHTML: The world is filled with amazing dips. Two of the best are hummus and guacamole, so we naturally thought maybe they could be combined into one dip to rule them all.
articleSummaryHTML: The world is filled with amazing dips. Two of the best are hummus and guacamole, so we naturally thought maybe they could be combined into one dip to rule them all.
seoTitle: Guacamole Hummus Recipe
seoDescription: The world is filled with amazing dips. Two of the best are hummus and guacamole, so we naturally thought maybe they could be combined into one dip to rule them all.
ingredients:
s:443:"
  • 2 avocados
  • 2 tomatoes (1 large), chopped
  • Half white onion, chopped
  • 1 can chickpeas
  • Juice from 1–2 limes
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt to taste
  • Optional: 1/4 cup tahini
";
directions:
Yes! Definitely one dip to rule them all, but not in a dark wizardy way. There’s nothing evil about this guacamole hummus, except how fast it will disappear.

Start with a ripe avocado. Slice it open and remove the seed (seeds never work well in the final dip). Scoop the soft, buttery avocado into a bowl and discard the skins (skins also don’t belong in this goodness). Dice two tomatoes to join the avocado in the bowl. We’re using roma, which hold up well to dicing, but you can choose your favorite tomato varieties. Yellow pear tomatoes, black krim, brandywine, amana orange, or whatever you have will do nicely, too. Dice half an onion. It joins the rest. Mash and stir away. {pvphgvt0}

Now for the hummus part, you’ll mash up a can of organic chickpeas with optional tahini. Add that to the guac and smoosh them together. Season your guacahummus deliciousness with fresh lime juice, salt, and pepper. You can up the spice level with some hot sauce or cayenne powder right about now, too. Garlic is also a nice touch.

Spoon your hybrid creation into a bowl next to chips or veggies and dip into the thick, tasty dip of your dreams. Enjoy. That is all.

articleBodyHTML:
You might not get a coach out of these pumpkins, but a protein frappe is still pretty magical, and it tastes amazing!

As autumn rolls around, the flavors are as important as the season: cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, apples, and pumpkins. Changing of leaves and wrapping ourselves in scarves and warmer jackets are just the beginning of this gorgeous and crisp season. Pumpkins are everywhere, and Thanksgiving is around the corner, so why not utilize these magical root vegetables to the best of our ability? There are so many local farms where you can pick your own pumpkins, sit on hay rides, and enjoy the crisp air. This is the perfect way to utilize in-season vegetables and fruits by keeping them local. This pumpkin protein shake is not only super delicious, but it's also packed full of nutrients and protein to keep you energized and happy the entire day.

For this recipe, we use organic canned pumpkin. You can find this at your local health food store. This recipe calls for lucuma powder which adds a delicious caramel and nutty flavor to desserts and drinks. It is made out of the lucuma fruit which is dehydrated into a powder. It contains many elements that aids in overall health such as calcium, magnesium, and potassium. Lucuma is also a great source of iron which can result in increased energy levels. One of the best things about lucuma is that it adds sweetness to any dessert without increasing your blood sugar levels. {94dkuxn7}

Pumpkin is an excellent source of dietary fiber, which will keep you fuller longer. They are also high in beta carotene which helps keeps your eyes healthy and strong. Pumpkin works as an amazing post workout food, boosting your potassium better than bananas.

This recipe is perfect for anyone wanting a quick pumpkin and spice filled drink post-workout, midday, or early morning. This drink is gluten free, vegan, high protein, and refined sugar-free. Can fall get any better?
articleSummaryHTML: You might not get a coach out of these pumpkins, but a protein frappe is still pretty magical, and it tastes amazing!
seoTitle: Pumpkin Protein Frappe | Sunwarrior Recipe
seoDescription: You might not get a coach out of these pumpkins, but a protein frappe is still pretty magical, and it tastes amazing!
ingredients:
s:478:"
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla Classic Plus protein
  • ¾ cup unsweetened almond or soy milk
  • 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice mix
  • 1 tablespoon lucuma powder
  • ½ cup pumpkin puree
  • 1 cup ice

Optional toppings: Coconut whip cream, nuts, seeds, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, granola

";
directions:
Place all ingredients in a high-speed blender. Blend until smooth and top with coconut whip cream, nuts, seeds, cinnamon or nutmeg.

Enjoy all the autumn-y, pumpkin-y, protein-y goodness!

articleTitle: No Churn Dairy-Free Pistachio Ice Cream
articleBodyHTML:
You have heard of green juice and green smoothies, but who has ever heard of getting your greens from ICE CREAM? Inconceivable! Yet totally awesome!

It’s true! This pistachio ice cream recipe contains one full serving of leafy greens. We’ll wait while your mind explodes.

The leafy greens not only help achieve that iconic green color of pistachio ice cream, but they put a healthy spin on dessert. So, now you don’t have to feel any guilt whatsoever in having a few (or more!) scoops.

Leafy greens would be your spinach, arugula, Swiss chard, and kale. Those green leaves give quite the punch of vitamins and minerals!

This group of vegetables contains vitamins, minerals, and carotenoids that act as antioxidants. Antioxidants help remove free radicals from the body before they have a chance to become harmful.

Green leafy veggies contain vitamins C and K and minerals iron and calcium. Dark green leafy vegetables are also an amazing source of fiber and folate. To absorb the carotenoids and vitamin K, the body needs a small amount of dietary fat to go with the dark green leaves. This is achieved with the almond butter in the ice cream recipe.

This ice cream recipe is also free of coconut, banana, and cashew, which dominate the dairy free ice cream recipes that are out there. It also doesn’t require an ice cream maker! If you have any doubt, this No Churn Dairy-Free Pistachio Ice Cream is still rich, creamy, and naturally sweetened, thanks to the almond butter and dates.

Almond butter is a great source of healthy fat. It’s made mostly of unsaturated fatty acids, which help improve blood cholesterol levels. Fats are also a great energy source. Almond butter is another fabulous source of vitamins and minerals, such as vitamin E and magnesium.

Make this in the morning, and by the time dessert rolls around, you will have a beautiful, decadently rich, sweet treat waiting for you. Share it with a friend for a night in, or scoop it on a cone for the kids. Vegetables + Dessert = Genius!
articleSummaryHTML: You have heard of green juice and green smoothies, but who has ever heard of getting your greens from ICE CREAM? Inconceivable! Yet totally awesome!
seoTitle: No Churn Dairy-Free Pistachio Ice Cream | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: You have heard of green juice and green smoothies, but who has ever heard of getting your greens from ICE CREAM? Inconceivable! Yet totally awesome!
recipeName: No Churn Dairy-Free Pistachio Ice Cream
ingredients:
s:503:"
  • 1/3 cup soaked pistachios
  • 1/3–1/2 cup almond milk
  • 1/3 cup creamy almond butter
  • 1/3 cup soft pitted dates (you may need to soak them if they are dry)
  • Small handful of frozen arugula (could also use spinach or kale)**
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
  • 1 tablespoon almond paste

Optional:

  • Top with sliced almonds or crushed pistachios
";
directions:
1. Puree the dates in a blender or food processor until a paste forms.
  2. Combine rest of ingredients into blender or food processor with the date paste until everything is fully incorporated.
  3. Pour the ice cream mixture into a freezer-safe container lined with parchment paper.
  4. Cover and chill for at least five hours. At the five hour mark, it will be firm enough to serve. However, the longer you leave it in the freezer, the firmer it will get.
  5. Scoop and enjoy!

**Note** I’ve tried this recipe with fresh greens too. The color turns out the same, but you can taste the bitterness from the greens much more with the fresh versus the frozen. My recommendation is to use frozen greens.

articleBodyHTML:
During pumpkin season, it's the perfect time to take your pumpkin prowess to a whole new level! This coconut pumpkin pie fluff is just the level!

Not sure if it was Sunday afternoon boredom, a longing to escape unpleasant tasks, or my body’s innate wisdom for an antioxidant infusion. But I made a trek to the kitchen, took a quick inventory of the pantry items on hand that could be transformed into something better, and this dish was my result. A delish creamy concoction of comforting flavors that dance on the taste buds in provocative whispers and layers.

We all know pumpkin plays really well with the warming spices: ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg. Toss in vanilla and orange and voila, taste sensations! Caramel sweetness comes from rich unsweetened apple butter (not applesauce,) or pureed, rehydrated Medjool dates work well, too. My fave all the way is the apple butter, so it’s the one featured here. There are many health benefits to this recipe: chia delivers a great dose of omega 3 essential fatty acids as well as protein, calcium, and iron. Pumpkin is a great prebiotic, which feeds probiotics, the healthy bacteria we hear about all the time. The spices are anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, and antifungal.

Ok, health benefits are all fine and dandy, but taste matters most. Make this, and I trust you will agree. The recipe is easily doubled given I only was using half cans. Make a double batch and freeze in portion-sizes. Outside of a little texture change, it will keep in the freezer a week or two (depending on your freezer and how often it’s opened and closed).
articleSummaryHTML: During pumpkin season, it's the perfect time to take your pumpkin prowess to a whole new level! This coconut pumpkin pie fluff is just the level!
seoTitle: Coconut Pumpkin Pie Fluff
seoDescription: During pumpkin season, it's the perfect time to take your pumpkin prowess to a whole new level! This coconut pumpkin pie fluff is just the level!
ingredients:
s:1090:"
  • ½ can organic coconut milk – full fat
  • ½ can organic pumpkin puree
  • 2 tablespoons organic apple butter
  • 1 organic orange, zested
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 1 inch fresh ginger, grated or minced
  • 2 tablespoons chia seeds
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, the real thing
  • ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
  • ¼ teaspoon grated nutmeg
  • Pinch sea salt

Garnish:

Mulberries, granola, coconut flakes, pecans, or walnuts as desired

Optional:

Add some great protein power with 1–2 servings Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein

";
directions:
Blast everything in a high-speed blender until you have a fabulous whipped creamy fluff. Taste and adjust seasoning and sweetness as desired.

Chill at least 30 minutes before serving then sprinkle with orange zest, enjoy as is or top with additional cinnamon and something crunchy such as a few mulberries, coconut, crunchy granola or chopped nuts or seeds. Pecans would heighten the buttery-ness of this creation.

No matter how you choose to serve this, I trust you will love this desserts simplicity and the sensational taste. The one caveat is not to overeat, for the creamy richness of this makes for a potent lure that just may call you back for seconds.

articleTitle: Cinnamon Raisin PB Cookies with White Chocolate Chips
articleBodyHTML: Get your happiness on with these cinnamon raisin and peanut butter cookies! Add white chocolate chips, and it’s a party in your mouth!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your happiness on with these cinnamon raisin and peanut butter cookies! Add white chocolate chips, and it’s a party in your mouth!
seoTitle: Cinnamon Raisin Cookies With White Chocolate | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Get your happiness on with these cinnamon raisin and peanut butter cookies! Add white chocolate chips, and it’s a party in your mouth!
recipeName: Cinnamon Raisin PB Cookies with White Chocolate Chips
ingredients:
s:932:"
  • 1 ½ cups peanut butter (I used PB & Company, cinnamon raisin)
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • 2 cups coconut sugar
  • 6 tablespoons almond or coconut milk
  • 1 tablespoon molasses
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla
  • 2 eggs (substitute with flax: whisk together 1 teaspoon of flax seed powder with 1/4 cup of water for each egg to be replaced. Or pureed fruit 1/4 cup for each egg. Increase leavening by 25–50%. Bake items slightly longer, if necessary.)
  • ½ tablespoon salt
  • ½ tablespoon baking soda
  • 4 cups flour
  • 12 oz. chocolate chips (I used white chocolate chips)
";
directions:
Mix all ingredients except the flour and chocolate chips until creamy. Add the flour one cup at a time until blended. Stir in the chips. Using a cookie scoop drop onto a cookie sheet and flatten with a fork in a # pattern. If you dip the fork in warm water it will help to not stick to the fork; also I sprinkled mine with cinnamon sugar, and the water helps it to stick.

Bake at 375 degrees for 9–10 min. I like to fill up a whole cookie sheet and then freeze the cookies, once frozen I throw into a Ziploc baggie, that way I can pull out how many I want to bake and pop them in the oven.

Makes about 6 dozen. {myriausz}

Sooo good dipped in cold milk. MMMMMM

articleBodyHTML:
You may just drool, Pavlovian-style, as soon as someone mentions Mediterranean or sweet potatoes. These are deliciously drool-worthy.

When you think of the Mediterranean, one of the first things that comes to mind is sweet potatoes. No? Did we get that wrong? Well, this recipe might change that from now on. {z438wufu}
articleSummaryHTML: You may just drool, Pavlovian-style, as soon as someone mentions Mediterranean or sweet potatoes. These are deliciously drool-worthy.
seoTitle: Mediterranean Sweet Potatoes | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: You may just drool, Pavlovian-style, as soon as someone mentions Mediterranean or sweet potatoes. These are deliciously drool-worthy.
ingredients:
s:678:"
  • 2 large sweet potatoes
  • 1 can garbanzo beans
  • ½ teaspoon coriander
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon paprika
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • Drizzle olive oil’
  • Dash sea salt
  • Dash rosemary
  • 2 tablespoons tahini

Optional

  • Cherry tomatoes, basil, oregano
";
directions:
Start by washing your sweet potatoes well. You’ll be keeping the skin on, so you want them fresh and clean. Rinse a can of organic garbanzo beans and place them in a bowl. Coriander, cinnamon, paprika, and cumin get sprinkled on those beans with a good drizzle of olive oil. Stir to coat all those beans with goodness. Halve your orangey taters and place them on a cookie sheet. Spoon out the seasoned beans next to your sweet potatoes. You could spice up this dish a little extra here by sprinkling a dash of sea salt and rosemary on the potatoes before they go in the oven. Bake everything for 40 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit.

Pull out the cookie sheet and enjoy the savory scents. Plate your taters. Smoosh down the centers of yon taters with a fork to form a hollow space. Spoon in the beans. Add tahini, halved cherry tomatoes, and parsley. You could also use other types of tomatoes and other herbs, like basil or oregano. Enjoy! Drool away.

articleBodyHTML:
Put the jingle back in your pocketbook by doing it yourself! Homemade coconut milk is the easy, healthy way to savings!

I like to save money on groceries, and a few different ways I do that is buy food that is on sale and make my own food such as granola, energy bars, and recently, coconut milk! Coconut milk, almond milk, soymilk, almond & coconut milk, cashew milk, etc. can all be pretty pricey. I usually get the unsweetened almond & coconut milk when I need milk. However, recently I wondered about making my own coconut milk. Most of the coconut and almond milks I buy are pretty healthy because there aren’t too many ingredients and they are unsweetened. However, I figured making my own coconut milk would not only be cheaper but would contain fewer ingredients. Have you found a coconut milk at the grocery store with only 3 ingredients?

Well, I’m giving you a recipe to make your own 3-ingredient coconut milk. That’s right. Only 3 ingredients! Can of coconut milk, water, and agave (or your favorite sweetener). When you make it, you can use whatever sweetener you would prefer. I usually use honey or agave when I bake and cook, and for this recipe, I decided to use agave since it’s less viscous and blends together better than honey. {6avqtgje}

Need another reason to make your own coconut milk?

Coconut milk is full of potassium, manganese, phosphorus, magnesium, iron, and copper. Coconut milk also contains medium chain fatty acids which help give the body energy.

Health Benefits of Coconut Milk

  1. Improves Heart Health by Lowering Blood Pressure and Cholesterol
  2. Builds Muscle and Helps Lose Fat 
  3. Provides Electrolytes and Prevents Fatigue
  4. Helps Lose Weight
  5. Improves Digestion and Relieves Constipation
  6. Manages Blood Sugar and Controls Diabetes
  7. Helps Prevent Anemia
  8. Prevents Joint Inflammation and Arthritis
  9. Prevents Ulcers

Coconut milk is good for everyone because it is completely free from nuts, grains, dairy, and soy; plus it’s vegan and good for plant-based eaters!
articleSummaryHTML: Put the jingle back in your pocketbook by doing it yourself! Homemade coconut milk is the easy, healthy way to savings!
seoTitle: Homemade Coconut Milk
seoDescription: Put the jingle back in your pocketbook by doing it yourself! Homemade coconut milk is the easy, healthy way to savings!
ingredients:
s:199:"
  • 1 can of coconut milk
  • 1 cup water
  • 2 tablespoons agave nectar (or your favorite sweetener)
";
directions:
Put all ingredients into a blender and blend for 1 minute. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before enjoying. Before each use, mix it up a little in case any separation occurs.

Then enjoy! Your body will thank you!

articleBodyHTML:
Give me a cup of autumn! Here is a pumpkin pie smoothie that is so good, it’s like drinking up the whole season.

It’s that time of the year- where the air is filled with aromatic spices, autumn leaves falling in the yellow-orange shades everywhere, and people are in the spirit buying their favorite Halloween costume and getting ready for the favorite season. What if I tell you, you can have this feeling in a cup? Everyone loves pie, and, of course, this season calls for the notoriously famous pumpkin Pie. This recipe is simple, super quick and absolutely delicious.

Benefits

  • Pumpkin is packed with essential vitamins and minerals. A small portion of pumpkin is packed with Vitamin B12, folate, magnesium and thiamin.
  • Pumpkin has been known to improve blood circulation and remove any clogs from the artery due to its anti- inflammatory properties
  • Due its high fiber content, it is the perfect ingredient to make you feel fuller, to improve your digestive state and keep your waistline in check
  • Containing good amounts of phosphorous, calcium and iron, pumpkin is known to improve bone density, reduce muscle spasms, helps in blood clotting and circulation.
  • Cinnamon is the perfect ingredient to reduce inflammation, reduce depression and helps in reducing blood pressure. A lot of people with cardiovascular are required to have cinnamon every morning for the same benefits.
  • Pecans are packed with essential energy, antioxidants, vitamins and minerals. A handful of these is a perfect combination of healthy fat, protein, carbohydrate and minerals.
  • Himalayan sea salt may have little to no iodine, but it’s packed with 84 minerals, making it the perfect add-on to help your body heal, detox and rejuvenate.
  • Coconut milk being a mono- saturated fat plays an important role in brain function, improve joint condition, reduces inflammation and acts as a natural anti-bacterial. A spoon of coconut oil a day can act as the perfect medicine to improve digestive health, skin, and hair.
articleSummaryHTML: Give me a cup of autumn! Here is a pumpkin pie smoothie that is so good, it’s like drinking up the whole season.
seoTitle: Pumpkin Pie Smoothie
seoDescription: Give me a cup of autumn! Here is a pumpkin pie smoothie that is so good, it’s like drinking up the whole season.
ingredients:
s:462:"

Smoothie

  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 frozen banana
  • ¼ cup pumpkin puree
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoon pecans
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Coconut Whip

  • ½ can coconut milk full cream
  • 1 tablespoon stevia powder
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Using a high-speed blender, blend all smoothie ingredients until smooth and creamy
  2. For the coconut whip, empty the ingredients in a bowl along with stevia and vanilla extract and give it a good whip until it becomes like a whipped topping foam.
  3. Pour the smoothie into a glass container and top it up with the coconut whip.

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
Dinner should be a place where tasty memories are made. We can help you start making your memories with this amazing stuffed acorn squash!

Pumpkins and all different sizes of squashes, falling leaves, and changing seasons mean our bodies are craving more hearty and filling dishes. Food in itself has a different personality that communicates with us on many different levels. It provides pleasure, nostalgia, and memories. This is the time of year where memories are made through familiar tastes and dishes that bring family together and fill our tummies during fall and thanksgiving. This dish is perfect if you have any vegetarians or vegans attending gathered dinners. This recipe is gluten free and vegan.

This dish is filling and will keep you full the entire day. We use brown rice and lentils to fill these delightful mini squashes. Top it with a fragrant pesto, and you have yourself a heart filled meal that will leave you wanting more. You can make a big batch of these little squashes and pop them in an airtight container. They will last 2–3 days in the fridge, so they’re a perfect leftover food.

Acorn squash is absolutely delicious. It has a delicious buttery soft consistency when roasted. This beautiful squash is transformed into a brand new dish when we add its filling. Unlike most squashes, you do not have to remove the skin. There are four different types of squashes that are popular during the fall season: butternut squash, spaghetti squash, sweet dumpling squash, and acorn squash. All of these squashes have incredible health properties. From boosting eyesight and helping to build and repair bones, to eliminating parasites in the body and boosting immunity. {9kucur9p}

Another great option for butternut squash is to make the sweeter version by slicing it in half, drizzling a touch of maple syrup, cardamom, and cinnamon. When it’s finished cooking, you have yourself a delicious and sweet treat that not only healthy but guilt free.
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner should be a place where tasty memories are made. We can help you start making your memories with this amazing stuffed acorn squash!
seoTitle: Stuffed Acorn Squash
seoDescription: Dinner should be a place where tasty memories are made. We can help you start making your memories with this amazing stuffed acorn squash!
ingredients:
s:678:"

Squash

  • 1 acorn squash
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt 

Rice and lentils

  • 1 package brown rice
  • 1 can soaked lentils
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 2 teaspoons coriander
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 2 tablespoons lime juice
  • 1/4 cup fresh pesto
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
  2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  3. Cut the squash in half and scoop out the center.
  4. Drizzle with olive oil and Himalayan salt.
  5. Cook for 40 minutes. 
  6. Cook rice and lentils. Add cumin, coriander, salt and lime juice to the cooked grains
  7. Once the acorn squash is done cooking, stuff with rice and lentil mixture. Top with pesto and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
If you think Halloween means chocolate and pumpkin, we happen to agree! Especially when it’s healthy! These cacao pumpkin squares take the trick out of Halloween treats!

Raw, vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free, wheat-free, soy-free, refined sugar-free, easy, delicious, and high in anti-inflammatory protein! The Sunwarrior protein powder lends itself really well to the crust, making it high in plant protein. {2qgi584q} The creamy, vegan pumpkin layer is decadent and super healthy without dairy. You are going to love this guilt-free, nourishing combo of chocolate and pumpkin!
articleSummaryHTML: If you think Halloween means chocolate and pumpkin, we happen to agree! Especially when it’s healthy! These cacao pumpkin squares take the trick out of Halloween treats!
seoTitle: Cacao Pumpkin Squares Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: If you think Halloween means chocolate and pumpkin, we happen to agree! Sunwarrior's cacao pumpkin squares take the trick out of Halloween treats!
ingredients:
s:776:"

Gluten-free Crust

  • 1 cup soaked, pitted dates
  • ½ cup Sunwarrior Classic Plus chocolate protein
  • 1 tablespoon raw, organic cacao powder
  • 2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

Creamy Pumpkin Layer

  • 1 ½ cups raw cashews
  • 1/3 cup yacon syrup
  • 1/3 cup steamed pumpkin (or canned, unsweetened pumpkin)
  • 1 teaspoon organic pumpkin spice
";
directions:
1. Soak the cashews in water for 1 hour. Discard the water. Line a pan or glass dish with parchment paper and set aside.
  2. Place the crust ingredients in a food processor. Pulse until it turns into a cookie dough texture.  Press this mixture evenly onto the bottom of pan or dish and place it in the freezer while you prepare the pumpkin filling.
  3. Place the pumpkin filling ingredients in your food processor and pulse until smooth. Pour the mixture over the cacao crust in the baking pan and spread it evenly. Freeze the dessert for a few hours.
  4. Cut into squares. Serve. Store in freezer.

articleBodyHTML:
Mangoes make everything taste good! And here is another smoothie trick to make your smoothies extra nutritious without compromising taste: mangoes!

Cut up white cabbage into small chunks and freeze them in a container or Ziploc bag. Add them to your smoothies to help bulk them up and keep the consistency cold and thick. Cabbage mixed with other yummy fruits has no flavor, and it offers a lot of benefits to help boost your health, fiber levels, and nutrition. The addition of avocados to your smoothies also helps make it creamy without adding any milk. Avocados offer good fats that help sate your appetite and nourish your brain and heart (not to mention your colon!). Blend until super smooth and creamy. Enjoy the dominant mango taste. You will be amazed at how delicious this is, especially knowing you are actually drinking cabbage! Cinnamon Raisin PB Cookies with White Chocolate Chips. {myriausz}

DID YOU KNOW?

Cabbage is a wonderful vegetable for cancer protection. It helps detoxify the liver and balance hormones.

articleTitle: Gluten Free Chewy Granola Bar Recipe
articleBodyHTML:
Make your kids the cool of snack with these homemade chewy granola bars! This is all about keeping snacktime healthy!

As a kid, I used to LOVE those chewy granola bars. What was your favorite flavor? Mine was a toss-up between the smore’s and the peanut butter chip.

Since the kids are back in school, I thought I would recreate a healthy version of these chewy granola bars. These are perfect for little ones (or the young at heart) that need to stick to a gluten free diet, but don’t want to feel ostracized with “weird” or “different” lunch and snack options. Man, the school cafeteria can be a rough place! {zrx89r5}

These granola bars include gluten-free quick oats to give density and chewiness to the bars. Quick oats are a great source of carbohydrates. The carbs help replenish glycogen stores, giving you energy, which makes it a perfect pick-me-up snack! This would even be a great snack to pack in your gym bag as an effective post-workout meal. Add some protein, like a Sunwarrior protein shake, and you are good to grow!

To give the granola bars some crunch, the recipe includes gluten free rice crisps. This keeps the recipe light and calorie friendly for those concerned with macro breakouts.

These bars are naturally sweetened, unlike those highly processed ones you would find in the store. The recipe uses brown rice syrup and honey, although you can certainly use maple syrup to keep it vegan.

Coconut oil is also used as a binder. For this reason, these bars are best kept intact in the refrigerator. Coconut oil is really unique because it expands as it cools. If left out on the counter for too long, the binding will start to break down and the bars will fall apart very easily. They are best consumed soon after taking them out of the fridge.

Check out the add-in options to customize the flavorings!
articleSummaryHTML: Make your kids the cool of snack with these homemade chewy granola bars! This is all about keeping snacktime healthy!
seoTitle: Gluten Free Chewy Granola Bar Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Make your kids the cool of snack with these homemade chewy granola bars! This is all about keeping snacktime healthy!
recipeName: Gluten Free Chewy Granola Bar Recipe
ingredients:
s:1241:"
  • 1 cup gluten free rice crisps
  • 1 ½ cups gluten free quick oats
  • Pinch salt
  • 1/3 cup brown rice syrup
  • 2 tablespoons honey (maple syrup or agave can be used)
  • 1 tablespoon nut butter
  • 4 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract

Add-In Options:

Peanut Butter Chip

  • Use peanut butter as your nut butter
  • 1/4 cup chocolate and peanut butter chips

Smore’s

  • 1/4 cup chocolate chips and mini marshmallows

Oatmeal Raisin

  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/4 cup raisins

Chocolate Chunk

  • 1/4 cup chocolate chunks
";
directions:
1. Mix rice crisps, quick oats, and salt in a mixing bowl. Set aside.
  2. Combine brown rice syrup, honey, nut butter, coconut oil (already melted), and vanilla extract in a small saucepan. Lightly melt the wet ingredients together on low heat for a few minutes.
  3. Pour the melted wet ingredients onto dry ingredients. Gently stir to fully incorporate everything together.
  4. Mix in add-in ingredients at this time. Gently stir again to evenly distribute the add-ins.
  5. Pour granola bar mixture into a shallow pan, or container.
  6. Press firmly to flatten the granola mixture. Should be about 1 inch thick.
  7. Refrigerate for at least an hour. At this point, you can flatten the mixture again by pressing firmly.
  8. When ready to serve, cut the mixture into 1 inch slices. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
The kids are starving, and you haven’t even thought about dinner yet. Don’t worry, we’ve got a quick, easy, and nutritious solution in these Santa Fe lettuce wraps!

Who doesn’t need a quick meal? This meal took 15 minutes from start to finish! I always try to keep most ingredients on hand, so I can make this meal in a pinch especially when I have avocados that need to be used. The dressing makes this meal superb and in my opinion, makes it over the top delicious!

The black beans, corn, and spinach all add necessary nutrients to your diet that help with your overall health. The black beans especially are a great way to fill fuller longer without eating meat. My kids like to eat it with tortillas because little hands have an easier time wrapping around tortillas.
articleSummaryHTML: The kids are starving, and you haven’t even thought about dinner yet. Don’t worry, we’ve got a quick, easy, and nutritious solution in these Santa Fe lettuce wraps!
seoTitle: Santa Fe Lettuce Wraps | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: The kids are starving, and you haven’t even thought about dinner yet. Don’t worry, we’ve got a quick, easy, and nutritious Santa Fe Lettuce Wraps.
ingredients:
s:1122:"

Wraps

  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • 1/4 cup minced red bell peppers
  • 1/4 cup minced scallions
  • 2/3 cup organic non gmo frozen corn
  • 1/2 cup organic canned black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 1/2 cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained
  • 2 tablespoons jalapeno peppers
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
  • 1 cup reduced vegan shredded cheese
  • 8 large iceberg lettuce leaves
  • One recipe of Avocado Cilantro Ranch Dressing

Avocado Cilantro Ranch Dressing

  • ½ cup nondairy sour cream plus 2 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 small jalapeno, seeds removed, leave them in if you want it extra spicy
  • 1/4 cup of fresh cilantro
  • 1 medium Haas avocado
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 tablespoons chopped scallion
  • Juice of 1 lime
  • 1/8 teaspoon cumin
  • 1/4 teaspoon fresh ground pepper
  • 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
";
directions:
Wraps

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the red bell pepper and scallions to the pan and sauté for 2 minutes until tender. Add the corn, black beans, spinach, jalapeno peppers, cumin, chili powder, salt, and cayenne pepper to the pan. Cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, stirring well so the spinach gets mixed in with everything.

Dressing

Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

articleBodyHTML:
Get creative with fresh vegetables. Bringing bright colors to our plates promotes happiness and health. And you’ll get a healthy helping of both with this beet and zucchini pad Thai!

Seeing bright and fresh colors and eating those same bright colors creates a sense of positive energy which translates over into our daily lives. For this salad, you can choose whichever vegetables you desire such as beets, carrots, capsicums, zucchini, micro greens, and sprouts! Fall harvest is the best time to go find out what is in season at your local farmers market and use it for salads. Salads don’t need to be boring; you can add different grains such as quinoa, faro, or couscous to make it a complete meal. You can also add slices of fresh avocado or raw nuts to give it a boost of healthy fats.

We tend to eat with our eyes before eating with our mouths. When you serve bright and colorful foods, serve them on white dishes. It makes the color pop, and they become more inviting to eat. Salads come in various textures, flavors, shapes, sizes, and colors which make them visually beautiful. The experience of eating food is all about the visual appearance. The better the food looks, the better it tends to taste. More and more people are creating salads in mason jars and clear containers as this gives us the visualization of beautiful and fresh foods.

Salads not only decrease our overall calorie intake for the day, but they also add a whole array of nutrients and fiber to our diet. By adding more salads to our daily diets, our bodies can become more alkaline and have better energy levels.

Like most salads, the dressing is the hero in the recipe. We use a blend of nut butter, miso, and herbs to give it a mix of sweet and salty. This recipe yields a large meal which can be stored in the fridge for leftovers the day after.
articleSummaryHTML: Get creative with fresh vegetables. Bringing bright colors to our plates promotes happiness and health. And you’ll get a healthy helping of both with this beet and zucchini pad Thai!
seoTitle: Beet and Zucchini Pad Thai
seoDescription: Get creative with fresh vegetables. Bringing bright colors to our plates promotes happiness and health. And you’ll get a healthy helping of both with this beet and zucchini pad Thai!
ingredients:
s:733:"
  • 2 golden beets, spiralized
  • 3 zucchini, spiralized
  • 1 cup micro greens
  • 1/2 red cabbage, diced
  • 1 cup edamame

Dressing

  • 1 tablespoon white miso
  • 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter
  • 5 limes, juiced
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1/4 cup water
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
Pad Thai

Toss all ingredients in a large bowl

Dressing

Blend all ingredients together in a high-speed blender

Enjoy!
