seoTitle: Peppermint Crunch Candy Cane Truffles | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: What do you get when you cross peppermint with chocolate? Christmas! Nothing says festive more than these peppermint truffles!
ingredients:
s:789:"
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Plus chocolate protein
  • ¼ cup almond meal
  • ½ cup Medjool dates, pitted, soaked 20–30 mins, drained
  • 1 tablespoon Maca root powder
  • 3 tablespoons Sunwarrior Mint Greens
  • ½ teaspoon peppermint extract or 2–3 drops food grade peppermint essential oil
  • 1 ½ cups unsweetened shredded coconut, organic
  • 1/3 cup coconut oil
  • ¼ cup raw cacao nibs
  • Pinch sea salt

GARNISH: Almond meal or raw cacao powder, to roll truffles in

";
directions:
Blend all the ingredients in a food processor until the mixture binds together, scraping down sides at least once to create an even consistency.

Roll into bite-size balls then place balls in a container or bag with almond meal or raw cacao powder and cover container or close bag. Shake closed container or bag until evenly covered. Freeze or refrigerate to store and enjoy as a fabulous quality snack – suitable for pre and post workout fuel.

Note: My fave product brands for the ingredients are Sunwarrior, Ojio, and Earth Circle Organics

seoDescription: If you’re on Santa duty this Christmas, fuel your sled, and illumin8 your holiday with this protein vegan eggnog smoothie from Sunwarrior.
ingredients:
s:322:"

 

  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 2 frozen bananas
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior illumin8 vanilla bean

";
directions: Place all ingredients in blender and blend for 3–4 minutes until the texture is creamy. Freeze the bananas first if you like your veggnog colder and creamier. When you’ve reached a smooth consistency, pour into a tall glass and sprinkle more nutmeg and cinnamon over the top. This is Christmas in a cup!

articleBodyHTML:
Heat up a bowl of healthy happiness with this crock pot tomato soup and find comfort and yumminess in every spoonful!

Nothing is better than a warm tomato soup on a cold winter day or even a sort of cold winter day, or, better yet, it doesn’t even have to be cold! I never really liked tomato soup because the only tomato soup I had was from a can as a kid. Not yummy at all. I stumbled across this recipe a few years ago and was very hesitant to make it because I didn’t like tomato soup. But the recipe looked good, so I tried it. Awesome happened! The soup as amazing! And what makes it even more delicious is how easy it is. You’re basically throwing everything in the crockpot, then blending until smooth. It seriously doesn’t get much easier. The soup pairs well with warm whole wheat bread or rolls. You’ll think you died and went to heaven.

Each serving of tomato soup has many benefits for your health. The tomatoes, celery, and carrots all have essential vitamins like vitamin E, A, C, and K, which help in your bone and cardiovascular health. The vegetable broth used is low in calorie and fat and also contributes to vitamin A content.
articleSummaryHTML: Heat up a bowl of healthy happiness with this crock pot tomato soup and find comfort and yumminess in every spoonful!
seoTitle: Crock Pot Tomato Soup
seoDescription: Heat up a bowl of healthy happiness with this crock pot tomato soup and find comfort and yumminess in every spoonful!
ingredients:
s:913:"
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 cup diced celery
  • 1 cup diced carrots
  • ½ cup diced onions
  • 28 oz. can whole plum tomatoes, with juice
  • 1 teaspoon thyme
  • 2 tablespoons basil leaves
  • 3 ½ cups vegetable broth
  • One bay leaf
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons gluten free flour
  • 1/3 cup grated parmesan regular or vegan cheese
  • 1 ¾ cups reduced fat (2%) rice or soy milk, warmed
  • Salt, to taste
  • Black pepper, to taste
";
directions:
Heat a skillet over medium temperature with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add celery, carrots and onions. Cook until golden brown or decided tenderness about 7 to 8 mins.

While veggies cook, add plum tomatoes to crock pot and crush the tomatoes with your hands. Add the thyme, basil, and bay leaf.

Once the celery, carrots and onions are cooked, use either an immersion blender or a blender (in small batches if needed) and blend until smooth. Add to crockpot. Cook a half to an hour.

Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a pot over medium heat and add flour. Whisk until smooth. Continue stirring for a few minutes to cook the flour. Slowly add warmed rice milk and a cup or so of blended soup from crock pot and cook until thickened. Add back into soup and stir. Taste the soup and adjust taste by using black pepper and salt. Cover and cook for an additional 30 mins.

articleBodyHTML:
For a warm welcome to your morning, try a mocha drink filled with protein, vitamins, minerals, and great flavor! Morning never tasted so good!

This smoothie covers your most important nutrition bases with superfoods like baobab, chia, flax, whole grain brown rice, kelp, holy basil, guava, and coconut, to name just a few that all come together in Sunwarrior’s illumin8. Clean protein, the best gluten free carbohydrates from, healthy fats, minerals, fiber, natural vitamins, enzymes, and probiotics. We’ve got it all.
articleSummaryHTML: For a warm welcome to your morning, try a mocha drink filled with protein, vitamins, minerals, and great flavor! Morning never tasted so good!
seoTitle: Morning Mocha | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: For a warm welcome to your morning, try a mocha drink filled with protein, vitamins, minerals, and great flavor! Morning never tasted so good!
ingredients:
s:430:"
  • 1 cup coconut or almond milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior illumin8 mocha
  • 1 teaspoon unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 2 teaspoons coconut sugar
  • Pinch salt
";
directions:
Mix dry ingredients. Heat coconut or almond milk over low heat. Add vanilla and dry ingredients to milk and mix well. Top with coconut whipped cream and chocolate chips (or whatever your favorite indulgence might be) and welcome the new day with a smile and good health. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Get Nutty! Cashew & Pecan Christmas Crunch
articleBodyHTML:
We’re nuts for these sweet snacks! Make them the life of the party, or be your neighbor’s favorite gift this year. This cashew, cacao & pecan maple vanilla crunch will be a holiday hit!

This recipe was inspired during the holiday season while creating a Christmas care package for my son (and my own desire for full taste explosions of flavor that just happen to pack healthy power). Every year, I aim to come up with a few indulgent treats that mark the holidays, and this year, cashews and cacao nibs have been an addiction for me. I made a double batch of these. Some for gifts, some to serve at a Christmas party, and some for me!

This combo is oh-so-good, somewhat addictive, and is a must-make any time of the year. The combo of crunchy, sweet, salty, and slightly bitter is perfection, and the best part is that anyone can make this. All you need to do is measure, mix, bake, and serve (or store and then sneak into every now and again). You are guaranteed to both love this and earn rave reviews from everyone who eats it. And yes, you can substitute in any nuts or seeds you love best!
articleSummaryHTML: We’re nuts for these sweet snacks! Make them the life of the party, or be your neighbor’s favorite gift this year. This cashew, cacao & pecan maple vanilla crunch will be a holiday hit!
seoTitle: Get Nutty! Cashew & Pecan Christmas Crunch | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: We’re nuts for these sweet snacks! Make them the life of the party, or be your neighbor’s favorite gift. Try our cashew and pecan christmas crunch.
recipeName: Get Nutty! Cashew & Pecan Christmas Crunch
ingredients:
s:800:"
  • 2 cups raw cashews
  • 2 cups raw pecans
  • ½ cup raw cacao nibs
  • ¼–1/3 cup maple syrup, the real thing
  • ¼ cup coconut syrup or additional maple syrup if not available yet this does impart a special taste and texture. I use the Ojio brand.
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla powder
  • ¾ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon cardamom
  • 1 teaspoon ginger powder
";
directions:
1. Cover a large baking sheet (1–2 inch sides) with a layer of parchment paper. Pre-heat oven to 325F.

2. Combine the nuts, cacao nibs, maple syrup, coconut syrup, and seasonings in a large bowl. Stir well. Spread out evenly into a single layer onto the baking sheet, place into the oven, and bake 15–20 minutes stirring occasionally.

3. When done, stir the nuts again and let cool before storing in airtight containers.

Can be stored in an airtight container for up to three weeks. For a more intensified caramel taste, cook an additional 10 minutes but watch carefully to ensure it doesn’t burn.

This is a perfect recipe to double and present as gifts when packaged in beautiful glass storage containers topped with parchment paper, a label and copy of the recipe.

Please ensure recipe credits are included.

articleBodyHTML:
There is a certain happiness that comes when wrapping your hands around a warm mug of a frothy-topped, flavorful oh-so-good latte! Make it minty, and you’ve reached perfection.

Are you a coffee shop fan? Hooked on lattes? We get it. But they can come at a steep price: excess calories, artificial flavors, excess sugar – be it syrup or a chemically created sugar imposter, and of course, there is the actual expense of it. Still, you really love them, feel you gotta have them, and so you do.

Well, how about a superfoods latte that’s coffee-shop worthy and really easy to make (especially if you have a high-speed blender, but if you don’t, you can still do this!). {9kucur9p} With some key quality ingredients, a saucepan, and a basic blender (sure, you can use a milk-frother if you have it), you are good to go.
articleSummaryHTML: There is a certain happiness that comes when wrapping your hands around a warm mug of a frothy-topped, flavorful oh-so-good latte! Make it minty, and you’ve reached perfection.
seoTitle: Minty Xoco Latte | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: There is a certain happiness that comes when wrapping your hands around a warm mug of latte! Try Sunwarrior's best minty xoco latte.
ingredients:
s:427:"
  • 1 teaspoon dark mint Macaforce powder from Health Force
  • 1 package XOCO chocolate shots (your favorite)
  • 1 serving Ormus Super Greens, mint
  • 1¼ cups homemade nut or seed milk, or your favorite store-bought unsweetened, non-dairy milk
  • A touch of raw honey or stevia, if needed
";
directions:
Blender Directions:

Froth all of the ingredients except extra sweetener in the blender until steamy warm.

Pour into a mug, top with a sprinkle of cacao power, Ormus Super Greens, or cinnamon, and wrap those hands around your mug to sip and savor.

Stove Top Method

Measure all the ingredients except sweetener into a small saucepan and whisk vigorously over medium low setting until mixture is warm and frothy.

Garnish as suggested about and enjoy with a smile on your face.

Having just made a batch of coconut milk, I topped my latte with additional foam from the milk for a frothy white contrast and a real coffee shop appearance.

If you don’t get the frothy top you want when whisking your latte stove-top, shake additional milk or your warm blend in a large heatproof glass jar before serving.

articleBodyHTML:
This cake is a must for any dessert table or holiday treat for the office. It’s moist, tasty, and so simple to make!

You can customize this with ingredients that you love. Looking for a sweet potato cake? Use sweet potato puree instead of pumpkin puree. Delicious.
articleSummaryHTML: This cake is a must for any dessert table or holiday treat for the office. It’s moist, tasty, and so simple to make!
seoTitle: Coconut Cranberry Pumpkin Cake
seoDescription: This cake is a must for any dessert table or holiday treat for the office. It’s moist, tasty, and so simple to make!
ingredients:
s:984:"
  • 1 ¾ cup whole wheat flour
  • ½ cup fresh cranberries
  • ½ cup vegan cacao chunks
  • ¼ cup palm sugar
  • ¼ cup unsweetened coconut flakes
  • 1 ½ cups pure pumpkin puree
  • 3 tablespoons pumpkin pie spice
  • 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ cup chopped walnuts
  • ¼ dried cranberries
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 1 teaspoon lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon agave
  • 3 tablespoons olive oil
  • ¾ cup coconut milk
";
directions:
Heat oven 350 degrees. Combine all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Stir together until well incorporated. In a medium mixing bowl gently whisk together all the wet ingredients. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and mix until well combined. You may need more coconut milk. If so, add one tablespoon at a time. This mixture will be quite thick. Don’t be alarmed.

Pour mixture into a parchment lined 8-inch cake pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until done. Enjoy!

For a sigh-worthy treat at the end of the day, warm your soul with some cocoa!

articleBodyHTML:
Do you know what’s more awesome than flax crackers? Flax crackers that taste like perfection because you made them yourself from healthy fresh ingredients!

Flax is one of those awesome things where every seed is bursting with high amounts of fiber and omega 3! Flax seed is great for the heart and for fighting inflammation, certain kinds of cancer, stroke, and diabetes. The lignans have antioxidant attributes which make these little guys pack a well-rounded punch at illness. Total knockout!

Nuts are naturally cholesterol free and cashews are no exception! Cashews lower cholesterol, provide heart-healthy fats, protein, and fiber, and they reduce your blood pressure! So much fabulous snugged into such tiny packages ready to be opened and enjoyed!
articleSummaryHTML: Do you know what’s more awesome than flax crackers? Flax crackers that taste like perfection because you made them yourself from healthy fresh ingredients!
seoTitle: Fantastic Flax Crackers | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Do you know what’s more awesome than flax crackers? Flax crackers that taste like perfection because you made them yourself from healthy fresh ingredients!
ingredients:
s:628:"
  • 2 cup ground flaxseed
  • 1 cup cashews
  • 1 red bell pepper, chopped
  • 2 small carrots chopped
  • 1 garlic clove chopped
  • ½ teaspoon oregano
  • 1 lemon juiced
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ½ teaspoon coconut nectar or agave nectar
  • Pinch of pepper
  • Pinch of onion salt
";
directions:
Place all ingredients into a food processor and puree. Spread out onto a nonstick parchment lined sheet pan or dehydrator sheets. Dehydrate until dry and crisp approximately 17 hours. I used my oven set at 175 deg. Check after about 6 hours and flip the crackers over. Break into pieces. Store in an airtight container.

SUPER EASY

For a sigh-worthy treat at the end of the day, warm your soul with some cocoa!

articleTitle: Zucchini Veggie Dip: the Skinny Dip for your Vegetables
articleBodyHTML: Are your crackers naked? Have we got the skinny dip for you! This zucchini veggie dip is sure to make your parties the event of the year!
articleSummaryHTML: Are your crackers naked? Have we got the skinny dip for you! This zucchini veggie dip is sure to make your parties the event of the year!
seoTitle: Zucchini Veggie Dip: Skinny Dip for your Vegetables
seoDescription: Are your crackers naked? Have we got the skinny dip for you! This zucchini veggie dip is sure to make your parties the event of the year!
recipeName: Zucchini Veggie Dip: the Skinny Dip for your Vegetables
ingredients:
s:605:"
  • 1 medium zucchini cubed
  • 2 small carrots, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons organic white sugar
  • 1 tablespoon tamari or soy sauce
  • 1 clove garlic, chopped
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • ¼–½ teaspoon salt
  • Pinch of pepper
  • 1 ¾ cups vegan mayo
  • ¼ horseradish mayo
";
directions:
1. Boil the zucchini and carrot until tender, about 5 mins, drain and place in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add everything but the mayo, process until blended. Add the mayo and pulse a few times until blended.
  2. Chill for at least an hour before serving.
  3. Serve with chopped veggies or crackers.
  4. This is also really good as a dressing for a salad.

Let us show you how to make the perfect flax crackers to go with this dip!

articleBodyHTML:
Shake up your preconceived ideas about what makes chili such a chill meal, and try this raw, vegan bowl of health and flavor!

Ah, chili. Family recipes are closely guarded secrets, and chili cook-offs are the stuff of legends. Everybody has his or her own version of the all-American dish, which is typically made con carne or with meat. I’m lightening it up and making it meat-free, bean-free, vegan, and raw. This easier-to-digest version is packed with surprisingly authentic chili flavor from sun-dried tomatoes, avocado, lime, carrots, and traditional chili spices. My recipe is also different in that it does not call for cooking or heating. Where you might otherwise spend a couple hours simmering, this version is prepared in a high-speed blender. Feel free to heat it gently on the stove if you’re so inclined.

This thick recipe would also make great dip with some baked or raw corn chips. It would make a mighty fine burrito-style sandwich, too. Simply load the chili into a tortilla or—if you want to keep it light—a cabbage leaf, and add any toppings you’d like to make it your own.

Be sure to follow the directions and leave the carrots and cilantro out of the blender—they need to be hand prepped and stirred in to provide the appropriate texture.
articleSummaryHTML: This raw, vegan chili gives all the health and all the flavor! This is sure to be a favorite recipe to the raw vegan who loves delicious foods!
seoTitle: Raw Vegan Chili | Sunwarrior Recipe
seoDescription: This raw, vegan chili gives all the health and all the flavor! This is sure to be a favorite recipe to the raw vegan who loves delicious foods!
ingredients:
s:839:"
  • ¾ cup sun-dried tomatoes, oil-packed
  • ½ cup almonds, soaked 12 hours and rinsed
  • ¾ cup purified water
  • 1 avocado, pitted
  • ¼ cup lime juice
  • 1 ½ teaspoons unrefined salt
  • 1 tablespoon chili powder
  • 1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin
  • ½ teaspoon cayenne
  • ½ teaspoon smoked paprika
  • ¼ teaspoon unrefined salt
  • ½ cup carrots, diced
  • ½ cup cilantro, chopped
";
directions: Combine soaked almonds, lime juice, tomatoes, and water in blender and mix on high until smooth, adding additional water as needed. Add remaining ingredients except fresh cilantro and carrots and process again to incorporate. Stir in carrots and cilantro and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
Morning coffee: the way it should be. Illuminate your morning coffee with flavor and all the vitamins that boost health and happiness.

Who doesn’t love to start their day with a little coffee? It can be a good jolt to get you moving and bust through the morning fog, but do you sometimes end up substituting that coffee as your breakfast? Just coffee for breakfast is not the healthiest way to jumpstart your daily routine. The always beautiful, inside and out, Marzia Prince, aka the Healthinista, is here to illuminate your morning with her Kicked-Up Coffee smoothie. This recipe takes care of you in all the best ways.
articleSummaryHTML: Morning coffee: the way it should be. Illuminate your morning coffee with flavor and all the vitamins that boost health and happiness.
seoTitle: Kicked Up Coffee Smoothie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Morning coffee: the way it should be. Illuminate your morning coffee with flavor and all the vitamins that boost health and happiness.
ingredients:
s:296:"
  • 1/2 cup oats
  • 1 cup coffee
  • 1 banana
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior illumin8 mocha
";
directions:
Start with one-half cup of oats. Toss those in a blender with one cup coffee, one banana, and one scoop of Sunwarrior illumin8 Mocha. Blend away. Enjoy. It’s that simple to kick up your day with complex carbohydrates, protein, and that hit of caffeine you’re craving.

A great way to get you going on resolutions is joining our fitness challenge!

articleBodyHTML:
For a minty blast of winter, this chocolate Minty Mousse Smoothie is like hitting the Alpine slopes!

It began with the need for a creamy thick chocolate smoothie, which always means it’s new recipe time. Out came the “I-love-my-Harley-Pasternak-high-speed-blender,” and it was go-time for creation!

First, I used the blender to whip my matcha power and cashew milk to a frothy steamy latte; then, I washed my greens. From there, it’s a simple toss of ingredients into the blender and voila, this creamy concoction that is heavenly.

I am so blessed – I love life, have a total devotion to living it fully, creating and enjoying amazing food and consciously sharing as much laughter, love and yes, delish food and drink with family, friends, colleagues and clients. Join me in a toast to us all once you make this.

If you are celebrating a special occasion, this is a perfect recipe for brunch or dessert.

Breakfast or snack, dessert, pre-post-workout meal.
articleSummaryHTML: For a minty blast of winter, this chocolate Minty Mousse Smoothie is like hitting the Alpine slopes!
seoTitle: Chocolate-Mint Mousse-Smoothie
seoDescription: For a minty blast of winter, this chocolate Minty Mousse Smoothie is like hitting the Alpine slopes!
ingredients:
s:849:"
  • ½ cup of your preferred liquid (non-dairy milk or coconut water)
  • 1 heaping cup leafy greens and stems (Frisee, Romaine, spinach, chard)
  • ¼ small avocado (approx 2 tbsps)
  • 1 small frozen banana, chopped chunks
  • 2 teaspoons hemp seeds
  • 2 teaspoons flax seeds
  • 2 teaspoons Sunbutter
  • 1 serving Ormus Super Greens with mint
  • 1 tablespoon raw cacao powder
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ inch piece fresh ginger
  • Tiny pinch sea salt
  • Approx. ¾ cup crushed ice or as desired
  • Garnish ideas – Fresh berries, pumpkin seeds, cacao nibs, granola
";
directions:
Measure all of the ingredients into your power blender in the order above. Blend using the tamper beginning on low and powering it up to high. Add additional liquid as needed.

Pour into a tall glass, garnish as desired and enjoy this creamy, dreamy chocolate-mint treat with a spoon and a latte of your choice.

(If you prefer a thinner sip-able smoothie, simply add more liquid.)

Teri’s Tips:

I infuse this blend with added nutrients – electrolytes via Liquid Light, Maca root Powder, and acerola cherry powder (Vitamin C). In the winter, I add Vitamin D as well.

articleBodyHTML:
Nutrition is always in style, so before you put that pumpkin craving on the seasonal shelf for next year, try this recipe for muffins filled with nutritious fashion.

We’re a bit past the time of the year where pumpkin is in EVERYTHING: lattes, pies, bagels, beer, cookies, cereal and so much more. But just because we’ve reached 2017 doesn’t mean that pumpkin is “so last year.” These pumpkin coconut muffins are full of nutritional benefits and are gluten free. These are so healthy that you can eat them for breakfast or as a snack.

Health benefits of pumpkin:

  • Feel fuller because pumpkins are full of fiber.
  • Boost vision because pumpkins are full of Vitamin A, which promotes good vision. Vitamin A also helps maintain healthy skin, bones, and teeth.
  • Lower blood pressure
  • Sleep better
  • Have a healthier heart
articleSummaryHTML: Nutrition is always in style, so before you put that pumpkin craving on the seasonal shelf for next year, try this recipe for muffins filled with nutritious fashion.
seoTitle: Pumpkin Coconut Muffins | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Nutrition is always in style, so before you put that pumpkin craving on the seasonal shelf for next year, try this recipe pumpkin coconut muffins.
ingredients:
s:767:"
  • 5 eggs (or vegan substitute)
  • 1 cup of pumpkin puree
  • ½ cup coconut flour
  • ¼ cup honey or agave
  • ¼ cup coconut oil (softened)
  • 3 tablespoons chia seeds 
  • 1 ½ teaspoons nutmeg
  • 1 ½ teaspoons ginger
  • 1 ½ teaspoons cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda

Toppings

  • ½ cup pecans
  • 1 teaspoon nutmeg
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
  2. Put all the muffin ingredients in mixing bowl
  3. Use a strong whisk or kitchen aid mixer, mix until smooth and all ingredients are mixed well. The batter should be a bit thick, if it is too thick, add a little bit of coconut milk or water for thinning, but don’t let it get runny. After you finish with the muffin batter, put together the toppings. Add all the topping ingredients and mix well.
  4. Put into muffin tins. The batter will be somewhat thick. Top with the pecan toppings before baking.
  5. Bake for 14–16 minutes, or until lightly browned. 
  6. Let them cool for 10–15 minutes before enjoying! Put them in the refrigerator and keep for up to a week.

articleBodyHTML:
When hunger pains start gnawing at you, bite back! Crunch into this golden granola of health and happiness!

Store bought granola is not only loaded with sugar, refined flour, and hydrogenated oils, but it also lacks flavor and that personal touch. It is so simple to make your own, and you feel good eating it. It can be eaten on its own, on top of oatmeal, yogurt or other whole grain cereals, or as a snack–—just like trail mix! You can also make it NUT FREE - just add other seeds instead of almonds, blend: hemp, flax, sesame and it’s safe to take to school!
articleSummaryHTML: When hunger pains start gnawing at you, bite back! Crunch into this golden granola of health and happiness!
seoTitle: Golden Granola
seoDescription: When hunger pains start gnawing at you, bite back! Crunch into this golden granola of health and happiness!
ingredients:
s:805:"
  • 4 cups rolled oats
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • ¾ cup pure organic maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon rice milk
  • 1 ½ cup oat bran or quinoa flakes
  • ¾ cups sesame seeds
  • ½ cup sunflower seeds
  • ½ cup pumpkin seeds
  • 1 cup coconut flakes
  • ¼ cup flax seeds
  • 1 cup chopped almonds
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 ½ cups of either raisins, apricots, or cranberries
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 300F. Combine maple syrup, rice milk and coconut oil in a large saucepan and set aside.

2. Mix remaining ingredients in a large bowl, except raisins, and toss well.

3. Add the oil-maple mixture and stir together really well.

4. Pour mixture into two shallow pans or baking sheets with parchment paper and bake for 15 minutes, stir, and bake for an additional 10 minutes until light golden brown.

5. Remove from oven and stir in raisins, apricots or cranberries.

6. Cool and store in airtight container.

7. Serve in half cup portions and serve with rice or almond milk.

articleBodyHTML:
Now that the seasonal figgy pudding revelers are no longer a threat bring out the fig! These fig and chocolate bites will sweeten your day!

These mini fig bars are the perfect treat. They are stored in either your fridge or freezer so when you come in from after a hot workout.

These bite size fig treats are not only super healthy, but they are also gluten free, grain free, refined sugar-free, dairy-free and guilt free. These bite-size treats are made with all organic ingredients and are the perfect mid-day pick me up snack. These bite-size treats are very easy to make and can be stored in an airtight container in the freezer for later consumption.

Raw nuts and seeds are one of the best sources for omega 3s. Pumpkin seeds are a nutrition powerhouse that contain high amounts of magnesium and antioxidants. These little green warriors are an incredible source of fiber. They are the perfect on the go snack as they are portable and can be taken with you wherever you go.

There is an ongoing battle with using dates or figs when making raw vegan treats. Dried figs are a great source of energy. They contain natural sugar but when paired up with the pumpkin seeds, the natural sugar won’t spike your blood sugar because the two counterbalance each other. Figs are rich in fiber which can aid in digestive problems or constipation. Figs also contain less sugar than dates. Figs also have fewer calories than dates, which give them the leg up in this recipe. When making this recipe, soak the figs in boiling water for 30–40 minutes prior to blending them. The figs will plump up and give the bars a more smooth texture.

We use carob chips in this recipe, but you can always opt to use regular chocolate chips. You can decorate them as you please by adding any dried fruit, nuts, seeds or granola on top.
articleSummaryHTML: Now that the seasonal figgy pudding revelers are no longer a threat bring out the fig! These fig and chocolate bites will sweeten your day!
seoTitle: Fig and Chocolate Bites
seoDescription: Now that the seasonal figgy pudding revelers are no longer a threat bring out the fig! These fig and chocolate bites will sweeten your day!
ingredients:
s:577:"
  • 1 cup figs, soaked in boiling water for 30 minutes
  • 1 cup pumpkin seeds
  • ½ cup raw almonds
  • 1 orange, zested and juiced
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla bean or vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt

Coating

  • 1 cup melted carob chips
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1.) Blend figs, pumpkin seeds, almonds, orange zest and juice, vanilla bean and salt together. Pulse until mixture comes together and is sticky. Remove from food processor and place in a 4 x 4 parchment paper lined tray. Place in freezer for 1 hour to set.

2.) Remove fig bar from the freezer and cut into bite size cubes. Melt carob and coconut oil. Dip each piece in carob mixture and place in freezer to set another hour

articleBodyHTML:
No hooks required to enjoy this vegan tuna fish salad! For a satisfying and refreshing dinner, this is a recipe to keep handy!

This recipe makes approximately four cups and is great as a filling in a lettuce wrap or tortilla!
articleSummaryHTML: No hooks required to enjoy this vegan tuna fish salad! For a satisfying and refreshing dinner, this is a recipe to keep handy!
seoTitle: Sol Luna Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: No hooks required to enjoy this vegan tuna fish salad! For a satisfying and refreshing dinner, this is a recipe to keep handy!
ingredients:
s:577:"
  • 2 cups roasted and salted sunflower seeds, soaked for about 24 hours in a Mason jar (overnight works well)
  • ¼ cup pickle juice
  • ¼ cup lemon juice (about one lemon)
  • ½ white or red onion minced
  • ½ cup celery minced
  • ¼ cup fresh parsley minced or 1–2 tablespoons dried parsley
  • ¼ cup fresh dill minced or 1–2 tablespoons dried dill
  • 1–2 tablespoons seaweed snacks or Dulse to give it just a hint of “fish” taste.
";
directions:
1. Drain and rinse sunflower seeds that have been soaking in Mason jar
  2. Place seeds, pickle, and lemon juice into food processor. Can add a pinch of sea salt if you like and a pinch of pepper. Pulse 10–15 times until seeds are broken up to your liking
  3. Place mixture into a bowl and add remaining ingredients, mix with a spoon until everything is evenly mixed.
  4. This salad can be served a lot of different ways, romaine lettuce wrap, collard leaves, tortillas, and, of course, on bread. Serve with a pickle spear, matchstick carrots, tomato wedges, chips, or avocado. Makes a really yummy lunch or light, refreshing dinner!

articleBodyHTML:
For a sweet and savory dinner dish, this coconut vegetable curry is the siren call to the family that it’s time for dinner. What’s on your table?

In case you didn’t know, coconut milk is loaded with nutrients and healthy fat. It contains vitamins, minerals, and calcium. It is a plant-based saturated fat, but rather than storing this fat, your body uses it for energy! Coconut milk is also dairy-free and makes a great alternative to regular milk!

This curry can also be adapted to whatever vegetables are in season or available to you. Always be sure to work with what you have, as long as it’s colorful with lots of variety you will have yourself a wonderful meal that will last all week. Don’t be afraid to freeze containers of this curry and save it for another day. It keeps well in the fridge and freezer. Just cooking up a fresh batch of quinoa, brown rice, gluten free noodles or kelp noodles to serve it with and you will have yourself a solid meal!

Are you seeing weird numbers and letters? Find out why here!
articleSummaryHTML: For a sweet and savory dinner dish, this coconut vegetable curry is the siren call to the family that it’s time for dinner. What’s on your table?
seoTitle: Best Coconut Vegetable Curry Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For a sweet and savory dinner dish, Sunwarrior Health Hub's coconut vegetable curry is the siren call to the family that it’s time for dinner.
ingredients:
s:1476:"
  • 1 onion
  • 1–2 teaspoons sea salt
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cut into ¾ inch cubes
  • 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and cut into ¾ inch cubes
  • 1 medium cauliflower, cut into bite-size florets
  • 1 cup shelled peas, cooked
  • ½ red cabbage
  • 1 cup quartered Brussels sprouts
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 cup water

Curry Blend (Grind in Spice Grinder):

  • 1 teaspoon coriander
  • 2 teaspoons cumin
  • ½ teaspoon turmeric
  • 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper
  • ¼ teaspoon fenugreek
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon cardamom seeds, no pods
  • ¼ teaspoon mustard seeds

Add in to Curry Blend After Grinding:

  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 tablespoon fresh minced ginger
";
directions:
1. In a large skillet, sauté onions with one teaspoon salt in oil and half of curry blend until they begin to soften and brown. Add squash and cook for ten minutes. Add potatoes and other half of curry blend and continue sautéing another five minutes, stirring often.

2. Add cabbage and cauliflower to the top of the squash and potatoes, being careful not to stir the mixture. Add water and coconut milk and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender (15 to 20 minutes).

3. With a wooden spoon, smash some of the squash in the curry mixture against the sides of the skillet to thicken the sauce. Stir in the peas and season to taste with salt.

A great way to get you going on resolutions is joining our fitness challenge!

articleBodyHTML:
For a healthier, still-chocolate-eating, you, these flourless chocolate chip cookies are the best things since . . . well, since chocolate chip cookies!

Since I try to eliminate all flour from my diet, I have to get creative in the kitchen in baking traditional staples. Studies have shown that removing flour from your diet will boost your metabolism and decrease inflammation in your body. There also appears to be a correlation between refined foods (like flour) and diseases. Scientists are still working on studying this, but I am not willing to take any chances.

That’s why I’m turning to flour-free recipes for some of my favorite cravings (because why not have a little fun while eating, right?!)

Because chocolate chip cookies usually contain loads of flour, butter, and added sugar, I wanted to create something to get rid of all three of those ingredients, but still maintain the flavor and texture of a traditional cookie. These cookies are a lighter, healthier, and guilt-free way of satisfying your next chocolate craving. Plus, they take less than 20 minutes to make!
articleSummaryHTML: For a healthier, still-chocolate-eating, you, these flourless chocolate chip cookies are the best things since . . . well, since chocolate chip cookies!
seoTitle: Flourless Chocolate Chip Cookies
seoDescription: For a healthier, still-chocolate-eating, you, these flourless chocolate chip cookies are the best things since . . . well, since chocolate chip cookies!
ingredients:
s:434:"
  • 1 cup almond butter
  • ¼ cup raw organic agave
  • 1 vegan egg
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon organic vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ¼ cup vegan chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees
  2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
  3. Whisk together the almond butter, agave, egg, baking soda, vanilla extract, and sea salt until a smooth batter forms.
  4. Fold in the chocolate chips evenly through the batter.
  5. Drop 1.5 tablespoons of batter per cookie onto the parchment paper, spaced out 1.25 inches apart.
  6. Bake for 10 minutes. If you want them a little crispier, leave them in a little longer, but watch them.
  7. This recipe makes 12 cookies, and they should come out with slightly browned bottoms. Let the cookies cool for 15 minutes before enjoying! By substituting traditional ingredients for healthier alternatives, you can enjoy your favorite snacks while feeling great in the New Year!

articleBodyHTML:
Banana chocolate chip muffins are here! Because. Breakfast! And breakfast should taste good as well as provide all those nutrients a body needs to get going

Using spelt flour instead of whole-wheat flour gives these muffins a bit more depth in flavor and loads them with fiber and protein. Also, adding ripe bananas gives this bread natural sweetness and makes it moist, tender and delicious!
articleSummaryHTML: Banana chocolate chip muffins are here! Because. Breakfast! And breakfast should taste good as well as provide all those nutrients a body needs to get going
seoTitle: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins
seoDescription: Banana chocolate chip muffins are here! Breakfast! And breakfast should taste good as well as provide all those nutrients a body needs to get going
ingredients:
s:695:"
  • 1 ½ cups organic spelt flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 2–3 ripe bananas (depending on size)
  • ½ cup rice milk
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 1/3 cup applesauce + 1 tablespoon ground flax
  • 1 cup chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Use a large bowl for the dry ingredients. Then mix wet ingredients into dry and fold slowly, mixing until there are no lumps remaining. Stir in chocolate chips.

2. Drop by spoonfuls into an oiled muffin tray or pour batter into a loaf pan.

3. Bake for 20 minutes if making muffins, or 30–40 minutes if making a loaf.

articleTitle: Pan Fried Tempeh & Smashed Purple Potatoes with Fresh Garlic & Rosemary
articleBodyHTML:
Hearty and wholesome, this pan-fried tempeh and smashed purple potatoes will make dinner a thing of beauty. The tasty kind of beauty.

This winter inspired recipe doubles as a wonderful side dish for non-vegans and a hearty, protein-packed main course for the vegans. So why a “not-really-meat” and potatoes dish you say? Because this time of year, I especially want a healthy, high protein, warm meal teeming to the brim with hearty, winter flavors. It’s just an added bonus that while all potatoes are high in potassium which helps protect and heal hypertension with the regulation of blood pressure, purple potatoes specifically are also very high in the antioxidant anthocyanin. This dish, however, you serve it will feed your body, feed your heart, and drop a little soul food for you, too.
articleSummaryHTML: Hearty and wholesome, this pan-fried tempeh and smashed purple potatoes will make dinner a thing of beauty. The tasty kind of beauty.
seoTitle: Pan Fried Tempeh & Smashed Purple Potatoes | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Hearty and wholesome, Sunwarrior's pan-fried tempeh and smashed purple potatoes recipe will make dinner a thing of beauty. The tasty kind of beauty.
recipeName: Pan Fried Tempeh & Smashed Purple Potatoes with Fresh Garlic & Rosemary
ingredients:
s:384:"
  • Small purple potatoes
  • Vegetable stock or water
  • 1 package tempeh
  • 1 stem fresh rosemary
  • 2 cloves fresh garlic
  • Extra virgin olive oil
  • Salt and pepper
";
directions:
Place the potatoes in a deep skillet and pour the water or stock over the potatoes until they are just barely covered. Salt the water, and boil the potatoes until they can be pierced easily with a knife or skewer. They should be fully-cooked but not over-cooked. Roughly 30 minutes. Drain the liquid from the potatoes and let them cook for 10 minutes.

Heat the oven to 400 degrees and place the fully-dried potatoes on a greased baking pan. Place a towel or use the back of a spoon (so you don’t burn your hand) and flatten the potatoes out, so they keep their shape but pop through the skin. Drizzle the potatoes with the olive oil, garlic and rosemary and bake for 15 minutes on each side until they are browned. Salt and Pepper to taste.

To prepare the Tempeh, simply slice into thin slices similar to the size of the potatoes. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet and pan fry the tempeh on both sides until browned.

Layer the Tempeh and Potatoes on a serving dish, pair them with your favorite green vegetable and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Enjoy yourself a little too much this holiday season? If that's the case, here’s a little pick-me-up detox juice to get your body back on track.

Did you get a late start on your New Year’s resolutions? The holiday season can bring laughs, memories, extra booze, and delicious indulgences. But it also can bring dehydration, inflammation, and weight gain that’s difficult to bounce back from. Even if you were trying to be healthy, it is easy to get swept up in the moment. Some of you are trying to get over that lingering post-holiday hangover right now or maybe just trying to detox from that inflammation fest you just had.

Before you grab your morning coffee or tea after you wake up, chug a couple glasses of water with lemon to hydrate your system. Then make this healthy hydration drink. Who needs GMO processed sports drink that claims to rehydrate you when it makes you feel actually worse. This fresh, organic cocktail will nourish your cells, rehydrate you, and bring you back to life. This is easy on the digestive system and packed with fiber; not to mention that your body will be flooding with fresh nutrients. Drink this hangover cure, and give yourself a couple of hours to feel amazing again. Say goodbye to your holiday hangover and hello to an energized new you!
articleSummaryHTML: Enjoy yourself a little too much this holiday season? Perhaps you are still going even though the holidays are long gone? If that is the case, here’s a little pick-me-up detox juice to get your body back on track.
seoTitle: Body Detox Juice | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Enjoy yourself a little too much this holiday season? Get back on track with our great body detox juice from Sunwarrior. Our detox will reset your body.
ingredients:
s:402:"
  • 1 cucumber
  • 1 stalk of celery
  • 2 kale leaves
  • 2 handfuls of spinach
  • 1 apple
  • 1-inch piece of ginger to taste (more if you like an extra kick)
  • ¼ of a lemon peeled
";
directions:
Take all ingredients, wash thoroughly, and put through a juicer. Pour into a glass. Enjoy immediately!

Drink this for a few mornings, and you will be back to your old self or should I say and even better self.

Happy Detoxing!

articleBodyHTML:
The search is over. As the colder months roll around, our body craves more hearty and dense foods. This soul-warming millet salad is exactly what you crave.

This hearty yet refreshing salad is filled with grains and local and in-season produce and greens. When this masterpiece of a salad is done, your eyes will be overwhelmed by the sheer beauty of plant-based simplicity. This salad is a perfect dish to make for a large group of guests or to have for leftovers the rest of the week.

Making this delicious salad isn't just about flavors but about colors. We eat first with our eyes, so adding colorful dried fruits and vibrant in-season vegetables and fruits will entice you to indulge over and over into this salad. This salad can be modified to suit you or your guests’ needs. You can add whichever vegetables or fruits are in season or switch out certain grains to add texture, flavor, or taste.

The base of this salad is millet. Millet is not a common grain seen on tables, but it’s making a dent in North American diets. Millet grain, common in India, is a source of key nutrients. Millet boosts an array of health benefits such as improving the digestive system and detoxifying the body and is a wonderful source of plant-based protein that can help repair muscles after exercising. Millet is rich in fiber which can help in bloating, constipation, and regulating our digestive problems. Millet can also lower our cholesterol levels leading to good heart health.

We added roasted tofu to this recipe to give this salad a boost of nutrients and added protein. You can omit the tofu and add any other protein of choice. This salad can be made ahead of time and placed in the fridge up to five days. Make a large batch, and eat away!
articleSummaryHTML: The search is over. As the colder months roll around, our body craves more hearty and dense foods. This soul-warming millet salad is exactly what you crave.
seoTitle: Soul Warming Millet Salad Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: The search is over. As the colder months roll around, our body craves more hearty & dense foods. This soul-warming millet salad is exactly what you crave.
ingredients:
s:551:"
  • 1 cup cooked millet
  • 1 cup roasted tofu slices
  • 1/3 cup raisins
  • ½ cup grated carrot
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
  • Zest from ½ of a lemon
  • Fresh herbs: mint, parsley, basil, scallions
";
directions:
1. Cook millet according to instructions. Let cool
  2. Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, zest, cumin, salt, and herbs together
  3. Combine dressing and millet together

articleBodyHTML:
Eating dessert for breakfast is a blessing! And when it’s healthy, nothing is better than that. That’s why we’re giving you tapioca pudding!

Tapioca–a Native plan from South America is derived from the cassava plant. It’s a starchy extract and is used in various Ayurveda dishes and desserts all over the world. Tapioca due to its glutinous nature has been known to excellent to cure ulcer and stomach burns as it balances the Ph. level in the body. It’s also well known for its high amount of fiber, carbohydrates, iron and essential minerals.
articleSummaryHTML: Eating dessert for breakfast is a blessing! And when it’s healthy, nothing is better than that. That’s why we’re giving you tapioca pudding!
seoTitle: Tapioca Pudding
seoDescription: Eating dessert for breakfast is a blessing! And when it’s healthy, nothing is better than that. That’s why we’re giving you tapioca pudding!
ingredients:
s:597:"
  • ¼ cup tapioca pearls
  • ½ coconut milk
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar or maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 mango, sliced
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus protein (to be added while serving)
";
directions:
1. Using a small pan, heat up the coconut milk and tapioca pearls for about 10–15 minutes.
  2. Slowly add cinnamon, sugar, ginger, and sea salt to the mixture.
  3. Keep stirring until all ingredients are mixed well.
  4. Transfer the ingredients to a glass bowl, and store in the refrigerator for an hour before serving.
  5. Slice the mango into small squares, and serve it a topping for the dish.

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
Your family called. They want to know what’s for dinner. Luckily, we have the answer: quinoa black bean burrito bowls! You’re welcome!

Quinoa has been deemed a superfood because of its dense nutrients. It can be made savory or sweet. I, personally, have only had it savory, and it’s delicious! This savory Quinoa black bean burrito bowl recipe is no exception. Burrito bowls are extremely tasty. No waiting for burritos to bake and no need for a tortilla either. Just throw it all in a bowl and serve.

This recipe is quite easy. The most time-consuming ingredient to prepare is the quinoa. When cooking quinoa, I have found cooking it in a rice cooker makes it even easier. No need to worry about the flame or temperature of the stove.

Quinoa and black beans are chock full of nutrients including manganese, folate, and fiber. The vegetables added into the burrito bowl give it a good balance for a healthy meal.
articleSummaryHTML: Your family called. They want to know what’s for dinner. Luckily, we have the answer: quinoa black bean burrito bowls! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Quinoa Black Bean Burrito Bowls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Your family called. They want to know what’s for dinner. Luckily, we have the answer: quinoa black bean burrito bowls! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:760:"
  • 1 cup quinoa
  • 2 ½ cups vegetable broth, divided
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • ¼ cup minced onion
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 2 cans (15 oz each) black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
  • ¼ teaspoon chili powder (mild)
  • Pinch of cayenne pepper (spicy)
  • 1 tablespoon fresh lime or lemon juice
  • 1 cup shredded lettuce

Optional Toppings

  • Vegan sour cream
  • Salsa
  • Tomatoes
  • Vegan cheese, cashew cheese, or cheddar cheese (for our vegetarian friends)
  • Avocado
  • Guacamole
  • Corn
";
directions:
Rinse quinoa in a mesh strainer, if needed. Pour the quinoa into a saucepan or rice cooker and add 2 cups vegetable broth. If you are using a rice cooker, cook according to rice cooker instructions. If using pot, bring quinoa and broth to bowl. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 mins or until desired tenderness.

While quinoa is cooking, heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Sauté onions until softened. Add garlic and cook until aromatic about a minute. Add black beans, ½ c broth, 1 tablespoon cilantro, chili powder, and cayenne pepper to onion and garlic mixture and combine well. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid is mostly gone (about 15 mins). Stir in 1 tablespoon fresh lime or lemon juice.

When quinoa is done, add 1 tablespoon cilantro and 1 tablespoon fresh lime or lemon juice. Mix.

To assemble burrito bowls, add about ¼ c lettuce to a bowl. Add desired amount of beans, quinoa, and additional toppings. Serve warm.

articleTitle: Whip It Good: Vegan Peanut Butter Mousse
articleBodyHTML:
Dessert should taste great, but a truly magnificent dessert should be healthy, too. We offer the magnificent with this vegan peanut butter mousse!

Typically, a mousse-style dessert is made with animal-based fats: cream cheese, heavy cream, whipped cream—but it doesn’t take any of that to whisk up this fluffy treat. Vegan Peanut Butter Mousse is equally “cream”-y and arguably even more delicious than its traditional counterpart.

Avocado stands in for the “cream” in this recipe, while maple syrup sweetens the mixture up. Notice we’re using vanilla powder for our mousse, although you can also use a traditional vanilla extract—just increase the measurement to a full teaspoon of extract. Vanilla powder is simply ground vanilla beans, and it’s a good substitute when baking, as it packs the punch of vanilla flavor without being diluted by the alcohol of the extracted version. A word to the wise: be sure to check your powder well before buying—often, manufacturers sneak in powdered sugar or synthetic extracts, two things you’d be better off avoiding!

For variation, try trading the peanut butter powder for cacao powder for a delicious chocolate mousse. Or better yet, make both recipes and serve layered in a parfait glass for a creamy peanut butter cup dessert.
articleSummaryHTML: Dessert should taste great, but a truly magnificent dessert should be healthy, too. We offer the magnificent with this vegan peanut butter mousse!
seoTitle: Whip It Good: Vegan Peanut Butter Mousse | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Dessert should taste great, but a truly magnificent dessert should be healthy, too. We offer the magnificent with this vegan peanut butter mousse!
recipeName: Whip It Good: Vegan Peanut Butter Mousse
ingredients:
s:448:"
  • 1 large avocado
  • 1 additional avocado or a ripe banana
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, softened
  • ¼ cup peanut butter powder
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • ¼ teaspoon vanilla powder
  • 1/8 teaspoon unrefined salt
";
directions: Place all ingredients into blender and puree until completely smooth. Chill before serving.

articleTitle: Yummy, Easy & Dairy Free: Key Lime Pie
articleBodyHTML: Sometimes, indulgence is okay. And it’s better than okay when you work to make that dessert as healthy as possible, like we do with this easy, dairy-free key lime pie!
articleSummaryHTML: Sometimes, indulgence is okay. And it’s better than okay when you work to make that dessert as healthy as possible, like we do with this easy, dairy-free key lime pie!
seoTitle: Yummy, Easy & Dairy Free: Key Lime Pie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Sometimes, indulgence is okay. And it’s better than okay when you work to make that dessert as healthy as possible, like this dairy free key lime pie!
recipeName: Yummy, Easy & Dairy Free: Key Lime Pie
ingredients:
s:616:"

For the Crust:

  • 1 ½ cups graham crackers
  • ½ cups coconut butter

For the Filling:

  • 1 avocado
  • 1 can coconut creme
  • 1 box organic vanilla pudding mix
  • 1 tablespoon gelatin  or agar agar
  • 3 ounces key lime juice
  • 1 tablespoon key lime zest
";
directions:
For the Crust

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees and spray a pie pan with nonstick spray.
  2. Combine all ingredients in a food processor and press into the pie pan.
  3. Bake for 8 minutes and set aside to cool completely.

For the Filling

  1. Whisk the gelatin (agar agar) into the lime juice until dissolved and set aside to “bloom.”
  2. In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine coconut cream and pudding mix until it is well combined. Add the gelatin, lime juice mixture and lime zest. Bring to a boil and continue stirring for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
  3. Immediately pour the pudding mixture into a high powered blender with one avocado and blend to combine.
  4. Pour into the cooled crust.
  5. Chill for at least 90 minutes before slicing.

articleBodyHTML:
Be the winner of your Super Bowl party this year with these vegan deviled potatoes!

A super healthy snack for this year’s Super Bowl is deviled potatoes. Taste way better than deviled eggs and to be honest, I was never a fan of deviled eggs. So, when I made this recipe, I wasn’t sure if I would like them. I am sure glad I did because these are delicious! Trust me; you can’t just have one bite. These will be a hit. Last time I made them, they were gone before the game started, so you will need to make plenty of these for your guests. They are both tasty, healthy, and very filling than most snacks at a Super Bowl party.
articleSummaryHTML: Be the winner of your Super Bowl party this year with these vegan deviled potatoes!
seoTitle: Vegan Deviled Potatoes | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Be the winner of your Super Bowl party this year with these vegan deviled potatoes!
ingredients:
s:425:"
  • 12 small red potatoes
  • 1 tablespoon spicy mustard or regular yellow mustard
  • ½ cup of vegan mayo
  • A dash of almond milk
  • Chives for garnish
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Paprika for garnish
";
directions:
1. Wash potatoes and cut them in half. Place in a steamer and cook until a knife inserts easily. Or you can put them in the oven at 375 degrees for 35 minutes. Make sure to cook thoroughly.
  2. Allow to cool slightly. Using a small melon baller, scoop out the center of each potato and place into a bowl and smash.
  3. In a small bowl, combine mustard, vegan mayo, salt, pepper, and paprika. Add the mashed potatoes to the mixture, and, if it's too thick, add a small splash of almond milk to loosen slightly. You want it smooth and creamy. It is ok if it has tiny chunks in it.
  4. Using a large star tip and disposable piping bag, pipe the mixture into the hollowed out potatoes. Or you can use a plastic baggy and cut the corner off.
  5. Sprinkle paprika and chives on top for garnish.
  6. Serve room temperature, or you can warm in the oven.

Go Team Go!

Happy Snacking!

articleTitle: No-Bake Peanut Butter Cup Chocolate Dream Cookies
articleBodyHTML:
Cue the angels, we have found something wonderful enough to merit a heavenly choir: no-bake peanut butter chocolate dream cookies!

Ever wonder what heaven on earth is? Peanut Butter and chocolate together. With these peanut butter chocolate dream cookies, these two love birds mesh together to create a masterpiece. This version of a peanut butter cup is made with only a handful of ingredients and without gluten, refined sugars or additives. They are better than store bought cookies and are one hundred times healthier. These peanut butter cups are so much fun to make, and they are delicious if you dunk them in a giant glass of almond milk. These peanut butter cups require no baking and minimal cleanup!

We use natural peanut butter in this recipe instead of regular peanut butter. When you take a stroll in the supermarket in the peanut butter isle, you will notice an abundance of nut butters. We see smooth, crunchy, chocolate, or even festive flavors brought in during seasonal times. The problem with most of these brands is that there is an abundance of additives such as salt, sugar, and hydrogenated oils. When you purchase, natural peanut butter is where it’s at. You want 100% peanuts without additives. Many retailers now even have machines that allow you to grind your own nuts into nut butter. This goes for cashews, almonds, and peanuts!

One of the best ways to make these peanut butter cups is using a muffin tray. All you need to do is oil the inside of each slot and place peanut mixture inside. Pop in the freezer and remove. Drizzle with delicious chocolate and voila! If you have silicon molds, these will pop out very easily. These peanut butter cups can be made ahead of time and placed in the freezer in an airtight container. These peanut butter cups are a great gift giving idea.
articleSummaryHTML: Cue the angels, we have found something wonderful enough to merit a heavenly choir: no-bake peanut butter chocolate dream cookies!
seoTitle: No-Bake Peanut Butter Cup Chocolate Dream Cookies
seoDescription: Cue the angels, we have found something wonderful enough to merit a heavenly choir: no-bake peanut butter chocolate dream cookies!
recipeName: No-Bake Peanut Butter Chocolate Dream Cookies
ingredients:
s:497:"
  • ½ cup natural peanut butter + 2 tablespoons peanut butter
  • ½ scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus natural protein
  • 1 tablespoon coconut flour
  • ½ cup vegan chocolate chips (Enjoy life) or ½ cup dark chocolate
  • 1 teaspoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1. In a small bowl, combine ½ cup peanut butter 1 tablespoon coconut flour, and Sunwarrior Classic Plus protein

2. Form mixture into rounds. Place in freezer for 1 hour.

3. Remove from freezer and slice horizontally. Add additional peanut butter onto one-half. Place the other half on top.

4. Melt chocolate with coconut oil. Dip each round into chocolate mixture and return to freezer to set for two hours

articleBodyHTML:
This refreshing chilled green goddess detox soup is just what you need to restore balance to your system.

For healing and balance, a good detox can cleanse your mind and body and increase your energy. When it's cool, creamy, and tastes great, you know you've done it right.

seoDescription: This refreshing chilled green goddess detox soup is just what you need to restore balance to your system.
