articleBodyHTML:
A healthy, tasty breakfast just got easy! Let us help you get on with your day after filling up the right way.

This delicious, slightly tangy yogurt uses the coconut meat from young Thai coconuts. It is super simple to make (especially now that I can buy the coconut meat already frozen at the health food store nearby).

As much as I love drinking the water and scooping out the meat from the coconut itself, I can happily say I don’t miss karate chopping those coconuts with a cleaver. When I first tasted coconut meat fresh from the coconut itself, I instantaneously fell in love with it! It is amazing how many creative dishes you can make with coconut meat, and it’s a great substitute for dairy. If you are vegan, have an allergy to dairy, or are choosing to limit dairy, this alternative is for you.

For the probiotics, I use Friendly Flora by Health Force Nutritionals. It has a whopping 100 billion organisms per teaspoon. Make sure to do a probiotic check to make sure it is dairy free if you are vegan or sensitive to dairy. Friendly Flora happens to be vegan.

Making coconut yogurt may sound pretty ambitious, and you may opt to just buy some from the store instead, however, know it’s easy, and there is nothing like homemade!
articleSummaryHTML: A healthy, tasty breakfast just got easy! Let us help you get on with your day after filling up the right way.
seoTitle: Coconut Yogurt Breakfast Bowl
seoDescription: A healthy, tasty breakfast just got easy! Let us help you get on with your day after filling up the right way.
ingredients:
s:794:"

Breakfast Bowl

  • 1 cup coconut yogurt
  • 2 tablespoons chia gel
  • 1 tablespoon sunflower seeds
  • 1 tablespoon pumpkin seeds
  • 1 tablespoon cacao nibs
  • ½ cup frozen blueberries
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla essence

Coconut Yogurt

  • 1 cup young Thai coconut meat
  • ½ to 1 cup of water or coconut water (depends on how thick you like your yogurt)
  • 1 teaspoon of probiotic powder
";
directions:
Yogurt

In a blender, add the coconut meat and vanilla bean powder. Add the water a little bit at a time; pulsate so you can judge how thick and creamy you like it. Blend until you have a smooth yogurt consistency.

Add probiotics powder and pulsate gently or fold in using a spoon.

Place the yogurt in a glass bowl and let it stand at room temperature (in a relatively warm area) for 15 to 24 hours to help activate the probiotics. It should taste a little sour.

Refrigerate. Yogurt should last for three days.

Breakfast Bowl Assembly

Place the yogurt in a bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients (chia gel, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, cacao nibs, and frozen blueberries).

Drizzle vanilla essence on top. Eat and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Giving your loved ones the gift of health and well-being with this chocolate protein cheesecake will trump any box of store bought chocolates!

Valentine’s Day is a special day of the year where we take a moment to give thanks to the people around us who support and love us unconditionally. Whether it’s for your family, spouse, children, or friend, Valentine’s Day is also a time where it can be fun to showcase your baking skills and creativity. Show the these people how much we love them by making a rocking protein cheesecake that is gluten free, grain free, vegan, protein-packed, and absolutely delicious.

Cheesecake is one of those decadent desserts that sometimes we cringe about because we know it’s loaded with sugar, dairy, and refined ingredients. Most store-bought cheesecakes are commercially prepared, so there is a huge number of saturated fats. Saturated fats are to be blamed for elevated cholesterol in your blood which can lead to heart disease and stroke. The base for this cheesecake is cashews which have a high percentage of unsaturated fatty acids which helps with reducing blood pressure and helps prevent weight loss. Cashews also contain lutein which is found in carrots. Lutein helps with eye sight and keeps eyes protected from light.

The base of the cheesecake is also made with dates and raw nuts. Since the dates are naturally sweet, we reduce the amount of sugar in the entire recipe. Dates also boost a large amount of fiber which makes them the best natural sweetener around.

This cheesecake takes a little bit of time to make, but I promise it is worth it. One of the best parts of this recipe is that it can be made weeks ahead of time and stored in the freezer in an air tight container. All you need to do is take it out and let it thaw for a few hours then top it with additional fruits or coconut whip cream.
articleSummaryHTML: Giving your loved ones the gift of health and well-being with this chocolate protein cheesecake will trump any box of store bought chocolates!
seoTitle: Chocolate Protein Cheesecake
seoDescription: Giving your loved ones the gift of health and well-being with this chocolate protein cheesecake will trump any box of store bought chocolates!
ingredients:
s:1061:"

Crust

  • 1 cup raw pecans
  • 1 cup raw walnuts
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 Medjool dates
  • 1/8 teaspoon Himalayan salt

Filling

  • 1 to 2 cups raw cashews, soaked for 4 hours or overnight
  • 1/3 cup coconut oil
  • 1/3 cup maple syrup
  • Seeds from ½ vanilla bean or 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/8 teaspoon sea salt
  • ½ cup water
  • 2 teaspoon lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon raw cacao powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus chocolate protein
";
directions:
1.) Place all ingredients for crust into a food processor. Pulse until it forms together. Press mixture into a 6-inch parchment paper-lined spring form pan. Place in freezer to set while making the filling.

2.) Drain the cashews, rinse them, and drain again. Place the cashews, maple syrup, vanilla, salt, cacao, Sunwarrior Classic Plus chocolate protein, and lemon juice in a food processor. Process to a paste and scrape down the sides of the bowl. Add water and blend again. Scraping down the side of the bowl. Add coconut oil, and blend until combined. The consistency should be super smooth

3.) Pour filling into spring form pan and freeze for 6–8 hours

4.) Serve with fruits, coconut whip cream, or maraschino cherries

articleBodyHTML:
Stopping with just one of these two-bite brownies is hard! Don’t worry; these brownie bites are protein and fiber rich. Eat more than one—guilt free!

Some treats are perfect for any time of the year, but with the Super Bowl and Valentine’s Day fast approaching, they become a little extra special. And if you add the maca root powder and pair it with the chocolate, this treat also works as an aphrodisiac.

Protein and fiber rich, these two-bite brownies can be eaten for breakfast and even suffice as pre-workout fuel with the bonus of a little caffeine kick from the chocolate and espresso (if you’re going the espresso route). No matter when you choose to have them or why you want them; it’s a super easy-to-make recipe and one we suggest you share with all those you love. Make them as a gift and include the recipe. Just be sure to credit the creator, thanks.
articleSummaryHTML: Stopping with just one of these two-bite brownies is hard! Don’t worry; these brownie bites are protein and fiber rich. Eat more than one—guilt free!
seoTitle: Black Bean Brownie Bites
seoDescription: Stopping with just one of these two-bite brownies is hard! Don’t worry; these brownie bites are protein and fiber rich. Eat more than one—guilt free!
ingredients:
s:1709:"
  • 1 15 oz. can organic black or adzuki beans, drained or 1 ¾ cups pre-cooked
  • ½ cup cacao powder
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 2 tablespoons ground flax
  • 5 tablespoons coconut water
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract (or 2 teaspoons brandy or coffee liqueur)
  • ½ cup maple syrup or agave or coconut syrup, (1/3 cup is fine for me)
  • ½ cup Sunbutter (smooth or crunchy or Organic)
  • 1/3 cup chopped chocolate – choose organic, dairy free
  • Fleur de sel

Optional

  • 1 teaspoon espresso powder or ground coffee
  • 2 tablespoons maca powder
  • 1–2 servings Sunwarrior vanilla, chocolate, or mocha protein powder
  • Sprinkle with coconut flakes or fleur de sel before baking

Topping Options:

Raw-Tella or raw hazelnut n cacao nut butter, chocolate shavings, espresso, Sunwarrior protein or raw cacao powder, or cacao nibs

";
directions:
1. Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees , and prepare a mini muffin tin with a brush of coconut oil or mini parchment paper cups.
  2. Mix the ground flax with the coconut water
  3. Measure all the ingredients (except toppings) into the bowl or a food processor or high-speed blender and blast until just smooth. Taste and adjust sweetener if desired then stir in the chopped chocolate.
  4. Spoon into the prepared muffin cups to two-thirds full then top each with approximately ½ teaspoon Sunbutter, swirling until marbled slightly. Sprinkle with sea salt. Bake approx. 20–25 minutes or until the brownies are just done. They will still look soft in the center, and that’s ideal.
  5. Let cool on a rack for a few minutes, enjoy as is or drizzle each with a little raw-Tella or chocolate shavings and any of the variations if using. Continue to cool completely then store in a covered container or freeze up to one month.

articleBodyHTML:
No, really. Gingerbread bread is what we’re making here today: bread with all those cozy gingerbread flavors.

Gingerbread is one of those foods with a very short season for in-style consuming. But sometimes fashion is flawed, which is why we’re bringing you gingerbread post fa-la-la-la-la season. We don’t follow trends. We make our own. And we make our own bread, too.
articleSummaryHTML: No, really. Gingerbread bread is what we’re making here today: bread with all those cozy gingerbread flavors.
seoTitle: Vegan Gingerbread Bread | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: No, really. Gingerbread bread is what we’re making here today: bread with all those cozy gingerbread flavors.
ingredients:
s:1099:"
  • 2 tablespoons ground flax meal
  • ¼ cup and 2 tablespoons warm water
  • 1 ½ cup oat flour
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic vanilla protein
  • 1 cup coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 teaspoon ginger
  • 1 teaspoon ground cloves
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 ¼ cup pumpkin puree
  • ¼ cup molasses
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 tablespoons almond milk
  • ¼ cup chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
  2. In a small copper bowl, dump in your flax meal and warm water. Mix the flax meal and water together and set aside.
  3. In a large mixing bowl, dump in oat flour, Sunwarrior Classic vanilla protein, coconut sugar, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, ground cloves, sea salt. Mix all that flavor together and set it aside.
  4. In a smaller mixing bowl, mix in the pumpkin, molasses, and vanilla. Then add your flax meal mixture and mix it in with the rest.
  5. Now, add your bowl of wet ingredients to your bowl of dry ingredients so they can have a party together.
  6. Add your almond milk and chocolate chips to really get the party going.
  7. Spritz your loaf pan with some coconut oil spray. Pour the mixture into your loaf pan and place in your preheated oven.
  8. Bake for 50–55 minutes

And there you have it: freshly baked gingerbread bread that tastes amazing. Always in style, always in season.

articleBodyHTML:
Valentine’s Day is referred to some people as a time for cuddles and calories. We encourage cuddles, but we’re here to cut calories without cutting flavor with this dark chocolate and raspberry shake!

Valentine’s Day can sometimes create havoc on our New Year’s goals by over indulging on sweets. Instead of growing your waistline, grow your health and love for the people around you. Change things around this year by surprising your loved one with a superfood protein shake that will energize them the entire day.

This protein-packed smoothie is filled with super foods. It contains chia seeds, hemp seeds, Camu Camu powder, Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein, cacao, and lucuma. Chia seeds are high in fiber and are packed with protein. Chia seeds help to keep you fuller longer as they expand in your stomach after ingested. Hemp hearts are rich in omega 3 and 6 fatty acids. Hemp hearts are one of nature’s most perfect and well-balanced foods. They help with weight loss, sustain energy levels, reduce inflammation, and contain more protein (when compared gram for gram) than chicken. These hemp hearts are very easy for the stomach to digest therefore we rapidly reap all of the benefits after being consumed.

Camu powder is one of those mysterious ingredients that we hear or see in recipes or in health food supermarkets. Camu Camu is a fruit that has one of the highest concentrations of vitamin c in the world. It also has an impressive amount of iron and calcium. Camu is rich in vitamin c and can help balance out hormone levels which are nature’s natural antioxidant. Lastly, lucuma is a natural sweetener. It is derived from a fruit just like Camu Camu. It can sweeten foods without raising blood sugar levels. This is the perfect sweetener for individuals who suffer from diabetes. Lucuma is rich in fiber which can help the digestive system function properly. Lucuma powder is wonderful to bake with as it replaces the need for refined sugars.

This superfood smoothie is guaranteed to give you an extra surge of energy to enjoy a fun filled day with loved ones.
articleSummaryHTML: Valentine’s Day is referred to some people as a time for cuddles and calories. We encourage cuddles, but we’re here to cut calories without cutting flavor with this dark chocolate and raspberry shake!
seoTitle: Dark Chocolate and Raspberry Shake | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Valentine’s Day is referred to some people as a time for cuddles and calories. Cut the calories this year with the best dark chocolate and raspberry shake!
ingredients:
s:441:"
  • 1 cup frozen raspberries
  • ½ banana
  • ½ cup unsweetened almond milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein
  • 1 tablespoon chia seeds
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 1 tablespoon hemp seeds
  • 1 teaspoon Camu Camu powder
  • 1 teaspoon lucuma powder
";
directions: Put all ingredients in your blend, blend, and pour!

articleBodyHTML:
The Super Bowl is around the corner, and that means SNACK TIME! Be the winner of the Super Bowl this year by keeping it healthy.

Most snack food items at a Super Bowl party are processed foods full of fat, sugar, GMO’s and other chemical ingredients. It may taste good at the time, but you will end up paying for it later. I am a fit foodie and always look for healthier alternatives because that is what a Healthinista does, right? What you eat is what you wear, and you don’t want to wear an inflammation suit of chemicals; trust me!

Ready to snack on something that will give your energy to cheer on your favorite team? You can still have your favorite fun snacks but without all the bad fat and calories. Try these cauliflower buffalo bites in place of Buffalo wings. They are AH-MAZING for feasting. I found a great recipe on the internet years back, and it is has been one of my favorite snacks. They go fast at a party. Make sure to make plenty because they will not last long! GO TEAM GO!
articleSummaryHTML: The Super Bowl is around the corner, and that means SNACK TIME! Be the winner of the Super Bowl this year by keeping it healthy.
seoTitle: Vegan Super Bowl Buffalo Bites | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: The Super Bowl is around the corner, and that means SNACK TIME! Be the winner of the Super Bowl this year with Sunwarrior Health Hub's vegan buffalo bites.
ingredients:
s:533:"
  • 1 head organic cauliflower chopped into bite size piece
  • ½ cup organic brown rice flour
  • ½ cup filtered water
  • ¼ teaspoon of organic garlic powder
  • Pinch of Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon Earth Balance vegan butter melted
  • ½ cup of your favorite organic vegan buffalo sauce
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 450F.
  2. In a small bowl, combine brown rice flour, water, garlic powder, and salt. Mix thoroughly with a whisk.
  3. Dip cauliflower pieces in the batter until coated evenly, then place on a parchment paper sheet.
  4. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the batter hardens, flip with a spatula, and bake for another 5 minutes.
  5. Whisk together buffalo sauce and Earth Balance butter in a small bowl.
  6. When the cauliflower is finished, take a brush and evenly brush each piece with the buffalo hot sauce mixture, or dip cauliflower into batter.
  7. Bake coated cauliflower for an additional 8–10 minutes or until cauliflower is crispy and sauce is absorbed.
  8. Remove from oven.
  9. Let cauliflower bites set out for at least 20 minutes before serving and enjoy!

Happy snacking!

articleBodyHTML:
Some people’s love might be the color of a red, red rose, but mine is the color of chocolate. DIY your valentine gift by making your own chocolate for your loved ones this year!

Valentine’s Day is a time for love, sweetness, and chocolates of course! Store bought chocolates are wonderful and sweet, but wouldn’t it be sweeter to make your own special chocolates for the ones you love? Valentine’s Day is that one time a year where giving the gift of an entire box of chocolates is totally acceptable. But how many people know that making their own chocolate is very simple. All you need to do is melt down the cocoa butter, add a little touch of maple syrup and voila. You can add cocoa powder, cocoa nibs, sea salt, fruits or nuts. Depending on what your valentine preferences, you can personalize these chocolates to their liking.

Raw cocoa butter is 100 pure and obtained from the cocoa bean. It is rich and velvety without all of the added chemicals white chocolate has. Cocoa is high in antioxidants and healthy fats which will give you a boost of energy. Cacao butter is naturally rich in omega 6 and 9 which can support an overall better health and well-being. Cacao butter looks like white chocolate when you purchase it, and it has the same mouth feel. Store-bought white chocolate is filled with added sugars and chemicals. These homemade chocolates are naturally sweetened, vegan, gluten-free, and there are no added ingredients.

You can buy as an assortment of molds to experiment. Since it’s Valentine’s Day, heart shape molds can be found at many retailers, but you can also mold them into squares or bars. Silicon baking molds are highly recommended for this recipe as they are easy to remove. These freeze very well. You can make a big batch, pop them in the freezer and have a guilt free dessert after dinner.

These chocolates are not only rich and decadent, but they are also creamy and simple to make!  These chocolates are what dreams are made of. We promise that these chocolates will lead to a cascade of hugs, kisses, and cuddles.
articleSummaryHTML: Some people’s love might be the color of a red, red rose, but mine is the color of chocolate. DIY your valentine gift by making your own chocolate for your loved ones this year!
seoTitle: Valentine’s Day Vegan Chocolates | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: When speaking of Valentine's Day, the conversation often starts with roses and chocolates. Try Sunwarrior's best vegan chocolate recipe this year!
ingredients:
s:275:"
  • 1 cup cocoa butter
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup

Add-ins:

  • Fruit, sea salt, cacao nibs, seeds, nuts, vanilla extract, mint extract
";
directions: Over low heat. Blend the cocoa butter, maple syrup, and any mix-ins. Pour into molds, and removed once they’ve solidified.

articleBodyHTML:
We’re here to buff up that coffee with this great coffee smoothie recipe that makes your morning wake-up call a whole lot smoother.

Lots of people love coffee. Coffee is one of my favorite drinks. Its powerful aroma, rich and smooth taste, and of course, the energy it gives me that I need for the day. But, sometimes the effect of coffee is short lived as it gets quickly absorbed in the blood stream. Adding a bit of healthy fat to a coffee drink not just makes it delicious and creamy but allows your body to absorb it slowly and give you a consistent energy release.

Here is a vegan coffee smoothie recipe that will make you fall in love your cup of Joe all over again!
articleSummaryHTML: We’re here to buff up that coffee with this great coffee smoothie recipe that makes your morning wake-up call a whole lot smoother.
seoTitle: Vegan Coffee Butter Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub

s:412:"
  • 1 cup brewed coffee
  • 1 tablespoon palm sugar (honey optional)
  • 1 tablespoon raw coconut butter
  • 1 teaspoon Maca powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus Vanilla or Chocolate protein
";
directions:
1. Make a batch of your favorite black coffee
  2. Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients along with coffee until smooth and creamy

Enjoy this first thing in your morning or even as a pre-workout drink to give you that extra oomph factor!

articleTitle: Green Velvet Squash n’ Cinnamon Spice Smoothie
articleBodyHTML:
A little squash can “squash” out the low energy doldrums! Spice up your day with this green velvet squash and cinnamon spice smoothie!

There are some days when smooth, comforting foods are an absolute necessity. While smoothies are most often on the menu to start my day, it’s a combo like this that delivers the sense of a long-held hug.

A long blast in the blender with extra ice keeps this smoothie cold while still giving the texture of liquid velvet. Once you taste test this for yourself, I am confident you’ll know what I mean and may want it two days in a row (maybe even three). Just garnish it differently so you can keep things new.

Besides all these great yum-factor features – knowing this smoothie is good for me adds to the comfort factor. The warming, fragrant seasoning also delivers bonus benefits of balancing blood sugar, boosting the immune system, and aiding in digestion. While this smoothie is fabulous all year round, it delivers a sense of indulgence while supporting your New Year’s resolutions for a healthier diet. Here is to the most awesome you in 2017!
articleSummaryHTML: A little squash can “squash” out the low energy doldrums! Spice up your day with this green velvet squash and cinnamon spice smoothie!
seoTitle: Green Velvet Squash n’ Cinnamon Spice Smoothie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: A little squash can “squash” out the low energy doldrums! Spice up your day with this green velvet squash & cinnamon spice smoothie from Sunwarrior.

s:940:"
  • ½ cup frozen or leftover cooked squash
  • 1 heaping cup spinach and radicchio
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein

";

Measure ingredients into a powerful blender and blast until creamy adding more liquid or ice as desired.

Top with raw cacao nibs, berries, or orange zest and additional spices.

articleTitle: Crockpot Apple and Steel Cut Oats Breakfast
articleBodyHTML:
Start the day off right by waking up to breakfast already done! These apple and steel cut oats taste like happiness, and the crock pot does all the work!

Hot cereal is delicious on a cold morning. It warms your insides, making the outside cold something pleasant. But making steel cut oats in the morning for your kids before they go to school is sometimes not possible. And eating just a plain bowl of quick oats gets a little boring for everyone. Sure, you can mix it up a bit, but it still takes time that might be better spent elsewhere. This is where crockpot oats comes in!

You can mix these delicious steel cut oats the night before, and it’ll be hot when you get up. It will only take a few minutes. You can cook this in a smaller crockpot (3 or 4 quarts) or if you have a larger one, just mix the ingredients in a bowl that will fit in your crockpot and add water up ¾ of the way up the bowl. I find that cooking the oats in the bowl actually makes the oats not cook so fast and so you can cook the oats all night long.

This is also an excellent way to use up old apples that aren’t bad but don’t really look good. Just chop them up and add them in.

What isn’t there to love about apples and cinnamon? Apples give you much-needed fiber and vitamin C to help fight off colds. The cinnamon is also a delicious antioxidant just like the apples. I can’t think of a better way to start your day than with a delicious bowl of hot cereal!
articleSummaryHTML: Start the day off right by waking up to breakfast already done! These apple and steel cut oats taste like happiness, and the crock pot does all the work!
seoTitle: Crockpot Apple and Steel Cut Oats Breakfast | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Start your day off right with Sunwarrior and our recipes. These apple and steel cut oats taste like happiness, and the crock pot does all the work!
recipeName: Crockpot Apple and Steel Cut Oats Breakfast
ingredients:
s:586:"
  • 2 medium-sized apples, cored and cut into ½ inch pieces
  • 1 ½ cup almond milk
  • 1 ½ cup water
  • 1 cup uncooked steel cut oats
  • 2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil (optional)
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 tablespoon flax seed
  • ½ teaspoon salt
";
directions:
Spritz crockpot or bowl with coconut oil that’ll you’ll be using for cereal. Add all ingredients to the crockpot or bowl. Mix together. Cover and cook for about 7 hours.

Dish into bowl(s). Add additional sweetener and milk if desired. Store leftovers in the fridge.

articleTitle: Happy Valentine’s Day Cake Pop Hearts
articleBodyHTML:
A celebration of sweethearts begs the attention of something extra sweet. These Valentine’s Day cake pop hearts will put a little more pink in your holiday!

Here is a quick and easy way to make cake pops without having to buy any fancy cake pop maker or mold and allowing you to avoid a messy cake mix, frosting disaster (if you made these from scratch, you know what I mean).

All you need is a cake loaf. In this recipe, I opted to try Organic Oven’s lemon loaf as I wanted something that was the consistency of pound cake. You can also use Sweets from the Earth’s gluten free chocolate cake if you are a real chocolate lover.

The only other equipment you need is a heart-shaped cookie cutter and cake pop sticks.

This can be fun to make with the kids for Valentine’s Day. What kid doesn’t love to use cookie cutters and dip chocolate?
articleSummaryHTML: A celebration of sweethearts begs the attention of something extra sweet. These Valentine’s Day cake pop hearts will put a little more pink in your holiday!
seoTitle: Valentine’s Day Cake Pop Hearts | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: A celebration of lovers begs the attention of something extra sweet. Sunwarrior's Valentine’s Day cake pop hearts will add flare for your holiday.
recipeName: Happy Valentine’s Day Cake Pop Hearts
ingredients:
s:275:"
  • 1 cake loaf (vegetarian or vegan)
  • 1 cup coconut oil (melted)
  • ½ cup of raw cocoa powder
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup (or to taste)
";
directions:
1. Liquefy the coconut oil at low heat in a pan or place in a glass container and melt in a double boiler.
  2. Add the melted coconut oil, raw cacao powder, and maple syrup in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. Slice the cake loaf approximately ¾ of an inch thick. Using a heart shape cookie cutter, cut as many hearts out of each slice of cake loaf that it allows.
  4. Dip the cake pop stick into the melted chocolate, and then insert them into the cake pop heart. Let the chocolate set in the fridge or freezer for 5 minutes. This can help avoid the cake from falling off the stick.
  5. Once the sticks have set into the cake, dip each cake pop into the chocolate slowly. Make sure not to over soak the cake pop. You can always double dip later. Wait until all the chocolate on the cake has had a chance to drip completely off before placing it upright in a glass jar to chill in the freezer. After all the cake pops on the sticks have been dipped in chocolate, put them in the freezer until the chocolate has hardened.
  6. If you like, you can re-dip them in a second layer of chocolate
  7. Chill them one last time to set the chocolate (approximately 10-15 min)

**Please note the bling in the center is not edible it is purely for photo purposes. Get creative and decorate as you wish.

articleTitle: Valentine’s Chocolate to Boost Your Health
articleBodyHTML:
Chocolate is magic. Okay, not really, but it provides benefits that seem magical. Cocoa flavanols improve your mood, boost health, and so, so much more! We’ve got the recipe for magic!

What are Flavanols?

Flavanols are natural plant-based phytochemical compounds found in various types of plants. These serve as antioxidants and provide a number of health benefits. Cocoa flavanols are particularly beneficial, which comes in handy this Valentine’s Day as they can be quite delicious, too. With all of the Valentine’s chocolate consumption, it’s nice to know you may be promoting your health! Be careful, though. Often times, the manufacturing involved with that chocolate bar may have taken out up to 80% of the health-aiding flavanols. To reap the promised health advantages of cocoa, make sure you know your flavanol facts! If you’re going to get your cocoa flavanols in chocolate, the darker the chocolate=the higher the amount of cocoa flavanols. When considering dark chocolates or cocoa powders, make sure it contains at least 50–80% of cocoa to actually contain enough flavanols to effectively boost those health benefits!

Health Benefits of Cocoa Flavanols

Promotes Circulatory Health  Maintaining a healthy circulatory system is vital for optimum overall health. Your circulatory system delivers oxygen and nutrients throughout your body, and cocoa flavanols encourage the blood vessels and arteries to stay flexible in order to adequately maintain cardiovascular health. Cocoa raises the nitric oxide levels within the body, widening your blood vessels and therefore assisting in lowering blood pressure and risk of stroke.

Natural Workout Supplement

This nitric oxide boost also makes it quite alluring to athletes for the workout benefits. The decreases stress on your circulatory system enables muscles to function and recover better. This increased rate at which the muscles can recover and repair damaged muscle tissue allows for a decrease in the soreness felt between workouts.

Contains Ample Antioxidants

No surprise here. The more antioxidants your body gets, the more you are warding off disease. Antioxidants target harmful free radicals in your bloodstream that may trigger disease or even cancer. Eliminating those risks by supplying your body with enough antioxidants is something we can all cheer for.

Helps Prevent Cognitive Decline and Possibly Dementia

Cocoa flavanols increase blood flow to the brain, which often decreases with age. By keeping up this healthy blood flow, you’re promoting healthy brain function, aiding in learning and memory, as well as reducing your risks for serious complications later in life.

Assists in Curing Fatigue and Sleep Deprivation

Due to the outstanding benefits to your circulatory system, cocoa flavanols are said to assist in curing insomnia or other issues related to sleep deprivation. A healthy heart and blood pressure will help stop those restless nights tossing and turning.

Can Lower Bad Cholesterol

The plant compounds specific to cocoa flavanols prevent LDL cholesterol (‘bad” cholesterol) from oxidizing. When LDL cholesterol is oxidized, it gets exposed to free radicals and produces inflammation in your arteries.

Improved Mood and Libido

Due to the cocoa flavanols ability to raise the levels of pleasure neurotransmitters (serotonin, dopamine, and phenylethylamine), it is said to be one of nature’s natural aphrodisiacs and mood enhancers. Phenylethylamine, or PEA, produces chemicals in the brain that are associated with falling in love. There’s no secret why a holiday associated with love is connected with so much chocolate! Furthermore, serotonin and dopamine are neurotransmitters proven to lift a person’s mood and relax the body.

With the health benefits cocoa flavanols provide, you don’t have to feel too guilty about treating yourself and your Valentine to that chocolate. Just remember, to reap the optimal benefits, you do want to ensure you're consuming a treat with at least 50-80% of cocoa flavanols, and be mindful of the caloric intake. If you can’t find a chocolate treat containing the desired high levels of cocoa flavanols, you can always make it yourself! There are plenty of delicious recipes that provide the benefits of cocoa flavanols without all of the unnecessary additives and calorie-soaring extras. For a sweet and healthy way of including cocoa flavanols in your diet, check out this recipe!
articleSummaryHTML: Chocolate is magic. Okay, not really, but it provides benefits that seem magical. Cocoa flavanols improve your mood, boost health, and so, so much more! We’ve got the recipe for magic!
seoTitle: Healthy Valentine’s Chocolate | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Chocolate is magic. Sunwarrior Health Hub's recipe provides benefits that seem magical. Cocoa flavanols improves your mood, boost health, & much more.
ingredients:
s:429:"
  • 225–250 g solid cacao butter (broken chunks, about 1 cup Cacao butter is the raw version)
  • 6–7 tablespoons raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
  • 3–4 tablespoons agave
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract/essence
  • 1 tablespoon almond slivers or shavings
";
directions:
1. Bring a quarter-full saucepan of water to boil and turn the heat down to simmering. Add cacao butter to a heatproof bowl and place over the simmering water. Make sure no water gets in the cacao butter.
  2. Stirring with a spatula, heat the cacao butter, and when almost all melted, add the cacao powder, vanilla, and agave to the melted cacao butter and whisk until dissolved and well incorporated.
  3. Line a tray with baking paper. Pour the chocolate into the tray and let it spread into a thin bark layer. While still melted, sprinkle almonds.
  4. Place the tray in the fridge for at least 2 hours. The bark will solidify within 30 minutes. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Roasted Vegan Cauliflower Tex-Mex Taco Meat
articleBodyHTML:
It’s taco night! Going vegan doesn’t mean taco night is a thing of the past. We’ve got it right here as tasty and perfect as ever.

A wonderful vegan alternative to ground meat fabulous as is and with tacos, nachos, pizza, pasta, enchiladas, burritos, nachos or in Chili, Curries, soups Use to top salads, fill nori wraps, soft organic corn or flour tortillas, collards, lettuce leaves and rice paper wrappers. Add shredded seasonal veggies, and guacamole, piccolo, salsa, pesto or my Cashew Cheddar cheese for an amazing vegan meal everyone will love, meat eaters included. For an easy appetizer: spoon a little guacamole on tortilla chips or crackers, triangles of cabbage or peppers then top with the crumble, raw tomato sauce, and fresh cilantro.
articleSummaryHTML: It’s taco night! Going vegan doesn’t mean taco night is a thing of the past. We’ve got it right here as tasty and perfect as ever.
seoTitle: Roasted Vegan Cauliflower Taco Meat | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Taco night is the best! Sunwarrior has you covered with our roasted vegan cauliflower tex-mex taco meat recipe. Going vegan doesn't end taco night.
recipeName: Roasted Vegan Cauliflower Tex-Mex Taco Meat
ingredients:
s:1065:"
  • 1 medium head organic white or orange cauliflower, wash, dry, cut into florets (approx 6 cups)
  • 3–4 garlic cloves, minced (approx 1 ½ teaspoons)
  • 2 cups raw walnut halves or pecans or almonds
  • 1 tomato, seeded and chopped (approx 1 cup)
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 tablespoon coconut aminos or organic gluten free, low sodium tamari
  • 1 teaspoon cumin or more to taste
  • 1 teaspoon mild chili powder
  • 1–2 teaspoon chipotle powder, or to taste
  • 1 ½ teaspoon smoked paprika, or to taste. If this is spicy, reduce the amount if needed
  • 3–4 tablespoon nutritional yeast, if desired
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt, or sea salt and black pepper, to taste
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350–375F degrees. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. In a food processor, process the cauliflower in batches until well minced, transferring to a large mixing bowl between batches. (Be mindful not to over process – ideally, texture will resemble rice). Pat the cauliflower with a towel if it is wet.

3. Add garlic to processor and whirl until minced, then add in walnuts, pecan or almonds and pulse to roughly chop.

4. Add the tomato and olive oil, pulsing to a crumbly texture. Stir this mixture into the cauliflower with remaining ingredients/spices until well blended. Taste and adjust seasonings. 5. Place mixture on the prepared baking sheet and spread out evenly. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour 15 minutes, stirring after 30 minutes and then every 15 minutes afterward, until crumbles are slightly dry and browned. Use as suggested for a delish meal you will make a fave. This combo stores in the refrigerator up to 3 days, and the freezer, up to 2 months.

Teri’s Note: I go heavy on the spices as it suits my palate. Use the lesser amount and taste to appease your preference. The flavors meld wonderfully as this roasts.

If eating raw decrease the amount of spices and garlic at first and adjust accordingly, to taste.

articleBodyHTML:
This cozy kettle corn is a healthy snack for those chilly winter nights when you’re snuggled down with a good book or a good movie.

Who doesn’t love a warm batch of savory sweet kettle corn while cuddling on the couch and binge-watching favorite television shows, especially on a cold winter day? So snuggle in with Talia Pollock, the charismatic host of Party in My Plants, as she breaks down the healthiest way to snack away your cuddle time with your fuzzy blankets and pillows this season. This cozy kettle corn won’t leave you with any regrets either, apart from a few lovers’ quarrels over who took the bigger handful perhaps. Let’s get started already!
articleSummaryHTML: This cozy kettle corn is a healthy snack for those chilly winter nights when you’re snuggled down with a good book or a good movie.
seoTitle: Kozy Kettle Corn | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Sunwarrior's cozy kettle corn recipe is a healthy snack for those chilly winter nights when you’re snuggled down with a good book or a good movie.
ingredients:
s:264:"
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 3 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • 1 tablespoon + 1 teaspoon coconut oil
  • ½ cups popcorn kernels
";
directions: In a teeny bowl or cup, mix together one-half a teaspoon of sea salt with three tablespoons of coconut sugar. In a large pot, dump in one tablespoon of coconut oil and heat it on medium to medium low. When you think it’s warm, drop in one popcorn kernel. If it bubbles around it, then you’re ready to add your half a cup of kernels. Once you do, shake that pot and don’t you dare stop. Enjoy the pop. Once it slows to every few seconds, it’s done! Turn off the heat and toss your delicious poppings into a mixing bowl. Drizzle this with a teaspoon of melted coconut oil and then your coconut sugar and sea salt mixture. Toss that together. That’s it. Easy, delicious snacking at your fingertips. Binge away!

articleBodyHTML:
Welcome to a sweet breakfast! Sweet and nourishing is the best combination ever.

What’s amazing about buckwheat is that it is not technically a grain, but a pseudo grain. This means it is higher in protein and fiber and makes it really easy to digest. If you are intolerant to gluten and grains, buckwheat might just be your answer. It is extremely hearty and sustaining. What I love most about these pancakes is that they leave you feeling nourished and not bloated! A huge plus when it comes to a sweet breakfast!
articleSummaryHTML: Welcome to a sweet breakfast! Sweet and nourishing is the best combination ever.
seoTitle: Blue Berry Buckwheat Pancakes | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Seeking a better breakfast? Follow this blue berry buckwheat pancakes recipe from Sunwarrior Health Hub for a fantastic, nutritious breakfast today.
ingredients:
s:653:"
  • 2 cups sifted buckwheat flour
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 2 teaspoons baking soda
  • 2 teaspoons maple crystals or coconut sugar
  • 3 tablespoons apple-cider vinegar
  • 2 cups rice milk or coconut milk
  • 1 to 2 very ripe bananas, mashed
  • 1 cup fresh or frozen organic blueberries
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1) In a small bowl, combine the buckwheat flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda and maple crystals. Set aside.

2) In a large bowl, combine the apple-cider vinegar and rice milk. Let sit for 5 to 10 minutes, then add the mashed banana.

3) Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Beat only until blended.

4) Add the blueberries.

5) Heat the coconut oil on a griddle. Using a 1-ounce ladle, pour the batter onto the greased griddle. Cook the pancakes until the bubbles in the batter break on the surface; flip and cook until browned. Repeat until you're out of batter.

6) Serve on a plate and top with maple syrup, cinnamon, fresh fruit, coconut yogurt, or cashew cream.

Vary It!

Try these pancakes with different fruits, such as cranberries or strawberries, or make the even more decadent by adding some non-dairy chocolate chips. You can also substitute another gluten-free or whole grain flour such as brown rice or oat flour for the buckwheat flour.

Bonus tip!

Add some homemade coconut whipped cream on top of these pancakes. Here is what you do. Put a can of organic full fat coconut milk in your fridge overnight. The next day, remove the cold coconut milk into a large bowl. Add in some sweetener (either 1 teaspoon coconut sugar or a few drops of stevia), cinnamon and vanilla. Then take a handheld blender and whip the cream until it is thick and frothy. Layer this goodness on your pancakes for a perfect topping!

articleBodyHTML:
Muffins make a good snack for breakfast, lunch, and in between. What makes them great is when you leave out the excess sugar and go gluten-free. Try great today!

Did you ever think that muffins could be made without flour? You better believe it because I discovered a chocolate chip banana muffin recipe that is gluten-free and nothing short of decadent. As someone who has eliminated flour from most of my diet, I am always on the hunt for recipes that allow me to eat some of my favorite snacks (that taste even better than the classics) while still feeling good about what I am putting into my body. There are two things I look for when baking: gluten-free and no added sugar in the batter (put down the sugar). This eliminates empty calories, spiking your cholesterol, and potentially fueling a slew of diseases that put your health at risk. With a little experimentation in the kitchen and consciously choosing to use healthy alternate ingredients to the traditional ones in most recipes, you can enjoy your favorite guilty pleasures at a much healthier cost.
articleSummaryHTML: Muffins make a good snack for breakfast, lunch, and in between. What makes them great is when you leave out the excess sugar and go gluten-free. Try great today!
seoTitle: Flourless Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Flourless Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins make a good snack for breakfast, lunch, and in between. Check out Sunwarrior Health Hub's unique recipe today.
ingredients:
s:408:"
  • 2 flax eggs
  • 2 ripe bananas
  • 1 cup almond butter
  • 1 dash organic vanilla extract
  • 4 tablespoons organic maple syrup
  • ½ cup cocoa powder (unsweetened)
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • ¼ tablespoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • Miniature vegan chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
  2. Spray a 12-cup muffin tin with extra virgin coconut oil
  3. Throw the ripe bananas into a large bowl and mash until smooth.
  4. Add the almond butter, eggs, vanilla extract, and maple syrup to the mashed bananas, and mix until blended.
  5. Add the salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cocoa powder to the mixture and stir together, folding the batter over to ensure the mixture is as smooth as possible (the mixture should be thick but free of chunks).
  6. Ration out the batter among the muffin tins (make sure the batter is distributed evenly by shaking the tin left to right).
  7. Place the vegan chocolate chips on top of the batter in each tin (use as many as you wish; I recommend 4 max).
  8. Place in the oven and bake for 23 minutes.
  9. Remove and let cool for 15 minutes.

Enjoy!

 Join our fitness challenge, and get healthy!

articleBodyHTML:
Get a glimpse of the summer that is just around the corner! Drink this tropical greens smoothie!

Not only does this smoothie give you a glimpse of the summer to come, but it's also healthy and will feed and soothe your mind and body! Afterward, you will feel more energized and ready to conquer the day. Remember; green smoothies during the winter will keep you healthy!

Health Benefits of Chia Seeds

  • Good source of energy boosting power
  • Promotes healthy skin
  • High fiber
  • Good source of protein, calcium, and potassium
  • Promotes a healthy heart

Health Benefits of Green Smoothies

  • Full of vitamins and minerals
  • Great way to get your daily greens
  • Lasting source of energy
  • Full of fiber

Health Benefits of Liquid Light

Liquid Light is a plant based fulvic acid mineral complex created by nature in ancient plant deposits well before modern pollutants existed. The ionic trace minerals are extracted using a cold process to create a liquid supplement that contains one of the most powerful nutrient transporters found in the natural world. Liquid light is perfect before, after, or during workouts to provide many minerals, including trace minerals, and electrolytes, but it plays a large role in protecting, nourishing, and detoxing cells with the might of fulvic acid. Fulvic acid acts as a cellular taxi, aiding assimilation of other nutrients." (Taken straight from Sunwarrior).
articleSummaryHTML: Get a glimpse of the summer that is just around the corner! Drink this tropical greens smoothie!
seoTitle: Tropical Greens Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get a glimpse of the summer that is just around the corner! What better way to celebrate than drink Sunwarrior's best vegan tropical greens smoothie.
ingredients:
s:509:"
  • ¾ cup apple juice
  • ¼ cup chia seeds, plus 1 tablespoon more for topping
  • 1 cup fresh or frozen spinach
  • 1/3 cup fresh or frozen kale
  • ¼ cup mango
  • ½ cup pineapple
  • 1 capful Liquid Light
";
directions: Add all ingredients to blender. Blend for 30–45 seconds. Top with 1 tablespoon of chia seeds and enjoy that one more splash of summer! Your mind and body will thank you!
videoDescritption: Add all ingredients to blender. Blend for 30–45 seconds. Top with 1 tablespoon of chia seeds and enjoy that one more splash of summer! Your mind and body will thank you!

articleBodyHTML:
Grapefruit season is here! And, what better way to showcase this healthy citrus, than with a fresh snack?

The peak of grapefruit season begins around Christmas and continues through April. Florida and Texas produce the most grapefruits in the U.S. Because grapefruits are low in calories and lower on the glycemic index, they are an ideal fruit for weight loss. Grapefruits will not spike your blood sugar or insulin levels the way some fruits will. The reason grapefruit is touted for weight loss is its ability to speed up the metabolism. Grapefruit can help the body burn fat when the metabolism is at a revved up state.

The Scripps Clinic 'Grapefruit Diet' study, led by Dr. Ken Fujioka, monitored the weight and metabolic factors of 91 obese men and women for 12 weeks.1 Each participant was randomly assigned to one of four groups to receive either placebo capsules along with 7 ounces of apple juice, grapefruit capsules with 7 ounces of apple juice, 8 ounces of grapefruit juice with a placebo capsule or half of a fresh grapefruit with a placebo capsule three times a day before each meal.

After 12 weeks, the fresh grapefruit group had lost the most weight at 3.52 lbs, the grapefruit juice group had lost 3.3 lbs, the grapefruit capsule group had lost 2.42 lbs, and the placebo group had lost 0.66 lbs. According to the researchers, there was also a significant reduction in 2-hour post-glucose insulin level in the grapefruit group compared with placebo.

Grapefruits are also packed with vitamins, vitamin A and C in particular! The combination of fiber, potassium, lycopene, vitamin C and choline found in grapefruit helps maintain a healthy heart. The beta-carotene in grapefruits also acts as an antioxidant. Your skin will benefit from all of these great vitamins and minerals too!

Flavonoids and phytonutrients found in grapefruit are another reason why this citrus is such a super fruit!

This fruit salad would be a great choice to compliment any meal, but breakfast especially. The pineapple juice and sweetener help cut the acidity that can sometimes come with grapefruits.

It is important to point out that grapefruits can interact with certain prescription drugs adversely. Always consult your doctor to find out about any negative interactions.

Pro tip: Grapefruit can be a pain to cut sometimes, especially in the morning when we are all short on time. Here are some tips to help make cutting a grapefruit into segments less stressful. Do this the night before and store in the fridge for quick access the next morning.

First, cut the citrus in half from top to bottom - not around the center! Lay one-half flat on the cutting board and peel the skin, leaving as much fruit as possible. Slice off the top cap of the peel. Pell away any leftover pith. Slice one segment as close to the membrane as possible and loosen the fruit to lift out the segment. Repeat for all segments.
articleSummaryHTML: Grapefruit season is here! And, what better way to showcase this healthy citrus, than with a fresh snack?
seoTitle: Lean & Clean Grapefruit | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Sunwarrior Health Hub wants you to know the health benefits of grapefruit. What better way to showcase this healthy citrus than with a fresh snack?
ingredients:
s:268:"
  • 4 oz. segmented grapefruit
  • 1–2 teaspoon pineapple juice
  • 1/2 teaspoon liquid sweetener of choice

Optional: chopped basil or mint

";
directions: Mix all the ingredients together and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
We give you homemade bread happiness without the hassle! Bread should rock, not be a rock, and this bread totally rocks!

To me, fresh homemade bread is the most comforting food in the world. However making it 100% whole wheat is so difficult. Whole-wheat flour is full of many nutrients like fiber and protein that are good for your diet, but why is it so hard to make bread that isn’t as heavy as a rock? I’ve searched for years trying to find a recipe that doesn’t produce a heavy loaf. I’ve tried countless recipes and always ending up with a rock of a loaf that no one wants to eat. So I just resolved myself to just using mostly whole-wheat and only a little white flour so the loaves aren’t so heavy and are edible. Finally, after years of searching, I have found a delicious loaf!

When making bread, one of the most important rules to know is adding too much flour will result in a heavy loaf. It is important to add just enough flour so the dough is tacky but still soft. Also adding the wheat gluten helps create a lighter loaf as well.

One thing that makes this recipe a winner, I think, is that you weigh the flour. You don’t just add cup after cup. Most of the time you will not need all the flour listed. When I made it the first time, I used a little more than half of the flour listed, but your results will vary. It may take a few times; breads take practice, after all. But hopefully, it’ll turn out just delicious for you as it did for me!
articleSummaryHTML: We give you homemade bread happiness without the hassle! Homemade bread should not be a stone in your stomach. Here's a recipe that give you bread that rocks rather than bread like a rock.
seoTitle: Homemade Whole Wheat Bread Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Check out this healthy homemade bread recipe from Sunwarrior without the hassle! Homemade bread should not be a stone in your stomach so try ours!
ingredients:
s:585:"
  • 40 oz. whole-wheat flour (about 7 to 8 cups)
  • 1 tablespoon yeast
  • ¼ cup vital wheat gluten
  • 1 cup whole oats
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice or vinegar
  • 3 ¼ cups very warm water
  • 1/3 cup canola oil
  • 1/3 cup coconut nectar (or honey for our vegetarian friends)
  • 1 tablespoon salt
";
directions:
In a large bowl, mix 2 ½ cups of wheat, yeast, wheat gluten, oats, and vinegar or lemon juice. Add warm water and mix well. Then add oil and nectar (or honey) and mix well again. Let it sit, covered, for 10 mins.

Once it has had time to rest, add salt and mix. Then gradually add enough flour, half a cup at a time, to make a tacky dough*. You may not need to use all the flour. Then knead the dough for 5 to 7 mins.

Form 2 to 3 loaves and put in sprayed loaf pans. Cover. Let rise until the bread is 2 inches above the top of the pan.

Heat oven to 350° and bake until bread sounds hollow when tapped or the internal temperature of bread reaches 170°. Remove from pan and let sit for 10 mins before cutting.

*When you touch the dough, if your hand comes away mostly clean, your dough is tacky.

articleBodyHTML:
Raw, vegan, and fast to make. These are the reasons this heirloom tomato gazpacho is the best soup out there!

Heirloom tomatoes are beautiful, fragrant and delicious. You don’t need to wait for hot summer days and nights to enjoy this bright and refreshing soup. This can be paired with a fresh loaf of ciabatta or eaten on its own. The best part about this soup is that it’s raw, vegan, and only takes a few minutes to make. There is no heating required, so all of the delicious nutrients and enzymes enact within the soup.

This soup doesn’t need to be pureed to be completely smooth. The beauty lays in the rustic textures of the tomatoes. You can add fresh herbs of choice such as basil, parsley, sage, tarragon or even mint. Each batch of this soup will be different colors based on the tomatoes you used. Since heirloom tomatoes can range from green to dark brown, the color and taste may change a little. You can drizzle pesto on top of the soup or even add some fresh avocado.

Tomatoes are incredibly healthy for you. They are a natural source of fiber and are low in sodium and calories. Tomatoes also have a high water content, so they keep you feeling fuller longer. Tomatoes contain beta-carotene which is the same enzyme found in carrots. Beta carotene can help protect your eyes and skin.

When summer comes, another variation of this soup would be to add some fresh watermelon. Watermelon and tomatoes are always in abundance during the summer, so why not mixed them together? This soup is perfect for family get-togethers, which means you will definitely want to tuck this recipe away for the summer when picnic season starts up (and definitely try the watermelon version)!

Once you blend all of the ingredients together, let this soup sit in the fridge for an hour or two to really absorb the flavors. Add a few chili peppers to give it heat, and you have the perfect soup.
articleSummaryHTML: Raw, vegan, and fast to make. These are the reasons this heirloom tomato gazpacho is the best soup out there!
seoTitle: Heirloom Tomato Gazpacho | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Raw, vegan, and fast to make. These are the reasons Sunwarrior Health Hub's heirloom tomato gazpacho recipe is the best soup out there!
ingredients:
s:560:"
  • 1–2 lbs. heirloom tomatoes
  • 1 cucumber, peeled
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 shallot
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 tablespoon sherry vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 1 cup mixed herbs of choice
";
directions: Place all ingredients in a food processor. Pulse on and off for 45 seconds. The texture should still have pieces of tomato and not completely smooth, Place in an airtight container in the fridge.

articleBodyHTML:
Need a healthy dinner in a hurry? We got you covered and then some with this great-tasting, kid-friendly chowder.

A quick soup on a busy night is just what you need, and here it is! This soup whips up in less than a half an hour. My kids really enjoy this soup and even request it on a regular basis. You don’t need any dairy for this recipe. Just make sure you pour out most, if not all, the liquid after the veggies cook. It’ll make the soup even creamier.

This soup actually has a lot of delicious veggies that make it very good for you. The potatoes, carrots, celery and onion all fill your diet with much-needed antioxidants. They also have many vitamins in them like K, A, C, B6, and B7.
articleSummaryHTML: Need a healthy dinner in a hurry? We got you covered and then some with this great-tasting, kid-friendly chowder.
seoTitle: Vegan Corn Chowder | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Need a healthy dinner in a hurry? Sunwarrior has got you covered and then some with this great-tasting, kid-friendly vegan corn chowder soup recipe.
ingredients:
s:644:"
  • 4 potatoes, diced
  • 6 sliced carrots
  • 1 small onion chopped
  • 2 celery stalks, diced
  • 6 teaspoons vegetable bouillon
  • 4 tablespoons olive oil
  • 4 tablespoons cornstarch
  • 4 cups rice or soy milk
  • 1 can organic sweet corn, drained (or 1 ½ cups frozen sweet corn)
  • Sea salt
  • Black pepper
";
directions:
Add potatoes, carrots, onions, and celery to pot. Cover with water and add bouillon. While veggies are cooking, heat oil in another pot over medium heat, and add cornstarch. Cook and constantly stir with whisk for about 3 mins. Slowly add milk and cook until thickened. Remove from heat.

Once veggies are tender, drain most of the liquid. Add the rice milk mixture to veggies and combine. Add corn. Adjust taste with sea salt and black pepper.

articleBodyHTML:
A sit-down family dinner fosters growth and communication. Roasted artichokes offer that leisurely dinner atmosphere and adds to it great taste and amazing nutrition.

I grew up eating artichokes at the time when they were not as popular as they are today. It was always interesting eating them in front of people who had no clue what they were and watching their reactions. My siblings and I always fought over the last roasted artichoke on the plate. Eating and savoring artichokes was a serious thing in my family. And just when I wasn’t watching, my brother took the heart of that artichoke right out of my hands. All that hard work of peeling and eating each petal one by one just to get to the center to enjoy that delicious heart was gone. I got good at protecting the treasured heart.

Little did we know how nutritionally valuable this amazing floral green vegetable was. Artichokes are packed with antioxidants and phytonutrients. They are especially high in Vitamin C, magnesium, iron, and  fiber. Artichokes are said to help prevent cancer, cardiovascular disease, control diabetes, and they assist in weight loss.

Artichokes are easier to make than you think. Try the following recipe and see for yourself.
articleSummaryHTML: A sit-down family dinner fosters growth and communication. Roasted artichokes offer that leisurely dinner atmosphere and adds to it great taste and amazing nutrition.
seoTitle: Roasted Artichokes | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: A sit-down family dinner fosters growth and communication. Roasted artichokes offer that leisurely dinner atmosphere and adds to it great taste.
ingredients:
s:222:"
  • 4–6 medium-size artichokes
  • 3 garlic cloves minced
  • Olive oil
  • Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1. Wash artichokes individually one by one. Chop off the stem at the bottom. Separate the artichoke leaves with your hands or alternatively turn the artichokes upside down and give them a quick little bang on the counter to open up the leaves. This not only helps so they can be washed thoroughly but also so they can be dressed easily.
  2. Add the minced garlic in between the leaves of each artichoke.
  3. Drizzle each artichoke with some olive oil and add a pinch of salt.
  4. Place the artichokes in a steaming basket and steam for 15 to 20 minutes.
  5. Place the partially steamed artichokes in a roasting pan. t. Place the pan on a barbecue brought to medium to high temperature, Alternately, you can use a wood burning stove.
  6. Roast them for 30 to 60 minutes or until the leaves can easily be pulled off.

How to eat an artichoke:

Slowly eat every leaf one at a time by scraping the inner part of the leaf with your front teeth. As you get closer and closer to the middle of the artichoke (better known as the heart of the artichoke), you will find something called the choke, which is hairy or furry-like. Using a spoon or a knife, scrape or cut around this part and discard it. Now, you are at the heart of the artichoke, which is the most delicious and sacred part of this floral, green vegetable. Make sure to pop it in your mouth before someone comes up behind you and grabs it!

Enjoy!!

articleTitle: Raw Vegan Chili Topped with Chipotle Nacho Cheese
articleBodyHTML:
With some creativity and culinary artistry, even a dish like a traditionally cooked chili can be made without ever turning on your stove!

This hearty chili provides an easy, nutritious, and super tasty plant-based meal that serves 3–4 people depending on your desired portion sizes.

Raw food recipes help us incorporate plenty of plant-based vitamins and minerals into our diets that help our bodies thrive. Eating raw food doesn’t mean constantly gnawing on a piece of plain raw broccoli or missing out on big, bold flavors.

This chili recipe incorporates robust seasonings that will have you going back for spoonful after spoonful! Not only is the tomato-based sauce rich and smoky, but the dollop of nacho cheese topping will send your taste buds into the stratosphere.

And the best part?

Because raw fruits and vegetables are also naturally packed with whole food fiber and water, your stomach feels full easily without needing to rely on the myth of “will power.” This means if you’re trying to drop some pesky pounds but constantly feel hungry, raw food meals can help you feel nourished and satisfied because they tend to be lower in calories while also being high in nutrients.

If you want to serve this chili warm but still raw, you can even heat it up in a saucepan on low, stirring constantly until it’s around the temperature of where you’d warm a baby bottle. That’s a great way of knowing if your food is still raw. In other words, it’s a step beyond warm, but not fully hot. Just be sure to add the nacho cheese topping after you heat the chili. You do not want to warm up the cheese.

Spring and summer are on their way, and raw food recipes like these can help you feel and look your best, with little effort, and lots of delicious flavor!
articleSummaryHTML: With some creativity and culinary artistry, even a dish like a traditionally cooked chili can be made without ever turning on your stove!
seoTitle: Raw Vegan Chili Topped with Nacho Cheese | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Raw vegan chili topped with chipotle nacho cheese recipe from Sunwarrior Health Hub provides a way for you to show off your creativity in the culinary arts
recipeName: Raw Vegan Chili Topped with Chipotle Nacho Cheese
ingredients:
s:1917:"

Sauce

  • 2 ½ cups sweet cherry tomatoes
  • ¾ cup smoked sundried tomatoes
  • 1 Medjool date, pitted
  • 1 cup red bell pepper, chopped
  • 1 small clove garlic
  • 1/8 teaspoon pink salt (optional if you are on a salt-free diet)
  • ¼ teaspoon onion powder
  • ½ teaspoon chipotle chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon Mexican oregano
  • ½ teaspoon cumin

Chili Base

  • 2 cups chopped button mushrooms
  • ½ cup minced chives
  • ½ cup minced cilantro
  • ½ cup yellow cherry tomatoes, chopped
  • ¼ cup nutritional yeast
  • ¼ cup chopped green onion
  • 1 tablespoon minced jalapeno pepper
  • 2 ½ cups chopped squash (yellow squash and zucchini)

Chipotle Nacho Cheese

  • 1 ¼ cups raw cashews
  • ½ cup water
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • ¼ cup nutritional yeast
  • ¼ teaspoon chipotle chili powder

Toppings

  • 2 green onions, sliced into thin discs
  • ¼ cup cilantro leaves
";
directions: Blend chili sauce ingredients in a high-speed blender until a thick tomato sauce is created. Set aside. Prep and chop chili base ingredients and place into a large mixing bowl. Set aside. Blend chipotle nacho cheese ingredients until a creamy texture is achieved. Now it’s time to assemble your dish. Toss the red sauce with chili base ingredients until well-coated. Serve in bowls of your choosing, then top with generous dollops of nacho cheese. Sprinkle chopped green onion and cilantro on top. Serve immediately and enjoy immensely!

articleBodyHTML:
In Russia, chaga is known as a gift from God. So a very merry unbirthday to you as we learn about this amazing mushroom (unless it is your birthday, in which case, happy birthday!)

What is Chaga?

With all the superfood fads out there these days, you may be wondering to yourself, “What’s all this buzz about chaga?” Known in Russia as “a gift from God,” this amazing mushroom is found growing on live birch trees, mainly in Siberia, Asia, and other Northern climates. It is touted as a high-powered immunomodulator and adaptogen, meaning that it not only boosts your immune system, but it also comes to the aid of any system in the body that may be lacking vitality and proper function. It is one of the richest sources of antioxidants on the planet, being extremely high in enzyme SOD which prevents premature aging and boasts being anti-inflammatory, anti-viral, anti-parasitic, anti-tumor, and anti-bacterial.

With all of these amazing disease fighting and health protecting properties, it is no wonder that many people are discovering the amazing benefits of chaga!

A Powerful Adaptogen

Although there is much to be discussed in terms of the health-promoting effects of chaga, let’s focus in on one of the most relevant benefits that this mushroom provides as it pertains to an increasingly stress-driven and fatigue-burdened society. As an adaptogen, taking chaga as a tea or extract in powder or tincture form can have a powerful effect on the body’s delicate balance and the interplay between organ systems. Because of chaga’s incredible ability to balance and support the body, it has long been hailed as an anti-aging tonic by Russian, Asian, and other Eastern cultures. Scientific research has listed chaga as one of the top adaptogens on the planet, also evidenced by its positive effects on performance and overall well-being of those consuming the mushroom long term. We can make use of this wonderful life-enhancing mushroom by treating mild fatigue to full-on adrenal burnout.

Chaga’s Effect on Stress

It’s safe to say that as a whole, the general population is affected to some degree by the ill effects of stress, whether that be from work, home, or other areas of life. The demands of everyday life can be overwhelming, leaving an individual depleted in every sense of the word. Chaga can be of much benefit in such a situation as it replenishes on a cellular level. Not only does chaga provide antioxidants as before-mentioned, but it also assists in detoxifying the liver and eliminating toxins from the body, thus increasing the metabolic process and allowing your cells to function more efficiently. As an adaptogen, there are no stimulating effects of taking chaga, yet it provides a steady source of energy to users who build upon use, meaning, that taken daily as a tonic it will continue to work on the body and address each layer needed to bring balance, without any harmful side effect. It is completely non-toxic and provides a grounding energy which can be felt on a deep cellular level. This is due largely in part to chaga’s ability to inhibit oxidative damage to DNA and protection against other free radicals. Less stress on the cells over time will lead to a noticeable difference in an individual’s overall well-being, such as noticeable emotional stability, physical stamina, and mental clarity, all of which help combat the negative effects of a constantly driven world.

Nourishing Nutrients

What is more, chaga provides high levels of many key nutrients that nourish the adrenal glands and the endocrine system as a whole. One of the key nutrients for adrenal healing, pantothenic acid, is found in high amounts in chaga. It is also high in zinc, iron, copper, and manganese, all of which stimulate SOD and provide antioxidant value. Chaga also contains a lanosterol, a precursor to human cholesterol, which supports the endocrine system by rebuilding cell membranes and providing the building blocks needed for optimal functioning. As with all adaptogens, give at least two months of consistent use to see a noticeable difference in energy levels and overall wellbeing.

Want a tasty, fun way to try chaga and reap the benefits of this incredible fungi? Try this Chaga Chia Pudding, complete with protein, fats, and a complex sweet-and-earthy flavor that will have you coming back for seconds.

articleBodyHTML:
Sunflower sprouts: rich in folic acid and B-complex vitamins. You can grow your own health!

Sunflower sprouts are a tasty superfood. These yummy young shoots are an excellent source of chlorophyll and protein, are rich in folic acid and the B-complex vitamins, vitamins C and E, selenium and zinc. They make a nutritious addition to salads and smoothies, and they juice well with cold press juicers. Dense, crunchy, “sunnies” are slightly nutty in flavor with a very mild hint of lemon. They can be grown indoors or outside, although birds and squirrels are attracted to them, so you will want to plan for protection if you choose to grow outdoors. Sunnies are simple to grow. Everyone adds his or her own spin to the growing process, so don’t be afraid to experiment. It’s hard to mess this up!

1. For a 10”x20” growing tray, soak a scant cup of organic, unshelled black oil sunflower seeds for 8 hours or overnight, and then rinse and drain them. Note that whole sunflower seeds float. To get them saturated, it is necessary to keep them completely under water. A wide mouth glass canning jar works well. Place the seeds in the bottom, fill the jar to the top with water and put the two-piece lid on tight, then invert the jar, so the seeds rise to the “bottom” of the jar.

2. Replace the two-piece canning jar lid with a sprouting jar strainer lid and drain off soak water thoroughly. The soak water has nutrients in it and is good for watering houseplants. Rinse seeds thoroughly with cool water and drain again. Set your sprouting jar at a 45-degree angle to drain between rinses—it works well to prop it up in a dish rack. Keep the jar out of direct sunlight and at room temperature between rinses.

3. Rinse twice a day until the seeds start to sprout. You will see a small (1/8”) white root growing out of the sunflower seed shells. This will occur after 2–3 rinse periods; it doesn’t take long.

4. Fill your seed tray about 1” deep with a good quality potting soil or compost. Some growers like to add earthworm castings to the growing medium. If you add earthworm castings, keep the ratio to less than 20% of the tray, or your sprouts may burn. Spread the soil evenly. Empty the jar with the sprouted seeds into the middle of the tray, and gently spread them out. It's fine if the seeds touch, and even if they overlap a little, but try to avoid little seed piles. If later you find any mold or fungus in your greens, reduce the amount of seed you plant. The hotter and more humid your climate is, the greater the potential for mold or fungus to grow.

5. Cover the seeds with a very thin layer of soil. Water gently, once or twice a day, and keep out of direct sunlight. Be careful not to overwater, which will make them prone to mold and rot. Under-watering sprouts will stunt their growth.

After 3–4 days, or when they are about an inch tall, move your crop to a well-lit location. If you use direct sunlight at this point, you’ll want to plan to do a little more watering.

6. Your sprouts are ready to harvest when their smooth seed leaves are large and green, and the second leaves have not yet appeared. They will be about 3–5 inches tall. Sunflower greens will shed their shells as their leaves open. Most of the seed husks or shells will have fallen off the sprouts by this point, but you will likely need to remove a few by hand. To remove remaining shells, tip the growing tray at an angle and brush your hand back and forth over the top of the greens.

To harvest the sprouts cut off near the base with sharp, clean knife or scissors, just above the soil’s surface.

7. Enjoy fresh sprouts in your salad or green smoothie. Stored in a produce storage bag in the refrigerator, they keep fresh for 5–7 days, providing they're almost dry, and all the husks have been removed.

Try pairing your sprouts with a simple dressing.
articleSummaryHTML: ​Sunflower sprouts: rich in folic acid and B-complex vitamins. You can grow your own health!
