articleTitle: Don’t Miss the Meat:  Amaranth Lentil Loaf
articleBodyHTML:
Meatloaf is one of those Sunday dinner meals that provide comfort and warmth, but there’s also a lot of unhealthy side effects. Serve up the good without the bad with this Amaranth Lentil loaf!

Any kind of “loaf” is always a comforting dish in the cooler winter months. The combination of amaranth and lentils give you loads of protein and fiber, and won’t leave you feeling heavy like a traditional meat loaf. You can certainly swap out the lentil for other beans such as chickpeas, red kidney beans, or even white beans to give this loaf a different variation.

Bonus tip – make it ahead of time, so the loaf has time to cool and set before you slice into it. It also tastes great the next day and even tastes good cold. It can be added to salads, sandwiches, grain dishes, or accompany a side of greens drizzled with tahini!
articleSummaryHTML: Meatloaf is one of those Sunday dinner meals that provide comfort and warmth, but there’s also a lot of unhealthy side effects. Serve up the good without the bad with this Amaranth Lentil loaf!
seoTitle: Don’t Miss the Meat:  Amaranth Lentil Loaf | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Meatloaf is one of those Sunday dinner meals that provide comfort and warmth, try Sunwarrior's amaranth lentil loaf recipe today to change it up.
recipeName: Don’t Miss the Meat:  Amaranth Lentil Loaf
ingredients:
s:1096:"
  • 1 cup green lentils, cooked
  • ¼ cup brown rice
  • ¼ cup amaranth
  • 4 cups water
  • 2 large carrots
  • 2 cups mushrooms
  • 2 stalks celery, chopped
  • ¼ cup parsley, chopped
  • 1 large onion
  • 2 tablespoons ground flax plus 6 tablespoons water
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ¼ cup tomato sauce
  • ¼ teaspoon ground pepper
  • ¼ teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • 1 tablespoon tamari
  • 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
  • ½ cup quick cooking oats
  • 2 tablespoons grapeseed oil
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Place lentils in a medium sized saucepan and add all the water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add brown rice and amaranth. Return to a boil and reduce heat again, covering and simmering for another 30 minutes or until all the water has been absorbed. Remove from heat and let cool.

2. While the lentils are cooking, prepare the vegetables (carrots, mushrooms, celery, parsley, and onion) and sauté over medium heat until they are soft. Remove from heat and let cool.

3. Add the flax and lentil mixture to a food processor and process until relatively smooth. Add the vegetables and chop for another 20 seconds or so until you reach a chunky but uniform texture. Add all the remaining ingredients and stir well.

4. Scoop the mixture into a non-stick loaf pan, cover with foil and cook for 30–40 minutes.

Remove the foil and cook for an additional 10 minutes or until firm on the top.

articleBodyHTML:
Dinner done easy and tasty is the winner of this crockpot black bean soup! You can feed a crowd and still have time to enjoy your evening!

Simple is the name of the game when it comes to raising a family. Anything I can pull together in under a half and hour and tastes good, I will try. This soup fits both criteria.

This soup tastes delicious and will warm you from head to toe on a cold day.

The crockpot is an amazing tool and certainly helps with meal preparation. Dinner making time is one of the busiest times of day for a mother. If I can do it beforehand, my day goes so much easier. When dinnertime rolls around, I don’t dread it as much because I have already done most of the work.

The benefits of this soup are fantastic! Black beans have fiber, potassium, folate, and vitamin B6. Black beans can also lower your cholesterol and decrease the risk of heart disease.
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner done easy and tasty is the winner of this crockpot black bean soup! You can feed a crowd and still have time to enjoy your evening!
seoTitle: Crockpot Black Bean Soup | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Dinner done easy and tasty is the winner of Sunwarrior Health Hub's crockpot black bean soup! You can feed a crowd & still have time to enjoy your evening!
ingredients:
s:975:"
  • (use organic where possible)
  • 3 (15 oz.) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
  • 3 to 3 ½ cups vegetable broth
  • 1 (10 oz.) can tomatoes with green chilies
  • 1 red bell pepper, minced
  • 4 oz. can diced green chiles
  • 1 tablespoon ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon ancho chile powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • ¼ teaspoon oregano
  • ½ cup chopped cilantro, divided
  • 1 medium avocado, sliced
  • Tofutti (or your favorite vegan brand of choice) sour cream
  • Tortilla chips
";
directions:
Add one can of beans in a food processor and blend with about a cup of broth. Puree. Add to crockpot. Then add the rest of the broth and beans, tomatoes, pepper, chilies, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano and ¼ c cilantro to the crockpot. Cook on low for about 6 hours.

Once cooked, stir then add the remainder cilantro and adjust seasoning by adding more salt or cumin. Serve with avocado, sour cream, and tortilla chips.

articleBodyHTML:
Apples and pears warmed up in a delightful nut cream is a snack that allows you to use that overripe fruit in the best, tastiest way possible!

This recipe was inspired by my mother who always knew what to do with food so that it would not go to waste. Whenever apples or pears were close to over ripening, she would bake apples and can pears so that we could enjoy them anytime.

If you happen to have apples and pears sitting around and you don’t know what to do with them, consider tossing them in a pan and baking them. As much as I love biting into apples and pears raw, I do occasionally enjoy them warm out of the oven around the cooler months.  There is nothing like the smell of these fruits baking in the oven especially when cinnamon and nutmeg has been added to the mix. The delicious aroma in the kitchen can linger for hours. You can bet on hearing someone in the house saying, “Mm-mm that smells so good!”
articleSummaryHTML: Apples and pears warmed up in a delightful nut cream is a snack that allows you to use that overripe fruit in the best, tastiest way possible!
seoTitle: Vegan Apple Pear Cream | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Vegan apple pear cream utilizes apples & pears warmed up in a delightful nut cream. It is a snack that allows you to use that overripe fruit for the best.
ingredients:
s:756:"
  • 2 Granny Smith apples
  • 2 pears
  • ½ cup freshly pressed apple juice
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • Pinch of nutmeg (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla essence (optional)
  • ½ cup almonds
  • 1 cup cashews
  • 1 ½ cup pineapple
  • 1 teaspoon Vitamin Mineral Rush (optional immune boost)
";
directions:
Directions for Apples and Pears

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
  2. Line a square pan with parchment paper.
  3. Chop apples and pears into chunks and place in the square pan.
  4. Pour apple juice, maple syrup, ½ teaspoon of vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg on top of apples and pears and mix so that all the fruit is coated well.
  5. Bake for 50 minutes. Halfway through, stir the fruit and continue to bake until soft.
  6. Cool slightly before serving.

Directions for Nut Cream

  1. In a food processor, blend the almonds and cashews. Add the pineapple and continue to blend and blend until smooth.
  2. Add the other ½ teaspoon of vanilla and 1 teaspoon Vitamin Mineral Rush and blend one last time.
  3. Top the apples and pears with the nut cream to your liking.

articleBodyHTML:
Finally! A dessert you can eat first without the guilt! This strawberries and yogurt fruit dip is so good it’ll feel like cheating on your diet.

Do you have a sweet tooth but wanting to stick to your healthy diet? Then this is the healthy dessert you need to try!

This tasty dessert only requires five ingredients, and each ingredient is full of healthy benefits. I always like to include the health benefits of the ingredients to show you how delicious and healthy it can be! That makes it even more irresistible. Yogurt can be a good breakfast, lunch, snack, dessert, or even dinner. This is a good spring and getting-ready-for summer type of dessert.

So grab your ingredients and get started!

Benefits of Coconut

Coconut is great for reducing inflammation, absorbing calcium, supporting thyroid functions, preventing tooth decay, and it is a great antioxidant!

Benefits of Lemon

Lemons contain vitamin C, citric acid, flavonoids, B-complex vitamins, calcium, copper, iron, magnesium, phosphorus, potassium, and fiber. Lemons actually have more potassium than apples and grapes.

Benefits of Strawberries

Improved eye care, proper brain function, relief from high blood pressure, full of antioxidants, prevent from arthritis, and various cardiovascular diseases.

Benefits of Honey

If you’re vegan and not into honey, agave syrup is a good sweetener substitute that has a low glycemic index. But if you’re vegetarian, there are some benefits to honey. Honey helps prevent cancer and heart disease, reduces ulcers and other gastrointestinal disorders, it is antibacterial and antifungal, it increases athletic performance, reduces a cough and throat irritation, helps regulate blood sugar, and heals wounds and burns.

Now that you’ve read all the benefits, are you ready to make it?
articleSummaryHTML: Finally! A dessert you can eat first without the guilt! This strawberries and yogurt fruit dip is so good it’ll feel like cheating on your diet.
seoTitle: How to Make Strawberry and Yogurt Fruit Dip | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Finally! A dessert you can eat first without the guilt! Sunwarrior's strawberries and yogurt fruit dip is so good it’ll feel like cheating on your diet.
ingredients:
s:532:"
  • ¾ cup plain coconut milk yogurt
  • 2 tablespoons agave syrup (or honey for our vegetarian friends)
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • 1 package of strawberries (or blueberries, blackberries, really any type of fruit would be delicious)
  • 1 teaspoon Vitamin Mineral Rush (to boost immune system)
";
directions: Mix the yogurt, honey, lemon juice, and Vitamin Mineral Rush together in a small bowl. Once it is all mixed together, dip the strawberries in the yogurt mixture and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Whether you’re pumping iron at the gym or pints at the pub, your recovery starts here!

Recover, Rehydrate, Renew with Sunwarrior’s recovery cocktail (aka: the hangover cure).

We get it. St Patrick’s Day is a day to go out and sing all those Irish drinking songs and laugh with good friends. In case the revelry gets a little too real and you end with a headache in the morning, we’ve got you covered. Or, if you decided to forego the pub and spend the holiday in the gym sporting your amazing shamrock gym socks, we’ve got you covered there, too.

Hangovers are usually the result of dehydration and mineral and electrolyte depletion. Drinking something rich in vitamins, electrolytes, antioxidants and nutrient transporters will rehydrate your body and brain and get all those minerals carried to the right places to keep you functioning at your best.

While a workout isn’t quite the same thing as drinking, you can still dehydrate and deplete your cells of those important nutrients. You want to make sure you replenish those cells so they can recover and be ready for the next day at the gym.

articleBodyHTML:
(Shhh… it’s a green smoothie in disguise!) Sometimes getting your green veggies and protein in every meal can be hard. That’s where this chocolate mocha smoothie comes in to save the day!

I hate to admit it but trying to make sure you are eating a balanced meal every time you sit down can be really tough and time-consuming. But it doesn’t have to be that way! I started changing one of my meals a day to a protein smoothie and found everything in my life to be so much easier. No more decisions on what to have for lunch and making sure that it had enough protein, veggies, carbs, fat, and all the rest. I just threw it all in a blender and voila! It’s the best because it doesn’t matter where you are (driving, working, walking, etc.) you can drink it anywhere. I love knowing where my food comes from and this allows me to do just that. And the best part is it’s so simple. Other than the convenience here are more reasons why I was inspired to make this smoothie.

Chocolate is amazing, and I feel it should be included in every meal ;)

Chocolate (especially dark chocolate) is a great antioxidant, contains essential vitamins and minerals, and has been associated with a TON of health benefits. Not only is it good for you, but it tastes amazing and will satisfy your sweet tooth so it can help limit those afternoon and evening cravings!

The flavors of mocha, coconut and chocolate are an excellent pick-me-up in the morning or afternoon.

The mocha flavor of the Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Mocha along with the added cocoa makes this smoothie almost taste like your favorite coffee drink. And the best part is it provides you with the energy your body needs without any of the dreaded caffeine hangover.

You can hide TONS of good-for-you vegetables into this smoothie without tasting them at all!!

The intense flavors of mocha in this smoothie hide any vegetable flavor you throw in it, so feel free to go leafy-green crazy! I’ve added frozen broccoli to this smoothie to give it a lovely smooth texture, and you can’t even tell at all! This would be an excellent smoothie for kids or if you are just starting out with green smoothies and need a bit of time to get used to the “green” color or flavors.

AND IT’S CHOCOLATE

Need I say more? I didn’t think so. Let’s get to it.
articleSummaryHTML: (Shhh… it’s a green smoothie in disguise!) Sometimes getting your green veggies and protein in every meal can be hard. That’s where this chocolate mocha smoothie comes in to save the day!
seoTitle: Best Chocolate Mocha Protein Smoothie Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Find out here how to make the best chocolate mocha protein smoothie with Sunwarrior. Chocolate is amazing, add mocha and you're having a good time.
ingredients:
s:811:"
  • 2 cups unsweetened almond, cashew or coconut milk (or your favorite milk)
  • 1 ½ scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Mocha protein powder
  • 1 tablespoon cocoa powder
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ frozen banana
  • ½–1 cup frozen broccoli
  • 1 big handful spinach
  • Toppings (optional):
  • 1 teaspoon unsweetened shredded coconut for topping (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon cocoa nibs for topping (optional)
";
directions:
Start by adding all the milk to a blender (this will help with the powder from getting stuck to the bottom).

Add the rest of the ingredients to the blender except for the toppings and blend on high for thirty seconds or until smooth.

Pour the mixture into two glasses, top with suggested toppings if desired and serve immediately. Alternatively, you could pour one serving and keep the other in the refrigerator to enjoy later.

*I recommend you enjoy this smoothie immediately after it’s made for best results. If that is not possible, be sure to keep it cold until you serve it and consume it within twelve hours.

articleBodyHTML: You call it healthy, but the family calls it a dinner win! These mushroom red pepper tacos are definitely a dinner win!
articleSummaryHTML: Your children will never know that good health is hiding in their yummy dessert! Neither will you! It’s time for peanut butter Aztec chocolate brownies!
seoTitle: Best Mushroom Red Pepper Tacos Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: You call it healthy, but the family calls it a dinner win! Sunwarrior's vegan mushroom red pepper tacos recipe is definitely a dinner win for your family.
ingredients:
s:1487:"

Tacos

  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 sweet onion, diced
  • 16 oz. Cremini mushrooms, sliced
  • 2 red peppers, sliced
  • 4 garlic cloves, minced
  • 2 tablespoons tamari
  • ¼ cup cilantro, chopped
  • Large lettuce leaves or taco shells of your choice

Slaw

  • 1 bunch kale thinly, sliced
  • 2 limes, juiced
  • 1 cup pineapple, diced
  • 1 jalapeno seeded and chopped
  • ¼ cup cilantro chopped

Cilantro Lime Dressing

  • 1 cup plain Greek yogurt
  • 1 cup cilantro rough chopped
  • 1 jalapeno seeded and rough chopped
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 lime, juiced
  • 1 tablespoon Vitamin Mineral Rush
  • Pinch of salt
";
directions:
Slaw

Put chopped kale into a bowl, pour the lime juice over it add a pinch of salt and massage into the kale. Add the remaining slaw ingredients and toss. Put in the fridge until ready to serve.

Cilantro Lime Dressing

Put all cilantro lime dressing ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth and creamy. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Tacos

Heat oil in a pan, add pepper and onions, cook about 5 minutes, add mushrooms and garlic, cook about 10 minutes, add the tamari, and cook for about 2–3 more minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro.

Assemble your taco and ENJOY!

articleBodyHTML:
St. Patrick’s Day rapidly approaches which means it is time to get creative in the kitchen with shamrock themed, guilt-free desserts. So we give you cocoa matcha protein balls!

While you may think of matcha as the delicious green tea Japanese powder that you sip in your almond milk latte, you should also think of it as the perfect festive ingredient to use all month long in your baking.

Matcha is a fine green tea powder that comes from the crushing of the tea leaves. The entire leaf is being consumed rather than just the extract from typical tea, making this a powerful antioxidant loaded with health benefits. Matcha is most typically used as an energizer (matcha creates an even spread of energy throughout the day, unlike coffee which can tend to have the crash effect). Matcha is a natural detoxifier for your body and contains high levels of a compound known to have tremendous cancer-fighting properties (EGCG). So why not incorporate this into your desserts? These vegan, no-bake Cocoa Matcha Protein Balls are a great snack to satisfy your chocolate craving while consuming all-natural, healthy ingredients:
articleSummaryHTML: St. Patrick’s Day rapidly approaches which means it is time to get creative in the kitchen with shamrock themed, guilt-free desserts. So we give you cocoa matcha protein balls!
seoTitle: Decadent Cocoa Matcha Protein Balls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: St. Patrick’s Day rapidly approaches which means it is time to get creative in the kitchen with shamrock themed, cocoa matcha protein balls by Sunwarrior.
ingredients:
s:574:"
  • ½ cup raw almonds
  • 2/3 cup dates (pitted and moist)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein
  • ¼ cup cocoa powder (unsweetened)
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
  • 1.5 tablespoons organic matcha powder
  • 1 tablespoon unsweetened vanilla almond milk
";
directions:
1. In a food processor, mix the dates and almonds together on high speed (note: when combined, the consistency should feel moist and smooth).
  2. Combine the protein, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, matcha, and almond milk to the batter and mix again on high speed until well blended (note: the consistency should still feel moist and sticky so that you can form the balls).
  3. Roll the batter into 12 balls and place on a non-stick baking sheet.
  4. Sprinkle matcha powder lightly over the balls for a green finishing touch.
  5. Be sure to keep the protein balls in the refrigerator so that they maintain their shape and consistency and enjoy this healthy, festive chocolate snack!

articleBodyHTML:
Keeping it real, keeping it green with this green smoothie bowl filled with all things tasty and nutritious!

Leprechauns, green shakes, pots of gold, and rainbows! Sounds familiar? It’s St. Patrick’s Day, of course! We decided to come up with a super green smoothie bowl to celebrate this fun and festive holiday. We snuck in lots of healthy greens to give this smoothie bowl a kick of protein, nutrients, and vitamins. Most people assume vegans lack protein in their diets, but there is an abundance of plant-based protein in the plants and vegetables that we consume.

There are many sources of plant-based protein that come naturally from the earth. Even if you are not plant based, adopting a one-day-a-week vegan diet can help regulate your digestive system. The fun thing about plant-based diets is that you can paint your dinner plate with a rainbow of vegetables, grains, nuts, and beans. Since our bodies can only metabolize a certain amount of protein per serving, we actually don’t need as much as we think we do! We can utilize the power of snacking during the day to acquire protein as well as at meals.

Quinoa is an amazing source of plant-based energy at 8 grams per cup. Green peas and artichokes both have close to 8 grams of protein. Hemp seeds pack 17 grams of protein for four tablespoons. There is hardly any weight to these little seeds which makes them very easy for your stomach to digest. Chia seeds, pumpkin seeds, almonds, and walnuts have a high concentrations of protein. The highest protein vegetables are peas, spinach, kale, broccoli, sprouts, artichokes, edamame, and lentils.
articleSummaryHTML: What better way to celebrate St. Patrick’s Day than with a green smoothie bowl? Since we couldn’t think of a better way, either, we’re sharing this smoothie bowl recipe!

";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 400 degrees F. When heated, precook your quiche crust until it is slightly brown but not cooked all the way through. About 5–8 minutes. Remove from oven, set aside, and reduce oven to 350 degrees.

2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions, mushrooms, zucchini, broccoli, carrots, and mixed peppers. Stir and cook until soft. About 5 minutes. Remove from skillet into a large bowl and set aside.

3. Combine flour and dried basil on a small plate and lightly coat both sides of the sliced tomato. Place coated tomato into the skillet and cook about 1 minute per side. Remove from heat.

4. In a bowl, whisk together blended tofu, soy milk, salt, and pepper.

5. Sprinkle a small handful of shredded cheese over the bottom of pre-cooked dough. Add vegetable mixture and spread evenly. Layer a few tomato slices on top of vegetables, and pour tofu mixture on top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and lay fresh basil leaves on top.

6. Bake for approximately 40 minutes, or until done. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Nutrition starts with you. Keeping it simple, healthy, and delicious is a great way to start your day. And remember, be you and don’t be afraid to mix it up a bit!

articleTitle: Vegan Curried Chickpeas in a Flash
articleBodyHTML:
Looking for a truly wonderful vegan dinner you can whip up in literal minutes? We got you covered. Life is busy, but a healthy dinner is still on the menu!

With today’s fast and pressing demands, we all need easy go-to meals, the kind that allows for subbing ingredients, no exact measuring, and quick prep and cooking time. Doubling the recipe is a great idea because it transforms perfectly into a salad topper, soup topper, or wrap and taco filling.
articleSummaryHTML: Looking for a truly wonderful vegan dinner you can whip up in literal minutes? We got you covered. Life is busy, but a healthy dinner is still on the menu!
seoTitle: Quick Vegan Curried Chickpeas | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Looking for a truly wonderful vegan dinner you can whip up in literal minutes? We got you covered. Check out our quick vegan curried chickpeas recipe.
recipeName: Vegan Curried Chickpeas in a Flash
ingredients:
s:868:"
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 1 large garlic clove, roughly chopped
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon turmeric
  • ½ teaspoon garam masala
  • ½ teaspoon coriander
  • ½ teaspoon turmeric
  • ½ teaspoon curry powder
  • Approximately ½ teaspoon sea salt and ¼ teaspoon black pepper, to taste
  • One, 14–16 oz. can organic chickpeas or approximately 2 cups pre-cooked,
  • *Reserve a little of the juice from the can or cooking liquid or have broth, juice, wine, or water on hand.
";
directions:
1. Preheat sauté pan over medium high heat – ideally cast iron or stainless steel. Add onions and garlic, give a little stir, then add in all the spices, dry-fry 30–60 seconds.
  2. Drizzle in a little olive or coconut oil and sauté until the onions are beginning to caramelize. About 3 minutes.
  3. Add the chickpeas and a little of the reserved liquid. Continue to cook on medium heat to infuse those fragrant spices for 3–5 minutes.
  4. Serve Curried Quickie Chickpeas with Forbidden black rice and pan-roasted Brussels sprouts.
  5. I go heavy on the spices as it suits my palate. Use less if you are not familiar with these spices then taste and adjust as desired to appease your preferences. This is all about you. The flavors meld wonderfully as this cooks. If you have time, leave it on the heat.
  6. If eating raw, decrease the spice and garlic measurements accordingly, to taste.

articleBodyHTML:
Don’t Have a Cow! With these vegan Mexican burgers, you can have your burger and eat it, too. Bite into a savory stack of awesome, now!

When you’re switching to a vegetarian or vegan diet, burgers can be hard for some of us to give up. Luckily, you have options when you want to swap out that all-beef patty and you don’t have to sacrifice your taste buds or your commitment.

While “garden burgers” or veggie patties are a lot easier to find these days, you’ll also find that many of them have some rather disagreeable ingredients. From texturized vegetable protein to trans-fat, and additives like sodium phosphate, nitrates, and even ammonia. You’ll want to read the label before you make your selection.

An even better solution is to make your own burger. Many raw vegan burger recipes tend to be heavy on nuts, but I’ve created a method that uses pumpkin seeds. Among the benefits of pumpkin seeds—sometimes called pepitas—are a nice dose of heart-healthy magnesium and a whole lot of zinc. High in fiber, pumpkin seeds also offer anti-diabetic, postmenopausal, and restfulness support.

Notice in this recipe that we’re using oil-packed sundried tomatoes, and I’ve suggested you toss in a tablespoon or so of the oil itself. Do make sure any herbs or garlic added to the oil will agree with your burger mix spice blend; if no herbs have been added, that’s fine! Down the line, after you’ve used up all the tomatoes in your jar, be sure to save that oil! It doubles as a flavorful base for homemade salad dressing.

In addition to making a good burger, this mixture can also be used as a taco meat substitute: skip the dehydrating and use it loosely in a romaine leaf topped with a dollop of guacamole. Olé! You’ve got yourself a fast meal.
articleSummaryHTML: Don’t Have a Cow! With these vegan Mexican burgers, you can have your burger and eat it, too. Bite into a savory stack of awesome, now!
seoTitle: Raw Vegan Mexican Burgers Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Don’t Have a Cow! With Sunwarrior Health Hub's vegan Mexican burgers recipe, you can have your burger and eat it, too. Bite into a savory stack of awesome!
ingredients:
s:610:"
  • 2 cups pumpkin seeds, soaked 12 hours or more
  • 1 cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, plus 1 tablespoon of the oil
  • ¼ cup chopped, fresh cilantro
  • 2 tablespoons minced onion
  • 2 tablespoons Mexican seasoning
  • 1 tablespoon unpasteurized miso
  • 1/8 teaspoon cayenne
  • 1 teaspoon unrefined salt
  • 1 clove minced garlic
";
directions: Combine all ingredients in a food processor, and process until smooth. Form into burger shapes and dehydrate on mesh dehydrator sheet at 105 degrees Fahrenheit for 5–7 hours.

articleTitle: Vegan Mexican Meat-less Balls: 5 Ways to Dinner
articleBodyHTML:
Dinner comes every day, and new ideas for how to shake it up while keeping it healthy and great tasting are hard to come by. So here are 5 ways to dinner with vegan meat-less balls!

Super easy, healthy, and delicious! These little Mexican no-meatballs are such an amazing and versatile food you can make for any given occasion, and I promise they will taste great with anything!

They will be perfect for a packed lunch, a romantic dinner for two, or a party for your 20 friends! They’re easy to make, quick, inexpensive, delicious, and super nutritious! But most importantly, they are versatile, allowing you to reimagine dinner:

  • As wraps
  • As burgers or bagel bites
  • As salad toppings
  • As skewers
  • As classic meatballs served with side dishes.

But let’s start with the basic super balls recipe. For 20 balls you will need:
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner comes every day, and new ideas for how to shake it up while keeping it healthy and great tasting are hard to come by. So here are 5 ways to dinner with vegan meat-less Balls!
seoTitle: Vegan Mexican Meat-less Balls: 5 Ways to Dinner
seoDescription: Here are Sunwarrior's 5 ways to have dinner with vegan meat-less Balls! Vegan meat-less balls are delicious and pack protein that builds muscle.
recipeName: Vegan Mexican Meat-less Balls: 5 Ways to Dinner
ingredients:
s:706:"
  • ½ cup uncooked basmati rice
  • 2 cans red kidney beans, drained
  • 2 cloves garlic, chopped
  • ½ red onion, chopped
  • ½ teaspoon cayenne powder
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • ½ lime, juiced
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 handful fresh coriander
  • 1/3 cup corn flour
  • Pinch of salt
";
directions:
1. Cook basmati rice.
  2. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Lay greaseproof paper (baking parchment paper) in a baking tray and put aside.
  3. Put all the ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend until all ingredients mix well and create a sticky mass, but be careful not to blend it till completely smooth in order to retain some nice texture.
  4. Scoop out the mass with a spoon and, using both your hands, roll out little balls, around 3cm wide. Place the balls on the prepared tray and put in the oven. Bake for 30 minutes.

When baked, take them out of the oven and use for:

WRAPS

Put some guacamole, grilled peppers and onions on the bottom of the wrap, and then finish with leafy greens, fresh tomatoes and super balls. Wrap it up and enjoy!

BURGERS and BAGELS

Cut your bun or bagel in half, smear some guacamole on both halves, then put the balls on the bottom half finished with your favourite veg and enjoy!

SALAD TOPPING

Chop up some vegetables, add leafy greens, your favourite seeds, and a nice dressing; finish with super balls on top!

SKEWERS

Load a BBQ stick with your favourite veg mixed with the super balls and enjoy grilled with a generous dollop of BBQ sauce and some guacamole on the side!

PROPER MEATBALLS + SIDES

Serve them as proper meatballs with a side of sweet potato mash and a leafy salad or steamed vegetables to make a yummy and nutritious meal for the whole family!

articleBodyHTML:
Get with the currant trends! No, we didn’t get that wrong, we mean currants as in the berries! Start your day with this great-tasting black currant and mint smoothie!

This black currant and mint smoothie is an amazing way to kick start the day and boost your mood! Spring is here which means refreshing and healthy drinks to help boost energy and refuel our bodies. This smoothie combines black currants, which are incredible sources of antioxidants, with the freshness of mint. Smoothies are a great way to pack in extra nutrition whether it’s in the morning, midday, or at night. You can add nut butters to make it richer, switch up the milks such as rice, soy, almond, or hemp, or you can even add hemp hearts or chia seeds to boost protein. You can also add a dollop of regular or vegan yogurt to add a delicious creaminess to your shake.

Black currants are very tart, so it’s best to combine them with other fruit to give them a more well-rounded taste. Combining black currants with additional berries (such as blueberries, strawberries, and raspberries) keeps the sugar levels low and antioxidant levels high. Black currants help fight free radicals in the body which can help stave off cancer cells. By fighting off these free radicals, it can also help in premature aging. Black currants also promote eye health and digestive health. Black currants have a huge amount of vitamin c that can also help boost immunity. This smoothie tastes fantastic with vanilla almond milk, but you can always use soy if you want a richer taste. I love the taste of fresh mint in this smoothie, but you can also use fresh basil, which gives it an incredible herbaceous taste.
articleSummaryHTML: Get with the currant trends! No, we didn’t get that wrong, we mean currants as in the berries! Start your day with this great-tasting black currant and mint smoothie!
seoTitle: Best Black Currant and Mint Shake Recipe| Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Get with the currant trends! Start your day with this black currant and mint smoothie from Sunwarrior. With all these antioxidants, you'll love it.
ingredients:
s:228:"
  • 1 cup frozen black currants
  • 1 cup mixed berries of choice
  • 1 cup vanilla almond milk
  • ½ cup fresh mint
  • ½ cup ice
  • 1 tablespoon chia seeds
";
directions: Blend all ingredients together and serve

articleBodyHTML:
Street tacos are the hot new trend, but what if you want to skip the meat and the shell?! Naked vegan street tacos are your answer!

These tasty tacos satisfy all of your taco cravings and are packed full of healthy veggies making them nutritionally dense and calorie-friendly. Pair with baked sweet potato wedges dusted with Cajun seasoning to round out a flavorful meal.
articleSummaryHTML: Street tacos are the hot new trend, but what if you want to skip the meat and the shell?! Naked vegan street tacos are your answer!
seoTitle: Naked Vegan Street Taco Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Street tacos are the hot new trend, but what if you want to skip the meat and the shell?! Sunwarrior's recipe for Naked vegan street tacos are your answer!
ingredients:
s:1206:"
  • 1 bag or head of riced cauliflower (riced means chopped finely)
  • 1 can of black beans, rinsed
  • 16 oz. mushrooms, sliced
  • 1 can of corn, rinsed
  • 1 bag spinach or kale
  • 1 Roma tomato, diced
  • ½ red onion chopped
  • 1 avocado
  • 1 lime
  • Fresh cilantro, chopped
  • Fresh mango and pineapple chopped or fruit salsa like Trader Joe’s Island Salsa
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon paprika
  • ½ teaspoon cumin

Secret Sauce:

  • 6 tablespoon BBQ sauce
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard

Stir together. This can be made in any quantity using a ratio of 3:1:1.

";
directions:
1. Sauté riced cauliflower in a large skillet with a little water.

2. Cook black beans on the stove adding 1 teaspoon cumin or more if desired until cooked.

3. Sauté corn on the stove with paprika and ½ teaspoon cumin or more if desired until cooked.

4. Sauté spinach or kale on the stovetop using a little water to cook it down.

5. Sauté sliced mushrooms until cooked.

6. Sauté red onions in skillet using a little water until cooked.

7. Dice avocado or mash if desired with fresh squeezed lime juice. May add sea salt and pepper if desired.

8. Chop Roma tomato, cilantro, and any fresh fruit.

9. Mix together BBQ sauce, Dijon mustard and maple syrup for the secret sauce.

10. Make your taco! Layer up the ingredients, lining your plate with 1/3–1/2 cup riced cauliflower, ¼ cup black beans, ¼ cup kale or spinach, ¼ cup corn, mushrooms, red onion, avocado mash, sprinkle tomatoes, cilantro, and add a spoon of fresh fruit salsa. Drizzle with secret sauce. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Vegan Chocolate Pudding with Coconut Cream and Berries
articleBodyHTML:
I scream! You scream! We all scream for pudding! Why not? It’s creamy chocolatey, desserty happiness in a bowl. Have some now!

This is a delicious chocolate delight. It has just the right amount of sweetness to feel guilty in the best way! The chocolate pudding itself takes minutes to make and a couple hours to chill and set. The coconut cream is quick and easy too; you just have to remember to put a can of coconut milk into the fridge the day before to harden the cream. Totally worth it!! Serves 4.
articleSummaryHTML: I scream! You scream! We all scream for pudding! Why not? It’s creamy chocolatey, desserty happiness in a bowl. Have some now!
seoTitle: Vegan Chocolate Pudding with Coconut Cream and Berries
seoDescription: I scream! You scream! We all scream for pudding! Why not? Try Sunwarrior's recipe for vegan chocolate pudding with coconut cream and berries!
recipeName: Vegan Chocolate Pudding with Coconut Cream and Berries
ingredients:
s:480:"
  • 2 cups nondairy milk (I used soy)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ⅓ cup cocoa powder, unsweetened
  • Pinch of cinnamon
  • ¼ cup cornstarch
  • Tiny pinch of ground red pepper
";
directions:
Directions for Chocolate Pudding

1. Into a medium pot sift sugar, cocoa powder, cornstarch, salt, cinnamon and red pepper.

2. Slowly begin to whisk in your nondairy milk. Turn heat to medium.

3. Continue whisking until pudding comes to a gentle boil. Reduce heat slightly and continue to whisk for another minute.

4. Cool slightly and place into serving dishes and chill for another couple hours.

5. Garnish with coconut whipped cream and berries if desired.

Directions for Coconut Whipped Cream

1. Place a can of coconut milk into the fridge for 24 hours.

2. When ready to use, turn can gently upside down and open. Gently pour out water or reserve liquid for making a great smoothie.

3. Scoop out hardened coconut cream into mixing bowl. Add ¼ cup of powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon of vanilla or liquid flavor of your choice. Beat with a hand mixer until nice and fluffy. About 2 minutes.

NOTE: This can stay for 5 days in the fridge.

articleTitle: Gluten Free and Vegan Fruit Tarts
articleBodyHTML:
Welcome the season with something sweet and satisfying. The fact that these gluten-free, vegan tarts are filled with healthy ingredients is just a perk to an already perfect dessert!

As another March finishes up, that means another Easter! The snow is melting, the days are becoming sunnier, and green is pushing out of the soil and greeting the season. We want to welcome the season, too! So we created this luscious vegan and gluten free fruit tart. Your friends and family won’t even know that it’s healthy and guilt free! This recipe comes together very easily. The filling is great to make as a pudding on its own or to save for further use.

These individual fruit tarts are the perfect way to celebrate the coming of spring. This vegan custard is zesty from the lemons and sweet from the touch of maple. Unlike other pastry dough that takes hours to rise and set because of yeast, this one only takes 15 minutes from start to finish. This recipe used mini tart pans but no sweat, you can also use extra-large muffin tins to get the same effect. You can use an assortment of fruit for the top from strawberries, kiwis, mangoes, or whatever fruit is in season where you live. Make this tart your masterpiece, and decorate it as you please!

Apricot preserves can be found at your local supermarket. It is a great way to add a sweet glaze to your tarts. Apricot preserves have a tartness yet an after note of sweetness which will compliment these tarts perfectly. If you’ve never tried apricot preserves, it’s a delicious breakfast idea to put on toast or muffins.

The best part about this recipe is that it can be eaten for dessert or for breakfast! This is a great make-ahead recipe. You can make the pie crusts a few days before, making sure to place them in air tight container and then fill them the day that you are going to eat them!

Happy hoppity baking!
articleSummaryHTML: Welcome the season with something sweet and satisfying. The fact that these gluten-free, vegan tarts are filled with healthy ingredients is just a perk to an already perfect dessert!
seoTitle: Gluten Free and Vegan Fruit Tarts | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: The fact that these gluten-free, vegan tarts are filled with healthy ingredients is just a perk to an already perfect dessert! Try these delicious tarts!
recipeName: Gluten free and Vegan Fruit Tarts
ingredients:
s:1099:"

Pastry:

  • 1 cup almond flour
  • 1/2 cup gluten free flour
  • 1/2 cup unsweetened coconut
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1/4 teaspoon Himalayan salt

Filling:

  • 1 can full-fat coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons organic cornstarch
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 zest of lemon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract or beans from 1 vanilla pod
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric
  • 1/8 teaspoon Himalayan salt

Glaze:

  • 1/2 cup melted apricot preserves
";
directions:
Place almond flour, gluten free flour, coconut, and salt in a food processor. Mix until combined for 30 seconds

Add melted coconut oil and maple syrup. Pulse until crumbs form. The dough should hold together

Remove dough and, using your fingers, press dough into a bottom of a tart pan with a removable bottom. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool

In the meantime, Place all filling ingredients into a pot over low heat. Cook until bubbly and thick (around 5 minutes). Remove from heat and place into a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let cool completely.

Remove crusts from pan. Fill tarts with custard and place fruit on top. Glaze with melted apricot preserves. Place in fridge for 1 hour to set

articleBodyHTML: Bite into a warm gooey cookie and then sigh with the satisfaction that there is no guilt with the healthy Ingredients that make up this truly yummy dessert!
articleSummaryHTML: Bite into a warm gooey cookie and then sigh with the satisfaction that there is no guilt with the healthy Ingredients that make up this truly yummy dessert!
seoTitle: Chocolate Banana Quinoa Cookies | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: This chocolate banana quinoa cookie gives you the satisfaction that there is no guilt with the healthy Ingredients that make up this truly yummy dessert!
ingredients:
s:697:"
  • 1 cup quinoa flour
  • ¾ of a spotty mashed banana
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • 1/3 teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ cup agave
  • 2 tablespoons softened coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder
  • ½ cup nondairy chocolate chips
  • ½ banana sliced into small pieces
  • Raisins or dried cranberries
";
directions:
Grab a large mixing bowl and mix in dry ingredients. This will include the cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, flour, raisins. Once everything is mixed well and smooth, set bowl aside.

Mix all wet ingredients in another bowl. This will include the agave, softened coconut oil and vanilla.

Combine both the wet and dry ingredients. Mix until smooth then add in chocolate chips and banana. Chill the batter in the fridge for 40 minutes. Preheat your oven to 325 degrees.

Spray your baking pan with coconut oil and drop batter into small balls onto the pan leaving 1 inch in between each cookie.

Bake for 10–15 minutes.

Let the cookies cool for 15 minutes and Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML: The coziest soup you will have this year! This cauliflower split pea soup is perfect for those crisp spring evenings!
articleSummaryHTML: The coziest soup you will have this year! This cauliflower split pea soup is perfect for those crisp spring evenings!
seoTitle: Cauliflower Split Pea Soup | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: The coziest soup you will have this year! Sunwarrior's cauliflower split pea soup is perfect for those crisp spring evenings!
ingredients:
s:770:"
  • 2 ½ cups green or yellow split peas
  • 1 large onion, peeled and chopped
  • 3 carrots, peeled and chopped
  • 1 head of cauliflower, cut into small florets or try 1–2 small sweet potatoes if using yellow peas (to thicken and sweeten)
  • 2 celery stalks, chopped
  • Pinch of rosemary
  • Pinch of thyme
  • Fresh oregano
  • Pinch of sea salt
  • Freshly ground black pepper
  • 1 large bunch of greens (kale, spinach, or chard)
";
directions:
1. Put 6 cups of water in a large soup pot and bring contents to a boil over high heat. Add the split peas, onion, carrots, cauliflower, celery, and herbs. Stir and bring to a boil again.

2. Reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, until the peas and vegetables are tender, about an hour. If you prefer a creamy soup, transfer half the mixture to a blender and blend until smooth. Return it to the soup pot and mix well to combine.

3. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Delicious Knowledge by Marni

The benefit of using dried split peas is that they don’t need to be soaked like other legumes and beans. They simply cook directly in your soup pot. They need a good hour or so, but they will break down and will blend nicely into your soup. Ever thought of thickening up your soup with cauliflower? Well, this is what happened here. Cauliflower can replace potato, flour, or any other thickener that would typically be called for or used in a soup. The cauliflower is adding in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, not to mention that cauliflower protects against cancer and heart disease.

If Cauliflower is not your thing, then opt for sweet potatoes–this is sometimes a favorite for me as this adds a nice rich, creamy sweetness to the soup!

articleBodyHTML:
Spice up dinner with this flavor-filled Mexican lentil soup. It’s a party for your tastebuds!

Lentil soup is delicious. I remember having lentil something or other when I was younger, and I wasn’t a fan. The texture was weird, and it didn’t taste good, either. I stayed away from it after that, basing my choice to not eat it all on that one experience. Then, a few years ago a friend of mine made me a Mexican version of lentil soup, and I was in love!

Maybe my taste buds have grown up, or maybe the recipe is just delicious. Since my kids love this soup, I’m thinking it’s just that the recipe is that amazing. Pureeing the soup helps a lot with the texture if you or your kids are picky about texture.

This soup is creamy and tastes scrumptious. And it is super easy to make! Just throw it all in a crockpot or slow cooker, and it’ll be done for supper. Even if you didn’t plan ahead (like you often must do with crockpot meals), this soup only takes a few hours, so it can be thrown in the crockpot in the afternoon and still be ready by evening!

Lentils help reduce your cholesterol since it has soluble fiber. It also reduces the risk of heart disease. Lentils are a great source of protein, which will keep you feeling full for longer. So what are you waiting for? You’ll just love this simple and easy soup!
articleSummaryHTML: Spice up dinner with this flavor-filled Mexican lentil soup. It’s a party for your tastebuds!
seoTitle: How to Make Vegan Mexican Lentil Soup | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Spice up dinner with Sunwarrior's flavor filled Mexican lentil soup. It’s a party for your tastebuds just in time for Cinco De Mayo. It's the best!
ingredients:
s:714:"
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • ¾ cup chopped onions
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 medium tomato, chopped
  • ¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped
  • ½ teaspoon cumin powder
  • 1 cup dried lentils
  • 1 small red potato, peeled and diced
  • 4 cups reduced sodium vegetable broth
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Kosher salt, to taste
  • Black pepper, to taste
";
directions: Add all ingredients to crockpot. Cook on low until lentils are tender about 2 to 4 hours. Puree soup in batches in blender until smooth. Serve hot with vegan sour cream and leftover cilantro, if desired.

articleBodyHTML:
Make your Easter dessert mm-mazing with these vegan Easter cookie sandwiches.

This time of year is filled with tasty desserts, bunny rabbits, and painted eggs. Although this time of year may seem difficult to be vegan, we promise it’s easy. We decided to come up with a festive and tasty cookie sandwich that will give you the warmth of this holiday and give the added bonus of a healthy, gluten-free treat. These cookies come together in no time, and your friends and family will devour them.

Any holiday season is a time for overindulgence when it comes to sweets and desserts. In our cookies, we used brown rice flour which is a lot healthier than white rice flour in gluten-free baking. The difference between white and brown rice flour is the husk. Since the husk is still intact, it contains more fiber and vitamins.

Fiber is such an essential part of our diets. We do receive a large amount of fiber from vegetables and other grains, but rice has insoluble fiber which can help move waste through the intestines. Since the husk is attached, brown rice flour can help make you feel fuller longer which can help in weight loss. Brown rice flour can also help in the absorption of calcium which can protect those special bones of yours.

Instead of using highly processed icing for this recipe, we used coconut butter which boasts many health benefits. Many people confuse coconut oil from coconut butter. The only difference is that coconut butter is made from the meat of the coconut while coconut oil is extracted from the coconut. Coconut butter is great for healthy hormones and high in fiber. It also contains healthy fats which will keep your energy levels high during the day. Coconut butter is a great substitute for butter in recipes.

This Easter-rific recipe only takes 15 minutes to make. You have to double dip the cookie sandwich to give it that extra special crunch, but we promise it is worth it.
articleSummaryHTML: Make your Easter dessert mm-mazing with these vegan Easter cookie sandwiches.
seoTitle: Vegan Easter Cookie Sandwich | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Easter is made for sweets. Chocolate eggs, marshmellows, and now these mm-mazing Sunwarrior vegan Easter cookie sandwiches with coconut.
ingredients:
s:697:"

Cookie:

  • 1/2 cup brown rice flour
  • 1/3 cup arrowroot flour
  • 1/4 cup maple syrup
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/8 teaspoon Himalayan salt

Filling:

  • 10 Medjool dates
  • 1/4 cup water

Coating

  • 1/2 cup coconut butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
Cookie:

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
  2. Mix all ingredients together to form dough
  3. Roll into balls and flatten
  4. Bake for 10 minutes
  5. Remove from oven and let cool

Filling:

  1. Place all ingredients in a high-speed blender
  2. Fill each cookie with 2 tablespoons of filling

Coating:

  1. Melt coconut butter and vanilla extract
  2. Coat each cookie once and place in the fridge. Repeat once more when cooled
  3. Top with chopped walnuts

articleTitle: The Greatest Peanut Butter Smoothie in the World
articleBodyHTML:
How to Make the Greatest Peanut Butter Protein Smoothie in the World!

A smoothie at its smoothest! Meet the greatest peanut butter smoothie in the world!

You’ll be hard pressed to find a smoothie of mine without something green and some Sunwarrior in it. Why? Because blending in spinach or kale adds virtually zero flavor difference (especially spinach!) yet a hefty nutritional difference. And because adding Sunwarrior's plant-based protein means the difference between a smoothie filling me up or leaving me hungry twenty minutes later.

So this peanut butter protein green smoothie achieves exactly all the above! It’s got the neutral but nutrition-packed greens, the satiating Sunwarrior plant-protein AND the icing on the cake; er rather, the tastiest flavor in the world for most of us: PEANUT BUTTER!
articleSummaryHTML: How to Make the Greatest Peanut Butter Protein Smoothie in the World!

seoDescription: Find out  the best way to make the greatest peanut butter smoothie in the world at Sunwarrior Health Hub. This creamy concoction does not disappoint.

articleBodyHTML:
It is cupcake time! Hazelnut & chocolate cupcakes are what happiness is all about. Make your happiness today!

These cupcakes taste so good you won’t believe they are healthy! And yet they are gluten-free, sugar-free, packed with protein, and just so delicious! There is a perfect balance of rich dark chocolate flavor and sweet and creamy icing. What’s more, they’re also super easy to make and don’t require too much prep time. There is a warning, though; they’re highly addictive! You’re likely to eat them all at once! Eat responsibly.
articleSummaryHTML: It is cupcake time! Hazelnut & chocolate cupcakes are what happiness is all about. Make your happiness today!
seoTitle: Hazelnut & Chocolate Cupcakes | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: It is cupcake time! Sunwarrior's best Hazelnut & chocolate cupcakes are what happiness is all about. Learn how to make your happiness today!
ingredients:
s:1121:"

For the Hazelnut Cream:

  • 150g hazelnuts
  • 200g dates, soaked overnight
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein
  • 1 cup plant-based milk
  • A pinch of salt

For the Cupcakes:

  • ½ cup gluten free oat flour
  • ½ cup cacao powder
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • 6 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 ½ cups plant-based milk
  • A pinch of salt
  • Cacao nibs or chocolate chips to sprinkle on top
";
directions:
Start with making the hazelnut cream. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius. Put the nuts on a baking tray and roast for 8–10 min or until golden-brown. Take out of the oven and let cool. Keep the oven on; you’ll need it to bake the cupcakes.

Put the nuts in a food processor and blend until sticky mass forms, just before it starts turning into nut butter. This will take a good few minutes. Add soaked dates, protein powder, salt and milk and blend until smooth.

To make the dough, simply put all the ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth. Pour one tablespoon of the dough in every paper cupcake case, then put one teaspoon of the hazelnut cream and top with the dough. In this way, you’ll have a lovely filling inside the cupcakes. Put them in the oven and bake for around 20 minutes.

When cool, use a piping bag to put the icing on top and sprinkle with cacao nibs/chocolate chips. If you have some hazelnut cream left, use it as a spread for a sandwich or add to your oatmeal in the morning!

Enjoy!

articleTitle: Do It Yourself Chocolate Easter Bunnies
articleBodyHTML:
Fill those Easter baskets with pure chocolate happiness that you made yourself (which means you get the bonus of knowing what goes into it)!

Easter is just around the corner, and I am sure we all have fond memories of Easter Sunday. Whether you enjoyed Easter because of the egg hunts that were planned just for you or whether you enjoyed receiving chocolate eggs and bunnies, whatever the reason, Easter is always a fun time of the year. Easter is also a sign that the warm weather is very near. Kids no doubt love Easter. With all the chocolate that comes with Easter, why wouldn’t they?

However, most commercial chocolate is highly processed, full of excessive amounts of calories, sugar and trans fats with zero nutritional value. Then again, not all chocolate is the same. These chocolate bunnies are made with raw, unprocessed chocolate or raw cacao. Raw cacao is certainly a super-food that is full of powerful antioxidants and contains minerals such as calcium and magnesium, which we definitely don’t get from commercial chocolate.

Here is a simple treat that your kids can have fun making to get ready for Easter. Hop on over to a craft store and purchase some cool, fun chocolate Easter moulds. Playing with chocolate moulds is always super fun.
articleSummaryHTML: Fill those Easter baskets with pure chocolate happiness that you made yourself (which means you get the bonus of knowing what goes into it)!
seoTitle: Do It Yourself Chocolate Easter Bunnies | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Fill those Easter baskets with pure chocolate happiness that you made yourself. Check out these do it yourself chocolate Easter bunnies.
recipeName: Do It Yourself Chocolate Easter Bunnies
ingredients:
s:417:"
  • ½ cup melted coconut oil
  • 1–2 tablespoon of maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoon of raw cacao powder
  • Pinch of Himalayan salt
  • 1 to 2 drops of essential oil of peppermint or sweet orange
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla essence
";
directions:
1. Place coconut oil in a measuring cup and melt it over a double boiler.
  2. Once coconut oil is melted, add maple syrup and cacao powder; stir until smooth and all the cacao powder has been mixed.
  3. Pour chocolate into the Easter moulds.
  4. Place the moulds in the freezer for minimum 1 hour.

articleBodyHTML:
How sweet it is! Welcome to your healthy, happening, hip springtime dessert where flavor is joy.

Citrus desserts have such a refreshing taste to them and fit perfectly with the warmer seasons. When made in a healthy way, they can also be beneficial to your body. And if made with simplicity in mind, they are definitely a win. This key lime pie recipe is delicious, healthy, and simple! All the awesome in one place!

Most key lime pies are made with unhealthy, sweetened condensed milk. This pie is made with soaked cashews, which gives it a creamy, delicious taste. Cashews are also rich in healthy fats as well as vitamins E, K, and B6.

Coconut milk and coconut oil also help with the creaminess. Coconut milk is high in vitamins C, E, B1, B3, B5, and B6 and other essential minerals like iron and calcium. Coconut oil also has healthy fats that help promote heart health and lower risk of heart disease.

The crust of this pie is a simple vegan graham cracker crust that can be baked for a few minutes or refrigerated for an hour. You can easily sub any crust that is your favorite, however.

This recipe really takes no time at all to put together, and before you know it, you’ll be enjoying this delicious dessert for any celebration!
articleSummaryHTML: How sweet it is! Welcome to your healthy, happening, hip springtime dessert where flavor is joy.
seoTitle: Vegan Key Lime Pie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: How sweet it is! Welcome to your healthy, happening, hip springtime dessert where flavor is joy. Try Sunwarrior's best vegan key lime pie today.
ingredients:
s:740:"

Crust

  • 1 ¼ cups vegan graham cracker crumbs (about 1 sleeve graham crackers)
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted

Filling

  • 1 cup raw cashews, soaked for 4–6 hours (or overnight), then drained
  • ¾ cup light or full-fat coconut milk, well shaken
  • 3–4 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 3–4 large limes or 6–7 key limes (1 tablespoon zest, ½ cup juice)
  • 1/3 cup agave nectar
";
directions:
For the crust, mix crumbs and coconut oil in a bowl. Press into a pie pan, spring form pan, or tart pan. Bake at 375 for 6–8 minutes until golden brown, or place in refrigerator for at least an hour.

For filling, add all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into crust and freeze for 2–4 hours.

To serve, remove from freezer 10–15 minutes before serving. Can add extra zest or vegan whipped cream, if desired.

articleTitle: For a Short Time Only: Garlic Scape Pesto!
articleBodyHTML:
Pesto from garlic scapes tastes amazing, but you can only get garlic scapes in the springtime so you’d better get stocked up now!

The season for garlic scapes is very short, so keep your eyes peeled in late spring, or you could easily miss your chance! Garlic scapes are the flower stalks of certain garlic plants, although they do not produce actual flowers. They are cut away from the garlic plant, since leaving them on would siphon the plants' energy away from forming an actual garlic bulb.

Chop scapes, and add them to salads or use them in place of scallions. They're great in hummus, dressings, salsa, and guacamole, or when made into a fresh aïoli. They also are wonderful pickled, but perhaps the most popular way to use them is to make a garlic scape pesto. Remove the stalk tip above the pod before using your scapes. The pod and tip are quite a bit tougher than the stalk.

Garlic scapes will keep up to a month in the refrigerator, although freshly cut scapes taste the best. Store them in a paper bag in the crisper drawer. Garlic scapes freeze well, too—you can blanch them or freeze them raw. Some of their flavor will diminish over time.
articleSummaryHTML: Pesto from garlic scapes tastes amazing, but you can only get garlic scapes in the springtime so you’d better get stocked up now!
seoTitle: For a Short Time Only: Garlic Scape Pesto!  | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Pesto from garlic scapes tastes amazing, but you can only get garlic scapes in the springtime so you’d better get stocked up now!
recipeName: Garlic Scape Pesto: Mayo and Spread
ingredients:
s:657:"

Garlic Scape Pesto Spread

  • 1 cup garlic scapes, chopped
  • 1/3 cup walnuts
  • 1/2 cup olive oil
  • 1/3 cup nutritional yeast
  • 1/2 teaspoon unrefined salt
  • Black pepper to taste

Garlic Scape Vegan Pesto Mayo

  • 3 tablespoons Garlic Scape Pesto Spread, from the recipe above
  • 2 tablespoons vegan mayonnaise
";
directions:
Garlic Scape Pesto Spread

Place scapes and walnuts in the bowl of a food processor outfitted with the S-blade, and process until fairly smooth. With the food processor running, drizzle in oil and continue to process until integrated. Pulse in nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper. Garlic Scape Pesto Spread will keep for up to one week in an airtight container in the refrigerator; it may also be frozen for more extended storage.

Garlic Scape Vegan Pesto Mayo

Combine ingredients in a blender until smooth. Garlic Scape Vegan Pesto Mayo will keep for up a week in the refrigerator.

articleBodyHTML:
Banana bread is a guilty pleasure that doesn't need the side effects brought on by gluten intolerances. This delicious grain-free, gluten-free recipe doesn't even have the guilt!

Gluten-free diets are more than a fad these days. Whether you have a serious celiac disease or just a minor gluten sensitivity (you know the feeling -- sometimes it just doesn't sit well), there is a rise in people choosing to eat less gluten. Over the last few months, I've been experimenting with baking gluten-free and grain-free recipes, leaving any feelings of bloat and inflammation behind.

Banana bread is one of my favorite guilty pleasures, but the heavy amounts of sugar, wheat, butter, and flour found in most recipes left me feeling sick to my stomach, literally and figuratively! But this recipe has simple ingredients and uses almond and coconut flour.

These two “flours” combined have a flavorful taste and the consistency of a traditional wheat flour -- perhaps even a little moister! Almond flour is simply almonds ground up, while coconut flour is created by grinding the dried meat from a coconut. Both are free of wheat and gluten. Using both of these ingredients in the recipe below made a perfectly moist and delicious banana bread that will satisfy any craving that you may have!
articleSummaryHTML: Banana bread is a guilty pleasure that doesn't need the side effects brought on by gluten intolerances. This delicious grain-free, gluten-free recipe doesn't even have the guilt!
seoTitle: Delicious Grain-Free, Gluten-Free Banana Bread | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Banana bread is a guilty pleasure. Sunwarrior has this delicious grain-free, gluten-free banana bread recipe that doesn't even have the guilt!
ingredients:
s:692:"
  • 1 tablespoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ¾ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ cup coconut flour
  • ¾ cup almond flour
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 3 flax eggs
  • 2 overly ripe bananas (or about 1 cup of mashed banana)
  • ¼ cup organic maple syrup
  • optional: ½ cup vegan chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F
  2. Combine the dry ingredients together in a bowl and mix well together with a whisk.
  3. In a separate bowl, mix together the wet ingredients and then add them to the bowl of dry ingredients and mix together.
  4. Grease the baking pan with coconut oil and add the batter to the baking dish.
  5. Bake for 40 minutes and test the bread is ready by sticking a fork or toothpick in the center of the batter. It should be perfectly moist and come out clean.

Enjoy!

Makes 8 servings.

articleBodyHTML:
This almond gelatin treat is super easy, fun, light, and tasty! When you have a hankering for Jell-O but are living vegan, this is the dessert that rocks your world!

By choosing a flavorless agar powder, you can create your own flavor profile. {3ast3r} If you want to jazz it up even more, try making your own fresh fruit compote to put on top. This almond gelatin has countless possibilities!
articleSummaryHTML: This almond gelatin treat is super easy, fun, light, and tasty! When you have a hankering for Jell-O but are living vegan, this is the dessert that rocks your world!
seoTitle: Almond Gelatin: Vegan Dessert | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: This almond gelatin treat is super easy, fun, light, & tasty! When you have a hankering for Jell-O but are living vegan, this dessert will rock your world!
ingredients:
s:387:"
  • 1 ½ cup water
  • ¾ cup almond milk
  • ¼ cup flavorless agar powder
  • 2 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • ½ teaspoon pure almond extract
  • Fresh fruit of choice for topping
";
directions:
In a small pot, add water, sugar, and agar powder. Over medium-high heat stir contents and bring to a low boil. Remove from heat. Add almond milk, and almond extract to mixture. Stir until well incorporated. Evenly pour mixture into four small ramekins. Chill in fridge approximately 1 hour. Add fresh fruit, almonds, or desired topping on top. Enjoy!

Note: Making a fruit compote requires 1.5 cups of desired fresh fruit (berries are always great), approximately ¼ cup of water, and 1 teaspoon of agave if you want to sweeten it up a little. Put ingredients into a small pot. Over low heat stir and let berries reduce into a semi sauce. Add additional water if needed to reach desired consistency.

articleBodyHTML:
These tahini chocolate chunk cookies are a dessert to go nuts over! Tahini offers a subtle nutty flavor but is a nut-free option to make dessert delicious!

When I first started living a plant-based lifestyle, I wasn’t really sure what to do with tahini. My only knowledge regarding tahini came from a tahini lemon salad dressing I had one time that somehow progressed into a tahini-maple dressing. I never really thought there was much to it until I decided that I wasn’t a big fan of peanut butter. It wasn’t anything bad about peanut butter; it was just too heavy sometimes! I couldn’t imagine eating another peanut butter cookie or even putting peanut butter on an apple. It was at this point when I started experimenting with tahini and adding it into baked goods. {3ast3r}  Man-oh-man was that an awesome idea, especially since it’s not every day that you see tahini being used in cookie recipes! Tahini is an awesome substitute that gives cookies a more subtle nutty taste while also being nut free! Not to mention when mixed with chocolate, it becomes irresistible. These cookies were gone in no time, and I plan to make more as soon as I can get to the store for more tahini!

Keep in mind that depending on which brand of tahini you use, the consistency will be thinner or thicker. The slightly thinner consistency might mean that you will need to add a little bit more flour (about 2 tablespoons) and potentially leave it in the fridge for a little bit longer to firm up. However, no matter what tahini you use, these cookies will be delicious.
articleSummaryHTML: These tahini chocolate chunk cookies are a dessert to go nuts over! Tahini offers a subtle nutty flavor but is a nut-free option to make dessert delicious!
seoTitle: Tahini Chocolate Chunk Cookies | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Sunwarrior's has the best tahini chocolate chunk cookies to go nuts over! Tahini offers a subtle nutty flavor but is a nut-free option for dessert.
ingredients:
s:532:"

Tahini Chocolate Chunk Cookies

  • ½ cup tahini
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 2 tablespoons melted coconut oil
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ¾ cup all-purpose flour or gluten-free flour
  • ¾ cup oats
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ cup chocolate chunks (or chips)

*Note: You can also cut up your favorite chocolate bar and use it as chunks!

";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375
  2. Mix tahini, milk, oil, vanilla, and sugar in a bowl. Whisk to combine well!
  3. In a separate bowl, mix flour, oats, and baking powder
  4. Add your wet mixture into the dry and stir to combine. Stir in the chocolate chips.
  5. Place mixture in the fridge for 10–15 minutes to firm up
  6. Scoop cookies onto a pan with parchment paper and bake for 10–12 minutes or until the bottom just begins to brown. Remove immediately from pan when they are done!

Makes 14–16 cookies

articleBodyHTML:
Nothing goes together better than cinnamon and apple, and when you put ‘em in a muffin, you find yourself in food heaven!

There are many health benefits to these cinnamon apple muffins. Cinnamon lowers LDL cholesterol, triglyceride concentrations, and overall cholesterol levels without affecting HDL cholesterol. These all reduce risk factors for heart disease, stroke, and diabetes. Cinnamon is also antifungal and helps reduce bad bacteria. Cinnamon also is rich in manganese, iron, calcium, and fiber which makes it a good nutritional boost all by itself. Couple that with the benefits of apple which helps with digestion because of being high in fiber and you have a dessert so good, you should have seconds.

And you can cover your most basic nutritional bases by adding a power boost of Sunwarrior’s illumin8. Plus the vanilla bean flavor blends perfectly with the cinnamon and apple.
articleSummaryHTML: Nothing goes together better than cinnamon and apple, and when you put ‘em in a muffin, you find yourself in food heaven!
seoTitle: How to Make Vegan Cinnamon Apple Muffins | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Nothing goes together better than cinnamon & apple, and when you put ‘em in a muffin, you find yourself in heaven! Try our vegan cinnamon apple muffins.
ingredients:
s:896:"
  • 3 cups whole wheat pastry flour
  • 1 ½ cups organic sugar
  • 2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 2 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • ¾ c refined coconut oil
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 tablespoon chia egg (1 Tablespoon chia flour, 3 Tablespoon water)
  • 1 granny smith apple peeled and grated
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior’s illumin8 vanilla bean (for a boost of your vitamins, minerals, and protein needed to keep a body healthy!) (optional)

Topping: cinnamon and coconut sugar

";
directions:
1. Mix dry ingredients together then cut in the coconut oil til crumbly,
  2. Mix the chia egg in separate bowl, add in the milk, add the wet ingredients into the dry, fold in the apple.
  3. Put into the size muffin tins you want. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar over the top.
  4. Bake at 375 deg for the amount of time needed for the size pan
  • 15 min for mini muffin size
  • 20–25 for regular muffin size
  • 25–30 for jumbo

articleBodyHTML:
Squash for dessert? That’s right! This is dessert done with style and health and awesome. We give you the berry squash crumble!

This berry squash crumble is a great way to enjoy a more substantial dessert with sweetness and texture that’s a little out of the box and unexpected. Berries are coming back into season, and what a great way to explore a new flavor profile. Serve with dairy free ice cream if desired. {3ast3r} Serves 6.
articleSummaryHTML: Squash for dessert? That’s right! This is dessert done with style and health and awesome. We give you the berry squash crumble!
seoTitle: Berry Squash Crumble Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Squash for dessert? That’s right! This is dessert done with style and health and awesome. Sunwarrior gives you the best berry squash crumble recipe!
ingredients:
s:546:"
  • 1 small acorn squash, halved and seeded
  • 2 tablespoons vegan margarine
  • 3 large strawberries, sliced
  • 2 teaspoons brown sugar
  • ½ cup oats
  • ½ teaspoon allspice
  • ½ cup raspberries
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ cup blueberries
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. While waiting, combine oats and 1.5 tablespoons margarine in a small bowl until well combined and stuck together.

2. Use remaining margarine and rub inside each half of squash. Sprinkle brown sugar, allspice, and cinnamon.

3. In a small bowl combine the berries and add berry mixture equally into each squash half. Sprinkle with remaining allspice and cinnamon.

4. Add oat mixture on the top of each half of squash. Cover and bake until done. Approximately 1–1.5 hours depending on squash. You want to make sure the squash is completely cooked until it’s super soft to bring out all the flavor.

5. Cool slightly and scoop chosen amount into a small bowl. Serve with dairy free ice cream. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Dress your dessert in decadence with these vegan cacao brownies!

Who doesn’t love a delicious, decadent brownie that melts in your mouth? I fell in love with chocolate a bit later than most people, and now it is a craving that I just can’t ignore. But it turns out brownies don't have to be made with dairy, added sugar, and flour – all ingredients that are hard for the body to break down. Instead, I found a recipe that gives a healthy spin on your typical brownies by using chopped zucchini as a main ingredient in the batter. I know that this combination may not sound conventional, but the truth is that you can’t taste the zucchini, and it creates a moist, cake-like consistency very similar to that of your traditional brownie! While some people make vegan brownies with avocado or black beans, zucchini brownies won’t have the potent smell that some bean brownies have, and they won’t be too chunky like the avocado brownies. That makes these a great choice to satisfy a true chocolate craving and get some added nutrients!
articleSummaryHTML: Dress your dessert in decadence with these vegan cacao brownies!
seoTitle: Vegan Cacao Brownie Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Dress your dessert in decadence with these vegan cacao brownies from Sunwarrior Health Hub. Nothing better than chocolate with a hint of zucchini.
ingredients:
s:803:"
  • 1.5 cups of zucchini (note - first grate the zucchini or purchase it already grated from your local health supermarket and then chop the shredded zucchini into tiny pieces)
  • 1 cup of organic almond butter
  • 1 flax egg (regular egg is also fine, but to make this vegan, use flax)
  • 1/3 cup organic maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon organic vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 cup of vegan dark chocolate chips (note – the Enjoy Life brand, 69% cacao is my go-to)
";
directions:
1. Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees
  2. Spray a 9 by 9 baking dish with coconut oil
  3. In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients (both wet and dry) and mix until smooth
  4. Pour batter into baking dish and bake for 40–45 minutes
  5. Remove from oven and let cool for 20 minutes
  6. Place dish in refrigerator (on top of a trivet) and store, allowing brownies to cool for 45 minutes before eating so that they get that moist consistency
  7. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Gallo Pinto: Not Your Average Rice & Beans
articleBodyHTML:
Beans and rice make a simple meal, but simple is awesome! Check out how simply delicious this dish is!

If you’ve ever been to Costa Rica or Nicaragua, you have likely been served Gallo Pinto. It could be said that Gallo Pinto is the national food of these countries. It looks like rice and beans because it is rice and beans, with a few secret ingredients that infuse this daily staple with fabulous flavor. Gallo Pinto means spotted rooster in Spanish, but don’t worry, this is a rooster friendly vegan dish that is simple and sublime. It contains just seven ingredients and only takes about ten minutes to make as long as you cook the rice and beans ahead of time.

Gallo Pinto packs a great amount of nutrients, particularly protein, fiber, folate, and antioxidants. The avocado slices add healthy fats, the cilantro is especially rich in vitamins A & K, and the red pepper gives us a boost of vitamins C. Together rice and beans contain all of the amino acids, forming a complete protein. Even though you don’t have to eat them at the same to get the benefits, they sure do taste great together.
articleSummaryHTML: Beans and rice is a simple meal, but simple is awesome! Check out how simply delicious this dish is!
seoTitle: Gallo Pinto: Not Your Average Rice & Beans | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Beans and rice is a simple meal, but simple is awesome! Check out how simply delicious this dish is! Sunwarrior has this Gallo Pinto recipe.
recipeName: Gallo Pinto: Not Your Average Rice & Beans
ingredients:
s:515:"
  • 8–10 springs fresh cilantro
  • 1 red or green pepper
  • 1 small onion
  • 2 cups of cooked beans (black, kidney, or red)
  • 1.5–2 cups of cooked brown rice
  • 2 tablespoons oil
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 avocado
  • 1 small tomato
";
directions:
1. Cook rice and beans (see instructions below)

2. Wash and chop cilantro. Slice avocado. Set Aside.

3. Dice onion and pepper and stir fry in a large pan or wok with 2 tablespoons oil on medium-high heat for about 5 minutes

4. Add 2 cups of beans, 1.5 cups of rice, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes until thoroughly warmed

5. Serve in bowls, add fresh cilantro, and mix well.

6. Add avocado slices

7. Enjoy!

Dry Bean Instructions (rinse thoroughly first)

A. Slow Cooker: fill 3/4 with water, 1/4 with beans, cook on high 4 hours

B. Stovetop: Soak 2 cups dry beans in 4 cups of water overnight. Add to large pan with additional 1 cup water- bring to boil, reduce to medium heat and cook 3 hours. (Note: This will yield more beans than necessary for this recipe, store in refrigerator for up to 1 week!)

Canned bean instructions (not advised)

Drain and rinse very thoroughly.

Brown Rice instructions

To a medium saucepan add 3 cups of water and 1 cups dry rice - let simmer on low/medium heat for 20–30 minutes, partially covered. Stir occasionally. Add 1/4 cup water if needed.

articleBodyHTML:
Sweet potato aren’t just what’s for dinner! We’re cooking up breakfast with these sweet potatoes and blueberries!

I like to change up what I eat for breakfast sometimes, to add variety and find new breakfast favorites. Sweet potatoes are always stocked in my house especially in the winter and spring time when they are on sale. I’ve made lots of dishes with sweet potatoes for lunches, dinners, and desserts. However, I’ve never made a dish of sweet potato for breakfasts. That’s when I got the idea to make a sweet potato dish for breakfast. That is when I got the bright idea to mix sweet potato and Sunwarrior Vanilla Meal Replacement powder and boy, it was delicious! The  Sunwarrior illumin8 vanilla added so much flavor and protein. It also gave the sweet potatoes a hint of vanilla!

Benefits of Sweet Potatoes

Sweet potatoes are an excellent source of vitamin A, source of vitamin C, manganese, copper, pantothenic acid and vitamin B6. Additionally, they are a good source of potassium, dietary fiber, niacin, vitamin B1, vitamin B2 and phosphorus.
articleSummaryHTML: Sweet potato aren’t just what’s for dinner! We’re cooking up breakfast with these sweet potatoes and blueberries!
seoTitle: Blueberry Sweet Potato Breakfast | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Sweet potatoes aren’t just what’s for dinner! We’re cooking up breakfast with these sweet potatoes and blueberries! Check out Sunwarrior's breakfast here!
ingredients:
s:401:"
  • 2 medium-sized sweet potatoes
  • 3 tablespoons honey (or agave syrup for our vegan friends)
  • 1 scoop of Sunwarrior illumin8 vanilla
