articleBodyHTML:
Summer is here and what better way to chill out than with a soup that will not only keep you cool, but also is jam-packed with nutrients. Welcome to summer chillin’ green soup

Summer is a great time to enjoy the freshest produce: light, low calorie, and refreshing. This savory soup is delicious and can be very versatile. Each time you make it, you can add different green leafy vegetables and change it up to add a variety of nutrients.

Both the celery and cucumber in this soup are made up of 95 percent water and are ideal for cooling and for staying hydrated on those scorching hot summer days. Cucumbers and celery are high in fiber and low in calories which makes them perfect for keeping you looking and feeling great in that swimsuit.

If you grew up watching the cartoon Popeye, then you know he ate spinach to grow big and strong. This is because spinach has a high protein content that helps build big strong muscles, and it doesn’t stop there. It is high in fiber, vitamins A, C, E, and K, thiamin, vitamin B6, folate, calcium, iron, magnesium, phosphorus, potassium, copper, and manganese. Overall a pretty amazing food. Spinach is also a great addition to this green soup because it has a very mild taste. This soup will impress even the green soup newbies.

Parsley and cilantro are rich in vitamins and minerals and have powerful detoxifying properties. Both these herbs rid your body of heavy metals that accumulate in the bloodstream and organs.

Of course, we cannot leave out the renowned avocado. It is one of the few fruits that will provide you with "good" fats that can help keep your cholesterol levels in the healthy range and help lower your risk for heart disease.

This soup is topped with some super vegetables such as purple cabbage and red pepper which not only adds color to this soup but is also rich in antioxidants.

So start blending and enjoy the healing and cooling benefits of this delicious soup.
articleSummaryHTML: Summer is here and what better way to chill out than with a soup that will not only keep you cool, but also is jam-packed with nutrients. Welcome to summer chillin’ green soup
seoTitle: Summer Chillin’ Green Soup | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Check Sunwarrior's Chillin' Green Soup this summer to keep you cool but also give you all the nutrients.
ingredients:
s:794:"
  • 1 English cucumber
  • 1 small avocado
  • ½ cup of parsley or cilantro
  • 1 lemon juiced
  • 2 large celery stalks
  • 1 cup of spinach
  • 1 cup of water
  • Salt to taste
  • Garlic powder to taste

Toppings:

  • Diced purple cabbage
  • Diced red pepper
  • Hemp seeds
  • Nutritional yeast
  • Cracked black pepper
";
directions: Place all ingredients except the toppings in a high powered blender until smooth. Add water ½ a cup at a time, and if it’s still too thick, add more as necessary according to your preference. Place in a bowl and add diced purple cabbage and diced red pepper. Sprinkle with hemp seeds, nutritional yeast, and cracked black pepper.

articleBodyHTML:
Apple nachos. No cheese, no crunchy tortilla chip. But we’re calling them nachos because they crunch and they’re drizzled with melty awesome. It’s a thing. A really good thing.

Apple nachos have about as much in common with actual nachos as Mother’s Day has with Father’s Day. I mean, same concept, I guess, but Mother’s Day activities and gifts are completely 180 degrees different from Father’s Day gifts, right? Well, similar to actual “nachos” these apple nachos do have a crunchy vehicle (apples) laid out on a dish with melty stuff on top (nut butter drizzle) so I guess they have all that in common. And what we have in common is greater than our differences.

Either way, I should stop analyzing because calling this easy-to-make healthy apple snack “nachos” makes it all the more fun, so whatever!

Oh, and you know that this is actually a healthy snack, right? I mean, the health benefits of apples are tremendous. They’re extremely rich in antioxidants and flavonoids, they have a lot of dietary fiber (make sure you eat the skins! And make sure they’re organic!), which can help you poop. Your blood sugar won’t spike from eating it, and they’ve got a solid amount of Vitamin C. So, yeah, I guess this is the opposite of nachos because nachos aren’t the least bit nutritious.
articleSummaryHTML: Apple nachos. No cheese, no crunchy tortilla chip. But we’re calling them nachos because they crunch and they’re drizzled with melty awesome. It’s a thing. A really good thing.
seoTitle: How to Make Apple Nachos! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Apple nachos. No cheese, no crunchy tortilla chip. But we’re calling them nachos because they crunch and they’re drizzled with melty awesome. It’s a thing. A really good thing.
ingredients:
s:493:"
  • 2 apples (any color, but I love green), washed and sliced thinly
  • ¼ cup nut butter of choice
  • 2 teaspoon melted coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup (or honey)
  • Optional: any additional sprinkle things that you like (chocolate chips, cacao nibs, shredded coconut, cocoa powder, cinnamon, or anything else you fancy)
";
directions:
1. Wash and slice your apples, then lay them out on a platter as you would chips for nachos.
  2. In a small cup or little mixing bowl, combine the nut butter, melted coconut oil, and maple syrup.
  3. Drizzle that on top of the apple chips.
  4. Finish by topping with any additional sprinkles of stuff that you like!
  5. Dive in!

articleBodyHTML:
For a rainbow of comfort, this ratatouille hits all the warm places of the soul while filling the body with nutrition.

This colorful dish makes a delicious and healthy midweek dinner. The vegetables are moist, soft and full of flavor. You can enjoy the ratatouille on its own, or with a side of green leafy salad and rice/sweet potato/bread. You won’t believe how simple it is to make!
articleSummaryHTML: For a rainbow of comfort, this ratatouille hits all the warm places of the soul while filling the body with nutrition.
seoTitle: Rainbow Ratatouille | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For a rainbow of comfort, this ratatouille hits all the warm places of the soul while filling the body with nutrition.
ingredients:
s:752:"
  • Olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic, chopped
  • 3 medium red onions + 1 white onion, chopped
  • 1 medium eggplant
  • 2 medium zucchinis
  • 1 red pepper
  • 1 green pepper
  • 1 yellow pepper
  • 3 medium tomatoes
  • 2 tomatoes, chopped
  • Pinch of dried rosemary
  • Pinch of dried thyme
  • 10–15 fresh basil leaves
  • Salt and pepper
";
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350 F (180 C).

To make the sauce, heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a saucepan, add chopped garlic and chopped white onion. Heat until golden but be careful not to burn the garlic. Add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper. Cook on low heat for about 15 min stirring occasionally. At the end add the basil leaves and a pinch of rosemary and thyme.

While the sauce is cooking, prepare the eggplant, zucchinis, tomatoes and onions by slicing them into thin rounds. Prepare the peppers by cutting them into pieces similar in size to the round slices of the other vegetables. Set aside.

Put ¾ of the sauce in a round baking dish. Arrange the sliced veggies in alternating patterns starting from the outer edge to the inside of the dish. Season with salt and pepper. Put the rest of the sauce on top and drizzle with olive oil.

Cover the pan and bake for 45 minutes. Remove cover and bake for another 15 min. By this point, the veggies should be nice and soft.

articleBodyHTML:

s:305:"

  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1/4 cup coconut milk

";
directions: Make coffee the normal way you would, whether that's in a coffee maker, French press, aero press, etc. Once the coffee is made and still hot, add the coconut oil, cinnamon, and agave. Mix until everything is well combined. Then add the coconut milk. You can also make this into Iced Coconut Latte. Add ice at the end. Then top with a little bit of cinnamon. Enjoy a cup or two!

articleBodyHTML:
Get to know tempeh and find yourself one of the best food friends you’ll ever have especially when you bite into this sesame miso crusted tempeh!

Tempeh is a traditional Indonesian food made by splitting, cooking, and fermenting soybeans. It looks like textured tofu but is more versatile than tofu. Tempeh’s hearty texture holds bold flavors and lends itself to veggie burgers, kabobs, salads, and stir fries.

As an energy building food, tempeh also contains protein and omega 3 fatty acids. The most unique feature is that it’s held together by enzymes that make it easy to digest because of its probiotic properties. Tempeh also gives your body much-needed B vitamins. You’ll likely find tempeh in the frozen or refrigerated section of most grocery stores. It often comes in different flavors with different herbs, seeds, or grains added. I prefer to have it plain.

I recommend buying only one to three packs at a time to keep it fresh. It’s best stored in your freezer.
articleSummaryHTML: Get to know tempeh and find yourself one of the best food friends you’ll ever have especially when you bite into this sesame miso crusted tempeh!
seoTitle: Sesame Miso Crusted Tempeh | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Get to know tempeh and find yourself one of the best food friends you’ll ever have especially when you bite into this sesame miso crusted tempeh!
ingredients:
s:630:"
  • 1 package of organic tempeh
  • 1 tablespoon miso paste
  • 2 tablespoons honey (or agave syrup for vegans)
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon ginger + a few extra slices for simmering in pan
  • 2 tablespoons tamari (1 tablespoon for simmering in pan)
  • 1 tablespoon mirin
  • 2 tablespoons sesame oil
  • ½ cup sesame seeds (black and white)
";
directions:
Simmer Tempeh in a shallow pan with ½ cup water, tamari, and sliced ginger for 15–20 minutes. Remove and pat dry with towel.

Place 1 tablespoon sesame oil in glass dish and coat bottom.

Mix marinade (omit sesame seeds) in small bowl and coat the tempeh completely.

Once Tempeh is coated with sauce, dip into sesame seeds and coat both sides.

Place in preheated oven (350) for 10–15 minutes.

articleTitle: Vegan Vigilante and the Kung Pow Peanut Sauce Stir Fry
articleBodyHTML:
The Vegan Vigilante is changing the way we see the food in our fridges one household at a time, leaving health in his wake. Where will he strike next?

Welcome to the first episode of the Vegan Vigilante, a video series where celebrity vegan chef Jason Wrobel steps up to the challenges Sunwarrior issues him. This week he was asked to cook a healthy, plant-based meal for a friend, using only the ingredients, tools, and equipment found in their kitchen. He isn’t allowed to take anything from home, not his beautiful blender, his fancy knives, or even a packet of Sunwarrior superfood protein.

The Vegan Vigilante will prove, once and for all, that it isn’t too hard, expensive, or time-consuming to make a healthy meal at home. If he can do it with what you have lying around, so can you. Jason Wrobel drops in on two of his friends, Robin and Ryan, to scrounge through their pantry, fridge, and cupboards and make them something nutritious and delicious.

Jason’s friends surprise him by having more ingredients than he expected. Many of us buy a decent amount of good foods, but let them spoil or use them in unhealthy ways. Spicy Asian stir fry to the rescue! He’s able to whip up a spicy, Kung Pow peanut sauce covered veggie dish in less time than it takes to make it to a drive thru and back home, especially in a big city. You have to see Robin and Ryan snarf this dish down even faster. It’s obviously delicious! Where and how will the Vegan Vigilante strike next?
articleSummaryHTML: The Vegan Vigilante is changing the way we see the food in our fridges one household at a time, leaving health in his wake. Where will he strike next?
seoTitle: Vegan Vigilante | Kung Pow Peanut Sauce Stir Fry
seoDescription: The Vegan Vigilante is changing the way we see the food in our fridges one household at a time, leaving health in his wake. Where will he strike next?
recipeName: Kung Pow Peanut Sauce Stir Fry
ingredients:
s:880:"

 

  • 1 cup rice, cooked
  • 1 head broccoli, chopped
  • 1 purple onion, chopped
  • 1 stalk celery, chopped
  • 1 carrot, chopped
  • 1 cup cremini mushrooms
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 3 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon chili garlic sauce
  • 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar
  • A splash sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon brown sugar
  • 1 tablespoon peanut sauce
  • 1 lemon juiced
";
directions: Sauté vegetables all together in a sauté pan on low heat, add all wet ingredients, mix and continue to sauté until vegetables are cooked al dente. Spoon rice into bowl and ladle saucy vegetables over the rice. Serve and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your fiesta on with this party in your mouth vegan tortilla soup! Everything healthy and flavor that tastes like a parade!

This recipe for vegan tortilla soup is a little labor intensive, but think of it as a labor of love. It will be well worth the effort. Aside from being incredibly savory and nutritious, tortilla soup is great for a cold, blustery winter day when the soups is served hot but is just as good during the summer if served cooled!

Thanks to the variety of vegetables, one bowl of this soup will supply you with immense health benefits: boosts immune system (vitamin C and antioxidants), improves heart heath (good fats), lowers cholesterol, improves liver function and detoxification, improves digestion (fiber and electrolytes), helps fight inflammation and oxidative stress(vitamin C), helps balance thyroid and adrenal function (polyphenols), maintains eye health (vitamin c, manganese, beta carotene), and increases energy levels and metabolism (b vitamins). Let’s get started!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your fiesta on with this party in your mouth vegan tortilla soup! Everything healthy and flavor that tastes like a parade!
seoTitle: Vegan Tortilla Soup Fiesta | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get your fiesta on with this party in your mouth vegan tortilla soup! Everything healthy and flavor that tastes like a parade!
ingredients:
s:1592:"
  • 4 cups cooked pinto beans
  • 4 tortillas
  • 12 cups water
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 onion
  • 6 cloves of garlic
  • 1 poblano pepper
  • 1 red pepper
  • 2 summer squash
  • 1 zucchini
  • 2 cups broccoli (or cauliflower)
  • 4 stalks of celery
  • 4 medium sized carrots
  • 4 green onions
  • 1 bunch cilantro
  • ½ cup red salsa
  • ½ cup pasta sauce
  • 1 teaspoon chipotle
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon garlic salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 1 avocado

For the Vegan Cashew Sour Cream

  • 1 ¼ cup raw cashews
  • ¾ cup boiling water (to soak cashews)
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon savory yeast 
";
directions:
1. Soak 1 ¼ cups cashews for vegan sour cream in 3/4 cup boiling water (skip this if using substitute)

2. Pour 8 cups of water in a large soup pot, turn on medium heat.

3. Chop carrots & celery then add to soup pot.

4. Chop summer squash, zucchini, and broccoli - set aside.

5. Chop peppers, onion, and garlic. Add to frying pan with 2 tablespoon oil. Cook on medium heat, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes.

6. Add squash, zucchini, and broccoli to soup pot.

7. Chop cilantro and green onion

8. Add 4 more cups of water, pinto beans, salsa, pasta sauce, spices to soup pot and simmer on low.

9. Create vegan cashew sour cream (or use vegan sour cream sub):

Pour out ½ the cashew water then add cashews, salt, savory yeast, lemon and apple cider vinegar to food processor and blend until smooth. Set aside 1/2 of this mixture in the fridge.

10. To the soup pot add ½ the vegan sour cream mixture, the onion, pepper, garlic. Stir fry the cilantro and green onion. Stir well.

8. Turn off heat and let soup sit for 5 minutes.

9. Cut tortillas into strips and pan fry in a tiny amount of oil until golden brown.

10. Serve soup into bowls with tortilla slices, avocado pieces, and a dollop of the cold vegan cashew sour cream.

11. Enjoy Immensely.

articleBodyHTML:
What better way to treat yourself after a workout than with a healthy and tasty chocolate protein truffle?

They are very nutritious, and they will instantly replenish the need for simple carbohydrates and protein after a tough workout. They are also absolutely delicious, rich and very decadent, but refreshing. They are super easy and quick to make, and you can store them in the freezer for as long as you like so you don’t have to worry about them going off. What is more, you can actually eat them directly from the freezer, and they never go rock-hard. These truffles are absolute winners, so make sure you make them today!
articleSummaryHTML: What better way to treat yourself after a workout than with a healthy and tasty chocolate protein truffle?
seoTitle: Chocolate Protein Truffles | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: What better way to treat yourself after a workout than with a healthy and tasty chocolate protein truffle? Check out these delicious plant based treats.
ingredients:
s:547:"
  • 200g Medjool dates, or regular dates soaked in water for 1–2 hour and then drained
  • 1/4 cup lukewarm water
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted but not hot
  • Cacao or cocoa powder for coating

(makes 12–15 truffles)

";
directions:
1. Put the dates in a food processor or a high-speed blender (must be high-speed), add water and blend until you get a smooth paste, this normally takes a good few minutes.
  2. Add coconut oil and blend until smooth. Then add the protein powder and blend until smooth and mixed thoroughly. Put in a bowl and place in the freezer for 2 hours.
  3. Put 1–2 tablespoons of cacao or cocoa powder on a flat plate. Take the paste out of the freezer and using a spoon, scoop out little portions, roll them in your hands and then roll in the cacao or cocoa powder for coating. Place on a flat tray. Put the tray in the freezer for 2 hours. After this time you can transfer the truffles into a box and enjoy them whenever you want. There is no need to defrost them in advance!

articleBodyHTML:
What’s for dinner? Health and flavor with this tomato and chickpea soup! It’s a great day to be vegan!

Every season is the perfect season for hearty soups that warm the soul and capture our taste buds. This soup can be made in big batches and then frozen and eaten at a later time.

This soup will hit the spot when you sprinkle in the smoked paprika, adding a fun smoky flavor. Another great option for this soup is to include some roasted red peppers. You can add them to the tray when you’re baking your vegetables. To liven it up, drizzle some lemon juice on your soup near the end of baking. You can add any additional herbs of choice such as freshly chopped basil or tarragon. This recipe uses a variety of microgreens to add vitamins and boost alkalinity in the body.

Chickpeas are such a versatile legume. They can be used for so many dishes, but most importantly they are high in protein, fiber, and contain so many great benefits that help boost our health. Chickpeas are rich in selenium which helps prevent inflammation in the body. Chickpeas keep us fuller longer and lower overall calorie intake for the day.

This recipe is vegan, dairy free, and gluten free. This is the perfect recipe to serve for a family dinner or large crowd. It is a definite crowd pleaser.
articleSummaryHTML: What’s for dinner? Health and flavor with this tomato and chickpea soup! It’s a great day to be vegan!
seoTitle: Smoky Tomato and Chickpea Soup | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: What’s for dinner? Health and flavor with this tomato and chickpea soup! It’s a great day to be vegan!
ingredients:
s:529:"
  • 2 lbs. Roma tomatoes, sliced in half
  • 1 lb. cherry tomatoes, sliced in half
  • 2 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 medium onion
  • 3 clove garlic
  • 1 tablespoon smoked paprika
  • 1 can organic chickpeas
  • 4 cups vegetable stock
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1.) Preheat oven to 400 degrees

2.) Line a baking tray with parchment paper. Add sliced Roma and cherry tomatoes, garlic and onion. Drizzle with olive oil and paprika. Roast for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes.

3.) Place roasted vegetables in a high-speed blender with 2 cups of vegetable stock. Blend until completely smooth. Reheat soup on the stove in a small sauce pot. Add chickpeas and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Add salt and pepper for taste.

4.) Remove from heat and top with micro greens, nuts, seeds, or chickpeas

articleBodyHTML:
Dessert for breakfast? Yes, please! Especially if it’s healthy! That’s why we’re bringing you this key lime pie smoothie. Good Morning!

Summer is right around the corner, and that calls for a refreshing citrus smoothie. I love key lime pie, so I decided to experiment with a few different key lime pie smoothie recipes until I found the perfect one. This one has a mouthwatering sweet lime tart taste but without all the added bad calories of the original Key Lime Pie. This smoothie will make you feel like you are indulging in a decadent dessert. You can even make this for a healthy dessert that is light and creamy.
articleSummaryHTML: Dessert for breakfast? Yes, please! Especially if it’s healthy! That’s why we’re bringing you this key lime pie smoothie. Good Morning!
seoTitle: Key Lime Pie Smoothie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Dessert for breakfast? Yes, please! Especially if it’s healthy! That’s why we’re bringing you this key lime pie smoothie. Good Morning!
ingredients:
s:546:"
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 fresh banana
  • 2–3 limes
  • 1 handful of spinach
  • 1 scoop vanilla Sunwarrior Classic Plus
  • 1 cup coconut milk or water
  • Ice
  • Gluten-free granola or graham cracker for garnish on top
";
directions:
Juice the limes until you get ½ cup lime juice. Zest 2 teaspoon limes. Add lime and lime zest to all the ingredients listed and blend well. Pour into a fun glass, Mason jar, or dessert cup, and add gluten-free granola or graham cracker for garnish on top. Enjoy!

Benefits of Lime

This citrus fruit has so many health benefits which include weight loss, skin care, improved digestion, relief from constipation, eye care, and treatment of scurvy, peptic ulcer, respiratory disorders, gout, and gums. It has many vitamins and minerals including potassium. Potassium is important for maintaining nerve function and healthy blood pressure levels. This fruit is also linked to antioxidants and bioflavonoids that researchers believe could lower the likelihood of cancer.

Fun Fact: There are two main lime fruits: Tahitian and Key. Did you know that Key Lime Pie was originated in Key West in the 1800’s? It has been around awhile, and I don’t think it is going anywhere!

articleBodyHTML:
In the heat of summer, dinner should be refreshing! We’re here to give you that refreshment with this radish and cucumber salad!

This delicious cucumber, radish, and dill salad is crunchy and adds a nutritional kick to your daily diet. We often see radishes as those additions to dishes that get pushed to the corner of the plate and forgotten in our consumption of dishes. These spicy and crunchy vegetables can help our digestion break down toxins in the body. Radishes have a very high amount of vitamin C that helps our immune system stay strong and healthy.

When you pair radishes with cucumbers, you have a hydration powerhouse. Both of these vegetables have high water content that keeps your body hydrated and nourished all season long.

The real star in this recipe is the hemp heart dressing. Hemp hearts are a great nutrition boost. Hemp hearts have a natural nutty flavor which adds an incredible taste to dishes or salad dressing. Hemp hearts are rich in Omega-3 and Omega-6 which helps maintain a healthy body and brain function. Our body does not produce them, so we need to get them from food sources. Hemp hearts are rich in plant-based protein, so they are a great way for vegans or vegetarians to amass a large amount of protein. A few tablespoons of hemp hearts have over 11 grams of protein which is comparable to a steak. Hemp hearts are easy to digest so your body doesn’t need to go into overdrive trying to digest them.

This salad will keep up to four days in an airtight container in the fridge.
articleSummaryHTML: In the heat of summer, dinner should be refreshing! We’re here to give you that refreshment with this radish and cucumber salad!
seoTitle: Radish and Cucumber Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: In the heat of summer, dinner should be refreshing! We’re here to give you that refreshment with this radish and cucumber salad!
ingredients:
s:728:"

Radish Hemp Salad

  • 2 large English cucumbers, sliced thinly
  • 5 radishes, sliced thinly
  • 1 bundle dill, stems removed

Hemp Heart Dressing:

  • ½ cup raw and hulled hemp seeds
  • ¼ cup lemon juice
  • ¼ cup filtered water
  • 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
  • ½ teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1.) Slice all vegetables and place them in a large bowl

2.) Add all dressing ingredients to a high-speed blender. Blend until smooth.

3.) Mix dressing with vegetables and add dill

articleBodyHTML:
Baking: ain’t nobody got time for that! That’s why we give you no bake coconut protein balls!

Coconut is one of my favorite things to eat, but many recipes containing coconut are saturated in fat, cholesterol, and sugar. There’s no reason why you shouldn’t enjoy this delicious flavor while eating ingredients that are natural. These no bake coconut balls are perfect for satisfying your chocolate craving, and the beauty of it? They contain plant-based Sunwarrior protein! Yes, chocolate protein can and should be incorporated into your snacks because it adds to the flavor and helps fuel your body in a variety of beneficial ways.

These balls take no longer than 20 minutes to make, and the best part is the cleanup: one bowl and one mixing spoon! I like to experiment with these types of snacks during the warmer months because no oven is needed to cook them, keeping your home nice and cool. Serve them to your kids as a healthy snack or to your friends at your next dinner party, and they will all be impressed at the savory and decadent taste of these treats!
articleSummaryHTML: Baking: ain’t nobody got time for that! That’s why we give you no bake coconut protein balls!
seoTitle: No Bake Coconut Protein Balls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Baking: ain’t nobody got time for that! That’s why we give you no bake coconut protein balls!
ingredients:
s:727:"
  • ½ cup (100% almonds) almond butter
  • ½ cup organic unsweetened shredded coconut
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate protein
  • 2 teaspoons cocoa powder
  • 2–2 ½ tablespoons unsweetened vanilla almond milk
  • 1 ½ teaspoons organic vanilla extract
  • *sprinkle Himalayan sea salt
  • *extra organic unsweetened shredded coconut
";
directions:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl (note – the almond milk helps bind all ingredients together so start with 2 tablespoons, and only use a little more if the mixture is too dry. Be careful to use any extra almond milk sparingly – if the mixture gets too soggy, then you have to start fresh)

Shape the batter into balls with your fingers

Roll the balls into unsweetened shredded coconut spread across a flat surface, so the flakes evenly coat the balls

Place into refrigerator for 20 minutes before eating (and use as place of storage for rest of the balls)

Enjoy!

articleTitle: The Vegan Vigilante and Puerto Rican Bean Tortillas
articleBodyHTML:
Another day, another dinner! Join the Vegan Vigilante as he surprises people with a Puerto Rican bean tortilla dinner straight from the contents of their own fridge!

For the second week of the Vegan Vigilante, we here at Sunwarrior send Jason Wrobel out into the world ill-prepared to face the kitchens of his friends once more. He is going into the home of Jason and Jessica to prepare a healthy, plant-based, delicious, and affordable meal for a family, using only the ingredients and equipment they happen to have on hand. It’s a tall order, but we think J-Wro can handle it. His friends aren’t vegan, but they are willing to hand over their dinner plans to one master chef for an evening. Jason will attempt to fill their bellies, please their palates, and make them happy. We don’t make things easy for him.

Digging through the cupboards, drawers, and fridge will reveal some surprises, both good and bad. Most of us have some decent options on hand, even if we don’t use them well. Jason pulls out the very best and decides to go with his Puerto Rican roots for some amazing tacos incorporating rice, beans, bell pepper, mushrooms, tomatoes, zucchini, and fried bananas. Fried bananas, people! Surprising choice for a family that hasn’t tried much in the way of plant-based living, J-Wro. A fresh lime, avocado, and mango salsa add even more flare. Will his friends join the Clean Plate Club? Will they walk away in disgust? Will they ask for seconds? You’ll have to watch to find out.
articleSummaryHTML: Another day, another dinner! Join the Vegan Vigilante as he surprises people with a Puerto Rican bean tortilla dinner straight from the contents of their own fridge!
seoTitle: Vegan Vigilante and Puerto Rican Bean Tortillas | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Another day, another dinner! Join the Vegan Vigilante as he surprises people with a Puerto Rican bean tortilla dinner from the contents of their own fridge!
recipeName: The Vegan Vigilante and Puerto Rican Bean Tortillas
ingredients:
s:1036:"
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 orange pepper, chopped
  • 1 purple onion, chopped
  • 1 cup cherry tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 zucchini, chopped
  • 1 cup mushrooms, chopped
  • ¼ teaspoon black pepper
  • ¼ teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 can black beans, rinsed
  • A pinch crushed red pepper
  • A pinch Pico de Gallo seasoning
  • 2 bananas, sliced
  • 2 avocado, diced
  • 1 mango, diced
  • 1 lime,
  • 1 package small tortillas
  • A handful of fresh spinach
";
directions:
Heat up 1 tablespoon coconut oil in fry pan and add onions and sea salt. Sauté for a few minutes. Add pepper zucchini and mushrooms to fry pan. Add black pepper and garlic powder and mix into vegetables. Add tomatoes and black beans. Heat until it sizzles. Remove from heat and set aside.

In new fry pan heat 2 tablespoons coconut oil and place sliced bananas in a single layer in the oil. Cook on one side until golden brown. Turn heat to low when you flip them to the other side. Squeeze lime over diced avocado and mangos.

Heat up tortillas.

Assemble by placing a thin layer of spinach over the tortilla, a layer of the vegetable mixture over that, a spoonful of the mango avocado mixture over that, and top with the caramelized bananas.

articleTitle: Apricot Orange N’ Cashew Triangle Chews
articleBodyHTML:
Apricots are soon going to be ripe and ready to pick. Highlight the summer bounty with these apricot orange n’ cashew triangle chews!

With a huge bag of organic apricots on hand I am finding creative ways to use them and this chewy sweet is perfect.  Buying organic apricots not only means no added sulphites and preservatives, it means you now have this dense caramel taste that is oh-so-good.  Pair in with mesquite and you’ve got this butterscotch taste that’s just divine.  These bars/triangles get better and better after a few days so plan ahead and let them ‘age’ for a more intense flavor and chewier consistency.  Of course they are perfectly fine to eat right away and you most likely will want to.
articleSummaryHTML: Apricots are soon going to be ripe and ready to pick. Highlight the summer bounty with these apricot orange n’ cashew triangle chews!
seoTitle: Apricot Orange N’ Cashew Triangle Chews | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Apricots are soon going to be ripe and ready to pick. Highlight the summer bounty with these apricot orange n’ cashew triangle chews!
recipeName: Apricot Orange N’ Cashew Triangle Chews
ingredients:
s:1001:"

Apricot Orange N’ Cashew Triangle Chews

  • 2 cups organic apricots
  • 1½ cups toasted, organic cashews
  • ½ cup organic coconut
  • ¼ cup chia, or hemp seeds
  • Zest from one organic orange
  • ½ cup organic orange juice
  • Pinch sea salt

* optional

  • 2 tablespoons mesquite powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein

Chocolate Topping

  • ½ cup 76% organic chocolate
  • ¼ cup carton or canned coconut milk
";
directions:
Apricot Orange N’ Cashew Triangle Chews

  • Line a 9 x 11 inch baking pan with parchment paper and set aside.
  • Measure the apricots and cashews into a food processor and blast until chopped. Add the remaining ingredients and process until ingredients bind together, scraping down the sides if necessary.
  • Press into an 8 x 8 pan, pressing down firmly and evenly and freeze while preparing the chocolate drizzle.

Options:

  • Add a scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein to the apricot mix
  • Pulse in 1/3 cup raw cacao nibs before pressing into the pan
  • Add intrigue and heat with a pinch of chipotle or cayenne to taste
  • Sprinkle addition orange zest and a power shaking of Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein over the chocolate while it’s still warm

Chocolate Topping

  • Finely chop chocolate while heating the milk in a small pan over medium low heat. Once hot yet not boiling, remove from the heat and add the chopped chocolate stirring well to melt.
  • Using a spoon held high over the bars drizzle with chocolate as thickly as you like.
  • Chill for approximately 30 minutes before scoring into bars, triangles or squares then cutting. Store in the refrigerator or freezer as desired.

articleBodyHTML:
As spicy as you like it, this Asian trinity noodle dish is the clear winner of dinner for when you need a side dish in a hurry! Or make a lot, and have it for your main course!

An aromatic trinity of fresh ginger, garlic, and scallions give this dish a fresh, mild kick. Simple and full of flavor. Great as a warm side dish, or equally tasty as a chilled dish. You can kick up the spice with more ginger, or tame it with less. This dish will please your palate. If you're serving it cold, you could add a capful of Vitamin Mineral Rush to give it a kick of vitamins without chnging the flavor.
articleSummaryHTML: As spicy as you like it, this Asian trinity noodle dish is the clear winner of dinner for when you need a side dish in a hurry! Or make a lot, and have it for your main course!
seoTitle: How to Make Asian Trinity Noodles | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: As spicy as you like it, this Asian trinity noodle dish is the clear winner of dinner for when you need a side dish in a hurry! Or make a lot, and have it for your main course!
ingredients:
s:517:"
  • ½ package pasta, cooked as directed
  • 4 scallions, thinly chopped
  • 2 tablespoons peeled ginger, grated
  • 1 1/2 tablespoons garlic, minced
  • 3 tablespoons Asian preserved pickle, finely diced
  • 3 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon light soy sauce
";
directions:
1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.

2. Add scallions, ginger, garlic, and pickle. Stir for approximately 2 minutes until all the flavors infuse together. Once infused, turn off heat.

3. Add mixture to warm, strained pasta. Add in soy sauce. Stir until combined.

Note: If you’re looking for a little more heat sprinkle in a few hot chili flakes.

articleTitle: Vegan Vigilante | Episode 3: Eatin' Vegan from the 99 Cents Only Store
articleBodyHTML:
Welcome to the third episode of the Vegan Vigilante. This week, Sunwarrior challenged our good friend Jason Wrobel to up his game even more. We sent him to a 99 cent store to find all his ingredients. That’s right; we didn’t even allow him the extra cent of a dollar store.

Jason still has to make something delicious, healthy, and plant-based after his less expensive shopping trip. Unusual? You bet! Difficult? Oh yeah! Possible? We’ll have to wait and see what our celebrity chef can manage. At least we let him use his own equipment this time.

Jason finds himself walking the aisles, surprised to discover that there are some decently healthy options anywhere if you look hard enough. Did you know some 99 cent stores and dollar stores carry fresh produce? High-end grocery stores often reject food that is too ugly to display, like bananas that are too curvy or too short, apples that aren’t quite as red, or celery that is too green. Discount stores snatch these up. Same quality food at lower prices. They also buy regular produce in season. There are even organic options. We may have made this too easy on the Vegan Vigilante.

Jason easily bags fresh tomatoes, garlic, avocado, spaghetti squash, asparagus, bell peppers, and so much more. Sixteen dollars later, he has the ingredients to make a fantastic summer salad that could satisfy a group of foodies at a fancy dinner party. We’ll have to make next week harder.
articleSummaryHTML: Welcome to the third episode of the Vegan Vigilante. This week, Sunwarrior challenged Jason Wrobel to up his game at the 99 cent store to find his ingredients.
seoTitle: Vegan Vigilante | Eatin' Vegan from the 99 Cents Only Store
seoDescription: Welcome to the third episode of the Vegan Vigilante. This week, Sunwarrior challenged Jason Wrobel to up his game at the 99 cent store to find his ingredients.
ingredients:
s:983:"
  • 1 avocado, diced
  • 1 whole Spaghetti squash
  • 1 tomato, chopped
  • 4 celery hearts, chopped
  • 2 radishes, chopped
  • 2 cups asparagus cut into smaller pieces
  • 1 orange bell pepper, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, crushed
  • 1 can organic kidney beans
  • Ground chia seeds
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • ¼ teaspoon Italian seasoning
  • Black pepper to taste
  • A dash of chili powder
  • A drizzle of olive oil
  • A splash of red wine vinegar
  • Pistachios, roasted
";
directions:
1. Split spaghetti squash in half and deseed it. Poke holes in the squash so it can cook evenly. Put one clove of crushed garlic in each half. Bake spaghetti squash in over on 400 degrees for 25 minutes. Steam your asparagus for eight minutes.
  2. Combine chopped celery, tomato, radishes, pepper, and kidney beans in a large bowl
  3. Use a fork to scrape out the spaghetti squash from the shell.
  4. Add asparagus and spaghetti squash to chopped vegetables
  5. Add seasonings, oil, and vinegar
  6. Mix all together.
  7. Plate and top with diced avocado, pistachio, and a sprinkle of chia seeds

articleBodyHTML:
Sweet, decadent, and filled with the full flavor of a vegan cheesecake done right! These mini chocolate and cherry cheesecakes are happiness in every bite.

These mini “cheesecakes” are absolute winners! They are high in protein, super healthy and unbelievably easy to make, but most importantly, they are creamy and fluffy almost like a mousse!

If you find vegan cheesecakes a bit daunting, you just haven’t yet made the right ones! They are so easy, you will not believe it! All you really have to do is put the ingredients together and blend them, and you will absolutely love the outcome!

(makes 12)
articleSummaryHTML: Sweet, decadent, and filled with the full flavor of a vegan cheesecake done right! These mini chocolate and cherry cheesecakes are happiness in every bite.
seoTitle: Vegan Mini Chocolate & Cherry Cheesecakes
seoDescription: Sweet, decadent, and filled with the full flavor of a vegan cheesecake done right! These mini chocolate and cherry cheesecakes are happiness in every bite.
ingredients:
s:936:"

For the Base

  • 1/4 cup oat flour (you can make your own by blending oat flakes in high-speed blender)
  • 1 tablespoon almond butter
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • A pinch of salt

For the Nut Cheese

  • 1 cup cashews, soaked for 2 hours in hot water or 5 hours in cold water
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 1/3 cup almond milk
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein
  • 36 pitted sour cherries in light syrup
";
directions:
To make the base, put all the ingredients (apart from the cherries) in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend until dough forms. It should have the consistency of wet sand.

Prepare 12 paper cupcake forms and put 1 tablespoon of the dough into each of the forms, then press gently into the bottom. Put 3 cherries on top of each base and set aside (no need to chill).

To make the “cheese,” put all the ingredients into a food processor/high-speed blender and blend until smooth (it will take a few minutes).

Put the “cheese” on top of the prepared base and put in the freezer for at least 4 hours. Then take out and sprinkle with some cacao/cocoa powder, or decorate with your favorite fruit. From this point, you can store the mini “cheesecakes” in the fridge.

Enjoy!

articleTitle: Summer Drinks and Pink Ginger Lemonade
articleBodyHTML:
Hot summer days beg for cool and refreshing drinks. They just go hand in hand. All the reasons why combined with the recipe for Pink Ginger Lemonade

It’s vital that you are properly hydrated when the sun is beaming. Sometimes you actually don’t even realize you are thirsty until a big glass picture filled with water and lemon is put in front of you.

That is not always the choice people make to quench their thirst. Unfortunately, juices, sodas, lattes and other high sugared, empty calorie drinks filled with artificial flavors and even aspartame are just too readily available.

If you want to curb this completely, get a hold of a just a few simple ingredients to make your own homemade summer refreshments:

Here are a few reasons why:

They are refreshing, easy and can be kept in your fridge

They will be full of natural ingredients and flavors (choose from either steeping some herbal tea and chilling it, adding mint, lemon, honey, ginger.

- Fruits such as oranges, lemons and limes slices added to water make an amazingly simple drink with natural sugars. You can even put this into your water bottle for when you are on the go.

Learn What to Avoid and how to Change Things Up!

Colors: from sports drinks, juices – they are full of artificial dyes and other preservatives.

Instead, choose a drink that is 100% natural from fruit, or use your own fruit purees! Raspberries, strawberries, and beets – make incredible ruby red drinks that are amazing for the playing field!

Fizzy Beverages Such as Sodas: not only are they filled with calories and syrups, but they can actually dehydrate you

Instead choose filtered, flat or spring water instead and add in mint or ginger for something refreshing and different. You can even opt for homemade kombucha or water kefir and flavor these your own way.

Added Sugars: (such as glucose, fructose, corn syrup), which just means added empty calories!

Instead choose natural sweeteners if necessary such as honey, maple syrup or from fruit.

Cream or Milk-Based Beverages: loaded with poor quality fat and often lots of sugar.

Instead, if you are feeling like something thick and creamy, make a smoothie or have one made with pure ingredients by using coconut milk, almond milk or hempseed milk. Any latte can be made with these instead and taste even more delicious!

Here is my favorite summer beverage. I keep this in pitchers in the fridge all summer long! It’s an excellent summer refresher and also makes a hydrating morning beverage.
articleSummaryHTML: Hot summer days beg for cool and refreshing drinks. They just go hand in hand. All the reasons why combined with the recipe for Pink Ginger Lemonade
seoTitle: Summer Drinks and Pink Ginger Lemonade | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Hot summer days beg for cool and refreshing drinks. They just go hand in hand. All the reasons why combined with the recipe for Pink Ginger Lemonade
ingredients:
s:418:"
  • 2 tablespoons dried goji berries
  • 2 cups water
  • ½ teaspoon ginger, minced
  • 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice
  • Pinch of Himalayan rock salt
  • 1 tablespoon coconut nectar or your liquid sweetener of choice
";
directions:
1. Soak berries for 4–8 hours in 2 cups of pure or filtered water (with ginger)
  2. Place all ingredients in a blender and blend on high until smooth

articleBodyHTML:
When the summer sizzle gets too hot, cool off with these refreshing lemon cups. Because sometimes you’ve gotta ice the sunshine!

This recipe was inspired from the many lemons that I have juiced with my awesome citrus juicer. I typically buy a bunch of lemons and juice them once a week so that I always have lemon juice whenever I need it. My favorite thing to do after extracting the juice is to fill up my stainless steel ice cube tray and freeze it to make lemon ice cubes. Once the cubes are frozen, I pop them out, place them in a zip lock bag and voila, lemon ice cubes whenever I need them. I can pop one in my water in the morning which is great for cleaning the liver first thing. I can add them to my green juice for a little bit of zing. And let’s not forget, lemons are also great for salad dressings.

I am always so amazed at how wonderful the juicer extracts juice from lemons. The lemon shells look so perfectly clean inside. This time I wasn’t ready to throw the shells into the compost. I decided that I was going to use them as a dessert cup instead. There are many creative ways to use lemon cups: from lemon puddings to sorbets, what a great way to impress guests. Below is another creative recipe using lemons and lemon cups. This recipe is very quick, simple, and easy to make.
articleSummaryHTML: When the summer sizzle gets too hot, cool off with these refreshing lemon cups. Because sometimes you’ve gotta ice the sunshine!
seoTitle: Refreshing Lemon Cups | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: When the summer sizzle gets too hot, cool off with these refreshing lemon cups. Because sometimes you’ve gotta ice the sunshine!
ingredients:
s:525:"
  • 1 cup cashews
  • 3 lemon shells (used for cups)
  • 3 lemons juiced (from the lemons above, ½ cup)
  • 1 tablespoon lemon zest
  • ½ can coconut cream (200ml)
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil (melt to a liquid)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Soak cashews for 2 hours in fresh water ahead of time.
  2. Cut lemons in half. Using an electric citrus juicer or by hand, juice the lemons, and set the shells aside to be used later.
  3. Once cashews have been soaked, blend all ingredients in a food processor until it is a smooth consistency.
  4. Place the lemon cups in a muffin tin, and pour the mixture into each lemon cup.
  5. Freeze cups minimum 1 hour before serving.
  6. Garnish with fresh mint.
  7. Eat and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Peanut butter jelly time! These bars are absolutely delicious, grain free, paleo, gluten free and vegan! And did we mention? These strawberry bliss bars taste great!

Summer means bright and scrumptious treats to energize us without feeling heavy. These bars are ridiculously addictive and super easy to make. After countless tries of different peanut butter and jelly treats, we found a winner. If peanuts and jelly are your thing, this bar is definitely for you.

These bars are perfect for breakfast, mid-day or that late night dessert we all crave. Using only simple and whole ingredients combining raw nuts, unsweetened coconut, and organic jam, this recipe comes together in no time. We used organic jam, but as the spring season rolls around, you could use your own homemade jam to really add a special touch to these bars.

Not only is this recipe delicious, but it is also nutritionally superior to any store bought bar you will buy. Walnuts and almonds have incredible health benefits which boost from being antioxidants, high in omega 3-6, container fiber and protein. The real winner in this bar is the coconut. Coconut is one of the most nutrient dense foods on this planet. This beautiful tropical fruit can provide you with enough energy to power you through an entire day. Coconut is super high in electrolytes, iron, and fats which all add to a well-balanced diet.

Place these bars in the fridge after they have cooled in an airtight container. They will last up to five days (if they last that long!). You can top these bars with a variety of jams if you aren’t fond of strawberry. A great alternative would be to use apricot jam which is a milder flavor. If there is a peanut allergy, you can substitute almonds on top. Do a little dance and peanut butter jelly time into spring! Happy baking!
articleSummaryHTML: Peanut butter jelly time! These bars are absolutely delicious, grain free, paleo, gluten free and vegan! And did we mention? These strawberry bliss bars taste great!
seoTitle: Strawberry Bliss Bar | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Peanut butter jelly time! These bars are delicious, grain free, paleo, gluten free and vegan! And did we mention? These strawberry bliss bars taste great!
ingredients:
s:495:"

 

  • 2 cups unsweetened shredded coconut
  • 1 cup almonds
  • 1 cup walnuts
  • 8 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 1 jar organic strawberry jam
  • ½ cup raw peanuts
";
directions:
1.) Blend coconut, almonds, walnuts, dates, maple syrup and salt in a food processor. Place mixture into a small loaf pan with parchment paper. Press down firmly. Spread strawberry jam and peanuts on top

2.) Preheat oven to 350 degrees

3.) Bake for 20 minutes

4.) Remove from oven and let cool completely before slicing

articleBodyHTML: No backyard BBQ is complete without the obligatory side of baked beans. So get going already with this simple and tasty crockpot baked beans. Prepare for awesome!
articleSummaryHTML: No backyard BBQ is complete without the obligatory side of baked beans. So get going already with this simple and tasty crockpot baked beans. Prepare for awesome!
seoTitle: Crockpot Baked Beans | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: No backyard BBQ is complete without the obligatory side of baked beans. So get going already with this simple and tasty crockpot baked beans. Prepare for awesome!
ingredients:
s:839:"

 

  • 1 ½ can organic black beans
  • 2 cans kidney beans
  • 1 can garbanzo beans
  • 2 cans pinto beans
  • 1 small can of tomato paste
  • 1 ½ cups water
  • 4 ½ oz. raisins
  • 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon minced garlic (or garlic powder)
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • Pinch of crushed red pepper
  • ½ teaspoon chili powder (I used Ancho)
  • 2 teaspoons ground mustard powder
";
directions:
Add all above ingredients to a blender and blend for about 20 seconds. Drain all cans of organic beans. Place the beans in a crockpot. Mix all other ingredients together in a bowl, and then pour the saucy mixture on top of the beans.

It’s exactly that easy! Mix and place on low for 2–3 hours before your party! Enjoy

*You can substitute tomato sauce for the tomato paste + water

** Feel free to mix and match the beans, stick with just one, or use them all to experience the different flavors, textures, and nutrients that they offer!

articleTitle: Red, White, and Blueberry Muffins! Vegan and Gluten-Free!
articleBodyHTML:
Celebrate freedom with these red, white, and blueberry muffins! You can ooh and aah at the spectacular display of flavor in the vegan and gluten-free delights!

With the Fourth of July fast approaching, I’ve been playing with recipes that incorporate red, white or blue in them so that I can add a patriotic touch to the celebrations. The problem is that so many recipes contain ingredients that leave you feeling bloated and heavy. Muffins are one of my favorite things to eat, and it’s often hard for me to walk by these delicious pastries without wanting to devour them. But then I remember how they are made - full of dairy with cups of sugar and gluten added – and suddenly one of my favorite treats is a major turn-off. That’s why I experimented in the kitchen and found a recipe that achieves that same, delicious, flavorful taste of a muffin while also containing healthy, natural ingredients. Blueberry muffins are an American staple (and great for Fourth of July brunch), so it’s important to have a recipe that leaves you feeling guilt-free while eating them. The stigma of muffins being highly caloric can now be broken with this grain-free recipe!
articleSummaryHTML: Celebrate freedom with these red, white, and blueberry muffins! You can ooh and aah at the spectacular display of flavor in the vegan and gluten-free delights!
seoTitle: Red, White, & Blueberry Muffins! Vegan & Gluten-Free!
seoDescription: Celebrate freedom with these red, white, and blueberry muffins! You can ooh and aah at the spectacular display of flavor in the vegan and gluten-free delights!
recipeName: Red, White, and Blueberry Muffins! Vegan and Gluten-Free!
ingredients:
s:520:"
  • 2 cups super fine almond flour
  • 3 flax eggs
  • 6 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1/3 cup maple syrup or liquid sweetener of your choice
  • ½ teaspoon of baking soda
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • I teaspoon pink Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 cup organic blueberries
";
directions:
1. (Makes about 12 muffins)
  2. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees
  3. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, coconut oil, agave, baking soda, and sea salt and whisk together until smooth
  4. Add the liquid mixture to a large bowl containing the almond flour and baking soda and mix everything together until smooth
  5. Once smooth and fluffy, gently fold in the blueberries (note – do not pound the mixture as the blueberries with splatter everywhere)
  6. Spray a muffin pan with coconut oil or use liners and fill with the batter
  7. Bake for 22–28 minutes (checking with a fork in the middle to make sure they’re cooked through but not overcooked)
  8. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Chill out with a chilled corn and jalapeño soup that is smooth, silky and a parade of flavor across your taste buds! You’re welcome!

Summer weather is here, and hot soups are out the door. Make way for delicious chilled soups which will leave you feeling energized and light throughout the day. Fresh sweet corn is in season so why not use this beautiful plant to make a delicious vegan corn chowder recipe. We use coconut milk to replace the cream and jalapeños to give it an extra kick. Some people find that coconut milk will change the flavor of the recipe so you can always add organic soy milk or almond milk if you prefer a more neutral taste. This recipe is gluten free, dairy free, vegan, and 100 percent healthy! This was a fan favorite at a potluck I recently attended. Everyone was shocked that this recipe was so silky and smooth even without using cream. This recipe is definitely a crowd pleaser. You can add more jalapeños to give it that extra notch of heat or tone it down to make a more subdued and silky soup.

Spring and summer time are the best times for fruits and vegetables so why not maximize their delicious flavors and textures. The first harvest of corn has arrived, and it’s unbelievably sweet. Adding chopped peppers, potatoes, and greens makes this soup super hearty. This is a great recipe to make in large quantities. You can divide them into small containers and freeze them. All you need to do is thaw it out and voila, the perfect lunch or quick dinner. You can eat this cold, or you can have it hot.

Over the years corn has gotten a bad reputation from being genetically modified and high in carbohydrates. The truth is that if you can get it from your local farmer, it is a great source of nutrients such as vitamin b and selenium which is hard to find in foods. You can add any additional vegetables to add extra nutrients such as cauliflower, sweet potatoes or any greens that are in season.
articleSummaryHTML: Chill out with a chilled corn and jalapeño soup that is smooth, silky and a parade of flavor across your taste buds! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Chilled Corn and Jalapeño Soup | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Chill out with a chilled corn and jalapeño soup that is smooth, silky and a parade of flavor across your taste buds! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:647:"

 

  • 4 ears of fresh corn, kernels only
  • 4 cups coconut milk
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 1 pepper, chopped
  • 1 cup potatoes, chopped
  • 1 jalapeño, charred
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
  • 1 juice of lime
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1.) Roast jalapeño over an open flame on gas stove or place in the oven to broil for 5 minutes. Place in a bowl with a cover on top to steam. Remove skin, slice open, and remove seeds. Chop finely.

2.) Place onion and potatoes in a large pot with 1 tablespoon coconut oil. Cook until the onions are translucent and fragrant. Add kernels, vegetable broth, pepper, coconut oil, oregano, and paprika. Cook for 30 minutes.

3.) Take half of the soup and place in a food processor. Blend until smooth and place back into pot with remaining soup. Stir well. Remove from heat and serve. Squeeze lime juice on top of soup.

articleBodyHTML:
With busy summer schedules, dinners you can freeze and warm up in a hurry make the whole season better. Make your summer rock with these vegan baked taquitos. Once you give them a try, your whole family will be clamoring for more!

Convenience is the name of the game in my family, especially over the summer. Kids always seem to be hungry. Always having food on hand is a must! But finding healthy food that kids like is hard! Sure I can have vegetables and fruit on hand all summer, but they don’t always want that. A lot of the time, I prebake dinners and freeze them, and a huge favorite is baked taquitos.

I know. I know. You don’t want to turn the oven on in the summer, but you can make a lot of these and freeze them. Then when you or the kids are hungry, it’ll take minimal effort to eat.

And the best thing about these taquitos is that they are stuffed with delicious and healthy stuff. Pinto and black beans are chock-full of folate, fiber, and protein, which means the kids will stay fuller longer. And salsa is filled with great vegetables. You can even add roasted peppers as well, which would make it even better!

This will take care of afternoon hunger pains, and your kids will thank you because they’ll love them!
articleSummaryHTML: With busy summer schedules, dinners you can freeze and warm up in a hurry make the whole season better. Make your summer rock with these vegan baked taquitos. Once you give them a try, your whole family will be clamoring for more!
seoTitle: Vegan Baked Taquitos | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Vegan baked taquitos by Sunwarrior are easy to make, delicious, and simple. Try them right here and share this recipe.
ingredients:
s:1211:"
  • 1 15 oz. can pinto beans, rinsed
  • 1 15 oz. black beans, rinsed
  • 2 tablespoons taco seasoning
  • 1 cup vegan grated cheese
  • 2 tablespoons lime juice
  • ½ tablespoon green or red salsa
  • 3 oz. vegan cream cheese
  • 36 small corn tortillas
";
directions:
1. Mix all ingredients, except for tortillas, in a food processor.
  2. Working with corn tortillas can be tricky but doable. Warm tortillas until very pliable. Working quickly, because you need to roll the tortillas when they are very warm or they will break, add about 1 tablespoon of the mixture on warmed tortilla and roll up. Place on a greased baking sheet. And spray with olive oil cooking spray.
  3. Bake at 425 for about 20 mins or until golden brown.
  4. To freeze, wait until they are completely cooled then put in a large Ziploc bag. When ready to eat, bake in a toaster oven at 350 until warmed about 6 mins.

articleBodyHTML:
Looking for a quick 5-minute recipe power packed with nutrients, vegan, gluten-free, and dairy-free? We've got you covered!

This Powerball recipe is a perfect snack pre or post workout and even a guilt-free treat to hold you over. Packed with protein, healthy carbs, and fat, this well-balanced snack is perfect for an energy boost. It provides a tasty treat perfect for individuals with busy schedules, and who are aiming to get in an abundance of healthy nutrients with each bite. Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: Looking for a quick 5-minute recipe power packed with nutrients, vegan, gluten-free, and dairy-free? We've got you covered!
seoTitle: No Bake (RAW) Chocolate Protein Powerball
seoDescription: Looking for a quick 5-minute recipe power packed with nutrients, vegan, gluten-free, and dairy-free? We've got you covered!
ingredients:
s:640:"
  • 1 tablespoon cinnamon
  • 10 Medjool dates (pitted)
  • 3/4 cup raisins
  • 1 ½ scoops chocolate Sunwarrior Classic Plus protein
  • ¼ cup oats
  • 2 tablespoons flax seeds
  • 1 ½ tablespoons chia seeds
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 1 tablespoon extra-virgin organic coconut oil
";
directions:
In a food processor, blend the dates, raisins, oats, cacao powder, Sunwarrior protein powder, and coconut oil. This creates the batter for the recipe. Roll the batter into 14 small balls using your hands. Coat balls with chia seeds, flax seeds, and cinnamon. It is easiest to roll the batter into balls then place the ball into a small bowl with toppings. Roll the ball around to ensure it is completely covered.

Next, place the balls in a container and place in the fridge. Let firm up for 30–60 minutes and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
These healthy cupcakes are rich, decadent and super fudgy. They will satisfy even the biggest chocolate cravings! Add a little protein, and you will have a super healthy cupcake!

They are also easy to prepare and make a perfect addition to breakfast, lunch boxes or even a post-workout snack if enhanced with Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein.
articleSummaryHTML: These healthy cupcakes are rich, decadent and super fudgy. They will satisfy even the biggest chocolate cravings! Add a little protein, and you will have a super healthy cupcake!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter Fudge Cupcake | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: They will satisfy even the biggest chocolate cravings! This is the best recipe for peanut butter fudge cupcakes.
ingredients:
s:1583:"

For the Cupcakes (makes 12):

  • ¾ cup oat flour (you can make it by blending oat flakes in high-speed blender)
  • ¼ cup ground almonds
  • ¼ cup plain flour
  • 2 tablespoons cacao/cocoa powder OR Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein if you’re making a pre or post workout snack or just needing more protein in your diet
  • 3 ½ dark chocolate, chopped
  • 6 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 6 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • Pinch of salt

For the Peanut Butter Fudge:

  • 3 ½ ounces Medjool or other soft dates
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 4 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • Pinch of salt

For the Chocolate Coating:

  • 2 ounces dark chocolate, chopped
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • Chopped nuts (optional)
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 Fahrenheit). In a saucepan, put the coconut oil and chocolate together and melt over low heat stirring occasionally. Take off the heat and add maple syrup and almond milk then mix, stirring until smooth.
  2. Put the rest of the ingredients in a bowl and mix. Add the melted chocolate and mix all until smooth dough forms.
  3. In a cupcake form, prepare 12 cupcake/muffin cases and pour the dough evenly into each case. Put in the oven and bake for 12–15 minutes. Take out and set aside to cool down.
  4. To make the peanut butter fudge, put all the ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend until smooth mass forms (it will take a good few minutes, and you might need to stop the blender and stir the mass occasionally).
  5. When the cupcakes have cooled down completely, put a heaping tablespoon of the fudge on top of each cupcake.
  6. To make the chocolate coating, melt the coconut oil with the chocolate over low heat stirring occasionally. When melted and smooth, drizzle over the top of each cupcake and sprinkle with your favorite chopped nuts or sea salt.
  7. You can store the cupcakes at room temperature for up to 3 days, or, for extra fudgy consistency, you can keep them in the fridge for up to a week.

articleBodyHTML:
When your summer schedule gets hectic, make one of these super greens smoothies and feel energized and refreshed all day long!

This smoothie is a refreshing treat for welcoming summer and staying healthy! The easy recipe makes for a quick smoothie that can be good for on-the-go! The addition of the Sunwarrior Supergreens to this smoothie adds lots of vitamins and minerals—everything you need to make your day perfect. What exactly is in this smoothie? Learn about the health benefits about some of the ingredients to make you want to make this smoothie all the time!

Sunwarrior’s Super Greens are full of health benefits! They are a high-quality superfood mix. Super Greens are packed with a variety of minerals, enzymes, vitamins, proteins that are absorbed by the body. They contain high levels of chlorophyll and antioxidants. Because of their highly concentrated nutrient profile, Super Greens are believed to help reduce inflammation, promote healthy digestion, boost the immune system, and detoxify the body.

Liquid Light is perfect before, after, or during workouts to provide many minerals, including trace minerals, and electrolytes, but it plays a large role in protecting, nourishing, and detoxing cells with the might of fulvic acid. Fulvic acid acts as a cellular taxi, aiding assimilation of other nutrients. Liquid Light is a good source of iron, iodine, chromium, molybdenum, magnesium, zinc, and selenium. Not only that, it also includes a trace amount of boron, calcium, carbon, cesium, chromium, cobalt, copper, europium, gadolinium, gallium, germanium, gold, hafnium, holmium, indium, iodine, iridium, iron, lanthanum, lutetium, magnesium, manganese, molybdenum, niobium, phosphorus, platinum, potassium, praseodymium, rhenium, samarium, scandium, selenium, silica, silver, sodium, strontium, sulfur, tantalum, terbium, thulium, titanium, ytterbium, zinc, zirconium.

Health benefits of pineapple include immune system support, eye health, digestive health, anti-inflammatory benefits, and increased bone strength. Pineapple is a good source of minerals and vitamins, including folate, potassium, vitamin B6, thiamin, pantothenic acid, magnesium, riboflavin, and manganese.

Health benefits of bananas include a full variety of vitamins and minerals: Vitamin B6, manganese, Vitamin C, potassium, fiber, protein, folate, and magnesium. Eating bananas can reduce the risks of asthma and cancer. They can also lower blood pressure.

Okay seriously, just make the smoothie already and enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: When your summer schedule gets hectic, make one of these super greens smoothies and feel energized and refreshed all day long!
seoTitle: Super Greens Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: When your summer schedule gets hectic, make one of these super greens smoothies and feel energized and refreshed all day long!
ingredients:
s:515:"
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Super Greens Mint
  • 1 capful Liquid Light
  • 1 ½ cups apple juice
  • 2 frozen bananas
  • ½ cup frozen pineapple
  • 3–4 tablespoons chia seeds
";
directions:
Blend all ingredients together until smooth, top with some extra chia seeds, and enjoy!

This recipe makes two smoothies. Double the recipe if you want to make more. The frozen bananas and pineapple help add a cold, creamy, and smooth texture to the smoothie.

Cheers!

articleTitle: Vegan Vigilante | Episode 4: 7-11 is Plant Based?!
articleBodyHTML:
Welcome to yet another fabulous episode of the Vegan Vigilante! Jason Wrobel has entered people’s homes, the local 99 cent stores and found success in making healthy meals from what he finds. But will he succeed with his next challenge?

Our celebrity chef, Jason Wrobel, didn’t struggle as much as we thought he might with the 99 cent store, so we are upping our challenge game this week. J-Wro must tackle 7-11 this time. That’s right, all his ingredients for a plant-based, healthy, delicious meal must come from the home of the Slurpee and Big Gulp, the convenience store on the corner you hit at the beginning of road trips, the snack shop that comes to mind when cravings strike in the middle of the night. We like making things difficult.

You wouldn’t really expect 7-11 to have much in the healthy or plant-based department, but, once again, you will be surprised at what Jason finds when he really looks. Who knew 7-11 was offering so many healthy options? We sure didn’t, or we might have made this harder on the Vegan Vigilante.

Coconut water, organic bars, nuts, seeds, and fresh fruits like mango, banana, kiwi, and strawberries! Jason walks out with plenty of ingredients for one monster smoothie bowl extraordinaire. He makes his own almond milk from raw almonds found in the aisles, adds his fruits, and blends away. He tops it with vegan bars and cookies. Can you say “yum?” This recipe easily goes spoon to spoon with any fancy smoothie bowl using ingredients from a health food store. Maybe we need to make things even harder on our superhero next week.
articleSummaryHTML: Welcome to yet another fabulous episode of the Vegan Vigilante! Jason Wrobel has entered people’s homes, the local 99 cent stores and found success in making healthy meals from what he finds. But will he succeed with his next challenge?
seoTitle: Vegan Vigilante | 7-11 is Plant Based?!
seoDescription: Welcome to yet another fabulous episode of the Vegan Vigilante! Jason Wrobel has entered people’s homes, the local 99 cent stores and found success in making healthy meals from what he finds. But will he succeed with his next challenge?
ingredients:
s:470:"
  • 3 oz. almonds
  • 2 cups filtered water
  • 2 bananas
  • ½ kiwi
  • 1¼ cup mango
  • ¼ cup strawberries
  • Coconut water
  • *Organic Bars (toppings)
  • *Nuts, Seeds (toppings)
";
directions: Place filtered water and almonds in a high-speed blender and blend until smooth and creamy to create almond milk. Add bananas, mango, kiwi, strawberries and blend until fruit is mixed in at your desired consistency. Cut up some vegan bars or cookies and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Can you ever really go wrong with cinnamon roll flavored anything? We don’t think so, either, and these cinnamon roll protein balls prove us right!

I have to admit that since becoming vegan, cinnamon has been a craving of mine. I love that it can be used in sweet and savory preparations and that it seems like you can never overdo it (or can you? Nah! Not in my book anyways).

This recipe is so incredibly simple that it only takes 5 minutes from start to finish to have protein ball bliss! A combination of almonds, dates, Classic Plus vanilla protein , and cinnamon is all you need to make this sweet, healthy treat. Personally, I more of a chocolate protein ball kind gal, but using vanilla in this recipe is what really allows the cinnamon be the star of the show! At about 120 calories per ball and 5 grams of protein, you’ll be sure to keep these with you all the time as a quick on the go snack or late night craving crusher. Needless to say, we devoured these as they are the perfect natural sweetness and made us feel good about having “dessert.”
articleSummaryHTML: Can you ever really go wrong with cinnamon roll flavored anything? We don’t think so, either, and these cinnamon roll protein balls prove us right!
seoTitle: Cinnamon Roll Protein Balls  | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Can you ever really go wrong with cinnamon roll flavored anything? We don’t think so, either, and these cinnamon roll protein balls prove us right!
ingredients:
s:503:"
  • 1 ½ cups almonds
  • 1 ½ scoops Classic Plus vanilla protein
  • 1 tablespoon cinnamon
  • 1 cup pitted dates – soaked in warm water for 30 minutes
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup (optional)
  • 2 tablespoons water
";
directions:
1. In a food processor, grind almonds until you get a coarse flour consistency. You’ll want some crunch in the almonds, so don’t go all the way to flour!
  2. Place almond grounds in a large bowl and add the  Classic Plus vanilla protein and cinnamon. Mix well to combine.
  3. In the same food processor, add your soaked dates, maple syrup (if using) and 2 tablespoons water. Process until smooth. Add date mixture to almond mixture and stir well to combine.
  4. Divide batter into 12 balls. Eat right away, or store in fridge for up to 2 weeks.

articleBodyHTML:
When you are the lone vegetarian or vegan in your family, how do you do get-togethers where food is involved? You make great vegan food! Like this summer Asian coleslaw!

I come from a family where our dinners at get-togethers consisted of fried chicken, hot dogs, mac & cheese, mashed potatoes loaded with margarine and salt, and more desserts than main dish choices. Most often our plates did not have any green food on them unless you counted the green icing on the birthday cake or the occasional green bean casserole. That being said, when I first started really changing my lifestyle and fixing my diet, I wasn’t sure how my family would respond. Would they judge me, or think I am judging them and their meal choices? Would this be an unnecessary cause of stress? Would it be better to make up an excuse not to go to avoid being around the tempting food that wouldn’t make me feel very good?

Needless to say, I found that it wasn’t as hard to eat healthy at gatherings if I prepared correctly. Properly preparing allowed me to engage my family in some great conversations on why I changed my diet and how great I feel now that my health has been improving so much! I made it clear that it wasn’t that I didn’t like their food or appreciate them, but some foods just physically made me feel really sick. That is why I have to avoid the processed oils, white sugar, or dairy.

Prepare a healthy main meal dish to bring that you can be full on, just in case this is the only thing you can eat. A big salad is a great idea! Or pack a separate Tupperware full of your own food just in case you get hungry, or bring a shaker bottle with some Sunwarrior protein!

Make enough to share! I have found that the best way to turn my family’s health around was not by lecturing them on the dangers of processed foods, dairy, and conventionally processed meats, but in leading by example! And letting them see my own health turnaround, and seeing that my food actually tastes GOOD! They were hesitant at first, but then they started asking questions, being receptive, and are changing their lifestyles to become healthier and happier with increased stamina and less fatigue!

This is the perfect take along to your summer barbecue!
articleSummaryHTML: When you are the lone vegetarian or vegan in your family, how do you do get-togethers where food is involved? You make great vegan food! Like this summer Asian coleslaw!
seoTitle: Summer Asian Coleslaw | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: If you are vegetarian or vegan in your family, how do you do get-togethers where food is involved? You make great vegan food! Like this summer Asian coleslaw!
ingredients:
s:776:"
  • 7 stalks celery, chopped (include the leaves)
  • ½ head of red cabbage, shredded
  • 3 red apples (or sweet pears), chopped
  • 1 green bell pepper, chopped
  • 2 red peppers, chopped
  • 3 zucchini, chopped.
  • 5 small green onions, chopped
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • ½ teaspoon black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon pink Himalayan salt
  • 1 tablespoon powdered ginger
  • 3 tablespoons liquid aminos (I use Bragg’s; you can add more to taste)
  • 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • Juice of 1 lime
  • 4 tablespoons sesame seeds, or sunflower seeds (raw)
  • 2 cups roasted edamame (unsalted)
";
directions: Directions: Cut all vegetables as described above, and mix together in a big, pretty bowl (the kind that begs to be shown off at a party J). Add in the spices, mix well. Then add lime juice and aminos! Right before you head to the party, throw in the edamame and seeds, and then shake it up! Super easy, flavorful, crunchy and delicious!

articleTitle: 8 Tips for the Traveling Vegan Foodie
articleBodyHTML:
Ever starved in an airport? Or worse, in a plane? Starve no more! Follow these 8 tips for the traveling vegan foodie!

There is nothing worse than being stranded without food in an airport (okay, there are a lot of things that are worse, but being stuck at the airport with no food isn’t awesome.). Sometimes you have to be creative and make do with limited resources. It is so important to make sure you are nourished when you are away. That may mean that you have to pack yourself a whole bunch of goodies to take with you on the go, just in case. Even if your airport may accommodate you with food stalls, it is not worth going through the stress that you may not be eating for the next few hours. Don’t resort to white sugar, white flour, or fried foods; all of these can zap your energy and your immune system while thousands of feet in the air.

If you choose not to bring your own food for when you get to your destination, then it is important to make use of the internet and source out some of the healthy, vegetarian and organic restaurants and stores that may be nearby. It is imperative that you put your eating habits first when you travel. The last thing you want is to be left hungry, tired, and frustrated because you didn’t plan properly!

Scope out the scene before you fly and check online resources regarding the area where you’re traveling. You’ll want to find local restaurants, health food stores, and farmers markets.

Always remember quick grab goodies like fresh fruit, raw veggies and other whole foods like avocado and coconut chips. You also need to definitely make and bring a trail mix with you every time you travel (see recipe below). These are great for both the plane and to keep in your bag while traveling.

Quick-fix breakfasts are cured with chia seeds and buckwheat. You can make them anywhere! All you need is some added water or nut milk (you may want to bring some cinnamon and powdered stevia too!). If you have a morning flight, this is perfect, too, while on the plane.

Bring an organic dark chocolate. The healthy fat will keep you full, and the chocolate will keep you happy even if your fellow passengers aren’t always pleasant. Plus, it will remove the temptation to get a mini, overpriced bag of junk food on the plane.

(NOTE: If you're looking for a little pick me up and want to stay away from the energy drink, check out our article on the plant based foods to boost your energy. Click here.)

Pack more food than you think you will need. Don’t just fill a single container with snacks bring two or more. You never know what can happen! If your flight is delayed a few hours, or there’s no chance of a healthy restaurant in sight, you’ll be grateful you have extra.

Pack organic dried fruit like mango, apple, and pear slices (organic is especially important for dried fruit to make sure you skip the preservatives or extra sugar). The tendency for people in airports is to grab a bag of candy. Your dried fruit will save you the sugar, calories, colors, and blood sugar crash.

Get savory with snacks like roasted pumpkin seeds with sea salt or seaweed. You can even bring an avocado with sea salt. This can help curb your sweet cravings and keep your salty tooth happy, so you don’t have to give into chips or pretzels on the plane.

Hydrate! Especially when you are going up in the air the body loses so much water, and planes tend to be extremely dry.
