Obviously, you will have buy water or other liquids on “the other side,” but don’t forget and drink lots before, during, and after your flight. I like to also add chlorophyll or Sunwarrior Super Greens to my water to help counter the effects of the radiation in flight.

Make this delicious trail mix combination in large batches to snack on even when you’re not traveling!
articleSummaryHTML: Ever starved in an airport? Or worse, in a plane? Starve no more! Follow these 8 tips for the traveling vegan foodie!
seoTitle: 8 Tips for the Traveling Vegan Foodie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Ever starved in an airport? Or worse, in a plane? Starve no more! Follow these 8 tips for the traveling vegan foodie!
ingredients:
s:302:"
  • 1 cup almonds
  • 1 cup cashews
  • 1 cup pumpkin seeds
  • 1 cup raisins or goji berries (or both)
  • ½ cup hemp seeds
  • 1 cup cacao nibs or dark chocolate chips
  • 1 cup coconut flakes
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
";
directions: Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl and serve. Refill when done! Or pack up in small containers to make it easy for travel. Stores very well in a large mason jar.

articleTitle: Vegan Vigilante | Episode 5: Walgreens Goes Vegan?!
articleBodyHTML:
We have reached the fifth episode of The Vegan Vigilante, and that means we are upping the challenge even further! Vegan chef Jason Wrobel may have met his match!

This week we ask Jason Wrobel, our always entertaining celebrity vegan chef friend, to make a healthy, delicious, plant-based, and nutritious meal using only the ingredients he can find in a store that isn’t known for its food options. Yes, we’re making it harder than ever. Forget 99 cent stores or convenience stores. We are sending J-Wro to Walgreens to source his recipe accoutrements! Yay, pharmacy for the win! We’re certain he’ll struggle this time.

Jason starts his mission off with a smile, but we’ll see how long that lasts when faced with cough syrups and maybe some snack foods. Of course Jason manages to find something better, even some raw options. He tosses tofurkey kielbasa, fancy Greek olives, mushrooms, green beans, tomato sauce, spaghetti, and spices into his basket.

This means Jason can make a solid pasta dish from pharmacy-found ingredients. He is doing the impastable here, people! Browning his kielbasa in oil from the olives, boiling up noodles, sautéing veggies, and tossing together deliciousness with more ease than we thought. The Vegan Vigilante proves once again that there are no excuses. You can find the means to make healthy meals everywhere you go.
articleSummaryHTML: We have reached the fifth episode of The Vegan Vigilante, and that means we are upping the challenge even further! Vegan chef Jason Wrobel may have met his match!
seoTitle: Vegan Vigilante | Walgreens Goes Vegan?!
seoDescription: We have reached the fifth episode of The Vegan Vigilante, and that means we are upping the challenge even further! Vegan chef Jason Wrobel may have met his match!
ingredients:
s:540:"
  • Pasta Primavera with Vegan Sausage
  • 1 package Tofurkey kielbasa, cut into coin-sized pieces
  • 16 oz. Fancy Greek olives
  • 10 oz. mushrooms
  • 16 oz. green beans
  • 16 oz. tomato sauce
  • 16 oz. spaghetti
  • 1 teaspoon parsley
  • ¼ teaspoon garlic salt
";
directions: In a large pot, boil your spaghetti until the noodles are al dente, drain and set aside. Warm the oil from the olives in fry pan. Use the warmed oil to brown the cut sausage. Add mushrooms, beans, and tomato sauce and spices and let simmer for approximately 20 minutes. Plate your pasta and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Coffee is a highly controversial drink in the health field. But if you’re a coffee drinker there are ways to improve the health of your favorite drink like with this power coffee recipe!

Some believe that it is absolutely unhealthy and some believe it has health benefits. While people are trying to come up with a real answer, you should know that the acidity in coffee can be reduced by drinking cold brew coffee and coffee is known to improve metabolism, elevate mood, improve endurance and strength, and, according to Dr. Gerson, it can be used to cure cancer by activating the liver.

I am a coffee lover, personally, and my day starts with a good cup of that amazing aromatic drink. Here is a coffee recipe that is healthy, delicious, and easy to make.
articleSummaryHTML: Coffee is a highly controversial drink in the health field. But if you’re a coffee drinker there are ways to improve the health of your favorite drink like with this power coffee recipe!
seoTitle: Power Coffee Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Coffee is a highly controversial drink in the health field. But if you’re a coffee drinker there are ways to improve the health of your favorite drink like with this power coffee recipe!
ingredients:
s:542:"
  • 1 cup coffee (already made)
  • 1 tablespoon coconut butter
  • 1 teaspoon maca powder
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup or your favorite liquid sweetener
  • 1 scoop vanilla Sunwarrior Classic Protein
";
directions:
1. Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy.

Benefits of Ingredients

Coconut Butter

Coconut butter, derived from real coconut is packed with powerful anti- inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties. It is known to improve metabolism, gets rid of bad bacteria, helps to lubricate joints and is packed with healthy fats. Above all, it gives your drink a smooth and creamy texture.

Maca Powder

Maca which hales from Peru, South America is derived from mama root. Peruvians have used maca for ages due to its amazing health benefits; its’s high in Vitamin B, C and E. It is known to improve the function of reproductive organs. Hence it is also marketed as an aphrodisiac. It is also known to improve blood circulation, improve energy levels, increase immunity level and can be used as a replacement for cacao if one is allergic to it.

Cacao Powder

Cacao powder is one of the most important ingredients in chocolate. Cacao powder which is the raw powdered form obtained from cocoa beans is not the same as cocoa powder, which is a processed form with added sugar and chemicals. Cacao powder is rich in antioxidants, magnesium, iron, calcium and it is known to cure mood swings, improve energy levels, reduce muscle cramps, prevents pre-mature aging and helps to improve cardiovascular function.

Sea Salt

Sea salt, unlike regular salt, is not iodized and hence contains only traces of iodine. But, Sea salt is packed with about 72 minerals; it helps to get rid of mucous, it improves hair and skin quality, it helps you to lose those extra pounds, it helps to facilitate the functioning of muscle fibers and move all it brings out the aroma and taste in any recipe.

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy

articleBodyHTML:
In summer, you need light, refreshing meals, and this tempeh strawberry salad gives you light, tasty, filling, and nutritious happiness. It’s working dinner like a boss!

Tempeh is a great alternative to tofu if you are looking for high-protein vegan foods. It is less processed, higher in protein and fiber and generally healthier. However, on its own, it has a funny taste, and you need to know how to prepare it to turn it into something really delicious. This colorful salad is a perfect choice if you fancy a light and nutritious meal. The spice of the tempeh goes great with the sweetness of the strawberries, and the crunchy nuts give it all a beautiful finish.
articleSummaryHTML: In summer, you need light, refreshing meals, and this tempeh strawberry salad gives you light, tasty, filling, and nutritious happiness. It’s working dinner like a boss!
seoTitle: Tempeh Strawberry Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: In summer, you need light, refreshing meals, and this tempeh strawberry salad gives you light, tasty, filling, and nutritious happiness.
ingredients:
s:1344:"

For the Salad

  • 200g plain tempeh
  • 10 medium strawberries
  • 1 medium avocado
  • ½ red onion
  • ½ cucumber
  • 2 handfuls fresh spinach
  • 2 handfuls green leaf salad mix
  • 1 handful favorite nuts or seeds, toasted

For the Marinade

  • 1 tablespoon ground cumin
  • 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
  • 1 tablespoon paprika
  • ½ tablespoon cayenne pepper
  • Pinch of salt
  • 2 tablespoon nutritional yeast
  • 80 ml almond milk

For the Dressing

  • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
  • Pinch of salt
";
directions:
To make the marinade, put all the spices in a bowl and add almond milk, then mix thoroughly. In a frying pan, preheat 1 tablespoon olive oil. Cut the tempeh into long, thin slices, dunk each of the slices in the marinade, then put on the hot pan. Fry for 3 minutes then turn and fry for another 3 minutes. Remove from heat.

Start plating the salad by putting 1 handful of spinach and 1 handful of leafy greens on each plate. Slice the strawberries, onion, cucumber, and avocado, and put on top of the leaves.

Make the dressing by putting all ingredients in a bowl and mixing thoroughly. Drizzle the dressing on the top of the salads. Put half of the tempeh slices on each plate and finish with toasted nuts/seeds. Serves 2.

articleTitle: Mint Chocolate Chip Banana Soft Serve Vegan Ice Cream
articleBodyHTML:
When ice cream is your go-to happiness, fear not! We’ve got a vegan answer with this mint-chocolate chip (n)ice cream that will knock the socks off your summer!

Growing up, mint chocolate chip ice cream was my jam! Well, all ice cream, in general, was my jam, but when I was feeling particularly fun, I’d always go for scoops of mint chocolate chip. Maybe this period was foreshadowing my later-in-life love for green smoothies because my mentality with mint chocolate chip ice cream was “the greener the better.” (Which in hindsight I know meant “the more food coloring, the better.” Oops.)

Luckily, I’m now able and happy to eat mint chocolate chip banana ice cream completely food-coloring free AND completely dairy, refined sugar, and processed crap free!

This is my recipe for mint chocolate chip banana ice cream and not to toot my own horn, but it’s quite possibly the best recipe for mint chocolate chip banana soft serve ice cream out there.
articleSummaryHTML: When ice cream is your go-to happiness, fear not! We’ve got a vegan answer with this mint-chocolate chip (n)ice cream that will knock the socks off your summer!
seoTitle: Mint Chocolate Chip Banana Soft Serve Plant Based Ice Cream
seoDescription: When ice cream is your go-to happiness, fear not! We’ve got a vegan answer with this mint-chocolate chip (n)ice cream that will knock the socks off your summer!
recipeName: Mint Chocolate Chip Banana Soft Serve Vegan Ice Cream
ingredients:
s:438:"
  • 1.5 frozen peeled bananas, cut into small-ish slices
  • ¼ cup fresh mint, packed
  • 2–3 tablespoon dark chocolate chips
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Classic Plus vanilla protein [optional – for when you need a little boost!]
";
directions:
1. In a food processor or blender, pulse the frozen banana pieces, scraping down the sides as needed. (If after 1–2 minutes the bananas still haven’t turned to soft serve ice cream texture, throw in a splash of water or almond milk.)
  2. Add the protein powder if using, and pulse again, so it blends in.
  3. Add the mint, and process together until smooth, still scraping down the sides as needed.
  4. Add the chocolate chips and process again until they're dispersed, and the ice cream is your ideal texture.
  5. Serve and enjoy immediately!

articleBodyHTML:
Want something sweet and healthy? These peanut butter rice treats are your new summer go-to protein snack!

You might have stumbled over the sweet and healthy concept, but yes, those two words can go together. And trust me when you make these yummy treats, you will agree! I love to make different types of peanut butter energy balls, and this time I wanted something different but something that still had the sweet and nutty mixture of peanut butter and maple syrup. That is when I had the brilliant idea of adding crumbled up rice cakes instead of the regular oats. The result? DELICIOUSNESS.

Peanut butter has a bad rap because of the high fats. However, peanut butter has health benefits such as appetite depressant, decreases chances of cardiovascular heart disease, lowers chances of colon cancer, helps protect against Alzheimer’s, full of healthy fats, and lowers type 2 diabetes. Peanut butter has protein as well as potassium. It also contains fiber, healthy fats, magnesium, vitamin E, and antioxidants.

Rice cakes are usually made from brown rice. The brown rice provides fiber, carbohydrates, and phytochemicals. They make a good snack because they are low in calories.
articleSummaryHTML: Want something sweet and healthy?these peanut butter rice treats are your new summer go-to protein snack!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter Rice Treats | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Want something sweet and healthy? These peanut butter rice treats are your new summer go-to protein snack!
ingredients:
s:403:"
  • 1.5 cups peanut butter
  • 3/4 cup liquid sweetener (maple syrup, agave, brown rice syrup, etc.)
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Classic Plus vanilla protein
  • 6–8 rice cakes (either no salt or lightly salted)
";
directions:
1. First, put all of the rice cakes together in a bowl. Either crumble or use a mixer to mix the rice cakes into a “crumble.” Afterward, mix all the other ingredients together and put into a 9 x 11 dish. Make sure to flatten down the mixture with a spatula. Once you have done that, place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before cutting into squares and enjoy!
  2. As an alternative, you can roll the mixture into balls and coat with your favorite toppings.

Once you try one square, you won’t be able to stop at just one!

Variations:

  1. Add Sunwarrior Classic Plus chocolate for a chocolate and peanut butter flavor!
  2. Different nut butter such as almond butter, sunflower butter, cashew butter, etc.
  3. Drizzle with dark chocolate for an extra burst of chocolate awesome!

articleBodyHTML:
There’s big taste and health in this micro green and fennel salad! A refreshing bite of summer!

Treat yourself right with this delicious fennel and micro green salad! Bursting with flavors with mint, lemon, arugula, and fennel, this salad will leave you smiling the entire day. The flavors will pop with our delicious lime vinaigrette. Just a touch of olive oil, lime juice, and seasoning, and this salad comes together to create a fresh and flavorful salad.

This salad is a blend of micro greens and fennel. What exactly are micro greens you ask? You’ve probably seen them covering dishes in restaurants which make them so appealing and stunning visually. These little guys aren’t only gorgeous, they pack a nutritional punch! Micro greens absorb nutrients in the soil which gives them a boost of nutritional value. Micro greens are typically grown in greenhouses and can be found anywhere in the world. The carbon footprint of these plants are very low, so it’s a perfect farm to table green. Micro greens are lighter in flavor than their mature counterparts. They take on different textures and flavors, ranging from sweet to spicy.

The real star of this salad is the delicious fennel. This vegetable has fantastic health benefits including large amounts of vitamin C which can help boost your immune system. Fennel has been known to help facilitate digestion, therefore, processing food more readily in the body. Fennel is high in fiber which can aid processing waste in the stomach. The most surprising fact about fennel is that it is a natural source of electrolytes. Fennel is immensely high in potassium which our body craves post workout.

This homemade salad will leave you smiling ear to ear. Boost your day with nutrients and green-powered energy!
articleSummaryHTML: There’s big taste and health in this micro green and fennel salad! A refreshing bite of summer!
seoTitle: Fennel & Micro Green Salad
seoDescription: There’s big taste and health in this micro green and fennel salad! A refreshing bite of summer!
ingredients:
s:523:"

 

  • 1 large fennel bulb, shaved thinly
  • ½ cup sliced radish
  • ½ orange, peeled
  • 1 cup mixed micro greens
  • 1 tablespoon chopped flat leafed parsley
  • 2 tablespoons lime juice
  • 3 tablespoons EVOO
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1.) For dressing, combine lime juice, extra virgin olive oil, and salt in a small bowl. Whisk well.

2.) Pour dressing on top of salad and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
No pain no gain: The mantra is real, but the pain part doesn’t have to be so awful. Recovery can happen for you in a natural and healthy way.

Recovery plays an important role in an active person’s life. If you are a heavy weight lifter or a long distance runner or even a yoga practitioner, pain is your friend. “No pain, no gain” mantra works like a charm when one is active. Your body going through inflammation and soreness after a strenuous exercise is considered healthy as that is the only way you realize that your muscles are building and getting stronger.

While working out continuously and getting stronger is great, some resort to painkillers in order to cope up with workouts .Commonly used painkillers such as Ibuprofen are known to reduce inflammatory pain which helps people go harder on their workout and helps them recover faster. However, using painkillers for recovery can, in the long run, affect kidney and liver function as they tend to block biochemicals such as prostaglandins. Instead of taking pain killers, here are some natural ways to beat inflammation and soreness so you can recover in a healthy way.

Ice Baths

Ice baths have been used since ancient times to build a stronger immune system and for beauty purposes. Sitting in an ice bath after a workout can drastically relax your muscles by reducing inflammation, closing those open pores, and by cooling off your system .This is not just great for your muscles but excellent for your skin.

Sleep

Nothing screams recovery louder than a good night’s rest. Your body recovers at its highest rate when you are sleeping. It’s the time to give your muscles and organs a good break and helps get rid of lactic acid and aids in muscle recovery. Six to eight hours are generally recommended. If you are physically active for more than two hours a day, you should extend your sleep to ten hours a night.

Massage

Being physically active has great benefits but can simultaneously cause havoc on your body when you have pushed it over a certain point. Massages are a great way to relax your mind and body. Massage relieves lactic acid, remove knots in your body, improves blood circulation, and helps with mental relaxation. Getting a massage once a week is ideal if you are strenuously active.

Nutritious Diet

The healthier you eat, the faster you recover. It’s that simple. Focus on eating wholesome and organic foods and sources of carbohydrates and protein that come from places other than red meat and peanut butter. Focus on quinoa, almond butter, lentils, and loads of greens to support your active lifestyle and speedy recovery. Sunwarrior has some great protein powders that are organic and fabulous tasting to help you with your post work out nutrition.

 

Find the Meal Plan That Works For You

Join Today!
articleSummaryHTML: No pain no gain: The mantra is real, but the pain part doesn’t have to be so awful. Recovery can happen for you in a natural and healthy way.
seoTitle: Recover from Your Workout | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: No pain no gain: The mantra is real, but the pain part doesn’t have to be so awful. Recovery can happen for you in a natural and healthy way.
ingredients:
s:449:"

Ginger and cayenne are high in anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that when applied externally, they can reduce inflammation, soreness, and general muscle ache.

  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon cayenne powder
  • 2 tablespoons ginger juice
  • ½ tablespoon shea butter
";
directions:
Mix all ingredient together until smooth and store in the refrigerator for long use.

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
Creamy and dreamy foods are for vegans too! And we can prove it with this vegan creamy mushroom pasta!

Ever wondered how to make super creamy mushroom pasta in a healthy and vegan version? Well, here it comes! This pasta is so creamy and indulgent that you would never know that it is entirely plant-based! It only requires a few simple ingredients and not too much work. It makes a healthy and nutritious mid-week dinner, and you can easily feed the whole family using just two pans!
articleSummaryHTML: Creamy and dreamy foods are for vegans too! And we can prove it with this vegan creamy mushroom pasta!
seoTitle: Vegan Creamy Mushroom Pasta | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Creamy and dreamy foods are for vegans too! And we can prove it with this vegan creamy mushroom pasta!
ingredients:
s:739:"
  • 10 oz.  chestnut mushrooms, chopped
  • 1 medium white onion, chopped
  • 5 tablespoons olive oil
  • ¾ cup almond milk
  • 1 can chickpeas, drained
  • 2 handfuls fresh spinach
  • 3tablespoons yeast flakes
  • 2 cloves garlic, chopped
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • A pinch of thyme
  • 13–16 oz. pasta (I used whole wheat spaghetti)
";
directions:
1. Start by cooking the pasta according to the instructions on the packaging.
  2. While the pasta is cooking, make the sauce by heating 2 tablespoons olive oil in a pan. Add chopped onions, mushrooms and garlic and cook for 5 min stirring occasionally.
  3. In the meantime, put the chickpeas in a food processor or high-speed blender and add 3 tablespoons olive oil, almond milk, yeast flakes, maple syrup, salt and pepper and blend until smooth (it should have a hummus-like consistency).
  4. Add spinach to the pan and cook for 3 min, then add the chickpea mix and stir everything together. Cook for 3 more minutes or until you get nice and creamy consistency (add a bit of water or almond milk if you think the sauce is too thick).
  5. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and mix everything together. Season with thyme and salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

articleBodyHTML:
Gazpacho is a lot like potato salad, and not just because both are popular in the hot summer months. Here is a recipe for easy gazpacho that will feel like a flavor parade!

See, potato salad is one of those classics that everybody has their own twist on. My grandmother’s classic version has homemade mayonnaise, mustard, celery, onion, and hard-boiled egg. Your family undoubtedly has its own adaptation.

Classic gazpacho—which originated in Spain—is made of raw vegetables, including a tomato base, and is served chilled. Modern variations might include the addition of avocados, grapes, parsley, almonds, dried fruits, and other herbs and produce. There are even non-raw, non-vegetarian twists with such inclusions as bread, seafood, meat stock, boiled egg, roasted tomatoes, and wine.

As with ingredients, texture—how thick the gazpacho is made—varies by family and by regions of the world.

If you’re opting for the more timeless style of gazpacho, know that every batch you make will taste different. Your selection of tomato will have a big bearing on the outcome, of course. The best tomatoes make the best gazpacho, so use fresh, juicy, organic heirloom tomatoes if you have access to them. Letting gazpacho “sit” allows the flavors to develop, but to reap the most nutritional benefits from this summer favorite, eat it soon after preparing—perhaps within a day or two. Keep it tightly sealed in the coldest part of the refrigerator.

For a meal that’s a breeze, pair a bowl of gazpacho with a side of your favorite vegan potato salad.
articleSummaryHTML: Gazpacho is a lot like potato salad, and not just because both are popular in the hot summer months. Here is a recipe for easy gazpacho that will feel like a flavor parade!
seoTitle: Easy Vegan Gazpacho | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Gazpacho is a lot like potato salad, and not just because both are popular in the hot summer months. Here is a recipe for easy gazpacho that will feel like a flavor parade!
ingredients:
s:506:"
  • 3 medium tomatoes, seeded and chopped
  • 1 small cucumber, peeled, seeded and chopped
  • ½ bell pepper, seeded and chopped
  • 2 tablespoons  white onion, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons garlic-flavored olive oil
  • 2 teaspoons red wine vinegar
  • Unrefined salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
Place all ingredients into a food processor and season with salt and pepper, if desired. Process until smooth. Chill at least 30 minutes before serving. Serve garnished with chopped cucumber and red bell pepper. Gazpacho will keep in the fridge up to three days.

You can add Sunwarrior's Immune Shield for a boost of immunity!

articleTitle: Summer Corn and Zucchini Basil Salad
articleBodyHTML:
Ear’s to summer! Corn on the cob is a great way to get started with this corn and zucchini basil salad.

It’s always a good idea to think about what seasonal veggies will be available. Summer boasts a ton of awesome veggies; corn is my favorite! I love corn on the cob whether it’s boiled and covered in lime and sea salt, grilled and topped with cilantro, or just plain ol’ by itself. The sweet kernels are so addicting that it’s hard for me to eat just one ear! If you’re like me, you’re going to be looking for ways to incorporate corn into your diet in these hot summer months, and this zucchini and corn salad is perfect! Packed with veggies and full of simple flavors, this salad is great to take to a potluck or even just have in the fridge for when you need some wholesome veggie goodness. This dish comes together in about 10 minutes so you know you can have a healthy side in no time at all. Try grilling the corn if you want a charred flavor, or try adding other veggies like yellow squash or cucumbers for extra crunch!
articleSummaryHTML: Ear’s to summer! Corn on the cob is a great way to get started with this corn and zucchini basil salad.
seoTitle: Summer Corn and Zucchini Basil Salad | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Ear’s to summer! Corn on the cob is a great way to get started with this corn and zucchini basil salad. Check it out today!
recipeName: Summer Corn and Zucchini Basil Salad
ingredients:
s:604:"
  • 1 ½ cup frozen corn (or fresh corn that has been cooked) (organic non-GMO)
  • 2 large zucchini, diced
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 cup cherry tomatoes, cut into quarters
  • ¼ cup fresh basil, chopped
  • 2 green onions, chopped
  • Zest and juice of 1 lemon
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan and add the zucchini. Cook until just tender about 4–5 minutes, then quickly add in the garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds). Remove mixture to a large bowl.
  2. In the same pan, add in the corn to toast for about 2 minutes. Remove and mix with the zucchini. Let this mixture cool.
  3. Once the zucchini and corn mixture has cooled a little bit, add the cherry tomatoes, basil, green onions, lemon juice and zest, and salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Mix well! Serve at room temperature or cold.

articleTitle: Vegan Funfetti Cupcakes (with a Sunwarrior Cameo!)
articleBodyHTML:
There is everything to love about a cupcake with the word fun in it, and that is why we are bringing you a healthier version of the funfetti cupcake!

My love for funfetti cupcakes runs deep. (I mean it’s a cupcake that has the word FUN literally IN IT!!!)

Growing up, my lucky mother got so much praise, because I’d jump for joy over my birthday funfetti cupcakes - without knowing they came from a box. (And she didn’t know that she was practically feeding me poison at the time, so I don’t hold that against her.)

But since I’ve grown up and started prioritizing the healthiness of the foods I put into my body, those sprinkle-packed cupcakes haven’t really been a thing. And my birthdays have been a little less fun because of it.

But this year on my birthday, I was determined to change that! By making funfetti cupcakes that actually are FUN – because they have sprinkles and because they don’t lead to bloating, blood sugar spikeage, or belly aches.

I use as little sugar as I could get away with without these really being muffins, I use spelt flour which is low in gluten and easy to digest, I add Sunwarrior plant protein to help with the blood sugar spike prevention, and I leave eggs, dairy, and butter out of the picture! And out of the cupcakes.

Trust me: these are funfetti cupcakes worth celebrating (with and for!).
articleSummaryHTML: There is everything to love about a cupcake with the word fun in it, and that is why we are bringing you a healthier version of the funfetti cupcake!
seoTitle: Vegan Funfetti Cupcakes with Sunwarrior | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: There is everything to love about a cupcake with the word fun in it, and that is why we are bringing you a healthier version of the funfetti cupcake!
recipeName: Vegan Funfetti Cupcakes (with a Sunwarrior Cameo!)
ingredients:
s:1213:"

Dry Ingredients:

  • 2 cups spelt flour
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior plant-protein (natural or vanilla flavored)
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 2 pinches sea salt
  • ¼ cup coconut sugar

Wet Ingredients:

  • 1 cup almond milk, unsweetened
  • ½ cup melted coconut oil BUTTER FLAVORED COCONUT OIL!!!!!
  • ½ cup maple syrup
  • 2 teaspoon apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Bonus Ingredients:

  • Sprinkles, as many as you like
  • Frosting, the healthiest kind you can find at your health food store (many organic frostings are sold now!)
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients into one bowl.
  3. Mix the wet ingredients into another bowl.
  4. Mix the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients.
  5. Add sprinkles and mix to incorporate!
  6. Line your cupcake pan with cupcake tins and then divide the batter equally among all 12 cupcakes.
  7. Bake for 20 minutes.
  8. Remove from the oven and let cool.
  9. Then spread your frosting on top of your cupcakes (not too much!) and immediately sprinkle with sprinkles.

ENJOY!!!

Here are video instructions:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FxU2PN7xGK0

articleBodyHTML:
Let your vegetables take a dive into a dip of awesome with this creamy beet veggie dip! This season is all about bright and crisp flavors, so we’re giving you the bright and crisp elegance of beets.

We eat first with our eyes. And the gorgeous colors of summer fruits are a feast! This season is about utilizing those colors to make dishes packed with nutrients and make you feel good over all. With color in mind, we decided to play around with the conventional hummus recipe and came up with this incredible veggie dip. Beets add a pop of color and flavor to everything, and this spreadable veggie dip is just what your vegetable plate needs. This dip has the earthiness of beets and the creamy texture from the tahini and cashews.

This hummus will keep up to one week in a sealed container in the fridge (If it lasts that long!).

This recipe is bursting with plant-based protein from both the tahini and cashews. With all that, the real star of this dish is the beets: bursting with fiber, potassium, and vitamin C. Spread this dip on toast or veggies, or use it as an accompaniment to any dish.
articleSummaryHTML: Let your vegetables take a dive into a dip of awesome with this creamy beet veggie dip! This season is all about bright and crisp flavors, so we’re giving you the bright and crisp elegance of beets.
seoTitle: Beet Veggie Dip | Simple Easy Recipe | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Let your vegetables take a dive into a dip of awesome with this creamy beet veggie dip!
ingredients:
s:514:"
  • 1 cup raw cashews, soaked overnight
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 2 large beets
  • 1 garlic clove
  • ¼ cup tahini
  • 1/3 cup fresh lemon juice
  • ¾ teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • 1/8 teaspoon pepper
";
directions:
1. Soak your cashews in 2 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of salt for 8 hours
  2. Preheat oven to 400C/177F. Place beets onto a baking tray with 1 tablespoon of coconut oil. Cover with tin foil and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove from oven and let cool
  3. Peel cooled beets and chop them into cubes.
  4. Drain cashews and place in a food processor with beets, garlic, tahini, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and cumin. Blend until smooth and serve

articleBodyHTML:
For fast and healthy, this red lentil pasta bowl helps you make dinner like a boss!

This warm lentil pasta bowl is fresh and healthy. By the time the pasta is cooked, you are ready to toss everything together and enjoy a heart healthy meal. Gluten free, and packed with fiber and protein, red lentil pasta is a healthy choice for you. This pasta bowl can be easily tailored to your food preferences, so feel free to get your culinary groove on! Serves 6–8.
articleSummaryHTML: For fast and healthy, this red lentil pasta bowl helps you make dinner like a boss!
seoTitle: Red Lentil Pasta Bowl | Sunwarrior Recipe
seoDescription: For fast and healthy, this red lentil pasta bowl helps you make dinner like a boss!
ingredients:
s:863:"
  • 10 oz. box red lentil pasta
  • 1 tablespoon avocado oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, finely diced
  • 1 small onion, diced
  • 1 small can corn, or 1 stalk of fresh roasted corn
  • 1 cup mixed beans
  • 1 can diced tomatoes, keep the liquid
  • 2 small jalapenos, finely diced
  • ½ cup plain soy yogurt
  • 1 small avocado, sliced
  • Handful of fresh cilantro, chopped
  • Small handful black olives
  • Juice of one lime
  • Pinch of salt and pepper
";
directions:
1. In a large pot, bring salted water to boil. Add pasta and cook according to directions. Drain and set aside.

2. On medium heat, heat avocado oil in a large skillet. Add onions and jalapenos, and cook over medium heat for approximately 3 minutes until they soften.

3. Add garlic, stir and cook 30 seconds.

4. Add corn, beans, and tomatoes with liquid. Heat and stir until everything is well-combined.

5. Turn temperature to low. Add pasta and stir until well-incorporated and until pasta is warmed.

6. In a small bowl, add yogurt and squeeze the juice of a small lime. Mix well.

7. Turn off skillet heat and transfer pasta into a large serving bowl. Add yogurt mixture, avocado, olives, and cilantro on top.

ENJOY!

articleBodyHTML:
For an orange creamsicle smoothie that tastes like summer sunshine and happiness, we have a recipe you simply must try!

Do you remember those orange push up pops as a kid? They had that orange juice flavor but with that creamy goodness that melted in your mouth. Before you know it, it was gone and you wanted another one! I know I would have two. Sigh…those were the good ol’ days.

Spotting them at the grocery store the other day sparked my childhood memory. Curious, I reached for the box and looked at the ingredient panel. Wow. How could I like these chemicals as a kid? I would never touch them as an adult. After looking at the ingredients, I went straight to the kitchen to experiment on how I could create this orange deliciousness in a smoothie. After a few tries, I created the perfect, cool, creamy, and citrusy smoothie.

You’re welcome.
articleSummaryHTML: For an orange creamsicle smoothie that tastes like summer sunshine and happiness, we have a recipe you simply must try!
seoTitle: Orange Creamsicle Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For an orange creamsicle smoothie that tastes like summer sunshine and happiness, we have a recipe you simply must try!
ingredients:
s:674:"
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 orange, peeled and seeded
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus vanilla
  • ½ cup fresh pressed orange juice
  • ½ cup water
  • Zest fresh orange peel for taste
  • A dash of vanilla extract
  • Ice
  • Optional: For an extra nutrition punch, try adding 1 cup of your favorite greens like kale or spinach.
";
directions:
Blend all and enjoy this creamy goodness!

You can also make this smoothie into a Popsicle for you and your kiddos. Make the mixture above, and pour in BPA-free plastic Popsicle molds. Freeze overnight and voila! A healthier orange pop!

Benefits of an orange: An orange has over 170 different phytochemicals and more than 60 flavonoids, many of which have been shown to have anti-inflammatory properties and strong antioxidant effects.

Fun facts about oranges:

Did you know that oranges are a type of berry, hesperidia to be exact? Crazy! Oranges were first mentioned in Chinese literature in 314 BC. Christopher Columbus brought them to America in 1493. Sailors used them on boats to prevent scurvy on long voyages. America produces about 25 billion oranges a year with Florida harvesting the most.

Enjoy!

articleTitle: Summer Salads: Waldorf is Thy Name!
articleBodyHTML:
Brighten up meal times with a fresh summer salad full of fruits and vegetables! And BONUS! A Waldorf salad recipe!

Summer is the best time of year to enjoy delicious fruits and veggies that are in season. Since our bodies naturally want to cool down during the summer, there is no better time to make refreshing salads with the best summer fruits and vegetables.

In terms of sourcing some of the best quality ingredients, be sure to shop at your local farmers market. This way you are sure to get what is freshest and what tastes the best. You can’t compare the produce you get at a summer market to any grocery store. Once you come home with an array of colorful summer veggies, the best and easiest thing to do is create a gorgeous, vibrant salad.

Here’s how you can build a perfect salad:

Pick a Base

Kale, chard, spinach, arugula, romaine, swiss chard

Choose a Protein

Pea sprouts, sunflower sprouts, alfalfa sprouts, cooked beans or sprouted beans, grilled tempeh

Add some Healthy Fats

Sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, chia seeds, almonds, walnuts, cashews, hazelnuts, hemp seeds, pecans

Avocado, coconut, or olives

Add some Healthy Extras with Vibrant Colors and Herbs

Red cabbage, beets, carrots, basil, thyme, mint

Green or red apple, pear, or blueberries

Dress it Up

Choose your favorite dressing – either a lemon tahini or balsamic vinaigrette

Take Advantage of Specific Delicious Summer Produce Ideas

Fruit: Strawberries, cantaloupe, apricots, peaches, grapes, limes, mango, nectarines, plums, tomatoes, watermelon

Veggies: Fennel, eggplant, cucumbers, corn, garlic, peas, peppers, radicchio, radishes, sweet onions, zucchini

Herbs: Basil, lemongrass, rosemary, mint, oregano, parsley, cilantro

Make a Homemade Salad Dressing!

The summertime is a great season to step out of your comfort zone and try making some homemade salad dressings. By making dressings at home, you will greatly reduce your exposure to preservatives, chemicals, artificial flavoring as well as intake of sugar.

Otherwise, I recommend making a large glass jar of dressing for the week and this will help you keep your salads healthy, flavorful and clean.
articleSummaryHTML: Brighten up meal times with a fresh summer salad full of fruits and vegetables! And BONUS! A Waldorf salad recipe!
seoTitle: Summer Salads: Waldorf is Thy Name! | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Brighten up meal times with a fresh summer salad full of fruits and vegetables! And BONUS! A Waldorf salad recipe!
ingredients:
s:760:"
  • 1 cup arugula or watercress
  • 1 large head red leaf lettuce (or two cups arugula)
  • ¼ cup peeled jicama or carrot
  • 3 stalks celery diced
  • 1 green apple, diced
  • 1 cup sunflower sprouts
  • ½ cup chopped walnuts or sunflower seeds
  • 2 cups Waldorf Dressing

Waldorf Dressing

  • ½ cup raw tahini
  • ¼ cup lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup or your choice of liquid sweetener
  • 2 tablespoons tamari
  • ¼ cup freshly squeezed orange juice
  • 2 tablespoons minced onion
  • 1 cup filtered water
";
directions:
Salad

Place salad ingredients in a large serving bowl and mix lightly together

Dressing

Combine the first five dressing ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until combined.

articleTitle: Kale Pizza with Roasted Eggplant Red Pepper Sauce
articleBodyHTML:
Ever get tired of the same old pizza? It’s time to shake up your toppings and discover flavors that make your pizza a party in your mouth!

Yum! This twist on sauce will leave you coming back for more. This is a tasty, healthy, come and get it while it’s hot kinda pizza. You can change it up with your favorite ingredients or make a few mini pizzas to keep your taste buds wanting more. This recipe serves two.
articleSummaryHTML: Ever get tired of the same old pizza? It’s time to shake up your toppings and discover flavors that make your pizza a party in your mouth!
seoTitle: Kale Pizza with Eggplant Red Pepper Sauce | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Ever get tired of the same old pizza? It’s time to shake up your toppings and discover flavors that make your pizza a party in your mouth!
recipeName: Kale Pizza with Roasted Eggplant Red Pepper Sauce
ingredients:
s:609:"
  • 8 ounces of pizza dough
  • 3 button or shiitake mushrooms
  • 1–1 ½ cups chopped kale
  • 1 ½ teaspoon Italian blend seasoning
  • ⅓ cup eggplant red pepper sauce
  • ⅓ cup vegan cheese (optional)
  • ¼ cup red onion, thinly sliced
  • 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
  • ⅓ cup mixed peppers, thinly sliced
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.

2. On a pizza stone spread pizza dough to your preference of thickness. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of Italian blend seasoning and spread eggplant pepper sauce on top of dough. Set aside.

3. In a nonstick pan over medium heat cook kale, red onion, peppers, and mushrooms until soft. About 5 minutes.

4. Evenly spread vegetable mixture on top of eggplant red pepper sauce.

5. Sprinkle with vegan cheese and remaining Italian blend seasoning. Place a pizza stone into the oven on a medium rack. Cook for approximately 12 minutes, or until crust is to your liking.

6. This pizza tastes great as it, but if you want, scatter some nutritional yeast on top and ENJOY!!

articleBodyHTML:
It’s a great day to be vegan with this mango & coconut crème parfait! Tasty, refreshing, sin-free indulgence!

Fresh mango can be used if you don’t mind the chopping – I love the Ataulfo or Francis mangos. These are so much sweeter meaning you can add less sugar and the texture is so much more creamy and smooth.

This is such an easy to make dessert that’s beautiful to look at and sensational to savor. Keep organic coconut milk on hand along with frozen mango chunks and you’re just minutes away from a fabulous sin-free sweet.
articleSummaryHTML: It’s a great day to be vegan with this mango & coconut crème parfait! Tasty, refreshing, sin-free indulgence!
seoTitle: Mango & Coconut Crème Parfait: Vegan
seoDescription: It’s a great day to be vegan with this mango & coconut crème parfait! Tasty, refreshing, sin-free indulgence!
ingredients:
s:898:"

Mango

 

  • 6 cups frozen mango chunks, slightly defrosted
  • 1–2 tablespoons coconut sugar, maple syrup, or Lakanto, to taste
  • ¼ cup thin coconut water from recipe below or orange liqueur
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Tiny pinch sea salt
  • Garnish: ¼ cup toasted coconut flakes, cashews, candied ginger, or lime zest

Coconut Whipped Crème

  • One 14/15-ounce canned full-fat organic coconut milk
  • 1–3 teaspoons coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
Mango

Measure the ingredients into a powerful blender or food processor and puree until smooth and creamy. Let mango defrost longer if you don’t have a powerful blender.

Serve right as a soft swirl or freeze up to 1 week removing from the freezer 20–30 mins before serving.

Coconut Whipped Crème

1. Refrigerate coconut milk four hours or overnight so it is well-chilled.

2. Open the can of coconut milk and scoop out the firm layer of coconut cream that has solidified at the top of the can ensuring you avoid the liquid. (Reserve and use in the recipe above, smoothies or sauces.)

3. Place the cream in large, chilled glass or stainless-steel bowl, or stand mixer.

4. Using hand beaters or a stand mixer set at high speed, whip the coconut cream for 3–5 minutes or until it becomes fluffy and light, with soft peaks.

5. Beat in the sweetener and vanilla until incorporated. Chill until ready to use.

To Assemble the Parfaits:

Using 6–8 flutes or wine glasses, spoon approximately 2 tablespoons coconut crème into each. Top with a scoop of the mango sorbet, then more coconut crème.

Garnish as desired and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
It’s summer time which means it’s time to get your quinoa on! Keep summer meal times light, refreshing, and satisfying with this quinoa tabbouleh salad!

This light dish of quinoa tabbouleh salad is easy to digest. It makes a delicious and wholesome summer lunch, snack, or side dish with dinner. This recipe makes approximately 2–3 cups.
articleSummaryHTML: It’s summer time which means it’s time to get your quinoa on! Keep summer meal times light, refreshing, and satisfying with this quinoa tabbouleh
seoTitle: Quinoa Tabbouleh Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: It’s summer time which means it’s time to get your quinoa on! Keep summer meal times light, refreshing, and satisfying with this quinoa tabbouleh
ingredients:
s:1279:"

Quinoa Salad

  • 1 cup rinsed quinoa
  • 1 large cup of chickpeas
  • ½ cup chopped red onion
  • ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley
  • ¼ cup chopped fresh mint
  • 1 bunch of spinach, finely chopped into shreds*
  • 1 cucumber, seeded and chopped into small pieces
  • 1 cup cherry tomatoes, sliced in halves or quarters

* grab a bunch of spinach leaves together and thinly slice into medium or long shreds depending on size of spinach leaves.

Dressing

  • 1 large clove garlic
  • 1 teaspoon dry or fresh pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon agave or your favorite liquid sweetener
  • 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
  • ¼ cup olive oil
";
directions:
1. Bring 3 cups water to boil. Add rinsed quinoa and cook on medium for 15 min.

2. Drain and rinse with cold water. Spread out on a plate to dry the grains. Then place into a bowl and combine with chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, cucumber, spinach, parsley and mint.

3. Mix dressing ingredients and toss into the quinoa mixture, and gently stir from the bottom up.

4. Serve and enjoy!

articleTitle: Wholly Guacamole! Keeping Summer Parties Healthy!
articleBodyHTML:
Not sure what to bring or not bring to your next backyard party or potluck? Here are some ideas and a guacamole recipe to help you bring something tasty and healthy!

There is nothing like spending your summer afternoons or evenings among friends devouring some delicious food. Whether it is a potluck, barbeque, patio party or just an excuse to get together on a summer day – you want your dish to be the life of the party. Don’t spoil it by bringing something that isn’t vibrant with color, filled with flavor, and sprinkled with texture. You don’t need to “give in” when it comes to summer time eating; in fact, it’s your chance to take advantage of local and fresh produce and make something that will have everyone begging for more!

Don’t Bring These

  • Don’t bring trays or platters with cheeses and dips loaded with calories
  • Don’t bring bags of basic potato chips loaded with sodium and fat
  • Don’t bring soda pop or fruit juices loaded with sugar
  • Don’t bring coleslaw or salad loaded with mayonnaise or a creamy dressing

Instead, Do Bring These!

  • Make an herbed bean dip or a guacamole
  • Bring organic corn chips or a vegetable platter
  • Make a refreshing lemonade or 100% fruit juice or water infused with berries and mint
  • Make a quinoa taboule salad or kale slaw salad filled with nuts and seeds and fresh herbs
articleSummaryHTML: Not sure what to bring or not bring to your next backyard party or potluck? Here are some ideas and a guacamole recipe to help you bring something tasty and healthy!
seoTitle: Wholly Guacamole! Keep Summer Parties Healthy! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Not sure what to bring or not bring to your next backyard party or potluck? Here are some ideas and a guacamole to help you bring something tasty and healthy!
ingredients:
s:788:"
  • 1 cup cooked green split peas
  • 4 green onions, minced
  • 3–5 tablespoons lemon or lime juice
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • ½ teaspoon ground coriander
  • ¼ teaspoon garlic powder or 1 clove fresh garlic
  • ½ bunch parsley
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 2 large ripe avocados
  • ¾ cup chopped tomatoes
  • Optional: 1 jalapeno or chili finely chopped
  • 1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil
";
directions:
1. Put peas, green onions, lemon juice, cumin coriander, garlic, parsley, jalapeno and salt into a food processor and blend until smooth.

2. Cut avocadoes in half, remove pits and scoop out flesh into a medium size mixing bowl. Blend with everything else.

3. Served with sliced jicama or carrots, or you can opt for corn chips or sweet potato chips

articleBodyHTML:
Quench your thirst with this salad. You heard that right: this spicy watermelon salad hits all the refreshing feels that will leave you hydrated and happy.

6 easy ingredients will get you a spicy summer watermelon salad that is both refreshing and has a kick to it. This is my new summer salad. I have made it numerous times and have had lots of compliments on it.
articleSummaryHTML: Quench your thirst with this salad. You heard that right: this spicy watermelon salad hits all the refreshing feels that will leave you hydrated and happy.
seoTitle: Spicy Summer Watermelon Salad | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Quench your thirst with this salad. You heard that right: this spicy watermelon salad hits all the refreshing feels that will leave you hydrated and happy.
ingredients:
s:319:"
  • 1 large watermelon
  • 2 cucumbers
  • 2 limes (Juiced)
  • 1 stalk of cilantro
  • 1 jalapeño
  • Himalayan sea salt to taste
";
directions:
Slice into the watermelon and remove the rind.

Cut into large square pieces. Place the cut watermelon in a large mixing bowl.

Wash and peel cucumbers. Chop cucumbers up and add to bowl with watermelon.

Wash jalapeño and take out seeds. Thinly slice half of it. Add the thinly sliced jalapeño pepper and lime juice to the bowl and toss gently until combined.

Sprinkle cilantro leaves and toss once more to incorporate. Then add salt to taste.

Refrigerate until ready to serve. Tastes best when marinated for a few hours.

Benefits of watermelon:

Watermelons are mostly water, about 92 percent, but this refreshing fruit is soaked with nutrients. Each juicy bite has significant levels of vitamins A, B6, and C, lots of lycopene, antioxidants and amino acids. There's even a modest amount of potassium. Plus, this summer snack is fat-free, very low in sodium and has only 40 calories per cup.

Fun facts about watermelon:

Did you know that watermelons have been cultivated in Egypt for more than 5,000 years? Yep, Egyptians depicted watermelon in their drawings on the walls of tombs and even left watermelon with their dead to nourish them as they journeyed through the underworld. Because watermelons are native to Africa, they need hot, sunny conditions to thrive. Some varieties need up to 130 warm days to ripen. Most watermelons mature in 85 to 100 days. We think of watermelon as a fruit because of its sweet flavor, but watermelon is actually a vegetable. It belongs to the cucurbit family and is related to pumpkins, cucumbers, and squash.

Stay hydrated.

articleTitle: Vegan Coconut Crush Gluten Free Almond Bars
articleBodyHTML:
Keeping life sweet is easier than ever with these vegan coconut almond bars! And we’re also keeping it gluten free and healthier by using the best ingredients!

If something is made with coconut, I'm instantly drawn to it. The problem is, most desserts that contain coconut are also made with dairy, added sugar, and gluten -- three things I avoid. It’s hard enough finding a gluten-free recipe, let alone one that doesn’t include adding copious amounts of sugar, butter, or cream. After doing some experimenting in the kitchen, I discovered a mouth-watering recipe that tastes better and lighter than any blondie you’ve ever eaten. This treat will satisfy any coconut craving you have, and it's the perfect dessert to entertain guests all summer long!
articleSummaryHTML: Keeping life sweet is easier than ever with these vegan coconut almond bars! And we’re also keeping it gluten free and healthier by using the best ingredients!
seoTitle: Vegan Coconut Crush Gluten Free Almond Bars | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Keeping life sweet is easier than ever with these vegan coconut almond bars! And we’re also keeping it gluten free and healthier by using the best ingredients!
recipeName: Vegan Coconut Crush Gluten Free Almond Bars
ingredients:
s:708:"
  • 1 cup of almond butter
  • 1/3 cup organic maple syrup
  • 2 flax seed eggs
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 tablespoon organic vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • ¼ cup of 100% organic reduced fat shredded dry coconut + 1 tablespoon
  • 1 handful unsweetened 100% organic coconut flakes
  • 1 handful 69% cacao dark chocolate chips 
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees
  2. Generously spray an 8 by 8 pan with coconut oil or line with parchment paper (makes for easier clean up)
  3. Mix together the almond butter, maple syrup, eggs, baking powder, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and sea salt until the consistency is smooth.
  4. Mix in the dry coconut
  5. Pour batter into the pan and evenly spread it to the edges
  6. Sprinkle the dark chocolate chips evenly across the top of the batter in the pan followed by the coconut flakes
  7. Bake for 20–25 minutes or until the edges are firm but the center is slightly moist
  8. Slice and let the bars cool for 30 minutes before enjoying and store them in the refrigerator so they maintain their moist consistency (note – many gluten-free dessert recipes taste richer when kept in a cool environment).

articleBodyHTML:
Instead of spring roll ups, try these “summer” roll ups. These veggie roll ups are the perfect summer snack. Cold and crunchy for any occasion and perfect in your favorite dip!

Why veggie roll ups are all the rage:

  • Easy to make
  • You can customize the veggies to your liking
  • Light but filled with fiber
  • Tasty way to get your veggies in
articleSummaryHTML: Instead of spring roll ups, try these “summer” roll ups. These veggie roll ups are the perfect summer snack. Cold and crunchy for any occasion and perfect in your favorite dip!
seoTitle: Veggie Summer Roll Ups | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Instead of spring roll ups, try these “summer” roll ups. These veggie roll ups are the perfect summer snack. Cold and crunchy for any occasion.
ingredients:
s:379:"
  • Rice paper
  • Kale
  • Carrots, julienned
  • Cucumbers, julienned
  • Purple cabbage, shredded
  • Avocado, chopped
  • And any other veggies you would like to add
";
directions:
Dip each piece of rice paper in water for 30 seconds, so that both sides are wet, shake off the excess, move it to a plate or cutting board while it’s still rigid, and let it rest until it finishes rehydrating. Add kale first, covering most of the rice paper except at the ends. Leave some room at the ends so you can roll it and it sticks. Start adding your veggies inside one by one. Don’t add too much or the bite will be too big. After you put the desired veggies in roll, lift the side of the rice paper that's closest to you, gently pull it forward (away from you) over the fillings. Hold the wrap firmly while you fold in each end of the wrap. Continue rolling to seal the seam. After it looks like a burrito, let it set for a bit. Continue to make the rest until you have made the entire batch of veggie rolls. Cut into bite size pieces so you can dip into hummus.

Fun fact about rice paper:

Did you know that Xuancheng is the place where rice paper originally came from? The name of the paper was mentioned in many historical accounts from as early as the 8th century. Like tortillas in Mexico, rice papers are the all-purpose food wrappers of Asia. They are made by combining finely ground rice, water, salt, and sometimes tapioca flour, then rolling out the mixture into paper-thin rounds and drying the rounds on bamboo mats in the sun. When dry the rounds look glassy and brittle, the crosshatch patterns from the bamboo showing through. When wet, they are translucent and pleasantly chewy.

Happy Dipping!

articleBodyHTML:
A thousand standing ovations for this vegan thousand island dressing! Here is where dressing gets real!

I grew up in Upstate New York, and in the summertime, we would take weekend family road trips to explore the area. One summer, we visited the Thousand Islands Region, located along the upper St. Lawrence River, between the United States and Canada. It seemed that everywhere we stopped, and no matter what we ordered to eat, it came with a different variation of a condiment called Thousand Island dressing. If you like pink/orange salad dressings such as French or Russian—and maybe even if you don’t—you’ll enjoy Thousand Island. While other dressings are typically smooth, this one is characterized by a chunky texture, the result of stirring chopped pickles into the final sauce.

Traditional Thousand Island is made from a mayonnaise base and ketchup; it may also include Worcestershire sauce. With its popularity no longer confined to Upstate New York, regional variations of the dressing abound. Besides pickles or pickle relish, the classic version may also contain minced garlic, chives, pimento, parsley, olives, red pepper, onion, or a hard-boiled egg. I wanted to create a vegan Thousand Island, and I personally like the clean flavor of using only one “chunky” addition.

Whatever you add to your rendition of this recipe, you’ll likely think it has a “familiar” taste. This may be because Thousand Island Dressing, or some version of it, is often the “secret sauce” used by restaurants.
articleSummaryHTML: A thousand standing ovations for this vegan thousand island dressing! Here is where dressing gets real!
seoTitle: Best Vegan Thousand Island Salad Dressing | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: A thousand standing ovations for this vegan thousand island dressing! Here is where dressing gets real! Check out Sunwarrior's best recipe for the occasion.
ingredients:
s:685:"

 

  • 1 cup cashews, soaked
  • 1 cup water
  • 1/2 cup orange juice
  • 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 1/4 cup tomato paste
  • 2 teaspoons maple syrup or liquid sweetener
  • 2 teaspoons tamari
  • 2 teaspoons onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
  • 1/4 cup chopped pickles, preferably homemade
";
directions: Drain cashews and place in blender. Add all remaining ingredients except pickles. Blend until smooth. Stir in chopped pickles. Stored in a sealed container, Thousand Island dressing will keep in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Makes 3 cups of dressing.

articleBodyHTML:
If you’re looking for a sweet fruit packed with nutrients and flavor, you are looking for papaya! And a papaya boat will float you to healthy happiness.

What better way to start your morning off than with this awesome papaya boat. Breakfast on the go doesn’t have to look like that mundane bowl of oatmeal. This papaya boat takes all of two minutes to make. You can store the other half in the fridge for the following morning, and it will be as fresh as when you cut it. We used coconut yogurt in the center of this papaya boat, but you can use any nondairy yogurt of choice. We topped it with an assortment of fruit and seeds to add more nutrients.

But even without nutrient-dense toppings, this deliciously sweet and buttery fruit is packed with nutrients. The best part about eating papaya first thing in the morning is that it contains a digestive enzyme called papain along with fiber which will leave your stomach in tip top shape. As well as being great for digestive problems, papayas are packed with vitamins and minerals. Papaya, although a tropical fruit, is relatively low in sugar and is low calorie. We used coconut yogurt in this recipe, but you can also use a variety of nondairy yogurts such as soy or almond yogurt. This can be found in the health food isle at your local supermarket.

Papaya boats are so much fun to make because you can choose an assortment of toppings that you like. I try to use whatever is fresh and in season to maximize the nutrients that I’m consuming. You can add granola, nuts, seeds, and fruit. You can even swap out the yogurt for nondairy sorbet and make a delicious dessert on hot days. Make your papaya your own Picasso and paint a beautiful masterpiece of fruits!
articleSummaryHTML: If you’re looking for a sweet fruit packed with nutrients and flavor, you are looking for papaya! And a papaya boat will float you to healthy happiness.
seoTitle: Papaya Boat | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: If you’re looking for a sweet fruit packed with nutrients and flavor, you are looking for papaya! And a papaya boat will float you to healthy happiness.
ingredients:
s:248:"
  • 1 ripe papaya
  • 1 cup nondairy yogurt of choice
  • Any additional toppings
  • Optional: Drizzle maple syrup on top
";
directions:
1.) Slice papaya into half, scoop out seeds

2.) Fill with yogurt and desired toppings

articleBodyHTML:
Win your entire family over with these fabulous, crusted, caramel colored, roasted gems or sweet garlic tofu nuggets. This is where dinner gets amazing.

Tofu on its own is pretty much rather bland, yet its sponge-like texture makes it perfect for absorbing flavors so be sure to season or marinate as you’ll do in this recipe. Blending a few tried and true ingredient combos and paying salute to the popular affliction for sour, sweet, savory and spicy combos (with a touch of astringency for intrigue) make for a sure-fire flavor enhancing winner. This is one of those recipes you keep close on hand until you know it by heart. Then you can shift it up with the addition of various spices such as curry powder, garam masala, Thai curry, etc. Now, get that marinade going and make great use of the oven being on and roast some veggies to round out your meal. See the tips below.
articleSummaryHTML: Win your entire family over with these fabulous, crusted, caramel colored, roasted gems or sweet garlic tofu nuggets. This is where dinner gets amazing.
seoTitle: Sweet Garlic Tofu Nuggets | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Win your entire family over with these fabulous, crusted, caramel colored, roasted gems or sweet garlic tofu nuggets. This is where dinner gets amazing.
ingredients:
s:1556:"

Tofu Nuggets

  • 1 pound pkg organic tofu, firm. Cut into 1-inch slices, wrap in a cotton tea towel and set aside.
  • 2–3 tablespoons coconut nectar
  • 3 tablespoons coconut amino's or Tamari, low sodium, gluten free version
  • 1 heaping tablespoon Dijon
  • 1 teaspoon fresh garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon chili sauce such as sriracha or 1 teaspoon fresh chili pepper, minced
  • Freshly ground pepper, as desired
  • ¼–½ cup sesame seeds, toasted
  • Approx. 12 metal or wooden skewers (soaked if wooden)

SWEET N SPICY GINGER DRIZZLE

  • 2 tablespoons coconut nectar or organic coconut sugar, to taste
  • 3 tablespoons coconut amino's or tamari, gluten free version
  • 1 teaspoon spicy chili sauce, or to taste
  • 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced
  • Juice from 1 freshly squeezed orange, zested, reserve zest for garnish
  • Freshly ground pepper, if desired

GARNISH: Fresh herbs of your choice from chives to cilantro and or orange zest

";
directions:
Tofu Nuggets

1. Combine all the sauce ingredients, leaving sesame seeds aside. Remove tofu from the tea towel, cut into 1-inch cubes and toss in marinade. Cover and chill 2–24 hours.

2. When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 350F, dredge each cube with the sesame seeds and skewer on presoaked bamboo sticks. Arrange on a rack, placed over a parchment covered baking sheet and bake for in the preheated oven approx. 20–25 minutes or until bronzed and firm. While baking, prepare the spicy drizzle.

3. When ready to enjoy, serve alongside sautéed or roasted veggies (that you baked at the same time such as cauliflower, broccoli, Brussels sprouts, asparagus, parsnips, Jerusalem artichokes or celery root, etc.). Drizzle with the sweet and spicy ginger sauce.

SWEET N SPICY GINGER DRIZZLE

1. Combine all ingredients and heat gently to melt sugar (if using) and mellow flavors. Set aside. Drizzle over the tofu kabobs and top with the orange zest and herbs.

TERI’S TIP: For a fun family meal, roasted sweet potato, parsnip, carrot or zucchini fingers are a perfect pair. Just be sure to include some non-starchy veggies such as leafy greens or steamed green beans.

articleBodyHTML:
These graham crackers are so good, you’ll want to tell the world, but you’ll be talking with your mouth full because these are too good to stop eating!

Camping is a favorite activity to do over the summer for many people. It is much cooler in the mountains, and it’s just fun. Sitting around the fire when camping is a favorite pastime of mine. One of the best things to do by a fire is roast marshmallows and make s’mores!

Finding healthy graham crackers can be a challenge, and making graham crackers can be a daunting task. But it doesn’t have to be! It really is quite simple. You simply mix all ingredients together, roll out, and bake. They really are delicious, a favorite for all, and they will last a long time.

Whole wheat flour is the main ingredient. I ground the whole wheat myself and use that. I was a little worried it would make a very crumbly cracker, but it doesn’t. They are so tasty, I had a hard time keeping the kids’ fingers (and mine) off of them! Whole wheat is an excellent source of fiber and protein.

The crackers are also made with coconut oil which is good for your cardiovascular health as well. They provide good fats that can help lower your LDL (bad cholesterol) and higher your HDL (good cholesterol).

So what are you waiting for? Schedule that camping trip and make those delicious s’mores now!
articleSummaryHTML: These graham crackers are so good, you’ll want to tell the world, but you’ll be talking with your mouth full because these are too good to stop eating!
seoTitle: Vegan Homemade Graham Crackers | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: These graham crackers are so good, you’ll want to tell the world, but you’ll be talking with your mouth full because these are too good to stop eating!
ingredients:
s:992:"

Graham Cracker

  • 3 cups whole wheat flour
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • ¾ teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon baking soda
  • 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 3 tablespoons brown rice syrup
  • 1 tablespoon molasses
  • 3 tablespoons lemon or orange juice
  • ¾ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ¾ cup coconut oil
  • ½ to ⅔ cup water

Cinnamon Sugar Coating

  • 2 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
";
directions:
Mix all dry ingredient together (flour through salt) for the graham crackers in mixer bowl. Then add all the ingredients from the brown rice syrup through the oil to the dry mixture and mix well. Add enough water just to make the dough come together. Refrigerate for about ½ hour.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Then roll out the dough until about 1/16 or ⅛ inch thick. Cut into squares or desired shape and place on cookie sheet. Prick each shape with a fork, if desired. Mix coconut sugar and ground cinnamon together, and sprinkle on top. Bake until edges start to darken, about 20 mins, but it does depend on the size and how thick you make the cracker. It could be longer or shorter time.

Let cool and store in an airtight until use.

articleBodyHTML:
For a taste of childhood with all the health benefits of on-the-go protein, these vegan Pop Tarts are your path to breakfast perfection.

Oh, how life is sweet again. Growing up, it was all about quick, easy breakfasts such as cereal and Pop Tarts. And, as an adult, I felt a nostalgic craving to return to my childhood treat. Going to the grocery store and picking up a box of Pop Tarts, I was in shock over all the added sugars and ingredients in one of my favorite childhood breakfasts. This discovery set me on a mission to create not only a Pop Tart that was vegan but one that also had health benefits. After countless trial and error experiences, I landed on a perfect ratio of ingredients to make these delightful treats. This recipe is gluten free, grain free, and vegan. It’s very simple to make, and your kids will absolutely love it. You can rest assured that your little ones will be well nourished with these treats.

We use a mix of both coconut oil and almond butter which have incredible health benefits. Almond butter will increase your iron levels and give you a boost of calcium where coconut oil is anti-viral and anti-inflammatory—both incredibly useful if you’re feeling under the weather or have had a hard workout!

What makes this recipe so great is that the dough doesn’t need to be leavened or watched for hours. This recipe is a one bowl recipe that comes together in less than five minutes. I used a store-bought jam from my local health food store without added sugars, but you can make your own very easily as well. We didn’t add any sugar to the recipe, but, if you want, add a touch of stevia to the dough. For fun flavor variations, you can use Classic Plus chocolate or Classic Plus vanilla protein instead of the natural flavors.
articleSummaryHTML: For a taste of childhood with all the health benefits of on-the-go protein, these vegan Pop Tarts are your path to breakfast perfection.
seoTitle: Best Vegan Pop Tarts Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For a taste of childhood with all the health benefits of on-the-go protein, these vegan Pop Tarts are your path to breakfast perfection.
ingredients:
s:575:"

Dough

  • ½ cup almond flour
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Natural protein
  • ¼ teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 2 tablespoons water

Filling

  • 1 jar organic strawberry jam

Glaze

  • ½ cup almond butter
  • 2 tablespoon coconut oil, melted
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
  2. In a medium bowl combine all crust ingredients together
  3. Roll out dough and cut into 4 x 4 squares
  4. Use 1 tablespoon of jam in the center of one square. Place a second square on top and press edges with a fork
  5. Bake for 12 minutes
  6. Remove from oven and let cool
  7. Combine almond butter and melted coconut oil. Spread on top of cooled pop tarts and sprinkle with sprinkles if desired

articleTitle: Grilled Pineapple Salad with Coconut and Lime Dressing
articleBodyHTML:
Put the lime in the coconut with this grilled pineapple salad all dressed up with a coconut and lime dressing! Bite into the refreshing!

This refreshing salad is great for hot summer days when all you want is a light meal that doesn’t require too much preparation. There is a perfect balance of sweetness from the pineapple and spice from harissa finished with a creamy coconut dressing. This salad is not only light and delicious but also rich in nutrients and vitamins. It’s a must for this summer!
articleSummaryHTML: Put the lime in the coconut with this grilled pineapple salad all dressed up with a coconut and lime dressing! Bite into the refreshing!
seoTitle: Grilled Pineapple Salad with Coconut & Lime Dressing
seoDescription: Put the lime in the coconut with this grilled pineapple salad all dressed up with a coconut and lime dressing! Bite into the refreshing!
recipeName: Grilled Pineapple Salad with Coconut and Lime Dressing
ingredients:
s:857:"

For the Salad

  • 1 medium pineapple
  • 4 handfuls mix leaf salad
  • 4 handfuls fresh spinach
  • 1 red onion
  • 2 medium avocados
  • 1 can chickpeas, drained
  • ½ cucumber

For the Dressing

  • 4 tablespoons coconut milk
  • Juice squeezed from 1 lime
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 tablespoons whole grain mustard
  • Pinch of desiccated coconut
  • Drizzle of harissa 
";
directions:
Start making the salad by peeling the pineapple and cutting it into 16–20 long slices. Put a grill pan over medium heat (no need for oil) and wait 2–3 min until hot, then put the sliced pineapple on top and grill for about 3 min on each side. Take off the heat and set aside.

Prepare the rest of the ingredients; peel and slice the avocados, finely slice the onions, slice the cucumber and cut it into half-moons. Drain the chickpeas and set aside.

Prepare 4 serving plates and put one handful of mixed leaf salad and one handful of spinach on each plate. Divide the onions, avocado, cucumber, and chickpeas into four equal parts and put a portion of each on each plate.

Make the dressing by mixing coconut oil with lime juice, mustard, and salt. Drizzle it on top of the salad. Then sprinkle a pinch of desiccated coconut on top of each plate and finish with a drizzle of harissa.

Need an immune boost for a hungry belly? This antioxidant-rich superfood smoothie will give your body a dose of nutrients to keep you healthy, strong, and satiated!

Blueberries and Acai are rich with antioxidants and vitamins like vitamin C, vitamin K, manganese, and other minerals for a healthy immune system. While avocado and nut milks offer brain-healthy fats to keep you fuller, longer. Avocados can also help your body absorb the nutrients from other plant-food sources (like the ones in this recipe) like fat-soluble vitamins and antioxidants.

Papaya seeds, while generally thrown away, are actually great for digestion and for cleansing the body of parasites. Stevia is a great no-calorie sweetener. If the facts don’t have you convinced, the flavor will! Sip on this refreshing smoothie anytime you need a boost for the spirit, mind, and belly.

seoDescription: Need an immune boost for a hungry belly? Our antioxidant-rich superfood smoothie will give your body nutrients to keep you healthy, strong, & satiated!
ingredients:
s:406:"
  • ½ avocado
  • 1 teaspoon papaya seeds
  • ½ cup frozen organic blueberries
  • 1 teaspoon acai powder
  • 1 teaspoon stevia or sweetener of your choice
  • 1 cup almond milk or cashew milk
";
directions: Place all ingredients in a high-powered blender. Blend on high until all ingredients are well combined. The avocado and frozen blueberries will thicken up! If you prefer a drink-through-a-straw shake, simply add more milk to reach a desired consistency.

articleTitle: Back to School Burgers: Vegan Style!
articleBodyHTML:
These easy vegan gluten free bean burgers make for a great lunch or even a dinner for when you’re in a hurry juggling life and school. Because dinner should be tasty, not stressful!

Now that is time for back to school, it's always a good idea to stock up on as many healthy lunch ideas as possible for busy school or work days! This delicious recipe takes about 30 minutes to prep and cook and will leave you with left overs for the following day! Food prep is key when sticking to your healthy meal plan is a goal even during hectic days. Not only is this recipe tasty, cruelty-free, low fat, and full of vitamins and minerals, it is also super simple! Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: These easy vegan gluten free bean burgers make for a great lunch or even a dinner for when you’re in a hurry juggling life and school. Because dinner should be tasty, not stressful!
seoTitle: Back to School Burgers: Vegan Style! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: These easy vegan gluten free bean burgers make for a great lunch or even a dinner for when you’re in a hurry juggling life and school.
recipeName: Back to School Burgers: Vegan style!
ingredients:
s:718:"
  • 6 large portabella mushrooms (or 6 gluten free buns)
  • ¼ cup canned organic corn
  • 1 cup organic gluten free oats
  • 1 cup brown rice
  • 1 can kidney beans
  • 1 tablespoon paprika
  • 1 dash of sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon onion powder
  • 1 dash of pepper
  • 1 can Engine 2 classic tomato basil pasta sauce
  • ketchup, mustard, or vegan cheese of choice for topping (if desired)
";
directions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the following: oats, brown rice, kidney beans, paprika, sea salt, onion powder, pepper, Engine 2 Classic Tomato Basil Pasta Sauce, ketchup, and organic corn.
  2. Mash together until the mixture resembles ground beef and has a hamburger "meaty" like texture.
  3. Divide the mixture into 6 patties.
  4. Roll into 6 medium size balls with your hand.
  5. Place the burger balls onto foil or a nonstick cooking sheet and smash down gently to flatten.
  6. Grill for 25 minutes
  7. Once the burgers are cooked, take the Portabella mushrooms and cut to use as a "bun" You may use gluten-free, organic, whole grain buns if desired.
  8. Top with mustard, ketchup, or vegan cheese if desired!
  9. Enjoy!
  10. *Store extra patties in the fridge for other lunches or dinners!

articleBodyHTML:
Mixing up the typical pasta dinner with something bright, filling, and fabulous with this garlic lemon orzo with broccoli!

Let’s be honest; almost everyone has pasta at least once a week. And that’s okay! No judgment here, but it doesn’t have to be spaghetti or penne. I like to explore the different pasta variations, and found that orzo is a great option! I love that it’s somewhat the shape of rice, so it’s easy to mix with vegetables and pass off as a side instead of the main meal. I also love how great it takes on whatever flavor you add to it – like all pasta!

I love this recipe! Not only is it so incredibly simple both in preparation and flavor, but it tastes amazing! Sometimes, simple is just better. This recipe is great with a tomato basil salad on the side, some Chik’n patties, or even just a big bowl of it on its own. It’s filling, light, and oh so delicious. Not to mention, it tastes great hot, warm, or cold. You can customize this recipe to add more garlic, more lemon, or even give it a pinch of red pepper flakes for some heat! I think I’ll be bringing this to summer picnics and barbeques for years to come.
articleSummaryHTML: Mixing up the typical pasta dinner with something bright, filling, and fabulous with this garlic lemon orzo with broccoli!
seoTitle: Garlic Lemon Orzo with Broccoli | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Mixing up the typical pasta dinner with something bright, filling, and fabulous with this garlic lemon orzo with broccoli!
ingredients:
s:361:"
  • 4 tablespoons olive oil
  • 5 garlic cloves, crushed
  • Juice and zest of 1 lemon
  • 1 pound orzo
  • 2 bags (2 pounds) frozen or fresh broccoli
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Cook orzo according to package directions. Drain and set aside
  2. In a small saucepan, add the olive oil and garlic and bring to a quick simmer. Then turn the heat off. Add the lemon zest and lemon juice.
  3. Place orzo in a large bowl and combine with the olive oil mixture. Mix well to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Steam the broccoli (or microwave) until warm and tender. Mix in with the orzo and serve!

articleBodyHTML:
Before summer’s gone, indulge in the best summer has to offer: snow cones! Fruity and refreshing and so, so good!

Snow cones were always a rite of passage into summer during my childhood. Every year, the anticipation for ice cold snow cones filled me with excitement.
