Add leeks and carrots to the pan and cook for 3 min stirring occasionally, then add broccoli, snap peas, chili, and pepper and cook for 3 more min. You want all the vegetables to be covered with the sauce and soften a bit, but be careful not to overcook them.

Add the noodles and bean sprouts to the pan and mix gently with the vegetables and season to taste with salt.

Place the Pad Thai in serving bowls and give a generous squeeze of lime and sprinkle with peanuts.

articleTitle: THE Pumpkin Protein Smoothie You’ll Make All Pumpkin-Season Long!
articleBodyHTML:
Pumpkin season is here! And to celebrate, we have a pumpkin protein smoothie that will probably become your go-to smoothie recipe for the rest of the season!

As soon as pumpkin season hits, my pantry practically morphs into a canned pumpkin puree warehouse! Since pumpkin puree is so comforting, so delicious, and so darn good for you, fitting it into everything I eat from October to December is non-negotiable!

One of my favorite things to do with pumpkin (and one of the easiest) is to blend it into smoothies! Its creamy texture just screams “blend me into a smoothie!” and its nutritional panel (being so high in fiber, potassium, beta-carotene, vitamin A, and vitamin C plus so low in fat and calories), well, also screams “blend me into a smoothie!”

So, here’s how I blend it into a smoothie to make the pumpkin smoothie I can guarantee will become THE pumpkin protein smoothie you’ll make all pumpkin-season long!
articleSummaryHTML: Pumpkin season is here! And to celebrate, we have a pumpkin protein smoothie that will probably become your go-to smoothie recipe for the rest of the season!
seoTitle: Pumpkin Protein Smoothie You’ll Make All Pumpkin-Season!
seoDescription: Pumpkin season is here! And to celebrate, we have a pumpkin protein smoothie that will probably become your go-to smoothie recipe for the rest of the season!
ingredients:
s:686:"
  • ⅓ cup pumpkin puree
  • ¾ cup almond milk
  • 1 tablespoon almond butter
  • ½–1 whole frozen ripe banana
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
  • 2 tablespoons–1 scoop vanilla Sunwarrior Classic protein
  • sweetener (maple syrup, stevia - to taste)
  • couple of ice cubes
";
directions: BLEND for a PUMPKIN SMOOTHIE PARTY IN YOUR MOUTH!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your pesto on with garden fresh basil flavor for a dinner that wows!

Most everyone loves the familiar scent of fresh basil. It’s instantly recognizable and likely triggers visions of a steaming plate of fresh, home-made pasta or perhaps a wood-oven pizza. Making your own pesto is so easy and in my view an essential to have on hand. This take on the endless versions that can be made is dairy-free leaving the option to add the proverbial Parmesan at the eater’s whim. I love it as is and suggest you make a large batch and freeze in small containers of a few ounces each or in an ice cube tray, so you have a cache on hand. Even just a little pesto adds a wallop of flavor and can elevate your meal to a wow status. That’s how I love to eat: wowed!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your pesto on with garden fresh basil flavor for a dinner that wows!
seoTitle: Garden Fresh Basil Pesto | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get your pesto on with garden fresh basil flavor for a dinner that wows!
ingredients:
s:739:"
  • 4 cups basil leaves, packed
  • 2–3 cloves garlic, roughly chopped
  • ½ cup organic walnuts, lightly toasted
  • 1/3 cup walnut oil
  • 1/3 cup organic robust olive oil plus extra as needed
  • 1 small avocado, halved and peeled
  • 1–2 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt, or to taste
  • ¼–½ teaspoon freshly ground pepper, to taste
  • Generous dash cayenne pepper, to taste
";
directions:
1. Pulse basil, garlic, walnuts, sea salt, and pepper in a high-speed blender using the tamper until well blended.

2. Blend in the lemon and avocado then slowly drizzle in oils, adding more if needed, until texture is as desired. Season to taste!

Teri’s Tips:

Add 2 tablespoons hemp seeds for additional omega 3 fatty acids

articleBodyHTML:
Is your salad starting to feel boring? Time to get dressed to go out with this amazing Basil N Orange Vinaigrette! Salad has never looked or tasted better!

Raised very frugally I am always mindful to avoid waste, and this recipe came as a perfect way to use up the few tablespoons of pesto at the bottom of my blender that was difficult to access when I made my own homemade pesto. I found that the flavor came out perfect for an amazing basil and orange vinaigrette!
articleSummaryHTML: Is your salad starting to feel boring? Time to get dressed to go out with this amazing Basil N Orange Vinaigrette! Salad has never looked or tasted better!
seoTitle: Basil N Orange Vinaigrette | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Is your salad starting to feel boring? Time to get dressed to go out with this amazing Basil N Orange Vinaigrette! Salad has never looked or tasted better!
ingredients:
s:456:"
  • 3 tablespoons pesto
  • 1 organic orange zested and juiced
  • ½ clove garlic
  • Pinch sea salt and black pepper
  • 1–3 teaspoons white wine vinegar
  • Splash of olive oil, as needed
";
directions:
• If you’re making your own pesto, then follow the instructions at the above link and remove most of the pesto from the blender (you will want to leave a few tablespoons). If you are using an already-made pesto, then measure all ingredients into the blender.
  • Blend to a creamy dressing, adding a splash of olive oil, tasting and adjusting seasonings and consistency as desired.
  • Drizzle over your favorite salad!

TERI’S TIPS:

Mix and match the herbs, greens if desired. A little arugula or watercress adds a nice peppery kick.

Using both parsley and basil, adding a teaspoon or so of Spanish paprika and splash of additional oil gives this a playful Spanish flavor. A few olives add a yum factor as well.

These recipes can be made in a processor, yet it can be a little precarious making the dressing due to the additional liquid so be careful.

If you have orange infused olive oil on hand, it's heavenly.

articleBodyHTML:
Vegans can eat sugar cookies, too! These vegan sugar cookies taste like holidays and childhood were meant to taste while being a much healthier option to the traditional sugar cookie!

Sugar cookies are a childhood staple. Kids love to decorate them and especially love eating them. You can make them into any shape you want, and they are ready for any holiday. A lot of the time the frosting is the best part for kids, but it is usually loaded with lots of refined sugar and flour and bad-for-you fats. But no more! The frosting and cookies are made with healthy whole wheat and coconut cream. The great thing is that these cookies are delicious!

The cookies are made from coconut oil. It will have a coconut taste if you use unrefined raw virgin coconut oil (which is not a bad thing in my book). But if you don’t like the taste of coconut, use the refined coconut oil. Coconut oil is high in natural saturated fats. Saturated fats are an essential part of your diet because they help your healthy cholesterol (HDL) increase. The cookies are also made with a whole wheat flour which has fiber and B vitamins.

The frosting is made from coconut cream. The coconut cream helps the frosting to be creamy and smooth without adding butter. Coconut cream does have fat, but it is considered the healthy fat that your body needs.

So, give your child some great memories and make some sugar cookies with them. Your kid will thank you, and you’ll be happy, too!
articleSummaryHTML: Vegans can eat sugar cookies, too! These vegan sugar cookies taste like holidays and childhood were meant to taste while being a much healthier option to the traditional sugar cookie!
seoTitle: How to Make Vegan Sugar Cookies | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Vegans can eat sugar cookies, too! These vegan sugar cookies taste like holidays and childhood were meant to taste while being a much healthier option.
ingredients:
s:834:"

Vegan Sugar Cookies

  • 1/3 cup coconut oil
  • 1/3 cup coconut sugar
  • 1 flax egg*
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 tablespoon + 1 teaspoon almond milk
  • 1 ½ cups whole wheat pastry flour
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon salt

Vegan Frosting

  • 14 oz. coconut cream (chilled in fridge for 24 hours)
  • ¼ to ¾ cup coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
For Cookies

Mix coconut oil and sugar together in bowl. Add flax egg, vanilla, and almond milk, and mix well. Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in separate bowl. Add to sugar mixture and mix until combined. Add more almond milk if needed. You want the dough to stick together but not be sticky.

Roll dough out between two pieces of parchment paper to about ¼ in thickness. Keep dough between parchment paper and place on cookie sheet and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.

When ready to bake, remove cookie dough from fridge and cut desired shape. Dough doesn’t reroll well, so cut shapes closely together. Bake in preheated 400-degree oven for about 6 mins or until edges are light golden brown. Once baked, let cool on cookie sheet. Frost as desired.

For Frosting

Chill coconut milk in fridge for at least 24 hours. Remove from fridge and do not shake. Open can or carton and scoop our cream on top and put in mixing bowl. Reserve remaining coconut milk for another use.

Beat cream for 30 seconds until creamy. Add optional vanilla and coconut sugar. Beat an additional minute or until it thickens. Add more sugar if desired. Decorate cookies as desired.

*Flax egg is 1 tablespoon ground flax seed plus 2 ½ tablespoons water. Let stand for 5 minutes.

articleTitle: Halloween Bean and Guacamole Chips and Dip
articleBodyHTML:
For a bean and guacamole dip that kids will love so much that it’s scary, this Halloween cemetery is sure to be a hit!

Is there anything creepier than a graveyard at Halloween? I don't think so. Our imaginations can run away with us sometimes and really scare us. But these graveyard cups won’t scare you! They are yummy and fun. These cups are filled with only healthy food and will fill those little tummies before they go have fun on Halloween. You can fill them with virtually anything that goes together. They also can be made in either small cups or a large bowl to benefit a crowd.

The black beans have fiber, potassium, folate and vitamin B6. They also help lower your cholesterol and decrease your risk of heart disease. Avocados have healthy fats, folate, and Vitamin K essential to our overall health. The olives also have healthy fat and contain high doses of vitamin E, iron, and copper.

Be that fun parent, and serve your kids fun and delicious food!
articleSummaryHTML: For a bean and guacamole dip that kids will love so much that it’s scary, this Halloween cemetery is sure to be a hit!
seoTitle: Halloween Bean and Guacamole Chips and Dip | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: For a bean and guacamole dip that kids will love so much that it’s scary, this Halloween cemetery is sure to be a hit!
recipeName: Halloween Bean and Guacamole Chips and Dip
ingredients:
s:789:"
  • 2 uncooked tortillas
  • 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
  • 1 teaspoon canola oil
  • ¼ c onions, chopped
  • 1 teaspoon garlic
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • ½ to 1 teaspoon salt
  • Ground pepper
  • 1 can olives, chopped
  • 2 to 4 avocados
  • Salt
  • Ground pepper
  • Garlic salt
  • 2 limes, divided
";
directions:
Headstones

Take each tortilla and carve out tombstone shapes. Place on baking sheet and cook on low until crispy. Set aside. If desired, use an edible pen and spell out R-I-P.

Black Beans

Add oil to a pan on medium heat. Add onions and let cook until clear. Add garlic and cook until aromatic. Add beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Heat until beans are heated through. Add lime juice to taste. Turn off heat and either mash the beans in the pan or blend in food processor. If processing beans in food processor it might be necessary to add a tablespoon or so or water to loosen up the beans.

Guacamole

Peel, pit, and smash each avocado. Season with salt, garlic salt, and lime juice to taste.

To make cups, add black beans to bottom and then layer guacamole on top. Top with black olives and add tombstones. Serve with tortilla chips or more toasted tortillas.

articleBodyHTML:
Quick! Before warm weather is totally over, make a cold, refreshing treat: banana bonbons! And if you still eat them through the winter, it’s okay. We don’t blame you, and we won’t tell!

Does anything possibly say awesome treat more than bonbons? They’re easy to pop into your mouth when you stroll by the freezer, they’re fun to dive into while sitting by the pool, and they’re arguably even more fun to just say out loud: “bonbon!” Of course, traditional bonbons can make you feel like crap crap. Full of dairy and processed sugar, they don’t exactly shout “good health!”

But know what does? These banana bonbons. Also known (to me) as “ban bans.” These cuties are so simple to make, so healthy, so fun, and so impressive that you (and whoever's lucky enough to enjoy them with you) will be left smiling from ear to ear.

There’s really nothing more to say other than, yeah: these banana bonbons really are the bomb bomb.
articleSummaryHTML: Quick! Before warm weather is totally over, make a cold, refreshing treat: banana bonbons! And if you still eat them through the winter, it’s okay. We don’t blame you, and we won’t tell!
seoTitle: Banana Bonbons | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Quick! Before warm weather is totally over, make a cold, refreshing treat: banana bonbons! And if you still eat them through the winter, it’s okay.
ingredients:
s:226:"
  • vegan or dark chocolate chips
  • RIPE banana(s)

**note: a good ratio is about ½ cup chocolate chips to 1 large banana**

";
directions:
Peel your ripe banana(s) and cut it/them into bite-sized chunks. Place those on a wax-paper-lined pan, plate or Tupperware (whatever can fit into your freezer). Let the banana bites freeze for about an hour.

Right before you're going to take out the banana bites, melt your chocolate. You can do this in a microwave or on the stove using a double boiler.

Remove your bananas from the freezer and start coating them: one by one, stab each banana with a fork, coat it with the melted chocolate. Place each chunk back onto the wax paper.

Once all the bananas have turned to bons, place your tray back into the freezer for at least another 20 minutes.

ENJOY!!!

articleBodyHTML:
For a spooky dinner that doesn't scare the health out of you, this spider dip bread is just what Halloween ordered!

Holidays are coming. It’s time for parties and celebrations with delicious food. But who says it has to be unhealthy? It doesn’t have to be. You can make simple party foods that are delicious and healthy, like this bread spider. This bread spider can be used in any way that will benefit your celebration. You can shape it any way you desire. You could do a spider for Halloween or a Pilgrim hat for Thanksgiving or a Santa Claus for Christmas. The ideas are endless! You can put anything in the bowl. Hummus. Marinara sauce. Vegan ranch. You can even do a soup! So many options. The bread dough can be homemade or store bought.

I chose to use a whole wheat bread recipe. The whole wheat will help you feel fuller longer. It also has a lot of fiber and important B vitamins. Depending on what you put in the middle will also make it more beneficial for your health. Don’t wait long. Plan that party now!
articleSummaryHTML: For a spooky dinner that doesn't scare the health out of you, this spider dip bread is just what Halloween ordered!
seoTitle: Spider Dip Bread Halloween | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For a spooky dinner that doesn't scare the health out of you, this spider dip bread is just what Halloween ordered!
ingredients:
s:1048:"

Bread Dough

  • 40 oz. whole-wheat flour (about 7 to 8 cups)
  • 1 tablespoon yeast
  • ¼ cup vital wheat gluten
  • 1 cup whole oats
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice or vinegar
  • 3 ¼ cups very warm water
  • 1/3 cup olive oil
  • 1/3 cup liquid sweetener
  • 1 tablespoon salt

Spider Fixings

  • Desired dressing, hummus, or marinara sauce
  • 2 raisins
  • 2 oz. of vegan butter
  • Garlic salt
  • 2 greased cookie sheets
  • Large serving dish
  • Bowl for dressing/sauce
";
directions:
To Make Bread

In a large bowl, mix 2 ½ cups of wheat, yeast, wheat gluten, oats, and vinegar or lemon juice. Add warm water and mix well. Then add oil and liquid sweetener, and mix well again. Let it sit, covered, for 10 minutes.

After 10 minutes, add salt and mix. Then gradually add enough flour, half a cup at a time, to make a tacky dough. You may not need to use all the flour. Then knead the dough for 5 to 7 mins.

To Shape Spider:

Using half the dough, shape dough into a large abdomen for spider body and place on a greased cookie sheet. Then take about 3 oz. of dough and shape into the head. Place next to abdomen for the head.

To form legs, take about 2 oz. of dough and roll into about a 10-inch rope. Lay on another greased cookie sheet and curve the rope down to shape a leg. Repeat seven more times.

Melt vegan butter and brush over spider body and legs and sprinkle with garlic salt. Cover both and let rise until double.

Bake the abdomen at 375 degrees for about 20 mins or until internal temp reaches 170 degrees. Bake legs for about 12 mins or until golden brown.

Once the spider is cooled enough to work with, trace the bowl on the abdomen. Remove bread and set aside for another use. Place bowl in the middle and fill with desired dressing or sauce.

Dig out little holes to place legs. They can be either laid down like in the picture or placed up to look a little creepier. If desired, brush with more vegan butter. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Put on your sweater and fuzzy socks and bite into pumpkin with these no-bake pumpkin protein bites!

Need an easy seasonal recipe to whip up fast for the next party you’re attending? These no-bake pumpkin protein balls will leave everyone craving more. The best part of this recipe is that it is packed with healthy ingredients so you can be health conscious while also satisfying your sweet tooth. These are a great addition to your breakfast or the perfect way to add a sweet touch after dinner. In this recipe, there is no dairy, no sugar added and no flour. The flavor is savory, and the pumpkin mixed with pecans (with a touch of chocolate from the protein) gives the bites a moist consistency. One note: if the batter is too moist after using the food processor to grind everything together, add more cashews to slightly dry it out so that you can form the balls easier. Take advantage of the season of pumpkin in a healthy, feel-good way!
articleSummaryHTML: Put on your sweater and fuzzy socks and bite into pumpkin with these no-bake pumpkin protein bites!
seoTitle: No-Bake Pumpkin Protein Bites | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Put on your sweater and fuzzy socks and bite into pumpkin with these no-bake pumpkin protein bites!
ingredients:
s:1539:"
  • ½ cup pecans (a touch more is okay to give them a slightly nuttier taste)
  • 1 cup medium-sized dates (pitted)
  • 1/3 cup organic pumpkin puree (this should be measured exact)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein
  • ¼ cup shredded unsweetened coconut flakes
  • 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
  • 1 ½ teaspoon organic vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon Pink Himalayan sea salt
  • ¼ teaspoon nutmeg
";
directions:
1.Using a food processor, grind the pecans for 1–2 minutes until a fine texture is formed.

2. Combine all other ingredients and grind for a few minutes to form smooth batter (make sure large pieces of dates are not left behind: you may need to move the batter around with a spoon and then continue grinding to ensure this doesn’t happen).

3. Roll into bite-size balls (about 12–15 depending on size).

4. Store in refrigerator (and let cool/harden slightly for 30 minutes before eating any).

5. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Fall is here! Which means spice and everything nice! And we’ve got those warming spices ready with these mm-mazing apple spice pancakes. Let the flapjack fabulousness begin!

The flavors of cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin spice, and chai are all autumn favorites. Using spices that reflect upon a season can bring back happy memories linked with food. For this recipe, we decided to use cinnamon, nutmeg, and apple. Your kitchen will smell out of this world from all the aromas and spices in the air. Let’s kick off this season with some delicious flapjacks that are protein-packed and gluten-free.

This recipe uses gluten-free flour, but you can opt for regular flour or even buckwheat flour. Buckwheat flour will give a delicious nutty and dense flavor to the pancakes. These pancakes are heaven on a plate. They are thick, light and fluffy. The best types of pancakes are ones that fluff up to double their size. They are less dense and make an overall better pancake. This recipe comes together in no time. It takes all of five minutes to whip up and less than 10 minutes to cook.

To give an extra crunch to these pancakes, this recipe used freeze-dried apples. You can always opt to use fresh apples as it is the season to do so! We suggest using a Granny Smith apple. Simply dice up your apple, sprinkle some cinnamon, nutmeg, and a touch of coconut sugar, and you have the best apple topping in the world. The final and most important part of this recipe is to drizzle your maple syrup on top. Maple syrup is one of Nature’s wonders. Not only is maple syrup pure and contains no high fructose corn syrup, but it also boosts an incredible amount of nutrients such as calcium, potassium, and sodium.
articleSummaryHTML: Fall is here! Which means spice and everything nice! And we’ve got those warming spices ready with these mm-mazing apple spice pancakes. Let the flapjack fabulousness begin!
seoTitle: Apple Spice Protein Pancakes | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Fall is here! Which means spice and everything nice! And we’ve got those warming spices ready with these mm-mazing apple spice pancakes.
ingredients:
s:908:"
  • 1 cup gluten-free flour
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 1/3 cup applesauce, unsweetened
  • ½ tablespoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
  • ¼ teaspoon salt

Optional add-on:

  • Maple syrup
  • Freeze dried apples
  • Raw apples, chopped
  • Cinnamon
  • Coconut sugar
  • You can also add a scoop of illumin8 for added protein and vitamin awesome!
";
directions:
1. Combine all ingredients together in a small bowl. Whisk well and let sit for 10 minutes
  2. Great a pan over medium heat with coconut oil. Dollop spoonfuls of mixture onto the pan and cook until you see bubbles appear on the top of the pancakes. Flip over and cook for another two minutes
  3. Remove from heat and drizzle maple syrup and apples on top

articleTitle: Maple Pecan Roasted Butternut Squash with Cranberries
articleBodyHTML:
Get seasonal with pecans, butternut squash, and cranberries! This roasted butternut squash crusted with maple pecans and cranberries is the sort of fall food that you’ll fall for!

Butternut squash has a great versatile flavor! The sweetness of this specific squash is emphasized when combined with the cinnamon and coconut oil in the recipe, especially when paired with the natural sweetness of cranberries, and nutty flavor of pecans. This comfort food combination is great as a side dish or appetizer, but it can also be added to greens for a salad or added to quinoa or rice to make a delicious autumn bowl. I even added some of my leftovers to almond milk yogurt the following morning! You can also incorporate other varieties of root or winter veggies to the 1.5 lbs. directed. Some great additions or substitutes include sweet potatoes, pumpkin, acorn squash, parsnips, turnip, carrots, and beets. I have also made this recipe with a sweet potatoes mix, including Japanese sweet potatoes, Hannah sweet potatoes, Purple sweet potatoes, and Jewel sweet potatoes. Root vegetables are a great way to satisfy your “comfort food” cravings in the fall and winter months without having to feel guilty! Squash and other root veggies are great complex carbs with a variety of vitamins, and fiber to keep you full.
articleSummaryHTML: Get seasonal with pecans, butternut squash, and cranberries! This roasted butternut squash crusted with maple pecans and cranberries is the sort of fall food that you’ll fall for!
seoTitle: Maple Pecan Butternut Squash with Cranberries | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Get seasonal with pecans, butternut squash, and cranberries! This roasted butternut squash crusted with maple pecans and cranberries is the perfect fall food.
recipeName: Maple Pecan Roasted Butternut Squash with Cranberries
ingredients:
s:396:"
  • 1 ½ lbs. of cubed butternut squash (or root vegetable of choice)
  • 1 cup dried unsweetened cranberries
  • 1 cup pecans
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400F and grease a baking sheet with coconut oil.
  2. Peel, seed, and cube butternut squash. You can also find prepared cubed butternut squash at Whole Foods and other supermarkets.
  3. In a bowl, combine butternut squash with cranberries, pecans, maple syrup, coconut oil, and cinnamon. Mix ingredients well so that everything is evenly distributed.
  4. Spread ingredients on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes. I turned ingredients for an even roasting after 15 minutes.
  5. Remove, and garnish with any desired additional toppings!

articleBodyHTML:
For a to-go power snack packed full of flavor, these apple cinnamon bites are just what you need with apple and cinnamon that satisfy those fall flavor cravings!

This is the perfect snack to have on hand at home for in between meals or to pack for your kid’s lunch. They even work as a quick energizing breakfast on the go!
articleSummaryHTML: For a to-go power snack packed full of flavor, these apple cinnamon bites are just what you need with apple and cinnamon that satisfy those fall flavor cravings!
seoTitle: Apple Cinnamon Bites | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For a to-go power snack packed full of flavor, these apple cinnamon bites are just what you need with apple & cinnamon that satisfy those fall flavor cravings!
ingredients:
s:489:"
  • 1 1/3 cup dates
  • ½ cup hemp seeds
  • ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 2 tablespoons flax oil or coconut oil
  • ½ cup dried apple pieces, coarsely chopped
  • 2/3 cup oat flakes or coconut flakes
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter or sunflower seed butter
";
directions:
1. Place dates in food processor and blend until you form a thick paste. Place in large bowl.
  2. Stir in the hemp seeds, ground cinnamon, dried fruit, oil and almond butter, using a fork or your hands to combine, and add oats last.
  3. Form them into small balls by the teaspoon- full.
  4. Roll in crushed sunflower, hemp, or pumpkin seeds
  5. After rolling in sunflower or pumpkin seeds, place in a container and refrigerate or freeze – they taste great right from the freezer!
  6. Marni’s Delicious Knowledge:
  7. These bites are not only filled with long-lasting quality “energetic” ingredients like coconut flakes, dates, coconut oil, and apples, but they are also high in fiber and are gluten-free. They make a great snack to take to school and are also great for breakfast on the go!

articleBodyHTML:
Being vegan means never having to say you’re sorry because you still get to eat all the yummy things! Like this silken chocolate mousse!

Enjoy this amazing dairy free, decadent, and creamy finale to dinner. It’s easy to make, has no added sugars, and is a spectacular alternative to mousse made with dairy and sweetened with sugar. It is a grand breakfast paired with fresh fruits and a crunchy topping like cacao nibs. With all the wonderful antioxidant powers and mood-boosting properties of this coveted superfood, why not aim to add this to your diet more often! Did I mention it is calcium-rich as well? Sweet, savory, spicy, sassy—it’s all sensational, and you are sure to love this easy to make recipe.
articleSummaryHTML: Being vegan means never having to say you’re sorry because you still get to eat all the yummy things! Like this silken chocolate mousse!
seoTitle: Silken Chocolate Mousse | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Being vegan means never having to say you’re sorry because you still get to eat all the yummy things! Like this silken chocolate mousse!
ingredients:
s:843:"
  • 1 package organic silken tofu, approximately 350gr drained in a coffee filter lined mesh sieve 30 mins
  • ½ cup Medjool date jam (soaked dates pureed into a thick paste)
  • Approximately 1\3 cup non-dairy milk
  • ½ cup raw cocoa powder, sifted
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 oz. espresso coffee

Garnish

Raw Chocolate shavings or ground espresso beans, cacao nibs, Sunwarrior mocha, vanilla, or chocolate protein powder sprinkled over the mousse with a spice shaker or through a wire sieve.

";
directions:
1. In a high-speed power blender or food processor (the results won’t be as creamy if using a food processor), blend all the ingredients except the garnish until creamy and mousse-like. Scrape down sides of your blender or processor occasionally and add additional liquid as needed and blend once again.
  2. Once ready, divide into four stemmed glasses or small mason jars and chill until ready to serve. (At least two hours).
  3. Garnish as desired and finish with a drizzle of espresso as a gourmet-good finishing touch.

articleBodyHTML:
The best thing about the Halloween season is the chocolate. Okay and maybe ghosts. And the movie Hocus Pocus. But definitely chocolate, so get batty with these chocolate protein muffins!

Getting your chocolate on in a healthier way sometimes feels incredibly difficult, but it can be done, and it can be done fun! These muffins are definitely an indulgence, but it is a holiday! So, grab the kids, put on your favorite Halloween music, and get baking!
articleSummaryHTML: The best thing about the Halloween season is the chocolate. Okay and maybe ghosts. And the movie Hocus Pocus. But definitely chocolate, so get batty with these chocolate protein muffins!
seoTitle: Halloween Bats! Chocolate Protein Muffins | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: The best thing about the Halloween season is the chocolate. And the movie Hocus Pocus. But definitely chocolate, so get batty with chocolate protein muffins!
ingredients:
s:1702:"

Muffin

  • ¾ cup oat flour
  • ¾ cup rice flour
  • 1 cup coconut sugar
  • 1 cup dark chocolate chips (or cacao nibs) (set aside ¼ cup)
  • ½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 2 teaspoons baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 1 flax egg
  • 1 cup coconut cream
  • ½ cup coconut milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ cup melted coconut oil

Frosting

  • Coconut cream skimmed off two cans coconut milk that have been stored in fridge overnight
  • 3 tablespoons coconut nectar
  • 5 tablespoons cocoa powder

Bats

Sugar-free, vegan chocolate cookies (if you’d like to make your own, you need to check this recipe out!) eyes can be made using a bit of the coconut cream not mixed with cocoa powder and a bit of the cookie placed in the center. Or you can just use edible googly eyes.

";
directions:
Muffin

Line cupcake pan with cupcake liners (use the fun Halloween themed liners for a little extra spooky in your holiday)

Preheat oven to 400 degrees

Mix together all dry ingredients (flours, coconut sugar, ¾ dark cup chocolate chips, cocoa powder, cinnamon, Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein, and baking soda) in a large mixing bowl. Set aside.

In a separate mixing bowl, mix together all wet ingredients (flax egg, coconut cream, coconut milk, coconut oil, and vanilla); whisk together until mixture is smooth.

Pour wet ingredients into the larger bowl of dry ingredients and stir until batter is blended.

Spoon batter into muffin tin (about ¾ full).

Sprinkle with remaining chips and put into over

Bake for 18-22 minutes. (use a toothpick to test if they're done)

Frosting

Stir cocoa powder and coconut nectar into the coconut cream

Bats

Frost muffins with chocolate frosting. Break chocolate cookies in half so the edges are a little ragged and place in frosting horizontally so “wing tips” are close to each other. Place two circles of white frosting for eyes and place two little cookie bits in the center of the whites. Or buy edible googly eyes.

articleBodyHTML:
Pumpkin is the whole reason for the fall season. Celebrate crunchy leaves and crisp air with these vegan, flourless pumpkin spice muffins!

The taste of fall is something that never gets old. In my opinion, the flavors of the season don’t last long enough. One of my favorite morning treats to enjoy while sipping my green tea is a delicious muffin. The problem is, what’s available in most stores doesn’t meet my health requirements. I avoid dairy, gluten, and excess sugar which are three ingredients people often make muffins with. I discovered a recipe for flourless, vegan pumpkin spice muffins that will leave you wondering why those three ingredients would ever be needed again to satisfy your next muffin craving. The centers are moist, the base has just the right amount of crisp, and the pumpkin flavor mixed with the chocolate melts in your mouth. If you are planning a celebration and want to make these really festive, use the muffins as your cake and frost them however you please to make healthy cupcakes. This is a recipe I plan on making all throughout the season until Thanksgiving, and it is a great way to enjoy this tasty treat while feeling guilt-free!
articleSummaryHTML: Pumpkin is the whole reason for the fall season. Celebrate crunchy leaves and crisp air with these vegan, flourless pumpkin spice muffins!
seoTitle: Flourless & Vegan Pumpkin Spice Muffins | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Pumpkin is the whole reason for the fall season. Celebrate crunchy leaves and crisp air with these vegan, flourless pumpkin spice muffins!
ingredients:
s:704:"
  • ½ cup organic pumpkin
  • 1 cup creamy almond butter
  • 2 flax eggs (or regular eggs if you wanted a non-vegan substitute)
  • 1/3 cup organic maple syrup
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ teaspoon pink Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon organic vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon pumpkin spice
  • 1/3 cup Enjoy Life 69% cacao dark chocolate chips
  • (optional) 1 dash of cinnamon 
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
  2. Spray a 12-serving muffin pan with coconut oil or line with festive muffin liners.
  3. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl (except the chocolate chips) and mix until smooth batter forms.
  4. Gently mix in the chocolate chips.
  5. Scoop batter evenly into the 12 muffin slots.
  6. Bake for 15–20 minutes (depending on the oven) and test a muffin with fork to make sure the center is cooked through (note - sweet spot seems to be around 17–18 minutes)
  7. Remove from oven and let cool for 15 minutes before enjoying!

articleBodyHTML:
Spice up your life with the awesome of pumpkin! These pumpkin spice bars are everything your taste buds wanted for the fall season!

The ingredient list is short and sweet, just like these bars. There are always healthy substitutes for our favorite recipes during the holidays. We can swap out traditional ingredients for healthier and more nutrient-dense ones. These bars have a base made from almond meal, which is gluten-free and paleo. In comparison to regular wheat flour, these bars are easy to digest on your stomach and rich in protein. This recipe uses coconut sugar which is lower on the glycemic index than regular table sugar. Unlike white sugar, coconut sugar still retains trace elements such as zinc. It also contains inulin which can help lead to a healthy gut. I used a can of organic pumpkin puree, but you are free to roast and blend your own pumpkin.

These bars pack a punch of spices, which are key to burst with flavor awesomeness. This recipe keeps very well in the fridge so you can double them up and save them for later. These bars would be great with blueberry, peach or cherry puree on top. Happy Baking!
articleSummaryHTML: Spice up your life with the awesome of pumpkin! These pumpkin spice bars are everything your taste buds wanted for the fall season!
seoTitle: Pumpkin Spice Bars | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Spice up your life with the awesome of pumpkin! These pumpkin spice bars are everything your taste buds wanted for the fall season!
ingredients:
s:780:"

Crust

  • 2 cups almond flour
  • ½ cup pecans
  • 5 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1/3 cup melted coconut oil

Filling

  • 1 can (2 cups) pumpkin puree
  • 1/3 cup coconut sugar
  • ½ cup natural almond butter
  • ½ cup coconut milk
  • ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
  • ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1. Place all crust ingredients in a food processor and mix until well combined. If the mixture is too dry, add another 2/3 tablespoon melted coconut oil.

2. Preheat oven to 350 C

3. Firmly press crust ingredients into a square pan. Place in oven for 15 minutes.

4. In the meantime, combine all filling ingredients in a food processor or by hand.

5. Remove crust from oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Pour filling on top and bake for 45

Minutes.

6. Remove from oven and let cool for 1 hour. Place in fridge to set for 4 hours!

7. Top with coconut whip!

articleBodyHTML:
Yes, they’re cupcakes. Yes, they’re vegan, gluten free, grain free, high in protein, and totally amazing. Get your holiday on because pumpkin is in the house!

This is the most versatile recipe there is! I love these cupcakes (brownie bites, muffins, or whatever you prefer to call them…) year-round. This is a great base recipe I have toyed with for a while to make my own portable protein snack bites. They are guilt-free, delicious, and nutritious! When I feel like a need a protein boost or something to satisfy my sweet tooth, they are my go-to snack or dessert. For the fall, I added the pumpkin frosting, and they taste and look festive for the season!
articleSummaryHTML: Yes, they’re cupcakes. Yes, they’re vegan, gluten free, grain free, high in protein, and totally amazing. Get your holiday on because pumpkin is in the house!
seoTitle: Vegan Frosted Chocolate Pumpkin Cupcake | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Yes, they’re cupcakes. Yes, they’re vegan, gluten free, grain free, high in protein, and totally amazing. Get your holiday on because pumpkin is in the house!
ingredients:
s:1088:"

Cupcakes

  • 1 Scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus Chocolate protein
  • 1 cup pumpkin puree
  • ½ cup nut butter (Almond or cashew work best)
  • ¼ cup cacao powder
  • 2 tablespoons flaxseed
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Frosting

  • ½ cup pumpkin puree
  • ¼ cup unsweetened nut butter (I used Nuttzo)
  • ¼ cup coconut butter or manna
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease with coconut oil.
  2. In a blender or food processor, combine ingredients and mix until a smooth batter is formed.
  3. Evenly distribute the batter to muffin tins. Bake for roughly 15 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
  4. Combine all ingredients for frosting in a food processor or blender, and blend until smooth.
  5. Allow cupcakes to cool before frosting. Enjoy this guilt-free treat, and store extra for up to 2 weeks in the refrigerator!

Feel free to add a banana to sweeten, or substitute banana or avocado for the pumpkin. Adding chopped nuts, chocolate chips, or cacao nibs are also some great ideas!

articleBodyHTML:
Dress your pumpkin up this year with all the awesome that is coconut! Flavor, health benefits, and satisfaction in every bite!

With the colder weather quickly approaching, these bars are a perfect addition to any dessert menu! They are moist, flavorful, and a little is enough to satisfy any sweet tooth. Pumpkin contains fiber, potassium and vitamin C which all support heart health. This quick and easy dessert is aimed to please. Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: Dress your pumpkin up this year with all the awesome that is coconut! Flavor, health benefits, and satisfaction in every bite!
seoTitle: Coconut Pumpkin Bars Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Dress your pumpkin up this year with coconut! Flavor, health benefits, and satisfaction in every bite! Our coconut pumpkin bars recipe is the best.
ingredients:
s:1297:"

Pumpkin Bars

  • 1 cup pumpkin puree
  • ⅓ cup coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons liquid sweetener of your choice
  • 1 cup oat flour
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • ⅓ cup chopped walnuts
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ⅛ teaspoon nutmeg
  • baking spray

Frosting

  • 2 packets stevia
  • ¾ cup arrowroot
  • 1 scoop vanilla Sunwarrior Classic protein
  • 3 tablespoons vegan butter, softened
  • 2 tablespoons vegan cream cheese softened
  • 1 tablespoon coconut milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla

 

";
directions:
Pumpkin Bar Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees

2. Lightly spray 9x9 baking dish to prevent sticking.

3. In a medium mixing bowl, mix pumpkin puree, oil, agave with a hand blender until fully incorporated.

4. In another mixing bowl combine flour, sugar, walnuts, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Stir together.

5. Add dry ingredients to wet mixture ½ cup at a time until combined.

6. Pour mixture into baking dish, spread evenly and bake 20–25 minutes until golden brown on top. Cool and frost with cream cheese frosting. Cut and serve.

Frosting Directions

1. In a mixing bowl mix vegan butter and cream cheese until light and fluffy. Add coconut milk and vanilla. Mix. Slowly add everything else and mix until creamy.

2. Frost pumpkin bars when cooled.

articleBodyHTML:
Your family called. They’re starving. For those days when you need a healthy dinner in a hurry, this easy vegan chili is just what the busy mom ordered!

Having a career and a family makes dinnertime tough. You want to keep it healthy and tasty, but you come home from work exhausted and short of the time it usually takes to get your health on. On days like that, I turn to this chili recipe. It’s easy, healthy, and super tasty! Now you get dinner on the table and still get to keep the rest of the evening to unwind and hang out with the family. You’re welcome.
articleSummaryHTML: Your family called. They’re starving. For those days when you need a healthy dinner in a hurry, this easy vegan chili is just what the busy mom ordered!
seoTitle: The Best Vegan Winter Chili | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Your family called. They’re starving. For those days when you need a healthy dinner in a hurry, this easy vegan chili is just what the busy mom ordered!
ingredients:
s:425:"
  • Two cans kidney beans
  • One can black beans
  • ¼ cup ketchup
  • One can stewed tomatoes
  • Two tomatoes
  • One red bell pepper
  • One yellow bell pepper
  • One small onion
  • 3 teaspoons chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 2 teaspoons cumin
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
";
directions:
Place olive oil in a large pot. Dice the onion and place in pot with oil. Sauté over medium heat until onion is translucent.

Dice up all the bell peppers and place in pot with onion. Sauté both until the peppers are just barely softened.

Dice tomatoes and add to pot.

Add all other ingredients into pot and mix well. Bring pot to boil while stirring often to keep contents on the bottom from burning. Once chili is at a boil, reduce heat to a simmer and let the flavors simmer together for 20–30 minutes so they have time to fuse into each other.

Serve with your favorite toppings and with a side of vegan corn bread. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Pumpkin Chocolate Marble Bread; Vegan, Gluten Free
articleBodyHTML:
Pumpkin Bread is the perfect fall go-to recipe! This pumpkin bread base recipe is vegan, gluten-free, and paleo friendly. Bread just got awesome!

For those days that you want to impress friends and family, or just experiment in the kitchen, the chocolate marble swirl will do exactly that. Don’t worry – it isn’t nearly as complicated as it sounds! I was nervous about making a marble bread or adding a swirl at first, but it isn’t as complex as it seems since there technically is no right or wrong way. Just be sure to alternate the batter mixtures, and not to overmix it at the end, so there is still some contrast between the pumpkin and chocolate. Embrace your creativity and enjoy the wonderful fall aroma this will leave in your kitchen.
articleSummaryHTML: Pumpkin Bread is the perfect fall go-to recipe! This pumpkin bread base recipe is vegan, gluten-free, and paleo friendly. Bread just got awesome!
seoTitle: Vegan, Gluten Free Pumpkin Chocolate Marble Bread
seoDescription: Pumpkin Bread is the perfect fall go-to recipe! This pumpkin bread base recipe is vegan, gluten-free, and paleo friendly. Bread just got awesome!
recipeName: Pumpkin Chocolate Marble Bread; Vegan, Gluten Free
ingredients:
s:928:"
  • 1 cup of unsweetened pumpkin puree
  • 1 ripe banana
  • 2 tablespoons flaxseed meal
  • ½ cup plant-based milk
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 2 teaspoons cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon nutmeg
  • ½ teaspoon cloves
  • ½ teaspoon allspice
  • 1 cup almond flour/meal
  • ¼ cup coconut flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • ½ cup chocolate chunks
  • 1 teaspoon cacao powder
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F and grease or line an 8x4 pan
  2. In one bowl, combine flaxseed meal, spices, almond flour, coconut flour, and baking soda, then stir.
  3. In another bowl, combine pumpkin puree, mashed banana, milk, coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla extract, then stir well. Once mixed well, add the wet ingredients to the dry.
  4. Melt chocolate chunks in the microwave. Once melted, stir in fresh cacao powder until dissolved.
  5. Combine 1 cup of pumpkin mix with the melted chocolate and stir.
  6. Spoon pumpkin batter into baking pan. Continue alternating between pumpkin and chocolate batter until none is left. Use a knife to gently stir a few spirals on the top of the baking pan. 
  7. Put in the oven and bake for 50 minutes. Let it cool for 5–10 minutes before slicing. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Peanut Butter & Dark Chocolate Protein Cookies
articleBodyHTML:
Peanut butter chocolate and protein all combined into these magnificent cookies that will leave you sighing with satisfaction!

These cookies are extremely quick and easy to make. All you need to do is put all the ingredients together, form the cookies, and put them in the oven: job done! They make a delicious and healthy snack when you crave something sweet but want to stick to your diet. They are also a great post-workout treat because of their high protein content. Caution! They might disappear from the plate too quickly, but the good news is that you can make a new batch with no effort! You just have to try them!
articleSummaryHTML: Peanut butter chocolate and protein all combined into these magnificent cookies that will leave you sighing with satisfaction!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter & Dark Chocolate Protein Cookies | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Peanut butter chocolate and protein all combined into these magnificent cookies that will leave you sighing with satisfaction!
recipeName: Peanut Butter & Dark Chocolate Protein Cookies
ingredients:
s:601:"
  • ¼ cup ground almonds
  • ½ cup oat flour (or 3.5 ounces oat flakes)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 ounce chopped dark chocolate
  • A pinch of salt
";
directions:
1. Start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees Farenheit
  2. If you don’t have oat flour, you can easily make it by simply blending oat flakes in a food processor or high-speed blender until flour forms
  3. In a saucepan, melt the coconut oil and add peanut butter when the pan is still hot. Mix until smooth (this will allow easier forming on the dough)
  4. Put all the ingredients in a bowl and mix until dough forms. It should stick together, but it shouldn’t stick to your hands. If it’s too wet, add more oat flour. If it’s too dry, add more coconut oil
  5. Lay a baking tray with greaseproof paper. Form 10–12 flat round cookies and put them on the tray. Put the tray in the oven and bake for 12–15 min or until golden-brown. Take the tray out of the oven, let the cookies cool and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
For a pre-workout breakfast that is savory and filling, you’ve got to try this comforting, cheesy oatmeal!

Changing seasons triggers different cravings for most people. This is body wisdom at work. As the temperatures drop, the body’s innate need for warming, filling foods rises. And for me, colder weather begets longing for more comfort as well. This creation fills all those needs and is such a simple twist on a familiar classic. We now know less sugar is best, and in my home, savory oatmeal or savory grits trumps sweet cereals. They taste best when cooked low and slow and paired with a few other faves – namely avocado, cashews and nutritional yeast. I am sure my body bows in gratitude as I slowly savor what becomes a weekly selection in autumn and winter. You can make extra and either enjoy it a few days later or freeze for those mornings when you need a grab and go breakfast. It’s okay at room temp yet best served steamy. Get breakfast going with this pre-workout meal!
articleSummaryHTML: For a pre-workout breakfast that is savory and filling, you’ve got to try this comforting, cheesy oatmeal!
seoTitle: Pre-Workout Comforting Cheesy Breakfast Oatmeal | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: For a pre-workout breakfast that is savory and filling, you’ve got to try this comforting, cheesy oatmeal!
ingredients:
s:677:"
  • 2 cups organic steel cut or rolled oats, gluten-free. Or you can use quinoa or buckwheat groats
  • 3 cups cold water
  • 2 cups unsweetened cashew or almond milk
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt, to taste
  • ¼ cup nutritional yeast

Toppings

  • 1 avocado, diced
  • ¼ cup toasted, chopped cashews or sunflower seeds
  • Additional nutritional yeast, optional 
";
directions:
1. Measure oats, water, and sea salt in a large saucepan, cover and bring to a boil over medium-high heat then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, 5–8 minutes. Stir oats, add ½–2/3 cup non-dairy milk and reduce heat to low.
  2. Cook over low heat for another 15 minutes or so checking every 5 minutes or so and adding additional milk as needed. Patience reaps the creamiest version of oatmeal ever.
  3. Once the oatmeal is done, stir in the nutritional yeast along with an additional splash of milk if needed.
  4. Spoon into four warm bowls and top each with avocado, nutritional yeast, and cashews or sunflower seeds.

articleTitle: An Award-Winning Chocolate Coffee Protein Smoothie!
articleBodyHTML:
Coffee in a smoothie that tastes so good it can make a loyalist of the most ardent coffee hater and make the coffee lover wonder how they’d lived this long without it!

Coffee has never meant squat to me. It's not that I'm anti-caffeine, I’m just anti-the-taste-of-coffee. Maybe it stems from that time when I was eight and was playing in the snow in my backyard and got insanely thirsty so I ran into my house, grabbed a thermos and chugged like a frat brother and 2 minutes in realized that I wasn’t chugging water, I was chugging coffee and almost vomited?

Or maybe I'm just not a coffee person.

Either way, as of a few weeks ago, coffee DOES mean squat to me because I happened to win Sunwarrior’s cutthroat smoothie competition with, ironically, a chocolate coffee protein smoothie!

In the cutthroat smoothie competition at the Sunwarrior booth at The Natural Products Expo East, I was given a must-use secret ingredient and only 3 minutes to whip up a tasty smoothie, and when the secret ingredient was COLD BREW COFFEE, I almost called it quits. But I like to win. A lot. So, I channeled my inner barista and threw stuff in a blender and by a round of applause (my own included) won the competition!! It was a day I'll never forget.

And trust me: this is one coffee smoothie recipe you'll never want to forget either.
articleSummaryHTML: Coffee in a smoothie that tastes so good it can make a loyalist of the most ardent coffee hater and make the coffee lover wonder how they’d lived this long without it!
seoTitle: Award-Winning Chocolate Coffee Protein Smoothie!
seoDescription: You can't start your morning with this award-winning chocolate coffee protein smoothie! Try out our best recipe and enjoy the taste and flavor after!
recipeName: An Award-Winning Chocolate Coffee Protein Smoothie!
ingredients:
s:582:"

  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior's Warrior Blend chocolate protein!
  • 2 Medjool dates (pitted, of course!)
  • 1 teaspoon cacao nibs (optional but awesome)
  • 1 teaspoon maca powder (also optional but also awesome)
  • 1 handful ice
";
directions:
BLEND, BABY, BLEND!!

Video Showing How to Make It

articleBodyHTML:
Getting your morning started right can set a positive tone for your entire day by making you feel light, healthy, and in turn more productive. We suggest orange cilantro smoothie.

Working all day indoors can deprive our bodies of essential Vitamin D and Vitamin C, which can lead to many health issues, such as fatigue, skin disease, reduction in bone density and so on. This recipe is packed with essential vitamins and minerals that would boost your immune system, improves blood circulation, removes heavy metals and keeps you energized all day long.
articleSummaryHTML: Getting your morning started right can set a positive tone for your entire day by making you feel light, healthy, and in turn more productive. We suggest orange cilantro smoothie.
seoTitle: Orange Cilantro Smoothie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Getting your morning started right can set a positive tone for your entire day by making you feel light and healthy. We suggest orange cilantro smoothie.
ingredients:
s:410:"
  • ½ cup coconut milk
  • ½ cup orange juice, freshly squeezed
  • ¾ cup cilantro leaves
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla Classic
";
directions:
Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth.

Variations

You can also use parsley and other herbs to change the flavor of the drink.

Benefits

Orange

As we all know, oranges are well known for their Vitamin C content. They are packed with essential phytonutrients that include citrus flavanone which helps boost the immune system and helps your body fight against free radicals. They are also known to reduce cholesterol, reduce high blood pressure and contain a good amount of potassium which aids in heart function.

Cilantro

Cilantro is a widely used herb in Asian countries. Being well known for its anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties, it can do wonders for your health. Cilantro is packed with Vitamin A, C, and K along with minerals such as magnesium, potassium, zinc, and calcium. All these essential vitamins and minerals help to reduce cholesterol, remove heavy metals from the system, stimulate digestion, reduce swelling due to arthritis or during sports injury and keep your body free from free radicals.

Coconut Milk

Coconut milk adds a creamy texture to the recipe and is packed with anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory ingredients, making it one of Nature’s best gifts to reduce inflammation, remove any viral infection, lubricate joints, improve blood circulation and keep your immune system functioning at an optimal rate.

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
Celebrate the weekend with this blueberry cheesecake! Enjoy the flavor of vegan fabulous!

Did you know? Cashews are cholesterol free, an excellent source of copper, and a good source of phosphorus, magnesium, manganese, and zinc. Yep. So good!
articleSummaryHTML: Celebrate the weekend with this blueberry cheesecake! Enjoy the flavor of vegan fabulous!
seoTitle: Blueberry Cheesecake! Vegan and Fabulous! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Celebrate the weekend with a vegan, plant based blueberry cheesecake. You won't believe the taste and how easy it is to make.
ingredients:
s:1085:"

Crust Ingredients

  • 1½ cups raw or toasted hazelnuts
  • 1/3–½ cup Medjool dates, pitted
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, room temp
  • 1 pinch sea salt

Filling Ingredients

  • 3 cups raw cashews, soaked 4 hours or overnight, rinsed and drained
  • ½–¾ cup fresh lemon juice
  • ½ cup raw agave or maple syrup
  • 1/3–½ cup coconut oil, warmed to liquid in a hot water bath
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 3 cups blueberries, fresh or frozen defrosted
  • 2 tablespoons blueberry powder, optional
  • 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
";
directions:
1. Blend the crust ingredients together in a food processor until it starts to stick together starting with 1/3 cup of the dates. Add extra dates only if needed. Press the crust evenly into the bottom of a 9-inch, parchment lined, springform pan to about ¼ inch thickness. Set aside while you make the filling.

2. In a high-speed blender, blend together cashews, agave or maple syrup and the lemon juice until creamy and smooth, scraping down the sides occasionally if necessary. Add the coconut oil, vanilla, and sea salt and continue to blend until mixture is well combined. The consistency will be similar to a thick pudding.

3. Use a spatula and pour 2/3rds of the filling on top of the crust and smooth evenly, cover the pan with a lid or plastic and place in the freezer on a flat surface for approximately 2 hours or until semi-frozen.

4. With the remaining cashew blend, add the blueberries and blueberry powder if using and blend until smooth and creamy. Set aside until the first layer of the cheesecake is firm enough to let the blueberry layer stay on top.  At that time carefully pour or spoon over and smooth evenly. Cover the cheesecake and place in the freezer on a flat surface for an additional 2 hours or until frozen throughout.

5.  When ready to serve, remove the cheesecake from the pan and let stand at room temp for 5-10 mins then garnish as desired and slice into 12 pieces.  Return any leftovers to the freezer or fridge until you are ready to enjoy again.  This delish cake will keep up 2-4 weeks if well wrapped. 

Blueberry Compote

Cook the berries and cinnamon over medium heat in a small saucepan until boiling, reduce heat to simmer and continue to cook until the berries are thickened to coat the back of a spoon. Remove from heat; add a touch of agave, maple, or coconut syrup to sweeten to taste along with an oz. of amaretto or orange liqueur if desired.

Let cool and then puree ½ of the mixture if desired and chill.  When you are ready to serve your cake, spread the thickened coompote evenly over the entire cake, garnish as desired and relish in this delish dessert.

TERI’S TIPS:

Substitute almonds or pecans for hazelnuts if desired

The cake is best made in a high-speed power blender. If making this in a food processor, be patient and blend for a few minutes at a time until the cream is smooth and silky. The results won’t be as creamy, yet it’s still so good.

articleBodyHTML:
Pumpkin pie on Thanksgiving is such a cliché! This year, go with a vegan pumpkin cheesecake! And fine, it’s round like a pie and pumpkin like a pie and it’s cheesecake like a pie. Wait . . .

Thanksgiving is probably the biggest food day of the year. A whole day dedicated to eating (and being grateful. We do that, too.). Yum! The best day with friends and family to eat all the food you want, but all the food doesn’t have to be unhealthy. There are many options to serve on Thanksgiving that are filling but healthy like this pumpkin cheesecake!

The creaminess is made with soaked cashews. Once blended, they create a smooth and creamy texture to mimic other cheesecakes. The cashews are packed with vitamins like E, K, and B6, and also are antioxidants.

The pumpkin is a good source of beta-carotene. They also a loaded with vitamin A which helps your eyesight. Coconut oil is low in saturated fats and will help increase your HDL (good) cholesterol. It also is heart healthy and will lower the risk of heart disease.

So now you can make your (cheese)cake and eat it too!
articleSummaryHTML: Pumpkin pie on Thanksgiving is such a cliché! This year, go with a vegan pumpkin cheesecake! And fine, it’s round like a pie and pumpkin like a pie and it’s cheesecake like a pie. Wait . . .
seoTitle: Vegan Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Pumpkin pie on Thanksgiving is such a cliché! This year, go with a vegan pumpkin cheesecake! It's delicious and will go perfectly with your feast!
ingredients:
s:798:"

Crust

  • 1 ¼ cup vegan graham crackers, crushed
  • ¼ cup vegan butter, melted

Filling

  • 1 ½ cups raw cashews (soaked in very hot water for 1 hour)
  • 1 lemon, juiced (2 tablespoons)
  • ¼ cup coconut cream
  • 3 tablespoons melted coconut oil
  • ½ cup light agave nectar, plus more to taste
  • ½ cup pumpkin puree
  • Pinch sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
";
directions:
1. Soak your cashews in hot water for at least an hour.
  2. Mix graham crackers and butter in a bowl. Then press into an 8 or 9 in a springform pan. Refrigerate for at least an hour.
  3. When ready to make cheesecake, drain cashews and place in blender and add lemon juice, coconut cream, coconut oil, agave nectar, pumpkin, sea salt, and cinnamon. Mix until smooth about 2 to 3 minutes. Pour into prepared pan with crust. Freeze at least 4 hours.
  4. Once ready to serve, let cheesecake sit at room temperature for about 5 minutes. Serve with whipped coconut cream, if desired.

articleTitle: Grateful for Pecan Pie Paleo Bars
articleBodyHTML:
In a time of being grateful, make sure good food makes the list. These Thanksgiving pecan paleo bars definitely make the grateful-for-good-food list!

Baking can be the most rewarding accomplishment. After the fruits of your labor, you are left with a delicious masterpiece that should be eaten slowly and with love. It’s even better if the fruits of your labor are healthy and guilt-free. One of the best times of the year for baking and cooking is fall. Delicious flavors are upon us such as cardamom, cinnamon, nutmeg, and pecan pies! Pecan pie in my eyes is what dreams are made of. Rich, delicious and completely irresistible.

Thanksgiving is a time of year where we think of all of the things we are thankful for, family coming together and time spent cooking together as a unit. This recipe for pecan pie bars uses natural ingredients such as maple syrup, almond flour, and coconut flour. Coconut flour has grown in popularity over the years. As more and more people are becoming gluten intolerant, coconut flour has been a go-to. Unlike most flours which are low in nutrients, coconut flour is high in protein, healthy fats, and has a low glycemic index. It is also made of digestible carbohydrates making this flour easy for your stomach to digest and process. Coconut flour is also high in fiber which helps promote a healthy digestive tract.

This recipe is incredible with a salted caramel sauce that uses pitted dates, almond butter, coconut oil, and Himalayan salt. All you need to do place all of those ingredients into a high-speed blender, pour on top of your pecan bars and voila, the most decadent and guilt-free treats you will have all holiday. The recipe for the crust can be used for any pie, so experiment away. There are so many in season and local fruits to be used during the fall season so bake as many apple, pear, and cherry pies as you can. Happy baking!
articleSummaryHTML: In a time of being grateful, make sure good food makes the list. These Thanksgiving pecan paleo bars definitely make the grateful-for-good-food list!
seoTitle: Grateful for Pecan Pie Paleo Bars | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: In a time of being grateful, make sure good food makes the list. These Thanksgiving pecan paleo bars definitely make the grateful-for-good-food list!
recipeName: Grateful for Pecan Pie Paleo Bars
ingredients:
s:903:"

Pie Crust

  • 1 ¾ cup almond flour
  • 2 tablespoons coconut flour
  • ½ cup coconut oil
  • 2 flax eggs
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla

Filling

  • 1 cup pecans
  • 2 flax eggs
  • 1/3 cup coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla bean
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup or brown rice syrup
";
directions:
1.) Heat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 6 x 6 inch baking tray with parchment paper

2.) Combine 2 tablespoons of flax meal with 6 tablespoons of water. Stir in a small bowl and place in the fridge for 10 minutes

3.) Remove from fridge and combine with all remaining pie crust ingredients in a stand mixer

4.) Press dough into the pan and bake until golden 12-14 minutes. Remove from oven and put aside

5.) Place pecans on a parchment paper-lined baking tray and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside

6.) Repeat process with flax eggs for filling. Place coconut sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, coconut oil, vanilla bean seeds and maple syrup in a pan over low to medium heat. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Add pecans and flax eggs. Pour on top of pie crust mixture and bake for 20–30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool overnight

articleBodyHTML:
For a thick, creamy dill dressing that rocks your world and makes you want to put it on everything, this creamy, vegan delight is for you!

Fresh Vs. Dried Herbs—What You Should Know

In many recipes, you can successfully substitute dried herbs for fresh by using a replacement ratio; most often one part dried equals three parts fresh. There are, however, certain times that the dried herbs simply can’t stand up to their fresh counterparts from a taste perspective. These include recipes calling for fresh basil, chervil, chives, dill, and parsley. The flavor of the fresh aromatic plant is far superior in these cases.

In this recipe for Creamy Dill Dressing, you could swap the dried for the fresh, but truthfully, your results would just not be the same. (Note: if you decide to go rogue and use dried, remember that the dried version is more concentrated. Substitute one teaspoon of dried for one tablespoon of fresh.)

Typically, a dressing like this would use yogurt, mayonnaise, or sour cream for richness. I’ve swapped the dairy out for cashews, which blend to create a thick, creamy base. The creamy mixture is sweetened—and thickened just a dab more—by the dates, while miso adds a welcome saltiness. Throw in a little bit of water, fresh lemon juice, onion, and garlic, and you’ve got an easy, memorable dressing.

Creamy Dill Dressing can also be used as a vegetable dip: keep it thick (leave the water out) and use it to dunk carrots, peppers, radishes, or cucumbers. It’ll be a party hit!
articleSummaryHTML: For a thick, creamy dill dressing that rocks your world and makes you want to put it on everything, this creamy, vegan delight is for you!
seoTitle: Creamy Vegan Dill Dressing Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: For a thick, creamy dill dressing that rocks your world and makes you want to put it on everything, this creamy, vegan delight is for you!
ingredients:
s:560:"
  • 1 cup cashews, soaked 2 hours and drained
  • ¾ cup water, as needed
  • 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
  • 3 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 2 teaspoons onion, minced
  • 1 large clove garlic
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 3 tablespoons dill, chopped
  • 1 teaspoon light miso
";
directions: In a high-speed blender, puree cashews, water, lemon juice, dates, onion, garlic, miso, and salt until smooth. Pulse in dill until incorporated. Creamy Dill Dressing will keep in the refrigerator for up to five days. Note: this dressing pairs especially well with a chopped cucumber salad.

articleBodyHTML:
So, you didn’t use all your cans of pumpkin, don’t despair. This pumpkin hummus recipe is here to give those cans a purpose!

When you have some leftover cans of pumpkin lying around, making pumpkin hummus is the perfect thing to do with them! (It’s also the perfect thing to do with cans of pumpkin puree that you buy at the store specifically FOR this recipe, but still.)

Pumpkin hummus is the ultimate crowd-pleasing meal. Going to a Friendsgiving potluck? Bring the pumpkin hummus! Hosting actual Thanksgiving? Start the feast by putting out this pumpkin hummus! Feel guilty about doing online holiday shopping while you’re supposed to be working? Bring this pumpkin hummus to share with your coworkers. Guilt be gone! (Also, hummus be gone, too! Which it will be. In minutes!)
articleSummaryHTML: So, you didn’t use all your cans of pumpkin, don’t despair. This pumpkin hummus recipe is here to give those cans a purpose!

ingredients:
s:479:"
  • 1 can pumpkin puree
  • 1 can chickpeas (garbanzo beans)
  • 2 tablespoons tahini
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 3–5 tablespoons maple syrup
";
directions:
1. Add all ingredients to a food processor and process until smooth and perfect!!
  2. Serve with pita chips or your favorite dippers & enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
A warm and cozy breakfast of amaranth pumpkin porridge spiced with cinnamon will make getting up in the morning a treat!

Amaranth is a gluten-free pseudo-grain that is a great source of protein and when cooked, becomes gummy, which is perfect for porridge! By soaking the Amaranth overnight, it releases phytic acids, which helps to make it more digestible. This porridge is perfect for breakfast or even as a snack! The spices (especially Ceylon cinnamon) are great for balancing your blood sugar and will help to keep you full all morning long!
articleSummaryHTML: A warm and cozy breakfast of amaranth pumpkin porridge spiced with cinnamon will make getting up in the morning a treat!
seoTitle: How to Make Amaranth Pumpkin Porridge | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: A warm and cozy breakfast of amaranth pumpkin porridge spiced with cinnamon will make getting up in the morning a treat!
ingredients:
s:314:"
  • ½ cup amaranth
  • ¼ cup pumpkin puree
  • 1 teaspoon Ceylon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 tablespoon almond butter
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • Sprinkle with toasted pumpkin seeds 
";
directions:
1. Soak amaranth in water and lemon juice for up to 8 hours.

2. Bring to a boil, add sea salt, cover and simmer for 20–30 minutes. Remove from heat and mix in pumpkin puree, cinnamon, nutmeg, almond butter, maple syrup, and coconut oil.

3. Sprinkle with toasted pumpkin seeds.

4. OPTIONAL: Add a half of a scoop of Sunwarrior Vanilla Classic Plus to give yourself an extra boost of protein for the day!

And enjoy this mm-mazing breakfast!

articleBodyHTML:
Holiday baking is a snap, or at least it tastes like a snap with these delicious protein ginger snaps! Happy Holidays, indeed!

Now that you’ve learned all about the health benefits of ginger, it’s time to get down to business with a ginger snap recipe meant to be the hit of the holidays! From curing your cold or your flu to settling an upset stomach, ginger is the complete package when it comes to the Christmas miracle. In under twenty minutes you’ve got a dessert without the guilt. You’re welcome.

seoTitle: Protein Ginger Snaps | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Holiday baking is a snap, or at least it tastes like a snap with these delicious protein ginger snaps! Happy Holidays, indeed!
ingredients:
s:1067:"
  • 1 ½ cup green banana flour (can sub for oat or all-purpose gluten-free flour)
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior vanilla protein powder
  • 1/3 golden monk fruit sweeten or coconut sugar + extra 2 tablespoons for coating
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon molasses
  • 2 teaspoons ground ginger
  • ½ teaspoon ground cloves
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon + extra ½ teaspoon for coating
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 1 flax egg (1 tablespoon ground flaxseed + 3 tablespoon warm water)
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees

2. Prepare flax egg

3. Combine all dry ingredients in a medium mixing bowl

4. Begin to add almond milk tablespoons at a time until cookie dough consistency is reached

5. Mix sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl to made coating

6. Form 2 tablespoons worth of dough into balls and then roll in coating until evenly coated

7. Press balls lightly onto a pre-lined cookie sheet

8. Bake for about 15–17 min or until golden brown

9. Once done baking allow to cool or enjoy warm!

So snap to it! Get baking now!

articleBodyHTML:
Just in time for Thanksgiving, we bring you vegan pie crust with all the flaky goodness a pie crust deserves and all the health benefits you deserve!

As the holiday time rolls around, pies are coming out in full force! We are blessed to have local and in season fruit which fills our pies with delicious flavors and textures and fills the kitchen with magnificent aromas. The great thing about autumn is that we can use the fruit interchangeably in different desserts and pies. When it comes to pie, the key is always the crust. As you take your first bite, you slice through a flakey and rich crust that leaves your stomach smiling. The only downfall with pies, especially commercially baked ones is that they are filled with preservatives, chemicals and a huge amount of sugar and unhealthy fat.

Most of the commercial pies we buy are loaded with hydrogenated oils and fats due to the need to preserve shelf life. Sadly, these ingredients are what lead to chronic health issues and obesity. After much research both in the kitchen and in the books, I decided to use palm shortening. Unlike its unhealthy counterpart, palm shortening is not hydrogenated. It contains absolutely no trans-fat and has a very high melting point. Making it great for baking, frying, or everyday use. Coconut oil is one of those incredible super foods that has taken the world by storm. It’s tropical counterpart, palm oil, seems to have been overshadowed. Palm oil is packed with nutrients, vitamins, and healthy fats to keep you strong and healthy. Just make sure to buy organic or cold pressed as some palm oils are manufactured differently than others.

Just pop into your local health food store, and there will be one waiting on the shelf for you. You can double up the batch of crust and save it in the fridge. It will last up to four days once it’s sealed. All you need to do is fill your pie with whatever filling you desire, and you have the perfect gluten-free and vegan pie crust.
articleSummaryHTML: Just in time for Thanksgiving, we bring you vegan pie crust with all the flaky goodness a pie crust deserves and all the health benefits you deserve!
seoTitle: Vegan Pie Crust | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Just in time for Thanksgiving, we bring you vegan pie crust with all the flaky goodness a pie crust deserves and all the health benefits you deserve!
ingredients:
s:501:"
  • 1 ¾ cups almond meal
  • 1 cup rice flour
  • ¾ cup tapioca flour
  • 1 tablespoon coconut or demerara sugar
  • 2 teaspoons xanthan gum
  • ½ teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • ½ cup palm shortening
  • 5 tablespoons cold almond milk
";
directions:
1.) Place all ingredients, excluding the shortening and almond milk, in a large bowl. Mix well until all ingredients are combined

2.) Using a pastry cutter or by hand, add shortening and almond milk. The mixture should look like fine crumbs after incorporating

3.) Transfer dough to a work surface which has been floured. Roll the dough out into two mounds. Gently work the dough, rolling it out horizontal and diagonal. You want the dough to be around 6 inches in diameter. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and place in the fridge to set

4.) Remove dough from fridge. Give it 30 minutes to warm to room temperature. Roll and fill with the desired filling of choice

articleBodyHTML:
Your holiday dinner just got healthy without the sacrifice of flavor. Meet the green bean casserole that makes spending time with family a little tastier!

Green bean casserole is a staple to many holiday parties, but a lot of the time it is loaded with fat and other unsavory preservatives. You can change that and make this delicious and healthier version of a family favorite. No one will miss the other version.

Green beans are loaded with fiber and full of essential vitamins like A, C, K, B6 and folic acid. Mushrooms add some delicious texture to this dish as well as provide protein, vitamin C, and iron. Almond milk adds creaminess to the dish and adds calcium, iron, potassium, and zinc.

Your holidays just became a lot healthier!
articleSummaryHTML: Your holiday dinner just got healthy without the sacrifice of flavor. Meet the green bean casserole that makes spending time with family a little tastier!
seoTitle: Vegan Green Bean Casserole | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Your holiday dinner just got healthy without the sacrifice of flavor. Meet the green bean casserole that makes spending time with family a little tastier!
ingredients:
s:741:"
  • 1 pound green beans, rinsed, trimmed and cut in half
  • Sea salt and black pepper
  • 2 tablespoons vegan butter or olive oil
  • ¼ cup chopped onion
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 cup finely chopped mushrooms (button, baby bella, or cremini)
  • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour or gluten-free flour, if needed
  • 1/2 cup vegetable broth
  • ½ cup unsweetened plain almond milk
  • 1 cup crispy fried onions or make your own
";
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

Bring a medium pot of water to boil. Once the water is boiling, add salt. Add the beans and cook 5 to 6 minutes. Once done, drain and put into a large deep-dish pie pan.

Melt butter or warm olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until clear. Then add garlic and cook a minute longer. Sprinkle flour on top and whisk until veggies are coated. Cook 1 minute. Slowly add in broth and whisk until smooth. Add almond milk and season with salt and pepper. Cook on medium heat until mixture is thick. If the mixture is too thick, then add a little more almond milk.

Pour veggie mixture over beans and mix a little while in pan. Sprinkle with fried onions. Bake for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve immediately.

articleBodyHTML:
Snuggle into the holidays with fantastic desserts and food possibilities that are endless!

We can use this time experimenting in the kitchen with new recipes, tweaking old recipes, and loving the tried and true recipes. Something new I wanted to create was lamingtons. If you have never heard of lamingtons, it’s because they were originally created in Australia. They have become very popular over the years and have become a staple in most holiday baking. Think about a petit four enrobed in coconut! I wanted to recreate a vegan version that would be as equally delicious as its original counterpart.

If you aren’t concerned with gluten, you can always substitute the almond flour and tapioca flour for 1.5 cups of regular flour.
articleSummaryHTML: Snuggle into the holidays with fantastic desserts and food possibilities that are endless!
seoTitle: Vegan Lamington Holiday Recipe | Sunwarrior Health Hub
