seoDescription: Snuggle into the holidays with fantastic desserts and food possibilities that are endless! Check out our Vegan Lamington Holiday recipe.
ingredients:
s:1021:"

Cake

  • 2 cups nondairy milk of choice (Soy or almond)
  • 2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 cup almond flour
  • ¾ cup tapioca flour
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ cup coconut oil, melted
  • ½ cup coconut sugar

Lemon

  • ½ cup icing sugar
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon lemon zest
  • ¼ cup almond milk

Coating

  • 2 cups desiccated coconut
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350C. Line a rectangular baking tray with parchment paper

2. Combine apple cider vinegar, baking soda, and nondairy milk in a small bowl. Let sit for 5 minutes or until it starts to bubble

3. In the meantime, sift both flours and baking powder into another bowl

4. In another bowl whisk coconut oil, coconut sugar, and vanilla extract together

5. Pour apple cider vinegar mixture into flour mixture, stir. Add coconut oil mixture to that same bowl and stir until well incorporated. Pour mixture into lined baking tray

6. Bake for 25–30 minutes or until toothpick inserted is clean

7. Remove from oven, let cool completely. Cut into 4-inch cubes when cooled

8. Place desiccated coconut on a plate for easy dipping

9. Combine all icing ingredients together into a bowl. Dip each cube into the icing and then into the coconut. Place on a parchment paper lined tray and let sit for 1 hour

10. Serve and enjoy!

The traditional recipe is actually dipped in chocolate before it is dipped in coconut. You can make a half batch like this or even a whole. If you decide to do it with chocolate, you will need two cups of your favorite chocolate. Once the cake has cooled, cut into squares. Melt 2 cups of chocolate over a double boiler. Remove from heat and dip cake into chocolate. Place dipped squares onto a cooling rack for 2 minutes and then dip in chocolate. This will make an extra special holiday treat. Have a merry holiday and happy baking!

articleBodyHTML:
Add a delicious green to your holiday table with these perfect Brussels sprouts drizzled with a mouthwatering aioli.

Brussels sprouts are a delicious vegetable, but sometimes it is hard to find a way to eat them that everyone loves. Look no further! Crispy Brussels sprouts are a win for everyone. Even those who don’t like Brussels sprouts will like this dish.

This dish is very easy and can be served with as a side for any meal. It takes about ten minutes from start to finish and can quickly be served with your meal. The aioli adds an extra punch that take this dish from boring to out of this world! Brussels sprouts are full of essential vitamins C and K. They also have folate, B6, and dietary fiber. Don’t wait to wow your family or your guests. Make it tonight. You won’t regret it!
articleSummaryHTML: Add a delicious green to your holiday table with these perfect Brussels sprouts drizzled with a mouthwatering aioli.
seoTitle: Brussels Sprouts with Aioli | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Add a delicious green to your holiday table with these perfect Brussels sprouts drizzled with a mouthwatering aioli.
ingredients:
s:852:"

Sprouts

  • 1 pound Brussels sprouts
  • 3 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • ½ teaspoon black pepper
  • 5 cloves garlic, minced

Aioli

  • ½ cup vegan mayo
  • 2 teaspoons hot sauce
  • ½ a lemon, juiced
  • pinch sea salt
  • pinch garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 1–2 teaspoons agave nectar
  • 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar
";
directions:
Rinse and dry Brussels sprouts. Cut the ends off the Brussels sprouts and cut in half if too large. Toss the Brussels sprouts with oil in a large bowl. Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add Brussels sprouts and let sit for a few minutes. You can either turn each Brussels sprout separately or just stir with a wooden spoon. Add garlic and toss again with Brussels sprouts. Let sit to brown again. A minute more or until golden brown.

Remove from pan and season with salt and pepper.

For aioli, add all ingredients to a small bowl and mix until well combined. Drizzle over top of Brussels sprouts and serve hot.

articleBodyHTML:
Tis the season to decorate and enjoy time with our loved ones. What better way to savor this season’s memories than with these simple pumpkin pie snickerdoodle cookies!

Who doesn’t love pumpkin at this time of year, especially when you’ve packed the flavor into a dessert? Snickerdoodles are a huge hit at my house around the holidays, and adding pumpkin to them spices things up. The cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg, and vanilla bring warmth into my home, and my loved ones can’t seem to get enough of them. The best part is that these cookies are suitable for just about every dietary requirement. However, if you have an almond allergy, substituting the type of flour can always be accommodated. Try to pack in as much health into your desserts, along with an equal balance of sweetness.

So many store-bought cookies are loaded with unhealthy ingredients, and oftentimes, those desserts aren’t vegan. Taking the time to bake something homemade where you know exactly what’s going in it ensures the best quality for you and your loved ones.

These cookies will last up to five days in an airtight container, assuming you’ll have any left over. Make sure to enjoy them with your favorite dessert beverage, whether that’s a glass of almond milk or a warm pumpkin spiced latte. And of course, share the deliciousness.
articleSummaryHTML: Tis the season to decorate and enjoy time with our loved ones. What better way to savor this season’s memories than with these simple pumpkin pie snickerdoodle cookies!
seoTitle: Vegan Pumpkin Pie Snickerdoodles | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Tis the season to decorate and enjoy time.  What better way to savor this season’s memories than with these simple pumpkin pie snickerdoodle cookies!
ingredients:
s:828:"

Cookie

  • 2 cups almond flour
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil (melted)
  • 3 tablespoons pumpkin pie mix (canned)**
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

Coating

  • ¼ cup cinnamon
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar

**Pumpkin pie mix can be substituted for pumpkin puree (canned). Make sure to add ½ teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice if substituted.

";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Coat cooking sheets with nonstick baking spray.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, combine almond flour, baking powder, salt. (*Combine pumpkin pie spice if substituting.)
  3. In a separate small mixing bowl, combine melted coconut oil, pumpkin pie mix/pumpkin puree, syrup, and vanilla extract.
  4. Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients. Mix together until fully combined. It should be a bit wet and sticky. Place mixture in the refrigerator and allow it to settle for about ten minutes.
  5. While you wait, combine the cinnamon, brown sugar, and cane sugar together to make the coating. Place ingredients in a small bowl.
  6. Once dough as settled, form balls about 1.5 inches thick in diameter and roll into coating mixture. Place onto sprayed cooking sheets. Push down cookies to make them flat, about ½ inch thick.
  7. Bake cookies for about twelve minutes. Time may vary depending on cookie thickness and your oven. Cookies should be firm on top and soft in the center. Allow cookies to cool for about five minutes - they will harden up just a bit while they cool.
  8. Cool, share, enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Vegan, Gluten-Free, Grain-Free, Sugar-Free. All that free leaves tons of room for the bursting good flavor in this naturally amazing baked stuffed acorn squash!

Acorn squash is one of the many superfoods of the fall and winter months! This versatile recipe can be enjoyed as a snack, appetizer, side dish or main dish. Cauliflower rice can be substituted for any rice variety or quinoa. Other nuts, dried fruit, or diced fresh fruit such as apples are great additions as well. Olive oil, salt, and pepper will give more of a savory flavor, or if you prefer sweet over savory, feel free to substitute with coconut oil, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
articleSummaryHTML: Vegan, Gluten-Free, Grain-Free, Sugar-Free. All that free leaves tons of room for the bursting good flavor in this naturally amazing baked stuffed acorn squash!
seoTitle: Baked Stuffed Acorn Squash | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Vegan, Gluten-Free, Grain-Free, Sugar-Free. All that free leaves tons of room for the bursting good flavor in this naturally amazing baked stuffed acorn squash!
ingredients:
s:911:"

Squash

  • 2 acorn squash, cut in half and seeded
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • Himalayan salt to taste
  • Black pepper to taste

Stuffing

  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 celery stalks, chopped
  • 2 cups "riced" cauliflower (about 1 head of cauliflower)
  • 1/3 cup pecans
  • ¼ cup dried unsweetened cranberries
  • ½ cup diced onion
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • ½ teaspoon fresh ground black pepper

 

";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400F
  2. Cut squash in half, remove seeds, and place face up on a baking sheet. Rub olive oil on top, then bake for 30–45 minutes, or until soft and browned.
  3. Begin prep for cauliflower rice. If you are purchasing prepackaged “riced” cauliflower, use 2 cups. If you are making the rice on your own, place 1 large head of cauliflower into a food processor and blend until a rice-like texture is formed.
  4. In a large frying pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
  5. Add onions, celery, and cauliflower rice to pan. Cook for about 3–5 minutes, and then stir in pecans and cranberries for another minute, or until desired.
  6. Once squash is thoroughly cooked, evenly spoon the mixture into each squash half. Serve warm. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Protein Pumpkin Cinnamon Brownies (Flour and Dairy Free)
articleBodyHTML:
Be the winner of every party you’re invited to this year with a dessert that is sigh-worthy! Healthy and full of fantastic flavor, these pumpkin cinnamon brownies are a hit!

Did you ever think it was possible to enjoy a decadent, savory brownie that is flour and dairy free? I was taught at a young age that in order to make a delicious brownie, you need tons of added sugar, flour, and butter. Well, I have fantastic news for you: you can make a healthy version of a classic dessert, that in my opinion, tastes even more flavorful than a traditional brownie. Although I don’t have celiac disease, I try to stay away from flour as much as possible because it makes foods much heavier than they have to be which can create problems with digestion and inflammation or bloating. During the holiday season when we are surrounded by so many heavy foods, why not make lighter options available that enhance the taste of fan-favorite desserts? These Protein Pumpkin Cinnamon Brownies will make you rethink the way you ever make a brownie again. They are super-fast to make and require very few ingredients, so I like to make these when I need a quick dessert for a party. And you get a boost of extra protein while eating these, so it’s a win-win all around.
articleSummaryHTML: Be the winner of every party you’re invited to this year with a dessert that is sigh-worthy! Healthy and full of fantastic flavor, these pumpkin cinnamon brownies are a hit!
seoTitle: Protein Pumpkin Cinnamon Brownies (Flour & Dairy Free)
seoDescription: Be the winner of every party you’re invited to this year! Healthy and full of fantastic flavor, these pumpkin cinnamon brownies are a hit!
recipeName: Protein Pumpkin Cinnamon Brownies (Flour and Dairy Free)
ingredients:
s:649:"
  • 1 cup almond butter
  • 1 cup pumpkin
  • 1/2 cup organic maple syrup
  • 1/2 cup 100% unsweetened cocoa
  • 2 tablespoons cinnamon (or more or less depending on how much you like the flavor)
  • 1/3 cup Enjoy Life Dark Cacao Chocolate Chips
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Chocolate Protein
  • A dash organic vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees
  2. Add all the ingredients to a food processor and blend until a creamy, smooth batter is formed
  3. Spray a square or bread pan with coconut oil and pour batter
  4. Smooth batter with a spatula to ensure it is completely even
  5. Bake for 28–30 minutes
  6. Cool for at least twenty minutes before serving

articleBodyHTML:
Put the rosy color in Santa’s cheeks this Christmas with vegan strawberry milk! It’s easy, fun, and tastes like joy and peace on Earth.

Santa will be getting a big surprise this year when he sees his Christmas Eve treat has turned pink! As a child, I absolutely loved strawberry milk: sweet, filling and pink. That is what a girl’s dreams are made of. As the years progressed and I became vegan, I still craved that strawberry milk. Going back to the grocery store and looking at the nutritional information, I was floored. The amount of sugar and processed ingredients was shocking. I knew I could re-create my own version that would be healthier and taste way better.

For the base, I used a combination of both almond and cashews. Cashews are one of those super nuts that have so many health benefits. They not only help grow hair, keep bones healthy and strong, but they also help in digestion. Almonds are another super nut, boosting healthy fats, reducing blood sugar levels, and curbing your appetite.

Many people get nervous about making their own nut milk, but in all honesty, it is very simple. Blend, pour into a milk or cheesecloth, squeeze the liquid out and chill! Simple right? You can create the most delicious nut milks for the holidays using a variety of nuts. One of my favorites is using 2 cups of hazelnuts, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, ½ teaspoon nutmeg and 4 pitted Medjool dates. Follow the same directions, and you will have a nutty and spicy nut milk perfect for snow-filled nights.

These nut milks will last up to five days in the fridge in a sealed container. This recipe is perfect for the little ones.You can even add a little kick of health to it by including a scoop of Warrior Blend Berry protein.
articleSummaryHTML: Put the rosy color in Santa’s cheeks this Christmas with vegan strawberry milk! It’s easy, fun, and tastes like joy and peace on Earth.
seoTitle: Vegan Strawberry Holiday Milk | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Put the rosy color in Santa’s cheeks this Christmas with vegan strawberry milk! It’s easy, fun, and tastes like joy and peace on Earth.
ingredients:
s:397:"
  • 1 cup raw cashews, soaked for 6 hours
  • ½ cup raw almonds, soaked for 6 hours
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 cups fresh strawberries, stems removed
  • 6 Medjool dates, pitted
  • Dash of sea salt
";
directions:
1. Blend all ingredients together in a high-speed blender for 1 minute
  2. Pour into a milk bag or cheesecloth over a bowl
  3. Squeeze well to remove all the liquid
  4. Chill for 2–3 hours before serving

articleBodyHTML:
Pump up your gingerbread cookies with pumpkin! Vegan, gluten-free, and grain-free, here is everything that is awesome about the holidays all in one place!

The aromas and tastes of the holidays are hard to escape – but why would you want to? With this recipe, you get gingerbread without the guilt and with an added pumpkin flare! You can adjust the sweetness to your liking by either using a sweetened plant-based milk or adding more maple syrup. For this recipe, I made it with unsweetened almond milk and 1 tablespoon of maple syrup, but it can be altered to the individual. Additional cinnamon can be sprinkled on the cookies while they are cooling. Depending on the occasion, if desired, coconut sugar can be included in the recipe (roughly ¼ cup) or sprinkled on top of the cookies while cooling.
articleSummaryHTML: Pump up your gingerbread cookies with pumpkin! Vegan, gluten-free, and grain-free, here is everything that is awesome about the holidays all in one place!
seoTitle: Vegan Chewy Gingerbread Cookies | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Pump up your gingerbread cookies with pumpkin! Vegan, gluten-free, and grain-free, here is everything that is awesome about the holidays all in one place!
ingredients:
s:868:"
  • 1 cup of pumpkin puree (can sub for sweet potato)
  • ¼ cup coconut flour
  • ¼ cup plant-based milk (I used almond milk)
  • ½ cup nut butter of choice
  • 1 tablespoon molasses
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed
  • 2 tablespoons cacao powder
  • 2 teaspoons ground ginger
  • 2 teaspoons cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon cloves
  • ⅛ teaspoon nutmeg
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F and set aside a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
  2. In one bowl, combine the pumpkin, milk, nut butter, and molasses
  3. In another bowl, combine the coconut flour, baking soda, flaxseed, cacao powder, and spices
  4. Mix the wet and dry ingredients to create a dough
  5. Evenly distribute the dough on the baking sheet and press down to form a cookie shape. (If you make larger cookies you should get about 8; you’ll get 10 if you make them a bit smaller)
  6. Bake for 12–15 minutes. Let the cookies cool for another 10 minutes
  7. Enjoy

articleBodyHTML:
Love on the pumpkin season while it lasts! What’s great about this pumpkin pie is that it loves on your muscles with awesome protein! You’re welcome!

Pumpkin season doesn’t end with Thanksgiving. It doesn’t end with Christmas either, though some people might argue that. Whatever your pumpkin season is, you’ve got to try this amazing protein pumpkin pie before it’s over. It’s good enough to convince you that pumpkin is in season all year long! With protein to build your muscles and the antioxidants in pumpkin to keep your body healthy, this is a win!
articleSummaryHTML: Love on the pumpkin season while it lasts! What’s great about this pumpkin pie is that it loves on your muscles with awesome protein! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: How to Make Protein Pumpkin Pie | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Love on the pumpkin season while it lasts! What’s great about this pumpkin pie is that it loves on your muscles with awesome protein! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:1199:"

Crust

  • 3 cups pecans
  • 1 cup gluten-free rolled oats
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon salt

Filling

  • 1 box extra firm tofu (or 1 cup soaked cashews)
  • 1 can 15 oz. pumpkin puree
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein powder
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon ground cloves

Topping

  • ¼ cup whole pecans
  • optional dairy-free whipped cream
";
directions:
1. In a food processor, add all crust ingredients. Process on low until it has an almond meal-like consistency and forms together.
  2. Place crust either in a pre-greased pie pan or in pre-lined cupcake tins.
  3. To make filling add all ingredients in a high-speed blender. Add either both of tofu or 1 cup soaked cashews, cashew base gives a slightly creamier and richer taste.
  4. Once completely blended up, either layer on top of crust in the pie pan or in the cupcake tins.
  5. Place nuts on however you please and place in the freezer for 2 hours.
  6. When setting time is done, you can add more optional topping and dairy-free whipped cream! Enjoy!

articleTitle: The Ultimate Treat Plate: Vegan Holiday Chocolate Truffles
articleBodyHTML:
With all the stress of the holidays, neighbor gifts should not be among them. Chocolate truffles with protein to the rescue!

The fact that these chocolate truffles have the health benefits of protein and the natural sweetness of dates means you aren’t just giving any treat plate. You are giving the ultimate in health and happiness! The fact that these are simple certainly doesn’t hurt either. All the time in making these is the time they take to set up in the freezer while you do other things.

So get your holiday and ho ho ho going with a neighbor gift that will make you seem as generous and awesome as the old guy in the red suit. Spread the love to the neighborhood this year!
articleSummaryHTML: With all the stress of the holidays, neighbor gifts should not be among them. Chocolate truffles with protein to the rescue!
seoTitle: Ultimate Treat Plate: Vegan Holiday Chocolate Truffles
seoDescription: With all the stress of the holidays, neighbor gifts should not be among them. Chocolate truffles with protein to the rescue!
ingredients:
s:561:"
  • ¾ cup oat flour
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein
  • 10 Medjool dates, pitted and soaked 30 minutes (drain after soaking)
  • 4 tablespoons cocoa powder
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla
  • ½ cup almond butter
  • 4 tablespoons shredded coconut
";
directions:
1. Blend dates in a food processor or a high-speed blender. Add a drizzle of water if needed, and blend until smooth.
  2. In a bowl, mix oat flour, Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein, 2 tablespoons of the cocoa powder (save two to roll the protein balls in later), vanilla, almond butter, date mixture, and shredded coconut until the ingredients are well blended.
  3. Roll the mixture into cute little snack-sized balls.
  4. Put the balls in the freezer for twenty minutes.
  5. Remove the balls from the freezer and roll through cocoa powder until each ball has a lovely dusting.
  6. Place on a flat tray or plate and pop back into the freezer for another hour to let them set up.
  7. Plate them up on cute Christmas plates or trays, and do the rounds of gift giving!

articleBodyHTML:
Welcome to the spirited taste of winter! This Christmas Mint Pattie smoothie bowl is everything cool and refreshing while also being filling and full of everything good for you! Merry Christmas!

Peppermint patties are reminiscent of my childhood. The shiny foil-wrapped patties bought at the local candy store were only 5 cents. Yes, that’s right, a mere nickel. They were a favorite, so a delicious home-made smoothie version was needed. So, I set out to recreate the cooling, minty sensation and the addictive smooth chocolate of those patties I loved. It’s fantastic. I suggest you keep your smoothie blend thick and creamy with the use of more ice if needed.
articleSummaryHTML: Welcome to the spirited taste of winter! This Christmas Mint Pattie smoothie bowl is everything cool and refreshing while also being filling and full of everything good for you! Merry Christmas!
seoTitle: Christmas Mint Pattie Smoothie Bowl | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: This Christmas Mint Pattie smoothie bowl is everything cool and refreshing while also being filling and full of everything good for you! Merry Christmas!
ingredients:
s:1122:"

Smoothie

  • 1/2–2/3 cup full fat organic canned coconut milk
  • ½ cup organic spinach
  • 2/3 cup frozen avocado chunks
  • 1–2 drops food-grade peppermint essential oil
  • 1 serving Super Greens w/ mint
  • 1 scoop Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • ½ cup crushed ice, or as desired
  • 1 heaping tablespoon cacao nibs or high quality vegan dark chocolate/chips
  • Sweetener as desired such as soaked dates, or maple syrup

Toppings

Vegan cream or coconut yogurt, crunchy chocolate granola, cacao nibs, pomegranate seeds, mint leaves, cacao powder, or matcha tea

";
directions:
Measure all of the ingredients in your power blender in the order above with the exception of the cacao nibs. Blend using the tamper to ensure a creamy mix. Once you have a thick consistency add cacao nibs and blend just to mix nibs throughout.

Pour into bowl or latte cup, garnish as desired, and dig in with a spoon and a satisfied smile.

Teri’s Tips

If you don’t have avocados, you can substitute with frozen banana chunks. It will add sweetness so taste test before adding additional sweetener.

Find the suggested products at quality health food stores or order online at

www.sunwarrior.ca Use the discount code ‘teri’ for 15% off.

articleBodyHTML:
Quick! Before the pumpkin season is over! Have your pie and eat it, too, with this raw, vegan pumpkin pie [no cheese]cake!

This raw protein pumpkin pie [no cheese]cake is a treat I made on a whim when I was craving something creamy and festive and pumpkin-y, but raw and energizing for mid-day snacking, not baked and cozy for evening cuddling and snacking. The great thing about a raw treat like this raw protein pumpkin pie [no cheese]cake is that because it’s raw, it’s actually chock full of living enzymes (they’re ALIVE because they haven’t been heated) that easily jet right into our bodies, and because they’re bringing their own live enzymes with them, our bodies break down and digest this plant food like speedy Gonzalez, which means they immediately give our bodies more energy! Did that make sense? I sure hope so.

Something that actually doesn’t make much sense to me is how just a few simple ingredients that you probably have in your kitchen right now, plus a few quick minutes that you can probably find (who needs to do laundry, anyway)  can yield something so tasty that my fiancé and I had to fight over last bites! I’m telling you - this raw protein pumpkin pie [no cheese]cake is really, really, REALLY good to eat. Not so good at keeping marital bickering to a minimum, but I’m still very excited for you to make it!

So now here’s how to do that:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FaJV2INUvBE
articleSummaryHTML: Quick! Before the pumpkin season is over! Have your pie and eat it, too, with this raw, vegan pumpkin pie [no cheese]cake!
seoTitle: Raw Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake (No cheese) | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Quick! Before the pumpkin season is over! Have your pie and eat it, too, with this raw, vegan pumpkin pie no cheesecake with no cheese!
ingredients:
s:832:"

CRUST

  • 1 cup pecans
  • 1 cup dates
  • 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
  • Pinch sea salt

FILLING

  • 1 cups cashews
  • ½ cup pumpkin puree
  • 3 tablespoon almond milk
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 4 tablespoons vanilla protein powder
";
directions:
• PROCESS your filling ingredients and press into whatever dish or pan you want.
  • BLEND your filling ingredients.
  • DUMP your filling on top of your crust and SPREAD it out.
  • FREEZE 2 hours!
  • THAW 10–15 minutes!
  • EAT IT UP RIGHT OUT OF THE CONTAINER!

articleBodyHTML:
It’s officially December,which means you need energy and good health to get through the season. That these vegan protein balls taste like Christmas is a bonus!

These energy balls are truly festive; they smell and taste of cinnamon, nutmeg, mulled wine, and dried fruit. And the best thing about them is that they are super healthy, vegan, and gluten-free, refined sugar-free, and high in protein. They are also super quick and easy to make. All you need is a few basic ingredients that you probably already have in your kitchen and a good blender. These little balls are a must-try, and everyone in your family will love them!
articleSummaryHTML: It’s officially December,which means you need energy and good health to get through the season. That these vegan protein balls taste like Christmas is a bonus!
seoTitle: Christmas Energy Protein Balls | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: It’s officially December,which means you need energy and good health to get through the season. That these vegan protein balls taste like Christmas is a bonus!
ingredients:
s:920:"
  • ¾ cup (or 6) Medjool dates, or other soft variety *
  • ½ cup walnuts
  • 10–12 pitted, soft prunes
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Vanilla Protein
  • 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, plus some extra for coating
  • ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • ½ teaspoon cardamom
  • juice squeezed from a ½ lemon
  • * If your dates are soft and gooey, there is no need to soak them, but if they are a little hard, it might be a good idea to pour some boiling water over them and leave them soaking for five minutes and then drain them properly.
";
directions:
1. Place all the ingredients in a food processor of the high-speed blender (must be high-speed!) and blend until chunky dough forms. This will take a good few minutes.
  2. On a small plate spread 1–2 tablespoons ground cinnamon. Using a tablespoon, take out small portions of the dough and roll round balls in your hands, then roll them in the prepared cinnamon until coated and put aside.
  3. You can store them in the fridge for up to a week or freeze them and simply take out 30 min before serving to defrost.

articleBodyHTML:
Say Cheese! Because we’ve got all the vegan cheese going on here. This simple recipe for Caprese Salad with "Mozz" (mozzarella) is keeping it cheesy!

This may be cheesy, but I think it's great! Simple, quick, easy, and can be used for a variety of snacks and meals for any vegan. Grill or melt the mozz, chop the cheese, or spread it on toast, bagels, tomatoes, or veggies! Vegan cheese is a great way to get the party started and a great way to maintain good bodily function—thank you, cashews. Reap the benefits! Homemade vegan cheeses are better for you than dairy and healthier than store-bought.
articleSummaryHTML: Say Cheese! Because we’ve got all the vegan cheese going on here. This simple recipe for Caprese Salad with "Mozz" (mozzarella) is keeping it cheesy!
seoTitle: Vegan Cheese and Caprese Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Say Cheese! Because we’ve got all the vegan cheese going on here. This simple recipe for Caprese Salad with "Mozz" (mozzarella) is keeping it cheesy!
ingredients:
s:795:"
  • 3–5 tomatoes depending on size
  • Fresh basil
  • Balsamic Vinegar Glaze of your choice
  • ¾ cup raw cashews
  • ¾ cup almond milk or cashew milk
  • ¼–½ teaspoon granulated garlic powder
  • ¼–½ teaspoon onion powder
  • 1/8 teaspoon turmeric
  • Optional 1 teaspoon tahini
  • 3 tablespoon lemon juice
  • ¼ cup melted coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1–2 fresh basil leaves (or dried)
  • 2 tablespoons + 1 teaspoon agar powder (sea vegetable used for thickening into gelatin-like consistency) Side note: if you cannot find this powder, they are usually sold at local Asian markets

 

";
directions:
Mozz Cheese

  1. Soak cashews 1 hour in milk for creamier texture (opt)
  2. Blend all ingredients except for water and agar powder on HIGH speed until creamy and smooth, scrape down side to make sure all the cashews are broken down and blend again and set aside
  3. Place water and agar powder in separate skillet/saucepan (be careful not to put too much) a little goes a LONG way. Heat over med-high until it turns to a boil. Stir frequently and reduce heat to simmer for nearly 1 minute and remove from heat. A gelatin-like consistency will begin to form. Set until cooled--Do not set aside for long.
  4. IMMEDIATELY add agar + water mixture to blender along with other ingredients and blend until smooth again
  5. Oil a container (I sprayed avocado oil). Immediately pour blended mixture into the container.
  6. Cover and refrigerate for a few hours or until set.

Caprese Salad

  1. Slice ripe tomatoes into thin slices
  2. Add thinly slice vegan mozzarella, fresh basil, and a drizzle of your fave balsamic vinegar/oil glaze along with a dash of salt and pepper

(optional) before adding cheese, you can roast the tomatoes for an extra "umph"

articleBodyHTML:
We’re keeping it cheesy in all the best ways with this rosemary garlic “cheese” spread. This spread is sure to be your new favorite reason for being vegan!

It’s that time of year where there is a party going on somewhere pretty much all the time. Here is where you can be the hero of your next get-together. Make up a vegan “cheese” spread filled with flavor and goodness! This spread is much easier on your digestive system than a dairy based cheese would be and tastes amazing. All the time is in the soaking, freeing you up to get to the things that are important in your life.
articleSummaryHTML: We’re keeping it cheesy in all the best ways with this rosemary garlic “cheese” spread. This spread is sure to be your new favorite reason for being vegan!
seoTitle: Vegan Rosemary-Garlic "Cheese” Spread | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: We’re keeping it cheesy in all the best ways with this rosemary garlic “cheese” spread. This spread is sure to be your new favorite reason for being vegan!
ingredients:
s:576:"
  • ½ cup plain cashews (soak in hot water for at least an hour or overnight)
  • 1 tablespoon your desired oil (avocado oil, grapeseed oil, garlic-infused oil, etc.)
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • ½ teaspoon apple cider vinegar
  • Garlic powder (I used a rosemary-garlic spice)
  • Pinch of dried or fresh rosemary
  • Dash of salt and pepper 
";
directions:
1. Drain the cashews and add into a blender on HIGH speed, mixing along with oil, lemon juice and apple cider vinegar 3–5 minutes or until smooth, desired consistency. (Resembles a creamy-cream-cheese or hummus-like texture)
  2. Transfer to a small dish and add the creamy spread to bagels, toast, toasted tortillas or veggies! You may even use this to substitute cream cheese in any dish.
  3. Store in airtight container
  4. Lasts up to 3–4 days

articleBodyHTML:
Don’t lose your head this holiday season when you say let them eat cake. Because cake can be good. Holiday Bundt Cake with healthier ingredient choices can be the best of all.

The Christmas tree is up, carols are playing on the radio, and holiday preparations are in full effect. It is a time where we decide who will be hosting the holidays, what to eat, and where we will be spending time (hopefully with loved ones). For me, the holidays are traditionally about making delicious food and being a scientist creating new desserts. This year, I wanted to blow the dust off my Bundt cake pan. Years ago, I purchased a plethora of mini Bundt pans. I loved the idea that instead of everyone having a slice of cake, they could have their own mini Bundt cake. I used my mini Bundt pans for this recipe, but you can always use the traditional size. Either works!

I wanted to add a holiday kick to this recipe. Traditionally, I like to use orange or lemon as my base for the cake, but I opted to use almond and cranberries. The tanginess of the cranberries compliments the nutty flavor of the almond extract. The best thing about these mini Bundt cakes is that they can be devoured for dessert or for a delicious breakfast the following morning.

I used a combination of both almond flour and gluten-free flour blend to give the cake a nutty and crumbly texture. Don’t forget to spray or rub your Bundt pan with extra coconut oil to prevent sticking! This recipe is gluten free, dairy free, and celiac safe for everyone! Your holidays have gotten that much healthier and brighter already. You can always experiment with the recipe, adding orange juice, lemon zest, chopped nuts, or even a chocolate drizzle. Make these Bundt cakes your own masterpiece and have a blast in the kitchen.
articleSummaryHTML: Don’t lose your head this holiday season when you say let them eat cake. Because cake can be good. Holiday Bundt Cake with healthier ingredient choices can be the best of all.
seoTitle: Vegan Holiday Bundt Cake | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Don’t lose your head this holiday season when you say let them eat cake. Vegan Holiday Bundt Cake with healthier ingredient choices can be the best of all.
ingredients:
s:796:"
  • 2 cups gluten-free flour blend
  • ½ cup almond flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt
  • 1 cup full fat coconut milk
  • 1 teaspoon almond extract
  • 3 tablespoon flax meal
  • 9 tablespoons water
  • ½ cup dried cranberries
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • Optional ½ cup powdered coconut sugar for dusting
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350C

2. In a small bowl, whisk flax meal and water together. Stir well and let sit for 5 minutes to thicken

3. In another bowl, combine gluten-free flour, almond flour, baking powder, baking soda, and sugar

4. In another bowl, combine coconut milk, almond extract, and flax meal mixture. Stir well

5. Combine wet and dry ingredients together

6. Rub your Bundt pans with coconut oil and then pour batter into pan filling to ¾ full

7. Bake for 25–30 minutes or until toothpick inserted is clean

8. Let cool for 30 minutes

9. Optional: Dust with powdered sugar and serve

articleTitle: No-Bake Thumbprint Cookies with Coconut Butter
articleBodyHTML:
A popular holiday cookie is the thumbprint cookie filled with jam. As delicious as they are, they are usually loaded with lots of butter and sugar. Here’s a vegan, low sugar alternative!

These cookies are an alternative to the traditional butter and sugar filled ones. They are low in carbohydrates and contain healthy fats. You can enjoy these any time of the day when you feel like a treat and are trying to stay healthy around the holiday season. Be careful though; they are so good you may end up eating the whole batch.

Although I have filled the cookies with coconut butter, feel free to use any sugar-free jam you like. Or make your own sugar-free raspberry jam. A super simple and no fuss cookie to enjoy and the best part there is no egg, no dairy, and no gluten and is Keto, Paleo, and vegan-friendly.
articleSummaryHTML: A popular holiday cookie is the thumbprint cookie filled with jam. As delicious as they are, they are usually loaded with lots of butter and sugar. Here’s a vegan, low sugar alternative!
seoTitle: No-Bake Thumbprint Cookies with Coconut Butter
seoDescription: A popular holiday cookie is the thumbprint cookie filled with jam. As delicious as they are, they are usually loaded with lots of butter and sugar. Here’s a vegan, low sugar alternative!
recipeName: No-Bake Thumbprint Cookies with Coconut Butter
ingredients:
s:619:"
  • 2 tablespoons hazelnuts
  • 2 tablespoons almonds
  • 2 tablespoons cashews
  • 2 tablespoons organic unsweetened coconut flakes
  • 1 scoop of Sunwarrior Classic Plus Vanilla Protein
  • 1 teaspoon honey or maple syrup or stevia drops
  • 3–4 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1/4 cup coconut butter
";
directions:
1. Place all the dried ingredients in a food processor and process until it turns crumbly. Do not over process.
  2. Add the coconut oil and maple syrup or stevia drops. Process once again to incorporate the coconut oil.
  3. It should turn into a moist dough that you can form into medium size balls approximately one tablespoon at a time.
  4. Shape into a ball and press the center with your thumb to make an imprint.
  5. Place them in the freezer for 10 minutes to harden and set.
  6. In the meantime, place coconut butter and 1 tablespoon of coconut oil in a glass or steel container and place on top of boiling water to melt. Once the coconut is all melted, remove from heat.
  7. With a small spoon fill the middle imprint with coconut butter. Alternatively, place a pecan and drizzle with melted coconut or melted chocolate.
  8. Place in the freezer once again until the coconut butter sets.
  9. Remove from the freezer and let it defrost for a couple of minutes before eating them or enjoy them straight out of the freezer which is the way I like them best.

articleBodyHTML:
If you leave these Vegan Almond Shortbread Christmas Cookies on the mantle with a vanilla nut milk, Santa might just make room on the nice list (We know, we know. You’re already on it!)

This is Christmas done right with a recipe that is vegan, gluten free, grain free, and refined sugar-free. It is always great to have a cutout cookie to decorate individually! For cookie cutters, I used a Christmas tree, candy cane, and gingerbread man – but the opportunities are endless. This recipe makes about 15 cookies, depending on size.
articleSummaryHTML: If you leave these Vegan Almond Shortbread Christmas Cookies on the mantle with a vanilla nut milk, Santa might just make room on the nice list (We know, we know. You’re already on it!)
seoTitle: Vegan Cut-out Almond Shortbread Cookies
seoDescription: If you leave these Vegan Almond Shortbread Christmas Cookies on the mantle with a vanilla nut milk, Santa might just make room on the nice list (We know, we know. You’re already on it!)
ingredients:
s:1055:"
  • ¾ cup almond flour
  • ¼ cup coconut flour
  • 2 tablespoons arrowroot starch
  • 1 tablespoon coconut butter (softened)
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil (room temperature)
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • ¼ cup plant-based milk
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Frosting

For this recipe I used melted chocolate, as well as this vanilla coconut icing recipe:

  • 1 can full-fat coconut milk
  • 1 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoons maple syrup 
  • 1 teaspoons. vanilla extract
";
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

In a mixing bowl, combine the almond flour, coconut flour, arrowroot starch, baking soda, and cinnamon.

Once the dry ingredients are combined, mix in the coconut butter, coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. Mix until a sticky, even dough is formed

Place the dough on a sheet of parchment paper. Use cookie cutters (or your own design) to form the cookie shape you are looking for. Place each cookie on the baking sheet when done.

Put the tray of cookies in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.

Remove cookies and let cool before eating or decorating!

Frosting

Just blend the ingredients together and then spread the frosting on your cookies as you wish!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your Christmas started with jam thumbprint cookies! They’re great for every occasion, but the white and red make them festive without even trying!

There’s jam in the center for that burst of sweet fruity goodness, but you can still get your chocolate fix by adding a drizzle to the top. I added pumpkin seeds on top for more “festive” coloring. Let the little ones in your life help you make them, and you will create memories that make the holidays amazing. Have an amazing holiday with these cookies!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your Christmas started with jam thumbprint cookies! They’re great for every occasion, but the white and red make them festive without even trying!
seoTitle: Vegan Strawberry Jam Thumbprint Cookies
seoDescription: Get your Christmas started with jam thumbprint cookies! They’re great for every occasion, but the white and red make them festive without even trying!
ingredients:
s:572:"
  • 1 cup almond flour
  • 2 tablespoons arrowroot starch
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons plant-based milk (I used an almond-cashew blend)
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 6 tablespoons jam of choice
  • Pumpkin seeds for garnish
  • ¼ cup gluten-free and vegan chocolate, melted (optional – for drizzle)
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Place a sheet of parchment paper on a cookie tray
  2. Mix together almond flour, arrowroot starch, coconut oil, and milk
  3. Once the dough is formed, spoon even portions of the dough onto the parchment paper. I used 1 tablespoon of dough for each cookie. Roll dough into balls, gently press flat and then use your thumb or spoon to make the imprint in the center
  4. Place into the oven and bake for 12 minutes
  5. Remove and let cool. Reinforce the thumbprint in the center if necessary
  6. Once the cookies are completely cooled, spoon jam into the center of each. Place pumpkin seeds in the center to add some color. If desired, drizzle the melted chocolate on each cookie. Let the cookies sit for another 10 minutes, then enjoy!
  7. Servings: 8 servings (dependent upon size – I did 1 tablespoon of dough per cookie)

articleBodyHTML:
Do you want Vegan Chocolate Chip Biscotti perfection? Use this recipe and then dip in chocolate with pistachios and cranberries. Biscotti just got real!

Growing up in a part Italian family, the biscotti is no stranger to me. Biscotti is known as a twice baked, almond cookie. This way, you can get even more almond in these cookies with a gluten-free twist! And when you dip them in chocolate with pistachios and cranberries, you have something that is close to perfection!
articleSummaryHTML: Do you want Vegan Chocolate Chip Biscotti perfection? Use this recipe and then dip in chocolate with pistachios and cranberries. Biscotti just got real!
seoTitle: Vegan Chocolate Chip Biscotti
seoDescription: Do you want Vegan Chocolate Chip Biscotti perfection? Use this recipe and then dip in chocolate with pistachios and cranberries. Biscotti just got real!
ingredients:
s:860:"

Biscotti

  • 1 cup almond flour
  • 2 tablespoons coconut flour
  • 2 tablespoons arrowroot starch
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons plant-based milk
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ cup dark chocolate chips

Toppings

  • ¼ cup melted dark chocolate
  • ¼ cup shelled pistachios
  • ¼ cup dried cranberries
  • ¼ cup shredded coconut
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper
  2. Combine the almond flour, coconut flour, arrowroot starch, and baking soda. Stir in maple syrup, coconut oil, chocolate chips, and milk of choice
  3. Once the mixture forms a dough consistency, place the dough on the baking sheet with parchment paper. Mold the dough into a loaf or log shape
  4. Bake in the oven at 350F for 15 minutes. Remove and let cool completely, about 30 minutes. Cut the loaf into individual slices, roughly ½ inch thick, depending upon your preferences
  5. Lay the slices on their side and bake for 10 minutes. Then, flip the cookies onto the opposite side for another 10 minutes
  6. Once each side has cooked, remove and let cool completely before adding toppings. Biscotti pairs great with tea, coffee, hot cocoa, or your favorite holiday beverage!

articleBodyHTML: This vegan eggnog tastes like Christmas in a cup! So make a toast vegan-style by mixing up a tasty, perfect vegan eggnog filled with all the warmth and cheer of the holidays!
articleSummaryHTML: This vegan eggnog tastes like Christmas in a cup! So make a toast vegan-style by mixing up a tasty, perfect vegan eggnog filled with all the warmth and cheer of the holidays!
seoTitle: Vegan Eggnog
seoDescription: This vegan eggnog tastes like Christmas in a cup! So make a toast vegan-style by mixing up a tasty, perfect vegan eggnog filled with all the warmth and cheer of the holidays!
ingredients:
s:572:"
  • 2 cups of cashew yogurt or almond yogurt*
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • ½ cup canned coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon ginger
  • 1 teaspoon allspice
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • ½ teaspoon cloves
";
directions:
1. Place all ingredients in a blender. Blend until you have reached your desired consistency. ** If you wish, you can add a teaspoon of rum extract or a splash of rum.
  2. Pour into glasses and serve. Add some extra cinnamon and nutmeg on top to garnish. Enjoy!

*I used Forager Cashewgurt because it is thicker than milk but not too thick. Kite Hill almond yogurt is also a good consistency. If you do not have this, you can blend 1 cup of raw cashews and add an extra cup of almond milk

Serves four

articleBodyHTML:
Beautiful and scrumptious, these vegan snowflake orange pull apart rolls will be the best part of the holidays!

Orange rolls are a wonderful indulgent during the holiday months. Waking up to hot rolls in the morning with a morning cup of coffee or hot chocolate is felt. With oranges in season, they are perfect to use up those extra oranges that have been forgotten. This recipe is very pretty as well. Pull aparts are a perfect social dessert.

Orange rolls are very similar to cinnamon rolls. You can add cinnamon to the orange mixture if desired. I’d just sprinkle it over the top. Topped with an orange vegan cream cheese frosting that pairs perfectly with the rolls.

Warm up the house in the morning (or even afternoon) and make these scrumptious rolls.
articleSummaryHTML: Beautiful and scrumptious, these vegan snowflake orange pull apart rolls will be the best part of the holidays!
seoTitle: Vegan Snowflake Orange Rolls
seoDescription: Beautiful and scrumptious, these vegan snowflake orange pull apart rolls will be the best part of the holidays!
ingredients:
s:588:"
  • 1 cup warm water
  • 1 tablespoon yeast
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup + 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 4 tablespoons vegan butter, softened + ¼ cup melted vegan butter
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 3–4 cups flour
  • 2 oranges, zested and juiced
  • ¼ cup organic coconut sugar
  • 2 oz. vegan cream cheese
";
directions:
In a large bowl, add water, yeast and 2 tablespoons maple syrup. Stir, then let sit until it starts to proof.

Once proofed, add salt, 4 tablespoons vegan butter, and 1 ½ cups of flour. Mix until smooth. Then add enough flour, ½ cup at a time, until the dough comes together and is smooth and soft. You may not need all the flour. Let dough rise in a warm place until doubled, about an hour.

Once the dough has proofed, mix orange zest and ¼ cup butter together. Set aside. Divide dough into 4 equal parts. Roll each dough piece into a circle. Lay circle on top of a cookie sheet covered with parchment paper. Pour a third of the orange mixture on top and spread. Then sprinkle about 1 ½ tablespoon of coconut sugar on top. Repeat with the two other layers. On the last layer, just lay dough on top. With a small cup or bowl in the center of the circle, cut all layers into an even 16 triangles. Take two pieces and twist outward and then join together at the end and make a point. Repeat with all other pieces. Let dough rise until doubled about 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and bake for about 30 minutes.

While dough is baking, mix cream cheese and 1 tablespoon maple syrup until smooth. Slowly add orange juice. You may not need all juice. Drizzle frosting (optional) over the top of warm rolls. Serve warm.

articleBodyHTML:
Sometimes we crave a dessert that is rich and silky, but we don’t want all the added sugars. Which is why we’re bringing you a berry protein mousse! You’re welcome!

I’ve created a dessert that fits the needs for silky and rich without the added sugars, and I did it using aquafaba. This fancy word is quite incredible but not as obscure as it sounds. Aquafaba is simply the liquid you typically throw away from a can of chickpeas. One of the most incredible things about aquafaba is that it turns out to be the same consistency as a regular mousse, that being very light and fluffy. You will actually see the air pockets inside the mousse when it is set. I have made countless avocado mousses, and although delicious, it’s a different texture. Aquafaba can be used to replace egg whites in most vegan baking, so think twice about dumping that chickpea liquid down the sink!

The top portion of the mousse was made with agar-agar, which is typically found in powder form and can be used to create vegan gelatin or mousse. The best part about agar-agar is that it’s packed with fiber, contains no sugar and no carbohydrates.

This dessert would be perfect to make for the holiday season. Your guests will be shocked when you tell them how healthy it is (or leave that part out!). You can make a variety of mousses with this recipe such as substituting the berries for chocolate. You can simply melt 1 cup vegan chocolate, let it cool down and then incorporate it into your whipped chickpea water (aquafaba).

Adding 1 shot of espresso and 2 tablespoons of maple syrup will make this that recipe come to life. You can use a variety of different fruits as well such as in season berries, mangos, coconut, or even peanut butter. This super-rich and silky mouse is decadent but super healthy. It’s packed with protein, low carb, dairy-free, and guilt-free.
articleSummaryHTML: Sometimes we crave a dessert that is rich and silky, but we don’t want all the added sugars. Which is why we’re bringing you a berry protein mousse! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Berry Protein Mousse
seoDescription: Sometimes we crave a dessert that is rich and silky, but we don’t want all the added sugars. Which is why we’re bringing you a berry protein mousse! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:970:"

Mousse

  • 1 can organic chickpeas
  • 2 cups strawberries
  • 1.5 cups raspberries
  • ½ scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Natural protein (r you can use vanilla or berry depending on how vibrant you want your flavors)
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup

Jelly Top

  • 1 cup water
  • ¼ cup reserved strained berries
  • 1 teaspoon agar-agar
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
";
directions:
1. Mousse: Combine strawberries and raspberries in a high-speed blender or food processor. Remove from blender and strain berries through a fine sleeve over a bowl. Pressing down firmly with the back of a spoon, allow all juices to drip into the bowl. Reserve 1/4 cup for jelly

2. Open the can of chickpeas and drain liquid into a small bowl. Place chickpeas in a bowl for later snacking or salad

3. In a mixing bowl with a whisk attachment, place chickpea water in bowl and whisk until soft peaks form

4. Gently fold in berry juice, Sunwarrior protein, and maple syrup. Divide mixture into small bowls and place in fridge to set for 3–4 hours

5. Jelly Top: Combine agar-agar and water into a small saucepan and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in maple syrup and strained berries. Pour onto chilled mousse and put in fridge to set for 5–6 hours

articleBodyHTML:
Celebrate Christmas with the gift of protein and great flavor with this vegan eggnog protein bread!

These flavors are Christmas in a bread pan. Bake one loaf and your house will smell like the holidays in all the best ways! It’s vegan and full of healthy options to boost your energy for the big day!
articleSummaryHTML: Celebrate Christmas with the gift of protein and great flavor with this vegan eggnog protein bread!
seoTitle: Vegan Eggnog Bread
seoDescription: Celebrate Christmas with the gift of protein and great flavor with this vegan eggnog protein bread!
ingredients:
s:1505:"

Bread

  • 1 ¾ green banana flour (oat and all-purpose, gluten-free works!)
  • 1 medium peeled zucchini
  • ¼ cup Sunwarrior Classic Plus protein vanilla
  • 1 tablespoon psyllium husk powder
  • 2/3 granulated sweetener (I used monk fruit, but you can use coconut sugar if you like)
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
  • ½ teaspoon ground cloves
  • 1/3 cup almond milk
  • 2 chai tea bags

Glaze

  • 3 tablespoons powdered sweetener (I used a powdered Erythritol) and monk fruit blend)
  • 1 ½ tablespoons almond milk
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Pinch of cinnamon
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a small loaf pan (I used a 5 X 3).
  2. Heat almond milk and steep both tea bags in the milk.
  3. Combine all the bread ingredients in a high-speed blender and start with ¼ cup of the chai almond milk.
  4. Once completely blended, transfer the batter into your pan and bake for 40–45 min.
  5. When done baking, let bread cool and begin assembling the glaze.
  6. Whisk 1 ½ tablespoon of the chai almond milk with the rest of the glaze ingredients. Drizzle over the cooled bread.

articleBodyHTML:
Easy desserts! Easy on the eyes, easy on the tummy and so easy on the taste buds! Vegan Christmas fudge is a reason to celebrate the season!

There are a few things that scream holiday season to me, and one of those happen to be fudge. I remember making it many years ago with my mom. Enjoying every melt-in-my-mouth piece I could get my hands on. It took a long time to make it with an endless list of ingredients. A lot of time we’d have to run to the store to get some ingredients that we missed. But no more! This fudge takes two ingredients and is done in a snap!

All you need is vegan chocolate chips and peanut butter or any other nut butter really. The peanut butter is what makes this more on the healthy side. Peanut butter has heart-healthy fats that your body needs to lower your risk of cardiovascular and heart disease. Peanut butter also has protein and potassium. Chocolate chips are just good for the soul.

Let the holidays begin with this simple fudge!
articleSummaryHTML: Easy desserts! Easy on the eyes, easy on the tummy and so easy on the taste buds! Vegan Christmas fudge is a reason to celebrate the season!
seoTitle: Vegan Christmas Fudge
seoDescription: Easy desserts! Easy on the eyes, easy on the tummy and so easy on the taste buds! Vegan Christmas fudge is a reason to celebrate the season!
ingredients:
s:153:"
  • 2 cups no sugar peanut butter or almond butter
  • 2 cups vegan chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. Line an 8x8 square with parchment paper. Set aside.
  2. Over a double boiler add peanut butter and chocolate chips. Continue cooking until all melted. Pour into prepared pan. Cool in freezer for about an hour.
  3. After the fudge has cooled, cut into squares and store in an airtight container in your freezer.
  4. You can dress this up in any way you choose with various flavors or add-ins like coconut shreds or nuts of your choice, but I like it simple.
  5. Enjoy with all the people you love this Christmas season!

articleBodyHTML:
These cupcakes make an easy twist on classic gingerbread. They are soft, moist and filled with aromatic flavors that will warm you up in this cold weather.

They are also super quick and easy to make so that there is literally nothing that can go wrong.
articleSummaryHTML: ​These cupcakes make an easy twist on classic gingerbread. They are soft, moist and filled with aromatic flavors that will warm you up in this cold weather.
seoTitle: Vegan Gingerbread Cupcakes
seoDescription: ​These cupcakes make an easy twist on classic gingerbread. They are soft, moist and filled with aromatic flavors that will warm you up in this cold weather.
ingredients:
s:1586:"

Cupcakes

  • 2 ¼ cups oat flour *
  • 1 flax egg **
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ cup brown sugar
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • ¼ cup almond milk
  • ½ cup apple juice
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
  • 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • ½ teaspoon ground ginger
  • ½ teaspoon ground cardamom
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • a pinch of salt

* You can simply make oat flour by blending oat flakes in a food processor or high-speed blender

** To make a flax egg, mix 1 tablespoon ground flax seeds with 2 tablespoons. water and set aside for 5 min.

Cashew Frosting

  • 1 ½ cups cashews (soaked for 4–6 hours)
  • Juice squeezed from ½ lemon
  • 6 tablespoons almond milk
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • A pinch of salt 
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius. Prepare 6–8 cupcake forms on a baking tray and set aside.
  2. In a large mixing bowl put flour, sugar, baking powder and baking soda and then add all the spices and mix thoroughly.
  3. In a separate bowl combine maple syrup with apple juice, coconut oil, almond milk and flax egg.
  4. Gradually add the wet mixture to the dry ingredients mixing continuously using an electric mixer. You want everything to be thoroughly mixed and the dough to be light and fluffy.
  5. Transfer the dough into the prepared forms and put in the oven. Bake for 15–18 min. or until a wooden stick comes out dry.
  6. Take out of the oven and set aside until completely cool.
  7. To make the cashew frosting simply put all the ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
  8. Put one heaped tablespoon of the frosting on each cupcake and sprinkle with ground cinnamon on top.

articleBodyHTML:
With winter in full swing, it is also flu and cold season. Kick the cold to the curb with this immune booster smoothie!

This smoothie is full of Omega 3's and antioxidants to help keep your inflammation in balance in colder months. I make this smoothie a few times per week to stay healthy during winter. Drinking pomegranate juice helps reduces oxidative stress, which is the toxic effects of free radicals, in healthy humans. Pomegranate juice also has more antioxidants than red wine, cranberry juice, green tea, and most other juices or drinks. The antioxidant capacity of pomegranates also helps protect against heart disease, cancer, and cognitive impairment.

Boost those benefits with Sunwarrior’s Immune Shield and you have all the tools you need to keep away the cold, especially since Immune Shield is a raw natural fulvic acid and mineral complex fortified with silver ions. This complex serves as a catalyst that delivers trace minerals, various nutrients, and electrolytes freely to the body’s cells. Silver ions then assist the immune system. These molecules provide a more efficient delivery system to safely provide silver ions in high amounts without worry. This fortified complex delivers the maximum level of benefit, protection, and performance.

What's the big deal about red beet powder? Most beet powders are loaded with the same potent vitamins, minerals, and nutrients as the red beets it comes from. It is rich in iron, potassium, antioxidants, calcium, folate, manganese, and dietary fiber.

What all of this means is that this smoothie has everything your body needs to be ready for everything during these winter months.
articleSummaryHTML: With winter in full swing, it is also flu and cold season. Kick the cold to the curb with this immune booster smoothie!
seoTitle: Immune-Booster Smoothie
seoDescription: With winter in full swing, it is also flu and cold season. Kick the cold to the curb with this immune booster smoothie!
ingredients:
s:683:"
  • 1 ½ cups pomegranate juice
  • 1½ cups spinach or kale
  • 1½ cups mixed berries (I usually use whatever berries I have or are in season, like blueberries)
  • 1 tablespoon red beet powder
  • 1 tablespoon flaxseed
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Vanilla Protein
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Immune Shield
";
directions: Combine all the ingredients in the blender, purée until blended. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Ring in your New Year party with a cookie butter spread that is so good, you might have a hard time sharing it! (but you should because sharing is nice)

One of my favorite things about the holidays is the seasonal food that only comes out at this time of year! One of my all-time favorites is cookie butter! However, it wasn’t until last year when I turned the jar around and looked at the nutrition label that I realized I probably shouldn’t eat the entire jar at once.

This year I had an idea to recreate cookie butter but maybe in a healthier way! So, I made the base of this recipe using garbanzo beans, which is why I call it hummus. This recipe not only is beyond fast and easy but is so delicious. It’s packed with protein and is perfect to spread on toast, used as a dip, top on ice cream, or smoothie bowls or of course eaten by the spoonful! It also can be used as a gift! Filling some cute mason jars with homemade cookie butter hummus and tying a bow, would make the perfect present along with some Christmas cookie mix! I’m sure Santa would even be very appreciative if some of this was left out with some cookies on Christmas Eve because, I mean, who doesn’t like cookie butter?
articleSummaryHTML: Ring in your New Year party with a cookie butter spread that is so good, you might have a hard time sharing it! (but you should because sharing is nice)
seoTitle: Vegan Cookie Butter Hummus
seoDescription: Ring in your New Year party with a cookie butter spread that is so good, you might have a hard time sharing it! (but you should because sharing is nice)
ingredients:
s:541:"
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • ¼ cup cashew butter
  • ¼ cup coconut sugar
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 1 can garbanzo beans
  • ¼ teaspoon ground ginger
  • ½ teaspoon ground cloves
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 1 tablespoon molasses
";
directions:
1. Drain the beans from the can and rinse.
  2. Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until completely smooth.

Notes

Option to add any mix-ins like dried fruit, chopped nuts, crumbled cookies, shredded coconut, dairy-free chocolate chips!

Also, consistency is most likely to be perfect as is, but almond milk can be used if having trouble blending!

articleTitle: A Low Calorie, No-Sugar Added Take on Margaritas & Mojitos
articleBodyHTML:
Toast in the New Year with these Low Calorie, No-Sugar Added Margaritas & Mojitos! A healthy take on your new year festivities!

I can’t resist a delicious margarita. After a long day of work, the thought of snacking on guacamole and sipping a freshly-made margarita at my favorite neighborhood restaurant sounds like heaven. But here’s the problem: a margarita can have up to 800 calories! They are often loaded with sugar and sodium, causing a rapid and potentially dangerous spike in your blood sugar. Mojitos are another crowd favorite, but I rarely order them because it’s like drinking pure sugar. The average mojito has 25 grams of sugar! That much added sugar can lead to weight gain, so why throw away all of your hard work in maintaining a healthy diet and pushing through tough workouts? It turns out there are healthy versions of both cocktails that have half the calories and no added sugar. They are even vitamin packed with some Sunwarrior power ingredients. Here are two recipes that will hydrate and fuel your body with minerals while you enjoy a cocktail!
articleSummaryHTML: Toast in the New Year with these Low Calorie, No-Sugar Added Margaritas & Mojitos! A healthy take on your new year festivities!
seoTitle: A Low Calorie, No-Sugar Added Take on Margaritas & Mojitos
seoDescription: ​Toast in the New Year with these Low Calorie, No-Sugar Added Margaritas & Mojitos! A healthy take on your new year festivities!
ingredients:
s:2271:"

Grapefruit Margarita:

  • 1.5 ounces of white tequila
  • 4 ounces of Be Mixed Margarita (*Be Mixed is a zero calorie, zero sugar, vegan cocktail mixer that is flavored predominately with monk fruit. It’s game-changing for cocktail making).
  • 2 teaspoons of Sunwarrior Vitamin Mineral Rush (a full spectrum of liquid vitamins and minerals from all raw plant sources)
  • 3 grapefruit slices
  • Salt (optional)

Cucumber Mojito

  • 1.5 ounces of rum
  • 4 ounces of Be Mixed Cucumber Mint
  • 1 ounces of fresh lime juice
  • 1/2 capful of Sunwarrior Liquid Light (a fulvic acid mineral complex packed with electrolytes which protects, nourishes, and detoxifies cells)
  • 4 ounces of unflavored club soda
  • Mint leaves
";
directions:
Grapefruit Margarita

  1. In a cocktail shaker, muddle fresh grapefruit slices
  2. Pour in the tequila and Margarita Be Mixed and shake for one minute
  3. With a strainer to catch the muddled fruit, pour the drink into a glass over ice
  4. If you like salt, garnish the rim

Enjoy!

Cucumber Mojito:

  1. In a cocktail shaker, pour the lime juice
  2. Muddle the mint for 45–60 seconds
  3. Pour in the rum and Cucumber Mint Be Mixed and shake for one minute
  4. Pour the mixture into a glass over ice and top with club soda

Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
The New Year is a good time for trying new things, including new recipes! Be the New Year hero with this vegan Peanut Brittle!

Some of the best holiday recipes come from the counter bring filled with all kinds of cookies, chocolates and brittle. Packing them away into festive holiday tins would be one of my favorite things to do during this time. Holidays will come and go, but this recipe will be a winner all year around! This super delicious and easy to make peanut brittle will be a fan favorite with family, friends, and loved ones. Sometimes people get deterred from making brittle or candy themselves because they think it’s a whole complicated ordeal; the truth is, it’s very simple to make and takes hardly any time to prepare!

The best part about this recipe is that you can swap out the peanuts for any type of nuts desired. If you have a peanut allergy or just prefer almonds, cashews, seeds, or even quinoa, this is your time to be creative! You can also add chocolate to your peanut brittle to add an extra flavor boost. This recipe can be stored in the refrigerator and can last up to two months in a sealed container (if it lasts that long!).

If you don’t want to purchase a candy thermometer or do not have one, there is a simple trick for knowing that your brittle is finished. Simply put a bowl of ice water near the stove near the boiling syrup. When the syrup begins to turn a golden brown, drop a small amount into the cold water. If the brittle hardens as soon as it hits the water, it’s done! I have used this trick many times when I have misplaced my thermometer. If you’re heading to any New Year’s parties, this is a great treat to bring along!
articleSummaryHTML: The New Year is a good time for trying new things, including new recipes! Be the New Year hero with this vegan Peanut Brittle!
seoTitle: Vegan Peanut Brittle
seoDescription: The New Year is a good time for trying new things, including new recipes! Be the New Year hero with this vegan Peanut Brittle!
ingredients:
s:433:"
  • 1 cup peanuts, unsalted
  • ¼ cup brown rice syrup
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 3 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • ½ stick vegan butter OR coconut oil
";
directions:
1. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine brown rice syrup, maple syrup, and coconut sugar.

2. When mixture begins to boil, add a lady thermometer. Continue cooking until mixture reaches 265 F. When it beings to boil, add peanuts and stir

3. Continue cooking until the mixture reaches 305F. Remove from heat, stir in butter, vanilla, and salt.

4. Pour onto parchment paper lined baking sheet. Let sit for 1–2 hours.

articleBodyHTML:
If you are simply looking for a way to celebrate any occasion without alcohol, this faux-mosa is everything you need!

There is always something to celebrate in life. If your social calendar is as busy as mine, then you know what I am talking about. Weekend brunches can pack on the pounds, especially when you have one too many mimosas. I had to come up with another way to celebrate with my friends when it came to brunch. Being the Healthinista that I am, I switched out champagne with sparkling water. And TA-DAH! A faux-mosa was born; a healthier version of a mimosa. No more lazy, bloated brunches with this little trick. You will leave your brunches feeling energized and ready to tackle the day.
articleSummaryHTML: If you are simply looking for a way to celebrate any occasion without alcohol, this faux-mosa is everything you need!
seoTitle: Faux-moses, Mimosas for the non-alcoholic | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: If you are simply looking for a way to celebrate any occasion without alcohol, this faux-mosa is everything you need!
ingredients:
s:196:"
  • Orange juice
  • Sparkling water
  • Champagne glasses
  • Friends
";
directions:
Pour ½ part sparkling water in your champagne glass and then add ½ part orange juice. Or you can make a big pitcher of fresh squeezed orange juice like I do at parties. If you're doing real mimosas, have sparkling water on the side as an option for those who don’t drink alcohol.

Tip for parties:

At the drink station or bar, have recipe cards made up for guests to make fun alcohol-free drinks. It is fun for the guests that do not drink alcohol and gives them something else to drink besides water.

Fun fact about Mimosas and sparkling water:

In 1925, a bartender at the Ritz Hotel in Paris named Frank Meier invented the mimosa, which uses equal parts sparkling wine and juice. It became a popular brunch drink to this day. Did you know that carbonated water was invented by Joseph Priestley in 1767 when he discovered a method of infusing water with carbon dioxide after suspending a bowl of water above a beer vat at a brewery in Leeds, England? It has no sugar, so it is a great crutch for those trying to wean off the bad soda habit.

articleBodyHTML:
Sweeten up your life naturally with these blueberry and orange bundt cake! Your taste-buds will say thank you!

Looking for that lightly sweet, yet simple cake to throw into the oven for an afternoon brunch? This recipe meets all expectations. Subtly sweet with a citrus undertone, this bundt cake can be made into individuals bundts, or one medium sized bundt. If you want a touch of extra goodness, feel free to top with an orange glaze.
articleSummaryHTML: Sweeten up your life naturally with these blueberry and orange bundt cake! Your taste-buds will say thank you!
seoTitle: Blueberry Orange Bundt Cake | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Sweeten up your life naturally with these blueberry and orange bundt cake! Your taste-buds will say thank you!
ingredients:
s:903:"

Cake Ingredients

  • 2 ¼ cup flour
  • 1 ¼ teaspoon baking powder
  • ¾ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ cup raw coconut sugar
  • ¼ cup unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 cup nondairy milk
  • ¼ cup orange juice
  • 1 cup blueberries, dusted in flour
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • Zest of one medium orange

Cake Glaze (Optional)

 1 tablespoon orange juice, 1/4 cup arrowroot powder, and zest of a small orange.

";
directions:
Cake Glaze (Optional)

In a large bowl (cereal size) whisk together 1 tablespoon orange juice, arrowroot powder, and zest of a small orange. If too thick, use a little more liquid, or add a little more powdered sugar if you would like it thicker. Drizzle over bundt.

Cake

1. Preheat oven to 350F. Grease bundt pan.

2. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and coconut sugar. Stir in all wet ingredients. When well combined, gently still in blueberries and orange zest.

3. Pour into mini bundt pans or large bundt cake pan.

4. Bake approximately 35–40 minutes for large cake, or approximately 20 minutes for mini bundt cakes. Check if cakes are done by inserting toothpick into center of cake. If it comes out clean, they are done. Let cool about 10 minutes before removing from baking dish.

5. Glaze prior to serving if desired.

articleBodyHTML:
Tahini protein snack balls are just what you need pre and post workout! Listen to your body and feed it well!

Whenever anyone asks me what tahini is, I say “it’s sesame seed peanut butter.” That’s legit, right? I mean, to make tahini, all you do is grind sesame seeds into a butter, the same way you grind peanuts into butter. So yeah. Tahini = sesame seed peanut butter. I like it. Well, I mean, I LOVE tahini. Because it’s excellent, both nutritionally and culinarily. (Meaning: it kicks ass for your body AND your taste buds.)

For your bod, Tahini is a SUPER source of CALCIUM! (And a super answer for us plant-eaters who always get asked, “So where do you get your calcium?”) It’s also a phenomenal source of PROTEIN, one of my favorite things in the world. Protein keeps us full, meaning we’ll eat less later. I’ve also read that the clever combination of calcium, protein, and zinc in tahini also helps hydrate hair and keep it from drying out and thinning – not a bad bonus feature for this sesame seed peanut butter.

But since it’s the sesame seed peanut butter, I love to use it in many of the ways that you WOULD use peanut butter but can’t if you have a peanut allergy or just want to live life to the fullest, like in smoothies, baked goods, and balls. Protein balls, snack balls, those kinds of balls. I dunno what balls YOU were thinking about.

So here are my vanilla maca tahini snack balls, which includes one of my all-time favorite superfoods, MACA. Maca, vanilla, and tahini go together like peanut butter and jelly and bread?

(Listen to my podcast episode that goes in depth about the MARVEL THAT IS MACA, like how it’s an energy food, it helps our adrenal glands like whoa, and it intuitively knows how to work with our bodies to bring them to balance -- you really ought to listen on your next commute!)

Oh, and you can 100% make these balls without maca if you choose so don’t let a lack-a maca talk you out of it!
articleSummaryHTML: Tahini protein snack balls are just what you need pre and post workout! Listen to your body and feed it well!
seoTitle: Vanilla Maca Tahini Snack Balls
seoDescription: Tahini protein snack balls are just what you need pre and post workout! Listen to your body and feed it well!
ingredients:
s:440:"
  • Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1 cup tahini paste
  • 1 cup vanilla Sunwarrior protein
  • 1 pinch sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon maca powder
  • Optional toppings (coconut flakes, chia seeds, cinnamon)
";
directions:
1. In a food processor, process the dates until they’ve formed a paste.
  2. Add the tahini, the protein powder, the salt, and the maca and process until a dough has formed.
  3. In your hand (you can lightly wet them if you’d like), roll the dough into balls.
  4. Roll those balls into a little bowl or plate filled with any topping you choose (coconut flakes, chia seeds, cinnamon, etc.) -- or leave them naked! Nothing wrong with that.
  5. Place in freezer for about 10 minutes and then move to the fridge for storage (or eat some right then!).
  6. Lasts about 1–2 weeks in the fridge.

Here’s a video demonstration of this recipe.

articleBodyHTML:
When you need a bite of energy, we’ve got you covered with these raw brownie batter energy balls!

You know when you want some energy, but you also want to eat a brownie? No? Haven’t desired those two things at the same time? Well, maybe that’s because the two are commonly completely contradictory!

But not anymore. (This sounds like an infomercial. But stay with me. Totally worth it.) These raw brownie batter energy balls TASTE just like raw brownie batter (which is the best kind of brownie batter) but actually give you energy thanks to the dates, cacao, nuts, and Sunwarrior plant-protein! So really, that whole “brownies and energy are completely contradictory” thing is now just null and void. Woot! Pre work out energy and post work out muscle repair with a flavor that is mm-mazing!
articleSummaryHTML: When you need a bite of energy, we’ve got you covered with these raw brownie batter energy balls!
seoTitle: Raw Brownie Batter Energy Balls
seoDescription: When you need a bite of energy, we’ve got you covered with these raw brownie batter energy balls!
ingredients:
s:319:"
  • 1 cup Medjool dates, pitted
  • ⅓ cup almond butter
  • ½ cup rolled oats
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior chocolate protein
";
directions:
1. Process all the above together, adding 1–2 tablespoons of water if you need the "dough" to be a little stickier.
  2. Then roll all that goodness into little balls (any size of bite that you choose) and store in a sealed container in the fridge!
  3. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Christmas may be over, but gingerbread cookies are forever! These high protein vegan chewy gingerbread cookies are so good, you’ll want them for breakfast!

My favorite part of this high-protein, vegan, chewy gingerbread cookie recipe is…. well, there’s so much I love about this recipe that choosing my favorite would be like Santa choosing his favorite reindeer! (ie. IMPOSSIBLE.)

This one-bowl recipe is easy, vegan, healthy, chewy, speedy and tasty. BUT, my most favorite trait of them all is the addition of the Sunwarrior Classic vanilla protein powder! Because the protein makes them not go right to your head (which means you can legitimately eat them moments after waking up from bed! Yes, they’re healthy enough to be a breakfast cookie!) And the addition of the plant-based protein means they’ll really fill you up so you wouldn’t even be able to eat more than like two in a sitting even if you tried really hard! Victory! (Plus, they obviously taste amazing.) (video here)
