articleSummaryHTML: Christmas may be over, but gingerbread cookies are forever! These high protein vegan chewy gingerbread cookies are so good, you’ll want them for breakfast!
seoTitle: High-Protein Vegan Chewy Gingerbread Cookies! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Christmas may be over, but gingerbread cookies are forever! These high protein vegan chewy gingerbread cookies are so good, you’ll want them for breakfast!
ingredients:
s:674:"
  • 1 cup spelt flour (or other flour of your choice)
  • 1 cup Sunwarrior plant protein powder
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon cloves
  • 1 teaspoon ginger
  • ½ cup almond butter
  • ½ cup molasses
  • ½ cup maple syrup
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F.
  2. Mix ALL ingredients together in one bowl. (Yep. Wet AND dry in one!!)
  3. Plop batter (or shape them nicely then place them) onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes.
  5. Remove from oven, let cool and dive in!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your vegan on with style in this avocado-no-egg salad. It’s creamy, dreamy delicious in all the right ways!

This recipe is a great substitute for the traditional egg salad. As with the traditional creamy mayonnaise dressing that is often added to egg salad, cashews and macadamia nuts provide an equally creamy alternative, and they make a great base for vegan mayonnaise. As avocados are similar to hardboiled eggs in texture, this recipe is not only easy to make but is delicious. You will be surprised how close in flavor that it tastes to the classic egg salad.

You can add this avocado-no-egg salad to your favorite raw or sprouted bread for a hearty lunch option. Or if you want to keep it light and are watching your carbohydrate consumption, lettuce leaves like romaine, collard, or kale are great replacements. Alternately, you can serve this as a dip with your favorite raw or vegan crackers or with vegetable sticks. Whichever way you decide to have it, you can’t go wrong with this recipe. It is versatile, easy, and quick to make and will have your taste buds dancing for joy.
articleSummaryHTML: Get your vegan on with style in this avocado-no-egg salad. It’s creamy, dreamy delicious in all the right ways!
seoTitle: Avocado No Egg Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Get your vegan on with style in this avocado-no-egg salad. It’s creamy, dreamy delicious in all the right ways!
ingredients:
s:1046:"
  • 4 avocados chopped
  • ½ sweet onion finely chopped
  • ½ red pepper
  • ½ yellow pepper
  • 1 ½ cups celery – chopped

Vegan Mayonnaise Dressing Ingredients

  • ½ cup cashew nuts or macadamia nuts
  • ½ teaspoon ground pepper
  • 1 teaspoon dry mustard
  • ½ tablespoon cumin powder
  • ½ teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 1 ½ teaspoons turmeric
  • 1/8 cup of lemon, juiced
  • 1/8 cup filtered water
  • 12 tablespoons fresh thyme finely chopped
  • ½ tablespoon honey (optional)
";
directions:
1. Blend the nuts, black pepper, dry mustard, cumin, salt, turmeric, lemon juice, water, thyme, and honey. Set aside.
  2. Chop avocados and place in a bowl.
  3. Finely chop onion, red and yellow pepper and celery. Add these ingredients to the avocado.
  4. Pour the dressing over the avocado, vegetables, and mix until well coated.
  5. Serve on your choice of salad leaves, crackers or sprouted bread.

Eat and Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Warm up your winter with this light and healthy vegan apple pecan pie. You’re welcome!

This pie is very light and healthy. It has no refined sugar and can easily be done gluten-free. It is also very quick and easy to make but most of all it is super delicious, and I bet it will be all be gone on the day you make it!
articleSummaryHTML: Warm up your winter with this light and healthy vegan apple pecan pie. You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Vegan Apple Pecan Pie
seoDescription: Warm up your winter with this light and healthy vegan apple pecan pie. You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:1161:"

Base

  • ¾ cup oat flour (use GF oats if making GF version)
  • ½ cup ground almonds
  • 4 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 5 tablespoons maple syrup
  • a pinch of salt

Apple Filling

  • 7–8 cups apples suitable for cooking
  • 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • juice squeezed from 1 lemon
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil

Pecan Topping

  • 1 cup pecans
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • a pinch of salt
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°. Lay a bottom of a 9-inch round cake tin with greaseproof paper and set aside.
  2. To make the base, place all ingredients in a big bowl and mix until dough forms; it should have the consistency of wet sand. Place the dough in the prepared cake tin and mold it to the bottom and to the sides of the tin so that it’s at least 1.5 inches tall. Spike the dough with a fork; place in the oven and bake for 10 min. Take out of the oven and set aside.
  3. While the base is baking, prepare the apples. Peel and core them and then chop into small cubes. Place a large pan over medium heat and put the apples in, then add the rest of the ingredients for the apple filling and cook for 10 min stirring occasionally.
  4. While the apples are cooking, prepare the pecan layer. Place a pan over medium heat and put the nuts in. Leave them in the pan over heat for about 5 minutes occasionally stirring so they don’t burn. Add the rest of the ingredients and cook for 3 more minutes.
  5. Place the apples evenly on top of the pre-baked base and top them with the pecans. Lower the oven temperature to  350 degrees and put the pie in the oven. Bake for 20-25 min until the pecans turn golden-brown. Serve hot or cold, both taste great!

articleTitle: Apple Pie Baked Oatmeal Cups: Vegan & Gluten Free
articleBodyHTML:
On the go breakfast full of health and energy for the vegan looking to start the day out right!

If you are looking for a quick, easy, and nutritious breakfast on the go during these crisp winter mornings, then these apple pie baked oatmeal cups are perfect for you. This recipe is vegan and gluten-free. It can also be made nut-free if you choose a non-dairy milk such as rice. After cooling, the oatmeal cups can be eaten right away or stored in the refrigerator for the following morning, or the week ahead.
articleSummaryHTML: On the go breakfast full of health and energy for the vegan looking to start the day out right!
seoTitle: Apple Pie Baked Oatmeal Cups: Vegan & Gluten Free
seoDescription: On the go breakfast full of health and energy for the vegan looking to start the day out right!
recipeName: Apple Pie Baked Oatmeal Cups: Vegan & Gluten Free
ingredients:
s:722:"
  • 2 cups of gluten-free steel cut oats (I used Bob’s Red Mill)
  • 1 cup non-dairy milk of your choice (I used almond-cashew blend)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior vanilla protein
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon allspice
  • ½ teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 apple of your choice, cored and diced (I used granny smith, but any variety will work)
  • 1 mashed banana
  • ½ cup applesauce
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 tablespoons milled flaxseed
  • ¼ cup maple syrup (adjust to desired sweetness)
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F and spray muffin tin with coconut oil or cooking spray of choice.
  2. In one bowl, combine oats, flaxseed, baking powder, cinnamon, allspice, and nutmeg.
  3. In another bowl, combine milk, protein, banana, applesauce, vanilla, and maple syrup.
  4. Once the wet ingredients are mixed well, add them to the dry ingredients.
  5. Stir wet and dry ingredients together, then add diced apple
  6. Pour ingredients evenly filling up the muffin tin.
  7. Bake for 25 minutes.
  8. Remove and let cool. Enjoy!!!!

Some good additional ingredients or toppings include ¼ cup of dried fruit, nuts, or seeds of your choice, coconut flakes, or cacao nibs/chocolate chips. The apple can also be subbed for 1 cup of pumpkin puree – or you can add pumpkin to this recipe as a fun addition.

articleBodyHTML:
Put a little zoodle fun in those chilly nights with vegan zoodle chili!

What a great way to lighten up a meal! Zoodles! Here’s a fun way to add more vegetables and texture to your meal. The best thing about this dish is the great fresh taste. Serves 6. Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: Put a little zoodle fun in those chilly nights with vegan zoodle chili!
seoTitle: Vegan Zoodle Chili
seoDescription: Put a little zoodle fun in those chilly nights with vegan zoodle chili!
ingredients:
s:810:"
  • 2 medium zucchinis for zoodling
  • 1 small onion, diced
  • 3 tomatoes, diced
  • 3 cups beans of choice
  • ¾ cup vegetable broth
  • 1 can tomato sauce
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons chili powder
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon ground coriander
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 1 large bay leaf (or two small)
  • pinch of salt and pepper
  • a touch of olive oil
";
directions:
1. In a medium pot sprinkle in olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic, onions, and tomatoes. Cook for a few minutes until soft. Add in spices, saving bay leaf until the last step. Stir until well combined. Add beans, vegetable broth, and tomato sauce. Stir over medium heat. Add in bay leaf and simmer for an hour or so. Adjust for more spices if you are wanting a little more heat.
  2. While chili is simmering, zoodle your zucchini. Add a small handful to bottom of your favorite chili bowl, add chili on top with a sprinkle of vegan cheese if desired.

articleBodyHTML:
School and work are tiring and hard sometimes. You need something delicious and healthy to recharge without sacrificing taste. That's where Sunwarrior comes in with granola bars!

Granola bars are an easy go-to favorite at our house. These delicious granola bars are loaded with healthy fats like peanut or almond butter. Oats are the main ingredient of granola bars which are also chock full of dietary fiber, protein, potassium, and iron. These granola bars will keep your kids (and you) fuller longer.

Granola bars are so delicious and versatile. You can add any dry fruit like raisins, raspberries or blueberries. Or add some coconut flakes, just make sure you take the same amount of oats out, so the granola bars don’t fall apart.

So, have fun and mix up some granola bars up for you and your kids. You won't regret it.
articleSummaryHTML: School and work are tiring and hard sometimes. You need something delicious and healthy to recharge without sacrificing taste. That's where Sunwarrior comes in with granola bars!
seoTitle: Homemade Granola Bars | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: School and work are tiring and hard sometimes. You need something delicious and healthy to recharge without sacrificing taste. That's where Sunwarrior comes in with granola bars!
ingredients:
s:960:"
  • 6 cups rolled oats (not quick oats)
  • 4 tablespoons melted coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 cup maple syrup
  • ½ cup peanut or almond butter
  • ¼ cup apple juice or water
  • 3 tablespoons molasses
  • 3 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1–½ cup crispy rice cereal
  • 1 cup flax seed
  • ¼ cup roughly chopped almonds
  • 1 cup chocolate chips (optional)
  • 1 cup craisins or other dried fruit
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus vanilla protein
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
  2. In a large bowl toss the oats, oil, and salt together. Spread mixture out on two large baking sheets and toast in oven for about 15 minutes. Watch them carefully; they can burn quickly. Stir about halfway through. Once the oats are done, let the oats cool down a bit on the baking sheets.
  3. Turn oven down to 325 degrees.
  4. In a medium-sized pot, add maple syrup, peanut butter, apple juice, and molasses and heat through. Mix in vanilla.
  5. Pour oats into the large bowl. Add the crispy rice, flaxseed, and almonds. Pour maple syrup mixture over oat mixture and mix well. Add craisins, chocolate chips, and Sunwarrior Classic Plus vanilla protein.
  6. Press into a large baking sheet. I usually take a measuring cup or regular cup and press firmly. If it isn’t pressed firmly, it will be tasty granola without the bar!
  7. Bake for 20 to 25 mins or until light golden brown. Cool completely then cut or break into bars or pieces.

articleBodyHTML:
Who doesn’t like desserts? Especially when those desserts are loaded with nature’s sweet health! Make a dozen or two and share these tasty truffles as you cozy around a fire!

You might think of truffles as round chocolaty bites with a jam, caramel, or soft, smooth chocolate inside. But these truffles are sure to make you think twice about healthy desserts. They’re loaded with omegas, fiber, and of course, sweetness. Not all of the desserts we eat have to be filled with processed sugars; these sure aren’t!

While you might love each ingredient listed here, you might not currently have them available at home. No need to worry, this recipe can be altered to what you currently have or can easily access at your nearest health food store. You’ll need four basic ingredients: nuts, seeds, dried fruit, and natural sweetness. If you’re allergic to any of these, substitute for chia seeds, oats, or cocoa nibs. You could even throw in a bit of dried unsweetened coconut flakes.

The options are endless! Explore the flavors you love and share them along with a hot cup of apple cider!
articleSummaryHTML: Who doesn’t like desserts? Especially when those desserts are loaded with nature’s sweet health! Make a dozen or two and share these tasty truffles as you cozy around a fire!
seoTitle: Raw Winter Truffles
seoDescription: Who doesn’t like desserts? Especially when those desserts are loaded with nature’s sweet health! Make a dozen or two and share these tasty truffles as you cozy around a fire!
ingredients:
s:555:"
  • 1 cup mixed raw nuts
  • ½ cup dried fruit (*I used dried berries.)
  • ¼ cup oats
  • 1 tablespoon hemp seeds
  • 1 tablespoon golden flaxseeds
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • Optional Topping: roll in cocoa powder
";
directions:
1. Add all ingredients to a food processor. Mix on high until completely ground together. It should look a bit chunky and sticky.
  2. Scoop out tablespoon sizes and roll into balls. You should have about 12 truffles, give or take.
  3. Refrigerator for about 5–7 minutes to harden. Roll in cocoa powder if you choose to.
  4. Enjoy! Don’t forget to share!

articleBodyHTML:
Chomp your chops into an amazing chopped salad. Making your own will save you a ton of money and taste exactly the way you want!

Chopped salads are just a spin on our traditional and at times boring leafy salad and cost a fortune when they are pre-made. But when you make it yourself, you can save money without sacrificing flavor.

One of the best ways to utilize that fresh produce is to create a fresh chopped salad. Some of the vegetables I used raw while the others I quickly placed in the pan to add another dimension to the flavors. This salad was missing one ingredient, one that many people turn their heads to in the grocery store. This ingredient is Jicama. Jicama is so refreshing and will take on any flavor, herb, and taste. Don’t be afraid to pick up this brown speckled oversized tuber. Jicama is incredible for your digestion as it has a high amount of fiber. One serving of Jicama can give you 40% of your dietary intake of Vitamin C for the entire day. Jicama is low in calorie and can be eaten cooked or raw. Don’t shy away from this vegetable, make it your friend. Jicamas can also be sliced into sticks can be used for dips or bake them into fries!

In the salad, we used an assortment of cucumbers, fresh herbs, carrots, asparagus, and tomatoes. The dressing is super light and made with very few ingredients. We utilized lime, pepper, avocado oil, and a dash of Himalayan salt.
articleSummaryHTML: Chomp your chops into an amazing chopped salad. Making your own will save you a ton of money and taste exactly the way you want!
seoTitle: Chopped Salad | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Chomp your chops into an amazing chopped salad. Making your own will save you a ton of money and taste exactly the way you want!
ingredients:
s:615:"
  • 1 cup Jicama, diced into cubes
  • 1 cup asparagus, diced into cubes
  • 3 large carrots, diced into cubes
  • 1 cup red pepper, diced into cubes
  • 1 cup cucumber, diced into cubes
  • 1 cup parsley, chopped finely
  • 3 limes, juiced
  • 1 tablespoon avocado oil
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
";
directions:
1.) Chop all ingredients and place in a bowl

2.) Mix lime juice, avocado oil, Himalayan salt, and pepper

3.) Drizzle dressing on top and place in fridge or eat immediately

articleTitle: Probiotic Power Sauerkraut N’ Dijon Vinaigrette
articleBodyHTML:
Power up with this probiotic power sauerkraut n’ dijon vinaigrette This tasty probiotic rich vinaigrette adds zip and life to your salad!

Salads! Everyone is eating them now. (Or so I like to think.) The trouble is most are dousing their salads with store-bought dressings that are anything but healthy. In fact, many contain hydrogenated vegetable oils, trans-fats, refined sugar, excess sodium, and numerous chemical preservatives and flavor enhancers. Plus, they taste like they are store-bought rather than flavored with the vibrant, sassy, slightly acidic, nutrient-infused, healthy fats, tasty blends of home-made creations.

If salads are a part of your diet, you need to ensure you are gracing those greens with quality dressings and vinaigrettes. Abundant in flavor and rich in probiotics, this vinaigrette will adorn most any salad wonderfully from straight up greens to a chopped veggie salad, greens and grains combos, and the full spectrum of beans. You can even use it to infuse tofu cubes with flavor for a vegan feta cheese alternative.

First, ensure you have the right juice! When shopping for your sauerkraut, be sure you are purchasing a raw, unpasteurized kraut. Great bonus if it is locally made. Health food stores and farmers markets or organic delivery services are your most likely option to find a quality product, and often there are various flavors and even veggie combos to choose from.
articleSummaryHTML: Power up with this probiotic power sauerkraut n’ dijon vinaigrette This tasty probiotic rich vinaigrette adds zip and life to your salad!
seoTitle: Probiotic Power Sauerkraut N’ Dijon Vinaigrette
seoDescription: Power up with this probiotic power sauerkraut n’ dijon vinaigrette This tasty probiotic rich vinaigrette adds zip and life to your salad!
recipeName: Probiotic Power Sauerkraut N’ Dijon Vinaigrette
ingredients:
s:652:"
  • ¼ cup juice from raw, unpasteurized sauerkraut
  • 1–2 teaspoons real Dijon mustard, to taste
  • 1/3 cup quality olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoons shallots, chopped
  • 1 small clove garlic, smashed
  • Fine grey sea salt, to taste
  • Fresh black pepper, to taste
  • 1–2 tablespoons fresh parsley or tarragon if available, chopped 
";
directions:
Measure all the ingredients in a glass jar with a lid and shake vigorously until emulsified. Give it a taste test adding more juice or olive oil if needed to appease your taste-buds. This is all about you!

If you prefer a creamy vinaigrette, consider whisking in a small mashed avocado or a few tablespoons nut or seed butter such as tahini.

articleBodyHTML:
Fabulous flavor is the show-stopping ingredient in this tofu mushroom stir-fry. Dinner’s ready!

Looking for something quick and healthy? With the warmer months ahead, this tasty, tofu mushroom stir-fry is just the recipe for you. Serve it with brown rice for a complete meal, or serve alone and skip the carbs if you want for a lighter dish. Serves 4.
articleSummaryHTML: Fabulous flavor is the show-stopping ingredient in this tofu mushroom stir-fry. Dinner’s ready!
seoTitle: Tofu Mushroom Stir Fry
seoDescription: Fabulous flavor is the show-stopping ingredient in this tofu mushroom stir-fry. Dinner’s ready!
ingredients:
s:678:"
  • ½ package natural pressed tofu, thinly sliced
  • 6 celery hearts, cut on diagonal
  • 5 fresh baby shiitake mushrooms, sliced
  • ½ cup dried wood ear mushroom, soaked until rehydrated and chopped
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 ½ tablespoons soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon cornstarch
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons water
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. On medium heat warm olive oil and garlic in a large skillet or wok.

2. Once the garlic is warmed, add celery, tofu, and mushroom. Cook under celery is softened. This just takes a couple of minutes.

3. Turn heat to low. Add soy sauce, cornstarch and a couple of tablespoons of water in a small bowl. Mix until combined. Add to vegetable mixture and still until incorporated, adding a small amount of additional water if necessary. This mixture creates a gentle glaze and adds additional flavor.  Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over brown rice if desired.

Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Spice up the cold months with a warming winter smoothie full of healing nutrients and warming spices like cinnamon and turmeric!

Smoothies don’t necessarily have to be cold or have a lot of fruit in them to sweeten them up. This smoothie uses room temperature nut milk, so it’s perfect for the cold winter months. By incorporating warming spices like cinnamon and turmeric into your smoothie, you will balance your blood sugar and warm your body from the inside out!

​Serves 2
articleSummaryHTML: Spice up the cold months with a warming winter smoothie full of healing nutrients and warming spices like cinnamon and turmeric!
seoTitle: Warming Winter Smoothie
seoDescription: Spice up the cold months with a warming winter smoothie full of healing nutrients and warming spices like cinnamon and turmeric!
ingredients:
s:573:"

 

  • 1 ½ cups coconut milk
  • 1 ½ cups filtered water
  • 1–2 tablespoons almond butter
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla
  • 1 tablespoon hemp seeds
  • 1 banana
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon mesquite
";
directions:
1. Soak your nuts for 2–8 hours in filtered water.

2. Rinse your nuts in a strainer and add to blender with 2–4 cups of water. Blend until creamy and then set aside in a separate jar.

3. Pour 1–2 cups of milk (unless you are doubling the recipe) into a blender and then add in the remaining ingredients (double ingredients if doubling the recipe).

4. Blend until combined and it’s a creamy golden color.

articleTitle: Green Tea Detox and Almond Cocoa
articleBodyHTML:
Boost your immune system and detox with these anti-inflammatory and warming winter drinks! 

Tea is great, especially green tea for antioxidants, dandelion tea for detoxifying purposes, and chamomile for calming and relaxation. Adding freshly squeezed lemon, honey, and apple cider vinegar will allow your body to absorb even more nutrients. Turmeric, ginger, and cinnamon are all also very tasty to add to tea or hot water. For mornings, my favorite detoxifying and immune boosting drink is one full of nutrients and nourishment. At night (or anytime) my favorite anti-inflammatory seasonal drink is a “superfood hot chocolate.” Today I'm giving you both recipes to keep you healthy day and night!
articleSummaryHTML: Boost your immune system and detox with these anti-inflammatory and warming winter drinks!
seoTitle: Green Tea Detox and Almond Cocoa
seoDescription: Boost your immune system and detox with these anti-inflammatory and warming winter drinks!
recipeName: Green Tea Detox and Almond Cocoa
ingredients:
s:973:"

Green Tea Detox

  • 1 green tea bag
  • 1 tablespoon honey
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
  • Freshly squeezed lemon juice
  • Cinnamon
  • Turmeric
  • Ginger

Almond Cocoa

  • 1 cup warm almond milk (or any milk of choice)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Chocolate protein
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 1 tablespoon maca powder
  • Cinnamon
  • Ginger
  • Nutmeg
  • Turmeric
";
directions:
Green Tea Detox

  1. Brew tea, mix and enjoy!

Almond Cocoa

  1. Heat almond milk, add powders and enjoy warm!

Most importantly, do what you can to be happy and healthy so that you can enjoy life with your loved ones!

articleBodyHTML:
Whether your New Year’s resolution was to lose weight, gain muscle, eat more greens, or simply stay healthy and fight off colds, the ultimate green smoothie is for you!

This ultimate green smoothie is perfect to help you meet your goals. Even for the most balanced diets, smoothies are a great way to pack in additional vitamins and nutrients you might be overlooking. It is easy to add oils, powders, fruits, and vegetables into a blender when you wouldn’t normally eat them otherwise. This is one of my favorite green smoothie recipes, and it can be a base if you would like to add any additional fruits, powders, or vitamins you might have on hand. Smoothies are also a great way to use up produce that you have in your house. You can add any fruits you’d like to this recipe, switch an apple for a pear, swap spinach for kale, or even add a caffeine boost with some matcha powder – the options are endless. The key is to get all of these nutrients in and personalize the recipe to help you meet your goals.
articleSummaryHTML: Whether your New Year’s resolution was to lose weight, gain muscle, eat more greens, or simply stay healthy and fight off colds, the ultimate green smoothie is for you!
seoTitle: The Ultimate Green Smoothie
seoDescription: Whether your New Year’s resolution was to lose weight, gain muscle, eat more greens, or simply stay healthy and fight off colds, the ultimate green smoothie is for you!
ingredients:
s:1184:"
  • 1 cup spinach
  • 1 apple of choice
  • 1 banana
  • ½ avocado
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 1 tsp black seed oil
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Liquid Light
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Vitamin Mineral Rush
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Super Greens
  • 1 tablespoon flaxseed
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric
  • 1 teaspoon ginger (freshly grated or powder)
  • ¼ cup almond milk (or milk of choice)
  • Splash of water 
";
directions: Add all ingredients to your blender and blend until smooth! If you would like it to be even colder, try blending in ice cubes or frozen acai puree. Enjoy as a tasty breakfast, post-workout snack, or afternoon pick-me-up????

articleBodyHTML:
For a delicious and healthy treat packed with protein and good fats, you need a little peanut butter chocolate fudge! 

This indulgent fudge is very easy to make, and it tastes absolutely amazing! It only requires a few simple ingredients and very little preparation time. It makes a delicious and healthy treat packed with protein and good fats. After making it, you can store it in the freezer for a long time and enjoy whenever you get a sweet craving. You just have to try it!
articleSummaryHTML: For a delicious and healthy treat packed with protein and good fats, you need a little peanut butter chocolate fudge!
seoTitle: Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge
seoDescription: For a delicious and healthy treat packed with protein and good fats, you need a little peanut butter chocolate fudge!
ingredients:
s:413:"
  • 5 ½ ounces desiccated coconut
  • ½ cup coconut oil
  • 9 ounces peanut butter
  • a pinch of salt (optional, depending on how salty your peanut butter is)
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 ounces dark chocolate
";
directions:
1. Put the desiccated coconut in a food processor or a high-speed blender and blend until creamy and smooth butter is formed – this may take up to ten minutes, and you might need to scrape down the sides while blending.
  2. In the meantime, prepare a standard loaf tin and lay it with greaseproof paper, then set aside.
  3. Melt the coconut oil and set aside to cool.
  4. When the coconut butter is formed, add peanut butter and blend until smooth.
  5. Add melted coconut oil and maple syrup and blend again until a smooth mass is formed. It should have a pourable consistency. Taste the mass and add more maple syrup or salt if needed.
  6. Finely chop the chocolate, then add to the mass and mix gently. Pour the mass into the prepared tin and put in the freezer on an even surface for about 20–30 minutes until firm.
  7. Take out of the freezer and use a hot knife to slice it into even squares. Enjoy right away or store in the fridge for up to ten days, or in the freezer for up to three months (if frozen, let soften at room temperature for about 5 minutes before eating).

articleTitle: Mocha Chia Nut Bowl: Keto Diet Style!
articleBodyHTML:
Show your good taste by eating a smoothie bowl that tastes good! And if you’re on a keto diet, this recipe is just the thing you need!

From online recipes to raw and vegan restaurants offering them on their menus, the smoothie bowl has become a popular morning breakfast option. However, this recipe is not exactly a classic smoothie bowl as it does not contain the fruit that usually is the base for smoothie bowls. If you are watching your sugar intake, experimenting with a Ketogenic diet or just want to try something different from the traditional smoothie bowl, this filling and satisfying bowl is for you.

This mocha chia nut bowl has you covered for protein because of the various seeds, almond butter, and Sunwarrior Protein. You can use any raw nut or seeds to make your own nut milk and add any toppings that you wish.

This mocha chia nut bowl makes a great breakfast, snack, or dessert that is high in calcium, iron, magnesium, and omega fatty acids. When you’re craving something warm and comforting, come to the bowl that contains lots of different textures and flavors to enjoy.

Be creative with how you serve your bowl and have fun with it.
articleSummaryHTML: Show your good taste by eating a smoothie bowl that tastes good! And if you’re on a keto diet, this recipe is just the thing you need!
seoTitle: Mocha Chia Nut Bowl: Keto Diet Style!
seoDescription: Show your good taste by eating a smoothie bowl that tastes good! And if you’re on a keto diet, this recipe is just the thing you need!
recipeName: Mocha Chia Nut Bowl: Keto Diet Style!
ingredients:
s:885:"
  • ½ cup coconut milk
  • ½ scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein mocha
  • 1 tablespoon almond butter
  • 1 drop food grade peppermint essential oil
  • ¼ cup mixed nuts and seeds (walnuts, pecans, pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, black sesame seeds, hemp seeds)
  • 1 tablespoon cacao nibs
  • 2 tablespoons coconut Kefir or yogurt
  • 2 tablespoons chia gel
  • 1 tablespoon coconut butter
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla essence or powder
  • 1 tablespoon Lakanto Monkfruit sweetener
";
directions:
1. Heat the coconut milk just until warm. Do not boil or overheat.
  2. In a blender, add the coconut milk, almond butter, peppermint oil, and mocha protein powder and Lakanto Monkfruit sweetener; mix until a smooth consistency is achieved.
  3. Pour the coconut milk base into a bowl, add the toppings, and drizzle with vanilla essence.

articleBodyHTML:
Avocado Madness: Good Fat is the New Fad! But unlike other fads, this one is here to stay because the avocado is full of all the things you need! Getting it in a smoothie is even better!

Fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and protein have a great reputation in the food world. But fat is a word that doesn’t have such a great reputation, which makes sense since having unhealthy fat in your body is not good. Eating bad fats such as saturated foods; corn syrup, ice cream, white sugar, butter, and whip cream is not good as well.

Nature has created several perfect combinations.

Carbohydrates

Banana, dates, peaches and other natural sugar-based fruits are perfect forms of carbohydrates.

Proteins

Spinach, beans, nuts, and seeds are fantastic forms of proteins.

Fats

And like the protein and carbohydrate, fat has its perfect form found in avocado, flaxseed, fish oil, and Brazil nuts.

Eating a healthy diet involves a perfect combination of good carbohydrates, protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals.

Avocado, also known as the butter fruit is loaded with essential vitamins and minerals such as Vitamin K, folate, potassium, Vitamin B6 and is packed with fiber, protein, and healthy monounsaturated fats. Monounsaturated fats, unlike saturated fats, are medium-chained and primarily obtained from oleic acid (same as found in olive oil) which is known to reduce blood pressure, cholesterol, and remove inflammation.  Consuming good fats also improves your skin, hair, joint lubrication, and also enhances mood and brain functions.

Not sure how to get more healthy fat into your diet? Start with a smoothie!
articleSummaryHTML: Avocado Madness: Good Fat is the New Fad! But unlike other fads, this one is here to stay because the avocado is full of all the things you need! Getting it in a smoothie is even better!
seoTitle: Avocado Madness Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Avocado Madness: Good Fat is the New Fad! But unlike other fads, this one is here to stay because the avocado is full of all the things you need! Getting it in a smoothie is even better!
ingredients:
s:524:"

 

  • 1 cup almond milk
  • ½ avocado, ripened
  • 1 banana
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 3–4 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
";
directions:
1. Using a knife remove the pit from avocado
  2. Scoop out the avocado from the skin
  3. Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy
  4. Enjoy!

It is a great way to add healthy fats to your diet and the best way to get your pre or post workout meal.

articleBodyHTML:
Warm up your soul with this spectacularly cozy vegan split pea soup! Full of vitamins and flavor, this is the soup to warm you from the inside out!

There’s nothing I crave more than a warm bowl of soup on a frigid day. Split Pea is one of my absolute favorite types of soup, but it’s not always easy to find a version that I can eat. The problem is that many places that serve Split Pea soup either put ham in the recipe, cook the soup with ham bones, or use chicken stock as the base. As a non-meat eater, this limits the opportunities I have to enjoy one of my favorite soups. That’s why I decided to create a vegan version that is lighter and just as flavorful. Peas are packed with vitamins and have a slew of health benefits, so why not be good to your body while eating something tasty? This recipe is super easy to make and will last all week long, so grab your peas, and let’s get cooking!
articleSummaryHTML: Warm up your soul with this spectacularly cozy vegan split pea soup! Full of vitamins and flavor, this is the soup to warm you from the inside out!
seoTitle: Vegan Split Pea Soup
seoDescription: Warm up your soul with this spectacularly cozy vegan split pea soup! Full of vitamins and flavor, this is the soup to warm you from the inside out!
ingredients:
s:794:"
  • 6 cups of low sodium vegetable broth (organic if possible)
  • 2 cups of green split peas (*these are dried and are found in bags usually by the canned goods section)
  • 2–3 stocks of celery (chopped)
  • 1 cup of carrots (chopped)
  • 1 large onion (chopped)
  • 3 cloves of garlic (minced)
  • 3 dried basil leaves (chopped)
  • 1–2 tablespoons turmeric
  • 1 tablespoon ginger
  • 1 teaspoon pink Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon of black pepper 
";
directions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a full boil
  2. Once boiled, reduce heat and cover
  3. Simmer the mixture for one hour and fifteen minutes, stirring occasionally
  4. Cool the mixture for 15–20 minutes
  5. Pour mixture into a blender and puree (make sure you break the mixture up into a few small batches and blend thoroughly. The consistency should be very smooth with no chunks)
  6. Pour puree into another fresh pot and repeat until the entire mixture is completely puréed.
  7. Reheat on stovetop for a few minutes before serving
  8. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Dinner is not greener on the other side when you’re cooking with collards! So, sauté some collards with Portobello mushrooms and live the high life!

If you are stuck on spinach and broccoli as a side or your main green vegetable, it’s time to shake things up a bit! The next time you are at your local grocery store or farmers market, I challenge you to get some collard greens (if they are in season and preferably organic). They are a wonderful green to get into the mix as they are a great source of vitamin C and soluble fiber and contain multiple nutrients with potent anti-cancer properties. Also, the fibrous texture of collards makes them great for sautéing and being used as a wrap for burgers and other sandwiches. Hopefully, you can make greens part of your weekly rotation of greens; you won’t regret it!
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner is not greener on the other side when you’re cooking with collards! So, sauté some collards with Portobello mushrooms and live the high life!
seoTitle: Sautéed Collards with Portobello Mushrooms
seoDescription: Dinner is not greener on the other side when you’re cooking with collards! So, sauté some collards with Portobello mushrooms and live the high life!
ingredients:
s:472:"
  • ¾ pound collard greens (6–7 cups chopped)
  • ¼ cup water
  • 2 teaspoons minced garlic
  • 1⁄3 cup thinly sliced scallions
  • 2–3 Portobello mushrooms, cut into thin slices
  • Olive oil to taste at the end
  • Salt to taste
";
directions:
1. Wash collards remove stalks and stack 4–5 leaves. Roll like a cigar and slice into thin ribbons.

2. To cook collards, place water in a skillet with a lid. Bring to a boil and add the prepared collards. Cover and cook over high heat for 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain in a colander and set aside.

3. Heat the oil in the same skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and scallions and sauté for about 30 seconds. Turn the heat to medium-high and add the mushrooms and a pinch of sea salt to draw out some liquid. Cook for 5–6 minutes, constantly stirring until mushrooms are tender.

4. Reduce heat to low, stir in cooked collards, cover and cook for 1–2 minutes until hot.

Special tip! To get the stalk/stem out of collards just lay them face side down on a cutting board and run your knife along both sides of the stem. This will help you to remove it to make the collard easier to chop, prep and eat.

articleBodyHTML:
Zucchini brownies! These are delicious, healthy, and so easy and simple to make you could do it in your sleep!

In these brownies, you won’t even know the zucchini is there because you puree it down. It makes the brownies so moist and tender. It is a very thick batter until you add the zucchini. These brownies are great for travel. They don’t fall apart, and best of all they are healthy! Zucchini is loaded with many vitamins like C, A, B6, folate, and many others. It is low in saturated fat and high in anti-inflammatory properties. The whole wheat flour is high in protein and dietary fiber, and it’s more sustaining than its boring white counterpart. You can sneak zucchini into these brownies, and the enjoyer will be none the wiser.
articleSummaryHTML: Zucchini brownies! These are delicious, healthy, and so easy and simple to make you could do it in your sleep!
seoTitle: Vegan Zucchini Brownies
seoDescription: Zucchini brownies! These are delicious, healthy, and so easy and simple to make you could do it in your sleep!
ingredients:
s:716:"
  • 2 flax eggs (2 tablespoons ground flaxseed + 6 tablespoons water)
  • 1 cup coconut sugar
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
  • 1 cup whole wheat flour
  • 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed
  • 6 tablespoons cocoa powder
  • ¼ teaspoon baking soda
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • 2 cups packed, grated zucchini
  • ½ cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
";
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8x8 pan and set aside.

Next, take grated zucchini and puree it in a food processor until almost liquid. Set aside.

Whisk the eggs, sugar, oil, and vanilla in a medium-size bowl. Then add flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Mix well. The batter will be very thick. Add zucchini and mix well. Then add chocolate chips if using.

Pour into prepared pan and bake for about 40 mins or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with moist crumbs.

Let brownies cool before eating.

articleBodyHTML:
Put the spice of life back into dinner with this Portobello mushroom curry that is as healthy as it is tasty!

Peanut butter is one of those magical ingredients that tastes good in about everything it comes into contact with. It’s creamy, rich, and packed with protein. Typically, curry utilizes an abundance of different spices and curry pastes to bring flavor to the dish. We wanted to spice up this recipe by adding a dollop of healthy fats and taste. Most of the time, curry recipes have a list of 20 or more ingredients that at times seems very daunting at first glance. We wanted to simplify the traditional curry, and it’s a fan favorite. This dish is perfectly balance with ginger, garlic, and onion with the meatiness of the Portobello mushrooms. This dish is perfect for a quick weeknight dinner. You can double up the recipe and store the rest for lunch the next day. Serve this dish alongside a beautiful mango salad and any grain of choice, and you will have a restaurant quality meal.

Adding more healthy fats into your diet can help control appetite and weight. The metabolic benefits of eating more fat are so incredible for the body. Helping you stay satiated and full of energy without crashing is one of the best benefits. We, as a society, are bombarded with low-fat and low-calorie products in our supermarkets. The problem is that they are high in carbohydrates and sugar which leads to a major crash in energy only after an hour or two. This can lead to overeating. The best sources of healthy fats come from avocados, olive oil, seeds such as chia or hemp, coconut oil, nuts, and cacao nibs.

You can play around with this recipe by adding a variety of vegetables such as cauliflower or broccoli. You can swap out the peanut butter and replace it with almond butter if there is a peanut allergy.
articleSummaryHTML: Put the spice of life back into dinner with this Portobello mushroom curry that is as healthy as it is tasty!
seoTitle: Portobello Mushroom Curry
seoDescription: Put the spice of life back into dinner with this Portobello mushroom curry that is as healthy as it is tasty!
ingredients:
s:683:"
  • 1 can full-fat coconut milk
  • 1 tablespoon peanut butter
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 tablespoon tamarind paste
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 onion, sliced thinly
  • 2 garlic cloves, diced finely
  • 1 ginger, 1-inch thickness, grated
  • 3 Portobello mushrooms, sliced
  • 2 cups collard greens, sliced
  • ½ teaspoon Himalayan salt and pepper
";
directions:
1. Heat a large skillet over medium with 1 tablespoon coconut oil. Add garlic, onion, and ginger. Let this cook for 3 minutes. Add Portobello mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes. Add cumin, salt, and pepper
  2. Add coconut milk, peanut butter, and tamarind paste. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add collard greens at the end and cook for 2 more minutes
  3. Remove from heat and serve over grain of choice

articleBodyHTML:
Forget your soy allergy because there are options to have your tofu and eat it, too! This Burmese tofu shows you the way be teaching you to make your own soy-free!

Many people have soy allergies, and some may not even know it! For me being vegan, I discovered I have an allergy to soy, too! I had been regularly eating many foods my body has a sensitivity to. My Natural Healing Doctor ultimately found that I had fungi in one of my intestines and that fungi feeds off of many things, but especially fermented foods like soy, kombucha, and sauerkraut. As a vegan, I consumed soy products daily: tofu, tempeh, liquid aminos, and edamame. Fungi also feeds off sugar and vinegar, which didn’t help since I was consuming apple cider vinegar daily! Once I began an entire protocol to kill off this fungus, my body looked and completely felt different!

So, whether or not you have a sensitivity to soy like me, I hope you enjoy this completely soy-free and fermented-free tofu, knowing that it still contains all the protein for those plant-based gains! So here is a recipe where you can still indulge with tofu because its 100% soy-free. It serves eight people and is ready in fifteen minutes!
articleSummaryHTML: Forget your soy allergy because there are options to have your tofu and eat it, too! This Burmese tofu shows you the way be teaching you to make your own soy-free!
seoTitle: Burmese Tofu
seoDescription: Forget your soy allergy because there are options to have your tofu and eat it, too! This Burmese tofu shows you the way be teaching you to make your own soy-free!
ingredients:
s:343:"
  • 2 cups chickpea flour
  • 6 cups water divided
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric
  • *optional ½ teaspoon seasonings of garlic powder, onion powder, paprika or turmeric
";
directions:
1. In a medium saucepan, take 3 of the cups of water and bring to boil in a saucepan.
  2. Take a mixing bowl and whisk the flour with desired seasonings and salt. Then add the rest of the measured water and thoroughly mix.
  3. Once completely combined, add mixture to boiling water and continue to which for 5 minutes on medium heat.
  4. After the 5 minutes, the mixture should have thickened up and transfer to either a loaf pan or an 8 X 8 baking dish.

articleBodyHTML:
Snickers Pie: So good with healthier ingredients, it’ll make you snicker with glee! We’re sure that queen wouldn’t have lost her head if she’d said, “Let them eat pie!”

We all know that peanuts, caramel, and chocolate are the best combo in the world, right? The thing is though it’s usually the worst option if you’re looking to eat healthily. Thankfully, with this wonderful pie, you can fully indulge in this heavenly flavor without any of the nasty stuff because there simply is no nasty stuff! This delicious pie is made with all natural ingredients, and it tastes so good you won’t believe that all this healthy stuff you’ve just put together turned into the most indulgent dessert.
articleSummaryHTML: Snickers Pie: So good with healthier ingredients, it’ll make you snicker with glee! We’re sure that queen wouldn’t have lost her head if she’d said, “Let them eat pie!”
seoTitle: Vegan Snickers Pie
seoDescription: Snickers Pie: So good with healthier ingredients, it’ll make you snicker with glee! We’re sure that queen wouldn’t have lost her head if she’d said, “Let them eat pie!”
ingredients:
s:930:"

Base

  • ¾ cup oat flour (you can simply make it by blending oat flakes in a food processor or high-speed blender, use gluten-free oats if needed)
  • ½ cup ground almonds
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 2 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • a pinch of salt

Filling

  • 16–17 pitted Medjool dates (or other soft variety)
  • 1/3 cup almond milk
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons peanut butter
  • a pinch of salt
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 7 oz. dark chocolate
  • 1 ¼ cups roasted & salted peanuts
  • Optional: 1/2 scoop Sunwarrior Classic Plus Chocolate
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Lay the bottom of a round 9-inch cake tin with greaseproof paper and set aside.
  2. In a large bowl, place all ingredients for the base and mix thoroughly until dough forms. It should have the consistency of wet sand.
  3. Mold the dough to the bottom and the sides of the prepared tin so that it is around 2 inches tall on the sides. Spike the base with a fork and place the tin in the oven. Bake for 15 min, take out and set aside.
  4. While the base is baking, prepare the filling. Place the dates in a food processor, add almond milk, maple syrup, peanut butter, and salt and blend until smooth and creamy caramel forms.
  5. In a saucepan heat, coconut oil then add chocolate and melt on low heat while occasionally stirring not to burn it.
  6. Spread 1/3 of the melted chocolate on the bottom of the baked base, and then transfer all of the date caramel on top and even with a spatula. Place the peanuts on top and finish with the remaining chocolate.
  7. Put in the fridge to set; it should be ready to serve after an hour. Store in the fridge for up to 5 days. You can also freeze it and then simply take out one hour before serving.

articleBodyHTML:
A hug in a mug! Warm your toes by the fire, and warm your hands by wrapping them around a mug of hot vegan mocha cocoa!

This mug of cocoa covers your most important nutrition bases with superfoods like baobab, chia, flax, whole grain brown rice, kelp, holy basil, guava, and coconut, to name just a few that all come together in illumin8. Clean protein, the best gluten-free carbohydrates from, healthy fats, minerals, fiber, natural vitamins, enzymes, and probiotics. We’ve got it all. And it tastes . . . well . . . like a hug in a mug! Which is to say fantastic!
articleSummaryHTML: A hug in a mug! Warm your toes by the fire, and warm your hands by wrapping them around a mug of hot vegan mocha cocoa!
seoTitle: Morning Mocha Cocoa
seoDescription: A hug in a mug! Warm your toes by the fire, and warm your hands by wrapping them around a mug of hot vegan mocha cocoa!
ingredients:
s:610:"
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • ½ scoop Sunwarrior illumin8 chocolate
  • 1 ½ tablespoons dairy-free chocolate
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
  • 1/8 teaspoon peppermint extract (optional)
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior illumin8 mocha
";
directions:
Heat almond milk over low heat in a saucepan. Add all other ingredients and mix well. Remove from heat. Pour into your favorite mug, top with coconut whipped cream, and sprinkle nutmeg, cacao, or cinnamon over the top.

Enjoy your vegan hot cocoa!

*This makes one mug, but since cocoa is best with friends, double or triple or quadruple the recipe and let the mug hugs commence!

articleBodyHTML:
You don’t have to have a significant other to feel the love of these chocolate bite desserts, but if you do have a significant other, you should probably share.

You may love chocolate simply because it tastes amazing. You may love it because it’s so abundant in healthful properties. You may love it because high-quality chocolate isn’t as caloric as its sugar-laden wanna-be versions are, maybe you crave it for the magnesium and maybe, just maybe, it’s because it’s a known aphrodisiac. Welcome to Valentine’s Day.

Whatever the reason, I tend to choose chocolate and cacao treats over most others, and I know I’m not alone. Bittersweet is best for my palate, yet these are a touch sweeter due to the dates. This recipe makes 12–16 bites.
articleSummaryHTML: You don’t have to have a significant other to feel the love of these chocolate bite desserts, but if you do have a significant other, you should probably share.
seoTitle: Vegan Love Bites Chocolate Desserts
seoDescription: You don’t have to have a significant other to feel the love of these chocolate bite desserts, but if you do have a significant other, you should probably share.
ingredients:
s:694:"
  • 12–16 Medjool dates, pitted, sliced open on one side
  • ¼ cup hazelnut butter
  • 2 tablespoons almond meal
  • 3 tablespoons raw cacao powder
  • 16 hazelnuts, toasted and skinned ideally

Chocolate Coating

  • 4 ½ ounces dairy-free organic dark chocolate, 76% or higher, finely chopped
  • 2 tablespoons coconut cream or 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • Fleur de sel salt 
";
directions:
1. Combine all the filling ingredients but the hazelnuts and fill each date with a teaspoon. Stuff a hazelnut into each date and press together to stick
  2. Set on parchment paper and prepare the chocolate coating.
  3. Heat a double boiler of water to a low simmer. Add the chocolate and coconut oil to another pot and place over the water ensuring the pot doesn’t touch the water. Gently stir until it's melted then remove from heat and either pour evenly over top of each of the dates or using tongs, dunk each date into the chocolate, gently shake off excess and place on parchment paper
  4. Sprinkle each date with fleur de sel, espresso powder, or cayenne. A few of each is my favorite way to make them. Life is like a box of chocolates: sometimes sweet, sometimes bitter, sometimes spicy, and often a combination. Keep chilled until serving.

TERI’S TIPS:

Add a few tablespoons cognac or spiced rum to the chocolate mixture if desired.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your vegan keto on in the sweetest way possible with this berry pudding that will provide you with your healthy fats and protein.

The ketogenic diet is eating foods that are low in carbs and high in fats. A keto diet can help with your energy levels if you're feeling sluggish and slow. But there are many other health benefits to the ketogenic diet as well. If you’re doing a keto diet to lose weight or to combat an illness, or if you're trying to improve the health of your brain or manage your blood sugar, the key is keeping it healthy. And this vegan keto berry pudding will help you do exactly that: be healthy! Make some up for yourself and enjoy the satisfaction of food that tastes fantastic and that will leave you working at your best!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your vegan keto on in the sweetest way possible with this berry pudding that will provide you with your healthy fats and protein.
seoTitle: Vegan Keto Berry Pudding
seoDescription: Get your vegan keto on in the sweetest way possible with this berry pudding that will provide you with your healthy fats and protein.
ingredients:
s:465:"
  • 1 avocado
  • 3 tablespoons chia
  • 16 oz. coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons Lakanto Monkfruit Sweetener
  • 1 ½ scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend berry protein
  • 1–2 teaspoons coconut oil
";
directions:
1. Soak the chia seeds for at least fifteen minutes (make sure the chia seeds aren’t watery but full and plump)
  2. Place all ingredients into a blender and blend away!
  3. Pour into your favorite bowl and top with berries and chia seeds
  4. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML: The keto diet doesn’t have to be complicated if you’re vegan.  These vegan keto stuffed avocado tacos are keto and vegan-friendly, but best of all they taste like a dinner win!
articleSummaryHTML: The keto diet doesn’t have to be complicated if you’re vegan.  These vegan keto stuffed avocado tacos are keto and vegan-friendly, but best of all they taste like a dinner win!
seoTitle: Vegan Keto Stuffed Avocado Tacos
seoDescription: The keto diet doesn’t have to be complicated if you’re vegan.  These vegan keto stuffed avocado tacos are keto and vegan-friendly, but best of all they taste like a dinner win!
ingredients:
s:983:"
  • 6 avocados
  • ½ cup Bob’s Red Mill TVP (Textured Vegetable Protein)
  • ½ cup hot water
  • ½ teaspoon chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon paprika
  • ¼ teaspoon garlic powder
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • ½ red onion, chopped
  • 2 Roma tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 jalapeno, chopped
  • ½ cup cilantro, chopped
  • 3 limes (two juiced, one sliced into wedges)
  • 1 teaspoon minced garlic
  • ½ cup almond milk
";
directions:
Cilantro Lime Dressing

  1. Peel two of the avocados and remove pits. Cut them into chunks.
  2. Put the chunks into a blender along with 2 tablespoons of lime juice, 1 teaspoon minced garlic, 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro, and ½ cup almond milk. Blend until dressing is creamy and smooth. Add more almond milk to desired thickness. Set aside.

Stuffed Avocado

  1. Prepare the TVP by placing it in a medium-sized mixing bowl along with hot water, chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and sea salt. Mix the ingredients together and let sit so the TVP can soak in the water and spice flavors.
  2. Slice the remaining four avocados in half and remove the pit. Leave the skin on. Cover exposed avocado with part of the lime juice to prevent browning.
  3. In a separate mixing bowl, mix together the chopped tomatoes, jalapeno, remaining cilantro, coconut oil, and remaining lime juice.
  4. Once the TVP is ready, fluff it up with a fork and combine with the tomato mixture. Mix together.
  5. Place TVP mixture inside the hollow of each avocado. Make sure to heap it so it is a liberal serving for each avocado.
  6. Drizzle with the cilantro lime dressing and garnish with a wedge of lime, halved cherry tomatoes or chopped Roma tomatoes, and a bit of cilantro.
  7. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Hearts, kisses, and chocolate! The avocado fat-bomb wins for a Valentine's treat that is vegan and keto friendly! You’re welcome!

I absolutely love the holiday season. It’s always a time to get creative in the kitchen and come up with new recipes for loved ones and friends. Why not make something that is sweet but also extremely healthy. What better way to show the ones you love that you love them than with a dessert that’s actually good for their health?

With the emergence of high-fat diets such as keto and paleo, there has been an influx of “fat bombs” on the market. Many people are experimenting with ditching the carbohydrates and replacing them with healthy fats such as avocado, nuts, seeds, and healthy oils. The reasoning is that fats keep you satiated longer than carbohydrates. Healthy fats will not make you gain weight, but eating heavily saturated fats such as fried foods and ice cream will. Healthy fats can give you that boost of energy needed to sustain you through the day.

These avocado fat-bombs are very simple to make. They take all of 20 minutes from start to finish without having to bake them. All you need to do is pop them in the fridge, and you are all set. This recipe is gluten free, low carb, guilt-free, and vegan. These avocado fat-bombs are oh so yummy!

The key to getting the exterior of these avocado fat-bombs are the molds. I bought a half-dome chocolate mold which I found at a bulk food store. They are made of silicone so it’s easy to pop the chocolates in and out. These are available in various shapes and sizes so if you don't love a half dome, you can opt for a square or a heart! Make sure to spray the mold with coconut oil before pouring the first layer of chocolate in, just to ensure it doesn't stick.
articleSummaryHTML: Hearts, kisses, and chocolate! The avocado fat-bomb wins for a Valentine's treat that is vegan and keto friendly! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Keto Avocado Fat Bombs
seoDescription: Hearts, kisses, and chocolate! The avocado fat-bomb wins for a Valentine's treat that is vegan and keto friendly! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:678:"
  • ½ cup vegan chocolate
  • ¼ cup unsweetened coconut
  • 2 avocados, ripe
  • 1 tablespoon cocoa butter or coconut butter
  • 1 ½ tablespoons cocoa powder
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 2 tablespoons lakanto monkfruit sweetener, golden
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1. Spray your silicone baking molds with nonstick spray or rub with 1 tablespoon of coconut oil.
  2. Melt ½ cup vegan chocolate in the microwave for 30 seconds. Stir. Return to microwave and microwave another 20 seconds or until completely melted. Stir in coconut.
  3. Carefully pour chocolate into the mold, making sure to spread the chocolate all the way up to the lid of the mold. You want the entire base to covered to create a shell. Pop into the fridge for 30 minutes to set.
  4. In the meantime, place avocado, cocoa butter, cocoa powder, protein, monkfruit sweetener, and salt in a food processor. Mix until smooth
  5. Remove mold from the fridge. Pour avocado mixture into each mold. Return to fridge for 30 minutes
  6. Melt remaining ½ cup chocolate in the microwave (step 1). Pour chocolate on top of avocado mixture and smooth out with a spoon. Return to fridge for 45 minutes to set.
  7. Carefully remove chocolates from mold and place in the fridge.
  8. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
How do you say Happy Valentine’s Day? Say it with healthier treats that are made by you! Because Valentine’s Day should be about the personal touch!

Valentines is a special time around my house. It’s gift cards and cookies, chocolate and cakes, kisses and love. We love to sit around and eat our favorite cookies, embrace one another, and appreciate the good times together. In all of that love, we also bake. Shortbread cookies are among one of the top picks for Valentine’s day. Creating a cookie that delicious and healthy for us wasn’t too challenging. Swapping out some unhealthy ingredients with others and voila, the perfect heart-shaped cookie was created. These Valentine’s Linzer cookies taste just as incredible as they look.

This recipe calls for gluten-free flour. If you make or buy your own blend, ensure it has guar gum to hold the cookie together. Traditionally, shortbread cookies are made with butter, but we swapped out that culprit for the healthy superstar called coconut oil. Ensure that the coconut oil is room temperature and not melted or your shortbread cookies may not hold up in the oven.

We made our own jam for the center of these cookies. The chia jam takes five minutes from start to finish. The best part about this jam is that you control what goes in it. No refined sugars or additives. You can use an abundance of organic fruits. If the berries aren’t in season, frozen berries are a perfect alternative. The great thing is that it lasts for up to a week and a half in the fridge in an airtight container. You can play around with the berries you add to your jam. This jam is not only packed with nutrients but also is busting with protein.

These cookies will last for up to a week in an airtight container. They are gluten-free, vegan, dairy-free, and guilt free. You will need two different size cookie cutters, a smaller round shape cutter and a larger cutter for the cookie. You can play around with different cookie cutters such as circles, squares, or hearts.
articleSummaryHTML: How do you say Happy Valentine’s Day? Say it with healthier treats that are made by you! Because Valentine’s Day should be about the personal touch!
seoTitle: Valentine’s Day Cookies
seoDescription: How do you say Happy Valentine’s Day? Say it with healthier treats that are made by you! Because Valentine’s Day should be about the personal touch!
ingredients:
s:826:"

Chia Jam

  • 2 cups berries of choice (blueberry, raspberry, strawberry, blackberry)
  • 3 tablespoons chia seeds
  • 3 tablespoons water
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup

Cookie

  • ½ cup coconut oil (room temperature
  • 1 ½ cups gluten-free flour
  • 1/3 cup coconut sugar
  • 1 tablespoon water
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/8 teaspoon Himalayan salt 
";
directions:
Chia Jam

Place all ingredients in a blender and pulse for 40 seconds. Transfer to a mason jar or air-tight container. Place in fridge to set for 1 hour.

Cookie

  1. Ensure the coconut oil is at room temperature. If you are finding it hard to scoop, place the container somewhere that it can warm up for 15 minutes.
  2. Place coconut oil in a mixer or use an electric mixer by hand. Cream the coconut oil until smooth and there are no lumps. Add remaining ingredients
  3. Remove dough from bowl and form into a log. Wrap in plastic wrap and place in fridge for one hour
  4. Preheat oven to 350 and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper
  5. If the dough is firm, slice into 1 ½ inch pieces. Using your cookie cutter, press down into pieces and remove excess. For half of the pieces use the smaller cookie cutter to create the center.
  6. Bake for 17–19 minutes or until lightly browned
  7. Transfer cookies to a cooling rack and let cool for one hour.
  8. Using your chia jam, spread 1 tablespoon on each cookie and top with a secondary cookie with the hole in the center. Sprinkle with coconut icing sugar (optional)

articleBodyHTML:
A red velvet brownie that is so red and velvety and brownie-fantastic that it’s gotta be love. Which means it’s perfect for Valentine’s Day!

Looking for a healthy alternative recipe for some Valentine’s Day treats? This vegan and paleo twist on red velvet brownies is both festive and healthy. There is no food coloring in this recipe thanks to nature’s natural red food coloring: beets. Beets also contain a sufficient amount of B Vitamins, Vitamin C, fiber, and potassium.
articleSummaryHTML: A red velvet brownie that is so red and velvety and brownie-fantastic that it’s gotta be love. Which means it’s perfect for Valentine’s Day!
seoTitle: Vegan Red Velvet Brownie
seoDescription: A red velvet brownie that is so red and velvety and brownie-fantastic that it’s gotta be love. Which means it’s perfect for Valentine’s Day!
ingredients:
s:691:"
  • 1 cup of pureed beets
  • ½ cup nut butter (I used Nuttzo)
  • ½ cup cacao powder
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 2 tablespoons ground flaxseeds
  • ¼ cup almond milk
  • 1 tablespoon beetroot powder (I used Yae Organics Sweet Beet)
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  •  1 tablespoon. of Lakonto monkfruit, or a flavored milk 
";
directions:
Heat oven to 375F. Grease a baking dish (I used 8x8) with coconut oil or line with parchment paper.

The beets can be freshly roasted, or you can use a prepackaged brand (such as LoveBeets). Once cooked, puree the beets in a food processor.

Combine beets, nut butter, cacao powder, Warrior Blend protein, flaxseed, almond milk, beetroot powder, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and baking powder.

Once mixed thoroughly, pour the batter evenly into a baking dish. If you wish to add any toppings, now is the time. Some topping ideas include chocolate chips, cacao nibs, or coconut flakes.

Place in the oven and bake for 20–25 minutes. Let cool for 5–10 minutes. Enjoy - and spread the love this Valentine’s Day!

Serves: 8–10

articleBodyHTML:
You know you just won snacking when that snack is anti-inflammatory, vegan, gluten free, grain free, ketogenic, tree nut free, and full of awesome flavor!

These truffles (or energy balls – whatever you’d like to call them) will satisfy your sweet tooth, fuel you through a workout, or start your day off right! This fat-burning recipe is high in antioxidants, fiber, healthy fats, potassium, and protein. These truffles are vegan, gluten-free, tree-nut free, paleo friendly, and low carb, so everyone will be happy! I tried to accommodate as many dietary restrictions as possible while adding multiple superfoods. You can substitute or add any additional toppings you might like. I kept with the anti-inflammatory theme and added extra turmeric, flax seeds, hemp seeds, chia seeds, and cacao nibs. If your diet allows for tree nuts, then chopped nuts of any variety are a great addition.

Turmeric: Turmeric is an anti-inflammatory powerhouse a natural antioxidant due to its high concentration of curcumin. It is widely used for joint health and pain relief. Turmeric can also help settle the stomach and prevent indigestion.

Avocado: Avocados are high in fiber, healthy fats, and potassium, but low in carbohydrates. Avocados are anti-inflammatory as well, while also helping to regulate blood sugar levels, and assist in nutrient absorption.

Flax Seeds: Flax seeds are another ingredient known for their anti-inflammatory properties. They are anti-viral and anti-bacterial. Flax seeds are very high in fiber, potassium, magnesium, and omega 3 fatty acids. These nutrients are what give flax seeds their power to help lower blood pressure and cholesterol.

Chia Seeds: Chia seeds are also anti-inflammatory and help to regulate blood sugar. They have high amounts of fiber, calcium, and healthy fats.

Hemp Seeds: Hemp seeds offer high amounts of plant protein, phytonutrients, omega 3 fats, and contain 20 amino acids.

Raw Cacao: This recipe uses raw cacao powder and nibs. Raw cacao is the highest plant-based source of iron, it has more antioxidants than berries, and it contains one of the highest food-based sources of magnesium. Cacao is known to support heart health, balance blood sugar, and regulate mood. In addition to magnesium, cacao also contains chromium, iron, manganese, phosphorus, zinc, and copper. See – chocolate isn’t bad for you! (when it’s the right kind, that is.)

Coconut: In this recipe, both coconut oil and coconut butter are used. Coconut contains high amounts of antioxidants and healthy fats that help lower cholesterol and boost metabolism. Coconut has antibacterial properties, and it is also low in sugar and high in fiber.

Maca: Maca root is very powerful due to high amounts of amino acids, vitamins, and enzymes. Maca helps regulate hormones, increase energy and reduce anxiety.

Sunwarrior Protein: I used the Chocolate Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein in this recipe. This is a raw, plant-based protein with BCAA’s, Arginine, Lysine, and Leucine.
articleSummaryHTML: You know you just won snacking when that snack is anti-inflammatory, vegan, gluten free, grain free, ketogenic, tree nut free, and full of awesome flavor!
seoTitle: Superfood Chocolate Truffles
seoDescription: You know you just won snacking when that snack is anti-inflammatory, vegan, gluten free, grain free, ketogenic, tree nut free, and full of awesome flavor!
ingredients:
s:1079:"

Truffles

  • 2 ripe avocados
  • ¾ cup raw cacao powder + 2 tablespoons for dusting
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Chocolate Protein
  • ¼ cup coconut butter
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 2 tablespoons turmeric
  • 1 tablespoon maca powder
  • 1–2 tablespoons Lakanto Monkfruit sweetener

Toppings

  • ¼ cup flax seeds
  • ¼ cup hemp seeds
  • ¼ cup chia seeds
  • ¼ cup cacao nibs
";
directions:
1. In a food processor or blender, combine the coconut oil and coconut butter until softened.
  2. Add the avocado, cacao powder, and protein to the mix gradually.
  3. Once the mixture is coming together, add in vanilla extract, cinnamon, turmeric, maca powder. Blend again with all ingredients included.
  4. Refrigerate for 20–30 minutes.
  5. Spoon out the mixture and roll into balls. Roll the balls into your desired toppings. I dusted them with a bit more cacao powder; then I sprinkled some extra turmeric. For added anti-inflammatory and nutrient benefits, I rolled a few into a mixture of flax seeds, hemp seeds, and chia seeds, while I rolled some others into cacao nibs. Get creative! Either eat immediately or store in the refrigerator until you plan to consume them. Enjoy!

** These can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week after making. An additional option with this recipe is to either put the mixture into a mold or tin before placing in the refrigerator to make it into fudge. If you turn it into a fudge instead of balls or truffles, then add any toppings or dusting powders you would like into the mixture beforehand. Place in refrigerator for 1 hour, then cut, and either eat immediately or refrigerate for up to one week.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your day going with a green smoothie that tastes like a trip to the tropics and helps you look great in whatever swimwear you'll be taking to the tropics! Keeping it vegan and keto friendly is just a bonus!

Let’s talk about healthy fats. Did you know that the avocado has more potassium than a banana? That is just the beginning of all the awesome things an avocado can do for you! They are also packed with fiber, vitamin k, vitamin c, vitamin e, and vitamins b5 and b6 too! The thing avocados are famous for, however, is the abundance of healthy fats! It contains oleic acid which is a monosaturated fat that is heart and brain healthy. Oleic acid reduces blood pressure, burns fat, repairs brain myelin, and so much more.

Keeping your body in its best shape is obviously something you care about. The avocado helps make that job a whole lot easier! Enjoy your smoothie!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your day going with a green smoothie that tastes like a trip to the tropics and helps you look great in whatever swimwear you'll be taking to the tropics! Keeping it vegan and keto friendly is just a bonus!
seoTitle: Vegan Keto Green Smoothie
seoDescription: Get your day going with a green smoothie that tastes like a trip to the tropics and helps you look great in whatever swimwear you'll be taking to the tropics! Keeping it vegan and keto friendly is just a bonus!
ingredients:
s:564:"
  • 1 whole avocado, peeled, and pitted
  • ½ cup fresh spinach
  • ¾ cup coconut milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 6–8 drops Lakanto Monkfruit vanilla liquid sweetener
";
directions:
1. Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
  2. Pour into your favorite glass and enjoy!

articleTitle: Keto and Vegan Mocha Frosted Chocolate Cupcakes
articleBodyHTML: Cupcakes: the friendly food! We’ve made these cupcakes even friendlier to your health by making them keto, vegan, and great tasting just like a mocha frosted chocolate cupcake should!
articleSummaryHTML: Cupcakes: the friendly food! We’ve made these cupcakes even friendlier to your health by making them keto, vegan, and great tasting just like a mocha frosted chocolate cupcake should!
seoTitle: Keto and Vegan Mocha Frosted Chocolate Cupcakes
seoDescription: Cupcakes: the friendly food! We’ve made these cupcakes even friendlier to your health by making them keto, vegan, and great tasting just like a mocha frosted chocolate cupcake should!
recipeName: Keto and Vegan Mocha Frosted Chocolate Cupcakes
ingredients:
s:1024:"

Cupcakes

  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 1 cup avocado puree
  • ½ cup almond butter
  • ¼ cup cacao powder
  • 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed
  • 1 teaspoon Lakanto Liquid Monk-fruit chocolate sweetener
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Frosting

  • 1 cup Lakanto Powdered Monk-Fruit sweetener
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend mocha protein
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil
  • ¼ cup coconut milk
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Line a cupcake pan with paper liners
  2. Combine all cupcake ingredients in a food processor and mix until smooth
  3. Pour the batter evenly in cupcake liners. Bake for 15 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
  4. Combine all frosting ingredients in a blender, and blend until smooth.
  5. Allow cupcakes to cool before frosting. You can lightly dust with a bit of the Sunwarrior Warrior Blend mocha protein if you want to give it a little extra special love.  Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
When you need a little extra pep in your step and a bite of all things good, these mocha almond coconut bites deliver!

It was true love at first sip. I know I’m not the only one, but many know me as a coffee addict. I absolutely love all things coffee. Whether is hot, cold, in soap, a candle, whatever form it comes in, I love it! It’s one of the few drinks I always feel like indulging in. It satisfies all the senses starting with taste, sent, touch, sight, and even hearing it be poured makes my heart happy!

When I first found Sunwarrior Warrior Blend mocha protein, I just about leaped for joy! I began putting it in my homemade Frappuccino’s, smoothies, ice cream, etc. But then I decided to make it into something denser. So, I combined it with my other love, coconut and the rest is history!

Here is my Mocha Almond Coconut Bites recipe! It’s perfect for on-the-go snacking, on top of oatmeal or smoothie bowls, packing for lunches, or even dipping in coffee. Look forward to these little guys giving you an extra pep in your step from not only the coffee but just because of how delicious they are!
articleSummaryHTML: When you need a little extra pep in your step and a bite of all things good, these mocha almond coconut bites deliver!
seoTitle: Mocha Almond Coconut Bites
seoDescription: When you need a little extra pep in your step and a bite of all things good, these mocha almond coconut bites deliver!
ingredients:
s:574:"
  • ½ cup almond meal
  • ½ cup shredded coconut
  • ¼ cup Sunwarrior Warrior Blend mocha protein
  • ¼ cup coconut sugar
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground coffee

Toppings

  • ¼ cup sliced almonds
  • ¼ cup shredded coconut
";
directions:
1. Put all ingredients in a food processor and process until you get a desired dough-like consistency. (I prefer mine well blended, but a little chunky.)
  2. In a small bowl, combine the topping ingredients.
  3. Then roll into balls and coat evenly with topping mixture.
  4. Enjoy!

*I like to store mine in the freezer so they harden.

articleBodyHTML:
Marry the two best flavors on the planet: almond butter and chocolate. Keto friendly and sugar-free, these almond butter cups have all the awesome of energy and flavor!

If you’re feeling adventurous and want your taste buds to experience a range of flavors, Warrior Blend also comes in chocolate, mocha, berry, and natural (for those who want to enjoy the almond butter flavor uninhibited; don’t worry, I get you).

If you’re looking to try the keto diet but want to keep your vegan on strong, we have some great recipes to help. Recipes like this one. Almond butter cups have everything you need for a vegan keto snack: Healthy fats, protein, and low carbs. You’re welcome! If you’re not looking for a keto diet, but are instead looking for a fantastic snack that is healthy, you’re still welcome!
articleSummaryHTML: Marry the two best flavors on the planet: almond butter and chocolate. Keto friendly and sugar-free, these almond butter cups have all the awesome of energy and flavor!
seoTitle: Vegan Almond Butter Cups | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Marry the two best flavors on the planet: almond butter and chocolate. Keto friendly and sugar-free, these almond butter cups have all the awesome of energy & flavor!
ingredients:
s:775:"

Chocolate for layering

  • ½ cup coconut oil, melted
  • 4 tablespoons almond milk
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla
  • 2/3 cup cacao powder
  • 1/8 teaspoon sea salt

Almond Butter

  • 1/2 cup almond butter
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 2–3 drops stevia
";
directions:
1. Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners
  2. Combine all ingredients for the chocolate together in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Mix well.
  3. Place a spoonful of chocolate mixture into the bottom of each liner. Make sure the mixture is spread evenly on the bottom.
  4. Place in the freezer for 10–15 minutes or until hardened.
  5. While the chocolate is in the freezer, combine all ingredients for the almond butter.
  6. Remove the tin from the freezer and place a spoonful of the almond butter mixture over the chocolate in each tin.
  7. Place back in the freezer for 10–15 minutes or until hardened.
  8. Remove tin from freezer and place a spoonful of the chocolate mixture over the top. Spread evenly so it has a nice flat top. Put whatever you'd like as a topping (obviously, nuts are a good choice) or leave them naked. After that, put them back in the freezer for another 10–15 minutes or until hardened.
  9. Remove tin from freezer and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Spread the love! It’s Valentine’s Day, which means it’s time for cookies. Make them with healthy ingredients to prove your love is real!

Valentine’s Day brings back fond childhood memories for many of us. One of my favorite memories was receiving cinnamon heart candies; I love cinnamon in all its forms. I wanted to create a healthy cookie that not only combined my love for cinnamon but other similar spices as well. Cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves are known to have amazing blood sugar lowering effects.
