Although I chose to make these cookies simple, you can choose to decorate them as you wish. Drizzle them with raw chocolate sauce, add coconut butter, almond butter, or any natural fruit jams (raspberry is my favorite). Experiment and be creative. I have also given you various nut options. They are all good and can work. Mix and match each time you make them and see which combination you like. I couldn’t decide, so that’s why I have given you a choice. Try them out and let us know what you think.
articleSummaryHTML: Spread the love! It’s Valentine’s Day, which means it’s time for cookies. Make them with healthy ingredients to prove your love is real!
seoTitle: Valentine’s Day Love Cookies
seoDescription: Spread the love! It’s Valentine’s Day, which means it’s time for cookies. Make them with healthy ingredients to prove your love is real!
ingredients:
s:626:"
  • 1 cup walnuts or almonds
  • 1 cup pecans or hazelnuts
  • 1 cup shredded coconut
  • 1 tablespoon Sunwarrior Classic vanilla protein
  • 2 tablespoons chia gel
  • ¼ teaspoon liquid stevia (vanilla) or to taste
  • ½ cup Medjool dates (optional) (Omit if on a Keto diet)
  • ½ teaspoon cardamom
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon ground cloves
  • ¼ teaspoon Himalayan salt
";
directions:
1. In a food processor, add the nuts and shredded coconut and process using an S blade until you get flour-like consistency. Do not over process.
  2. Add the protein powder, chia gel, stevia, vanilla, and all the spices. Process until all ingredients are well combined and the dough sticks together.
  3. Taste the dough for personal sweetness. You can add more sweetness, vanilla, or salt to desired personal taste.
  4. Once all the ingredients are well combined, gather the dough into a ball.
  5. Using a silicone baking sheet, dehydrator sheet, or parchment paper, flatten out the dough using a rolling pin.
  6. Once the dough is flat, about ½ inch thick, use a heart-shaped cookie cutter and cut dough.
  7. Keep rolling out the dough and cut the dough with cookie cutters until all dough has been used.
  8. Place cookies in the dehydrator at 115 degrees. Dehydrate overnight or until cookies are dry. If you want them chewier, dehydrate less if you want them crispier, dehydrate longer.
  9. Alternatively, if you do not have a dehydrator, put them in them in the oven at the lowest temperature and check in 10 to 15-minute increments. Remove them from the oven when they look done.
  10. These cookies keep well in the fridge or freezer.  
  11. Enjoy with a glass of almond, coconut milk, or Matcha green tea latte.

articleBodyHTML:
Valentine’s Day is about all things sweet so we’re bringing you a sweet, healthy treat in these red velvet cupcakes.

Red velvet cupcakes just spell out love and beauty. February marks Valentine’s Day, and it’s a reason to celebrate our loved ones. Although, most of us have tried to keep with New Year’s resolutions of eating healthy and making our new year filled with accomplishments of health and wellbeing. Valentines does not need to be an excuse to break any of these promises made to ourselves. These cupcakes are made with beets and chocolate.

Using beets in this recipe will give the cupcakes that beautiful and glowing red color. Instead of using highly processed food colorings, we used the natural beauty and color of the beets to shine through. Even if you are not a fan of beets, you can barely notice the flavor. Adding beets to this recipe will boost the nutritional value of the cupcake and give you all of the incredible benefits such as vitamin c, fiber, and potassium. Beets are incredible for helping to boost athletic performance and can help reduce inflammation in the body. Beets can even help our brain function, making our cognitive abilities that much sharper. To make these cupcakes even more nutrient dense, we added a scoop of Sunwarrior protein to give them a boost of plant-based protein. Can this recipe get any sweeter?

The icing is very simple to make. Ensure that the coconut milk is chilled for a minimum of 24 hours in the fridge.  This icing is 100 percent natural and contains no additives or copious amounts of sugar. Coconut milk boosts so many incredible health benefits just like beets. Coconut milk can help provide electrolytes to the body, provide healthy fats for the body and can even improve digestion.

Not only is this cupcake delicious, but it’s also packed with nutrients, enzymes, and minerals to fuel us during the day. Now that’s what I call a sweet valentines!
articleSummaryHTML: Valentine’s Day is about all things sweet so we’re bringing you a sweet, healthy treat in these red velvet cupcakes.
seoTitle: Red Velvet Cupcakes
seoDescription: Valentine’s Day is about all things sweet so we’re bringing you a sweet, healthy treat in these red velvet cupcakes.
ingredients:
s:1099:"

Cupcake

  • 1 ½ cups gluten-free flour
  • 1 cup pureed beetroot (2–3 large beets)
  • ¼ cup sugar of choice (this recipe used coconut sugar)
  • ¼ cup cocoa powder, unsweetened
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/3 cup lemon juice
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend natural protein
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon Himalayan salt

Coconut Cream Icing

  • 1 can full-fat coconut milk, chilled
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla bean or extract
";
directions:
Cupcakes

  1. Wash beets thoroughly. Place a pot of water on the stove to boil. Add beets and boil for 45 minutes. Remove from water and let cool for 10 minutes. Remove skin and place in a food processor. Blend until completely smooth.
  2. Preheat oven to 375 degrees
  3. Stir together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, protein powder, and salt.
  4. In another bowl add all wet ingredients, pureed beetroot, coconut oil, and vanilla.
  5. Using a hand mixer or stand mixer, blend both wet and dry ingredients together
  6. Line a cupcake tray with cupcake liners. With a spoon, fill the liners until ¾ full. Bake for 35–40 minutes or until toothpick inserted is clean

Icing

  1. Chill the can of coconut milk overnight in the fridge.
  2. Open the can and scoop out the hard coconut cream on the top, discard the rest of the liquid (or you can drink this, super nutritious)
  3. Using a hand mixer, whip coconut cream with maple syrup and vanilla.
  4. Using a pastry bag or by hand, frost cupcakes when completely cooled.

articleBodyHTML:
Romance your health today with a red velvet chocolate cream smoothie! Better yet, make one for the people you love in your life!

Do you have addictive tendencies?  I mean really – are there a few go-to, must-haves in your dietary regime?  Come on now; it’s confession time, and yes, I’ll go first.  My addiction is smoothies.  As much as I advise my clients on the importance of variety, I almost always default to a smoothie as breakfast for it’s a perfect way to power pack my body with so many nutrients along with veggies and fruits.  And then, of course, there is that dessert-like breakfast aspect.   It’s like having an ice cream (vegan of course) sundae every day with all the various toppings we can garnish our creation with. 

What’s so grand about this addiction is there are endless sensational smoothie options, and of course Sunwarrior aces this.   Here is one of the many I truly love from my Spring 2017 Plant Strong program.
articleSummaryHTML: Romance your health today with a red velvet chocolate cream smoothie! Better yet, make one for the people you love in your life!
seoTitle: Red Velvet Chocolate Cream Smoothie
seoDescription: Romance your health today with a red velvet chocolate cream smoothie! Better yet, make one for the people you love in your life!
ingredients:
s:1147:"
  • Approximately ½–2/3 cup non-dairy milk or coconut water
  • 1 heaping cup spinach
  • 1 small beet, cubed
  • ¼ medium-size avocado
  • ½ cup fresh or frozen organic red berries or red grapes
  • 1 tablespoon almond, cashew, Brazil nut, or Sunbutter
  • 1 tablespoon flax seeds
  • 2 dates or agave or stevia, as desired
  • 1 tablespoon raw cacao powder
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon each cinnamon and turmeric with black pepper
  • ½–1 inch gingerroot
  • ½ cup ice
  • Pinch sea salt and dash cayenne

Garnish

Berries, coconut, cacao nibs, granola, hemp seeds, or anything else you love best

";
directions:
1. Measure all of the ingredients but the garnishes into your high-speed blender and blend on high speed to create a smooth, thick and creamy consistency.  Pour into tall glasses, garnish as desired and relish in the yumminess.

Tips

  • Add a serving of Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein powder: vanilla or chocolate.
  • Pre-workout: 1 tablespoon coconut meat, coconut butter or flakes.
  • No high-speed blender?  Use grated raw beets or cook the beets first. 
  • Serving for dessert? Simply divide between two sexy glasses and drizzle with a little chocolate syrup or a berry or orange infused liqueur.

articleTitle: Vegan & Gluten-Free Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
articleBodyHTML:
Lemon poppy seed muffins are a perfect healthy snack to bring in a little sunshine when you might be missing the summer!

Lemons are said to have a slew of health benefits. They are high in Vitamin C and are powerful antioxidants. Lemon juice can increase iron absorption, boost the immune system, and even help you maintain a healthy complexion. That’s why lemon poppy seed muffins came to mind. I don't really think about lemon poppy seed-flavored anything, mainly because lemon desserts tend to taste a little too strong and tart. If not tart, they are too buttery, heavy, or dry. So, I wrote lemon poppy seed muffins off as being unimpressive. But this changed when I decided to make a vegan, gluten-free, no sugar added version. When done right, lemon can add a refreshing flavor that is perfect for any time of year, but especially when you might be missing summer. So, try this light recipe and enjoy the new and improved version of lemon poppy seed muffins!
articleSummaryHTML: Lemon poppy seed muffins are a perfect healthy snack to bring in a little sunshine when you might be missing the summer!
seoTitle: Vegan & Gluten-Free Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
seoDescription: Lemon poppy seed muffins are a perfect healthy snack to bring in a little sunshine when you might be missing the summer!
recipeName: Vegan & Gluten-Free Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
ingredients:
s:744:"
  • ¾ cup coconut flour
  • ½ cup organic maple syrup
  • 7 tablespoons lemon juice (freshly squeezed is best, but you can use a jar of organic squeezed)
  • ¼ cup coconut oil (melted down)
  • 6 flax eggs (regular eggs also work fine but to make this vegan, use flax)
  • ¼ teaspoon pink Himalayan sea salt
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 2 tablespoons poppy seeds
  • 1 dash cinnamon 
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and spray a 12-serving muffin tin with coconut oil (or use muffin liners if you prefer. I usually only use liners if they are for a party. Otherwise, I make them right in the tin).
  2. In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except for the poppy seed and coconut oil.
  3. Whisk together until the batter is smooth.
  4. Melt the coconut oil and add into the batter and quickly whisk to melt together. If you don’t add the coconut oil at the end and immediately whisk it, it will harden and not blend well with other ingredients.
  5. Add the poppy seeds and stir into the batter.
  6. Divide the batter evenly into the 12 trays.
  7. Bake for 20–25 minutes (sweet spot being 23). This may vary depending on your oven.
  8. Let cool for 15 minutes and then enjoy!

articleTitle: Put Your Spiralizer to Use: Curry, Coconut Lime, and Sesame Cucumber Zoodles
articleBodyHTML:
Zoodle your way into dinnertime magic! These three recipes of curry, coconut lime, and sesame cucumber will fill your dinnertime with the fantastic flavors dinner deserves!

Spiralized veggies are the new craze! You can find them in the grocery store and even on restaurant menus. However, if you invest in a spiralizer or zoodler, you can have homemade veggie noodles any night of the week for a fraction of the cost. Turning veggies into noodles is a great way to get a huge serving of vegetables without even realizing it! It’s also a great way to ensure that veggies are filling and fun if you are trying to feed kids. Here are 3 simple and easy recipes to try out your veggie noodling skills tonight!
articleSummaryHTML: Zoodle your way into dinnertime magic! These three recipes of curry, coconut lime, and sesame cucumber will fill your dinnertime with the fantastic flavors dinner deserves!
seoTitle: Put Your Spiralizer to Use: Cucumber Zoodles are here!
seoDescription: Zoodle your way into dinnertime magic! These three recipes of curry, coconut lime, and sesame cucumber will fill your dinnertime with the fantastic flavors dinner deserves!
recipeName: Curry, Coconut Lime, and Sesame Cucumber Zoodles
ingredients:
s:1062:"

Curry Zucchini Noodles

  • 2 large zucchinis
  • 1 tablespoon red curry paste
  • ¼ cup coconut milk
  • Salt if needed

Almond Coconut Lime Carrot Noodles

  • 3–4 carrots
  • 1 tablespoons almond butter
  • 1 tablespoon desiccated coconut
  • Juice of ½ lime
  • 2–4 tablespoons hot water
  • Cilantro for topping

Sesame Cucumber Noodles

  • 1 large English cucumber
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce, tamari, or liquid aminos
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil
  • Sesame seeds for topping
";
directions:
Curry Zucchini Noodles

Use your noodle peeler or spiralizer to turn the zucchini into noodles. Set aside. In sauté pan, heat the red curry paste and coconut milk together until warm and smooth. Add the zucchini noodles and bring sauce to a simmer, tossing and turning the zucchini noodles as they cook. Cook until tender, about 4 minutes and serve! You can add tofu as well for a fully satisfying meal.

Almond Coconut Lime Carrot Noodles

Use your noodle peeler or spiralizer to turn the carrots into noodles. In a small bowl (or blender), mix the almond butter, coconut, lime juice, and water until combined. Pour over carrot noodles and top with cilantro! (Note: you can steam or boil your carrot noodles to soften them if you prefer)

Sesame Cucumber Noodles

Use your noodle peeler or spiralizer to turn the cucumber into noodles. Place in a bowl and toss with the soy sauce and sesame oil. Top with sesame seeds and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
For a minty blast of flavor, this chocolate mint smoothie is like hitting the slopes no matter what time of year it is!

When you want to feel the cool tingle of chocolate mint, this smoothie is your mouth’s gateway to a winter wonderland. It’s keto friendly and vegan. So what are you waiting for? Raise your glass to winter!
articleSummaryHTML: For a minty blast of flavor, this chocolate mint smoothie is like hitting the slopes no matter what time of year it is!
seoTitle: Vegan Keto Chocolate Mint Smoothie
seoDescription: For a minty blast of flavor, this chocolate mint smoothie is like hitting the slopes no matter what time of year it is!
ingredients:
s:798:"
  • ½ avocado, pitted and peeled
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Chocolate protein
  • 3–4 drops Lakanto Monkfruit chocolate liquid sweetener
  • 1 cup fresh spinach
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • ½ teaspoon peppermint extract
  • 1 teaspoon Sunwarrior Supergreens Mint
  • 3 tablespoons cacao nibs
  • Coconut Whipped Crème
";
directions:
Coconut Whipped Crème

  • Refrigerate coconut milk for a few hours, long enough to let the cream solidify at the top. Four hours should do it.
  • Remove the cream and save the coconut liquid for a different smoothie later.
  • Place the cream in large, chilled glass or stainless-steel bowl—something already cold and ready to take the chill to awesome.
  • Using hand beaters, whip the coconut cream for 3–5 minutes or until it becomes fluffy and light, with soft peaks.

Smoothie

  • Set aside 1 tablespoon cacao nibs and the coconut whipped crème.
  • Put the rest of the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
  • Pour into your favorite glass, add a dollop of the coconut whipped crème and the rest of the cacao nibs, and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
For on the go fuel that tastes great and puts the pep in your step, these protein bites are your perfect quick food source!

Protein bites are great fuel for on-the-go and can be customized any way you like. Use dates to help them stick together and then put in your choice of nuts, seeds, goji berries, coconut flakes, fruit, or cacao. You can even whip together chocolate chip cookie dough protein balls made from rolled oats, dates, vanilla protein powder, natural almond butter, unsweetened almond milk, and mini dark chocolate chips. They will taste just like raw cookie dough!
articleSummaryHTML: For on the go fuel that tastes great and puts the pep in your step, these protein bites are your perfect quick food source!
seoTitle: Superfood Protein Bites
seoDescription: For on the go fuel that tastes great and puts the pep in your step, these protein bites are your perfect quick food source!
ingredients:
s:837:"
  • 1 ½ cups whole raw almonds (or sunflower seeds for a nut-free option)
  • 2 tablespoons hemp seeds
  • 1 cup chopped dates
  • ¼ cup goji berries
  • 2 tablespoons cacao nibs or cocoa powder
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon mesquite powder (optional)
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla powder
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 2 tablespoons Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
Place all the ingredients into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until you get a thick “doughy” consistency. Roll and flatten into 2-inch cookies. Feel free to also roll them into little balls for quick power bites –perfect for your purse or a midday snack or after a workout.

You can also roll them into coconut, cacao, or ground up goji berries for a fun outer coating.

articleBodyHTML:
Stop loafing around and try some raw banana bread that is so good it will drive you . . . well, bananas!

Who doesn’t love banana bread! Banana bread is one of those treats that is amazing, but sadly it is filled with processed and refined sugars, butter, preservatives, and flours. Although bananas are an incredible way to start the morning, opting for that slice of banana bread at your local cafe is not the greatest start. It will leave you feeling lethargic and heavy. You may feel as though you’re crashing an hour or two after consuming it because your body is working double time to digest it. Now, how about we replace that with a more nutrient-dense cake? This raw vegan version will keep you energized and satiated! This banana loaf is gluten free, grain free, dairy free and one hundred percent raw vegan. It’s also delicious, naturally sweetened, and will come together in less than ten minutes.

This recipe uses whole foods. We use an abundance of fruit and vegetables along with nuts, dates and flax meal. Flax meal is super high in fiber and low in carbohydrates. Flax is high in both insoluble and soluble fiber. This can help reduce sugar cravings, increase fat loss, and keep you satiated longer. Flax seeds are also high in Omega-3 fatty acids which is crucial for a healthy diet. We also used a blend of both brazil nuts and walnuts: both with incredible health properties. These both increase brain health, helping to improve cognitive abilities.

We used a dehydrator in this recipe, but you can always place it in the oven at the lowest temperature for 6 hours. This banana loaf can be enjoyed anytime during the day, morning to night! Try not to eat all of the dough out of the bowl before baking it. Top this banana bread with nut butter or jam to add an extra dose of deliciousness.
articleSummaryHTML: Stop loafing around and try some raw banana bread that is so good it will drive you . . . well, bananas!
seoTitle: Raw Banana Bread
seoDescription: Stop loafing around and try some raw banana bread that is so good it will drive you . . . well, bananas!
ingredients:
s:600:"
  • 5 ripe bananas
  • 1 cup ground flax meal 
  • 1 cup apples, chopped
  • 1 cup zucchini, chopped
  • ¼ cup filtered water or coconut water
  • ½ cup walnuts, chopped
  • ½ cup brazil nuts, chopped
  • 1/3 cup raisins 
  • 1/3 cup pitted dates
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla 
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 170 (if not using a dehydrator)
  2. Combine all ingredients in a food processor. Blend until smooth
  3. Line a loaf pan with parchment paper and pour mixture inside
  4. Bake or dehydrate for 10 hours. Remove from oven or dehydrator and let cool before slicing

articleBodyHTML:
When we’re still in the heart of winter, warm up old man winter’s heart with vegan cream of broccoli soup. Dinner just got awesome!

With the weather getting colder, it becomes soup season. It warms the insides when it is cold outside. So, it is important to have a plethora of top-notch soups on hand. You'll want to add this cream of broccoli to your collection. It is a creamy, dreamy soup. You don’t want to miss out! It is also so simple and very filling. The broccoli is full of many vitamins and nutrients like dietary fiber, vitamins B6, E, B1, and A. Broccoli is also a good source of magnesium, omega-3 fatty acids, protein, zinc, and calcium. The cashews bring the creaminess to the soup. When the cashews are soaked, they can easily be blended smoothly to add the creamy factor without using cream or milk. Blending the soup makes even the pickiest eaters enjoy it.
articleSummaryHTML: When we’re still in the heart of winter, warm up old man winter’s heart with vegan cream of broccoli soup. Dinner just got awesome!
seoTitle: Vegan Cream of Broccoli Soup
seoDescription: When we’re still in the heart of winter, warm up old man winter’s heart with vegan cream of broccoli soup. Dinner just got awesome!
ingredients:
s:624:"
  • ¾ cup raw cashews, soaked
  • 2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 2 medium onions, diced
  • 2 stalks celery, chopped
  • 3 carrots, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 16 oz. broccoli (about 7 cups, packed)
  • 6 cups vegetable broth, divided
  • 1½ teaspoons salt (or to taste)
  • Freshly ground pepper
";
directions:
1. Place cashews in a small bowl, cover with water, and let soak for at least 30 mins or overnight.
  2. Add oil to large pot over medium heat. Add onions. Sauté until onions are clear. Add celery and carrots. Sauté for about 5 minutes. Add garlic and broccoli and sauté for another 5 minutes.
  3. Add 5 cups of vegetable broth. Stir together. Bring mixture to boil then turn down and let simmer for about 15 minutes with lid on.
  4. Drain cashews and add to blender and 1 cup vegetable broth. Blend until well blended and smooth.
  5. Once vegetables are tender, drain most of the liquid for a thicker soup or don’t drain a lot, if you want a thinner soup. Add cashew cream. Mix well and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

articleBodyHTML:
Taco Tuesday just got a makeover. Move over black bean tacos and say hello to jackfruit! Chili lime jackfruit tacos make a fiesta out of dinner time!

Jackfruit is the new plant-based meat that is taking the taco industry by storm. It is not processed faux meat. It is vegan, gluten-free, and soy-free. Even though it is a fruit, the neutral taste of jackfruit can be made sweet or savory with any dish. The meaty texture is what has plant-based taco lovers replacing beans with jackfruit. This delicious fruit is now a staple in my home.

Benefits of Jackfruit

Jackfruit is rich in vitamins, minerals, and lots of dietary fiber. It is also a viable source of minerals, such as iron, magnesium, and manganese as well. It’s also high in potassium, which helps muscle function, hydration, and to maintain healthy blood pressure.

Fun Facts about Jackfruit

Did you know a single jackfruit tree can produce up to 250 jackfruits that weight between 20–50 lbs. Ripe jackfruit is eaten as a fruit, but unripe jackfruit is prepared as a vegetable. Young jackfruit is used in stews or curries, boiled, and roasted.
articleSummaryHTML: Taco Tuesday just got a makeover. Move over black bean tacos and say hello to jackfruit! Chili lime jackfruit tacos make a fiesta out of dinner time!
seoTitle: Chili Lime Jackfruit Tacos | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Taco Tuesday just got a makeover. Move over black bean tacos and say hello to jackfruit! Chili lime jackfruit tacos make a fiesta out of dinner time!
ingredients:
s:865:"

Ingredients for taco

  • Jackfruit (fresh, canned, or packaged)
  • Non-GMO organic corn tortillas
  • 2 avocados
  • Salsa
  • Cilantro

Chili lime marinade for jackfruit

  • ½ small onion chopped
  • 2 tablespoons chili spice
  • 1/3 cup vinegar
  • 2 limes juiced
  • 2 cloves garlic pressed
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon coriander
  • ½ teaspoon black pepper
";
directions:
Make sure jackfruit is washed and cleaned. Then make chili lime marinade in a bowl. Put jackfruit in a bowl of marinade and mix thoroughly. Let it set in the fridge for 2 hours or more (can be made the night before). After jackfruit is marinated, pull out of the fridge. Pour out marinade sauce. Have a frying pan heated to medium. Put marinated jackfruit in frying and heat thoroughly. After heated, put jackfruit in taco and dress with avocado slices, salsa, and cilantro.

Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
If life isn’t the bowl of cherries you’re hoping for, make your own with this chocolate cherry smoothie bowl!

This decadent smoothie bowl is healthy and delicious, making it a great breakfast, dessert, or snack for any time of day! Plant-based living is not only delicious, but it’s good for your health, and for the health of our planet. When we live mindfully and care for the wellbeing of ourselves, others, and the world, we are practicing love. What better way to practice love and share wellness than to eat great vegan food? Gather your blender and ingredients to join me in this smoothie bowl that’s sure to satisfy your sweet tooth.
articleSummaryHTML: If life isn’t the bowl of cherries you’re hoping for make your own with this chocolate cherry smoothie bowl!
seoTitle: Chocolate Cherry Smoothie Bowl | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: If life isn’t the bowl of cherries you’re hoping for make your own with this chocolate cherry smoothie bowl!
ingredients:
s:648:"
  • 2 cups frozen cherries
  • 2 frozen bananas
  • 2 cups frozen strawberries
  • 3 tablespoons almond butter
  • 2–3 scoops of Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Garnish

Shredded coconut, fresh berries, cacao nibs, granola, walnuts, and any of your other favorite toppings! 

";
directions:
1. Blend all ingredients together in a high-speed blender. Bonus points if you blender boogie!
  2. Pour your blended ingredients into a bowl, top with desired garnish, and serve!

Tips

Note that the mixture will be very thick. For ideal vegan ice cream consistency, do not add any non-dairy milk or water. However, if you would like a more smooth and thin consistency, add non-dairy milk or water for desired texture.

articleBodyHTML:
Mashed potatoes cauliflower with a sweet twist. This dish is a smooth and creamy crowd-pleaser that is like a party on your plate! You’re welcome!

This is the perfect side dish that is quick, easy, and tastes like a fluffy sweet cloud from heaven. Low in calories, low in fat, and high in essential nutrients, vitamins, fiber, and protein! I like this best cold, chilled in the fridge for a couple hours, then just scoop out a bit for a sweet treat!
articleSummaryHTML: Mashed potatoes cauliflower with a sweet twist. This dish is a smooth and creamy crowd-pleaser that is like a party on your plate! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Mashed Potatoes Cauliflower Twist
seoDescription: Mashed potatoes cauliflower with a sweet twist. This dish is a smooth and creamy crowd-pleaser that is like a party on your plate! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:424:"
  • 4 medium-sized white Japanese sweet potatoes
  • ½ head cauliflower
  • 3 full scoops of Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla Protein
  • 1–2 cups vanilla almond milk (or coconut milk, soy milk, cashew milk)
";
directions:
Steam the cauliflower and sweet potatoes until they easily fall apart when pierced through using a fork. Then transfer to a big glass bowl, let cool 10–15 minutes and then mash with a fork until no big lumps are left. Add in the vanilla protein slowly, alternating ½ scoop powder with 2 tablespoons of almond milk, stirring thoroughly. Add in more almond milk at the end if you like your potatoes with a smoother texture! Let cool and place in the refrigerator covered.

You can also use a handheld mixer, following the same sequence of ingredients to add in as listed above.

Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Hearty, healthy and healing, these homemade quinoa bowls are loaded with the ingredients to nurture you!

This might be one of my favorite things to make because it’s hearty, healthy and healing. My quinoa bowls are loaded with power-house ingredients that nurture the body. The best part is that if you make this recipe in bulk, you will have a week’s worth of nutrient packed-lunches or dinners ready to go. One bite of this and you’ll be wondering why you haven’t made Quinoa Bowls sooner!
articleSummaryHTML: Hearty, healthy and healing, these homemade quinoa bowls are loaded with the ingredients to nurture you!
seoTitle: Homemade Quinoa Bowls
seoDescription: Hearty, healthy and healing, these homemade quinoa bowls are loaded with the ingredients to nurture you!
ingredients:
s:741:"
  • 1 cup spinach lettuce
  • ½ cup quinoa
  • 1/3 cup cherry tomatoes
  • 1 roasted sweet potato
  • 1/3 cup roasted chickpeas
  • 1 handful chopped celery
  • 2 tablespoons hummus
  • 1 teaspoon Turmeric
  • ½ teaspoon Pink Himalayan Sea Salt
  • ½ teaspoon Pepper
  • ¼ cup Olive Oil
  • Optional: Avocado
  • Your favorite dressing
";
directions:
1. Bring half a cup of quinoa and 1 cup of low sodium vegetable broth to a boil. Simmer for about 20 minutes until fluffy and then remove from heat.
  2. Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
  3. Thinly slice the sweet potato and throw into a bowl.
  4. Drizzle the sweet potatoes with olive oil (until lightly moistened), 1 ½ teaspoon of pink Himalayan sea salt and black pepper. Mix all together.
  5. Roast in the oven for about 25–35 minutes, mixing occasionally. (note - ovens do vary so be sure to check that the sweet potatoes are not burning).
  6. Turn off oven for just a couple minutes so that it cools down before your next batch of roasting.
  7. Now preheat oven to 400 degrees.
  8. Rinse your chickpeas and thoroughly dry with paper towels.
  9. Toss chickpeas with olive oil (just a touch to drizzle them with) and pink Himalayan sea salt
  10. Roast in the oven for 20–30 minutes, until slightly hardened.
  11. Remove from oven and toss in a bowl with turmeric and pepper (as little or as much as you please).
  12. Coat the bottom of a bowl with your spinach lettuce
  13. Add sweet potato chips, roasted chickpeas, quinoa, and sliced cherry tomatoes around the edge of your bowl.
  14. Scoop the hummus in the center of your bowl and place the chopped celery next to it
  15. Add your favorite dressing and mix well. I recommend a light balsamic vinaigrette or a lemon garlic. (Tessemae’s All Natural is a great sugar-free and organic brand, available at Whole Foods or your local health food store)
  16. Optional: Add avocado
  17. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
DIY almond milk to get all the ingredients that are awesome and forget the ones that aren't!

As someone who only really reads nutrition labels for the ingredients and not so much for the calories, I have been very surprised to see what is in most plant milks. I have been drinking the same almond milk for about six years now and finally read the ingredients in it. To my surprise, I found some included that I had never heard of before and could hardly pronounce. This was a wake-up call to me because I am so adamant on paying attention to what foods are made of and even constantly preach this to my clients! I can’t believe I finally turned the bottle around and read it completely!

In my readings, I found ingredients I wasn’t thrilled to consume.

There are also new brands out there that now carry added protein plant milks. With these, there are still a bunch of different preservative and ingredients added.

This made me think, why don’t I just make my own? That way I can know exactly what goes into a product I’m using multiple times a day. Also, saving a little extra money is just a pro that goes along with it! I also decided to add extra protein to it! This is where the creativity is completely up to you! You can blend it with vanilla, chocolate, mocha, berry, or even just natural. I ended up making vanilla since I add it to so many different recipes, but chocolate would be good if it were blended up with a banana and peanut butter. You could even make the “milk” mocha flavored and use it as a coffee creamer!

As I said, this recipe is limitless! So, have fun in the kitchen and don’t hesitate to experiment and try new things!
articleSummaryHTML: DIY almond milk to get all the ingredients that are awesome and forget the ones that aren't!
seoTitle: Protein Almond Milk
seoDescription: DIY almond milk to get all the ingredients that are awesome and forget the ones that aren't!
ingredients:
s:443:"
  • 2 cups raw almonds
  • 4 cups filtered water
  • 2–4 tablespoons maple syrup *optional for added sweetness (can also use 2–4 dates)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein (whichever flavor you choose. Vanilla is fun!)
";
directions:
1. Soak almonds overnight or 8–10 hours. Make sure they are fully covered in water.
  2. After soaking, place almonds, maple syrup, and water in a blender. Blend on high speed for about 1–2 minutes.
  3. Strain the freshly blended almond milk in a nut milk bag into either a mixing bowl or jar. Make sure to squeeze so you can get all of the milk strained.
  4. Now pour the milk back into the blender and add your choice of Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein flavor. Blend on high speed and your all done!

articleBodyHTML:
Because life is short and should taste great, we’re bringing you this cookie dough banana granola! Take a bite out of life!

The proverbial peanut butter and banana combo has been a long-time favorite and just begging for innovative new creations. Nut allergen sufferers – not to worry because this granola is made with Sunbutter! Sure, it can be made with any nut or seed butter you like; however, I think you’ll taste perfection in this combo of ingredients. You likely have them all on hand, and they come together with one bowl, a measuring cup, a spoon and a baking sheet.

There are all kinds of stir-in additions options. The most fun with this granola is how it bakes up into bite-size pieces, making it a perfect snack when you are on the run, and there’s no time to sit down for a bowl of cereal or a parfait. The recipe makes about 3 cups and is easily doubled. I highly suggest doing so if you have a household of more than two. It freezes easily so you can prep a week of grab-and-go snack bags of these cookie-dough granola bites.

This cookie dough granola is truly a guilt-free, nutrient-dense snack you’ll love.
articleSummaryHTML: Because life is short and should taste great, we’re bringing you this cookie dough banana granola! Take a bite out of life!
seoTitle: Cookie Dough Granola Bites | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Because life is short and should taste great, we’re bringing you this cookie dough banana granola! Take a bite out of life!
ingredients:
s:874:"
  • 2 cups organic old-fashioned organic rolled oats, gluten-free
  • 1 teaspoon organic ground cinnamon
  • Pinch sea salt, to taste
  • 2 tablespoons organic ground flax seeds
  • ½ cup raw walnuts (or sunflower seeds if nut allergies exist)
  • 1 large banana, mashed
  • ¼ cup organic coconut milk or non-dairy milk of your choice
  • ¼ cup sunbutter (organic, regular or crunchy)
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 1 – 2 tablespoons coconut syrup or maple syrup to taste
  • 1 generous splash real vanilla extract
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F and cover a baking pan with parchment paper then combine the first 5 dry ingredients in a measuring cup.
  2. Mix together the remaining ingredients in a medium or large size mixing bowl. Begin with 1 tablespoon sweetener and add more only if needed after a taste test when all the ingredients are combined together. If your bananas are really ripe it’s unlikely you will need more syrup or honey.
  3. Stir the dry ingredients into the banana mixture. You will have a thick cookie dough texture. This is when you can taste test for sweetness and add any of the stir-in options.
  4. Once your mixture is ready, spread out onto the baking sheet in a thin layer.  Bake in the preheated oven approximately 15 minutes. Give it a gentle stir mindful to retain bite-size clusters and bake another 10 minutes or so until the clumps are starting to firm. Remove and let cool on a rack before storing in an airtight jar at room temp. It will keep for a few weeks. If your kitchen is hot, store in the refrigerator to prolong shelf life.

articleBodyHTML:
The power of the green smoothie in a bowl will get you all your antioxidants and happy feels of eating stuff that tastes good!

A smoothie bowl in a wonderful way to fuel your body and have a little fun at the same time. Smoothie bowls can be adapted to your personal taste buds, seasonal fruit and your own creativity! This power greens smoothie bowl is loaded with antioxidants and knocks it out of the park! So good. Enjoy! Serves two.
articleSummaryHTML: The power of the green smoothie in a bowl will get you all your antioxidants and happy feels of eating stuff that tastes good!
seoTitle: Power Greens Smoothie Bowl
seoDescription: The power of the green smoothie in a bowl will get you all your antioxidants and happy feels of eating stuff that tastes good!
ingredients:
s:845:"

 

  • 2 cups power greens (spinach, kale etc)
  • 1 ¼–½ cup mango coconut water
  • ½ Granny Smith apple, cored
  • ¾ cup frozen mango

Topping Ingredient Options

  • Fresh strawberries
  • Fresh blueberries
  • Granola
  • Shredded coconut
  • Bananas
  • Limes
  • Nut butter
  • Raspberries
  • Apple slices
  • Kiwi
";
directions:
1. In a blender combine all smoothie ingredients and blend until smooth. You want this a little thick so add mango coconut water, or frozen mango to your desired consistency

2. Pour smoothie mixture evenly into two bowls

3. Top as desired

4. Eat immediately

articleBodyHTML:
Can’t get your kids to eat greens? Make it a party by celebrating with the Irish and getting your green on in healthy, fantastic tasting ways!

If you’re a parent that struggles with making your kids eating greens, then this is for you. Grownups think that kids should understand when we say, demand they eat their greens so they can be strong like Popeye. Since many kids don’t even know who Popeye is anymore, our words fall on deaf ears. The truth is that parents try hard in the way they best know how. But, what is the easiest and less stressful way to make your kids eat those greens? Camouflage it! No, this doesn’t mean hide broccoli in their grilled cheese sandwich. It means blend it in a way they would never know it’s a green and put it in a product they do not want to refuse: Ice cream and shakes!

Here are some recipes that you can try to help your little one consume more greens without a fuss.
articleSummaryHTML: Can’t get your kids to eat greens? Make it a party by celebrating with the Irish and getting your green on in healthy, fantastic tasting ways!
seoTitle: Kids, Greens & Vegan Ice Cream
seoDescription: Can’t get your kids to eat greens? Make it a party by celebrating with the Irish and getting your green on in healthy, fantastic tasting ways!
ingredients:
s:1100:"

Green Coco Ice Cream

  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 3 dates, pitted
  • ½ avocado or coconut butter
  • ¾ cup spinach
  • 1 tablespoon cacao nibs
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt

Strawberry Vanilla Shake

  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 1 banana
  • 1 tablespoon liquid sweetener
  • ¾ cup kale
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • handful strawberries
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 scoop coconut milk ice cream (optional) 
";
directions:
Green Coco Ice Cream

  1. Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy.
  2. You can also add some cacao powder if your kid dislikes the color green.

Strawberry Vanilla Shake

  1. Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy (except ice cream)
  2. Transfer all ingredients to a glass. Top up the shake with a scoop of coconut milk ice cream.

Kids are driven by vision and taste. Every kid has a sweet tooth and loves the idea of eating ice cream for breakfast or dinner. Little will they know it’s filled with greens. It’s a win-win for the parent and the child.

Healthy can be delicious and addictive!

articleBodyHTML:
Pumpkin and St. Patrick’s Day? Yes, please! This green smoothie bowl will get you into the March spirit while providing you all the health and tasty happiness of a perfect smoothie.

Who said pumpkin can only be eaten in the fall? Personally, I love including pumpkin in my diet year-round. Pumpkin contains high amounts of Vitamin C and Vitamin A. It is loaded with fiber, and it is a great thickener for smoothies and soups. Smoothie bowls are both delicious and nutritious, but it is important to be mindful – a lot of smoothie bowls are only a blend of high sugar fruits. This recipe gets your greens in with spinach, but you also get healthy fats from acai and avocado, and fiber from pumpkin. Once blended together, the toppings are endless!
articleSummaryHTML: Pumpkin and St. Patrick’s Day? Yes, please! This green smoothie bowl will get you into the March spirit while providing you all the health and tasty happiness of a perfect smoothie.
seoTitle: Green Smoothie Bowl
seoDescription: Pumpkin and St. Patrick’s Day? Yes, please! This green smoothie bowl will get you into the March spirit while providing you all the health and tasty happiness of a perfect smoothie.
ingredients:
s:991:"

 

  • 1 cup spinach
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Chocolate Protein
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • ½ avocado
  • ¼ cup pumpkin
  • 1 frozen acai packet
  • ¼ cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk

Topping Options

  • Berries (I used blueberries)
  • Apple slices
  • Cacao Nibs
  • Coconut flakes
  • Flax Seeds
  • Hemp Seeds
  • Cacao Powder
  • Cinnamon 
";
directions:
1. Measure out and place all ingredients in a blender; adjust the liquid amount to a thickness of your liking. Feel free to add any other fruits, powders, or oils you would like.
  2. Blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl, add desired toppings, and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
What the kale are we having for dinner? Kale and pomegranate salad, of course! For all the health of the seasons, this is the salad for you!

Kale is one of those greens that survive all year around whether it is the sizzling heat of the summer to the dreary winter days. By itself, kale is very tough and hard to digest if not made into a smoothie or properly made into a salad. When making a kale salad, the key is to massage the leafy green so that it becomes silky. All you need to do is wash the kale, de-rib it, chop finely and massage it in dressing or lemon juice. The transformation comes within five minutes, and you will see a stark change.

The addition of pomegranate seeds and quinoa adds incredible nutritional benefit. Pomegranate seeds have a huge amount of fiber, potassium, and vitamin c. These little arils will keep you healthy throughout the transition of the seasons. Quinoa is packed with plant-based protein and will keep you supercharged and satiated throughout the day. Quinoa also contains almost twice as much fiber as other grains, so this will keep your digestive tract smiling and in good health.

This salad can be doubled in size and actually tastes better the next day when the flavors have had time to marinate! You can add a variety of in-season fruits and vegetables to this salad as one season progresses to another.
articleSummaryHTML: What the kale are we having for dinner? Kale and pomegranate salad, of course! For all the health of the seasons, this is the salad for you!
seoTitle: Kale and Pomegranate Salad
seoDescription: What the kale are we having for dinner? Kale and pomegranate salad, of course! For all the health of the seasons, this is the salad for you!
ingredients:
s:568:"
  • 1 bundle kale, de-ribbed and chopped
  • 1-cup pomegranate seeds
  • 1-cup butternut squash, cut into cubes
  • ½ cup cooked quinoa
  • ½ cup red cabbage, chopped finely
  • 2 teaspoons lemon, juice
  • 3 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Wash and clean kale. De-rib and chop into pieces. Place into a bowl and squeeze the juice of 1 lemon on kale. Massage for 3 minutes and set aside.
  2. Cut butternut squash into cubes. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place squash on a parchment paper-lined baking tray. Bake for 30 minutes.
  3. Cook quinoa according to the package. Let cool.
  4. Combine lemon juice, olive oil, and maple syrup in a small bowl.
  5. Combine kale, quinoa, squash, and cabbage in a large bowl. Drizzle dressing on top and let sit for 10 minutes before serving. Top with pomegranate seeds. Place in airtight container for leftovers.

articleBodyHTML:
Go green or go home! Or go green *at* home; that works, too. Celebrate your St. Paddy’s day with a little greener version of food with the avocado breakfast muffin!

The avocado is truly a celebrated fruit for most everyone, and there are endless ways to use them. The fast-food breakfast muffin isn’t exactly the best thing for your health, but if you reimagine it a little, you will find extraordinary flavor without the extraordinary cost to your health. Nutrient-dense and gourmet good creations like this deliver a serious dose of essential amino acids, quality carbs, healthy fats, fab flavor, mega fiber, and divine satisfaction. Keep this as your go-to, good for you breakfast option.
articleSummaryHTML: Go green or go home! Or go green *at* home; that works, too. Celebrate your St. Paddy’s day with a little greener version of food with the avocado breakfast muffin!
seoTitle: Avocado Breakfast Muffin | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Go green or go home! Or go green *at* home; that works, too. Celebrate your St. Paddy’s day with a little greener version of food with the avocado breakfast muffin!
ingredients:
s:590:"
  • English muffins, toasted (Use the Food for Life rice tortilla or the corn wraps from Whole Foods if you want gluten-free)
  • Basil pesto
  • 1 whole avocado mashed with a little lemon and sea salt
  • Sundried tomatoes, chopped
  • Fresh tomato slices
  • Raw hemp seeds or toasted pine nuts
  • Sea salt, cayenne, black pepper, nutritional yeast, fresh basil leaves to taste
";
directions:
1. Spread a little pesto evenly on each half of the muffin
  2. Top one half with avocado mix, spread evenly
  3. Add 1 tablespoon sundried tomatoes, a tomato slice, basil leaves, hemp seeds or pine-nuts and season as desired
  4. Press muffin halves together and dive in, or wrap in parchment paper for a great to-go breakfast

TERI’S TIPS:

  1. Not an avocado fan? Sub in tomatoes, raw or sautéed mushrooms, or roasted eggplant, zucchini, or peppers
  2. Add slivered greens such as arugula
  3. Make this open-faced and garnish as above adding a sassy drizzle of balsamic reduction
  4. Add additional protein with beans of your choice

articleTitle: Saint Patrick’s Day Superfood Green Soup
articleBodyHTML:
Forget the pot of gold! Get a pot of green . . . soup that is! There is no better way to honor the patron saint of Ireland than with a mouthwatering bowl of healthy, delicious, and festive soup.

To celebrate the month of all things green, I decided to whip up my Superfood Green Soup. Green vegetables are some of the healthiest foods around. They lower the risk of disease, promote healthy weight loss, strengthen your internal organs and bones, and are attributed to reversing the signs of aging. Since green vegetables are packed with so many vitamins and minerals, it was only appropriate to start off the name of this recipe with Superfood. Not everyone loves the taste of vegetables alone, but when blended and turned into a soup, the flavors combine to form a mouthwatering flavor. Keep your immune system and taste buds happy all spring long with this delicious recipe!
articleSummaryHTML: Forget the pot of gold! Get a pot of green . . . soup that is! There is no better way to honor the patron saint of Ireland than with a mouthwatering bowl of healthy, delicious, and festive soup.
seoTitle: Saint Patrick’s Day Superfood Green Soup
seoDescription: Forget the pot of gold! Get a pot of green . . . soup that is! There is no better way to honor the patron saint of Ireland than with a mouthwatering bowl of healthy, delicious, and festive soup.
recipeName: Saint Patrick’s Day Superfood Green Soup
ingredients:
s:544:"
  • 1 ¼ cup frozen peas
  • 1 ¼ cup chopped frozen spinach
  • 3 cups broccoli florets
  • 1 medium white onion
  • 1 stock celery (sliced)
  • 4 cloves minced garlic
  • 1 ¾ cups low sodium organic vegetable broth
  • 1 cup water
  • 3 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon turmeric
  • 1 tablespoon onion powder
  • 1 tablespoon pepper
  • Dash Pink Himalayan Sea Salt
  • ½ cup cannellini beans 
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
  2. Combine broccoli florets, 1 ½ tablespoons of olive oil, salt, and pepper in a large bowl and mix all together.
  3. Evenly spread on a nonstick (or sprayed) pan and roast for 20 minutes (note - make sure to flip broccoli half-way through at the 10-minute mark). Put to the side when done.
  4. While you wait for the broccoli to finish, pour 1 ½ tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and celery and mix for 3 minutes.
  5. Add the vegetable broth, water, peas, and spinach and bring to a boil. (note - make sure you are constantly stirring because this will help the flavors blend together).
  6. Once it’s at a boil, add turmeric, a dash of pepper and salt, and onion powder and simmer for 15 minutes, so the flavors combine.
  7. Add the broccoli and simmer for another 10 minutes.
  8. Let soup cool for 15 minutes and place in a blender.
  9. Blend on high until soup is creamy and smooth.
  10. Add cannellini beans to top of the soup.
  11. Mix together and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
The best-kept secrets are ones that should be shared—especially when they are recipes that are awesome! This chickpea muffin recipe is the secret you will want to share over and over!

I get a thrill when I keep secrets. Planning birthday surprises are one of my favorite activities but simultaneously biting my tongue not to give away the huge surprise I giddily planned is a struggle! Fortunately, and unfortunately, that challenge carries over to these lovely chickpea muffins. Nobody will ever guess that the bulk of these muffins are secretly, chickpeas, but watching your loved ones scarf the muffins down with gusto will make it hard for you to not blurt out the secret ingredients! You can ruin the surprise - I’ll allow it.

These muffins are great for a morning on the go; you can easily grab one or two as you’re flying out the door, and they’re equally great for a midday snack when you’re in the awkward and uncomfortable snack-time/pre-dinner situation!

(makes about 8 large muffins)
articleSummaryHTML: The best-kept secrets are ones that should be shared—especially when they are recipes that are awesome! This chickpea muffin recipe is the secret you will want to share over and over!
seoTitle: Vegan Secret Chickpea Muffins
seoDescription: The best-kept secrets are ones that should be shared—especially when they are recipes that are awesome! This chickpea muffin recipe is the secret you will want to share over and over!
ingredients:
s:638:"
  • 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
  • ½ cup almond butter
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon baking soda
  • 2 tablespoons rolled oats
  • Raisins, optional and as many as you’d like!
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F.
  2. Simply add all the ingredients (except the raisins) into a food processor and process them together.
  3. Stir in the raisins (optional).
  4. Spray a muffin tin with coconut oil spray so the muffins don’t stick and add the batter to your muffin tin. (It makes about 8 large muffins.)
  5. Bake for 20 minutes.
  6. Remove and let cool before diving in!
  7. Store in a sealed container in the fridge.

articleTitle: A JACKED UP Post-Workout Golden Turmeric Smoothie!
articleBodyHTML:
Know what must be as fun as a party? Winning the gold! So we’re giving you the ultimate recipe for a post-workout turmeric golden smoothie! You’re welcome!

Know what you have to do to win a gold medal? Be JACKED! (Unless you won the gold in, well, even ping pong people are pretty jacked!) Whether we’re jacked or not, all of us can experience the fun of drinking a JACKED UP GOLDEN SMOOTHIE which helps those big strong muscles of yours recover from a workout so you can go back to life and win in motherhood or fatherhood or employeehood or take first place in a This is Us Marathon.

The turmeric in this smoothie has some great anti-inflammatory properties which can really help soothe our swollen, achy joints and muscles. One of the active components in Turmeric and the stuff that makes turmeric yellow (which looks great in this smoothie but not on your stained t-shirt) are called curcumins. Curcumin provides awesome antioxidants which can help keep your immune system strong after you kick your own booty in the gym, AND it could even help ease that post-workout pain!

The plant-protein, a la Sunwarrior, helps your body rebuild the muscles it broke down when it worked out. Duh.

The maca is terrific at giving your adrenals some TLC. Your adrenals, by the way, work their butts off to release hormones that help you perform your butt off during a workout. But under the stress of hard exercise and after you drink caffeine before your hard exercise, they get a little burnt out, and maca is a superstar at helping them recover. And the ginger is that deliciousness that helps with muscle soreness. Many studies have been done and concluded that consuming ginger post-workout can speed up your recovery time and give you fewer excuses to miss tomorrow’s workout! Sorry, I’m not sorry.

But you will be sorry if you don’t try this smoothie.
articleSummaryHTML: Know what must be as fun as a party? Winning the gold! So we’re giving you the ultimate recipe for a post-workout turmeric golden smoothie! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: JACKED UP Post-Workout Golden Turmeric Smoothie! | Sunwarrior
seoDescription: Know what must be as fun as a party? Winning the gold! So we’re giving you the ultimate recipe for a post-workout turmeric golden smoothie! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:556:"
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Vanilla Plant Protein
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon ground ginger
  • ½ teaspoon ground turmeric
  • 1 date
  • 1 teaspoon maca (optional)
  • 1 handful of ice 
";
directions:
Put it all in a blender and BLEND!!!

(serves 1)

COOKING VIDEO = http://bit.ly/party-golden-smoothie-vid

articleBodyHTML:
Put the lime in the coconut and eat it all up! A refreshing Vegan Coconut Lime Pie that satisfies the sweet tooth and offers a bit of sass to your after-dinner desserts!

This mouthwatering pie combines creamy coconut and refreshing lime in one, and it turns out absolutely delicious! It’s very healthy and nutritious and very easy to make, so make sure you give it a try!
articleSummaryHTML: Put the lime in the coconut and eat it all up! A refreshing Vegan Coconut Lime Pie that satisfies the sweet tooth and offers a bit of sass to your after-dinner desserts!
seoTitle: Vegan Coconut Lime Pie
seoDescription: Put the lime in the coconut and eat it all up! A refreshing Vegan Coconut Lime Pie that satisfies the sweet tooth and offers a bit of sass to your after-dinner desserts!
ingredients:
s:720:"

For the crust:

  • 1 cup oats
  • 1 cup desiccated coconut
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • a pinch of salt

For the filling:

  • 1 ½ cups desiccated coconut
  • 2/3 cup cashews (no need to soak)
  • 14-ounce can coconut milk
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • Juice + zest of 2 limes
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350.
  2. To make the base place oats and desiccated coconut in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend until fine meal forms. Add maple syrup and coconut oil and mix thoroughly until dough forms – it should have the consistency of wet sand.
  3. Line a bottom of a round 8-inch cake tin with greaseproof paper and mold the dough to the bottom and the sides of the tin. Spike with a fork and place in the oven. Bake for 10 min, then take out of the oven and set aside to cool down.
  4. To make the filling, place desiccated coconut in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend for 3 minutes. Add cashews and blend for another 3 minutes. Add coconut milk, maple syrup and lime juice and zest and blend for a good 5 minutes until smooth and creamy.
  5. Transfer the filling on top of the baked base and even out the surface using a spatula. Place in the fridge for at least 4 hours or ideally overnight. Take out of the fridge and decorate with lime zest and desiccated coconut (optional). Serve on its own or drizzled with raspberry preserve. Store at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the fridge for up to 5 days.

articleBodyHTML:
What is this tasty little tuber that carries with it a whole stack of health benefits? Keep reading to know! And have a tigernut banana berry muffin to try it out!

Since I am constantly on the prowl for new forms of nut milks and non-grain flours – I am so glad I discovered tigernuts. They are now the newest superfood in my arsenal. What I love most about the tigernut is that it has its own natural sweetness and a delicious crunch. This makes it perfect for a quick snack or something that I can add into my morning or afternoon smoothie, chia cereal, loaf, or muffin batter.

Tigernuts are also extremely diverse as you can make them into a milk, a flour, or just eat them as is. They have a very unique, chewy texture.

They are an easy addition to anyone’s diet, as it is friendly to all common allergens from nuts to seeds, grains, dairy, sugar, and beans. If you haven’t tried them yet or their flour, today is your day.
articleSummaryHTML: What is this tasty little tuber that carries with it a whole stack of health benefits? Keep reading to know! And have a tigernut banana berry muffin to try it out!
seoTitle: Tigernut Banana Berry Muffins
seoDescription: What is this tasty little tuber that carries with it a whole stack of health benefits? Keep reading to know! And have a tigernut banana berry muffin to try it out!
ingredients:
s:772:"

 

  • 1 cup tigernut flour
  • ½ cup coconut flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 2–3 ripe bananas (depending on size)
  • ½ cup coconut milk
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
  • ¼ cup coconut sugar
  • 1/3 cup applesauce + 1 tablespoon ground chia
  • 1 cup blueberries
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Use a large bowl for the dry ingredients. Then mix wet ingredients into dry and fold slowly, mixing until there are no lumps remaining. Stir in blueberries or chocolate chips.

2. Drop by the spoonful into an oiled muffin tray or pour batter into a loaf pan.

3. Bake for 20 minutes if making muffins, or 30–40 minutes if making a loaf.

articleBodyHTML:
Vacation in the tropics without even leaving your house. All you need is a blender and a few key ingredients for a coconut mango peach smoothie holiday!

The best thing about smoothies is the way they make you feel like you’re indulging, but (most of the time), you’re treating yourself to a big dose of nutritious ingredients, giving quick energy without leaving you feeling bloated.

Peaches, mango, and banana enhance the tropical vibe of the coconut in this recipe, resulting in layers of flavor notes. To make sure you’re getting the most sweetness out of your bananas, be sure to use them when they’re ripe—the riper they are, the more sugars will be broken down and released into the fruit. Fresh produce is always preferable, but you can enjoy your tropical treat even when the ingredients are out of season by snagging frozen mangoes and peaches.

The most intimidating part of this recipe is opening the coconut, and that’s not even as hard as it seems!

Here’s how it goes:

Select a young Thai coconut that is white, with the least amount of blemishes. Especially inspect the bottom, and pick one without mold or cracks.

Turn the coconut on its side and begin slicing off the husk from the pointed part of the coconut. Use a sharp knife with a 90-degree corner edge and slice until you see the nut crowning (it’ll be browner than the husk)

Stand your coconut right side up and chop—swiftly and firmly—into the base of one of the spines (the edge of the nut you just revealed) using the bottom corner edge of the knife. This should result in a cut that penetrates all the way through the shell

Repeat the previous step if needed to allow you to pry the top off with your fingers

If you’re still intimidated by the whole knife-hacking process, there is a tool called a Coco Jack® that takes some of the mystery out of coconut opening. Check it out!
articleSummaryHTML: Vacation in the tropics without even leaving your house. All you need is a blender and a few key ingredients for a coconut mango peach smoothie holiday!
seoTitle: Coconut Mango Peach Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Vacation in the tropics without even leaving your house. All you need is a blender and a few key ingredients for a coconut mango peach smoothie holiday!
ingredients:
s:618:"
  • 1 large young Thai coconut, water and flesh
  • 1 cup sliced peaches, fresh or frozen
  • 1 cup chopped mango, fresh or frozen
  • 2 medium ripe bananas
  • 3–4 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1 tablespoon ground flax seed
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla
";
directions:
1. Blend until smooth. Add additional coconut water to thin if needed.
  2. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Oh, pecan pie, the gooey and warm pie that sings of indulgent joy! This protein Pecan Bar equivalent is all the joy without the guilt!

The only problem with pecan pie is that it’s not among the healthiest desserts on the planet. Although delicious, the traditional pecan pie is loaded with copious amounts of sugar, fat, and wheat. The combination of the three will make your blood sugar spike and send your brain into a fog. Indulging in desserts does not have to be unhealthy. We created a protein-packed pecan square that is equally as delicious as the conventional pecan pie. We used almond flour which contains iron, minerals, and protein. The best part about almond flour is that it contains one ingredient; almonds! White flour on the contrast has very little nutrients. The good qualities of the wheat normally has been stripped away. White flour can lead to fatigue, anxiety, diabetes, obesity, and high blood pressure.

The best thing about this recipe is that it is creamy, rich and guilt free. Pecans are wonderful sources of protein and calcium and are incredible for your hair and skin. This recipe uses whole food ingredients to ensure you are receiving the best mixture of ingredients. You could easily make this recipe into a pie if you didn’t want squares. Whichever way you eat it, your stomach will be dancing with joy.
articleSummaryHTML: Oh, pecan pie, the gooey and warm pie that sings of indulgent joy! This protein Pecan Bar equivalent
seoTitle: Protein Pecan Bars
seoDescription: Oh, pecan pie, the gooey and warm pie that sings of indulgent joy! This protein Pecan Bar equivalent
ingredients:
s:1148:"

Crust

  • 2 cups almond flour
  • 1 cup shredded coconut
  • 1/3 cup melted coconut oil
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Natural protein
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt

Pecan and Walnut Filling

  • 1 cup pecans, chopped
  • 1 cup walnuts, chopped
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup 
  • 2 tablespoons water
  • 6 tablespoons flax meal
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ½ cup chocolate chips
";
directions:
1. In a mixer combine all crust ingredients. Mix until all ingredients are well combine. Line a 6 x 6 baking tray with parchment paper. Remove crust from mixer and press into pan firmly. Bake for 12–14 minutes or until light golden brown. Leave oven on. Let the crust cool for 1 hour.
  2. In a small bowl combine flax meal with water and let sit for 5 minutes
  3. Place pecans and walnuts onto a parchment paper lined baking tray and bake for 6 minutes 
  4. Place coconut oil, coconut sugar, maple syrup, vanilla, and salt into a small pot on medium heat. Bring to a slight boil and remove from heat immediately. Add pecans/walnuts and flax mixture. Stir well.
  5. Spread pecan mixture onto cooked crust with chocolate chips and a few extra walnuts.
  6. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Place in fridge for one hour before slicing

articleBodyHTML:
For a grab-and-go healthy snack, this matcha chia pudding with all sorts of health benefits, great protein, and fantastic flavor is just what you need!

I’m the type of person that could eat plain chia pudding no problem, but with the endless flavor palette available, I thought it was time to create a unique and delicious flavor! Chia pudding is a great breakfast or pick-me-up snack as it is rich in antioxidants, omega 3 fatty acids, and can help to provide loads of fiber, iron, and calcium – nutrients which are often overlooked in plant-based diets.

In this recipe, we’re using Matcha! I’m sure you’ve seen the matcha craze over the past couple of years, and there’s good reason! Not only does matcha help to detoxify the body, but it also may help to reduce the risk of cancer, and can even help promote weight loss. If you’re a big coffee drinker or an “anything but water” drinker, matcha can be a great substitute as it not only tastes delicious but can aid your body in so many ways.

While you can use whatever plant milk you’d like in chia pudding, this version contains coconut milk! Not only is it a great texture and flavor, but I love the dose of healthy fats I get from coconut milk. When paired with the matcha, you get an extremely creamy texture that’s almost like a matcha latte but just thicker…and with chia seeds!

My favorite thing to do is to make a huge batch of this chia pudding and pre-portion it into jars for grab-and-go options. You can also make this super customizable by adding a scoop of Sunwarior Warrior Blend vanilla protein, mini chocolate chips, hemp seeds, or a variety of nuts and fruits.
articleSummaryHTML: For a grab-and-go healthy snack, this matcha chia pudding with all sorts of health benefits, great protein, and fantastic flavor is just what you need!
seoTitle: Matcha Chia Pudding
seoDescription: For a grab-and-go healthy snack, this matcha chia pudding with all sorts of health benefits, great protein, and fantastic flavor is just what you need!
ingredients:
s:354:"
  • ¼ cup chia seeds
  • 1 can full-fat coconut milk
  • 2–3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 ½–2 tablespoons matcha powder (2 Trader Joes Matcha Green Tea single serve packets)
";
directions: Mix all ingredients well in a large bowl. Cover and let sit for at least 3 hours. Enjoy cold!

articleBodyHTML:
Grain Free Blueberry & Cranberry Muffins: giving you the depth and yummy flavor your taste buds and health deserve!

Using Cassava and coconut flour gives these muffins a bit more depth in flavor and loads them with fiber and protein. Also, adding applesauce gives the muffins natural sweetness and makes it moist, tender and delicious! They are perfect during the fall months. You can store them in your freezer for up to three months and warm them up for breakfast and add some almond or pumpkin seed butter for a little extra protein and fat.
articleSummaryHTML: Grain Free Blueberry & Cranberry Muffins: giving you the depth and yummy flavor your taste buds and health deserve!
seoTitle: Grain Free Blueberry & Cranberry Muffins
seoDescription: Grain Free Blueberry & Cranberry Muffins: giving you the depth and yummy flavor your taste buds and health deserve!
ingredients:
s:778:"
  • 1 cup organic cassava flour
  • ½ cup coconut flour
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ½ cup almond flour
  • ½ cup coconut milk
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
  • 1⁄3 cup applesauce
  • ½ cup cranberries
  • ½ cup blueberries
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350F. Measure and combine dry ingredients; flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and sea salt

2. Mix wet ingredients, oil, maple syrup, applesauce, berries, and coconut milk

3. Pour wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix well, making sure there are no lumps. Stir in raisins

4. Spread mixture evenly among 12 muffin cups

5. Bake for 20 minutes

6. Remove from oven, let sit for a few minutes and remove and cool muffins on cooling rack or tray

articleBodyHTML:
Though winter is over, there is still comfort to be had with a flare of Indian spices in a delicious hearty spiced lentil soup!

What I love most about lentils is that they don’t need to be soaked overnight. Most other beans and legumes require a long soaking time, typically overnight. So, if you are in a pinch and wanted a big pot of lentil soup for dinner, you can cook lentils right into your broth!

This soup has a flare of Indian spices that are warming and satisfying. Complete your soup with a bowl of basmati rice, steamed greens, or gluten-free bread!
articleSummaryHTML: Though winter is over, there is still comfort to be had with a flare of Indian spices in a delicious hearty spiced lentil soup!
seoTitle: Hearty Spiced Lentil Soup | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Though winter is over, there is still comfort to be had with a flare of Indian spices in a delicious hearty spiced lentil soup!
ingredients:
s:860:"
  • 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 ½ cups diced yellow onion
  • Pinch of sea salt
  • 2 carrots, peeled and diced
  • 1 ½ cups celery, peeled and diced
  • 1 tablespoon garlic
  • 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/8 teaspoon ground allspice
  • 2 cups green lentils, rinsed well
  • 8 cups water or vegetable stock
  • 2 bay leaves
  • ½ cup fresh lemon juice
  • ¼ teaspoon maple syrup
";
directions:
1. In a large sauté pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and pinch of salt and cook until golden brown. Add the carrots, celery, and garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds

2. Add the cumin, cinnamon, allspice, lentils, and pinch of salt

3. Add the liquid and bay leaves. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer until the vegetables are softened and the lentils have cooked through, about 30 minutes

4. Add lemon juice and maple syrup, and serve

articleBodyHTML:
Start your day with an aromatic cardamom vanilla smoothie! It's full of health benefits and happy flavors that make it the perfect addition to spice up your workouts and your day!

Cardamom is a famous spice that hails from India. Ancestors have used this spice for many years, as it possesses many health benefits. Cardamom is well known to refresh your breath with its aromatic ingredients, it acts as a natural anti-inflammatory medicine and helps to reduce swelling and infections, and it aids in digestion by improving blood circulation and by reducing bloating. Adding this amazing spice to your morning drink is the best way to start your day and the best thing you can do for your health. Plus, the other health benefits are fantastic!

Muscle Spasms

Cardamom is a natural antispasmodic spice which helps to relax your muscles. It’s the perfect spice to add post-workout or any stenos workout. Women can also use it during menstruation cramps or menopause.

Depression

Cardamom has been known to elevate mood and reduce depression. Ayurvedic practitioners believe that drinking a cup or two of cardamom tea every day has a good effect on people suffering from anxiety and depression

Digestive Aid

This spice helps in improving blood circulation, increases the amount of oxygen and this, in turn, helps your digestive system. Drink a cup of cardamom tea if you feel congested, constipated, stressed out, or if you have any digestive issues.

Oral Hygiene

Containing powerful antibacterial properties, cardamom is used to improve gum health and reduce inflammation and bleeding along with eliminating bad breath. You can use a drop or two of cardamom oil with your toothpaste or simply chew on a pod of cardamom after meals.

Body Cleanser

Cardamom is packed with powerful anti-oxidants and antibacterial properties which work wonders inside out for your body. It aims to destroy any free radicals in your system, improves blood circulation, and helps your organs flush out toxins at an escalated rate. Drink cardamom tea on an empty stomach for the best result. You can also add it to your morning coffee if you like

And now for the best part: the Cardamom Vanilla Smoothie!
articleSummaryHTML: Start your day with an aromatic cardamom vanilla smoothie! It's full of health benefits of happy flavors that makes it the perfect addition to spice up your workouts and your day!
seoTitle: Cardamom Vanilla Smoothie | Sunwarrior Health Hub
seoDescription: Start your day with an aromatic cardamom vanilla smoothie! It's full of health benefits of happy flavors that makes it the perfect addition to spice up your workouts and your day!
ingredients:
s:517:"
  • 1 cup nut milk
  • 1 teaspoon cardamom powder
  • 2 bananas, frozen
  • ¾ cup blueberries
  • 2–3 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt 
";
directions:
Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth

Eat right. Stay active. Be Happy.

articleBodyHTML:
Let the feasting begin! It’s vegan cornbread to the rescue of any meal that requires just a little something special added!

Soups and chilis are a staple for healthy hardy meals. But they can get a little boring and sometimes need a little more oomph. Adding a healthy side is sometimes a little tricky especially if you have picky eaters. Cornbread to the rescue!

Cornbread is so versatile and can be made as muffins or just in a pie pan. It comes together very quickly and goes with almost any soup. And leftovers can be served for breakfast with a slather of jam. Tasty!

Cornmeal is a healthy grain that an excellent source of carbohydrates. Carbs are essential for brain function and to keep your energy. It is needed in everyone’s diet. Cornmeal also has iron, dietary fiber, and zinc. Coconut oil is also very helpful in raising your HDL cholesterol and is also known as a healthy fat.
articleSummaryHTML: Let the feasting begin! It’s vegan cornbread to the rescue of any meal that requires just a little something special added!
seoTitle: Vegan Cornbread
seoDescription: Let the feasting begin! It’s vegan cornbread to the rescue of any meal that requires just a little something special added!
ingredients:
s:541:"
  • 1 cup yellow cornmeal
  • ½ cup all-purpose flour or gluten-free flour
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 tablespoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 cup sour almond milk*
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 1 flax egg
  • 3 tablespoons melted coconut oil
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
  2. Combine cornmeal, flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a medium-size bowl. Then add soured almond milk, almond milk, flax egg, and coconut oil to dry mixture. Combine well. Pour into greased deep-dish pie plate or 8x8 square pan or muffin tins. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes for pan or 15 to 20 minutes for muffins or until golden brown.

*Soured almond milk: Add 1 tablespoon of vinegar to bottom of 1 cup and fill the rest of the way up with almond milk.

**Flax egg: Add 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed to 2.5 tablespoons water. Stir and let sit for 5 minutes before using.

articleBodyHTML:
Indulge in the warm flavors of this mid-eastern spiced kale crunch. So addictive, you might have to hide it from yourself just to make it last! Or make a double batch . . .

These are so fabulous and perfect to pair with Tabouli, hummus, fattoush, baba ganough or whatever Mid-Eastern delights you enjoy. Fataya – the spinach pies are a great choice too. This version of crunchy, earthy, lemony chips has a flavor infusion of herbs inspired by the mid-Eastern culture. Its kale chips with substance. They’re protein and calcium-rich bursting with vitamins making for a sin-free indulgence that will grace whatever you choose to pair it with. Of course, you can eat them as is, hand to mouth.

I store them in 12oz containers – stainless steel or glass jars, for a quick snack to grab while on the go or if I am stuck at the computer on a project and needing some fuel of substance that is easy to eat.

Find spices like Zataar and sumac (it’s also great with these) in Mid-Eastern stores. Don’t fret over seeing a large bag of the spice. It’s a wonderful infusion of flavor, perfect for marinades, salad dressings, popcorn, grilled and roasted veggies, and so much more. Plus, it keeps well for about six months stored in an airtight container.

What are you waiting for? Get crunching!
articleSummaryHTML: Indulge in the warm flavors of this mid-eastern spiced kale crunch. So addictive, you might have to hide it from yourself just to make it last! Or make a double batch . . .
seoTitle: Mid-Eastern Spiced Kale Crunch
seoDescription: Indulge in the warm flavors of this mid-eastern spiced kale crunch. So addictive, you might have to hide it from yourself just to make it last! Or make a double batch . . .
ingredients:
s:680:"
  • ½ cup tahini paste
  • 4 tablespoons water – or more if needed to create a thick yet pourable mixture
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice, or more to taste
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • ½–1 teaspoon sea salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
  • 2 tablespoons Zataar
  • 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
  • 2 med to large bunches kale – approximately 10 cups
";
directions:
1. In a food processor, or a large jar with a tight-fitting lid, blend tahini with the lemon juice then pulse or stir in the water along with the oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Alternatively measure into a glass jar with a lid and stir then shake until well combined and a thick creamy consistency forms. Adjust seasonings and set aside.
  2. Cover two large baking sheets with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 300–325F.
  3. Wash and dry the kale well, and tear the leaves into bite-size pieces leaving the stem for juicing, salads, sautés, or broth. Toss in a large mixing bowl with the dressing ingredients using your hands to massage into all the kale pieces. Sprinkle evenly with the Zataar and sesame seeds as well as the cayenne if using.
