  4. Bake in 10–15 minute intervals for 30–40 minutes or so moving the chips around as needed to cook evenly. Some may be ready before others so be sure to remove them to ensure they don’t over crisp.
  5. Once they are all done, let cool completely on a rack before storing or diving into them.

articleTitle: Mint Chocolate Protein Fudge: Vegan, Paleo, Keto
articleBodyHTML:
Sweeten spring baskets in the best way possible with this mint chocolate protein fudge!

This is a great recipe to satisfy your sweet tooth! The peppermint is optional, but I wanted to add it to give a little festive kick for springtime. If you would like to sweeten these treats beyond what the natural sweetness and protein powder offers, feel free to add a couple of drops of Stevia or sweetener of your choice. These also make a great kid-friendly Easter candy!
articleSummaryHTML: Sweeten spring baskets in the best way possible with this mint chocolate protein fudge!
seoTitle: Mint Chocolate Protein Fudge: Vegan, Paleo, Keto
seoDescription: Sweeten spring baskets in the best way possible with this mint chocolate protein fudge!
recipeName: Mint Chocolate Protein Fudge: Vegan, Paleo, Keto
ingredients:
s:415:"
  • ½ cup raw cacao powder
  • ½ cup raw cacao butter
  • 2 tablespoons raw coconut butter
  • 1 tablespoon raw coconut oil
  • 2 scoops Sunwarrior Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 1 teaspoon peppermint extract 
";
directions:
1. Line a mini muffin tin with baking cups. If you desire to make them larger, you can use a regular size muffin tin. You can also use any mold of choice.
  2. Heat the cacao butter on the stove at medium until it begins melting.
  3. Once the cacao butter begins melting, stir in the coconut oil and coconut butter.
  4. When all ingredients are melted and thoroughly combined, take off heat and mix in the cacao powder, protein powder, and peppermint extract.
  5. Evenly distribute the mixture into the tin. Place in the refrigerator for 1 hour, then remove and enjoy! These treats can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a week.

articleBodyHTML:
For a dessert perfect enough to make those special occasions that much more fantastic! Easter dinner, date night, or anytime you want to celebrate!

A few months back, I was asked to serve dinner to a group of kids with their dates. One of the kids happens to be my son’s best friend, and he also is gluten intolerant and dairy sensitive. Obviously, we wanted him to have just as great of a time as the rest of his friends, so I went about trying to find something he could eat, too. I came up with the raspberry cheesecake. It was a huge hit, not only with him but will all my kids, too!

This cheesecake has no crust but can easily be added. Just make up any kind of crumb crust you like and press it into the bottom of the cups before adding the cheesecake.

What makes this cheesecake when there is no cream cheese involved is the cashews. When cashews are soaked and then blended, they become so creamy and delicious. Cashews are packed with vitamins, minerals like iron and zinc and antioxidant. Raspberries are also antioxidants and contain vitamin C.

Whip this up when you want a simple and easy dessert! And I bet you won't miss the dairy!
articleSummaryHTML: For a dessert perfect enough to make those special occasions that much more fantastic! Easter dinner, date night, or anytime you want to celebrate!
seoTitle: Vegan Raspberry Cheesecake
seoDescription: For a dessert perfect enough to make those special occasions that much more fantastic! Easter dinner, date night, or anytime you want to celebrate!
ingredients:
s:647:"

Base

  • 2 cups raw cashews, soaked for 1 ½ hours in hot water
  • ¼ cup lakanto or agave
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • ¼ teaspoon sea salt
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice

Puree

  • 6 oz raspberries, fresh or frozen, thawed
  • 2 tablespoons lakanto or agave
";
directions:
1. Blend cashews, lakanto, almond milk, salt, oil, and lemon juice in a powerful blender for 2 minutes or until desired smoothness. If the mixture is too thick, add more almond milk. Pour into lined muffin tins.
  2. In a food processor, blend raspberries and lakanto until pureed well. Pass puree through a fine sieve to remove seeds.
  3. Pour 1 tablespoon of raspberry puree into each cheesecake. Using a small spoon, stir raspberries into cheesecake making a marble look. Freeze until firm.
  4. Let sit at room temperature for about 5 minutes or until desired softness. Serve with dollop of sweetened coconut cream on top. If there is leftover raspberry puree, drizzle on top of cheesecake. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Load ‘em up! These vegan loaded sweet potatoes come loaded with flavor and vitamins and eating joy!

Sweet potatoes are packed with nutrients and have been dubbed as one of the healthiest foods in the world. They’re rich in Vitamin A, B6 (which aids in metabolism) and Vitamin C, and they are loaded with calcium and potassium. Sweet potatoes have even been found to regulate heart function. More and more people today are talking about gut health (we see this with the rise of probiotic and kombuchas), so it’s also worth noting that these types of potatoes are packed with fiber and assist in maintaining a healthy digestive system. They help fight off chronic disease and have many anti-aging properties. The bottom line? You should be eating sweet potatoes! But eating them day in and day out can get a bit repetitive, so try adding a Mediterranean twist to your next sweet potato meal.
articleSummaryHTML: Load ‘em up! These vegan loaded sweet potatoes come loaded with flavor and vitamins and eating joy!
seoTitle: Vegan Loaded Sweet Potatoes
seoDescription: Load ‘em up! These vegan loaded sweet potatoes come loaded with flavor and vitamins and eating joy!
ingredients:
s:819:"
  • 3 sweet potatoes (medium size - make sure they are thoroughly rinsed and cleaned)
  • ½ cup cherry tomatoes
  • ¼ cup chopped parsley
  • 12–15 ounces chickpeas
  • ¼ cup of your favorite organic hummus
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1–1 ½ tablespoon lemon juice
  • 1 teaspoon turmeric
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon of garlic
  • ½ teaspoon of pink Himalayan sea salt 
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 400 degrees.
  2. Cut your sweet potatoes in half with a thick knife, length-wise.
  3. With the back of a spoon, lightly coat each sweet potato half with olive oil and place orange side down on a baking sheet.
  4. While oven is preheating, drain chickpeas into a bowl and add a drop of olive oil, the cinnamon, cumin, garlic, and sea salt and mix well.
  5. Place chickpea mixture onto a separate baking sheet and lightly sprayed with coconut oil.
  6. Place both trays in oven and roast for about 30 minutes. (note: you should be able to press a fork into the sweet potatoes and have a slightly mushy texture).
  7. Mix chickpeas every 10 minutes.
  8. While potatoes and chickpeas are roasting, slice your cherry tomatoes in half and place into a bowl.
  9. Pour most of the parsley over the tomatoes (leaving a few sprinkles for the end), and add the lemon juice. Let marinate.
  10. Remove trays from the oven.
  11. Let cool for 10 minutes.
  12. Flip potatoes on their skin and press the back of a fork into each one so a little dent forms. Add hummus to each potato, followed by the chickpeas and then the tomato mixture so that a delicious, messy mountain of vegetables forms on each potato.
  13. Sprinkle the remaining parsley on top.
  14. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Vegan Egg Spinach Omelet & Protein Hack
articleBodyHTML:
With Easter right around the corner, we thought you might want to whip up a little something eggs-tra special! This vegan egg spinach omelet is certainly worth celebrating!

People eat eggs for the protein content, but you can have your vegan egg and your protein too! Let us show you how!
articleSummaryHTML: With Easter right around the corner, we thought you might want to whip up a little something eggs-tra special! This vegan egg spinach omelet is certainly worth celebrating!
seoTitle: Vegan Egg Spinach Omelet & Protein Hack
seoDescription: With Easter right around the corner, we thought you might want to whip up a little something eggs-tra special! This vegan egg spinach omelet is certainly worth celebrating!
recipeName: Vegan Egg Spinach Omelet & Protein Hack
ingredients:
s:993:"

Omelet Batter

  • 2 Follow Your Heart Vegan Eggs (4x tablespoons)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Natural Protein
  • 1 ½ cup ice cold spring water
  • A small handful organic spinach
  • Pinch Redmond Real Salt

Toppings

  • 1 cup organic spinach
  • ¼ cup organic chopped organic white and red onions
  • ¼ cup of chopped organic yellow and red peppers
  • 5 halved organic cherry tomatoes
  • Redmond Real Salt and Organic Pepper to taste
  • Optional: Organic Salsa
";
directions:
1. Heat pan coated with about a tablespoon of olive oil on med-high heat
  2. Chop and prepare dry ingredients
  3. Combine Vegan Egg powder, water, Warrior Blend protein, and spinach in a blender (or whisk in a bowl)
  4. Pour blended Vegan Egg batter in to heated pan and let fry for a few minutes
  5. Lower heat to medium
  6. Add about ½ of chopped vegetables and spinach to one half side of the omelet
  7. Let cook for a few minutes until slightly golden brown and firm on the bottom
  8. Fold bare side of the omelet. Be careful so as not to break it
  9. Flip omelet over carefully to thoroughly cook the other side
  10. If you’d like you can add remaining onions, peppers, and spinach to the pan to fry lightly
  11. Remove omelet and place on a serving plate
  12. Arrange toppings
  13. Salt and pepper to taste
  14. Enjoy!

*This Vegan Egg spinach omelet takes about 15 minutes to make and tastes delicious. Add a scoop of Sunwarrior protein to the "vegg,” batter to up the nutritional content.

articleBodyHTML: For a sweet treat with just a lil’ sass, you will want to serve these dark chocolate and sea salt Lil’ Cuties!
articleSummaryHTML: For a sweet treat with just a lil’ sass, you will want to serve these dark chocolate and sea salt Lil’ Cuties!
seoTitle: Dark Chocolate & Sea Salt Cuties
seoDescription: For a sweet treat with just a lil’ sass, you will want to serve these dark chocolate and sea salt Lil’ Cuties!
ingredients:
s:443:"
  • 6 Cuties (or tangerines)
  • 8 oz dark chocolate morsels
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Sea salt flakes

Supplies

  • Parchment paper
";
directions:
1. Peel and section the cuties, removing any strings or rind from the flesh of the slices.
  2. Melt the dark chocolate pieces over low heat and be careful not to scorch them.
  3. Add the coconut oil and vanilla extract to the chocolate and melt for another couple of minutes until you can stir well to combine.
  4. Dip one cutie slice at a time into the melted chocolate halfway and set on the parchment paper. Repeat until all of the slices are coated.
  5. Sprinkle a little bit of the sea salt flakes on each slice.
  6. Place the cuties in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before consuming to allow the chocolate to harden.
  7. Store in the refrigerator and enjoy within a week!

articleBodyHTML:
Vegan Chocolate Crepes! Making every day feel like something worth celebrating!

Crepes are so versatile. They can be savory and sweet, be served for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert. But have you ever had chocolate crepes? It goes to a whole new level of amazing! By only adding a few tablespoons of cocoa powder, your crepes have a whole new depth to them. You can fill them with whatever you desire: berries, bananas, coconut cream, jam. Really the possibilities are endless!

The crepes have coconut oil that help increase your HDL (healthy cholesterol). And depending on what you roll up in the crepe can also add more health benefits. This particular crepe is filled with strawberries which have antioxidants, vitamin C, dietary fiber, and magnesium. There is also coconut cream which also is a healthy fat.
articleSummaryHTML: Vegan Chocolate Crepes! Making every day feel like something worth celebrating!
seoTitle: Vegan Chocolate Crepes!
seoDescription: Vegan Chocolate Crepes! Making every day feel like something worth celebrating!
ingredients:
s:1067:"

Crepes

  • 2 ¼ cups flour
  • 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
  • 2 ½ cups almond or coconut milk
  • 2 tablespoons lakonta or agave
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 1 flax egg (1 tablespoon flaxseed meal+2.5 tablespoons water)

Toppings:

  • Strawberries
  • Blueberries    
  • Raspberries
  • Maple syrup
  • Coconut cream
  • Bananas
  • Almond/Peanut butter
  • Jam/jelly
";
directions:
Sift all dry ingredients together so there are no lumps when you add the liquids. Add all the liquids and mix until smooth. Add more milk if needed. You need a runny batter that will move easily on the pan.

Heat large nonstick pan over medium heat or use a crepe maker. Spray pan with nonstick spray then add a couple of tablespoon of batter (depending on what size of pan you use, you may need more or less) and rotate pan to spread evenly over bottom. If batter won’t spread easily, add more nut milk. Flip when crepe is bubbly. Once flipped it won’t take as long to cook as the first time. Serve when crepe as cooled slightly. Makes about 20 crepes depending on pan size.

articleBodyHTML:
Dinner just got awesome with these vegan scalloped potatoes that can be either a side dish or the main attraction! Either way is a dinner win!

Potatoes are a staple in many kitchen pantries because they are so versatile and cheap, but they can get boring when you have the same things all the time. So I dug deep and pulled out a classic recipe, scalloped potatoes. These potatoes can be served up with any main dish or can be used as a main dish.

They are very simple to make, and you only need the basic ingredients. You can give them a boast and add vegan ham and cheese to make them a main dish, but you can also leave them with not much more than the sauce to add to an already full meal.

Potatoes are very low in calorie with no fat, sodium, or cholesterol. They have more potassium than a banana and also have vitamin B6, fiber, and antioxidants. Almond milk is also low in calories and high in vitamin D. They are a good pair that make a killer dish.
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner just got awesome with these vegan scalloped potatoes that can be either a side dish or the main attraction! Either way is a dinner win!
seoTitle: Vegan Scalloped Potatoes
seoDescription: Dinner just got awesome with these vegan scalloped potatoes that can be either a side dish or the main attraction! Either way is a dinner win!
ingredients:
s:429:"
  • 3 to 4 red potatoes (about 1 lb)
  • ¼ cup chopped onions
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons vegan butter
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ teaspoon pepper
  • 1–¼ cup almond milk
";
directions:
1. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a pie pan or 8x8 pan, set aside.
  2. For sauce, melt butter in small pan over medium heat, then add onions and cook until onions are clear. Add garlic and cook until you can smell it, about 1 minute. Add flour, salt, and pepper and cook for about 1 minute. Add milk and cook until thick and bubbly.
  3. Slice potatoes very thinly. Arrange half the potatoes in a pie plate or pan, then pour half the sauce over potatoes. Arrange other half of potatoes, then add remaining sauce over top.
  4. Bake in preheated oven for about 30 mins covered. Uncover and bake for about 15 to 20 mins more or until potatoes are tender.
  5. To make a main dish, add about 2 cups of vegan ham in between layers of potatoes.
  6. To add cheese: stir in ¾ c of vegan cheddar cheese into thickened sauce.

articleBodyHTML:
Spring is here and ready to delight you with refreshing flavors like the ones you will find in this strawberry spinach salad!

Confession time: I used to think adding fruit to a salad sounded absolutely gross UNTIL I actually tried it! Man, it is delicious. And this salad is no exception. It is so tasty, and the tart poppy seed dressing makes it perfection. In fact, I had it for lunch this past week and discovered its deliciousness all over again.

There is everything to love about this salad. Strawberries are a very good antioxidant with plenty of vitamin C, folate, potassium and dietary fiber. You can also sub any berry you want in this salad as all berries have excellent health benefits. Mandarin oranges also have high levels of vitamin C and are an antioxidant as well. Spinach is chock full of even more healthy factors like protein, zinc, fiber, calcium, and potassium.

Quickly, throw this salad together and enjoy every morsel. I know you’ll love it!
articleSummaryHTML: Spring is here and ready to delight you with refreshing flavors like the ones you will find in this strawberry spinach salad!
seoTitle: Strawberry Spinach Salad
seoDescription: Spring is here and ready to delight you with refreshing flavors like the ones you will find in this strawberry spinach salad!
ingredients:
s:603:"

Salad

  • 8 oz spinach
  • ½–1 head of green leaf lettuce
  • 1 large can mandarin oranges or 2 or 3 mandarin oranges, peeled
  • 1 lb. strawberries
  • ½ red onion, sliced thin

Dressing

  • ¼ cup lakanto
  • 1 teaspoon kosher salt
  • Dash of pepper
  • ¼ cup vinegar, plain, red or white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon mustard
  • 1 green onion
  • ½ cup vegetable oil
  • 1 teaspoon poppy seed
";
directions:
1. Toss spinach, lettuce, oranges, strawberries and red onion in large bowl. Top with poppy seed dressing.
  2. For dressing, combine all dressing ingredients in food processor and blend well. Add poppy seeds and pulse a couple of times. Store unused dressing in the fridge.

articleBodyHTML:
World’s worst cook? We’ve got a delicious dinner even the world's worst cook can’t mess up! Easy vegan ramen!

This delicious vegan ramen makes a nutritious dinner that comes together in just 30 minutes! It doesn’t require any fancy ingredients, and there is nothing that could go wrong so even if you’re the world’s worst cook – you’ll definitely succeed!
articleSummaryHTML: World’s worst cook? We’ve got a delicious dinner even the world's worst cook can’t mess up! Easy vegan ramen!
seoTitle: Easy Vegan Ramen
seoDescription: World’s worst cook? We’ve got a delicious dinner even the world's worst cook can’t mess up! Easy vegan ramen!
ingredients:
s:1100:"
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
  • 1 medium white onion
  • 4 garlic cloves, crushed
  • 2 tablespoons freshly chopped ginger
  • 5 cups vegetable broth
  • ¼ cup soy sauce

Plus:

  • 4–5 shitake mushrooms (or other variety)
  • 7 ounces firm tofu (I used smoked for extra flavor)
  • 1 tablespoon miso paste
  • 2 tablespoons sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • 3 tablespoons kimchi
  • 7–8 pieces tender stem broccoli
  • 5–6 spring onions
  • Black sesame seeds.
  • 5 ounces rice noodles (or other noodles)
";
directions:
1. Heat coconut oil in a medium saucepan and add onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 5 minutes stirring occasionally.
  2. Add vegetable broth and bring to boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
  3. In the meantime, mix miso paste with sesame oil and maple syrup and set aside.
  4. Prepare two medium frying pans and heat 1 tablespoon coconut oil in each.
  5. Chop tofu into small cubes and place it in one of the pans then fry until golden for about 10 min.
  6. Chop mushrooms and place them in the other pan, cook for 5 min, then add broccoli and prepared miso paste mix. Cook for 5 more minutes stirring occasionally.
  7. In a separate saucepan cook the noodles according to the instructions on the packaging.
  8. Add soy sauce and four whole spring onions to the broth and simmer for two more minutes.
  9. Place cooked noodles in serving bowls; add broth and cooked spring onions then place mushrooms, broccoli, tofu and kimchi on top. Serve sprinkled with chopped spring onion and black sesame seeds.

articleBodyHTML:
For a gluten-free, low sodium snack these white chocolate protein pretzels are going to be your new favorite snack!

Pretzels have always been one of my favorite snacks. But what I thought to be a healthy snack turned out to be a snack that was sky high in sodium. When I learned how to read food labels and the reality hit in that my go-to healthy snack wasn’t so healthy, I wanted to create one that was. Over the years I have been searching for a healthy pretzel. Time and time again, I’ve been disappointed. With the emergence of healthy eating and gluten-free sensitive’s, companies have been creating gluten-free and sodium free pretzels. When I first discovered them, I did a happy dance and devoured the entire package. I couldn’t have been more elated with this product. One night, I was experimenting in the kitchen with recipes, and one of the pretzels fell into my coconut butter mixture I was creating for a cupcake, I took the pretzel out and left it on a plate, meaning to throw it out later. When I was cleaning up, I saw that the mixture had solidified and voila, a new invention was created (the best ones are always by accident right?). Toiling around with the recipe I created a white “chocolate” protein pretzel. Now my life was really complete!

The best part of this recipe is that it uses coconut butter. Coconut butter is one of those miracle foods that has so many incredible health benefits such as helping to boost immunity and ward off viruses because of its antibacterial properties. Coconut butter also helps to burn fat in the body and is the perfect fuel to get the body going. Make sure when you are purchasing this product that it says coconut butter on the label. Coconut oil and butter are two different things so opt for the latter. Paired with Sunwarrior protein, you have yourself a delicious vegan, protein-packed, gluten-free snack. Could this world get any better!
articleSummaryHTML: For a gluten-free, low sodium snack these white chocolate protein pretzels are going to be your new favorite snack!
seoTitle: Vegan Protein Pretzels
seoDescription: For a gluten-free, low sodium snack these white chocolate protein pretzels are going to be your new favorite snack!
ingredients:
s:484:"
  • 1 package gluten-free pretzels
  • ½ cup coconut butter
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ¼ cup orange juice
  • ½ scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
1. Blend all icing ingredients in a high-speed blender until smooth.

2. If your coconut butter is solidified, place jar in a pot of boiling water to gently heat up. keep 

3. Dip pretzels into mixture and place onto a parchment paper lined dish. Let cool for 30 minutes. Store in airtight container when cooled.

articleBodyHTML:
Moist, amazing, and full of all the healthy things that will allow you to eat more than one: we bring you vegan coffee cake muffins.

Coffee cake is one of those recipes that bring beautiful memories of my grandmother. Always preparing coffee cakes for our parties and events in the family. I remember being in the kitchen with her and watching her bake this marvelous creation that we all have grown up on. Recreating a coffee cake as good as hers is nearly impossible because it came from her hands but recreating a recipe that pays homage to this cake was a mission I was ready to embark on.

Coffee cake sounds simple to make right? I thought I would nail it on the first try. Not quite! Recreating a coffee cake that was vegan and tasted up to standards definitely took me a few tries. I wanted to also make it gluten-free, so most of my attempts came out too mushy or dry like a sponge. Luckily, I landed on a recipe that I could publish and was delicious. Experimenting with different nut milks and sugars, I recommend using higher fat nut milk like coconut milk. This will give your cupcakes more moisture and will be more flavorful. Don’t be frightened by using full-fat coconut milk. The fat in coconut milk will actually help you to lose weight or get rid of excess fat.

This recipe calls for oat flour, which is a great substitute for gluten-free baking. Using coconut sugar and applesauce created the sweetness this cake needed. Luckily, this will not spike your blood sugar levels because they both are lower glycemic sweeteners. Applesauce is a great substitute to use in vegan baking as it acts like an egg. This will bind the recipe together. You can also add in some fruits such as apples or even blueberries to make this recipe your own. This recipe is a great base for many experiments in the kitchen.
articleSummaryHTML: Moist, amazing, and full of all the healthy things that will allow you to eat more than one: we bring you vegan coffee cake muffins.
seoTitle: Vegan Coffee Cake Muffins
seoDescription: Moist, amazing, and full of all the healthy things that will allow you to eat more than one: we bring you vegan coffee cake muffins.
ingredients:
s:841:"

Muffins

  • 2 cups oat flour
  • ¼ cup coconut sugar
  • ½ cup full fat coconut milk
  • ¼ cup unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • ¾ teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • ½ teaspoon salt

Crumble

  • ½ cup almond flour
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 3 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees

2. Mix together oat flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl

3. In another bowl mix coconut milk, applesauce, and vanilla

4. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir well. Making sure there are no clumps

5. In a small bowl, mix crumble ingredients together. This mixture will be crumbly as it will give texture to the muffin

6. Place muffin tins inside muffin tray. Pour muffin mixture into each tin until ¾ full. Top with 1 tablespoon of crumble mixture

7. Bake for 15–18 minutes or until when a toothpick inserted is clean

8. Remove from oven and let cool for 20 minutes

articleTitle: Green Matcha Coconut Latte: Energy Elixir
articleBodyHTML:
When you need a quick shot of healthy energy this green matcha coconut latte energy elixir has got your back!

We all need a pick me up, almost every day. It could be the mornings or the time of the day when you try to avoid the sudden crash. Though coffee is truly one of my favorite drinks, I sometimes switch to black tea, herbal teas, and of course green matcha. Switching your “pick me up” drink is essential to avoid addiction to one type of beverage and also allows your body to have a chance to adapt and benefit from different ingredients.

Green matcha tea that originates from Japan is well known for its health benefits:

  • Anti-inflammatory and packed with anti-oxidants
  • Energizes you by boosting metabolism
  • Balances PH level in your body
  • Detoxifies effectively
  • It’s rich in Vitamin C, selenium, zinc, magnesium, and chromium
  • Lowers blood cholesterol level

One of the best ways to consume this magical powder is in the form of latte. It’s perfect for any season and any time.
articleSummaryHTML: When you need a quick shot of healthy energy this green matcha coconut latte energy elixir has got your back!
seoTitle: Green Matcha Coconut Latte: Energy Elixir
seoDescription: When you need a quick shot of healthy energy this green matcha coconut latte energy elixir has got your back!
recipeName: Green Matcha Coconut Latte: Energy Elixir
ingredients:
s:461:"
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 teaspoon green matcha powder
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
  • 1 cinnamon bark stick
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
1. Using a small pot, heat the coconut milk with cinnamon stick and sea salt
  2. Once it comes to a boiling point, remove the cinnamon bark stick
  3. Add rest of the ingredients to the pot and give it a quick whisk until all ingredients are blended in

If you would like to serve it cold, simply blend all ingredients in a high-speed blender and add ice to it

Tips: If you find the matcha powder to be clumping, use a small amount of milk and the powder and whisk it well and then add the rest of the milk and ingredients

Eat healthy. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
If you’re one of those people who love snacking, you need a date with dates! These date rolls are healthy, fun, delicious, Snacking just got awesome!

If you are like me, you’re working long hours and snacking is your best pal. So, it just might be time to replace your snacks with something healthy and nutritious. That brings us to this delicious recipe that can be eaten during work, pre and post- workout, and during long hikes.

Dates are natural sweeteners- they can help to reduce your sugar cravings and help in weight management. They are natural source of Iron- we lose a lot of iron and calcium as we age. Stress and hormones play a key role in the loss of iron for women. 2-3 dates a day for women especially can do wonders for their health. The inclusion of nuts and seeds means you’re giving yourself a rich source of protein, fat, vitamins, and minerals.

A healthy amount of fat combined with good source of energy, boosted with essential nutrients is a great way to feed your living cells.

Have these date rolls with a cup of tea for the full, luxurious experience! You won’t be sorry!
articleSummaryHTML: If you’re one of those people who love snacking, you need a date with dates! These date rolls are healthy, fun, delicious, Snacking just got awesome!
seoTitle: Date Rolls: Snack of Champions!
seoDescription: If you’re one of those people who love snacking, you need a date with dates! These date rolls are healthy, fun, delicious, Snacking just got awesome!
ingredients:
s:423:"
  • 1 cup dates, pitted and made into a paste
  • ¾ cup almonds
  • ¾ cup pine nuts
  • ¾ cup pistachios
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 2 tablespoons spirulina 
";
directions:
1. Using a food processor, process all ingredients together until they are well combined and smooth
  2. Roll them into small balls of your preferred size
  3. You can roll them over shaved coconut or sliced almonds to give it an extra crunch
  4. Serve them with your favorite cup of tea/coffee
  5. Store them in an air-tight container for longer use

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
For granola that crunches and munches in all the healthy ways, we have got you covered with protein-packed cacao granola!

Here’s the deal: cacao is the raw form of chocolate. Cacao is the HEALTHY form of chocolate. It grows on trees in football-like colorful pods. When you open a cacao pod, you’ll find huge seeds inside that are called cacao beans even though they’re seeds (weird but just go with it). If you dry the beans, remove their skin and press on them a bit, they crumble naturally into….NIBS!! (Gotta love cacao nibs.)

But ferment the nibs, grind them up, extract the fat (aka cacao butter) and you’ll get yourself some decadent cacao powder! Which is chock full of antioxidants and minerals – especially iron and magnesium. (And is not the same thing as cocoa – not just in its spelling. Cocoa is heated and also has sugar and other crap added to it, cacao is unadulterated awesome.)

K, so clearly, consuming chocolate by way of cacao is how you can justify calling chocolate “healthy.” And this truly amazing, easy to make, high in plant-protein, quinoa-based CACAO GRANOLA is how you can justify eating chocolate for breakfast.
articleSummaryHTML: For granola that crunches and munches in all the healthy ways, we have got you covered with protein-packed cacao granola!
seoTitle: Protein-Packed Cacao Granola!
seoDescription: For granola that crunches and munches in all the healthy ways, we have got you covered with protein-packed cacao granola!
ingredients:
s:930:"

DRY INGREDIENTS:

  • 1 ½ cups rolled oats
  • 1 cup quinoa (dry, raw, not rinsed)
  • 2 tablespoons chia seeds
  • ¼ cup Sunwarrior Classic chocolate protein
  • 2 tablespoons cacao powder (or 3 for really chocolatey quinoa!)
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • ⅓ cup shredded unsweetened coconut

WET INGREDIENTS:

  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons almond butter
  • 4 tablespoons (or ¼ cup) maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all the dry ingredients.
  3. In a small saucepan on the stove, stir to melt the wet ingredients together over low to medium heat.
  4. Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl over the dry ingredients. Mix together well.
  5. Dump granola mixture onto a baking sheet and put into the oven for 12 minutes.
  6. After 12 minutes, take the granola out of the oven, move it around with a spatula and put it back in the oven for another 3 minutes.
  7. Remove and let cool then let your mouth and spoon run WILD!

articleBodyHTML:
When the siren song of coffee calls, you can shake things up (or blend them) and make that call a healthy one!

There are times when coffee calls my name. It’s the smell, the ritual of grinding beans, and inhaling the aroma with sheer joy. I go through phases where I relish in the process of making and sipping coffee. It’s not the caffeine I love – it’s the bitter, bold, dark taste that has such a personality. Perfection! I prefer it black Americano style with only an occasional cappuccino or soy latte when I want a longer lasting beverage. Adding the Sunwarrior Supergreens and matcha tea is the perfect pick me up after lunch. While going out for coffee may be fun on occasion, it’s nice to know you can make an equally impressive frosty latte at home.
articleSummaryHTML: When the siren song of coffee calls, you can shake things up (or blend them) and make that call a healthy one!
seoTitle: Iced Café Matcha-Cino
seoDescription: When the siren song of coffee calls, you can shake things up (or blend them) and make that call a healthy one!
ingredients:
s:536:"

 

  • 1 cup coconut, soy, or almond milk
  • 1 cup chilled espresso strength coffee
  • 1 teaspoon Sunwarrior Supergreens
  • 1 teaspoon matcha powder
  • ¾ to 1 cup crushed ice

Garnish: Cacao powder, ground coffee, cinnamon, chili flakes

";
directions:
1. Measure all of the ingredients into the blender, pulse to chop the ice then blend on high speed to create a smooth, thick and frothy consistency. Pour into tall glasses, sprinkle with desired garnishes and sip slowly - preferably outside on your patio or in the park.

TERI`S TIPS

A few teaspoons of Sunwarrior protein powder makes for a creamier concoction and a tbsp of raw cacao powder is perfect for any chocolate cravings.

Add stevia or Lakanto if you need an additional touch of sweetness.

No high-speed blender? That’s ok – you can shake the greens into your coffee and pour over ice with the milk of your choice.

articleBodyHTML:
Got yourself in a smoothie rut? Don’t drink the same old smoothie every day! Explore the fantastic flavor of this chard, lime, and mint smoothie that will add zing to your day!

Most of us have a go-to recipe, often using bananas, strawberries, blueberries, and the like for smoothies, but don’t be afraid to shake it up! Experimenting with ingredients like fresh greens, herbs, tropical fruits, and citrus can create flavor complexity and add an array of nutrients to the mix.

To make this blend a little less pedestrian, I’ve combined Swiss chard, fresh mint, lime, and kiwi—sounds like a salad, doesn’t it? Think of Swiss chard as a kale substitute with more fiber, protein, calcium, and (a lot more) iron. Add the freshness of mint, the tang of lime, and delicate sweet tart of kiwi: you’ve just pumped your average fruit smoothie up a level!

Struggle with that sweet tooth? Honeydew melon and a Medjool date (or two, if you’re inclined) is included in the recipe. Dates are loaded with good sugars to sweeten up life; plus their high fiber content will keep you satisfied longer, curbing the temptation to reach for less-healthy snacks.
articleSummaryHTML: Got yourself in a smoothie rut? Don’t drink the same old smoothie every day! Explore the fantastic flavor of this chard, lime, and mint smoothie that will add zing to your day!
seoTitle: Chard, Lime & Mint Smoothie
seoDescription: Got yourself in a smoothie rut? Don’t drink the same old smoothie every day! Explore the fantastic flavor of this chard, lime, and mint smoothie that will add zing to your day!
ingredients:
s:523:"
  • 1 cup honeydew melon, rind and seeds removed
  • 2 cups Swiss chard, stems removed
  • ½ cup almond milk, preferably homemade
  • ¼ cup fresh mint, chopped
  • 3 tablespoons lime juice
  • 1 large kiwi, skin removed
  • 1 Medjool date, pitted
  • Pinch unrefined salt
";
directions:
Blend until smooth. Finish with a sprinkle of lime zest if desired.

Enjoy all the flavor!

articleBodyHTML:
Do you ever crave zucchini bread and brownies at the same time? Well, problem solved! This Chocolate Zucchini Protein bread recipe combines the best of both worlds!

This recipe is great for all diets like vegan, gluten-free, sugar-free, keto, soy-free and overall yucky ingredient-free! It even has added protein and hidden veggies! You get your chocolate brownie fill without the guilt since there’s veggies and added protein! In traditional brownies, you use eggs, butter, and hydrogenated vegetable oil. But I substituted the eggs for flax eggs, the butter for sunflower seed butter, and the zucchini is what helps to keep the loaf moist, which is what the oil is for! This bread is kid approved, fitness junkie approved, and health-conscious mom approved! Good for all on the go who want a little pick-me-up in the morning, after school, before the gym, or even for dessert!
articleSummaryHTML: Do you ever crave zucchini bread and brownies at the same time? Well, problem solved! This Chocolate Zucchini Protein bread recipe combines the best of both worlds!
seoTitle: Chocolate Zucchini Protein Loaf
seoDescription: Do you ever crave zucchini bread and brownies at the same time? Well, problem solved! This Chocolate Zucchini Protein bread combines the best of both worlds!
ingredients:
s:726:"
  • 2 cups shredded zucchini
  • ¼ cup cacao powder
  • 2 scoops Chocolate Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein
  • ¾ cup coconut flour
  • 2/3 cup monk fruit sweetener (coconut sugar works too!)
  • 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed
  • 2 tablespoons sunflower seed butter (any nut/seed butter works!)
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ½–1 cup almond milk
  • *Optional ¼ cup toppings like nuts/seeds/chocolate chips.
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
  2. Make flax eggs by mixing ground flaxseed with 6 tablespoons of warm water.
  3. In a medium mixing bowl, combine dry ingredients except the zucchini.
  4. Once fully mixed, add in “eggs,” sunflower seed butter, and almond milk ¼ cup at a time.
  5. The batter should be similar to a cake batter or pancake batter consistency and then add zucchini.
  6. Transfer mixture to a loaf pan and sprinkle toppings if you desire them.
  7. Bake for 45–55 minutes!

articleBodyHTML:
Spring Cleaning for your body is just as important (more important) than cleaning any house. Get your insides ready for summer with this Spring- Clean-My-Insides Smoothie!

I feel a little bad for my blender. Every winter it becomes that thing on my counter that takes up space, makes me resent the cold weather and reminds me of coat-less, hat-less, better times. But every spring, it’s like my blender’s reborn because I go buck wild using it every chance I get now that the temperature of the beverages I make in it isn’t the same as the temperature in the air! Well here’s a detoxifying green smoothie, starring some of the top detoxifying plants, that I love to make at the brink of spring to give some love to my liver who worked so hard throughout the winter while I admittedly fed it some hearty, hard-to-process foods!
articleSummaryHTML: Spring Cleaning for your body is just as important (more important) than cleaning any house. Get your insides ready for summer with this Spring- Clean-My-Insides Smoothie!
seoTitle: My Spring-Clean-My-Insides Green Smoothie!
seoDescription: Spring Cleaning for your body is just as important (more important) than cleaning any house. Get your insides ready for summer with this Spring- Clean-My-Insides Smoothie!
ingredients:
s:538:"
  • A couple of sprigs or a handful of mint or cilantro leaves
  • 1 cup loosely packed spinach
  • 1 cup cucumber (peeled if not organic!)
  • 1 cup pineapple chunks
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • 1 tablespoon peeled fresh ginger, cut into small chunks
  • ½ avocado
  • 1 capful Vitamin Mineral Rush
  • 1 cup green tea, chilled (or just water if tea is not your thing!)
";
directions:
Place all ingredients in a highspeed blender

BLEND!

articleBodyHTML:
Paint the town red by starting with your shake! This vegan cherry shake will bring the color back into your life with vibrant, creamy flavor that’s definitely a party in your glass!

Your core combo of sweet cherries and beets make for a most vibrant colored shake that is all the stuff happiness is made from! One sip of this thick, creamy delish shake and you will be longing for more and planning for the next time you can make it. With just a few ingredients that pack a powerful punch of nutrients including omega 3 EFA, you have a shake that will suffice for breakfast, a pre or post workout refueling, an afternoon indulgence, or a sensational dessert for even the most luxurious dinner gathering. Simply serve in sexy glasses, top with fruits and drizzle with a little chocolate syrup or a berry or orange infused liqueur.
articleSummaryHTML: Paint the town red by starting with your shake! This vegan cherry shake will bring the color back into your life with vibrant, creamy flavor that’s definitely a party in your glass!
seoTitle: Thick & Creamy Vegan Cherry Shake
seoDescription: Paint the town red by starting with your shake! This vegan cherry shake will bring the color back into your life with vibrant, creamy flavor that’s definitely a party in your glass!
ingredients:
s:453:"
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 large beet, cubed
  • 2 cups frozen cherries
  • ½ large avocado
  • ½ cup raw walnuts
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 servings Liquid Light
  • Pinch sea salt and cinnamon
  • Ice if needed
  • GARNISH: chopped walnuts, cherries, mulberries, vanilla powder
";
directions:
1. Measure all of the ingredients in your highspeed blender and blend on high speed to create a smooth, thick, and frothy consistency. Add additional coconut milk and ice if desired. Pour into tall glasses, garnish as desired and relish in the yumminess.
  2. Enjoy!

TERI`S TIPS

  • I add acerola cherry powder and maca root powder
  • Pre-workout: 1 tablespoon each raw cacao and coconut meat, butter, or flakes
  • Post workout, add Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • No highspeed blender? That’s okay; use grated raw beets or cook the beets first and soak the walnuts for 4 hours or overnight. Drain.
  • If your cherries aren’t sweet, add a date or a few drops of stevia to taste
  • Serves 2

articleBodyHTML:
For something as fresh and vibrant as the spring weather outside, try out this spring quinoa and veggie pilaf!

Perfect for dinner as the main course or as a side dish, this quinoa and veggie pilaf has all the springtime going on! Since asparagus is in season right now, it’s the perfect time to plate it up and take in the nutrition it offers. What are you waiting for? Dinner is on!
articleSummaryHTML: For something as fresh and vibrant as the spring weather outside, try out this spring quinoa and veggie pilaf!
seoTitle: Spring Quinoa and Veggie Pilaf
seoDescription: For something as fresh and vibrant as the spring weather outside, try out this spring quinoa and veggie pilaf!
ingredients:
s:751:"
  • 1 ¾ cups water
  • 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 small yellow onion, small dice
  • 2 clove garlic, minced
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 4 asparagus spears, chopped and steamed
  • 1 cup chopped and steamed broccoli
  • 1 sprig of fresh or ¼ teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 cup red or white quinoa, rinsed and drained
  • ½ cup toasted pine nuts
  • Add olive oil and sea salt to taste at the end
";
directions:
1. Dry Toast* quinoa in a pot (2–3 mins).
  2. Add 2 cups of water, ¼ tsp dried thyme, and salt to quinoa and bring to a boil in medium saucepan with lid.
  3. Reduce heat and simmer 15–20 minutes or until quinoa is tender.
  4. Heat olive oil over medium heat.
  5. Add onion and sauté until golden.
  6. Add garlic and salt, and sauté for another 30 seconds.
  7. Add asparagus and broccoli, and sauté for another minute.
  8. Combine cooked quinoa with asparagus and onion mixture; add pine nuts.
  9. Serve hot. May be served as an entrée or side grain dish.

* Dry Toast: place the quinoa in a pot after it has been drained (no water added), heat on medium heat until all the water has evaporated and quinoa gives off a light, nutty scent.

articleBodyHTML:
A dessert so sassy, you’ll never guess it’s vegan! This vegan almond raspberry tart is guaranteed to be the hit of your party!

This delicious tart is a vegan twist on a classic frangipane tart. It is rich but at the same time delicate and fruity with a strong almond note.  It is 100% vegan and refined-sugar free, and it can easily be done gluten free – just use GF oats for the base. It’s one of those cakes where nobody believes it’s vegan, making it a great recipe to show off!
articleSummaryHTML: A dessert so sassy, you’ll never guess it’s vegan! This vegan almond raspberry tart is guaranteed to be the hit of your party!
seoTitle: Vegan Almond Raspberry Tart
seoDescription: A dessert so sassy, you’ll never guess it’s vegan! This vegan almond raspberry tart is guaranteed to be the hit of your party!
ingredients:
s:1108:"

Base

  • 1 cup oat flour (you can simply make it by blending oats in a food processor)
  • ¾ cup ground almonds
  • 4 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • A pinch of salt

Filling

  • ½ cup smooth almond butter (make sure you use one that it 100% almonds)
  • 1 cup ground almonds
  • 1 can chickpeas in water (you will only need the water)
  • ½ cup maple syrup
  • A few drops almond essence
  • A pinch of salt
  • 1 tablespoon raspberry jam
  • 1 handful fresh or frozen raspberries
  • Almond flakes (optional)
  •  
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Line bottom of a round 8-inch cake tin with greaseproof paper and set aside.
  2. In a large bowl, mix thoroughly: oat flour, ground almonds, coconut oil, maple syrup, and salt. The formed dough should have quite wet consistency and be easy to form.
  3. Transfer the dough to the prepared cake tin, and, using your hands, mold it to the bottom and to the sides to form a base that is around 1.5 inches tall. Spike the base with a fork and place in the oven. Bake for 10 min then take out and set aside.
  4. While the base is in the oven, prepare the filling. Transfer chickpea water to a clean and grease-free bowl and, using an electric mixer, whisk for 5 min on high speed until white, foamy, and fluffy.
  5. In a small bowl, mix almond butter with maple syrup and almond essence and gradually add that to the chickpea water while still whisking.
  6. Gradually add ground almonds while whisking continuously and finish with a pinch of salt.
  7. Spread raspberry jam on the bottom of pre-baked base, then transfer the almond filling and spread evenly on top. Place raspberries and almond flakes on top and put back in the oven. Bake 45–50 min, turn the oven off and leave the tart inside for another 15 min. Then take out of the oven and set aside to cool.  Serve on its own or with a side of vegan ice cream.

articleTitle: Vegan Peanut Butter Chocolate Mini Cheesecakes
articleBodyHTML:
Fast and easy, these vegan peanut butter chocolate mini cheesecakes provide tons of nutrients and proteins without the guilt!

These indulgent mini cheesecakes are super healthy and packed with nutrients and protein! They don’t require too much preparation, and, once ready, you can store them in the freezer for as long as you like without worrying about them going off.
articleSummaryHTML: Fast and easy, these vegan peanut butter chocolate mini cheesecakes provide tons of nutrients and proteins without the guilt!
seoTitle: Vegan Peanut Butter Chocolate Mini Cheesecakes
seoDescription: Fast and easy, these vegan peanut butter chocolate mini cheesecakes provide tons of nutrients and proteins without the guilt!
recipeName: Vegan Peanut Butter Chocolate Mini Cheesecakes
ingredients:
s:938:"

Base

  • ½ cup oat flour (you can make it by blending oat flakes in a food processor or high-speed blender)
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 tablespoon maple syrup
  • ¼ cup ground almonds
  • a pinch of salt

Cheesecake

  • 1 1/3 cup cashews, soaked for 4–6 hours
  • 12+1 tablespoons peanut butter
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup

Chocolate

  • ½ cup dark chocolate
  • 1 tablespoon coconut oil
";
directions:
1. Prepare 12 cupcake cases and put them on a cupcake tin.
  2. To make the base put all the ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender and blend until dough forms. It should have a consistency of wet sand. Press 1 tablespoon of the dough firmly to the bottom of each case and set aside.
  3. To make the cheese put drained cashews in a food processor/high-speed blender, add maple syrup, coconut oil, and one tablespoon peanut butter, then blend until smooth ‘cheese’ forms, which should take a good few minutes. When ready, put an equal portion of the ‘cheese’ in each cupcake case. Using a teaspoon, make a tiny cavity in each cheesecake and then fill it with one tablespoon peanut butter. Put the tin in the freezer.
  4. To make the chocolate, melt one tablespoon coconut oil on low heat and add chopped chocolate. Keep stirring until completely melted. Take the cupcake tin out of the freezer and pour an equal amount of chocolate on top of each cheesecake, then put back in the freezer for 2 hours. From this point, you can store the cheesecakes in the fridge for up to a week or in the freezer for as long as you like (just take them out 30 min before serving).

articleBodyHTML:
Breakfast doesn’t have to be boring, and it never is when it’s got blueberries! This superfood blueberry oatmeal is all the things breakfast should be starting with delicious!

Oatmeal is a great breakfast staple across the world and has been for years! The only issue is that sometimes all the toppings and sweeteners can deteriorate the nutritional value that oatmeal has to offer. Oatmeal is high in fiber, iron, protein, magnesium, and many other vitamins and minerals. These nutrients provided by oats can help lower cholesterol, stabilize blood sugar, and promote weight loss. Many commercialized oat brands add sugar or other sweeteners to prepackaged servings. For this recipe, I recommend using gluten-free oats that are rolled oats or steel cut oats, and even instant oats are fine as long as there is only one ingredient on the label.

Flax seeds are high in omega-3 fatty acids and fiber. Chia seeds are also a great source of omega-3s, as well as calcium. Hemp seeds are a complete protein and contain both omega 3 and omega 6 fatty acids. Maca root helps to balance hormones and increases energy. Getting sweetness from cinnamon, vanilla extract, and protein powder that is only sweetened with stevia leaf ensures bursting flavor without added sugar spikes and unnecessary carbohydrates. To top it off, not only are blueberries in season for spring, but they are very high in antioxidants and flavor, and low in sugar.
articleSummaryHTML: Breakfast doesn’t have to be boring, and it never is when it’s got blueberries! This superfood blueberry oatmeal is all the things breakfast should be starting with delicious!
seoTitle: Superfood Blueberry Oatmeal
seoDescription: Breakfast doesn’t have to be boring, and it never is when it’s got blueberries! This superfood blueberry oatmeal is all the things breakfast should be starting with delicious!
ingredients:
s:918:"
  • ½ cup gluten-free old fashion oats
  • 1 cup water or 1 cup plant-based milk
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 1 teaspoon organic raw maca powder
  • 1 tablespoon flax seeds
  • 1 tablespoon hemp seeds
  • 1 tablespoon chia seeds
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Optional toppings

  • Cacao nibs
  • Cacao powder
  • Coconut Flakes
  • Almond Butter
";
directions:
1. Bring a cup of water (or milk) to a boil. Add in cinnamon and vanilla extract. Once boiling, add the oats.
  2. If using old-fashioned oats, turn down to low/medium heat for 10 minutes and occasionally stir (check directions because some brands and oat varieties differ in cook time – I used Bobs Red Mill Old Fashioned Oats). Once the oats are fully cooked, pour into a bowl.
  3. Mix in a scoop of protein powder, 1 teaspoon of maca powder, and the additional ¼ cup of almond milk.
  4. Top with flax seeds, chia seeds, hemp seeds, blueberries, cinnamon, and any other ingredients of your choosing!

articleBodyHTML:
Going vegan doesn’t mean giving up the good stuff! You can make your own “cheese” out of nuts. This cashew rawcotta recipe shows you how!

When you can make your own “cheese” out of nuts, there is truly nothing better. You can’t imagine how easy it is to replace dairy with good old nuts (or seeds). The benefit is you are crafting something that is totally dairy-free, free of preservatives, and totally natural. Cashews have that same mouthfeel as cheese, as they provide a creamy texture and a delicious flavor, especially when you make it salty! If you are allergic to nuts, you can also use hemp seeds or sunflower seeds.

This rawcotta will last a few days in the fridge, and you can add it to pizza, zucchini noodles, gluten-free pasta, salad, or even raw crackers. Also, be sure to add in different herbs and spices to get the flavor just the way you want it.
articleSummaryHTML: Going vegan doesn’t mean giving up the good stuff! You can make your own “cheese” out of nuts. This cashew rawcotta recipe shows you how!
seoTitle: Cashew “Raw”cotta: Vegan Cheese
seoDescription: Going vegan doesn’t mean giving up the good stuff! You can make your own “cheese” out of nuts. This cashew rawcotta recipe shows you how!
ingredients:
s:489:"
  • ½ cup cashews (soaked in water for 1 hour)
  • 1 teaspoon of nutritional yeast
  • A handful of basil or 1–2 teaspoons dried basil
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Add olive oil if necessary for consistency
";
directions:
1. Drain the cashews and place in food processor with herbs and salt and pepper. Process until the mixture takes on the consistency of ricotta cheese. Set aside for when you need it.
  2. Sprinkle on raw pizza crust, raw pasta “zucchini noodles” or on a salad.
  3. Enjoy it!

articleBodyHTML:
Dressing up dinner has never tasted so fresh and delicious! This green beans almondine will be the star of the table!

Green beans are a classic side; however, they can be boring on their own. So, the addition of almonds gives them a crunchy texture with some health added fat and protein. If you aren’t into green beans feel free to swap them up with snow peas, snap peas, or asparagus depending on the season.

Alternatively, if you aren’t into almonds or you have an allergy, try using hazelnuts, walnuts, pecans, or even sunflower seeds for a different variety.

This makes an excellent side dish on the table along with protein or root veggie dish.
articleSummaryHTML: Dressing up dinner has never tasted so fresh and delicious! This green beans almondine will be the star of the table!
seoTitle: Green Beans Almondine
seoDescription: Dressing up dinner has never tasted so fresh and delicious! This green beans almondine will be the star of the table!
ingredients:
s:419:"
  • 1 cup almonds, chopped and toasted (lightly toast in the oven at 200F for 10 minutes)
  • 2 pounds green beans, ends trimmed and strings removed
  • Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
";
directions:
1. Place the green beans in a large steamer basket and steam for 3–5 minutes or until tender. Place under cool running water to halt the cooking and maintain a bright green color. Transfer the steamed greens to a large bowl.
  2. Season the green beans to taste with salt and pepper, toss gently, and set aside.
  3. In a large skillet, warm the olive oil on low heat gently, and add the green beans, and sauté for 3–5 minutes.
  4. Remove the skillet from the heat, add the remaining ingredients and stir well to combine. Sprinkle the toasted almonds over the green beans and toss well to thoroughly coat the beans with the mixture.
  5. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Hummus probably has to be the easiest thing in the world to make, besides pouring yourself a bowl of cereal, so get going and enjoy food happiness with this harissa hummus!

Hummus is also the most customizable! All you have to do is place everything in a food processor and then blend until smooth. Garlic hummus? No problem. Lemon hummus? Easy peasy! Greek hummus? Just add some Kalamata olives and oregano! In this case, however, we’re talking about harissa hummus.

If you haven’t been introduced to harissa yet, then allow me to be the first! A combination of roasted red peppers, vinegar, and sugar come together to make this delicious condiment that can be added to almost anything. The spice levels range depending on which one you buy, but I prefer the mild flavor as you can always make it spicier with red chili flakes. Harissa can be found at your local grocery store – most of the time – just make sure to ask if you don’t see it!

This recipe is so versatile, and it comes together in five minutes flat! Whether you need a quick appetizer for guests or are just looking for something to dip your carrots in, this recipe is for you. Personally, I like to make a double batch and then have it in the fridge for the whole week (yes, we do eat that much hummus). I put it on toast, salads, and dip all sorts of veggies in it. It’s a great, oil-free, healthy alternative to fattening dressings and spreads that can add unwanted calories to your meals!

Note: you can also use dried chickpeas and then cook them to soften them. Soak ½ cup dried chickpeas for 8 hours. Drain and rinse, then boil the chickpeas for about 45 minutes or until tender. If you like your hummus warm, make the hummus right after you finish boiling the chickpeas.
articleSummaryHTML: Hummus probably has to be the easiest thing in the world to make, besides pouring yourself a bowl of cereal, so get going and enjoy food happiness with this harissa hummus!
seoTitle: Harissa Hummus
seoDescription: Hummus probably has to be the easiest thing in the world to make, besides pouring yourself a bowl of cereal, so get going and enjoy food happiness with this harissa hummus!
ingredients:
s:355:"
  • 1 can chickpeas rinsed and drained
  • 2 tablespoons tahini
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • 2 tablespoons mild harissa
  • ¼ cup water
  • Salt and pepper to taste 
";
directions: Add all ingredients into a food processor and blend to desired consistency. Serve room temperature or cold!

articleBodyHTML:
Fast and easy, this lemon garlic avocado mousse side dish adds zip and zing to any main dish! Who says the sidekick has to stay in the shadows? Sidekicks were meant to shine!

This lemon garlic avocado mousse is an excellent side dish to my salsa marinated tempeh recipe. The bold flavors combine into something truly fantastic! But it pairs well with any Mexican entrée!

I’ve long been on a mission to shift the belief that healthy food is tasteless and boring. No boring food in my world, baby! All of you on the wellness path know what a myth it is that healthy food must taste flavorless. Taste-bud-dropping-foods, infused with flair, flavor, and nutrition is exactly what you’ll find with my recipes. Not for the weak of palate! With uncomplicated ingredients and confident intention, you can make great tasting food with the added bonus of having that food be oh-so-good-for-you. All you need to do is get to it and this recipe will have you proud of your culinary skills. So, all the salutes to you and the fabulous creations you will make in your kitchen! This lemon garlic avocado mousse will help you get on your way to food greatness!
articleSummaryHTML: Fast and easy, this lemon garlic avocado mousse side dish adds zip and zing to any main dish! Who says the sidekick has to stay in the shadows? Sidekicks were meant to shine!
seoTitle: Lemon Garlic Avocado Mousse
seoDescription: Fast and easy, this lemon garlic avocado mousse side dish adds zip and zing to any main dish! Who says the sidekick has to stay in the shadows? Sidekicks were meant to shine!
ingredients:
s:323:"
  • 2 medium ripe avocados
  • 1 clove garlic, minced
  • Generous squeeze lime or lemon juice
  • Pinch sea salt and cayenne pepper
  • optional splash of coconut water
";
directions: 1. Using a handheld blender, puree to a creamy smoothie mix adding a splash of coconut water to create desired consistency if needed. Serve with the tempeh cutlets or any main dish that needs a bit of spice and sass on the side!

articleBodyHTML:
For some Southwest flavor, we’ve got you covered with a bold and zesty dinner of salsa marinated tempeh!

With the use of big, bold, sweet, salty, savory, and sassy spices and fresh herbs, this grilled tempeh recipe came about when in Peace River, AB where ingredient choices were limited. With fresh salsa on hand, a handful of spices, a splash of oil and the tempeh I packed in my suitcase, a wonderful dinner came about.
articleSummaryHTML: For some Southwest flavor, we’ve got you covered with a bold and zesty dinner of salsa marinated tempeh!
seoTitle: Salsa Seasoned Grilled Tempeh
seoDescription: For some Southwest flavor, we’ve got you covered with a bold and zesty dinner of salsa marinated tempeh!
ingredients:
s:791:"
  • 2 250g packages. organic or non-GMO Tempeh
  • ½ cup fresh salsa juice or spicy tomato juice (like Walter’s clamato mix)
  • 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
  • 1 tablespoon olive or avocado oil or 3 tablespoons creamed avocado
  • 2 teaspoons garlic, chopped
  • 1 heaping teaspoon cumin
  • 1 heaping teaspoon chili powder
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder if you want smoky spiciness
  • Garnish: fresh cilantro, additional salsa, and lime wedges
";
directions:
1. Combine the marinade ingredients in a large glass baking dish and marinate tempeh in a single layer for at least 1 hour at room temp or overnight in the fridge flipping halfway through.
  2. Remove tempeh from marinade, reserving marinade for basting. Place cutlets on a parchment or coconut oil covered baking sheet and bake at 350F for 25 – 30 minutes or until bronzed. Turn over after 20 mins and baste. Baste again with marinade before plating and serve with additional salsa and a roasted or grilled veggie salad.

TERI’S TIPS:

  • Salsa juice is simply strained salsa. Save the thick chunky salsa remnants to serve along-side the cutlets.
  • To BBQ, grill over medium-high heat approx.8 minutes per side or until you see caramel grill marks.
  • Use tofu, eggplant, or Portobello mushrooms in addition to or as an alternative to tempeh.
  • Overcooking hack! Double the marinade recipe and marinate at least 4 hours if you are known to overcook your food. :-)
  • Pair with roasted or grilled peppers, onions, tomatillos, and corn cobs and serve with warm organic corn tortillas for a fun take on fajitas. Fresh watermelon juice is a natural fit for your beverage choice or lime lemonade.

articleBodyHTML:
Bring out the flavors of spring by chopping them up into this delightful salad! Zesty and refreshing, this is everything you love about spring!

Created with a variety nuts, seeds, grains, and amazing veggies, including carrots, potato, kale, and collard greens, this delicious salad will leave you energized throughout your entire day. My friends always complained that they were hungry an hour after eating their salads, therefore always snacking on foods until dinner time. By adding more hearty and nutrient dense vegetables, this salad will leave you satiated! This salad is great if you double it and refrigerate it for the following day. This recipe is popping with flavors; it is hard to resist.

This salad not only is bustling with greens and vegetables, but it also adds the incredible power of red rice. Red rice is unhulled like it’s counterpart brown rice adding more nutritional value to the grain. Red rice is very high in bran; therefore, the fiber content is high. This will help regulate your digestive system. The flavor of red rice is beautiful nutty flavor.

Spring is the time that greens are blooming and ready to eat. Take a day on the weekend to visit your local farmers market to see which greens are in season and local. I found delicious kale and collard greens for this salad, but any green will work. When your greens are local and have been harvested only a few days prior is when the maximum amount of nutrients are present. The salad dressing comes together in no time. We use orange juice to give it a touch of sweetness, but you can always omit it for lemon or lime juice.
articleSummaryHTML: Bring out the flavors of spring by chopping them up into this delightful salad! Zesty and refreshing, this is everything you love about spring!
seoTitle: Spring Chopped Salad
seoDescription: Bring out the flavors of spring by chopping them up into this delightful salad! Zesty and refreshing, this is everything you love about spring!
ingredients:
s:623:"

Salad

  • 1 cup cooked Yukon potato, diced
  • ½ cup cooked red rice
  • 1 cup chopped cooked carrots
  • 1 cup chopped collard greens
  • 1 cup chopped kale
  • 1/3 cup pumpkin seeds
  • 2 tablespoons chopped almonds
  • 2 tablespoons chopped dates
  • ¼ cup sliced scallion

Dressing

  • ½ cup rice vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons orange juice
  • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
  • ½ clove garlic
  • salt and pepper 
";
directions:
1. Cook carrots and red rice. Let cool.
  2. Add to large bowl with all other ingredients.
  3. In a small bowl, whisk dressing ingredients together. Pour on top of salad. Let sit for 10 minutes and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
A few things are great all year round, and molasses ginger cookies are definitely on the short list of great things!

They can be soft or crispy, but this particular recipe is soft, but oh so, delicious. And healthy! Win-win for all! These cookies can be made with all-purpose flour or whole wheat flour or even gluten-free flour. I made these with whole wheat flour, and they were delicious! You, or anyone eating them, won’t even know they were made with wheat. My five-year-old couldn’t get enough!

The wheat flour adds protein and fiber to these cookies. Wheat also has the essential vitamin folate. Coconut oil is heart healthy. It can help increase your HDL (good) cholesterol if eaten with a proper diet.

Break out that molasses and ginger and fill your house with smells of fresh-baked cookies. You won’t regret it!
articleSummaryHTML: A few things are great all year round, and molasses ginger cookies are definitely on the short list of great things!
seoTitle: Molasses Ginger Cookies
seoDescription: A few things are great all year round, and molasses ginger cookies are definitely on the short list of great things!
ingredients:
s:887:"
  •  
  • 2 cups whole wheat flour, white whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour or gluten-free flour for the gluten-free version
  • 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon ground cloves
  • ½ teaspoon ground ginger
  • ½ cup coconut sugar
  • 6 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 5 tablespoons molasses
  • 1 flax egg
  • 2 tablespoons almond milk
  • 3 tablespoons coconut sugar, for rolling

 

";
directions:
1. Stir together flour, soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and ginger. Set aside.
  2. In a mixing bowl, combined coconut sugar, oil, molasses, and egg. Add to the dry mixture and mix well. If needed add the almond milk, so the dough sticks together but not too sticky. Refrigerate for an hour.
  3. When ready to bake, preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roll dough into small balls and then, roll in the 3 tablespoons coconut sugar. Bake for 8 minutes or until desired doneness. Let cookies cool on baking sheet for a few minutes before removing them to cookie rack.

articleBodyHTML:
Indulge in all the dessert without all the guilt with this vegan strawberry vanilla cheesecake! Because life should always taste awesome!

Love classic strawberry cheesecake but want to stick to healthy plant-based food? Don’t worry; I’ve got you covered! This vanilla & strawberry heaven is 100% vegan, refined sugar-free and can be easily made gluten-free! You can indulge in the creaminess of this cheesecake without any feeling of guilt. Make sure you give this recipe a go!
articleSummaryHTML: Indulge in all the dessert without all the guilt with this vegan strawberry vanilla cheesecake! Because life should always taste awesome!
seoTitle: Vegan Strawberry Vanilla Cheesecake
seoDescription: Indulge in all the dessert without all the guilt with this vegan strawberry vanilla cheesecake! Because life should always taste awesome!
ingredients:
s:1175:"

Base

  • 1 ½ cups oat flour (you can simply make it by blending oats in a food processor, use GF oats if needed)
  • 4 ounces ground almonds
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • a pinch of salt

“Cheese”

  • 14 ounces cashews, soaked for at least 4 hours
  • 1/3 cup maple syrup
  • 1/3 cup almond milk
  • Coconut cream from one 16 ounce can coconut milk (just the thick top part)
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • a pinch of salt

Topping

  • 2–3 tablespoons strawberry jam
  • 8–10 fresh strawberries
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350. Lay the bottom of a round 8-inch cake tin with greaseproof paper and set aside.
  2. To make the base place all ingredients in a big bowl and mix thoroughly until dough forms. It should have the consistency of wet sand.
  3. Using your hands, mold the dough to the bottom and the sides of the tin so that the base is about 1.5 inches tall.
  4. Spike the base with a fork and place it in the oven. Bake for 10–12 min, then take aside to chill.
  5. While the base is baking prepare the ‘cheese.’ Place drained cashews in a food processor and add all the remaining ingredients apart from the strawberries and jam. Blend until smooth and creamy, which will probably take a good 5 minutes.
  6. When the based has cooled down, spread strawberry jam on the bottom, and then transfer the ‘cheese’ layer on top and even the surface using a spatula.
  7. Place in the freezer for an hour, then put in the fridge for at least 4 hours before serving. Decorate with fresh strawberries when ready to serve. You can store this cheesecake in the fridge for up to 5 days.

articleBodyHTML:
Zoodles with Almond Sauce: this is everything that is awesome about dinner. Asian style: vegan, gluten-free, paleo, keto, and tasty!

Everyone craves some noodles once in a while! This versatile recipe is a great base for experimenting with “zoodles” or “zucchini noodles” for those who aren’t as familiar. You can add any additional vegetables you would like – broccoli and mushrooms are some good ideas, and feel free to add nuts or other toppings to garnish that you wish! The sauce can be made stronger by adding more almond butter or coconut aminos if you’d like. If you are not worried about staying low-carb, some maple syrup can be added to the mix as well. This will satisfy most dietary preferences including gluten free, dairy free, low carb, and vegan. I experimented with almond butter instead of peanuts to make the recipe paleo friendly as well.
articleSummaryHTML: Zoodles with Almond Sauce: this is everything that is awesome about dinner. Asian style: vegan, gluten-free, paleo, keto, and tasty!
seoTitle: Asian Almond Zoodles
seoDescription: Zoodles with Almond Sauce: this is everything that is awesome about dinner. Asian style: vegan, gluten-free, paleo, keto, and tasty!
ingredients:
s:1061:"
  • 2 large zucchinis (or 2 cups already spiralized)
  • 1 large carrot cut into thin slices or ‘noodles’
  • 1 green pepper, thinly sliced
  • 1 red pepper, thinly sliced
  • 1 onion
  • ¼ cup creamy almond butter
  • 2 tablespoons avocado or olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon coconut aminos
  • 1 tablespoon crushed red pepper flakes
  • ½ lime (freshly squeezed juice)
  • ½ lemon (freshly squeezed juice)

Toppings

  • ¼ cup almonds or sesame seeds for garnish
  • ** Feel free to add any additional vegetables or toppings you desire!
";
directions:
1. Spiralize, or cut zucchini into noodles, if not already sliced.
  2. Heat sesame oil and your choice of avocado or olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once heated, add the peppers, carrots, and onions.
  3. Next, add the zucchini noodles to the skillet. Be sure to move the noodles around so they are evenly cooked.
  4. Combine the rest of the ingredients for the sauce into a bowl, and then pour into the skillet. Mix together well.
  5. Remove from the heat and portion out servings. Add toppings or garnish of your choice. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Sweet Potato and Vegan Field Roast Sausage Hash
articleBodyHTML:
Start your day off right with the most important meal of the day being savory, warm, and filling with this sweet potato and vegan field roast sausage hash!

There’s something about a warm, savory breakfast that just hits the spot. Of course, I’m a huge fan of overnight oats or a bowl of cold cereal, but sometimes you just need to eat something hot. This recipe is so incredibly easy and quick to make that doubling it is not looked down upon. It’s a great brunch option if you’re looking for something a little more special as it pairs well with a tofu scramble, but it’s also great reheated the next day and eaten in the car on your way to work. Feeling adventurous? Trying adding red or green peppers, handfuls of kale instead of spinach, or even adding your tofu right into the mix! This recipe is super adaptable for whatever you’re craving.
articleSummaryHTML: Start your day off right with the most important meal of the day being savory, warm, and filling with this sweet potato and vegan field roast sausage hash!
seoTitle: Sweet Potato and Vegan Field Roast Sausage Hash
seoDescription: Start your day off right with the most important meal of the day being savory, warm, and filling with this sweet potato and vegan field roast sausage hash!
recipeName: Sweet Potato and Vegan Field Roast Sausage Hash
ingredients:
s:419:"

 

  • 2 medium sweet potatoes, cut into medium chunks
  • 2 vegan Field Roast Italian Sausages – cut into small chunks
  • ½ large onion, small diced
  • 2 large handfuls of fresh spinach
  • salt and pepper to taste 
";
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375. Place sweet potatoes on a baking pan lined with parchment paper and toss with a little bit of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Place in the oven and bake for about 30–40 minutes until the sweet potatoes are tender and slightly caramelized.
  2. In a small sauté pan, heat about 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add in the onion and sauté until tender and starting to get golden (about 7–10 minutes). Add in your Field Roast Sausage and continue to cook until the sausages are heated through, about another 5 minutes.
  3. Finally, add your handfuls of spinach (you can rough chop these if you like) and sauté until just wilted.
  4. Remove sweet potatoes from the oven and mix with sausage mixture. Serve right away or store in the fridge for up to 4 days.

articleTitle: Vegan Thai Peanut Butter Fried Rice
articleBodyHTML:
This is the dish that will change your life: vegan Thai peanut butter fried rice that will make you sigh with happiness with every bite!

I was fortunate enough to be a server at a high-end Asian fusion restaurant when I became a vegan over six years ago. I quickly discovered that many of my favorite wok fried dishes were inherently plant-based, besides of course the meat, fish, and egg ingredients. To my amazement, simply removing these items and substituting tofu or extra veggies led to many simple and satisfying vegan meals. I credit this experience with laying the foundation for my path, teaching me that living a plant-based lifestyle is not as hard as it sounds. In fact, it’s a breeze!

As it turns out, a lot of Asian cuisines are easy to recreate at home, especially those of the wok fried variety. After much experimentation, I have crafted a simple recipe for delicious fried rice with a Thai inspired peanut butter sauce. I’ve decided to nickname it “The Crowd Pleaser,” due to the overwhelmingly positive feedback upon sharing with several co-workers during a lunch break. The Crowd Pleaser is a hearty, healthy and versatile entrée, so feel free to serve it as the main course, or as an awesome side dish to other foods. Either way it is tried, tested, and guaranteed to make everyone happy—even the omnivores!

I sincerely hope you enjoy this recipe. In closing: you are what you eat, and food always tastes better off someone else’s plate, so eat light, and always make enough to share.

Feeds 4-6 people
articleSummaryHTML: This is the dish that will change your life: vegan Thai peanut butter fried rice that will make you sigh with happiness with every bite!
seoTitle: Vegan Thai Peanut Butter Fried Rice
seoDescription: This is the dish that will change your life: vegan Thai peanut butter fried rice that will make you sigh with happiness with every bite!
recipeName: Vegan Thai Peanut Butter Fried Rice
ingredients:
s:1549:"

RICE

  • 3 cups organic basmati rice
  • 6 cups water
  • 2 tablespoons avocado oil (or your favorite oil)
  • ½ tablespoon of salt

SAUCE

  • 4–6 oz. water
  • ¼ cup organic creamy peanut butter
  • 6 tablespoons organic tamari soy sauce (gluten-free)
  • 3 tablespoons organic hemp seeds
  • 2 tablespoons sesame oil
  • ¼ cup organic rice vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon organic white pepper
  • ½ teaspoon Redmond Real salt
  • ½ teaspoon organic ginger powder (or ½ teaspoon fresh grated ginger)
  • ½ teaspoon organic paprika powder
  • ½ teaspoon organic cayenne pepper
  • ½ teaspoon organic garlic powder

VEGGIES

  • 1 cup water
  • 1 cup chopped organic broccoli
  • ½ cup chopped organic cauliflower
  • ¼ cup mix of chopped organic red, yellow and orange peppers
  • ¼ cup  sliced mushrooms
  • 2 tablespoon sesame oil
  • ½ tablespoon Redmond Real salt
  • Dash of organic white pepper

GARNISH

  • 1 tablespoon of organic black beans per serving (canned is fine)
  • 1 tablespoon of sesame oil (add when heating beans)
  • 1 generous pinch of sesame seeds sprinkled on top of each serving
";
directions:
1. Combine rice, water, oil and salt in a rice cooker.
  2. Set rice cooker to white rice setting and wait approximately 45 minutes (exact time varies by machine).
  3. Add veggies to wok. Add 1 cup of water and salt to pan, and turn burner on high until water is boiling. Place medium sized pan lid over veggies and lower heat to medium-low. This will steam the veggies. Let steam for about 10 minutes.
  4. Open can of beans and drain most liquid out using lid, keeping beans in can.
