  5. Empty contents into a small saucepan, add 1 tablespoon of sesame oil and set heat to medium.
  6. Combine all sauce ingredients in preferred blender or food processor. I used a Vitamix for my recipe.
  7. Turn blender on and pulse to mix ingredients until smooth.
  8. After vegetables are steamed, remove lid and drain water from Wok. This can be achieved by using the wooden ladle to hold back veggies while pouring water over the sink. Using a colander works too. It is okay if a little water is left over in wok.
  9. Turn heat up to medium-high and pour 2 tablespoons of sesame oil in the wok with veggies. Lightly fry for about 4 minutes.
  10. Put a dash of white pepper in the wok while veggies are frying.
  11. Add rice to wok and pour peanut butter sauce over rice. Mix with a wooden spatula until thoroughly mixed. Continue frying until hot.
  12. Each serving should be 1 or 2 cups of fried rice. Use a measuring cup in a small bowl to create a flat surfaced look.
  13. Add sesame seed and black bean garnish
  14. Give gratitude and enjoy your food!

PRO TIP: Fancy wok flips are always a cool party trick! Give it a try. Doing this is a surefire way to impress your guests, but be careful not to drop food on the ground. If you do, don’t sweat it. Learn to laugh at yourself!

articleBodyHTML:
Zesty, and healthy, these easy veggie quesadillas are great for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks! So heat up the frypan, and prepare for awesome!

Who doesn’t love a little Mexican food? Whether you like things spicy or mild, by sneaking avocado into the filling recipe, you are providing a delicious and creamy base so that sour cream is not necessary! Once it is all put together, these paper-thin tortillas are great for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. They are even amazing for kids to take to school for lunch, and it provides an amazing after school snack!
articleSummaryHTML: Zesty, and healthy, these easy veggie quesadillas are great for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks! So heat up the frypan, and prepare for awesome!
seoTitle: Black Bean Tortillas: Grain Free
seoDescription: Zesty, and healthy, these easy veggie quesadillas are great for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks! So heat up the frypan, and prepare for awesome!
ingredients:
s:473:"
  • 1 cup cooked or canned black beans, drained
  • ½–1 ripe avocado, cubed
  • ½ teaspoon cumin
  • ½ teaspoon coriander
  • 1–2 teaspoon garlic, minced
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt to taste
  • ¼ teaspoon dulse granules
";
directions:
Filling

  1. In a food processor, puree beans. Add cumin, coriander, garlic, salt, lime juice, dulse granules, and reserved liquid from beans.
  2. Blend until smooth.
  3. Add avocado and chopped veggies and pulse a few times until all ingredients are well combined.

To Make Easy Tortillas

  1. Place filling inside of half of SIETE almond tortilla, and add cashew cheese or nutritional yeast on top of filling. Cover with the other side of tortilla (making a half moon).
  2. Lightly oil a pan with grapeseed oil; turn the heat on to medium. Lightly pan-fry each side of the tortilla until the cheese has melted.
  3. Remove from pan and cut tortilla in half, two-quarter triangles and serve. Keeps for up to 4 days if kept separately, or 1 day if made tortilla and filling are stored together.

This recipe can also be dipped in a mild salsa.

articleBodyHTML:
A little thing called Acai: This berry is your new jam! How can a berry so little, be packed with so much punch? There’s health and flavor all in one!

Acai is quite the buzzword these days. Whatever the form (juice, frozen pulp, or powder), and whatever you may have heard, it is most likely true. These little purplish-blue berries from the Amazon jungle contain a powerhouse of nutrients. To name a few, they have everything from B-vitamins to zinc! Not to mention they are loaded with healthy cell promoting antioxidants. Acai is a superfood, which means the nutrients in these tiny berries are so concentrated that you need such a small amount (daily) to get all of its benefits. They have been known to support weight loss, detox the body, provide long-lasting energy and give a delicious and unique flavor to any recipe!

There are many ways to add Acai to your daily recipes. Whether you add the frozen pulp or powder it into a smoothie, chia cereal, homemade jam, or dessert, there are so many ways to use this magical berry and reap its benefits.
articleSummaryHTML: A little thing called Acai: This berry is your new jam! How can a berry so little, be packed with so much punch? There’s health and flavor all in one!
seoTitle: Acai Berry Jam
seoDescription: A little thing called Acai: This berry is your new jam! How can a berry so little, be packed with so much punch? There’s health and flavor all in one!
ingredients:
s:322:"
  • 2 tablespoons chia seeds
  • ½ cup apple juice (fresh is best)
  • 2 tablespoons acai berry powder
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
";
directions:
Mix together the chia seeds with the apple juice in a small bowl or glass. Allow to sit for 20–30 minutes, stirring once. After the chia has gelatinized, mix in the acai powder, maple syrup, and lemon juice. For best results, allow mixture to set for 30 minutes before serving. Will keep in a sealed container in the refrigerator for 1–2 weeks.

Makes 2/3 cup.

articleBodyHTML:
Just in Time for Strawberry Season! It’s The Strawberry Smoothie to End All Strawberry Smoothies! Get ready for flavor!

You know when you just nail a smoothie that satisfies the exact craving and flavor profile you were going for? The smoothie that you blended up - er, dreamt up - while on your last leg of a sweaty sunny run? Well, this is that smoothie. Hence why I’ve titled this recipe The Strawberry Smoothie to End All Strawberry Smoothies. The craving came when I was .5 miles away from home and exhausted and I needed something extra special to push my legs for, and a creamy, dreamy strawberry smoothie came to my mind...and then my mouth.

Here’s the awesome recipe:
articleSummaryHTML: Just in Time for Strawberry Season! It’s The Strawberry Smoothie to End All Strawberry Smoothies! Get ready for flavor!
seoTitle: Super Strawberry Smoothie!
seoDescription: Just in Time for Strawberry Season! It’s The Strawberry Smoothie to End All Strawberry Smoothies! Get ready for flavor!
ingredients:
s:687:"
  • 1 cup frozen strawberries
  • 1 cup frozen cauliflower
  • ¼ cup frozen banana, cut into slices for easier blending
  • 1 teaspoon maca powder (optional but amazing)
  • ½–1 whole scoop of Sunwarrior’s Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • ½–¾ cup coconut water (or 1 cup coconut water)
  • ½–¾ cup almond milk (or 1 cup almond milk)
";
directions:
1. Go for a run, get all sweaty, come back home and then blend!!
  2. Or, just blend!
  3. (And add any extra splashes of liquid to make the smoothie your desired consistency.)

articleBodyHTML:
Looking for a refreshing smoothie to satisfy? This is it! Quick, delicious and waiting for you to get your morning smoothie on! The Banana Coconut Creamsicle Smoothie is here!

This is breakfast at its best! In fact, enjoy whenever you get the desire. No added sugars and this all natural smoothie will make you smile for all the right reasons! Don’t pass this up. All you need are a few ingredients and your best ice crushing blender! Serves three.

MAIN BENEFITS

Oranges

  • High in Vitamin C and strong antioxidant: can block the formation of free radicals.

Bananas

  • Rich in fiber and potassium: may lower blood pressure.

Coconuts

  • Anti-viral properties: strengthens immunity.
  • Saturated Fats: providing energy in the form of Medium Chain Triglycerides. The body can use the fat as an immediate source of energy.
articleSummaryHTML: Looking for a refreshing smoothie to satisfy? This is it! Quick, delicious and waiting for you to get your morning smoothie on! The Banana Coconut Creamsicle Smoothie is here!
seoTitle: Banana Coconut Creamsicle Smoothie
seoDescription: Looking for a refreshing smoothie to satisfy? This is it! Quick, delicious and waiting for you to get your morning smoothie on! The Banana Coconut Creamsicle Smoothie is here!
ingredients:
s:675:"
  • 2 medium oranges peeled, diced with visible seeds removed
  • 3 bananas, peeled and broken in half
  • 1 ½ cups coconut almond milk, unsweetened
  • 2–3 servings Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 1 tablespoon pure vanilla
  • About 10–12 ice cubes

Optional

  • Coconut flakes
  • Fruit
";
directions: 1. Place diced oranges and bananas in your blender first, then add your non-dairy milk, vanilla. Blend on low-speed for about 20 seconds until your main ingredients are combined together. Add in your Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Vanilla Protein. Blend again for another 20 seconds. This will give your smoothie great smooth texture. Finally, add the ice and blend on high speed until smooth. Pour into glasses and top with optional ingredients. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Snap Pea Radish Salad with Carrot Dressing
articleBodyHTML:
Want something fresh for lunch? Well, snap to it with this snap pea radish salad with carrot dressing!

Fresh, fresh and fresh! This salad exudes freshness! It’s bright, crisp, happy and filling. The many textures in this salad will keep your palate enticed and wanting more. Get creative with your toppings to really make this salad your own. It’s also full of vitamin, minerals and healthy fats, so you know you’re doing your body some serious good!
articleSummaryHTML: Want something fresh for lunch? Well, snap to it with this snap pea radish salad with carrot dressing!
seoTitle: Snap Pea Radish Salad with Carrot Dressing
seoDescription: Want something fresh for lunch? Well, snap to it with this snap pea radish salad with carrot dressing!
recipeName: Snap Pea Radish Salad with Carrot Dressing
ingredients:
s:1049:"

Salad

  • 5 ounces snap peas, rinsed
  • 1 cup radishes, thinly sliced
  • 2 cups carrots, grated (one cup for salad, one cup for dressing)
  • ¼ teaspoon kosher salt

Dressing

  • 1 cup carrots (use from salad ingredients)
  • 4 tablespoons water
  • 2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons avocado oil
  • 1 tablespoon plain soy yogurt
  • ½ of a shallot, finely chopped
  • 1 ½ teaspoons ginger, grated
  • 1 ½ teaspoons miso

Salad Toppings

Walnuts, craisins, pomegranate seeds, sliced avocado

";
directions:
1. In a medium pot, blanch snap peas over medium/high heat. Drain and then ice snap peas for 5 minutes. Once completed, cut into bite-size pieces and move peas into a medium salad mixing bowl.

2. Add one cup of grated carrots and thinly sliced radish. Sprinkle with ¼ teaspoon kosher salt. Mix.

3. Combine dressing ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Drizzle dressing over salad mixture in salad bowl.

4. Top with salad toppings and ENJOY!!

articleBodyHTML:
Give your taste buds a happy place with this Vegan Thyme Lemon Bread that tastes and smells like everything awesome!

Two ingredients that sing together in harmony are an odd combo at first glance. Odd or not, once you bite into one slice of this delightful cake, your taste buds will be doing a happy dance. These two ingredients are thyme and lemon. Yes, at first it sounds savory, a little odd, and something you would throw together in a kitchen sink type of recipe. I promise; this tastes incredible. If you aren’t a fan of thyme, you could always replace it with rosemary or lavender. The possibilities are endless. This cake can be made for spring brunches, birthday parties, or even that daily desert we all crave in the morning or after dinner. Using a different variety of flavors and herbs to our desserts can enhance the core flavor.

This recipe is a spring favorite but can be used during fall as well as the flavors intermix with the seasons. This isn’t your typical loaf cake which can be super dry. This cake is moist, bursting with fresh flavors, and spongey. Adding a lemon syrup to the cake while it’s cooling gives that extra burst of freshness. The beautiful thing about this cake is that it's gluten-free and of course, vegan. This cake resembles something you would buy at your local coffee shop. Speckled with perfection and too pretty to eat, until you take that first bite. To ensure freshness, you can always pop this into the fridge when it’s cooled, and it lasts a few days longer than if it was sitting out (if it lasts that long!).

This is a foolproof recipe that will come together in no time. You can double up the batch and pop it into the fridge for five days if you plan on making a second loaf during that time.
articleSummaryHTML: Give your taste buds a happy place with this Vegan Thyme Lemon Bread that tastes and smells like everything awesome!
seoTitle: Vegan Thyme Lemon Loaf
seoDescription: Give your taste buds a happy place with this Vegan Thyme Lemon Bread that tastes and smells like everything awesome!
ingredients:
s:914:"
  • ¾ cup almond milk
  • ½ cup melted coconut oil 
  • 2 lemons, juiced
  • 3 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • Zest of two lemons
  • 1 ¾ cup gluten-free flour 
  • 1 cup nut meal (almond, hazelnut, walnut)
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder 
  • ¼ tsp salt

Thyme and Lemon Syrup

  • ½ cup fine ground sugar or coconut sugar
  • ¼ cup fresh lemon juice (around 3–4 lemons)
  • 3 sprigs thyme 
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
  2. Melt coconut oil over low heat in a small pan. Add 3 tablespoons of sugar, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Whisk all ingredients together. Remove from heat
  3. Mix gluten-free flour, nut meal, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together. Add wet ingredients and fold gently. 
  4. Pour the batter into a parchment paper lined loaf-pan. Bake for 45 minutes. 
  5. Place sugar, lemon juice and thyme in a pot over low heat. Let it come to a boil and then remove from heat. Let cool
  6. Once finished, remove loaf from oven and pierce the top of the cake with a toothpick. Brush the top of the cake with lemon syrup.
  7. Slice and enjoy

articleTitle: Homemade Healthy High-Protein Chocolate Almond Butter
articleBodyHTML:
Where health meets happy! Get our protein on with satisfying flavor in this chocolate almond butter!

It’s time for my annual birthday recipe! Because it’s my annual birthday! This year was a little different for me and my birthday - I uncharacteristically got in the birthday spirit very early, and kinda did that whole birthday month thing. So I wanted to create a birthday recipe that I could enjoy all month long, not just during my big 24 hours of being a queen.

My solution was to make this CHOCOLATE BIRTHDAY BUTTER! Which is an extra special, rich, festive, decadent, high-protein (thanks to the Sunwarrior plant protein powder), creamy chocolatey nut butter that turns anything you spread it on, toast - apples - bananas - your spoon, knife or thumb into a something worth celebrating!

And also worth celebrating? How ridiculously easy it is to make.
articleSummaryHTML: Where health meets happy! Get our protein on with satisfying flavor in this chocolate almond butter!
seoTitle: Homemade Healthy High-Protein Chocolate Almond Butter
seoDescription: Where health meets happy! Get our protein on with satisfying flavor in this chocolate almond butter!
recipeName: Homemade Healthy High-Protein Chocolate Almond Butter
ingredients:
s:610:"
  • 3 cups almonds
  • 2 tablespoons coconut sugar
  • ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • ½ teaspoon sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 tablespoons Sunwarrior’s Warrior Blend chocolate protein
  • 2 teaspoons cacao powder
  • SPRINKLES, to taste - er, festive look!
";
directions:
1. Toast your almonds on a baking sheet at 400 degrees for 7 minutes or until they’re light brown and smell amazing.
  2. Add them, while they’re still warm and toasty, to your food processor, along with the coconut sugar, cinnamon, sea salt, vanilla, chocolate protein and cacao powder.
  3. Process your nuts! You’ll need to be patient because this could take about 12 minutes. You may need to stop it a couple times to scrape down the sides, but keep going. It will go from crumbly to doughy to smooth and buttery. When it gets to perfect almond butter consistency, mix your sprinkles right into the food processor and then pause in awe because that’s real nut butter that you just made in your own house with ingredients you know and understand!
  4. Transfer your birthday celebration (nut butter) to a jar and store  in your pantry or fridge. Happy Birthday!

articleTitle: A Cool-Down Pina Colada Chia Pudding!
articleBodyHTML:
Cool down this summer with a cool-down Pina colada chia pudding! Seriously! You’ve never tasted awesome until you’ve tasted this!

In the warm weather, chia pudding is my go-to snack to the max. Chia pudding is terrifically high in fiber and protein, which means that chia pudding can fill you up big time, (which can mean that you’ll have less room to eat big time and more ability to slip into skimpy warm-weather clothes.)

Chia pudding is also an energizing treat, which’ll give you more gusto to stay up for those extra-long sunny days.

Chia pudding (and the seeds in general) are also full of one of all of our favorite things: antioxidants! Which is great for keeping our immune system strong so we can live every day to the fullest.

One of the coolest, most unique things about chia seeds is they can absorb up to 10 times their own weight in water! This makes them one heck-of-a healthy hydration hack.

There are endless ways to flavor chia pudding, but one of my favorite ways to enjoy it in the sweet summertime is as a pretend Pina Colada!
articleSummaryHTML: Cool down this summer with a cool-down Pina colada chia pudding! Seriously! You’ve never tasted awesome until you’ve tasted this!
seoTitle: A Cool-Down Pina Colada Chia Pudding!
seoDescription: Cool down this summer with a cool-down Pina colada chia pudding! Seriously! You’ve never tasted awesome until you’ve tasted this!
recipeName: A Cool-Down Pina Colada Chia Pudding!
ingredients:
s:462:"
  • 1 cup almond or coconut milk
  • 3 tablespoons chia seeds
  • ½ cup frozen or fresh pineapple, chopped into small chunks
  • 2 tablespoons coconut flakes
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Sweetener, to taste (stevia, maple syrup, monk fruit, honey, agave, etc.)
";
directions:
1. In a jar, add all the ingredients.
  2. Use a fork to stir the chia pudding so the chia seeds don’t clump together.
  3. Screw your lid onto your jar and place the pudding in your fridge.
  4. About 10 minutes later get back into your jar and stir it again with a fork.
  5. Let it sit in the fridge for at least another 30 minutes and then stir again and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Smooth and creamy and full of all the health benefits a smoothie should have, this vanilla cardamom smoothie will be the reason you sigh with happiness today.

Vanilla Bean

Vanilla extract is a powerful anti-bacterial ingredient; it’s also well known for its anti-inflammatory properties along with being rich in anti-oxidants. It improves cellular metabolism, soothes anxiety, and improves skin condition.

Cardamom

Cardamom is rich in anti-oxidants and anti-inflammatory properties. They are also rich in micronutrients such as niacin, pyridoxine, riboflavin, thiamine, vitamin A, vitamin C, sodium, potassium, calcium, copper, iron, manganese, magnesium, phosphorus, and zinc.

Cardamom is known to reduce depression, improve digestion, reduces muscle and joint pain, and also helps the body detoxify.

Maca Powder

Maca is a root vegetable that is high in antioxidants and nutrients, such as vitamin C, copper, and iron. It has been used medicinally for thousands of years and has been shown to enhance sexual health and libido; improve energy, mood and memory; and balance hormone levels

Almonds

Almonds are a natural source of healthy fats; they are also rich in protein, fiber, magnesium, and Vitamin E. They help to regulate blood pressure, lower cholesterol, and improve skin and hair quality.
articleSummaryHTML: Smooth and creamy and full of all the health benefits a smoothie should have, this vanilla cardamom smoothie will be the reason you sigh with happiness today.
seoTitle: Vanilla Cardamom Smoothie
seoDescription: Smooth and creamy and full of all the health benefits a smoothie should have, this vanilla cardamom smoothie will be the reason you sigh with happiness today.
ingredients:
s:586:"
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 2–3 dates, pitted
  • 1 tablespoon almond butter
  • 1 tablespoon Maca powder (optional)
  • 1 teaspoon Himalayan sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon cardamom powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
";
directions:
Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.

articleBodyHTML:
Warmer weather and potato salad were made for each other! And this vegan spring potato salad is like sunshine and happiness for your belly!

Spring is for potato salad! Its creamy texture with the hint of mustard. The addition of crunchy onions and freshly ground pepper is what we all love so much about this simple dish. Traditional potato salad requires the use of egg mayonnaise, so it’s not vegan-friendly and not particularly healthy either. Luckily, with this recipe, you can still enjoy the delicious flavor and creamy texture of potato salad without any guilt! The mayo used in here is made of beans, which makes it much healthier and rich in plant-based protein. Altogether it makes a healthy and nutritious dish, which is also very easy to make! Make sure you give it a try.
articleSummaryHTML: Warmer weather and potato salad were made for each other! And this vegan spring potato salad is like sunshine and happiness for your belly!
seoTitle: Vegan Spring Potato Salad
seoDescription: Warmer weather and potato salad were made for each other! And this vegan spring potato salad is like sunshine and happiness for your belly!
ingredients:
s:673:"
  • 1 can cooked butter beans
  • ¼ cup sunflower oil
  • ¼ cup water
  • Juice squeezed from 1 lemon
  • 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard
  • Salt and pepper (use Kala Namak salt if you have it – it will make your mayo taste eggy while keeping it vegan)
  • 2 ¼ lbs. new potatoes
  • 3–4 spring onions
  • 1 medium red onion
  • Freshly ground pepper
";
directions:
1. Wash the potatoes, and cut the bigger ones in halves so that they all are roughly the same size. Put them in a pan full of salted water, bring to boil and simmer for 12 minutes until cooked through. Drain and set aside to cool.
  2. While the potatoes are cooling, make the mayo. Place the beans in a food processor, add oil, water, lemon juice, and mustard, and blend until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. Once the potatoes are cool, cut them into smaller pieces and place in a large mixing bowl. Add the bean mayo, finely chopped onion and spring onions. Mix thoroughly and set aside for at least an hour for all the flavors to blend.
  4. Sprinkle with freshly chopped spring onions to serve. Store in the fridge for up to three days.

articleBodyHTML:
Add a little spunk to your wild rice kale salad with fresh asparagus and the sass of a light and flavorful apple cider dressing. You will love this medley of vegetables.

Wild rice is one of my favorite types of grains. I love the nutty flavor and the incredible health benefits such as high-fiber content. It’s rich in nutrients which offers sustained energy for our bodies. Of course, the main star of the salad is kale, which is still one of my favorite greens. Sometimes I find when I am eating out at a restaurant, the kale is very chewy and it’s hard to swallow. When I de-stem my kale and chop it into fine pieces, I then squeeze the juice of an entire lemon over it and massage the lemon into the kale leaves. This allows the kale to soften while giving an extra boost of nutrients to the salad.

I love making asparagus salads when they come into season. These little spears are actually packed with minerals, vitamins, protein, and fiber. If you have leftover salad dressing, pour it into a sealed container and it will last up to a week or more in the fridge. I love doubling up recipes because I know I’ll use it later!
articleSummaryHTML: Add a little spunk to your wild rice kale salad with fresh asparagus and the sass of a light and flavorful apple cider dressing. You will love this medley of vegetables.
seoTitle: Wild Rice and Asparagus Salad
seoDescription: Add a little spunk to your wild rice kale salad with fresh asparagus and the sass of a light and flavorful apple cider dressing. You will love this medley of vegetables.
ingredients:
s:987:"
  • 1 bundle kale, de-stemmed and chopped finely
  • 1 lemon, juiced
  • ½ cup radishes, sliced thinly
  • ½ cup wild rice, cooked
  • ¼ cup matchstick carrots
  • ¼ cup raw almond pieces
  • 2 tablespoons dried cranberries
  • 1 bundle asparagus

Dressing

  • ¼ cup apple cider vinegar
  • 1/3 cup olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
  • 2 tablespoons agave
  • 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
  • ½ garlic clove, minced
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add ½ rice and 2 ½ cups of water. Add a touch of salt. Bring to a boil then reduce heat. Cover with lid and let cook until tender (around 30 minutes). 
  2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
  3. Add fresh asparagus to a parchment paper-lined baking tray. Drizzle with a touch of olive oil and salt. Cook for 15 minutes
  4. Once asparagus is done cooking, remove and set aside.
  5. In a medium bowl add chopped kale and lemon juice. Let this sit for 5 minutes.
  6. In a large bowl add chopped kale, radishes, wild rice, carrots, almond and dried cranberries
  7. In a small bowl add all dressing ingredients. Whisk very well until.
  8. Add dressing ¼ cup of dressing. Mix well and top with asparagus

articleBodyHTML:
Everybody’s trufflin’! Or maybe they are just lovin’ this incredible vegan mac & cheese recipe where flavor rules supreme and health is on the menu!

Who doesn’t love mac & cheese, right? But this creamy, cheesy and extremely comforting dish is the complete opposite of a healthy plant-based meal, and it’s not really the best option if we’re trying to watch what we’re putting on our plate. Well, with this recipe you can enjoy all the naughty sides of the beloved classic and still have a healthy vegan meal! The secret is in the genius “cheesy” sauce made of potatoes! Yes, you read it right, potatoes and yeast flakes with a little addition of the right spices make the best vegan ‘cheese’ out there, and it works perfectly as a substitution for a classic heavy cheese sauce. It’s not difficult to make, and I bet even the non-vegans you know are going to love it! I made it here with mushrooms and truffle oil for a little more sophisticated flavor but feel free to skip that if you prefer a more classic version or alternatively add some veg and swap the pasta for whole-wheat for a healthier version.
articleSummaryHTML: Everybody’s trufflin’! Or maybe they are just lovin’ this incredible vegan mac & cheese recipe where flavor rules supreme and health is on the menu!
seoTitle: Vegan Truffle Mac & Cheese
seoDescription: Everybody’s trufflin’! Or maybe they are just lovin’ this incredible vegan mac & cheese recipe where flavor rules supreme and health is on the menu!
ingredients:
s:706:"
  • 2–3 medium white potatoes
  • 1 medium sweet potato
  • 10 tablespoons yeast flakes
  • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
  • ½ teaspoon onion powder
  • ½ teaspoon smoked paprika
  • ½ cup vegetable oil
  • 1 cup plant-based milk
  • 8 oz. chestnut mushrooms
  • truffle oil
  • salt and pepper
  • 20 oz. pasta of your choice
";
directions:
1. Peel and cut all potatoes into smaller pieces and steam them until very soft.
  2. Place the potatoes in a food processor and add oil, milk and all spices. Blend until smooth and creamy sauce forms. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
  3. While the potatoes are steaming, prepare the mushrooms. Wash and cut them into thin slices, then heat one tablespoon of oil in a large pan and fry them for 5–7 minutes until dark brown and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
  4. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius and have a large ovenproof dish ready for baking.
  5. Cook pasta according to the instructions on the packaging but stop boiling at 2–3 minutes before stated in the instructions to make sure it’s still a little bit hard.
  6. Drain the pasta and place it in the prepared roasting dish. Transfer the “cheese” sauce and the mushrooms to the dish and mix thoroughly with the pasta making sure each individual piece is covered in the sauce. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper and drizzle with truffle oil.
  7. Bake for 15 minutes until golden. Serve hot on its own or with a side of leafy green salad.

articleBodyHTML:
For a salad that is fun and fresh and full of flavor, this courgette salad is your new springtime favorite meal for the whole family!

Spring and summer are the best time for produce in areas where we have four seasons. Here in Canada, we have a spring, summer, fall, and winter so we can look forward to new vegetables every few months. With spring arriving, the possibilities are endless. This recipe would be perfect for the little ones. These courgettes and carrots resemble multicolored French fries! What better way to get the kids involved in eating fresh foods than this salad.

Courgettes, also known as zucchini, have a whole array of health benefits for the body and skin. They are low in calories and contain mostly water and fiber, which will keep you feeling satiated longer and leaving your body feeling refreshed. If you’ve ever had one of those days that you go a little crazy on the carbohydrates, zucchinis are always that vegetable that will come to the rescue. These beautiful vegetables are low in sodium and carbohydrates. Making a bountiful salad such as this will ensure you are getting a huge amount of water for the day. Zucchinis are incredible for your skin which will leave you looking radiant and fresh. How much better does this salad get?

To add a little bite to this salad, add organic olives. You can omit the olives if you are not an olive person. Add nuts or seeds instead.
articleSummaryHTML: For a salad that is fun and fresh and full of flavor, this courgette salad is your new springtime favorite meal for the whole family!
seoTitle: Courgette Salad
seoDescription: For a salad that is fun and fresh and full of flavor, this courgette salad is your new springtime favorite meal for the whole family!
ingredients:
s:656:"
  • 2 yellow zucchini, julienned
  • 2 green zucchini, julienned
  • 2 large carrots, julienned
  • 1 large red pepper, julienned

Dressing

  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon orange juice
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 teaspoon pepper
";
directions:
1. Slice all vegetables and place in a large bowl
  2. Whisk all dressing ingredients together. Pour over salad and set aside for 20 minutes to set in the fridge or serve immediately

articleBodyHTML:
This vegan lemon polenta cake is a plant-based twist on the classic, and it is absolutely delicious! Flood your taste buds with flavor!

Polenta has a nice, sticky consistency and the addition of lemon juice and zest makes this cake refreshing and tangy. This recipe doesn’t use refined sugars, and the only fat comes from coconut oil. It’s a lot healthier than the traditional cake and still tastes amazing! It’s also very easy to make because honestly there’s nothing that could go wrong.
articleSummaryHTML: This vegan lemon polenta cake is a plant-based twist on the classic, and it is absolutely delicious! Flood your taste buds with flavor!
seoTitle: Vegan Lemon Polenta Cake
seoDescription: This vegan lemon polenta cake is a plant-based twist on the classic, and it is absolutely delicious! Flood your taste buds with flavor!
ingredients:
s:723:"
  • 1 cup polenta
  • 1 cup self-rising flour
  • 1 ½ cups ground almonds
  • 1 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda
  • Liquid from 1 can chickpeas (aquafaba) *
  • ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
  • 2/3 cup maple syrup
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • A pinch of salt
  • Juice and zest from two lemons

* Make sure that the aquafaba you buy contains no other ingredients but water, salt, and stabilizer

";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Lay a bottom of a round 8-inch cake pan with greaseproof paper and set aside.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, place polenta, flour, ground almonds, bicarbonate of soda, and salt and mix thoroughly.
  3. In a separate bowl, place aquafaba and, using an electric mixer, whisk for 4–5 min until foamy and fluffy. Add coconut oil, olive oil, and maple syrup and whisk again for 1 minute.
  4. Slowly pour the wet mixture into the bowl with dry ingredients while whisking continuously. Add lemon juice and zest and whisk again until smooth dough forms.
  5. Pour the dough into the prepared cake pan and place in the oven. Bake for 30–35 min until a wooden toothpick comes out dry. Take out of the oven and set aside to chill.
  6. Serve drizzled with maple syrup and lemon juice or with a side of whipped coconut cream. You can also heat it up before serving and serve with vegan ice cream!

articleBodyHTML:
For a picnic party favorite, this vegan macaroni salad will make sure you are the highlight of every get-together!

Springtime is the commencement of outdoor parties, festivals, and gatherings for friends and family. One of my all-time favorite soul-food classic recipes has to be macaroni salad. I grew up on macaroni salad, but I had to find a way to make it taste just as delicious as I remembered while still keeping it vegan.

After a few trial and error attempts, I landed on a recipe that my friends loved. They had no idea that it was vegan and they were perplexed on how similar it tasted. Brownie points on that one! I love this recipe because it comes together so quickly. You can make a huge batch, pop it in the fridge, and take it with you the next day. The best part is that it keeps for a long time in the fridge. I opted to use regular elbow pasta for this recipe, but if you are sensitive to gluten, you can always swap it out for gluten-free pasta. It will taste just as delicious. I kept my macaroni salad more basic for this recipe so if you wanted to experiment with different vegetables or herbs. Some examples would be adding fresh dill instead of parsley, adding fresh cucumbers, carrots, and red onion. Whichever vegetables you have an affinity for, add them in. It’s an “anything goes” type of recipe so have fun with it and enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: For a picnic party favorite, this vegan macaroni salad will make sure you are the highlight of every get-together!
seoTitle: Vegan Macaroni Salad
seoDescription: For a picnic party favorite, this vegan macaroni salad will make sure you are the highlight of every get-together!
ingredients:
s:1197:"
  • 3 cups elbow macaroni (or pasta  of your choice)
  • ½ red pepper, diced
  • 1 cup fresh green peas

Mix-Ins

  • 1 cup celery, diced
  • 1 cup cucumber, diced
  • ½ cup carrots, diced
  • ½ cup red onion, diced
  • Fresh parsley or dill

Dressing

  • ¾ cup silken tofu
  • ½ cup raw cashews, soaked (4–6 hours)
  • 2 tablespoons dill pickle juice (or 2 tablespoons dried dill)
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil 
  • 1 tablespoon white vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 1 teaspoon mustard (optional)
  • ½ teaspoon water
";
directions:
1. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package
  2. Chop all vegetables and set aside 
  3. Drain water from cashews and add to a high-speed blender with tofu, dill pickle juice, olive oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, and mustard, Mix on high speed and use water to thin out the dressing if it’s too thick.
  4. Drain cooked pasta and add to a large bowl. Add dressing and chopped vegetables. Place in fridge to set.

articleBodyHTML: Go meatless this Monday with a vegan burger that puts all other burgers to shame. One bite into this juicy burger, and you’ll never go back to those other boring burgers again.
articleSummaryHTML: Go meatless this Monday with a vegan burger that puts all other burgers to shame. One bite into this juicy burger, and you’ll never go back to those other boring burgers again.
seoTitle: Meatless Monday: Vegan Smokehouse Burger
seoDescription: Go meatless this Monday with a vegan burger that puts all other burgers to shame. One bite into this juicy burger, and you’ll never go back to those other boring burgers again.
ingredients:
s:1267:"
  • 1 cup raw walnuts
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Natural Protein
  • ½ cup quick oats
  • 3 teaspoons Vegan Spice Mix ( ½ teaspoon Trocomare, ½ teaspoon garlic powder, ½ teaspoon white pepper, ½ teaspoon allspice, ½ teaspoon cumin, ½ teaspoon dill weed)
  • 1 medium white onion, finely chopped
  • 4 cloves oven-roasted garlic
  • 1 Portabella mushroom, stemmed and finely chopped
  • 1 teaspoon fresh thyme, chopped
  • ½ medium beet, grated/shredded
  • ½ can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
  • ½ can black beans, rinsed and drained
  • ¼ teaspoon smoked salt
  • ½ cup cooked brown rice
  • 4 tablespoons vegan BBQ sauce
  • Pack of 8 vegan hamburger buns
";
directions:
1. Toast walnuts over medium heat, stirring frequently, until fragrant and golden brown. Transfer to a blender or food processor.

2. Toast quick oats over medium heat for 3–5 minutes. Combine with walnuts and 1 teaspoon of Vegan Spice Mix and 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend Natural Protein. Pulse in a food processor until you get a fine meal. Set aside.

3. Lightly spray skillet with olive oil and heat to medium heat. Add onions and sauté. Add oven-roasted garlic, mushroom, 2 teaspoons Vegan Spice Mix, and thyme. Sauté. Remove from heat; add beets and stir until beets release color. Set aside.

4. In a large mixing bowl, mash kidney and black beans with smoked salt.

5. Add cooked brown rice, walnut mixture, sautéed mixture, and BBQ sauce. Mix thoroughly until moldable dough forms.

6. Begin toasting buns in toaster or oven

7. Form dough into burger patties and cook in pan (or grill) for about 3–4 minutes, flip over. Cook until desired temperature is reached

8. Dress buns with desired toppings, add patty to bun and serve with watermelon and avocado on the side.

articleBodyHTML:
Stop missing breakfast, and start your day with these fantastically filling and flavorful oatmeal cranberry vegan muffins!

Quick and easy breakfasts are what we need in the morning, especially when it's a busy morning. More often than not I’m running out the door to work or getting kids off to school and no time for breakfast. It’s very convenient to have a breakfast already made that you can pull out in the morning and let it sit until you are ready for breakfast or heat them in a toaster oven. These muffins fit the bill.

These muffins are filled with goodness. Oats are very filling and can actually lower your LDL cholesterol over time. They also are a good source of fiber and protein. Oats also have iron, manganese, and zinc. The cranberries offer antioxidants and anti-inflammatory benefits. They also have vitamin C, E, and K.
articleSummaryHTML: Stop missing breakfast, and start your day with these fantastically filling and flavorful oatmeal cranberry vegan muffins!
seoTitle: Vegan Oatmeal Cranberry Muffins
seoDescription: Stop missing breakfast, and start your day with these fantastically filling and flavorful oatmeal cranberry vegan muffins!
ingredients:
s:961:"
  • 1 cup unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 flax eggs*
  • ¼–1/3 cup maple syrup
  • ¼–⅓ cup coconut sugar
  • ¾ cup almond milk
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 2 teaspoons real vanilla
  • 2 ½ cups old-fashioned oats (1 ½ cups ground, 1 cup whole)
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 2 cups whole cranberries, pulsed in a food processor
  • Whole oats, optional
  • Coconut sugar, optional
";
directions:
1. Mix applesauce, flax eggs, maple syrup, coconut sugar, and almond milk in large bowl. Add coconut oil and vanilla. Mix well. In a separate bowl combine oats, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
  2. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Mix until just combined. Mix in cranberries.
  3. Divide batter into 12 muffins tins. Sprinkle with oats and coconut sugar, if desired. Bake at 350 degrees for 20–25 minutes.

*Flax eggs: mix 1 tablespoon ground flax seed with 2 ½ tablespoons water. Let sit for 5 minutes. Use in place of one egg.

articleBodyHTML:
Open Sesame! Fast and easy, Tahini dressing is the best way to dress up meal time so that dinner feels like an event to be celebrated!

As peanuts are to peanut butter, so sesame seeds are to tahini! Tahini is a paste usually made from ground hulled and toasted seeds—though it can also be made with unhulled, raw, sprouted, or even black seeds. Tahini can work as a substitute for those with peanut allergies—and its uber-high calcium content is a bonus for those concerned about bone health!

Arguably, the most well-known use of tahini is in making hummus, but if you’ve ever savored baklava or Baba Ghanoush, you may have found it there as well. As you might have guessed, tahini is most popular in North African, Middle Eastern, and Mediterranean cultures, where it is frequently used in day-to-day cuisine.

I used tahini to create the oil-free, sweet and salty dressing below. Tahini Dressing may be drizzled over a green salad or used as a dip. Feel free to alter the consistency, using more or less water to play with thickness. You can also thin it with a little orange juice to alter the flavor.
articleSummaryHTML: Open Sesame! Fast and easy, Tahini dressing is the best way to dress up meal time so that dinner feels like an event to be celebrated!
seoTitle: Tahini Dressing
seoDescription: Open Sesame! Fast and easy, Tahini dressing is the best way to dress up meal time so that dinner feels like an event to be celebrated!
ingredients:
s:345:"
  • ¼ cup tahini
  • ¼ cup coconut nectar, maple syrup or agave
  • 2 tablespoons white miso, unpasteurized
  • 1 ½ teaspoons lemon juice
  • Water to consistency desired
";
directions: Place all ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. (Can also be combined with a whisk.)

articleTitle: Beat the Bloat! Secret Nighttime Remedy!
articleBodyHTML:
Sleep like a baby! Go to bed feeling light and ready to rest without the bloated feeling that creeps in and steals quality sleep! Here is your secret weapon to beat the bloat!

One of my favorite evening activities is cozying up on the couch with a sweet treat (and a juxtaposing not-so-sweet something on the TV. Balance, baby!). But one of my least favorite things is being bloated or going to bed on an empty stomach. That’s why I came up with this warming bevvie, a tonic, if you will, that tastes like a naughty dessert but is anything but.

In fact, is also has lots of de-bloating powers so one could actually possibly justify that this is a magical, health-boosting, must-drink nightcap!

It’s got an all-star line-up of de-bloaters: ginger, a very famous stomach-soother, cinnamon, vanilla, which help with relaxation (a lovely antidote to bloating), and dates, a magnesium-rich plant that can help stimulate bowel movements and make that bloating begone!

Simply blend the following ingredients and then warm them in a saucepan on your stove for a guilt-free, gut-nourishing nightcap.
articleSummaryHTML: Sleep like a baby! Go to bed feeling light and ready to rest without the bloated feeling that creeps in and steals quality sleep! Here is your secret weapon to beat the bloat!
seoTitle: Beat the Bloat! Secret Nighttime Remedy!
seoDescription: Sleep like a baby! Go to bed feeling light and ready to rest without the bloated feeling that creeps in and steals quality sleep! Here is your secret weapon to beat the bloat!
recipeName: Beat the Bloat! Secret Nighttime Remedy!
ingredients:
s:362:"
  • 2 cups almond milk
  • 2 Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1–2-inch chunk of peeled fresh ginger
  • ½ teaspoon cinnamon
  • A pinch of salt
";
directions:
1. Blend all ingredients together
  2. Warm in a saucepan
  3. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Freeze! Because we’ve got vegan, superfood, green popsicles that will melt all the worry out of our summer snacking!

Being a raw vegan has great perks. One of them is that even desserts are healthy! As parents or workaholics or fitness freaks, we all have one thing in common. We want to feed ourselves and our family healthy foods. The superfood popsicle is one of my favorite recipes. It satisfies your sweet tooth, it’s healthy, and you’re eating ice cream that isn’t creating a cavity or other health issues.

Health Benefits

Coconut milk contains healthy fat and medium-chain fatty acids which don't get consumed by our body in the same way as high saturated fats. It’s also rich in anti-viral and anti-bacterial properties, and it nourishes your joints and muscles inside out.

Spirulina

Spirulina contains a high amount of protein and antioxidants. A small amount of Spirulina can fight free radicals, reduce muscle soreness, improve bone density, and help detoxify

Moringa Powder

Moringa is rich in flavonoids and phytonutrients that fight free radicals, increase DNA oxidization and protect the body from infections and tumors. Being rich in Vitamin A, C, and K, this is a perfect ingredient to consume on a daily basis.

Don't have Moringa or Spirulina?  Get our Super Greens here!

Coconut Nectar

Raw coconut nectar naturally has a low GI and is packed with essential vitamins and minerals. It’s also high in prebiotic fiber that aids digestion and reduces bloating and gas.

Banana

This fruit is well known for its high potassium and magnesium content. It’s also rich in Vitamin C and K making it the perfect ingredient for a pre or post-workout snack. This is also a great way to add more fruits to your diet.

Eat right. Stay active. Be happy.
articleSummaryHTML: Freeze! Because we’ve got vegan, superfood, green popsicles that will melt all the worry out of our summer snacking!
seoTitle: Superfood Green Popsicles
seoDescription: Freeze! Because we’ve got vegan, superfood, green popsicles that will melt all the worry out of our summer snacking!
ingredients:
s:455:"
  • 1–2 cups coconut milk (depending on consistency you need)
  • 1 teaspoon spirulina
  • 1 teaspoon moringa powder
  • 2 tablespoons coconut nectar
  • 2–3 frozen bananas
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt
  • 3/4 cup coconut chips (optional)
";
directions:
1. Using a high-speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy
  2. Add the coconut chips into the mixture
  3. Empty the mixture into your favorite popsicle molds
  4. Leave them in the freezer for about 1–1.5 hours
  5. Serve when ready

articleBodyHTML:
Tofu is one of the highest (and most delicious) sources of protein for an athletic vegan. Have it air fried and you’ve got everything you could ever want!

Contrary to what many people believe because of lots of circulated misinformation, phytoestrogen, which is found in soy products like tofu, is not the same as human estrogen. In fact, several clinical studies show that soy doesn’t affect testosterone levels or cause feminizing effects in men. Instead, soy protein enhances the growth of lean tissue while stimulating weight loss. It’s packed with amino acids, iron, calcium, and zinc. There is so much to discuss regarding this topic, but the main takeaway is that tofu is a delicious, nutritious, and impactful food to eat on a plant-based diet.

You may have seen the rise of air fryer photos going around social media. The benefits of cooking with them are amazing! They encourage low-fat meals, simple and clean ingredients, and using air to evenly cook your food. You can’t get healthier than that! This is a recipe that I cook several times throughout the week. It’s super healthy and packed with flavor. The best part? It makes for a quick meal (and even quicker clean-up)! Pair it with some quinoa and a big side salad with veggies, and you are good to go! Grab some non-GMO tofu, and let’ get cooking!
articleSummaryHTML: Tofu is one of the highest (and most delicious) sources of protein for an athletic vegan. Have it air fried and you’ve got everything you could ever want!
seoTitle: Air Fried Tofu
seoDescription: Tofu is one of the highest (and most delicious) sources of protein for an athletic vegan. Have it air fried and you’ve got everything you could ever want!
ingredients:
s:443:"
  • 1 16 oz. package of organic Nasoya Pressed Super Firm Tofu (or any other super/extra firm tofu)
  • 3 tablespoons Bragg Liquid Aminos
  • ¼ cup nutritional yeast flakes
  • 1 tablespoon turmeric
  • 1 tablespoon garlic powder
  • Dash of pepper 
";
directions:
1. Slice the tofu into medium-size strips or cubes and put into a large bowl.
  2. Add the liquid aminos, nutritional yeast (spread evenly on top of the tofu), turmeric, garlic powder, and pepper.
  3. With a large silicone spoon or spatula, gently mix everything together so that the mixture is evenly spread throughout the tofu.
  4. Lightly spray the basket of the air fryer with avocado oil and evenly spread the tofu throughout (note - some pieces can be on top of each other, as long as the tofu is in an even layer. That’s the beauty of the air-fryer, it still cooks nice and evenly).
  5. Air fry the tofu at 400 degrees F for 12 minutes.
  6. Let cool for 2 minutes and remove the golden tofu from the basket.
  7. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
For a sweet summer snowball cookie these raw, vegan coconut macaroons are everything to make your summer feel like a vacation!

These little snowball-like cookies are perfect for any day because they’re so simple to make! If you are a mounds lover or almond lover like me, you can also add almond shavings or press an almond into each macaroon.
articleSummaryHTML: For a sweet summer snowball cookie these raw, vegan coconut macaroons are everything to make your summer feel like a vacation!
seoTitle: Raw, Vegan Coconut Macaroon
seoDescription: For a sweet summer snowball cookie these raw, vegan coconut macaroons are everything to make your summer feel like a vacation!
ingredients:
s:625:"

Macaroon

  • 2 cups of unsweetened coconut flakes
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon coconut butter

Chocolate Drizzle

  • ½ cup chocolate chips of your choice
  • 1 teaspoon coconut oil
  • Whole almonds (one per macaroon) or almond shavings (¼ cup) if desired
";
directions:
1. Line a cookie sheet with either parchment paper or wax paper to place the cookies on later.
  2. In a blender or food processor, mix together the coconut flakes, coconut oil, maple syrup, and coconut butter. Blend until the mixture has a moldable consistency, but there are still some visible coconut flakes.
  3. Spoon the mixture onto the cookie sheet. I made each cookie with about one tablespoon and got ten cookies.
  4. Melt the chocolate, by combining the chocolate chips (a bar or squares of chocolate will do as well) with a bit of coconut oil. I placed it in the microwave for 30-second increments, and the chocolate was perfect after 90 seconds.
  5. Drizzle chocolate as your wish, or dip the macaroons in chocolate!
  6. Once you have finished your chocolate design, place the macaroons in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before enjoying.

articleTitle: No Fuss Risotto Style Sunbutter Oatmeal
articleBodyHTML:
Get yourself comfortable for breakfast with this creamy no fuss risotto style sunbutter oatmeal!

Comfort food at its best! For a delish new taste experience, choose coconut syrup or if you are more of a traditionalist go for the familiar, real maple syrup. Lakanto and stevia are great options for diabetics. This recipe is perfect for breakfast, a snack, pre-post workout meal, or even dessert
articleSummaryHTML: Get yourself comfortable for breakfast with this creamy no fuss risotto style sunbutter oatmeal!
seoTitle: No Fuss Risotto Style Sunbutter Oatmeal
seoDescription: Get yourself comfortable for breakfast with this creamy no fuss risotto style sunbutter oatmeal!
recipeName: No Fuss Risotto Style Sunbutter Oatmeal
ingredients:
s:702:"
  • 2½ cups old fashioned organic rolled oats or buckwheat flakes
  • 3 cups cold water
  • 2 cups+ non-dairy milk such as coconut
  • ¼–½ tsp sea salt
  • ¼ cup Sunbutter
  • 1 tablespoon coconut or maple syrup

Toppings

  • Coconut or maple syrup
  • ¼ cup raw sunflower seeds
  • Chopped Almonds
  • Cinnamon
";
directions:
1. Combine oats, water, and sea salt in an 8 cup saucepan.
  2. Cover and bring to a boil over medium-high heat then reduce heat to low and simmer 5 mins.
  3. Stir oats, add ½ cup non-dairy milk and reduce heat to low.
  4. Leave uncovered and cook over low heat for another 10–20 minutes checking every 5 minutes or so and adding additional milk as needed. This process takes time yet results in such a rich, creamy texture. Of course, you can enjoy it as soon as it’s ready yet this slow cook method is my favorite way to enjoy oatmeal.  
  5. Just before you are ready to serve your oatmeal, stir in the Sunbutter and syrup of choice along with an additional splash of milk.
  6. Serve in bowls you’ve warmed by the stove and top as desired. Then sit down and enjoy this body and spirit nourishing breakfast bowl.

Teri’s Tips

Cook your oatmeal long and slow for the best results. Think risotto-like with only occasional stirring required making Italy’s “slow food” movement doable even with today’s fast pace.

articleBodyHTML:
You’ll get your just desserts for the vegan lifestyle with this amazingly indulgent vegan chocolate tart!

This tart is super indulgent! Only a tiny slice will be needed to satisfy any sweet craving. Although I’m pretty sure you won’t just stop on one slice because it is just so dangerously good! It is also 100% vegan and can easily be done gluten-free (just use GF oats) so really, guys, there’s no reason why you shouldn’t make this beauty!
articleSummaryHTML: You’ll get your just desserts for the vegan lifestyle with this amazingly indulgent vegan chocolate tart!
seoTitle: Vegan Chocolate Tart
seoDescription: You’ll get your just desserts for the vegan lifestyle with this amazingly indulgent vegan chocolate tart!
ingredients:
s:896:"

Base

  • 1 ¼ cups oat flour (you can simply make it by blending oat flakes)
  • 1 cup ground almonds
  • 4 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 4 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • A pinch of salt

Chocolate Filling

  • 7 oz. dark vegan chocolate
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 can coconut milk (refrigerated for at last 6 hours. You will only use the top white solid part. You can set aside the rest for a smoothie later.)

Plus

  • Fresh summer fruit for decoration
";
directions:
1. reheat the oven to 350. Line a bottom of a round 8-inch cake pan with greaseproof paper and leave aside.
  2. In a large bowl, mix oat flour, ground almonds, and salt, and add coconut oil and maple syrup. Mix thoroughly using a spoon until dough forms; it should have a consistency of wet sand.
  3. Place the dough in the prepared cake pan and, using your hands, mold it to the bottom and the sides so that they are about one inch tall. Spike the bottom with a fork and place the pan in the oven. Bake for 12 minutes until golden brown. Take out of the oven and leave aside to cool.
  4. To make the chocolate filling, melt the chocolate with the coconut oil in a water bath. When melted, place in a large bowl and add coconut milk (only add the top white solid part) then mix together using a hand whisk until you get a smooth and creamy texture.
  5. When the base cools down, transfer the chocolate filling onto it and even out the surface using a spatula. Decorate with fresh fruit and place in the fridge for at least 4 hours or ideally overnight. Serve on its own or with a side of whipped coconut cream. Store in the fridge for up to 5 days.

articleBodyHTML:
March to the beat of summer with beets, mangos, and berries! Cool off in the tastiest way possible!

The warmer weather tends to change eating habits for the better. People tend to be more consistent with getting out and doing some physical exercise or starting a routine to shed a few pounds. With healthier habits trending, smoothies come into play more often. The best part is you can blend this up and take it on the go. If you feel rushed on time, prepare your fruit the night before, so all you have to do is blend in the morning.

This mango beet berry smoothie is loaded with health benefits, is super healthy and ready to protect and fuel your body! Mangos contain over 20 vitamins and minerals and provide an excellent source of dietary fiber and vitamin B6. They aid in digestion and boost your immunity. Did you know that approximately eight strawberries contain more vitamin C than an orange? Not to mention strawberries help improve heart health, increase HDL cholesterol (yep, the good one!), lower blood pressure, and are high in antioxidants. Beets are linked to improving stamina, has anti-inflammatory properties, and helps detox your liver. The protein in this smoothie is designed to fuel your body, aid in inflammation, and speed recovery. Not a bad smoothie at all!
articleSummaryHTML: March to the beat of summer with beets, mangos, and berries! Cool off in the tastiest way possible!
seoTitle: Mango Beet Berry Smoothie
seoDescription: March to the beat of summer with beets, mangos, and berries! Cool off in the tastiest way possible!
ingredients:
s:667:"
  • 1 ½ cup unsweetened coconut milk (or nondairy milk of your choice)
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior berry Warrior Blend protein
  • ¾ scoop beet powder
  • ¾ cup fresh (or frozen) mango
  • 5 large strawberries
  • Pinch of ginger
  • Handful or more of ice (depends on your preference)
  • Extra fruit and unsweetened coconut for garnish
";
directions:
1. In your blender lightly pulse your fruit to break it up, add your nondairy milk and pulse until combined.
  2. Add your protein, beet powder and pinch of ginger. Blend until combined. About 30 seconds.
  3. Add your ice and blend until desired consistency.
  4. Garnish with fresh fruit and unsweetened coconut. Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Cool off and power up this summer with an icy vegan espresso shake! It’s where amazing and delicious party!

As the summer is rolling by, we crave drinks that are icy, cold, and refreshing. I am a big lover of all things coffee, so iced coffee is always my go-to drink. Some are simply coffee and nut milks, or some are blended. Here in Toronto, the mornings are not warm so having that morning cup of brew that is warm does that trick. Halfway through the day is another story completely. I always crave rich and cold drinks, but I know how bad they are for us nutritionally.

I went home one day and said to myself; “Let’s try to make this taste as good as the coffee shop, only healthier.” After one try, I landed on an amazing recipe that I use daily. The best part about this recipe is that it is guilt free and nutritionally fantastic for our bodies. So what’s in this magical shake?

The recipe is so simple. All you need to do is pop the ingredients into your blender, and one minute later you have a silky and scrumptious protein shake. I add a frozen banana, almond milk, Sunwarrior protein powder, 1 shot of espresso, and a tablespoon of maca. Maca is derived from a root vegetable. It is rich in antioxidants and helps to enhance our mood and energy. Maca totally beats out anything caffeine can do. I found that after an hour, my caffeine kick would die out and I was left tired and restless. I added the maca powder, and it helped me sustain a great amount of energy during the day without the burn and crash from too much coffee.

If you want to play around with the recipe, you can add some chocolate chips or cocoa powder to make this a mocha iced coffee. You can even add some fresh mint or mint extract to make this a mint coffee drink. Whatever you add, the end result will always end up being delicious.
articleSummaryHTML: Cool off and power up this summer with an icy vegan espresso shake! It’s where amazing and delicious party!
seoTitle: Vegan Espresso Shake
seoDescription: Cool off and power up this summer with an icy vegan espresso shake! It’s where amazing and delicious party!
ingredients:
s:462:"
  • 1 shot espresso (or 1 cup brewed coffee)
  • ½ frozen banana
  • 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
  • 1 scoop vanilla Sunwarrior Protein powder
  • ½ tablespoon maca powder
  • 2 cups ice
";
directions: 1. Place all ingredients into a high speed blender. Mix for 1 minute and serve!

articleBodyHTML:
Fudgey, dense, and decadent brownies, who doesn’t love them! It’s basically what dreams are made of, aren’t they? Let us show you how to make vegan tahini brownies right!

Some people are cake type brownie lovers, but personally, I love dense ones. But brownies are typically made with an abundance of unhealthy ingredients such as flour, refined sugar, and oil. So I came up with a recipe that is healthier and even tastier! The eggs are substituted with flax eggs. Whenever I give my friends these brownies to eat, they are shocked that they are vegan and actually taste delicious. Without failure, this recipe is always requested, which means I make triple batches for everyone!

I started to incorporate tahini into my everyday cooking. I became addicted to this stuff after purchasing a tahini nut butter. I tested it out in baking and cooking and found that it was a great substitute in salad dressings or in cakes. Tahini has a rich and velvety texture that adds so much flavor to any dish you are eating, plus it adds an endless amount of nutrients.

Tahini is one of those amazing superfoods that boosts health benefits such as being high in healthy fats and amino acids. It also has a high amount of vitamins and minerals that our bodies need for great metabolic and bone health. Tahini is made of sesame seeds which are great to balance hormonal levels in our bodies. Plus tahini can help us look radiant and fresh due to its skin health. All of this from one brownie, I’m in!

This brownie wouldn't be complete without adding some Sunwarrior protein powder to help our muscles regenerate and give us the extra bit of nutrients we may be lacking during a day. I added Sunwarrior chocolate protein, but you can always opt to use the natural flavor one as well since the natural ends up being neutral. Second helpings for this brownie? Yes please, sign me up for three helpings!
articleSummaryHTML: Fudgey, dense, and decadent brownies, who doesn’t love them! It’s basically what dreams are made of, aren’t they? Let us show you how to make vegan tahini brownies right!
seoTitle: Vegan Tahini Brownies
seoDescription: Fudgey, dense, and decadent brownies, who doesn’t love them! It’s basically what dreams are made of, aren’t they? Let us show you how to make vegan tahini brownies right!
ingredients:
s:709:"
  • 1 cup vegan chocolate chips
  • 1 tablespoon tahini, plus 2 tablespoons for drizzling
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 tablespoons cocoa powder 
  • 2 tablespoons flax meal
  • 4 tablespoons water
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Chocolate Protein
  • 1/3 teaspoon salt
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/3 cup coconut sugar
";
directions:
1. Stir water and flax meal together. Set aside for 5–7 minutes to thicken. Stir well.
  2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 6-inch baking tray with parchment paper
  3. In a small saucepan, add chocolate, coconut oil, and tahini. Stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and set aside 
  4. In a medium bowl add coconut sugar and flax eggs. Stir well for 2 minutes. Add salt and vanilla. Mix in chocolate mixture. Add cocoa powder and protein powder. 
  5. Pour brownie mixture into prepared pan
  6. Drop dollops of tahini (2 tablespoons) onto the mixture. Using a toothpick, creating swirls
  7. Bake for 20 minutes
  8. Remove from oven and let cool for 15 minutes

articleBodyHTML:
If a muffin is your breakfast go-to, make sure it’s worthy of participating in the most important meal of the day!

Muffins have a not so great track record. They're usually loaded with sugar and fat and are hardly healthy, let alone suitable for breakfast! These strawberry muffins have a small amount of agave and are bursting with strawberries. Say goodbye to unhealthy muffins!

Strawberries are plentiful in the summer. They are delicious and are easy to take anywhere, to the beach, picnic, or work. Strawberries are also very easy to bake with. You can add them to a lot of muffins or cakes.

Strawberries are crammed with vitamins and fiber and are very high in antioxidants. They are sodium-free, fat-free, and cholesterol-free. Coconut nectar sweetens this delicious muffin and is low on the glycemic index score.

Make yourself a batch and enjoy this muffin as a breakfast or a snack!
articleSummaryHTML: If a muffin is your breakfast go-to, make sure it’s worthy of participating in the most important meal of the day!
seoTitle: Vegan Strawberry Muffins
seoDescription: If a muffin is your breakfast go-to, make sure it’s worthy of participating in the most important meal of the day!
ingredients:
s:645:"
  • 1 ½ cups whole wheat flour or gluten-free flour
  • ½ cup all-purpose flour or gluten-free flour
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ cup coconut oil
  • ½ cup coconut nectar
  • 2 flax eggs*
  • ½ cup almond milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 ½ cups chopped strawberries
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Prepare a muffin pan by either greasing the tins or lining with paper or reusable cups. Combine all dry ingredients together except coconut sugar and set aside. Mix all wet ingredients together. Combine the wet and dry ingredients together until just combined. Don't overmix. Gently fold in strawberries.
  2. Fill muffin tins ⅔ full and sprinkle a little coconut sugar on top if desired. Bake for 20–25 minutes or until done. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to rack. Makes 12 muffins.
  3. Flax eggs: Mix 1 tablespoon ground flax and 2 ½ tablespoons of hot water. Let sit 2 to 3 minutes until thickened. Makes 1 flax egg.

articleBodyHTML:
What’s in your picnic? If you don’t have a pasta salad with snow peas, then your picnic could definitely use a little pick me up!

If there were ever a perfect side dish to bring to a potluck, picnic, or party, a pasta salad would be it. Add snow peas to that salad, and you reach picnic perfection. Though, this pasta salad isn’t creamy or loaded with calories. It is light and fresh. Choose gluten-free pasta to make it even more digestible, and select different in-season vegetables to fill it with each time you make it!
articleSummaryHTML: What’s in your picnic? If you don’t have a pasta salad with snow peas, then your picnic could definitely use a little pick me up!
seoTitle: Pasta Salad with Snow Peas
seoDescription: What’s in your picnic? If you don’t have a pasta salad with snow peas, then your picnic could definitely use a little pick me up!
ingredients:
s:668:"

Pasta

  • 1 package of brown rice pasta (any shape you desire)
  • 1 cup of sliced snow peas

Dressing

  • ½ cup olive oil
  • ¼ cup red wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar
  • 1 clove garlic, crushed
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano, or 1 teaspoon dried
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the package: approximately 10–15 minutes, drain, rinse with cold water and set aside.
  2. Whisk dressing in a separate bowl.
  3. Combine pasta with dressing and snow peas.
  4. Chill for a few hours and serve with a smile!

Don’t be afraid to make extra to bring home from the party! This pasta salad still tastes great the next day.

articleBodyHTML:
If you like the sass that is salt flavoring in your food but want to make healthier choices, Gomasio is your healthy salt alternative!

As a long-time, self-confessed condiment queen, my pantry and refrigerator offer quite the array of various food enhancers and garnishes for crunch, spice, sass, saltiness, color, beauty, and nourishment. I am very much taken by food that looks lovely, inspires a wow response upon tasting, and is infused with as much nutrient density as possible. Gomasio, a combination of dulse (a mineral-rich sea vegetable) and sunflower or sesame seeds was introduced to me a few decades ago and fast became essential. The dulse hosts a healthy dose of iodine with a satisfying salty taste and the toasted seeds a delish nuttiness.

While consuming sea vegetables may seem frightful to some, combined with the toasted sunflower or sesame seeds and even those with the faintest of taste-buds are sure to love this healthy salt alternative.
articleSummaryHTML: If you like the sass that is salt flavoring in your food but want to make healthier choices, Gomasio is your healthy salt alternative!
seoTitle: Gomasio: the Healthy Salt Alternative!
seoDescription: If you like the sass that is salt flavoring in your food but want to make healthier choices, Gomasio is your healthy salt alternative!
ingredients:
s:160:"
  • Approximately 3 cups loosely packed dulse
  • 1/3 – ½ cup sunflower seeds
";
directions:
1. Lay dulse out in a thin layer on a ceramic or parchment lined baking sheet, place in the oven with the light on, close the door and leave overnight or until dry and crunchy. Alternatively, use a dehydrator as directed.
  2. Meanwhile, toast the sunflower seeds in a large skillet over medium heat until bronzed. Let cool.
  3. Using a coffee grinder whirl the seeds until crushed – only a short time otherwise they will become pasty or butter like. Pour into a glass jar.
  4. Next whirl dulse until well crumbled and add to the sunflower seeds. Cover the jar and shake well.
  5. Top your salads with a heaping teaspoon for a nourishing and healthy protein, fat, and mineral-rich salt alternative. Store in a cool, dark cupboard or refrigerate for up for 2–3 weeks.

Teri’s Tip

An alternative is to use raw or toasted sesame or pumpkin seeds in place of the sunflower seeds; or combine all three for an eclectic treat. The toasted versions are a fragrant treat while the raw seeds have the added benefits of increased digestive enzymes so make a batch of each.

articleBodyHTML:
Chipotle-inspired, gluten free, dairy free, vegan, and low carb, this cauliflower rice bowl is everything filling, fantastic, and flavorful! You’re welcome!

This Mexican dish will satisfy all dietary needs! Get creative and add your favorite vegetables to the mix. I used cauliflower rice, but you can use regular rice if desired. I have included the recipe for homemade sweet potato chips at the end of this! You can always use store bought sweet potato chips, or corn tortillas to keep it fast, gluten-free, and equally nutritious.
articleSummaryHTML: Chipotle-inspired, gluten free, dairy free, vegan, and low carb, this cauliflower rice bowl is everything filling, fantastic, and flavorful! You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Vegan Chipotle Cauliflower Rice Bowl
seoDescription: Chipotle-inspired, gluten free, dairy free, vegan, and low carb, this cauliflower rice bowl is everything filling, fantastic, and flavorful! You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:836:"
  • 2 cups cauliflower rice (or 2 cauliflower heads pulsed in a food processor)
  • 1/3 cup peppers
  • 1/3 cup mushrooms
  • 1/3 cup tomatoes
  • 1/3 cup carrots
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 small onion (diced)
  • 1 avocado (or 1 cup of guacamole)
  • 1 lemon (for freshly squeezed juice)
  • Garlic powder
  • Cayenne powder

**Optional

  • Gluten-free corn tortilla chips
  • Sweet potato chips
";
directions:
1. If you are making your own riced cauliflower: add cauliflower florets to a food processor. Pulse until you have reached a consistency similar to rice.
  2. Heat olive oil in a pan, then once heated, add the cauliflower and onion.
  3. Once the cauliflower is tender, stir in the peppers, mushrooms, tomatoes, and carrots. Sprinkle in cayenne and garlic powder, and cook for another minute on low heat.
  4. Once finished cooking, place into a bowl. Squeeze fresh lemon juice, then add sliced avocado and salsa to your liking.

If you are making your own sweet potato chips:

  1. Preheat oven to 400F.
  2. Slice sweet potatoes into ½ inch “chips.”
  3. Rub the sweet potatoes with olive oil and spread evenly throughout the pan.
  4. Roast for 20 minutes on one side, then flip sides for another 20 minutes.
  5. Remove, and let cool, then enjoy!

articleBodyHTML: For dinner that bursts with flavor and health benefits, this curry rice and vegetable meal is everything your taste buds have been begging you for!
articleSummaryHTML: For dinner that bursts with flavor and health benefits, this curry rice and vegetable meal is everything your taste buds have been begging you for!
seoTitle: Curry Rice & Vegetables
seoDescription: For dinner that bursts with flavor and health benefits, this curry rice and vegetable meal is everything your taste buds have been begging you for!
ingredients:
s:1108:"

Rice

  • 2 cups brown jasmine rice
  • 4 cups water
  • 1 tablespoon turmeric
  • 1 teaspoon garlic
  • 1 teaspoon sea salt (don’t used iodized salt when cooking rice as it gives rice a metallic flavor)
  • 1 teaspoon curry

Roasted Root Vegetables

  • 3 cups of assorted root vegetables (carrots, potatoes, yams, onions, beets)
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 3 teaspoons no-salt seasoning
  • 2 teaspoons garlic salt
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon rosemary
  • 1 teaspoon parsley

Curry Chickpeas

  • 2 tablespoons healthy oil (coconut, ghee, olive)
  • 1 can chickpeas (with liquid drained)
  • 3 tablespoons curry
  • Fresh herbs for garnish and flavor (basil, mint, parsley, cilantro)
  • 2 tablespoons vegan yogurt
  • 1 tablespoon liquid sweetener
  • 2 teaspoons lemon juice
";
directions:
Rice

  1. Rinse rice well.
  2. Combine all rice ingredients.
  3. Cook for 35 minutes or until rice is fluffy and all the water is gone. Let sit for 10 minutes. Stir well.

Roasted Root Vegetables

  1. Preheat oven to 450.
  2. Slice root vegetables into medium evenly-sized cubes.
  3. Mix vegetables with all seasonings for the vegetables. Arrange them on the cookie sheet in a single layer.
  4. Place vegetables in the oven, and cook until tender but not mushy (approximately 15–20 minutes). Turn on broil for a minute to crisp vegetables up, but only a minute so they don’t burn.

Curry Chickpeas and Vegetables

  1. Place chickpeas in the pan of oil and curry. Pan-fry the chickpeas to soften them.
  2. Once the chickpeas are softened, add pan-roasted vegetables and the rest of the curry ingredients and gently fold together. Cook out most of the extra liquid. Make sure to gently mix vegetables and chickpeas so that the flavor has time to marinate together (approximately 10 minutes).
  3. Serve with curried rice and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your summer on with a dessert that is cold, refreshing, and full of flavor! We’ll help you do just that with this fantastically guilt-free, vegan blueberry cheesecake!

What’s better on a hot summer day than a piece of cold blueberry cheesecake?! Even more so when it’s coated with crispy chocolate, is completely vegan, is refined sugar-free, and tastes absolutely amazing! This cheesecake is filled with blueberries, quite literally, which makes it even more refreshing! It’s a must-try this summer!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your summer on with a dessert that is cold, refreshing, and full of flavor! We’ll help you do just that with this fantastically guilt-free, vegan blueberry cheesecake!
seoTitle: Vegan Blueberry Cheesecake
seoDescription: Get your summer on with a dessert that is cold, refreshing, and full of flavor! We’ll help you do just that with this fantastically guilt-free, vegan blueberry cheesecake!
ingredients:
s:1158:"

Base

  • 1 cup oat flour (you can make it easily by blending oat flakes in a blender)
  • 1 cup ground almonds
  • 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
  • 3 tablespoons maple syrup
  • A pinch of salt

“Cheese”

  • 2 2/3 cups cashews, soaked for at least 4 hours
  • 2 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 1 can coconut milk, chilled in the fridge for at least 4 hours
  • Juice squeezed from 1 lemon
  • 5 tablespoons maple syrup (or more if you prefer a sweeter taste)
  • 2 tablespoons cornstarch

Toppings

  • 4 cups fresh blueberries
  • 1 tablespoons coconut oil
  • 2 ounces vegan chocolate
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a bottom of a round 9-inch cake pan with greaseproof paper and leave aside.
  2. To make the base, place all ingredients in a large bowl and mix thoroughly until dough forms. It should stick together but not stick to your hands. Transfer the dough to the prepared cake tin, and, using your hands, mold it to the bottom to form a base. Then spike with a fork and place in the oven. Bake for 12 min, then take out of the oven and set aside to cool down.
  3. To make the “cheese” layer, place cashews in a food processor, add coconut oil, the thick top part of the coconut milk (you don’t need the remaining liquid so save it for a smoothie later), lemon juice, maple syrup, and cornstarch. Blend together until smooth and creamy mass forms (which will take a good few minutes). You may want to add more lemon juice or more maple syrup depending on what your flavor preference is. It won’t affect the consistency unless you add loads more.
  4. Transfer the “cheese” to a large bowl and add ¾ of blueberries, and mix them in thoroughly. When the base has cooled down, fill it with the prepared “cheese” mass, even out the surface and decorate with the remaining blueberries. Place in the freezer for 30 min.
  5. In a small saucepan place 1 tablespoon coconut oil and the chocolate and melt on low heat occasionally stirring with a spatula. Take off the heat and leave aside for 5 min.
  6. Take the cake out of the freezer and decorate with melted chocolate on top, then place in the fridge and leave there for at least four hours or ideally overnight. Serve on its own or with a side of vegan chocolate ice cream. Store in the fridge for up to four days.

articleBodyHTML:
No Beach? No Problem. This tropical green smoothie will transport you to the sea and make you feel like you’re on vacation!

Once summer hits, all I want to do is beach it up. But the problem with that is that I don’t live anywhere by the beach. So, I do the obvious next best thing: I make this smoothie and sip it on the roof in the sun while blasting Bob Marley.

Packed with plant-protein from the incredibly awesome Sunwarrior, filling and healthy fat from avocado, potassium from coconut water, digestion-boosting (and de-bloating) bromelain from pineapple and antioxidants from greens, this smoothie is the tropical oasis that your insides (and your taste buds) crave in the summer!
articleSummaryHTML: No Beach? No Problem. This tropical green smoothie will transport you to the sea and make you feel like you’re on vacation!
seoTitle: Summer Beach Smoothie
seoDescription: No Beach? No Problem. This tropical green smoothie will transport you to the sea and make you feel like you’re on vacation!
ingredients:
s:532:"
  • 1 large handful spinach or kale
  • 1 cup pineapple, frozen or fresh
  • 1 cup coconut water
  • ¼ avocado
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla-protein
  • Juice of 1 lime
  • Handful of shredded coconut (optional but great!)
";
directions:
