Put it all together in a blender.

Blend!

And relax and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
BBQ your summer holidays into awesomeness with this BBQ pulled jackfruit! It’s everything savory and fantastic about a summer barbecue! You will love it!

You have probably seen this before somewhere on the Internet and didn’t really believe that it was possible, right? But guess what, it is! You can make a BBQ pulled pork bagel without actual pork, without cruelty, and without any nasty, unhealthy ingredients! Jackfruit is the star of this show, and you’ll be surprised at how easy it is to work with! When cooked and seasoned the right way, it turns into something utterly amazing, and it can fool any meat-eater. If you haven’t tried to make pulled jackfruit before, don’t waste any more time and dig into this recipe because I guarantee it will become your new obsession! 

(serves 2)
articleSummaryHTML: BBQ your summer holidays into awesomeness with this BBQ pulled jackfruit! It’s everything savory and fantastic about a summer barbecue! You will love it!
seoTitle: BBQ Pulled Jackfruit
seoDescription: BBQ your summer holidays into awesomeness with this BBQ pulled jackfruit! It’s everything savory and fantastic about a summer barbecue! You will love it!
ingredients:
s:1712:"

BBQ Pulled Jackfruit

  • 1 can young jackfruit in water *
  • 1 white onion, finely chopped
  • 5 cloves garlic, finely chopped

**Plus

  • ½ cup sugar-free ketchup
  • 2 tablespoons vegan Worcestershire sauce (if you can’t find a vegan one in your store, use soy sauce instead)
  • A dash of Tabasco
  • 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast flakes
  • 4 teaspoons smoked paprika
  • Salt and pepper
  • Olive oil

**Or ¾ cup ready-made BBQ sauce

Slaw

  • ¼ small red cabbage
  • ¼ small white cabbage
  • 1 red onion
  • 2 tablespoons cider vinegar
  • 1 heaping tablespoon wholegrain mustard
  • 3 tablespoons vegan yoghurt
  • Juice squeezed from 1 lemon
  • Salt and pepper

Plus

  • 2 vegan bagels
  • A handful of arugula

* Make sure that you buy canned young jackfruit in water; any other type isn’t going to work for this recipe. 

";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a large baking tray and line it with greaseproof paper.
  2. In a large frying pan, heat 3 tablespoons water and add chopped garlic and onion. Simmer for 3 minutes.
  3. Drain jackfruit from the can and cut the chunks into smaller pieces (I cut most of them in half). Add to the pan and cover with ½ cup water. Simmer for 5 min.
  4. Add ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, yeast flakes, liquid smoke, and smoked paprika. (Alternatively, you can just add ready-made BBQ sauce although it will not taste quite the same) Mix thoroughly using a spatula and simmer for 5 more minutes.
  5. By this point, the jackfruit should be soft and will start breaking down into strips. Take the pan off the heat, and, using a potato masher, mash the jackfruit so that there are no big chunks left. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  6. Transfer the jackfruit onto the prepared baking tray; drizzle with olive oil and bake for 15 minutes.
  7. While the jackfruit is in the oven, prepare the slaw. Thinly slice the onion and both the white and the red cabbage and place in a mixing bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  8. Cut the bagels into halves and toast them, then build by placing first the jackfruit, then the slaw, and finish with some fresh arugula and a drizzle of olive oil. Serve while still hot!

articleBodyHTML:
Get in the summer spirit and celebrate with your picnic and backyard BBQ with style with this vegan purple potato salad!

Summer is here and so are picnics and barbecues. I am a potato type of gal, but I always find the humble purple potato so underused. There are so many different types of potatoes on the market, and, normally, they’re in season all year around. These potatoes originate from South America, and they are gaining popularity worldwide. I remember years ago, they were very difficult to find. Now, they’re available at almost every grocery store.

Unlike white potatoes, these are higher in antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties. I am an endurance athlete, so I am always looking for that perfect carbohydrate that will keep me energized before and during training. I have found that these potatoes give me the sustained energy I need to power through hours of rigorous training. I even have made them into mashed potatoes and potato chips. These are still my preferred energy source.

Summer markets are in full swing, so try to find vegetables that are in season and grown locally. These vegetables will have ten times more nutrients than those from the grocery store. I added some tomatoes and kale to this dish. You can add whatever vegetables you want, as long as the star of the show is your potato. You can double up this batch for a party and make it the night ahead. Pop it into the fridge and let the flavors come alive overnight. This salad is meant to be served cold.
articleSummaryHTML: Get in the holiday spirit and celebrate with your picnic and backyard BBQ with style with this vegan purple potato salad!
seoTitle: Vegan Purple Potato Salad
seoDescription: Get in the holiday spirit and celebrate with your picnic and backyard BBQ with style with this vegan purple potato salad!
ingredients:
s:663:"
  • 1 pound baby purple potatoes
  • 1 bundle kale, de-stemmed and chopped
  • 1 cup baby tomatoes, halved
  • ½ cup fresh parsley, de-stemmed and chopped finely
  • 1 tablespoon capers 
  • ½ tablespoon hemp hearts
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar 
  • ½ teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt 
";
directions:
1. Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Around 20 minutes. Remove from water and set aside to cool.
  2. Once cooled, cut potatoes into slices
  3. In a large bowl, add kale, baby tomatoes, parsley, capers, and hemp hearts together
  4. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, apple cider vinegar, Dijon, and salt. 
  5. Add potatoes to salad and pour dressing on top. Mix well and place in a sealed container in the fridge to let flavors marinate at least one hour.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your dancing shoes on because here’s a recipe for watermelon salsa! (oops wrong salsa, but hey this recipe is so good your taste buds will be dancing!)

With summer in full swing, nothing hits that hot summer’s day craving like a refreshing, juicy watermelon. Watermelon season has finally arrived! This sweet fruit is incredibly hydrating, containing over 90% water and packed with vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and amino acids. Watermelon has one of the highest lycopene levels of all fruits and vegetables. Lycopene is a phytonutrient, which means it is a chemical created by plants that serve many functions to protect the plant. Lycopene gives watermelon its vibrant red color and has been proven to slow cancer growth, promote eye health, and lower blood pressure. With all these benefits, watermelon is the perfect ingredient to add to your diet! With watermelon juice, salads, and sorbets, there are many creative ways to incorporate this fruit. This salsa recipe is a fun, summer twist on classic salsa that provides a sweet and savory taste. The perfect accompaniment to bring to picnics, parties, and more!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your dancing shoes on because here’s a recipe for watermelon salsa! (oops wrong salsa, but hey this recipe is so good your taste buds will be dancing!)
seoTitle: Watermelon Salsa
seoDescription: Get your dancing shoes on because here’s a recipe for watermelon salsa! (oops wrong salsa, but hey this recipe is so good your taste buds will be dancing!)
ingredients:
s:416:"
  • 3 cups diced watermelon
  • ½ cup cilantro, chopped
  • 1 cucumber, diced
  • 1/3 cup red onion, diced
  • 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
  • 1 tablespoon lime juice
  • Add salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
Combine the chopped watermelon, cilantro, cucumber, red onion, and yellow bell pepper in large bowl. Add salt and pepper. Drizzle lime juice on top. Chill for at least one hour before serving and enjoy!

Serving Ideas

Try this salsa with cinnamon tortilla chips, on grilled eggplant, with zucchini chips, on banana chips, or in lettuce wraps.

Before you toss the rind of the watermelon, hang onto it! This pretty green skin is edible and full of nutrients! It makes a great addition to smoothies and can be sautéed, pickled or simply enjoyed as is. Watermelon rind contains amino acids, vitamin C, and chlorophyll. By saving the rind, you waste less, helping the environment and nourish your body more. Another fun way you can use the rind is by getting crafty and carving it into a serving bowl or cutting designs into it (like a pumpkin!). Get the whole family involved by having watermelon carving contests!

You can also use the seeds of watermelon which are full of benefits. Instead of spitting them out, keep these edible seeds and roast them as a delicious snack. These seeds contain potassium, protein, b vitamins, and iron.

articleBodyHTML:
Fast, easy, and cool, this chickpea salad is everything you need for lunch on those hot summer afternoons or for picnic dinners!

Chickpea Salad is one of my absolute favorite (and easiest) meals to make. It literally takes 15 minutes to make: no cooking required! I’m weird when it comes to cooking. My favorite part of the whole process is chopping vegetables. Sure, the cooking part can be cool, but I love taking my sweet time, cutting and chopping each little vegetable perfectly and with all my love!

You’re going to love Chickpea Salad. It’s all about the cutting and chopping of the vegetables! Not only is it a great, easy to make a snack, but it also has many great benefits for your body. Chickpeas, otherwise known as Garbanzo beans, are packed with all those little vitamins people often forget about- vitamin K, folate, manganese, choline (what the heck is that?), zinc, copper, and phosphorus. In addition to those small vitamins and minerals, they also contain high levels of iron, magnesium, and vitamin b-6. Chickpeas are your go-to source for fiber and protein in a vegan diet or even a gluten-free diet.

I find my favorite way to eat Chickpea Salad is like a dip- with some corn tortilla chips. If I don’t do that, I either eat it by itself like a salad, or even make it into a sandwich, using some whole grain bread, Chao Vegan cheese, and sprouts. Enjoy!
articleSummaryHTML: Fast, easy, and cool, this chickpea salad is everything you need for lunch on those hot summer afternoons or for picnic dinners!
seoTitle: Chickpea Salad
seoDescription: Fast, easy, and cool, this chickpea salad is everything you need for lunch on those hot summer afternoons or for picnic dinners!
ingredients:
s:714:"
  • 1 large can (15oz) of Low-Sodium Chickpeas (Westbrae Natural)
  • 1 ¼ cups Soy-Free Vegenaise
  • ¼ cup baby dill pickles
  • ¼ cup unsalted black olives
  • ¼ cup red onion
  • 2 stalks of green onion
  • ½ medium-sized green bell pepper
  • 1 tablespoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • 1 teaspoon dill weed
  • Salt & Pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Drain and Rinse your chickpeas and put into a large mixing bowl (smash the chickpeas just a little bit with a meat tenderizer or potato masher).
  2. Add the Vegenaise, seasonings, and herbs into the bowl with chickpeas- Stir. Add seasoning to taste.
  3. I also like to do just a small splash of the olive juice and pickle juice into the mix. Yum!
  4. Dice the olives and pickles into small cubes- add to mix. Stir.
  5. Dice the bell pepper, red onion, and green onion- add to mix.
  6. Mix it all together, and you’re done—just like that!

articleBodyHTML:
BBQ time with burgers! Smoky and sensational, these black bean and beet burgers will rock your summer!

Besides capturing the smoky, juicy, savory sensations of biting into a really great burger, these come through as a fave for all eaters—even those with dietary restrictions.

Nervous about eating beans? Try these digestive enzymes to help you with digestion so you don’t miss out on the endless benefits to legumes and pulses. How often do you get to say a burger is beneficial to your health and longevity? You can now.
articleSummaryHTML: BBQ time with burgers! Smoky and sensational, these black bean and beet burgers will rock your summer!
seoTitle: Beet & Bean Burgers
seoDescription: BBQ time with burgers! Smoky and sensational, these black bean and beet burgers will rock your summer!
ingredients:
s:1236:"
  • Olive oil and broth or water for sautéing
  • 1 onion, finely diced
  • 2–4 garlic cloves, finely chopped
  • 1 cup wild mushrooms, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons ground flax seeds, mixed with ¼ cup water or broth for flax eggs
  • 2 (14-ounce) cans organic black beans, drained, rinsed, roughly mashed
  • 2 medium beets, grated (I use the food processor for the beets and nuts)
  • 1 cup walnuts or pecans, chopped (use whole sunflower seeds as a nut-free sub)
  • 3 tablespoons tomato purée
  • 2 tablespoons organic, gluten-free tamari, coconut, or liquid aminos
  • 1½–2 teaspoons smoked paprika
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano, rubbed
  • Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
  • Approx. ½ cup cooked grains such as rice, quinoa, or ground oats, if needed, see below.
";
directions:
Heat a skillet over medium, add a little splash oil, broth or water and warm 1 minute then add the onion. Cook a few minutes, add the garlic, mushrooms, and a pinch sea salt.  Continue to sauté approximately 5 minutes or until mushrooms are caramelized. Remove from heat and set aside. Prepare flax eggs.

Add black beans to a large bowl with the remaining ingredients including the sautéed onion-mushroom mixture and the flax seed eggs and seasonings.

Using your hands or a spatula combine the mixture well.  Taste to adjust seasonings if needed and test to ensure it holds together well when formed into patties. If they aren’t sturdy enough, add additional grains or oatmeal.

Wet hands with water and form mixture into 8 patties approximately an inch thick and 3 to 4 inches wide. Stack between slices of parchment paper if you plan to freeze these.

To cook – bake on a parchment covered pan in the preheated oven at 375F for 15 mins, turn and continue to bake another 10–15 minutes or until burgers are perfectly bronzed and hold together well.   They can be enjoyed at this point, frozen, seared in a hot cast iron sauté pan or on the grill.  Serve warm on buns or greens with chosen toppings such as caramelized onions, avocado, hot sauce, toasted nuts, and side dishes such as those suggested below.

TERI’S TIPS:

Avocado aioli, salsa verde, mango salsa, cashew cheddar, or chimichurri are my favorite sauces with these burgers along with crispy, smoky tempeh bits or coconut bacon.

A serving of fermented veggies such as sauerkraut or kimchi will help you with digestion, and it’s a delish burger companion.

Want more protein power?  Add a scoop or two of Natural Sunwarrior Protein

Follow me via Sunwarrior, on FB, and visit my website for recipes and wellness info.

articleBodyHTML:
Eating gluten-free can be a struggle, but it doesn’t have to be. With a little extra effort, you can make your menu gluten-free. You can start with these delicious gluten-free, vegan rolls!

My son’s good friend is gluten intolerant. For an upcoming holiday dinner, my son asked if I could find a way to make rolls for dinner. I was at a loss. There are so many ways to make gluten-free rolls. I scoured the internet, and most of the recipes call for a homemade gluten-free flour or a kind of flour that I had no access to. I didn’t want to buy a lot of different flours when I had no use for them really. After speaking with some people that are gluten free and reading many reviews on store-bought gluten-free flours, I settled for Bob’s Red Mill gluten-free flour. The rolls turned out fantastic, and my son’s friend was forever grateful.

Not all gluten-free flours are made equal. Some are more for breads, and some are more for cookies. If you find a flour you want to try, I would either talk to someone that is gluten free and knows their flours or read what the flour is best used for. The shape of your pan is very important. The dough is not like the dough for normal gluten rolls. They are very sticky. Choose a pan that will help the rolls stay upright. I used a pie pan that was perfect for these rolls. Also, you will not get the same results if you measure the flour with a cup. It is very important to use a scale.

I am by no means an expert. I’ve made this recipe and found it delicious even for those that aren’t gluten-free. If you need to become gluten free, this is a great way to start.
articleSummaryHTML: Eating gluten-free can be a struggle, but it doesn’t have to be. With a little extra effort, you can make your menu gluten-free. You can start with these delicious gluten-free, vegan rolls!
seoTitle: Gluten-free, Vegan Rolls
seoDescription: Eating gluten-free can be a struggle, but it doesn’t have to be. With a little extra effort, you can make your menu gluten-free. You can start with these delicious gluten-free, vegan rolls!
ingredients:
s:521:"
  • 11 ½ oz. Bob’s Red Mill Gluten-free flour
  • 2 teaspoons yeast
  • ¼ cup agave nectar
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 cup warm water (105–110°)
  • 2 tablespoons oil or vegan butter, softened
  • 1 flax egg
  • 1 teaspoon vinegar (white or cider vinegar)
";
directions:
In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. In another bowl, add water, yeast, and agave. Mix until combined. Let yeast proof. Then add oil, egg, and vinegar to yeast mixture. Add all liquid ingredients to flour mixture and mix on medium speed for three minutes. The dough will be very wet.

Grease an 8 or 9-inch cake pan or pie plate. Scoop (I used a large cookie scoop) dough into 8 or 9 mounds in the pan. Dipping your fingers in water, smooth out the tops of the dough. Let rise in a warm place for about an hour. Bake in a preheated 400 degree for about 25 to 28 minutes or until golden brown. Brush rolls with vegan butter if desired.

articleTitle: Quinoa Surprise Salad for Picnic Fun!
articleBodyHTML:
Picnicking just got awesome! Every picnic needs a good salad, but this quinoa surprise salad will make your picnic fantastic!

This salad is perfect for any summer picnic. It’s colorful, has texture, and is a complete meal on its own, or it can be paired with anything on the side. The best thing about quinoa is that you can pair it with anything. It is a blank palette for so many different kinds of ingredients. Whether fruit, veggies, nuts, seeds, or greens. Have an incredible picnic or stay-at-home meal
articleSummaryHTML: Picnicking just got awesome! Every picnic needs a good salad, but this quinoa surprise salad will make your picnic fantastic!
seoTitle: Quinoa Surprise Salad for Picnic Fun!
seoDescription: Picnicking just got awesome! Every picnic needs a good salad, but this quinoa surprise salad will make your picnic fantastic!
ingredients:
s:716:"
  • 1 cup quinoa, rinsed
  • 2 cups boiling water
  • ¼ cup cranberries
  • ½ cup chopped celery or blanched green beans
  • 1/3 cup walnuts
  • ½ chopped tart apple (granny smith) or pear
  • 3 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 orange, juiced
  • 2 tablespoons orange rind
  • 1 garlic clove
  • 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
";
directions:
1. Mix lemon juice, cranberry water, orange juice, garlic, mustard, and salt together and toss over salad.
  2. Dry toast quinoa in a large pot for 1-5 minutes, add 2 cups boiling water over quinoa, bring to a boil and reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until all the water has absorbed.
  3. Remove from heat and let sit until it cools.
  4. When all the grains are cool, add the quinoa, celery, cranberries, walnuts, and apples together.
  5. Mix the dressing and toss and serve.

articleBodyHTML:
You won’t feel blue with this blue majik smoothie bowl! It tastes great, looks pretty, and is filled with all the good your body needs! We’re here for you!

Oh smoothie bowl, you are so blue. You are so gorgeous to our view! What’s blue, colorful and looks like something designed by the blue fairy? It’s the newest craze called Blue Majik.. After seeing many people in the city consuming this gorgeous turquoise smoothie, a recipe had to be created. Many of those colorful lattes or drinks we see people consuming are actually added food coloring which I am not a fan of. Food coloring contains chemicals and additives that serve no purpose to the body. The key to this bright smoothie is limiting the number of ingredients that go into it. For best results, only add ingredients that are neutral in color or white such as almond milk, protein powder, banana, or vegan yogurt.

This powder is derived from spirulina. This powder has high concentrations of proteins, vitamins, and nutrients.  We added this superfood to our smoothie bowl, and it was absolutely delicious. This newest food trend seems to be popping up in juices, lattes, and smoothies. The best quality about Blue Majik is that it contains B12. Vegans often suffer from low vitamin B12 because it is not readily found in a lot of foods. Although this powder does have a powerful smell, we promise it tastes incredible mixed into smoothies. Since you only need such a small amount of the powder, it will last you a long time!

The best thing about this smoothie is that it’s fantastic first thing in the morning. Unlike cereals, cookies, or cakes, this smoothie bowl won’t give you a crash half way through the day. Plus, it’s super simple; toss everything in the blender and voila! Top with any fruit, granola, nuts, seeds, or coconut whip. Make this bowl your masterpiece and enjoy every last blue sip.
articleSummaryHTML: You won’t feel blue with this blue majik smoothie bowl! It tastes great, looks pretty, and is filled with all the good your body needs! We’re here for you!
seoTitle: Blue Majik Smoothie Bowl
seoDescription: You won’t feel blue with this blue majik smoothie bowl! It tastes great, looks pretty, and is filled with all the good your body needs! We’re here for you!
ingredients:
s:436:"
  • 2 teaspoons blue majik powder
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 1 frozen banana
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 1/3 cup coconut yogurt
  • ½ cup ice
";
directions:
1. Blend all ingredients together
  2. Top with granola, fruit, nuts, seeds, or coconut

articleBodyHTML:
Know jack about jackfruit! There are tons of reasons to fall in love with jackfruit, and this barbecue jackfruit salad is just one of them!

Being a plant-based connoisseur, I thought I knew about every fruit on the planet, but I realized I did not know jack about fruit! I have recently discovered jackfruit! Jackfruit is an amazing meaty fruit that has a neutral taste. Whatever you flavor it, it takes on that taste. I discovered it one day when eating at a health-conscious Latin American restaurant. I asked if they had a vegan “meat” option and the server said “We have jackfruit. It is soy-free and gluten-free with a meat-like texture.” I was intrigued. So I ordered my salad with barbequed jackfruit on top. To my surprise, it was quite delicious! I actually liked it better than my other faux meats because it was not processed. I loved it so much, I have created my own recipe, and now I make it at pretty regularly.

Benefits of Jackfruit:

Jackfruit is rich in vitamins, minerals and lots of dietary fiber, which makes it a good natural laxative. It is also a viable source of minerals, such as iron, magnesium, potassium, and manganese as well.

Fun Facts about Zucchini:

Did you know that jackfruit is the largest fruit that grows on trees? It can grow up to 100 lbs! It is widely cultivated in throughout tropical regions in the world. It is the national fruit of Bangladesh.
articleSummaryHTML: Know jack about jackfruit! There are tons of reasons to fall in love with jackfruit, and this barbecue jackfruit salad is just one of them!
seoTitle: Barbecue Jackfruit Salad
seoDescription: Know jack about jackfruit! There are tons of reasons to fall in love with jackfruit, and this barbecue jackfruit salad is just one of them!
ingredients:
s:1241:"

Salad

  • Spring mix lettuce
  • Cucumbers, sliced
  • Tomatoes, chopped
  • Carrots, julienned
  • Avocado, sliced
  • Pepitas sprinkled on top
  • Jackfruit chopped and cleaned

Barbeque Sauce

  • ½ cup organic ketchup
  • 3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon white vinegar (or lemon juice)
  • 1 tablespoon coconut sugar
  • 1 tablespoon vegan Worcestershire
  • 1 tablespoon mustard
  • ½ teaspoon pepper
  • ½ teaspoon smoked paprika
  • ½ teaspoon onion powder
  • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
  • ½ teaspoon chili powder
  • 1/3 cup water
";
directions:
1. To make the salad- Add all salad ingredients to a bowl and mix thoroughly. Put salad on a plate.
  2. To make the barbeque sauce- Add all ingredients to a saucepan and heat for 15 minutes on the stovetop. In a separate bowl, take fresh chopped up jackfruit and add as much homemade barbeque sauce as needed. Mix the barbeque sauce and jackfruit thoroughly. Then add as much jackfruit you want on top of salad. You can use a teaspoon or two of the homemade barbeque sauce for salad dressing. It gives it a smoky but fresh flavor. It will be the best barbeque salad you ever make!

articleTitle: Warm Dijon Green Bean and Potato Salad
articleBodyHTML:
Potato salad has never been better than this warm Dijon green bean and potato salad! Sometimes you just have a craving that needs to be met!

Do you want a side that is healthy, flavorful, and fun. I had been craving Dijon mustard for some reason so decided to make the dressing a reality to meet that very craving. What came out of it was pure deliciousness! We loved how fresh and vibrant the flavors (and colors) were, and while I had anticipated having leftovers, there were none.

Not only is this salad super easy to make, but it’s also a great addition to any summer menu, potluck, or even just over a bed of greens for dinner. Want to add some more protein? Chop up some Beyond Meat chicken strips and add to the mix. Want to add some more veggies? Try roasted Brussels sprouts or broccoli!
articleSummaryHTML: Potato salad has never been better than this warm Dijon green bean and potato salad! Sometimes you just have a craving that needs to be met!
seoTitle: Warm Dijon Green Bean and Potato Salad
seoDescription: Potato salad has never been better than this warm Dijon green bean and potato salad! Sometimes you just have a craving that needs to be met!
recipeName: Warm Dijon Green Bean and Potato Salad
ingredients:
s:846:"
  • Salad
  • 1 pound baby Yukon gold potatoes
  • 1 pound haricot verts (cut in half)
  • ½ large red onion (sliced)
  • 1 (14oz) can cannellini beans
  • Dressing
  • 2 tablespoons whole grain Dijon mustard
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Juice of 1 lemon
  • 1 tablespoon agave
  • 2–3 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley, dill, and thyme)
  • 2 garlic cloves (finely chopped)
  • Salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Mix all dressing ingredients in a large bowl until well combined
  2. Add in drained and rinsed cannellini beans
  3. Sauté onion for about 3–5 minutes until just tender, then add to the dressing bowl with beans
  4. Cut potatoes in half length-wise and place in a large pot of cold, salted water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for about 8 minutes (until just starting to become tender)
  5. Add haricot verts to the pot and cook for another 4 minutes until just tender
  6. Drain potatoes and green beans and rinse with cold water for about 1 minute
  7. Add potatoes while they are still warm to the dressing and beans, and toss to combine
  8. Serve warm

articleBodyHTML:
For an on-the-go snack or meal that is packed with protein and flavor, you need these Chocolate Banana Bread Protein Muffins. You’re welcome!

When you’re on the go, it’s hard to find healthy snacks to bring with you, especially since most store-bought food has extra added ingredients that negate the whole “healthy” claim. Usually, I would grab some of the Sunwarrior Warrior Protein and run to work or class, but lately, I’ve been craving more sustenance than just a shake, so I developed this recipe for quick, easy, and filling protein muffins that are easy to bring with you anywhere.  They are perfect because you can eat them before a workout, too, without feeling overly full and still get a good boost of nutrients and energy!  They are good for breakfast as well when you add some peanut butter with them to make them even more filling and yummy.
articleSummaryHTML: For an on-the-go snack or meal that is packed with protein and flavor, you need these Chocolate Banana Bread Protein Muffins. You’re welcome!
seoTitle: Chocolate Banana Bread Protein Muffins
seoDescription: For an on-the-go snack or meal that is packed with protein and flavor, you need these Chocolate Banana Bread Protein Muffins. You’re welcome!
ingredients:
s:842:"
  • 1 ripe banana
  • 4 flax eggs (¼ cup flaxseed and ¾ cup warm water)
  • 1 cup Good Karma Protein Flaxmilk
  • 1 teaspoon coconut oil
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon maple syrup
  • ½ cup gluten-free flour (or regular flour)
  • 3–4 scoops of Sunwarrior Warrior Protein in Mocha or Chocolate flavor
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400
  2. Blend the banana and egg whites together in a blender, or if you don't have a blender just mash the banana really well in the bowl. Pour into bowl with flaxmilk and oil and blend. Then add the vanilla, syrup, baking soda and baking powder and stir. Lastly, add the dry ingredients: flour and Sunwarrior protein powder. {If you don't have protein powder you can just use more flour}.
  3. Pour the mixture into cupcake papers and top with shredded coconut or coconut sugar. Bake for 30 minutes or until not gooey inside and try not to eat them all in one sitting! Store in the refrigerator to keep them fresh.

articleBodyHTML:
Dinner is served in all the right ways with this vegan ricotta zucchini roll-ups. This is where dinner and flavor get together to party!

Did you know that zucchini is actually a fruit? You can grill it, bake it, zoodle it, or just snack on it. Containing high sources of vitamin C, manganese, and dietary fiber, zucchini allows you to reap some great health benefits. In addition, it also contains amounts of vitamin A, copper, magnesium, folate, and potassium. Best of all, this recipe highlights the delicate flavor of the zucchini, and it is a light addition to any summer plate.

This recipe will tempt your palate for more. Feel free to garnish on top with some vegan cheese and fresh basil. Try kicking it up a notch with some red pepper flakes if you want to get your extra spice on.
articleSummaryHTML: Dinner is served in all the right ways with this vegan ricotta zucchini roll-ups. This is where dinner and flavor get together to party!
seoTitle: Vegan Ricotta Zucchini Roll-Ups
seoDescription: Dinner is served in all the right ways with this vegan ricotta zucchini roll-ups. This is where dinner and flavor get together to party!
ingredients:
s:670:"
  • 1 medium zucchini, sliced
  • ¾ cup vegan ricotta cheese
  • 3 basil leaves, thinly sliced
  • Dash of salt and pepper
  • Vegan cheese and fresh basil for garnish on top

Sauce

  • 1 cup tomato sauce of your choice
  • 1 cup mushrooms, sliced how you like
  • ¼ cup orange pepper, thinly diced
  • ½ teaspoon Italian spice
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly spray with olive oil.
  2. Wash the zucchini and by using a cheese slicer or mandolin, gently slice the zucchini lengthwise. One medium zucchini should give you about 8 slices.
  3. Sprinkle the zucchini with salt and pepper and cook in oven until tender. Approximately 12 minutes.
  4. While zucchini is cooking, prepare 3/4 cup vegan ricotta cheese and basil into a small bowl. Mix until basil is incorporated. Set aside.
  5. In a skillet, combine tomato sauce, mushrooms, peppers, and Italian spice. Cook on medium-low until peppers and mushrooms are tender. Remove from heat and set aside.
  6. When zucchini is ready, remove from oven and let cool. Blot zucchini with a paper towel if juice remains.

Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
DIY Activated Charcoal Toothpaste

For that bright smile you long for without the chemical side effects of brighteners and toothpastes that aren’t good for you, we bring you a DIY activated charcoal toothpaste! Go ahead. Smile!

There are a lot of recipes for activated charcoal toothpaste, a lot of them are a little too “pasty” for my taste. This recipe has more of a powder texture that makes it a little more palatable. If you prefer a wetter sort of paste, add more coconut oil to the recipe. Activated charcoal offers a natural way to brighten your smile and the ingredients in this recipe work together to remove light staining on your teeth as well as kill the bacteria that lead to bad breath and tooth decay.

Be smart when using activated charcoal (or any substance) on your teeth. Don’t brush hard. Swirl the toothbrush in gentle circles over your teeth. If your toothpaste feels too gritty, you will want to use a different brand of activated charcoal. You want to brighten your smile, not erode enamel, so save your aggression for the gym, not the bathroom, and brush your teeth gently.
articleSummaryHTML: For that bright smile you long for without the chemical side effects of brighteners and toothpastes that aren’t good for you, we bring you a DIY activated charcoal toothpaste! Go ahead. Smile!
seoTitle: DIY Activated Charcoal Toothpaste
seoDescription: For that bright smile you long for without the chemical side effects of brighteners and toothpastes that aren’t good for you, we bring you a DIY activated charcoal toothpaste! Go ahead. Smile!
ingredients:
s:378:"
  • ½ cup of aluminum-free baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon pink Himalayan sea salt
  • 3 teaspoons of activated charcoal
  • 3 teaspoons of coconut oil
  • 10–12 drops of essential oil of peppermint that is food safe
";
directions:
1. Mix the ingredients together in a glass dish, then transfer to a glass container with a tight lid for storage
  2. Wet toothbrush
  3. Dip it in the activated charcoal toothpaste powder
  4. Brush gently
  5. Smile!

articleTitle: Strawberry Banana Vegan Yogurt Pops with Blueberries
articleBodyHTML:
Cool off this summer with the vibrant rhythm of strawberry banana vegan yogurt pops!

You can make these ahead of time, and they will be a hit at your 4th of July get together or any get-together. These popsicles are healthy, refreshing, fun and fruity! You can get as creative as you like. Have some fun and experiment with your favorite fruits and flavors.

Strawberries have an excellent source of both vitamin C and K. They also contain fiber, potassium, folic acid, and manganese. With such a sweet summer taste, it's hard to believe that these little guys pack such a powerful punch. They are low in calories, naturally sweet and have a ton of antioxidants.  So grab your popsicle molds and get your strawberry vibe on because these popsicles will be a hit! Don’t be afraid to play with different fruit combinations; this recipe is really your playground.
articleSummaryHTML: Cool off this summer with the vibrant rhythm of strawberry banana vegan yogurt pops!
seoTitle: Strawberry Banana Vegan Yogurt Pops with Blueberries
seoDescription: Cool off this summer with the vibrant rhythm of strawberry banana vegan yogurt pops!
recipeName: Strawberry Banana Vegan Yogurt Pops with Blueberries
ingredients:
s:429:"
  • 2 cups strawberries, lightly blended (not completely pureed)
  • ½ banana
  • ½–2/3 cup vegan vanilla yogurt
  • ¼ cup blueberries, sliced in half
  • ½ teaspoon pure vanilla
  • Small squeeze of lime or lemon
";
directions:
1. Using your blender, slightly pulse strawberries, banana and lime or lemon until they are still just a little bit chunky.  You can completely puree this combination if you prefer not to have texture.
  2. In a small bowl combine yogurt, vanilla, and blueberries. Stir until combined.
  3. Using a spoon or popsicle funnel, add the strawberry mixture into the popsicle base until just over halfway. Then add the yogurt mixture, and you can top it off with a thin layer of strawberry mixture again if you like.
  4. Secure stick and lid. Place into freezer for 6 hours or overnight.
  5. To remove popsicles from mold let sit out for a few minutes, or briefly run under warm water. Remove gently and enjoy!
  6. Makes 8–10 popsicles depending on mold size.

articleBodyHTML:
All the blueberries on all the pancakes. Breakfast just got mm-mazing with these vegan-gluten free blueberry pancakes.

I absolutely love making pancakes. I mean who doesn’t like pancakes right?  This recipe is vegan, gluten free, and absolutely delicious. These pancakes are fast and easy to make for breakfast or any time of the day really.

This is an awesome recipe for all of you who have a sweet tooth and love pancakes just like I do.
articleSummaryHTML: All the blueberries on all the pancakes. Breakfast just got mm-mazing with these vegan-gluten free blueberry pancakes.
seoTitle: Vegan Gluten-Free Blueberry Pancakes
seoDescription: All the blueberries on all the pancakes. Breakfast just got mm-mazing with these vegan-gluten free blueberry pancakes.
ingredients:
s:612:"
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • Chia eggs (see instruction below) or 1 tablespoon vegan egg replacer (Bob’s Red Mill is a good choice)
  • 2 tablespoons melted coconut oil
  • 1 ½ cups gluten-free Pancake Mix (Bob’s Red Mill is my favorite)
  • 1 cup blueberries
  • ½ scoop Sunwarrior Berry Warrior Blend (for an extra protein boost)
";
directions:
1. Making a chia or flax egg: Grind the chia or flax seeds and then combine 2 tablespoons ground chia or flax seeds with 6 tablespoons water. Let it rest for 5 minutes to thicken. It should be thick like a gel.
  2. In a medium size mixing bowl whisk together the egg, almond milk, and melted coconut oil.  Mix well until there are no lumps and smooth.
  3. Preheat 1 tablespoon coconut oil in a small frying pan over medium heat. Spread the oil around the pan with a paper towel.
  4. Add ¼ cup of the batter to the middle of the pan. Move the pan around to spread the batter and form a round pancake (approximately 4 inches). Add the blueberries sparingly around the pancake. Push them in so that they are somewhat coated with batter. This will allow the pancake to cook evenly once it is ready to be flipped to the other side.
  5. Cook for a minute or two until the top is bubbly and the bottom turns brown then flip. Repeat the process with the remaining 4 tablespoons of batter.
  6. Drizzle both pancakes equally with maple syrup (Canadian is best - just saying       ),
  7. Top with the remainder of the blueberries.
  8. Eat and Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Get your sunshine on with the refreshing taste of lemon in this vegan pistachio lemon cake! The sun is out: start shining!

This cake is so wonderfully tangy and refreshing that it makes a perfect dessert for hot summer days! It’s nutty and moist but light and fluffy at the same time. What is more, it’s a lot healthier than any regular cake as it is 100% vegan and almost completely free from refined sugar! Serve it with a scoop of vegan ice cream or a side of whipped coconut cream or just enjoy on its own!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your sunshine on with the refreshing taste of lemon in this vegan pistachio lemon cake! The sun is out: start shining!
seoTitle: Vegan Pistachio Lemon Cake
seoDescription: Get your sunshine on with the refreshing taste of lemon in this vegan pistachio lemon cake! The sun is out: start shining!
ingredients:
s:932:"

Cake

  • 1 cup self-raising flour
  • ½ teaspoon baking powder
  • ½ teaspoon baking soda
  • ½ cup pistachios, finely ground in a food processor
  • 1 cup ground almonds
  • Zest and juice of 2 lemons
  • 1/3 vegetable oil
  • ½ cup maple syrup
  • Water from 1 can of cooked chickpeas (aquafaba)
  • Pinch of salt

Syrup

  • ½ cup pistachios, finely chopped
  • Juice squeezed from 2 lemons
  • ¼ cup maple syrup
";
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Farenheit. Lay a bottom of a round 8-inch cake tin with greaseproof paper and leave aside.
  2. In a large mixing bowl place flour, baking powder and baking soda, salt, pistachios and almonds and mix thoroughly.
  3. Place aquafaba in a clean, grease-free bowl and whisk using an electric mixer for about 3 min or until foamy and fluffy. Add maple syrup, oil, and lemon juice and add the mixture to the bowl with dry ingredients. Mix thoroughly with an electric mixer until all is well combined.
  4. Transfer the mixture to the prepared cake tin and place in the oven. Bake for 25–30 min or until a wooden stick comes out dry. Take out of the oven and leave aside to cool.
  5. When the cake is lukewarm, make the syrup. Place maple syrup, lemon juice and pistachios in a saucepan and cook on small heat for 5 min. Mix thoroughly. Transfer the syrup on top of the cake and leave to set for at least an hour. Serve on its own or with a side of whipped coconut cream.

articleBodyHTML:
For  a super simple version of pesto, we bring you this raw almond basil pesto pate which is sure to  bring you much happiness and nutrition!

When you think of pesto – I am sure immediately basil comes to mind. It does for me! Not that you can’t make a pesto without basil, it just tastes that much better with it. Especially when you have freshly grown basil in season. There are so many variations of pesto and some contain dairy, some have other vegetables mixed in – but I like to keep mine either super simple with oil or this creamy version using lots of nuts. The key to this recipe is soaking the almonds to get a creamy consistency. IT’s so packed full of nutrients that this can become your full meal! All you need are some greens, kelp noodles or raw cracker with it and you’re done. This can also be served over cooked gluten-free pasta in the cooler months. However, I encourage you to try this over zucchini or kelp noodles for a light and nourishing grain-free option.
articleSummaryHTML: For  a super simple version of pesto, we bring you this raw almond basil pesto pate which is sure to  bring you much happiness and nutrition!
seoTitle: Raw Almond Basil Pesto Pate
seoDescription: For  a super simple version of pesto, we bring you this raw almond basil pesto pate which is sure to  bring you much happiness and nutrition!
ingredients:
s:357:"
  • 2 tablespoons torn fresh basil
  • 1 tablespoon chopped parsley
  • 1 cup whole almonds, soaked
  • ½ cup pine nuts
  • 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  • 1 garlic clove
";
directions:
1. Place all ingredients in food processor and blend until smooth
  2. Place in a small bowl and refrigerate
  3. Serve with cucumber slices, carrots, zucchini, or kelp noodles

articleBodyHTML: The vegan praline recipe is so simple, you will love to make it again and again for dessert, for snacks, for gifts, for yourself!
articleSummaryHTML: The vegan praline recipe is so simple, you will love to make it again and again for dessert, for snacks, for gifts, for yourself!
seoTitle: Vegan Praline
seoDescription: The vegan praline recipe is so simple, you will love to make it again and again for dessert, for snacks, for gifts, for yourself!
ingredients:
s:436:"
  • ½ cup coconut cream (skinned off the top of a can of coconut milk)
  • 1 cup maple syrup
  • 1 tablespoon molasses (totally optional but gives it an authentic brown sugar flavor)
  • 1 cup chopped pecans (delicious if roasted but it's optional)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
";
directions:
1. Prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
  2. In a thick-bottomed pot, bring the coconut cream, maple syrup, and molasses (if using) to a continuous rolling boil over medium-high heat until it reaches 245–250° on a candy thermometer.* Take it off the heat and stir in vanilla and pecans and stir vigorously until the mixture turns from glossy to slightly matte. Spoon quickly into pralines into the prepared parchment paper.

*If you don't have a candy thermometer, just drip a drop of the mixture into a cup of ice water to test for readiness. If it gets thick and balls up on the bottom of the water, it's ready. If it dissolves into the water, cook longer.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your vegan on with this tasty eggplant manicotti with cashew ricotta! Dinner is served!

This totally vegan eggplant manicotti is a change from the traditional one made with noodles and ground beef.  It is rolled in a creamy cashew “ricotta” and topped with a fresh and simple tomato, basil and onion sauce. I really love the simplicity of this dish.
articleSummaryHTML: Get your vegan on with this tasty eggplant manicotti with cashew ricotta! Dinner is served!
seoTitle: Eggplant Manicotti with Cashew “Ricotta”
seoDescription: Get your vegan on with this tasty eggplant manicotti with cashew ricotta! Dinner is served!
ingredients:
s:928:"
  • 1 medium eggplant
  • 4 vine-ripened tomatoes, chopped
  • ½ sweet onion, chopped
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 2 to 4 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon oregano
  • 3 leaves of basil
  • Salt

Cashew “Ricotta”

  • 2 cups of cashews (soaked for minimum 20 minutes optional)
  • 1 lemon juiced
  • 1 to 2 teaspoon nutritional yeast
  • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • ½ cup water or as needed for a smooth consistency
";
directions:
1. Thinly slice the eggplant with a mandolin. Once sliced, place the sliced eggplant in a bowl with salt and water. This helps to remove the bitterness from the eggplant. Let stand for 30 min. Rinse under cool water
  2. Arrange eggplant slices in one layer on a baking sheet. Place eggplant under broiler about 4 inches from heat source. Broil about 5 minutes just to soften them up so that can be easily rolled
  3. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
  4. Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan. Add garlic and onions and cook until slightly golden. Add the chopped tomatoes, oregano and salt to taste. Bring the sauce to a boil and then simmer for another 20 to 30 min
  5. Combine all ingredients for the cashew “ricotta” in a food processor and blend until smooth. If you do not have a food processor, you can use a blender
  6. Take your grilled eggplant after they have cooled, add ricotta to the eggplant and roll them
  7. Use a square casserole dish; spread some tomato sauce on the bottom of casserole dish to start. Add the rolled eggplants to the dish and top with the remaining tomato sauce
  8. Cover the casserole dish and bake the manicotti at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for another 15 to 20 minutes or until the eggplant has softened
  9. Eat and Enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
Nothing sucks about the summertime when you’re sucking on a creamsicle! And when that creamsicle is powered by delicious Sunwarrior Protein, it’s even better!

These creamsicles are homemade, packed with real ingredients, and even have some Sunwarrior plant-protein powder snuck into it, you can lick that popsicle by the pool knowing you’re just winning at life -- and at summer.

These creamsicles are laughably easy to make and noticeably delicious and will no doubt become a summer staple for your family (or yourself). And the best part is that it packs in REAL orange juice from REAL oranges, which means you’re getting the REAL health benefits of these super fruits, like being high in Vitamin C: which can help fight skin damage from the summertime sun and having lots of potassium which can help with replenishing our insides after our outsides sweat from the summertime sun. (Potassium’s also linked to lower blood pressure and stroke risk.)

Making these delightful creamsicle treats couldn’t be quicker: just blend five easy ingredients and freeze ‘em! Then try to exercise patience while they freeze!
articleSummaryHTML: Nothing sucks about the summertime when you’re sucking on a creamsicle! And when that creamsicle is powered by delicious Sunwarrior Protein, it’s even better!
seoTitle: Protein Powered Creamsicles!
seoDescription: Nothing sucks about the summertime when you’re sucking on a creamsicle! And when that creamsicle is powered by delicious Sunwarrior Protein, it’s even better!
ingredients:
s:399:"
  • 2 cups coconut yogurt
  • 1 scoop Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 2 oranges, peeled and cut into chunks
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla
  • 2 tablespoons agave
";
directions:
1. Blend all ingredients in a blender.
  2. Then pour blended mixture into popsicle molds and let freeze for 3 hours to overnight.
  3. Wiggle to remove each popsicle from the popsicle mold and enjoy!

articleTitle: Carob Fig Frozen Fudge with Vitamin Infusion
articleBodyHTML: A take on brownies, this frozen treat is gooey, chewy, and delicious. It is perfect in the summertime for a no-fuss dessert recipe that is super simple to make and healthy to eat!
articleSummaryHTML: A take on brownies, this frozen treat is gooey, chewy and delicious. It is perfect in the summertime for a no-fuss dessert recipe that is super simple to make and healthy to eat!
seoTitle: Carob Fig Frozen Fudge with Vitamin Infusion
seoDescription: A take on brownies, this frozen treat is gooey, chewy and delicious. It is perfect in the summertime for a no-fuss dessert recipe that is super simple to make and healthy to eat!
recipeName: Carob Fig Frozen Fudge with Vitamin Infusion
ingredients:
s:535:"
  • 1 cup figs, soaked
  • 1 ½ cups filtered water
  • 1 tablespoon pure vanilla
  • ½–1 cup nut butter (almond or sunflower)
  • ½–1 cup raw carob powder
  • ½ cup hemp seeds
  • 1 tablespoon Vitamin Mineral Rush
";
directions:
1. Place the figs in a bowl, cover with water, and soak for about an hour, until soft. Drain liquid into a separate bowl.
  2. In a blender, blend the figs and vanilla until smooth, slowly adding the fig-soaking water as needed to form a creamy consistency.
  3. Transfer the fig mixture into a large bowl, add the nut butter, and stir to combine.
  4. In a separate bowl, mix the carob and hemp seeds.
  5. Gradually add the dry carob mixture into the wet fig mixture. Stir well. Press evenly into a 10 by 18-inch brownie pan, 1 inch thick, and freeze until firm (about 3 hours).
  6. To serve, cut into 1-inch squares

articleBodyHTML:
A Canadian classic! Chewy chocolate base with a delectable creme filling and slathered with a chocolate coating, this is the dessert you've been waiting for!

These delicious treats originated in the Canadian Rockies in a town called Nanaimo in British Columbia. They are not only enjoyed in Canada but everywhere around the world, and there are good reasons for it! Super sweet and addictive, you will probably go for seconds and perhaps even thirds. This recipe swapped out many of the unhealthy and refined ingredients that go into these bars for more nutritious and health-conscious ingredients. Using only the best such as coconut oil, cashews, and dates, these bad boys are packed with essential nutrients, proteins, and minerals.

If you’ve never had a Nanaimo bar, the explanation would be such. Chewy chocolate base with a delectable creme filling. Typically slathered with some kind of chocolate coating or ganache. They are definitely a treat and can be quiet overtly sweet. This recipe uses dates, a vegan’s best friend. Not only are dates a natural form of sugar they also contain fiber which fills you up and helps with digestive problems. Hold up, a cookie bar that’s actually good for you? Shocking! These bars are ten times better than any store bought Nanaimo bars.

These bars are great any time of day, and since they contain all natural ingredients, they are guilt free (even at 4am).This recipe is gluten-free, grain-free, vegan, and 100 percent worthy of that second serving. They also freeze well. You can double the recipe, cut them into squares, pop them into a freezer safe container and voila! Dessert any time of year. If you wanted to spice up the recipe, you could add mint to the creme filling to create a mint chocolate Nanaimo bar which I make for the holidays. This is my homage to the Canadian classic, happy baking!
articleSummaryHTML: A Canadian classic! Chewy chocolate base with a delectable creme filling and slathered with a chocolate coating, this is the dessert you've been waiting for!
seoTitle: Raw Vegan Nanaimo Bars
seoDescription: A Canadian classic! Chewy chocolate base with a delectable creme filling and slathered with a chocolate coating, this is the dessert you've been waiting for!
ingredients:
s:1084:"

Crust

  • 1 cup Medjool dates, pitted
  • 1 cup almonds
  • 1 cup walnuts
  • ½ cup unsweetened coconut
  • 1 tablespoon cacao powder
  • 1 tablespoon Warrior Blend protein chocolate
  • 1/8 teaspoon salt

Custard Layer

  • 2 cups raw cashews (soaked 6 hours)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/3 cup maple syrup
  • Chocolate ganache
  • 1 cup cacao powder
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • ½ cup melted coconut oil
  • 1/3 cup unsweetened almond milk
";
directions:
1. Line a 6-inch square pan with parchment paper
  2. In a food processor, combine all ingredients for the crust. Make sure everything is finely chopped and incorporated. Remove from food processor and press mixture down into the pan.
  3. Clean out the food processor and mix all custard ingredients together. Process until it is as smooth as possible. Pour mixture onto crust and place in the fridge for 1 hour to set.
  4. Combine all chocolate ganache ingredients together and place into food processor. Again make sure it is very smooth. Remove from food processor and pour over creme layer. Return to fridge for 3-4 hours to set before slicing. Cut into bars and store in the fridge.

articleBodyHTML:
Get your pick me up in the morning with this refreshing antioxidant smoothie!

This smoothie is an excellent source of nutrition to keep your mind and body refreshed and alert. It is full of antioxidants with a little kick of lemon and mint. This smoothie is a great way to start your morning or to give you a little pick me up in the afternoon! Serves one large smoothie, or 2 small. Sunwarrior's Vitamin Mineral Rush makes this smoothie all the great ways to start a great day!
articleSummaryHTML: Get your pick me up in the morning with this refreshing antioxidant smoothie!
seoTitle: Refreshing Antioxidant Smoothie
seoDescription: Get your pick me up in the morning with this refreshing antioxidant smoothie!
ingredients:
s:598:"
  • Small handful raspberries
  • Small handful blueberries
  • Small handful blackberries
  • Small handful spinach
  • 1 cucumber, peeled, seeded, diced
  • ½ lemon
  • 3–4 mint leaves
  • 1 capful Vitamin Mineral Rush
  • Crushed ice if desired
";
directions: Squeeze lemon into blender. Add all other ingredients into blender and blend until smooth. Add a handful of ice into blender if desired. Enjoy!

articleTitle: Matcha Crème and Berry Chia Parfait
articleBodyHTML:
Beautiful food just tastes so much better, so snap your Instagram picture and then dig into this amazing vegan Matcha Crème and Berry Chia Parfait!

The foodie world is ever expanding, and we all love to eat great food right? But wait, that’s after we take the picture!. Absolutely make time to plate your food pretty. This chia parfait tower is easy to make lovely because of the varying colors and textures. Prepare your layers, (just remember to factor in the advance soaking time), find pretty glasses, and layer your parfait tower any way you like.
articleSummaryHTML: Beautiful food just tastes so much better, so snap your Instagram picture and then dig into this amazing vegan Matcha Crème and Berry Chia Parfait!
seoTitle: Matcha Crème and Berry Chia Parfait
seoDescription: Beautiful food just tastes so much better, so snap your Instagram picture and then dig into this amazing vegan Matcha Crème and Berry Chia Parfait!
recipeName: Matcha Crème and Berry Chia Parfait
ingredients:
s:1122:"

Chia

  • 8 generous tablespoons chia seeds
  • 2 cups coconut water
  • 2 teaspoons Liquid Vitamin mineral rush

Cashew Macadamia Crème Ingredients

  • ½ cup each raw cashews and macadamia nuts
  • ¾ cup organic non-diary milk (more if needed)
  • 2 tablespoons maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 teaspoons matcha powder
  • Pinch sea salt

Raspberry Coulis

  • 2 cups organic raspberries, fresh or frozen
  • 2 teaspoons Vitamin Mineral Rush

*optional maple syrup to taste

";
directions:
Chia

Measure all three ingredients in a large bowl with a cover, mix well and let sit in the refrigerator overnight.  Stir well before using.

Cashew Macadamia Crème Ingredients

Measure the nuts into a jar, cover with water and let sit in the refrigerator for four hours or overnight. Drain before using.

Make the crème by combing all the ingredients but matcha into a powerful blender and blast until well-combined and creamy.  Adjust sweetness and thickness, transfer ½ half to a glass bowl and refrigerate.

Measure matcha into the remaining crème, blend until smooth and transfer to another glass bowl and chill until ready to use.

Raspberry Coulis

In a small saucepan over medium heat, gently cook berries at a simmer 10 minutes or so to reduce. Turn off heat, let cool, add the Vitamin Mineral Rush and sweeten to taste only if needed. Chill until ready to use.

Parfait Assembly

Spoon ¼ cup chia pudding into each of 4 tall glasses, cover with a spoonful coulis, then vanilla crème, more coulis, and top with matcha crème. Garnish creatively, snap your picture and then sit down to enjoy.

Garnish with chopped almonds, raw cacao nibs, fresh mint

articleTitle: Blueberry Muffins with Protein, Oat & Greek Yogurt
articleBodyHTML:
Keep your sweet tooth in check with a healthy breakfast alternative or late night snack like these blueberry muffins with protein, oat & Greek yogurt!

These blueberry muffins with protein, oat & Greek yogurt made with awesome Sunwarrior Warrior Blend protein will give you the boost of energy your body needs to conquer the day.
articleSummaryHTML: Keep your sweet tooth in check with a healthy breakfast alternative or late night snack like these blueberry muffins with protein, oat & Greek yogurt!
seoTitle: Blueberry Muffins with Protein, Oat & Greek Yogurt
seoDescription: Keep your sweet tooth in check with a healthy breakfast alternative or late night snack like these blueberry muffins with protein, oat & Greek yogurt!
recipeName: Blueberry Muffins with Protein, Oat & Greek Yogurt
ingredients:
s:569:"
  • 1 cup + 1 tablespoon almond or coconut flour divided
  • 1 cup rolled oats
  • 1–2 scoops of Sunwarrior Warrior Blend vanilla protein
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • 2 flax eggs
  • 1 cup plain vegan Greek yogurt
  • 1/3 cup 100% pure maple syrup
  • ¼ cup nut milk
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries or fruit of choice
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F
  2. Spray a muffin pan with coconut oil
  3. Combine 1 cup almond flour, oats, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
  4. In a medium bowl, combine flax eggs, yogurt, maple syrup, nut milk, and vanilla extract until well-combined
  5. Pour and stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until combined.
  6. Add the blueberries in the flour that is remaining
  7. Fold them carefully into the batter
  8. Fill the muffin cups to the top with batter
  9. Bake muffin batter for about 18–20 minutes (the tops of the muffins should be golden and firm)
  10. Let muffins cool completely

articleBodyHTML:
Sweet Potato Guacamole Sliders are a perfect addition to your summer picnic or BBQ. When you add immune-boosting antioxidants, you slide into a win!

“Sweet potato toast” is becoming more and more popular! It is a great alternative to give your body its carb fix without the gluten while providing vitamins, minerals, and fiber. Try these sweet potato sliders for your next picnic or cookout!
articleSummaryHTML: Sweet Potato Guacamole Sliders are a perfect addition to your summer picnic or BBQ. When you add immune-boosting antioxidants, you slide into a win!
seoTitle: Sweet Potato Guacamole Sliders
seoDescription: Sweet Potato Guacamole Sliders are a perfect addition to your summer picnic or BBQ. When you add immune boosting antioxidants, you slide into a win!
ingredients:
s:846:"

Guacamole

  • 2 large Hass avocados
  • 2 tomatoes diced
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 red onion
  • 1 jalapeno
  • 1 lime
  • Pinch of sea salt
  • Fresh cilantro

*optional capful Liquid Light (for detoxing electrolytes and antioxidants)

Sweet Potatoes

  • 3 large sweet potatoes
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Sea salt and pepper to taste
";
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400F. Wash and slice sweet potatoes into ½ inch thick rounds.
  2. Toss sweet potatoes in a bowl with olive oil, sea salt, and fresh ground pepper. Spread out of a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  3. Bake for 10–15 minutes, then flip sides and cook for another 10–15 minutes.
  4. While sweet potatoes are baking, prepare guacamole. Mash all the ingredients together until thoroughly combined.
  5. Once sweet potatoes are removed from the oven and cooled, place a spoonful of guacamole on each slider, garnish, and enjoy!

articleBodyHTML:
It’s the time of year to stop dreaming about fresh summer peaches and start eating them! And one of the best ways to enjoy peaches is fresh in this vegan peach bruschetta!

This dish is one of those wonderful finds that has a little bit of everything to delight the senses: sweet, savory, bright color, refreshing flavor and smell, and great texture. Brighten your summer table with this vegan peach bruschetta!
articleSummaryHTML: It’s the time of year to stop dreaming about fresh summer peaches and start eating them! And one of the best ways to enjoy peaches is fresh in this vegan peach bruschetta!
seoTitle: Vegan Peach Bruschetta
seoDescription: It’s the time of year to stop dreaming about fresh summer peaches and start eating them! And one of the best ways to enjoy peaches is fresh in this vegan peach bruschetta!
ingredients:
s:424:"
  • Vegan baguette (or other long loaf artisan bread) sliced into ½ inch slices
  • Vegan cream cheese spread
  • 2 fresh peaches, peeled and sliced
  • Nutritional yeast
  • Balsamic glaze
  • Fresh basil (do not substitute for dried)
";
directions:
Toast

Preheat oven to 350. Lay baguette slices on Jelly roll pan. Brush with olive oil. Bake for 6 minutes or until just toasted (do not overcook.) Let cool.

Assembly

Spread slightly cooled toast slices with the spread. Top with a peach slice, sprinkle with nutritional yeast, basil, and drizzle with balsamic glaze.

Balsamic Glaze

To make your own Balsamic glaze, put 1 cup of balsamic vinegar in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and simmer for 5-10 minutes, until thickened and reduced to about 3/4 cup. Cool before drizzling over bruschetta. Leftovers do not need to be refrigerated, store in an airtight container.

**To chiffonade the basil, stack the basil leaves and roll into a tight cigarette roll. Starting at one end, and being protective of your fingers, slice into very fine strips.
